reviewText: Do you ever wonder why you do what you do? Do your small daily habits drive you crazy, or hinder you in some way? This is a great book that will help you easily identify those daily ticks and take the needed steps to correct them. Nice explanation of how the brain's working parts influence our daily lives in ways we don't even realize. I particularly like how the author links our use of language to our habits, good and bad. Interesting book and well worth a read, let alone as a guide to help make needed changes.
summary: Listen to yourself and make the needed changes

reviewText: I've been looking for ways to live off the grid so I'm glad I found this book.I've struggled with finding solutions to keep plants, fruits, and veggies alive... as well, as keeping pests (insects and rodents) out of my house.So I'm glad I found tips that I didn't know and others I simply overlooked. For me the tips on how to protect my food, along with how to create my own organic pesticides (and which brands to buy) were easily worth the read.I'd highly recommend getting this book now before your garden or home is overrun!

I found some very good tips for organic pest control. I never knew that basil would protect tomato plants. Of course, it's much easier to go to store and buy some pest control products, but you won't find many organic products to protect your garden.There are some good recipes how to make it at home, also how nature can help, like attracting birds so they would reduce a number of insects.

Confidence is something I have always struggled with. Author Beau Norton gives small steps that helped me break out of my shell, along with encouraging advice. I enjoyed reading this e-book from start to finish!

EXTREME CONFIDENCE is a concise, easy to read guide that will help you on your way to gaining a better view of yourself and a better outlook on life. Full of practical tips that can be done daily or as needed, this is a great way to boost your ego.

I have read several of this author's books and each one impresses me. The author is well versed and understand how to portray concepts to his readers. In this book he talks about confidence, first explaining what confidence is, the two different types: body and mind. He goes through ways to increase your confidence through various techniques to eventually attain extreme confidence or self-reliance, where you're able to find joy no matter the consequences. Great book!
summary: Another great self-help book by Beau Norton

reviewText: I must say i have read a lot of books in this niche but still i found out a lot of new information in this book . I will recommend this book to everyone who are interested in increasing their confidence.
summary: A great book for increasing self esteem

reviewText: If you like witch books, these are a great read. They can be slow at times but when they pick up holy cow! Loved all 3.
SNAP is branching out all over the world. The Kandesky's are branching out also with surprising results. You've just got to read it. It's very hard to put down once you start to read it.

I LOVED THIS BOOK!Ryder takes bad boy biker to a WHOLE OTHER LEVEL!  He knows what he wants, but still thinks he is unworthy of Jade's love. Jade is a Princess, but she also is independent and loving. When family from both sides try to keep them apart it is heartbreaking. While they both realize they love each other; they continue to be apart, but yearn for one another.  I loved Ryder & Jade ~ I love the supporting characters.  I can't wait to read more from this series. Ms. Kay makes you become invested in these characters and want them to be happy even though they have obstacles in their way. The prequel was awesome and gave so much background.  I enjoyed both books.5 Stars ~ HOT storyline & HOTTER Sex!!Pick up now to enjoy this new MC book!~Shauna~First Class Books
summary: HOTNESS On Another Level ~ You need Ryder In Your Life!

reviewText: I can never get enough of his books.. action packed plots, and Jack is my hero.. :) looking forward to more from this author.
summary: my favorite Author does it again

reviewText: I choose this book because I like to read Jack Nobels writing. this book was long for me because it seem to take forever to get to the end. I enjoyed the book very much. can't wait for the next book to come out.

I have read all the Jack Noble books and love them but I had missed this one. it was fantastic like all the rest. I could not put it down kept me on the edge of my seat all the way throughout the whole book. Can't wait for Noble Intention 4.

I was honestly surprised at how much I enjoyed this book. I stayed up all through the night it totally had me hooked from page one and I was wanting more when I read the last.When fates collide has everything I love in a book, a great foundation ( good back story ) hot and sexy characters , great pace ( no lagging bits ) and frigging hot chemistry between the two main characters.We can't recommend this book enough.The main female character Lily married her longtime boyfriend but the ( A hole) turned out not to be the guy she thought he was.When fates collide and she mets Gavin it turns her world up side down.I can't wait for more of these two !A must read !!!!!Charlie & Mel's book reviews on FB

This book took me 1000 years ago into the heart the Mayan civilization to experience their culture and traditions. In a new world where humans were no longer the dominant race, the leader of a rebel group tried his best to fight against an alien force who wanted to conquer us. From the very first pages, the author throws us deep into the warfare and demonstrates how the weaker survived and the strong dominated in this new world order. I really enjoyed how Mr. Todd incorporates the real ancient Mayan traditions and customs into the plot and at the same time takes us into a futuristic society where our world is primitive yet able to overcome a more advanced civilization. What makes the story very realistic is the reference to Chichen Itza, an ancient Mayan settlement, and a special celebration that is still practiced in that location today. What a creative account of ancient civilization, warfare, and science!

This book has a lot of great information for women to use for their safety when it comes to fear, but me being somewhat centric would say that a lot of women will use this book for reasons other then what its meant to be use for. Fear is something that we all experience weather men or women. I agree with the book about women fearing more than men but some women use their fear to manipulate a lot of people, especially their spouses or boyfriends. I’m not speaking of the book being negative I enjoyed the material in this book because I think some men could use a lot of this advice as well. So don’t mistake my centric words for a negative outlook on this book. I think we could all learn from this book and start using our minds more than our physical for fear and any other issues that we come across in life.
summary: Review on The power of Fear.

reviewText: The Power of Fear: A Guide for Woman to Anticipate, Predict and Prevent Violent Behavior by Raven Heidrich I wish I would have read this book a long time ago. My second husband was abusive to me for seven years. If I would of read this sooner maybe I could of prevented it before it started. Since that time, as with my childhood abuse, I often feel fear in certain situations and to certain individuals. Many times I will try to hide it. This book now gives me the courage to use that fear to my advantage. To no longer let the fear win for them, but win for myself. It seems so many woman are going through this, and with good reason. This book would help so many of those in fear. It could even save some of them as well and escaping being put into the situation. I think I am going to pass this onto a few I have in mind right at this moment. I also think it is a very important for every female out there to read. Too many think the relationships are good, and they ignore their fears. This one is one that tells you not to ignore but use those fears.
summary: Using your fear to the positive

reviewText: Tired of being part of the rat race? I work a 9 to 5 that can be anything but 9 to 5 some weeks. It gets aggravating working long hours for little reward. This book shows you how to end that grind and start cashing in. I didn’t know much about outsourcing but I figured I’d check it out. This book is great for beginners and really gives you some fantastic ideas for getting started. I’ve been doing freelance work for a little while now and I’m already starting to see a boost in my income. I’m easily pulling an extra $200 - $300 a month now and I’m just getting started. I love working for the clients that I choose to take on and taking jobs that I really want to do. It’s easy to find something that I love to do and get paid for it! Start your road to financial independence doing what you want to do, not what a demanding boss tells you to do.
summary: Getting started on being my own boss

reviewText: I purchased this because it intrigued me. I have purchased all of Castalia House books to this point, and have enjoyed every single one of them. My first thought was that the formatting, as is mentioned in other reviews would make this hard, but I finally decided to go for it anyway. It took about 5 or 6 pages to get used to the modified screen play format, and then I didn't even notice it anymore. If that is the only reason you might have to avoid the book, just get the thing and read it. The format is no big deal.Story-wise, this was simply wonderful. Great characters, and they are dynamic. They grow and change. In fact, if I could, I would give this book a 4.5 rating, with the 1/2 star deduction being that some of the characters appear as important parts of the story, then sort of fade away as the book progresses. I want to see more of them in later portions, too. The "secret" about one of the female leads does appear to be a little underused. Why is the secret a big deal? That portion was underdeveloped, I thought.Still, the plot was engaging. There is very little 'downtime' in the book. Action throughout. Get the book. You won't be disappointed.

It would be easy to point out all the nits and oddities in this book, but the test of a good book is whether it pulls you into the story and makes you keen to pick it up and keep reading. "The Stars .." did this for me. It probably deserves a 3 star rating but I give it a 4 for keeping me happy.
summary: Strangely Written and a Bit Flawed, but Gripping

reviewText: "I just finished reading "Sweet Reflection". It was an enjoyable romantic read. The buildup from a no-strings attached sexual encounter to a relationship between Laurel and James was great.It was well written with a good storyline without a lot of the usual "too sweet to be true" romance a lot of stories have. It has all the components - antagonistic exes, broken hearts, friends, intimacy, and family turmoil.  The characters were well developed and real with distinct personalities.  The main characters are robust and interesting with spirit. I loved the character of Ryan - he was handsome, sweet, and a good friend. He was attracted to Laurel but chose to help her and James see that they needed each other, instead of pursuing his own desires. James - he's sexy, determined, and a great catch when caught. I was surprised by his occupation though. I saw him more as the architect type. Laurel - the beautiful, broken hearted girl looking for a good time with no strings attached to prevent further hurt. And then the story wouldn't be complete without Alex - the evil, antagonistic ex that wants James for more than a hook-up.I enjoyed the multiple POV's and thought they added depth to the characters. I enjoyed seeing James lay his feelings out for Laurel and get real. It was also refreshing to see a woman not recognize so end she had slept with prior for a change. The letter from Laurels father added a layer of emotion, as did the illness of her mom. Then throw in the buy-out confrontation at the end and you've got a great story.
summary: An enjoyable passionate romanctic read filled with twists, turns, and heat!

reviewText: Frankly since about 4 it has been very marginal about value for the standard $3 per book, I was very iffy about 6 and 7.The page count is up for this one but the quality has spiraled down so quickly the last few books I can't buy another book for more money even if it is more pages.If it was lowered to $3 to give people a chanceto rescue what trust was burned before I might try it.

A day that begins with finding a new Spinward Fringe book for sale, is a great day indeed. I'm 8 books into this series and I can't get enough. I love the character development and the ideas behind the science fiction. Framework tech is a great thing, until it isn't. If you've been keeping up with this series, this is a.must read. If you've stumbled across this review by chance, then you need to find book 1 and read till your eyes bleed. You won't regret the purchase.
I love everything Konkoly has written. And, now that he has added to the Wayward Pines universe I'm more pleased than ever. Can't recommend him enough no matter what he writes.

I used others recommendations in considering this book. Suspense, torture, romance, and at time adult rated. I have to say I enjoyed it completely. It's well thought out, at times very funny, and yet serious as well. I never thought a cold war spy novel could be so enjoyable.
I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book. The characters were very believable and you couldn't help being sucked right into their lives. I look forward to more books by this author.
I liked the continuation of this series.  Don't really like cliffhangers but can't wait until the next book to see what happens.

Holy Moses! This is one that definitely was suspenseful, captivated my attention and interest. I started to read it and couldn't put it down. I was drawn into it, and look forward to the next book. Some parts were a little graphic but over all, I would recommend this one.

I can't spend a lot of time writing (which I am not good at anyway) because I have to read That Man 3. But I will say I LOVE you Nelle L'Amour. Please, please keep on writing. You will never know what reading good stories means to me and yours are GREAT.
The characters in this book are great. Blake is so bad but so likeable and Jennifer is a great foil for him.
At 1st I was very angry with Hiram, but t as I read more of the story, I really start liking him.This was A very good book and I loved the outcome.

What caught my eye about this book, was the fact that the author, in his description, mentions minimal time.  I'm always in search of ways to save time. Especially, when it comes to working out. As I age, I'm starting to feel the effects of all those years of long, brutal workouts.  This really is a no fluff guide that takes you from beginning to advanced without the fear of injury. Good read!

I think that this may be my favorite phase yet.  And maybe that is because of the romantic in me who wants Petra and Law to finally admit to themselves and each other the feelings that are slowly forming for each other.The last phase left us squirming in our seats with visions of rats dancing in our heads, gross I know.  And that is exactly where Phase 3 picks up.  Petra and Law are dealing with rat bites and deciding whether Petra should continue on this journey with Law or go back to camp.  But unexpected guests make that decision for them quickly.  They head back to camp and now have to deal with a disgruntled Odin and some other issues amongst the members of their camp.What I loved about this phase is watching Petra and Law’s relationship develop a little more.  There was a little bit more of romance in this installment,  and I loved every minute of it.  Law and Petra care for each other and he will protect her in everyway possible.  As the reader we knew this but it took them a little time to finally admit it to themselves and each other.  The two of them together just makes me smile.Lila still has us on the edge of our seat wondering what will happen next.  Still needing to know what Odin’s plans are and exactly how Petra fits into those plans.  And whatever those plans are can Law protect her from any danger that may be coming their way.  While Odin is still a mystery, I will say I don’t trust the man or any plans that he has.  I cannot wait to see where we go next.  Cannot wait to see more of Petra and Law together.  Another great job by Lila Felix.  This is a fantastic series.

reviewerName: Java Davis, author "Java Davis, independent a...
reviewText: This is the second book I've read on the subject of tapping pressure points for de-stressing.  In the first book, it was just a part of a larger book.  This book is completely devoted to the subject of Emotional Tapping Therapy.  Naturally, as I read it, I had to tap the suggested spots on the body.  It was amazing how quickly I felt better!While the subject matter is covered perfectly and succinctly, the composition is not perfect.  Since this is a reference book and not classic literature, I found the mistakes forgiveable.

Smoking Hot - another in Anne Marsh's Smoke Jumpers series.  Tye Callahan takes his promises to heart.  When his fellow Seal is killed in action, Tye feels responsible and he had a debt to honor Kade's commitments and signs on with Donvan Jumpers in Strong, CA along with keeping an eye on his fiancee, Katie Lawson  But is Katie, really a fiancee or just a friend with benefits.  While Katie cannot accept that Kade will not be coming back, she can fullfill his bucket list along with a little help from Tye.  Join all your friends in Strong and see what happens when you combine the heat of a sexy Seal and a bucket list picked from the internet.  You won't be disappointed.  Kudos to Anne Marsh with another winner.  Can't wait to see how this series goes with the next release.
WOW!!! Great opportunity to read the material of some good authors for the first time. Do not hesitate to buy this set. I will definitely follow some of the authors I was introduced to.

Just finished Seal of my Heart by Sharon Hamilton and could wait till I read the other stories to leave my reviewI adore Sharon's Seals and reading the short but hot story about Tyler melted my heartI loved that he was embarrassed for reading but proud of his sister's booksHope to see the letters between these two lovers while he deploys I bet they are awesomeWill update review as I read the other stories though I'm pretty sure they will all be great

I found these books very enjoyable. They were full lengthy novels, not samples or chapters masquerading as a book. The writing was clever, there were few typos and the stories were good. It is certainly worth the $3 that I paid.

Sara is a small town farm girl who moves to the big city of Washington, D.C. after her father passes away. There, she meets and lives with a couple who open her eyes to how the world is outside a small farm town. Meanwhile, Jake, the President of the United States is dealing with his own sexual slump. He is divorced and needing some release! When Sara and Jake's paths cross, will they end up getting together? And if they do, will it be something that lasts or will it be a fling? This is just Part 1 but you definitely need to read it to get all the juicy details! I can't wait for Part 2 and see how the story plays out.

Palmer is an 18 year old guy, but when he’s online, he becomes whatever woman his next target is looking for.  He flirts, he romances, he sends pictures that he has found online of a woman that is not him, and then he convinces them to send him money.  Things are going pretty good for him, until he gets an email to his own email address, not a throwaway account.  Someone knows.  And they know where he lives.This book is a showcase on the bad idea that is cat-fishing online.  It was a really effective story, with a lot of tension, and great pacing.  It was a fairly quick read, but not in a bad way.  It was as long as it needed to be, to keep the tension, and keep you interested.The main thing with these thrillers, however, are the plot twists throughout.  While I did “sort of” see one of the twists coming (of COURSE Rose Bud is the sled!), that twist itself was handled really well.  And the others that I didn't see coming were even better.  I go back and forth when it comes to twists in stories, and whether they are good or not.  Ideally, you shouldn't see it coming AT ALL, but if it’s completely out of nowhere, that is a bad twist.  The best twists you can see coming, but you don’t want to believe them.  That’s how I felt with this… I talked too much about the twist, didn't I?Overall, this was a really good, short read.  For $.99, it is definitely something you should check out.  I’m glad I did, and am now interested in the author’s other work!
summary: "I Know..." that this is a great read!  #badwordplay

reviewText: All the characters were a little weak.  OK read, but did not get inspire a great love of the story.
I found this to be a wonderful story, and I am thrilled to have found a new author. Brava, Ms. Bush.

This is such a I'm-not-putting-it-down-until-I'm-done book. Which is exactly what I did, this author did such a great job. The characters are so complex, and just absolutely wonderful. I enjoyed reading this story. I will admit that I want more!! Hint hint Bella Jewell ;) -Steph

We first meet William as a young boy taking a short cut on his way to school when he runs into a few of his class mates that has been bullying him for a while. He never fought back in fear they'll make the beatings worse. However on this particular day they beat him up so bad that it left him disfigured, and changed his life forever.Some years later 13 girls wake up to find themselves locked in a dark room with no memory of how they got there or even who they are. Each girl has the number 1-13 tattooed on them. There captor is a mystery to the girls all in hopes of gaining there trust.I absolutely loved this story! For me it read like your modern day Beauty and the beast. except the girls didn't just happen to wander into the castle.Generally this story is about number 13. and is told in two POV's William's and number thirteen.When I first started this book I thought I knew how this story would go and I was pleasantly surprised I was wrong. Number thirteen is labeled a dark romance, which as you probably know by now i'm so drawn to. But this was sooo different than anything else i've read. While it has its dark moment this is just an all around romance story with a twist.If your looking for something out side of what your use to this is it!!
summary: You think you know.. but you have no idea... never judge a book by its cover!!

reviewText: I wasn't sure what to expect after reading the reviews. But Bella Jewel does not disappoint. I finished this yesterday and I was left speechless. So today I try to put it into words. It was an emotional read, it grabs you by the heart strings and the twist and turns just kept coming. It had pain, heartache, love, loyalty. This story pulled you in and didn't let go.I didn't want to stop where it did I wanted more :) This is a definite must read.

Totally not where I thought this story was going..., William and his girls were seriously damaged, flawed, twisted and scared. They all want what everyone wants.... acceptance, safety, love and most of all a life!!!This was an amazing story..., I loved it♥

Oh man, where do I begin?! This is a dark, sad, and mesmerizing story of love and salvation.William is a man that came from a dysfunctional family. Him being the outcast, the one that was never accepted, turned him into someone else. A man with a mission.William has acquired thirteen girls. Thirteen broken girls who have no idea who they are or where they came from. He has made it is job to fix these women. To teach them how to change their lives.While attempting to do this, William encounters many more obstacles than he expected. These girls have no idea what William wants them for.As William takes on the task of trying to heal these thirteen lost souls, he begins to see how much he needs his own healing. Number Thirteen goes against everything he is trying to accomplish and it drives him nuts! While also intriguing him and making him feel things he doesn't want to believe in.Number Thirteen is unhappy to say the least to find herself, whoever she is, in a home with a man she knows nothing about, yet he expects her to obey him implicitly. As she fights with him more and more, they begin to realize there is some serious chemistry going on.Neither of them is expecting it and they don't want it, how can it be real?Will these thirteen girls or William be able to come to terms with each other? Will any of the find their salvation? Can they accept it if it is offered? What about love? For a household of broken wills, how will any of them be able to move forward with a life worth living?
summary: A beautifully, dark tale of salvation and love!

reviewText: Bella Jewel does it again! I have each and everyone of Bella' s books and I love them all. If your looking for something different this is it.

This was just ok for me. I felt that the story could have went so much deeper. There was nothing to draw you into the characters themselves. Number 13 could be admired for her courage at times, and I do have sympathy for what William endured as a child. However, there wasn't enough to get me emotionally involved in the story or the characters. Sadly enough I found myself wondering what I was going to read next then paying attention to what I was actually reading. Not a bad read, but not one that I would recommend to my friends.

What a book! After reading the synopsis I knew the story would hook me from the very beginning – and boy it did! I didn’t want to put it down for a second. Although the blurb already said it is not a BDSM romance this book was nowhere near what I would have expected. The first half is dark and twisted and had me always second-guessing what might happen next – the other half is just plain beautiful and deeply moving. It is that kind of story that stays with you long after you finished reading.Thirteen girls wake up disoriented and helpless in an unfamiliar environment. All of them have a number between one to thirteen tattooed onto their wrists. Terrified, they have tons of questions:Where are they?Who are these other girls?What happened to them?What will happen to them now?As if it is not worse enough that they know nothing about their current situation – they also have no memory at all about their past lives – hell, they cannot even remember their own names!Soon they learn that they all are held captive by one mysterious Master who they have never seen and that their lives will be at his mercy, full of servitude and – if they don't obey – pain. Their MasterHow will they cope with all this? Are they going to fight to get back their rights – their stolen lives – no matter what the consequences might be? Or would it be better to just give up in order to satisfy the Master?Thirteen is a meaningful number for William. It is the number he associates with the most important lesson life taught him – the number that has formed him to the man he is today – a monster.Now it is his turn to teach these thirteen girls a lesson. All of these girls are chosen for a reason, because all of them are destroyed and broken in some way or another. They have to learn to trust William, to believe that everything he does serves a purpose; that they have to follow his rules or get punished if they don’t, to learn that these rules are necessary to protect them.But also William has to learn: He needs to believe that not everyone judges him based on the incidence that connects him to the number thirteen, that not everyone thinks of him as a monster.The book’s POV alternates between William’s and Number Thirteen’s. It helps to understand William on one hand and on the other you witness how Number Thirteen copes with this whole situation and how she discovers her past anew. …but most of all you experience the two of them developing feelings for each other, no matter the messed-up situation they are in. It is a unique and precious love unlike any other I have read about.Oh, William! After reading the prologue I was on his team immediately! My heart broke for him… several times. It made me trust him from the very beginning. I believed that he meant the girls no harm, no matter his suspect and arguable orders. I also think his hiding in the beginning served two purpose: Encouraging the girls to fear him even more but hiding his monster from them at once.I am absolutely digging this story! It is about survival, courage and bravery, fear and sadness, hope and faith and, most importantly, it is about trust and love. This story hit me deep in my core and I know it will stay for me for a long time. It is a book that is definitely worth a re-read!There is only one question that was never answered and that still bothers me: What really happened to Number Six??? I don’t think it is what all the girls are suspecting… but I’ll leave it at that, as I don’t want to spoil it. I just needed to get it out because it still keeps preying on my mind!!This is only the first book by Bella Jewel I’ve read, but I already count her to my favorites. It is such a breathtaking story! I’d really love a sequel of maybe Number Twelve’s and Ben’s story!!But for now, I cannot wait to start Enslaved by the Ocean very, very soon!NUMBER THIRTEEN is certainly one of my top reads in 2014!
Great story Bella!  I could not put it down.  The ending was a twist I did not see coming.  I can't wait for your next book!
Can't wait for the next book!! This short will wet your appetite for more from this author!Great descriptions and wonderful, period appropriate, writing!

I have to say I am so glad I did not pay for this book. It starts off ok, then gets better. As I'm reading I notice how I'm getting closer to the end of the book, but there is so much more story to tell I know. So to the author you better have another book to follow this one or I will not be reading another book by you. I want to know what Enzo will do, and what will Jackson do? What happens to Angela?

Author, Ireland Taylor has brought us a beautiful and fun filled children's book which will bring life to each season starting with spring for kids ages 3-9. Rayne Drop is so fun to read, that kids are learning without even realizing it. As an adult I enjoyed reading this and can't wait to read it to my nieces and nephew. This is such a refreshing story for someone to read to their young child or grandchildren. The colors pop right out of the pages and when you finish the book you can't help but start over again. I can't wait to begin each season with these books.
summary: LOOK OUT Spring, here comes the 3 C's!!! Cute, colorful, and cheerful!

reviewText: I bought this book for my three year old nephew. He absolutely loved the story, the vibrant pictures, and enjoyed seeing Rayne Drop and her friends busying themselves with their work. :)
summary: Effortlessly keeps the little one's attention

reviewText: I have read all 4 of the 5 books and I'm loving the story, can't wait to find out the ending in book 5 . I really hope Jessica and Dylan have a HEA ending. I recommended this book as a must read

Once again JJ has left my head spinning. Just when I thought I,knew where this story was headed there was another twist. I can't figure out who is who and what is what. That suspense keeps me wanting more. I can't wait for the final book to have this mystery solved. I hope it has HEA for Dylan and Jess. If you have not started this series, what are you waiting for?!?!?! This series has it all.I was gifted a copy of Revenge 4 for an honest review.

Twists and turns, everyone has an agenda and Jess is stuck in the middle of it, what's a girl to do. Maybe follow Dylan's advice “Don’t you know? It’s always the shy girls who are the wildest of all. Jess, let yourself free. You can be a wild animal with me. It’s what I want. It’s what I need.”Jess is certainly learning to be more herself as the books progress it's great seeing how she is growing and learning in the big city, the trick is to stay yourself.We learn even more of Dylan's secrets in this episode but Jess finds that she is keeping more secrets, what with Nick and Q and now Riley in the mix life is certainly getting interesting.Although each episode is quite short it's amazing how much is packed in, and every time you think they can't get better but they, the characters are becoming your friends and you can't wait to see what happens to them next.I received a free copy for an honest review

I received the ARC for an honest review. This is book 4 in the series and you really will want to read them in order. These are short reads and flow just perfect. You will NOT be able to put them down.I have no idea where to began. I have fallen so hard for Dylan and my heart beats with Jess's. Things are taking off for Dylan as he signs the million dollar contract but Jess is suspicious of things ever since she got some info out of Nick and found out who Nick's mom was. Then there is the pictures. There is a lot to take in in this book and a lot of steamy sex. The fact that Dylan has professed his love to Jess and seems to be open with her now makes it even better.I am patiently awaiting the next book. NOT! I'm in dire need for the next book.Awesome job again!!!
summary: Yes! Yes! Yes! Oh God Yes! you should really read this series

reviewText: Once again I'm blown away by the story line, the writing style, and the characters!  I love love love this series and it just keeps getting better!  I can not wait for the final installment!

I can't help but feel like these volumes are getting a little repetitive and I have to admit, not as interesting to me anymore. I am thankful that there is only one more volume in this series. I am really curious to see how the author wraps up so many things in one volume to end this story.

reviewText: What a great series I can't wait for the last book in this series to come out. This series is a must read I couldn't put it down.

Kudos to this author as I am still trying to guess the mystery behind the characters and what the truth is.The book is called Revenge so someone is seeking it and by the looks of it the Revenge has to be against Dylan. The question is, is Jesse just a pawn or is it against her too. All I know is whatever the reason, it is somehow tied to Sarah, Dylan's dead wife.Some more information comes to light in book 4, but it only deepened the mystery. We find out who Q is, Riley is up to no good, Nick reveals some more info and his true identity is revealed, which blew my prior theory. Also Dylan tells Jesse all about Sarah and his marriage, another theory on paper thrown in the trash. So as I sit here typing I still ponder the final direction the author will take since it is to conclude in book 5.As for Jess, I am happy she told Dylan some info she has discovered, because that may be her only saving grace to have a future with this man. She has hidden so many secrets and took and spent corporate money from the shady music company that her hole is pretty deep. Dylan only wants one thing, Jess. Someone he can love and trust whole hardheartedly. She has had plenty of opportunities to come clean and not once has she done that. Depending how things play out Dylan will either see it as a form of betrayal or see she was just a pawn, in this nasty game of revenge. I just hope it's the latter. Boy book 5 can't come fast enough.
summary: I am still guessing, & just when I think I can solve the mystery a new turn arises blowing that theory

reviewText: We didn't end this story with the type of cliffhangers that the first 3 books had, but we are still left hanging.  More questions have been answered and yet, we still have more that we still need answered.  Will volume 5 give Dylan and Jess a HEA ending or will the questions and doubts finally pull them apart.  Still trying to resolve some of the mystery people that seems to still tie them together.
summary: Sometimes we have more questions than answers

Lily hasn’t had the easiest life. Adopted at a young age by incredibly strict parents, forced to forget her past and raised in a religious zealot’s home, the only real light in her life is her sister Beth. When Beth married a motorcycle club member Razer, Lily’s life was flipped upside down and hasn’t necessarily settled yet.Shade first saw Lily when Razer met his wife Beth. Knowing she was too young for any sort of relationship, Shade has bided his time and watched from afar. Yet as life and circumstances seem to have Lily falling farther and farther into a black hole, Shade finds himself the only one that can break into her psyche. At first Lily is appalled at the lifestyle the bikers, their blatant disregard for privacy and their openness with one another. However, as she gets to know the people within the club, she realizes she has never been more wrong in her life.I had enjoyed the Last Riders Series but have been looking forward to Shade and Lily’s story from the very beginning. I was worried I may have been building the story up in my head but was happy to realize that I was worried for nothing. Longer than I remember her other novels being, Begley takes her time and really tells the story that needs to be told.Lily had seemed like such an injured kitten in the previous books. She still seems like an injured soul, don’t get me wrong, but the background is finally explained. A horrific history and an especially horrible early childhood has created this manic young woman who honestly doesn't know who she is.A well developed romance, Shade and Lily’s road to romance is rocky but ultimately completely satisfying. At times I found Shade’s behavior overbearing and a bit hard to believe, but I think within the context of the story Begley was trying to tell it worked. A well rounded, very sensual romance that is easily my favorite of the series so far.

I couldn't wait for Shade and Lily's book. It didn't let me down. I was hooked on Shade from the first time I read about him in Jamie's previous books. You really got to understand him so much better in his book.  Anyway, he turned out to be one of my all time favorite MC Bad Boys!! Love him. Sometimes I did want to tell Lily to suck it up!! Lol.  I love all of Jamie Begley's books, she's one of my favorite authors.
I was highly anticipating this book... and I wasn't disappointed! Lily and Shade's relationship is finally a real thing!
summary: Just as spectacular as the rest!

I received a free copy of this book from the author in exchange for an honest review."When Sean Loves Rusty" is a collection of stories by Chris Cox about two young men in their mid-twenties who are deeply in love with each other.  I enjoyed the chronological flow of the book because it allowed the reader to see their lives during the course of a year, along with all the changes and growth that can happen in that time.  Sean and Rusty have been in a relationship for several years, and when Sean graduates with a mechanical engineering degree there are some struggles to find a job in their hometown of New Orleans.  Rusty already has a job with his family's company of landscape designers, and the thought of leaving New Orleans is frightening for him.  When Sean receives a job offer from a company in Boston, the pair need to decide what their next steps will be.  In each stage of the book they are supportive of one another and work hard to ensure that their partner feels secure and loved.  The book addresses the pain of geographic distance and the stress of the unknown mixed with the excitement of independence, especially when Rusty moves to Boston to join Sean after the job training is completed.  It also does a good job of exploring the similarities between expanding your comfort zone with moving, work, and new friendships with the challenges of addressing issues with your past or self-perception.  This was a book that successfully mixed both the serious and the sweet.One of my favorite things about this book was the way the author structured the inner thought processes for the characters, because they felt very true to life.  It can be challenging to convey the thoughts and emotions that go into compromises and the give-and-take of relationships, and this book does a good job of showing how the love that Sean and Rusty have for one another helps them bridge their differences and their worries to try and make the best choices for their relationship.There were a handful of typos, but they were easy to move past because the story was so compelling.  Part of me was hoping for a bit more detail about how Sean and Rusty made the shift from best friends to a couple when they were younger, but that was largely due to the fact that I enjoyed reading about them so much that I was curious about as many facets of their romance as possible.  I will absolutely be interested in reading more about them when the author has a chance to continue their story, which was hinted at with a teaser at the end of the book.I greatly look forward to reading more from Chris Cox, both in this series and in his other works.  I recommend "When Sean Loves Rusty."

4 HeartsThis collection of Bayou Boys stories follows Sean and Rusty over the first year after college, the hunt for a job, moving, their first Halloween in new city, their first visit home for Christmas and finally their wedding. We are drawn into their lives one stage at a time seeing their fears and triumphs, doubts and joys and each hurdle they cross as they find their lives together changing and seeing as they grow and change with it.Meant to be:Sean has finished college and is struggling to find a job and to add to his worries they have to move out of student housing, Rusty is secure in his job at his father’s landscaping company and is looking forward to moving back to his parent’s house until Sean gets a decent job.These two men have been sweethearts since they first knew they were gay, Sean moved in to Rusty’s family home when his father beat him for being gay and the two are inseparable. Sean now wants to embark on the next part of their lives but feels that unless he is contributing then he is failing, but his confidence is low after thirteen interviews and no job in sight. Rusty is very close to his family and knows that they will always be there for him and Sean, Rusty has always loved Sean but when Sean finally gets a job offer it causes friction and as the time draws closer for Sean to give an answer will their love be enough to see them through.I loved this story as we see a very insecure Sean and a very confident Rusty working through a difficult decision that causes friction between them. With Sean’s past it would have been easy for him to fall back into the security that he found in Rusty and his family but the opportunity he has been offered is too good for him to turn his back on, and we see him finding the confidence to go for what he wants. With Rusty we see him having to let go of the security he has always known for the unknown that he will have with Sean. I loved seeing how love wins through against the doubts and fears and hoe Rusty gave up the security for Sean.Moving On:It has two month’s since Sean moved to Boston for his new job and Rusty has missed him something fierce, now Sean is coming home after setting everything up and Rusty will be returning with him. Sean has missed Rusty and hopes he has set everything up so Rusty can just fit seamlessly into a new life in Boston, but as they meet at the airport they both feel something is just a bit off.Oh now this has just a bit of angst as Rusty has let his imagination run just a bit wild after Sean has described everything he has been doing and the friends he has made. Rusty is used to Sean leaning on him for everything but now with Sean being alone in Boston Rusty feels like Sean has been moving on without him. Sean has had to move out of his comfort zone to make sure Rusty doesn’t feel like he lost everything, so he has made friends, found an apartment and checked out the local sites to show Rusty, but he couldn’t help trying to make Rusty a tiny bit jealous.Hmmm there’s nothing like spending two months apart to really test a relationship, and no matter how much you love someone the fear of betrayal and loss is still there. Rusty has torn himself up with worry when he noticed that the phone calls were getting shorter or being missed altogether but even with the doubts in his mind he isn’t letting Sean go. Sean has his own doubts when Rusty pulls out a condom and it takes a heart to heart for them to get back on an even road.Tricked Up for Treats:As Sean and Rusty struggle to make ends meet Rusty splashes out on tickets to a Halloween competition, Rusty thinks that it will be a great way for Sean to relax and be more at ease with his feminine side. Sean is reluctant at first but gives in knowing that it will be a bring some of the sparkle back to Rusty’s eyes as the worries of being jobless have been wearing away at Rusty’s spirit.I really loved this one as both men try to please the other. Sean hates anything that reminds him of his father’s constant bullying, and dressing in drag has the words that his father drilled into him rolling through his mind, but for Rusty he will do anything. Rusty wants Sean to relax more and embrace his more feminine nature, being free to walk and act how he wants and Rusty thinks that the drag competition will help with that. Both men trying to boost the other and having a blast while doing it, having their love support them and showing both of them that they can do anything together.Jingle My Bells:After winning a prize for the drag competition and swapping it for two plane tickets Rusty and Sean are heading back to New Orleans for Christmas, it is a time that awakens both Sean and Rusty to how far they have both come and how things have changed.Ah there’s nothing like going home for Christmas to make you realise just how much you have grown up and that everything moves on and changes. As Rusty and Sean visit Rusty’s family for Christmas they both see how they have grown as a couple, doing things for themselves instead of relying on the parents and starting their own traditions, and we also see as Rusty and Sean realise just what freedom they have living alone with no constant interruptions. We also see how far Sean has come and also healed as he does his yearly Christmas present drop on his parent’s porch; there is also a light of hope as he gets a visit from his sister and his mom.Better or worse:Sean and Rusty’s wedding is days away and Sean is worried that he has messed up at work, he worries that he will lose his job and that he made a mistake dragging them both to Boston. Rusty knows Sean has something to tell him but he knows that he will be there to support Sean no matter what. They are about to embark on the next step in their life and nothing will stop them from standing together and facing the world.This was a wonderful little story that shows us exactly how far both Sean and Rusty have come and how far they have grown as a couple and as individuals. Sean handles his work problems with panache, facing them head on even though he feels fear. Rusty ups his search for a permanent job as Sean confides his fears about his job. And while all this is going on they are preparing for their wedding and the step that will take them onto the next journey in their life.****My overall rating for these books is 4 Hearts and I would have to say that each step in their journey is just as good as the last. I absolutely adored how the author never stepped back from showing each man’s fear or their triumphs, we see the remarkable journey they take to fully become the men that they deserve to be and it was wonderful to see that even as they have ups and downs their love never falters and just got stronger. Sean and Rusty are two men that deserve all the happiness in the world, we see their happiness at the simplest things and how they work as a couple to make things work for them… standing together and leaning on each other to get through life.I recommend this to those who love seeing love deepen and grow, who love watching relationships develop and work through the ups and downs of life, who love characters who develop and grow even as they grow closer to their lover, and to those readers who love watching pivotal moments unfold into something incredible.
summary: 4 Hearts from MM Good Book Reviews

reviewText: This story opened in a way that showed me I was in for a good read and I wasn’t disappointed. This is a fast paced read with a good amount of twists in all the right places.Stefan caused me stress more than once or twice by his actions.  I liked Madeline and thought the author did a great job creating all the characters as I either liked them or found myself irked by one or two along the way.  The author made the characters very real and the descriptions surrounding them and their actions made them spring to life right away.The ending was one that I didn’t expect and actually had to re-read it as it blindsided me.  This was another strong point – any time I thought we were going left or thought I had something figured out, the author went a different way.  This definitely drew me even deeper into the story.This is a book that you won’t want to put down.
summary: Powerful story with an ending you won't see coming

reviewText: I like that this book is specially packaged for the seniors, it’s like giving them the acknowledgement they deserve. We all know that as we age and grow older, we are faced with limitations. The book doesn’t give you the false hope by contradicting that, instead, it gives brief but detailed reason as to why there are physical limitations as we age as well as the myths about ageing. I’ve been doing Yoga for more than 4 months now and I am glad to have influenced my mom. She’s almost 60. This book is perfect for having photos to illustrate some exercises! Good grab!

Each person, each family, each nation builds its own network of friendships, extended family, work, play, school, sports, entertainment, etc. We form our rituals of daily life, vacations, traditions, cultures, and inherited beliefs.  Some of us grow beyond those inherited beliefs, be they secular or religious and, through much self-work, experience, we form our own, live our lives along the paths we have plowed with so much effort shedding the beliefs previously presented as truths by our fore-bearers.Some of us abide in a place where we divide our loyalties between those who  think and believe as we do; find support in those of similar life patterns of belief and life styles, and find others whose lives are different as we see them among “enemies” of our way of life. Others try to remain open to conflicting points of view, trying to bridge gaps; trying to open communication and remain unaffected by propaganda, distorted religious dogmas, yellow journalism, and yes, just down and out plain lies and hyperbole.That being said, as humans when things, whatever they may be—economic, terrorist, job loss, “unacceptable” life styles that upset previous  “normalcy”—we  look, intentionally or unintentionally, for scapegoats;  for someone to blame, rather than ourselves for our perceived misfortune; for the perceived invasion of what we have designated as our neat and tidy artificially perfect, or not so perfect, life. Some accept responsibility which is good, moves one forward, but perhaps we should also ask what outside forces have impacted on us from areas previously never considered.So, what has all this to do with the 29 Conspiracies of the Orphan Trilogy?What if we think we are our own puppet masters; that we pull our own strings, and that is not now, nor never has been, the way of it?  What if those we consider THEM to our US, are not really the THEM that pull the strings, but that THEIR strings are being pulled; kept so deeply entangled with ours to keep us both too busy with “conflict” at  personal/national/international levels to notice the strings that are tying our heads and theirs up in knots?What if behind this veneer of civilization; behind this veil that obscures our sight, there are who lurk in the shadows—there are those to whom “regular people” are simply devices to be “educated” to produce the demand for what they supply—legally, illegally, out in plain sight, under the proverbial table of decency, honor, and every other word that supposedly defines one as a righteous woman or man?Once upon a time in November we were dismissed early for prom night.I was on a bus when I heard the news that shattered a dream. There was no prom that night. Everyone sat in horror in front of the television for days.Did we believe then, do we believe now, that our president was murdered in the way we were told? Not many of us, just as not many of us believed what we were told about Martin, about Bobby. Too many variables, too many too quick answers, too much at stake for such simplistic answers. But perhaps the explanation was to make us feel better in such a terrible time of betrayal?We do so like to feel good, thus, the pharmacological industry spends millions on advertisements about drugs that will help our hearts, our arthritis, our allergies and a host of other ailments. Everyone, every actor, in them seems the picture of health, tiptoeing through the tulips, bouncing a grandchild on our knees. And then, then come the warnings about possible side-effects from  everything from strokes to promiscuity, and, oh yes, kidney failure. That is in the fine print, in the sotto voce voice.We like to feel good, so corporations and banks all make advertisements around the idea that they care so much about us, maybe even give us an astonishing 1% back on our credit cards that carry usurious rates of interest, while paying less than that in interest on our savings accounts—and, well, yes, there were all those too good to be true mortgages that allowed us to find, maybe not keep, but find our homes.We are engaged in “endless war” against terrorists who could, will, are coming from wherever. We have color coded alert levels, a “permanent” loose coalition  of ill defined but always disparaged enemies with hordes of WMD's—somewhere.In the news there are those “meetings” of heads of state, CEO's of corporations, CEO's of banks just there to talk things through for the betterment of all. And if, indeed, they are there for the betterment of all, why is all kept sub rosa—secret...what happens in wherever, stays in wherever.We feel good that slavery is illegal, immoral, and yet close our eyes and ears to the horror of it still existing in many areas including sexual slavery increasingly rampant across the world. Would that donut you might be dunkin' while reading this truly taste as sweet if you really acknowledged that many of those contemporary slaves are children—prepubescent children armed with rifles, with shovels, or used as sexual slaves, forced physically through punishments or induced drug addictions?Surely they did not volunteer for service or have naps with cookies.And what is that little whatzit inside your cell phone, i Pad, etc. that is not available in huge quantities; that could make the country that has it rich, but which instead knows poverty and war? Wonder why?Does 200.000 billion seem like a lot of money to you? Does it seem a lot of money when it could end hunger worldwide? Have you checked out the costs of war in Iraq and Afghanistan? If we are so innately bellicose, if we so love war, can someone tell me why those who fight them are changed forever, suffer so many horrid physical aftermaths, and wake screaming, live screaming with PTSD? If were are innately bellicose, why are there 22 veterans suicides a day in the States alone?How necessary really is war, and what are the true causes behind it—what are the real profits behind it, and who is making them?What is the real cost of war in human terms? How many have come back, this is not even counting those who live in country, with TBI, with spinal cord injuries? How many KIA, WIA, MIA, in armies and civilian populations? If you don't know, why not?Why is the continent of Africa, so rich in resources, so devastatingly poor in so many areas?Are we mind controlled by some devious force in endless ways, subliminal ways? Are we becoming conditioned to drones making strikes, watching our movements; to subversion of our communication systems? If were are becoming conditioned to “collateral damage” of so many kinds, from whence cometh the conditioning? Who are those men who stare at goats?Are we really citizens united when some of us barely can make our electric bills, put food on the table, and others POUR millions into elections?Are you like Mulder, do you want to believe that they are out there, maybe even here, here even for a long, long time and not just sitting about munching on bonbons? If they are here, have been here, why are all not benefiting from advanced technology?Would you frack or put a pipeline in your own backyard and not expect some reaction from Mother Nature? Those of us old enough remember the advertisement saying that “you can't fool Mother Nature.” Perhaps it should have said you can't fool with Mother Nature, unless, of course, you want to make seemingly limitless money and don't give a tinker's damn about Mother Nature—her children, or her planet.The bottom line questions the Morcans are asking in this mind bending work are of importance to us. Many children never get over their fright of disturbing clown masks, of puppets on strings made to yell, hit each other, be verbally abusive to each other. What these authors are asking is simple—are we choreographing our own lives, or are there, indeed, very powerful puppet masters in the shadows, in the air, under the ground, deep in caves, and/or at sumptuous secretive retreats for those who broker power as their own inalienable right? Do we wish to live with might is right, or right is might?Do we want to live with power with, or under power over?Do we choose a Machiavellian world, or do we choose  the order we need for a new world of compassion, communication, and peace?Are you up to the challenge of the 29 Conspiracies of the Orphan Trilogy which gives a whole new cavernous dimension to a parent's terrible fear of not living long enough to care for and protect their children at least until they come of age. No one wants unprotected orphan children; well, maybe not no one. My reviews for the Trilogy are here online.Read this explosive unveiled follow up of the 29 ConspiraciesGo for it.Then start asking questions yourself and be prepared to dig deep, not from the infotainment “news.”  And, oh yeah, you might want to have a paperclip or two around to keep track of some things that will launch you into areas and things that you have heretofore never considered, or perhaps even heard of.Good read, great adventure for those with  the black hats, the Fedoras, or  those of the Tin Foil variety—an unveiling of those who possibly dwell in the shadows that whips up thought, pours light through those closed drapes and clandestine meetings to “them.”
summary: Only Those in the Shadows Truly Know

reviewText: Rafe and Nicki are in Paris for their wedding along with the rest of the gang. Of course there are complicationssuch as Nicki walking in on Rafe holding his first  girlfriend. And therein lies the story. It's a good one so don't miss it.Taylor does her usual good job tying up this series and it is not to be missed. All the books in this series are filled withexcitement and hard to put down reading. They are definitely worth the time and money so get them and enjoy.

I knew this would be a difficult journey for Kal and Caben after the dramatic ending in the first book, Of Silver and Beasts. Kal and Caben didn't part on the best of terms, but their connection is so strong they are continually drawn to one another. Of Darkness and Crowns was pretty exciting because there’s a lot of plotting and confrontations throughout, as both sides are preparing for war and the arrival of the goddess - Bale.I enjoyed seeing how deep Bale’s hold is on Caben. He struggles with her dominating his mind at times, but he manages to find a way to dull her for a while. His passion for Kal is still strong and he is not sure whether he wants to kill her or love her. One thing is certain; he does not want Bale to have her…Kal is protecting Caben’s kingdom from the Prince himself, but she wants to save him no matter the cost. She knows that he is still in there with Bale, and can see sparks of him when they are together. Kal also struggles with her faith for her goddess and empress. She is not sure if they are doing the right things and is unsure of what they want from her.Kal and Caben did reunite a few times throughout this book and I was excited to see the tension and passion that still exists between them. But with Bale still inside Caben, they struggle to hold that connection again. It was also exciting to see a lot of the characters from the first book returning too. They support Kal with everything she does, whether it’s good or bad.Trisha weaved some darker elements into this story, due to the evil that is trying to take over the world, and at times it may leave you gasping! Do not allow it to sway you… The story is not over yet! There were some components revealed that have opened my eyes to the depth of the plot and that the whole situation has had centuries to unfold. I have enjoyed the direction of the story so far and I am excited for the dramatic show down…Complimentary copy provided by the Author in exchange for an honest review.
summary: A fantastic, but dark sequel in the series..... I loved it!!

The reader gets to know more about  Nicki, Rafe, Gray and Caleb and their past as well as future. I will stop here as I don't want to give away the suspense!

reviewText: Wow..so worth the wait but be prepared, it's a tearjerker and sooooooooo much happens in this book. But what an ending! Kudos to C.C for another great book.

I was so looking forward to this book. I NEEDED 2 know what the heck happened to Alex & Cassie. The book takes you thru a roller coaster of your emotions OMG up & down. I actually had 2 put the book down for awhile so I could compose myself I was crying & sobbing so bad my sons came running to me to make sure I was ok. I get WAY to involved in my books..lol. I can not say enough about how well CC Brown finished this love story WOW!! I just wish it didn't end I want MORE of Alex & Cassie but we all know we cant let it go on 4ever. Thank you CC Brown for such an awesome conclusion to this wonderful couple :o)

I absolutely fell in love with Alex and Cassie’s story in Fraternizing and just couldn’t wait for Compromising to be done because I just needed to know how their story continued!Compromising is the continuation of the difficult times they have ahead. Their instant attraction and fraternizing led them to falling in love, trying to hide it and eventually, getting called out for it. Now both of their careers as Marines are on the line as consequences, and possibly so is their relationship.In this amazing follow-up and ending to their story, they endure the fight and struggle to make it through the system and somehow keep their love intact. But what happens when you can’t trust anybody, people who you thought were friends and family call you out, and have one pissed off First Sergeant that seems to be gunning for you both? Welcome to Alex and Cassie’s world on base Twentynine!The consequences to the fraternizing policy are dealt with but Alex and Cassie have to fight every step of the way. The Marines uphold important rules and value the importance of obiding them, maintaining proper procedures of consequences if such rules are broken. Both of them knew this prior to establishing their relationship. What they didn’t know was how everything would play out, testing their love and devotion to one another. It seemed like with every step, there was a barrier for them to struggle to break through and their road to happiness would not start off easy.This is a beautiful struggle for them to learn the meaning of Compromising. Alex admits he will screw up but Cassie is just the one to give him s*** when he deserves it. With everything going on with the legality of their fraternization, miscontrued friendships and family issues, can their love for one another overcome the road blocks and push on?Compromising was a fantastic conclusion to Alex and Cassie’s story. They really went through so much that your emotions were just so up and down. Alex is a hard, alpha, military badass that when he is passionate and loves something, nothing and no one will penetrate that aura around him and that object of love. Cassie has a dedication to prove herself. Her mom knocked her ego down growing up so the joining the Marines was her escape to prove herself. On that journey to being her own badass, she saw the light in Alex’s dark and was able to show him that he doesn’t need to be all Alpha all the time, to see the logic in a situation. Cassie was his calming and voice of reason. Their love was definitely tested but in the end, they both realized love was winning out, they’re better together than they are apart.Again, a GREAT story and GREAT ending! Absolutely LOVED the epilogue! This story does toy with your emotions and you may shed some tears with the events that go on but it’s real, this s*** does happen whether we like it or not. Alex and Cassie get their happily ever after and then some but again, it’s not an easy road to get through. Riley and Nat were great, as was Dalton! Alex’s sister Adriana was funny and I loved her so the great supporting characters continued on as did the slimey backstabbers creating drama!I really enjoyed Fraternizing and Compromising so definitely put them on your to-be-read list!

Wow  This book had me in tears at some parts.  Sorry for a Fell for them.  So happy they worked through all of there problems.  Alex and Cassie had such a chemistry that he could not live without.  They had a lot of struggles esp. being in the Marines.  People should not be judged because of there love.  You do not know when it is gonna hit you.  I loved these books.  Sorry to see it end.
