reviewText: I really enjoyed this Novella By Renee Trofe. It was a great quick read! Filled with lots of fun & passion.If your looking for a fun, sexy novella this would be one of my top picks!! You wont be disappointed.

I had never heard of Zentangle but saw this book and it caught my eye. I think this is an excellent idea for anyone who needs a mental break anytime. If you don’t know what Zentangle is, it is a way of creating art while essentially meditating. You may think “I’m not an artist!” but with this method, truly anyone can be an artist. I would highly recommend this book to everyone because it provides a mental break throughout the day.

Even those of us that live the paleo lifestyle don't have to forego sweets. This book tells you all about it and is filled with tastiness for you to discover. I thoroughly enjoyed this one. My thanks!
The story flowed and the characters seemed to reach out and touch me.  The ending was beautiful and brought a tear to my eye!  Highly recommended!
Summer Lee once again engages us, this time with a modern day story of the search for truth, and finding the unbelievable and supernatural.

BED OF ROSES by Rita Herron is short--43 pages (without front- and end-matter).  It's full of twists, turns, and very short chapters (some half a page).  Herron wrote this with an economy of words (this can be a very good thing).In brief, our heroine is suddenly the focus of a stalker whose threats become more and more frightening.  She turns to her next-door neighbor, a hunky and handsome policeman.  This is the beginning of their romance as they're thrown together by his need to protect her and the investigation.  Interestingly enough, we see short snippets of the villain's point of view.  Sometimes this inclusion stoked the apprehension I felt as a reader and sometimes it detracted from the suspense.This was my first exposure to Rita Herron's work, though I have several of her books in my TBR cue.  I look forward to reading longer novels, as this glimpse of the quality of her writing has me interested.  Recommended to fans of contemporary romantic suspense.
summary: Lots of plot in this short novella

reviewText: Along with some great recipes, The Hot Sauce Cookbook is really informative!  The first few chapters give an entertaining and in depth look at peppers from around the world and how they’re used – a must for anybody who wants to cook with them successfully.  There’s also a heat scale that lets you see how common chilies stack up in terms of hotness.  The recipes cover not only how to make various hot sauces but also other dishes that use them – a bit of a bonus.  It’s an entertaining and educational little cookbook that really teaches how to make and use all kinds of hot sauces, not just the typical Southwestern ones.

We find that the history of human use of peppers, chili and related “hot” ingredients for use in cooking actually goes back thousands of years. This and other interesting facts are just a few of the fascinating historical traditions and sources of how these types of foods began and traced back to our ancestors. Along with the history lesson, dozens of great recipes are included for the connoisseur of hot foods and for those interested in exploring these unique tastes. Some basics on ingredients, methods of preparation and equipment needed, as well as useful safety tips are part of the lesson to be learned when using hot sauces and make for interesting reading and a valuable resource for making your hot sauce experience a successful one.
I enjoyed this series very much. In fact, I awaited each book with anticipation as they are fun, rompy, light reading in the usual Sawyer Bennet style of story writing.
What a great ending to the series. I just love sawyer and all her books! She's a great writer and I become instantly addicted!!
It was a cute serial.  I couldnt wait to see what happened with the couple.  Of Course I knew what was going to happen in the end.

I wasn't sure how this story would end. I anticipated an HEA for Matt and Mac but didn't have a clue how. My girl Mac stayed true to herself and it made me and I know Matt love her more! Mac's strength in her beliefs and not wavering from them was great. She didn't want to change Matt just wanted to help him find peace. :) LOVED the ending!!!

Legal Affairs series is wonderful! I read all 6 books in one sitting. I'm a sucker for a good HEA and was not disappointed with Matt and Mac's story. Never disappointed with Sawyer Bennett. Good job :)

I really enjoyed the way she wrote this series.  She released the books at least every two weeks which kept it moving fast.  I also loved the characters and you really fell right into the story with them.  I have read all of her books and love the way she writes and the characters.  Keep writing and I will keep reading.
This was a fun series to get into. At times it was a little predictable, but and enjoyable read nonetheless.

Affirmation was everything I wanted it to be and so much more! Here we have Matt, still on the fence, being his usual jerky self (but with appeal) and Mac, who has grown so much throughout the story and has easily become one of my favorite female characters. Things are pretty much up in the air for them and their relationship since Mac wants more and Matt is unwilling to go there. This one definitely tugs at your emotions and having invested so much into these characters and this story, the way things ended made it all worth it.Matt made me want to tackle him for what he put both him and Mac through while he was battling his demons and even though I understood and sympathized with the guy, he definitely pushed my buttons. Mac, on the other hand, has gotten more and more awesome and I loved how, despite her feelings for Matt, won’t accept anything less than what she deserves and knows she deserves greatness. I also loved that Mac is slowly becoming more confident as a lawyer and makes great strides to further her career in this last installment. While I wasn’t too keen on the new obstacle they had to face this time, stupid Matt, I liked what it did for their dynamic and it really helped kick things into gear for them.And that ending?! Sigh, I love how Bennett doesn’t hold anything back and really ends this story with a BANG! Even when it was over, I just couldn’t get enough. This is definitely one of my favorite books from her and a favorite romance read in general.I am so sad to see this book end and I really hope Bennett writes more books like this. Since this was my first time reading a serial romance, I have to say, while the waiting sucks, the actual experience is pretty fun! Seriously, whether you’re a fan of Bennett’s or not, you’ll want to give this book a try. One read and you’ll never be the same again!
summary: A strong finish to a very addicting serial romance!

reviewText: Lots of twists and turns.  This book is unpredictable, a real page turner.  Jack is a real hero, the old fashioned kind.

I like the two books I've read now.  I am holding off for the third reading as I hate to not have another one coming.Replacement is a kick in the pants and looking forward to their friendship growing.  You can just see the facial expressions between Jack and Replacement (Alice), great!
summary: Sure Hope Grayson has more to come.

reviewText: All these lies, deceit, treachery, no loyalty OMG where does it end. OMG now everyone is procreating WTH is going on here. I am so done. This circle of love is unbelievable. smh Great read though...Can't wait for episode 3

This was a really cute and sweet romance about best friends, Kitty and Aaron.  While Kitty has stronger feelings for Aaron, she's not sure what to think when he flirts with her one minute and then asks her to help him plan the 'perfect date' for another woman.I loved both of these characters and really enjoyed this story that takes place during the Christmas season.  It's the third book in the author's Dreams Come True series, but it can totally stand alone.

This was a quick, sweet read that I really enjoyed. Kitty and Aaron are best friends who have feelings for each other, but neither one realizes it. The chemistry between them was great. Even though this was a short story, the pace was good and it felt complete.

I love Noelle Adam's books and have read and sometimes re-read her books but this one was just not that good. I was disappointed in the hero and heroine, kind of boring people. I wasn't super interested in what happened to them. I felt that the story just fell short, like it just kind of ended. Anyway, readers of Noelle will love "A Negotiated Marriage" or "Listed" or "Missing", etc. but this one is just missing something.

Usually I am not a big of short stories. I enjoyed the plot line of this book, demons on the uprise. But wished it gave you more. I enjoyed the erotica, which added to the story. The story ended quickly leaving you needing more to have the complete story.

I'm a fan of short stories and read as many as I can. This is a story of regret about the choices we make when young that can come back to haunt us as we grow older. Well written in a clear voice. I look forward to reading more of Mr. Bell's writing.

Loved the characters and story line. Everyone has a dream and passion. Knowing that you have choices and that you don't always make the right choices is alright too. Would highly recommend this book to others. Enjoyed it all.

Technology is just the part of our life, but never should be the heart of the life. Unfortunately, it becomes our addiction to check Email, Facebook, Twitter, or chatting with friends and relatives hours together. After reading this book, I really realized how much unsocial, I became in last five years; while I used to call my relatives to convey holiday wishes, now just leave them messages on Facebook.  I totally forget when the last time I passed an entire day with email, Facebook or net browsing. This book is quite well written, and full of some impressive findings. This book delivers an important awakening message to all of us about our technology addiction. I already shared this book with my best buddies, and they also agreed that each of identifying issues in the books is absolutely practical, self-realizing, and honest.Ben's friendly and straightforward writing style turns this book also a page turner. I never thought that some of our addictions are actually embedded in our household chores. Simply surprising!!  Definitely I would recommend reading this awesome book.

Joe is a newly divorced man. He meets Myra and a relationship starts. She is afraid what will happen if she falls in love with Joe. Joe wants to have a relationship with her. They is secrets in Myra past that could end them. What will happen when Joe finds out. I love this story and love the way author unfolded the story.

This the first book I’ve read from this author. There were things I liked and disliked like most books. Some things I enjoyed were the secondary characters and their contribution to the story. It’s always helpful to get to know the main characters through thoughts from secondary characters. Gives me a better feel for them. Justice and Nic had great chemistry. They were definitely sizzling on page. There was a good connection that straddled the insta-love and insta-lust line. I especially enjoyed things from Nic’s POV. The way he looked and reacted to Justice really helped me understand what he was seeing in him. Justice was kind of a whirlwind character. He was all over the place. He was high then low. Strong then weak. Feminine and then masculine. I felt rung out just reading about him. I can’t imagine actually being in love with him. Complex character indeed.Some of the things that didn’t work for me were Justice’s panic attacks. I just didn’t feel his pain and fear. I know I read it but it just didn’t break that barrier where I’m right there in it with the character. So, I was just reading about Justice’s many issues and how they affected the people around him. I’m not the saint Nic is and became frustrated with Justice. Justice went from public displays of affection to not being able to walk in his friend’s wedding with Nic when that meant the world to Nic after his ex made Nic his dirty little secret. Came off as selfish and cruel. He did redeem himself in the end. I get the fact that he had to deal with his issues before he could really be with Nic but I don’t have to like it!Another thing that niggled with me was Nic’s dirty talk to Justice at some very inappropriate times. Justice was way back in the closet and for Nic to talk about pounding Justice into a mattress while in public almost seemed vulgar instead of sexy. I get that he was pushing him but it just seemed like too much. For the most part Nic was an amazing guy and I adored his character. This was my only issue with him.I kind of wish Rich’s character wasn’t so over the top. You understand where all the BS comes from by the end of the book but he’s just so unlikable. I have strongly disliked a character before and an author fully redeemed him in my mind and hopefully, if the next book is heading where I think it is, that happens. I did like Rory and my mind is already wondering about him….. I’ll be picking up the next book to find out!Originally posted at "live Your Life, Buy The Book"

There are many books out there regarding how to lessen chronic pain. Some are good, some excellent and some not helpful at all. This book I found unique and very helpful as I am a person that has chronic shoulder pain from a car accident.What I love about this book:+ Six chapters are listed in the table of contents, each has a link so I just pressed the chapter that I wanted to read and was taken right to it - what a timesaver!+ Each chapter has HELPFUL and USEFUL suggestions that are realistic and holistic and they work! This is important for one who wants to feel better naturally with natural things.+ My favorite chapter is chapter 3 Utilize Your Inner Healer, which has a section on How To Balance Your Brain. This has step by step exercises that help one THINK clearer and balance the brain. This I believe is the first step to healing and good health!
summary: Helpful book for one with chronic pain!

reviewText: This book teaches you how to cure chronic pain in a step by step format. The author does a great job making the strategies easy but powerful. I would recommend this book to anyone suffering from any kind of chronic pain.
This series gets better and better...this is the best so far! I love the characters, love getting to know them. The plot is intense...in a I-can't-put-it-down way!!

I enjoyed this book so much more than Tex.  Of course, Shooter is still my favorite book in this series.  Hawk was a great alpha H that really couldn't believe his turn around thinking about relationships.  Think you should give this one a try.

Where do I begin?? Well, my only complaint is, I wish it were a lot longer. But as usual, Niles Manning gets the point across. I love the way other characters from the proceeding books are tied in to the details. I became a fan of Yoni somewhat in this book, but at other times she frustrated me. However, all that is a good thing. She holds your interest until the end. Ready for the next one.

reviewerName: Jade Jones Author of Cameron "Author of Cameron"
reviewText: I already knew this would be a banger from the posted excerpts and I was not at all disappointed. Niles Manning really brings his characters to life with the depth of their personalities. I have yet to be disappointed by a read from this author. Keep 'em coming. Wish you much success.
The premise is lame.I wasn't impressed and the story doesn't meet Aliyah's usual standard.Not worth paying for IMHO
This was a great story that had me hooked from page one. I didn't know what to expect next and I loved that. I can't wait for part 2.

Seems lately that cheating is a big thing in books that I have read and more often than not, in fact the person who has been accused of the cheating hasn't exactly or in a way they weren't themselves, though in saying that there are some scumbags out there in the big bad world who are cheaters.  Amber had her whole life planned, she was going to head to college with her boyfriend Kyle and move in with him and life was going to be swell as they were soul-mates and meant to be or so she thought, when she walked into his bedroom and heard the shower running and saw a naked girl sitting on his bed. She assumed the worst and left without a word as the smalltown of Oakville reminded her too much of Kyle and she couldn't afford to get her heartbroken again. Now six years have passed and Amber is back in Oakville needing another fresh start as she has again found her fiance cheating on her. Amber heads back into town and gets a job as a waitress but what will happen when it is discovered that the owner KC who is currently on tour with his band turns out to be none other than Kyle Connors - her first love and the one whose heart she ripped out and inspired their band name "Bleeding Hearts". It seems though that someone else has their eye on Amber , Beau and if he has his way Amber will be all his. What will happen when Amber discovers that Beau knows the truth about her parent's death and then finds herself clinging on to her life as Beau turns nuts. Can Kyle rescue her and this time the pair of them can finally receive their HEA? Find out in book #1 of the Oakville Series by Kathy-Jo Reinhart.
summary: Is your first love, your destined soul-mate ?

reviewText: So now what does emery still loves wise even though she married to his friend???? Wow its a small world

Very Good read!! I've read this author before and really enjoy her books. I loved Wise n Emery. Shad I liked too. Sure the fireworks gonna pop in pt 2 between these three. Gonna be some payback too. One click you won't be disappointed!!
I thoroughly enjoyed this book! I laughed my ads off at so many of the witty descriptive expressions this creative author has written. Great job. I was able to clearly visualise every paragraph.

OMG,I so loved this book even as short as is was.. I cant wait to see how the author get Wise and Emery back together and get Shad out the picture.. Tiffany is a mess, I didnt think she would end up with all them kids.. Marie id going to be a proble that much I can see.
I must say that this book was great.. it held my attention from beginning to the end. I love the friendship that Em and wise had.

Tara and Lucian are still doing the tug of war over who is going to be the Dom and I can't wait to see what happens in Round Three but I swear, I just want to punch the "host" of the show, she needs to back off! LOLCharacters: I loved Lucian right away just because of his name, something about that name just makes me all hot and bothered. Tara and Lucian's characters grow in this installment of Dom Wars and I feel even more connected to them than the first book.Sex: the chemistry between Lucian and Tara is electric!Religious: noWould I recommend to others: yesMore than one book in the series: yesGenre: EroticWould I read more by this author: yes~Wicked Reads Review Team~

Wow, this book is HOT!This book continues where round one left off. Each challenge crazier than the last. Lucian and Tara are doing everything they can to stay in the competition.There were a few minor grammatical errors but other than that I thought this book was great! It's fast paced, engaging, each chapter leaves you wanting to continue with the next. So far this is turning out to be a fun, sexy series!  Happy reading

I loved Dom Wars Round One, but I have to say this surpassed it by leaps and bounds. I didn't think Mr. Bane could make the book series better but he did. The sex scenes were hot, and I loved how Lucian and Tara's characters evolved. I can't wait to see what he has in store for us in Round Three!
All I will say is that this book gave a good view of the lifestyles of the Dom,could have been more on the Domme.The storyline was hot.

Round 2  More demons come out and trust starts to happen more. Lucian and Tara have more to do but together they can face it. The protector in Lucian to keep Tara safe and to break down the walls that are up to keep her safe from everyone and thing she hides from. Great book.

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads, so here is my review. I enjoyed this one much more than the first one. It had more substance to me than the first one. And with most challenges for Tara and Lucian, it makes you wonder if her will let him break her walls down. She keeps herself hid from the world but Lucian wants to learn all her secrets and to be hers forever. He has fallen for her and it hurts him to see her retreat back behind those walls. Tara thinks she is only there to win and that was true at the beginning. She is losing the war with herself and her feelings stirring inside about Lucian. While the challenges are getting somewhat disturbing, can they past them and win? Will the public keep voting for them? Another great round and hope for round three soon.**Wicked Reads Review Team**
Loved it. I enjoy the game dom wars but the emotional battle They face is keeping me on edge waiting for her to admit love.

This one left off just where the first ended, at the competition for the Ultimate Dom. These challenges were definitely harder than the first, more mentally challenging and based on trust between the couple essentially.I love Tara and Lucian, they really pull you into their story and have you falling in love with them both even more! Tara is still very feisty and is determined to be the Dom in the relationship. She does make me laugh sometimes and then really feel for her at other times.Lucian is in love with Tara and wants to protect her in everything, he wants there to be more between them than just the DOM Wars and gaining points, but although Tara enjoys and is fully committed in the things they do you can still see that her walls are up and she is in it for the points gaining, or is kidding herself that is the only thing she is there for anyway.Again there are very HOT scenes in this, written so well and you can clearly feel the passion between them. Cannot wait for the next round to see what challenges are brought on them this time and hoping to see more of Tara's walls come down as she opens herself up to Lucian more.
summary: Definitely 4/4.5* read for me! Brilliant read!

reviewText: Lucian Bane IS the ineffeable DOM - seriously.  This series is a must read for anyone who is a fan of BDSM - totally new take on the Dom/s roles and what it means to really Dom a woman (or man).  Very proud of Lucian for bringing light to a lifestyle that hit the scenes like a hot celebrity - he has made this a reality, what THE lifestyle should actually look like.  Ah-mazing!

Round 2 yeah, another round of self reflecting and inner challenges that Lucian and Tara have to overcome. As they continue to maneuver through the emotionally  complicated test they realize that they are becoming closer to one another. He embraces the bond and she fights it all the way.I can see why she would though, it is a hard thing to give up control, I mean we can let go of our inhibitions that is hard in itself. But to let go of the control you have on who you let into your heart and soul??? Well that is something. I can relate to Tara when it comes to that.Lucian is another enigma in this book not so much that we don't understand his feelings but that we see how far he is willing to go to capture the heart he so much wants to be his. And in the process he begins to find himself changing in ways he didn't think he could change.Lucian and Tara have captured my heart and I cant wait for the next round to see where there hearts are at. Which one will break and which one will dominate in Round 3
summary: Another hit! This one earning more POINTS than the last *8* from me!

reviewText: This is such a great start to this series!  Logan is an author in town doing a reading.  Ava is an art student who got dragged by her friend to attend this reading.  After the reading, Logan approaches Ava.  Eventually, you see there's this attraction he and Ava shares that keeps you very interested in this story.  Logan just seems very smooth and sly in his approach.  Ava is trying to fight this attraction,  I'm very eager to see what is going to happen next between Logan and Ava!

I can’t wait for you to all meet Samantha Ross, Cole Walker, and even Bentley, Sam’s brother.  Three kids who grew up in the slums together, fighting to survive.Let’s begin with Samantha Ross.  A young girl who has been damaged by her past.“I was afraid to get close to anyone because if I did, they would leave.  Everyone always did.”But she was tough.  Sam was strong willed and brave….she may have dressed like a girl but she was not a girly girl by any means.“I might have blushed if I was that kind of girl.  But I wasn’t.  I didn’t blush.  Nor did I swoon, grow breathless, get butterflies, or feel giddy over a boy.”Sam speaks her mind and tells it like it is…good or bad, take it or leave it.  She has no problem standing up for herself, anything to protect herself from getting hurt.And now let me introduce you to Cole Walker…the bad boy from the ghetto, best friend to Samantha’s brother Bentley.  A man who doesn’t pretend to be something that he is not.“I was who I was.  A driver.  A thug.  A drunk.  A man with a long list of crimes.”“People were right – I was an animal.  Self-disgust turned the meanness in me to full blast.”Still….he can’t resist the one thing he feels that he can never have, Samantha Ross.  A girl he grew up with, was close with…until one day changed their lives forever“And I did hate her.  I hated the way she made me feel.  How she smelled, how she walked, how she smiled with her eyes.  I hated that I would do anything for her, including going to jail.”I have never felt so much tension between two characters before.  The story wold bring them together and I’d be fist pumping and then something would happen to ruin a moment or pull them apart and I would want to throw my kindle.  The lust and the anger was a deadly combination.  The need and the want were sooooooo strong!!!  Here’s a little taste of what you can expect…“The boy would be my destruction and my savior.  He would challenge me.  Keep me sane and drive me crazy.  He would destroy and save me.“Sure, we hated each other and probably always would but there was a part of me that was intrigued by him.  I guess I was still that little girl, curious about that mysterious angry boy who lived down the street.”“I had my hand in my enemy’s hair, sampling Sam’s mouth like there was no tomorrow.  My d1&k; was hard pressed up against her, begging for what it wanted.  It felt like a sin, kissing her.  It was headier than the rush I got from alcohol.  Crazier that the thrill I got from racing.  I felt out of control, desperate to have her.  Willing to do anything to her too.  It scared the s#it out of me so I let her go.”Should they even be together though….my heart screamed “YES for the love of pete YES….get together, be together…SOMETHING!!!!”  While my head was busy saying “Oh no….disaster waiting to happen…don’t do it, no do it….wait….maybe this won’t work!”  Oh yeah…it was just like that!“That monster caused this hate between us and that hate keeps you away from me.  That’s exactly where I need you to be – safe and nowhere near me.”“I disliked him, but I liked his touch, I wanted to be near him but I needed to keep my distance.  I thought he was an a$$hole and he probably thought I was a bi%^h, but for some reason, we wanted each other.  It didn’t make sense.”There is so much trouble for everyone in this book…bad guys everywhere, drama at every turn.  When they finally realize what is happening…will it be too late?“I didn’t want to waste another second of my life denying it.  I may never deserve her but damn, I wanted her for all time.”This book will have your heart racing and pounding….I can’t tell you how many times I clutched my chest and screamed out!  Go and one click now….you won’t regret it!!

A fun book for dog lovers. Learn different tips to train your dog. This book was written with love and is clear and concise about how to train your dogs and puppies. It is a book that you can take your time with and get your dog to be the best dog he can be.

I am really glad that I read this book. It had so many great tips that will surely help you to train your dog. I will definitely be implementing these tools immediately with my own dog. Overall great read!

XXX: A 60 Story Erotic eBook Collection is a very good erotica collection, a worthy addition to your bookshelf. While some might be put off by the description of the book having sixty stories, don't worry: the book doesn't skimp of quality. Each story is well-written, with engaging characters, bizarre twists and odd turns. I found myself compelled to keep reading; the book truly has that "page-turner" quality.The sheer quantity of stories in XXX: A 60 Story Erotic eBook Collection is also a plus. Each story covers a wide variety of erotic situations, ensuring that the book will appeal to an extremely large audience. Regardless of what turns you on, there's something in XXX for everyone.If you're looking for another erotica book for those lonely late nights, XXX: A 60 Story Erotic eBook Collection is a worthy buy. It's sexy, engaging and fun: everything erotica should be.
it started out good but then i lost my intrest and i didnt like the way it had ended but it is a good reading

I love the role-reversal concept of If Women Ran The World - of course, I'm a woman, and have experienced many of the difficulties my gender faces in this world my whole life, so it's a refreshing change to get to see males deal with the same problems.I laughed watching women in positions of power inherit the qualities of men, as well as men in the female subordinate position begging for shopping and chocolate. It makes you wonder - how many of those characteristics developed because we stayed at home, because we were left out of competition?If Women Ran The World is a book that will make you laugh and also re-think your position on how our society works. Five stars for this woman-forward read.

This story is frightening! Yet...intriguing! I felt like a double standard female. seeing a vice versa setting and having men as the subservient and women as the dominant was mind blowing! however it also made me want to share this book with my girls and guy friends. I hope more people read it.

I got this book in exchange for a review but didn't get on with it. Somehow it was too twee with men coming out with the cliches women have been saying for years. It seemed more intent on getting the stereotypes into the narrative rather than telling a story. It might just not be my sense of humour.

This a really good book for anyone who wants eat healthy or is vegan eater. This book has advice and health benefits of veganeating and recipes which are easy to follow and written in a step by step way. Also the ingredients shown can be found frommost local supermarkets.

Are you ready to change your life fot the better? So decide what you want in life and plan how to get it. Goal setting is the easiest and the hardest choice at the same time. But if you don’t decide now, you will never decide. This book explains you how to do it, so get it before they raise the price! I enjoyed it!

Goal Setting: How To Set Goals, Get Goal Motivation And Achieving Goals For Total Success by Luke Kennedy is a 38 page book consisting of 22 chapters. Clearly this book is going to be extremely superficial and will lack both details and specificity. This "Goal Setting" book is yet another in a sea of related books that are more motivational than functional. Do not expect to learn how to actually set goals with this book. While reading this book I got the visual of the late night infomercial guy Tony Little yelling, "You can do it!" This book failed to offer anything new or insightful.One of the better goal setting books that I highly recommend is:How To Set Goals and Keep Themby Scott Kirshner, M.Ed.  This book actually provides a specific method on how to set goals and provides numerous examples of how to actually write down and formulate the goal. It also reviews common reasons why goals fail, motivation, and ways you can get back on track. If you are looking for a goal setting book then get How to Set Goals and Keep Them.Overall Assessment:Goal Setting: How To Set Goals, Get Goal Motivation And Achieving Goals For Total Success by Luke Kennedy is a book that I would skip especially if you are really serious about setting goals. Providing a motivation rah rah rah as this book does will not get you to achieving your goals. There are better options available as previously mentioned.

I adore Haley and loved having an episode from her perspective. She is the perfect mix of best friend, brains and sarcasm. This episode is one of my favorites of season two with non-stop action, all of the main characters in play and we are FINALLY getting Miller back. Haley's inner monologues and interactions with Kane were just the icing on the cake.

With powerful characters, passionate love scenes, and an unexpected storyline, Nothing Special is one of my favorite stories by A.E. Via! She has quickly become one of my favorite authors in the M/M Erotic Romance Genre. Writing characters that are strong yet vulnerable and constantly surprising me with the versatility of her storytelling, Nothing Special is a book that I had been looking forward to reading for quite some time. While some readers were shocked and disappointed by some of the changes that took place within God and Leo's relationship during the course of the story, I was blown away by the raw honesty and open communication that the two men shared.  With 10 out of 10 flames in the passion department, this is an adult story for grown-up readers, and I loved every minute of it!
summary: Raw and unexpected; I loved it!

reviewText: I skimmed about a hundred pages of the book. The relationship was resolved so easily and early in the book that I got bored. And I see what some of the other reviewers mean about needing to be proofread better. Obvious mistakes like the incorrect use of "your" when the author meant "you're" were added distractions.
summary: Story was okay but too long

reviewText: I have totally bought into the story and the great characters. I was slow to read the second book but now will be pestering the author for more after reading books 3 & 4. Great writing and an entertaining way to spend a pre-apocalyptic afternoon. Thanks to the author.
WANT THE NEXT BOOK

The Slow Burn series is an excellent new spin on the zombie stories. They are well thought out with very enjoyable characters. Poor Zed, anything that can go wrong for him will go wrong. He always seems to come out stronger for it. I highly recommend this series.
summary: This is a great new series!!!

reviewText: There was definitely a message at the end that he got loud and clear! Very nicely written, adorable illustrations, age appropriate.

I'm A Dragon by author Sigal Adler was wonderfully crafted, edited and illustrated.This story showed the patience's of a "dad" and how he tolerated his child's decision to become a "reckless child" for a few hours. The dad indulged his son until he had enough.I mean this story really was a big hit.The illustrations was powerful, creative and awesome.Excellent job to Sigal Adler.
Its a read that is deep in thought and may not work for all.  It is one of my favorites.  The look inside a very disturbed mind.

I discovered that this book existed after watching the movie the League of Extraordinary Gentlemen and was automatically interested. I couldn't put this book down. It is possibly one of the best books I have ever read...not only action wise, but topic wise as well due to the fantasy and imagination put into this book.

If sex is what you want to read about here it is. If you want a plot that makes sense and is believable it isn't this book. To be honest I really don't know how to review this one. It sounds like a fan of the Sons of Anarchy was tripping and wrote this. Very high school like. I think I will be skipping books by this author.

I gave it only one star because the novel was badly written. I only read part of the first novel in the set. It might just not be my thing. But if you like Lee Child and John Sandford, novels that are written with precision and a sense of humor, you probably won't like this set of novels.

I really liked this book! I honestly didn't know much about yoga before, and that's why I found this book so helpful. It was catered to beginners like myself, and I found it really easy to follow and understand.I would definitely recommend this to all other beginners looking to learn more about yoga!
The third book in the series is yet to be released!  The story is what one would expect from this author, wonderful escapism.
great sequel that was enjoyed very much. as I am retired from the usn I very much enjoyed the nautical terms used. looking forward to the sequel.
Starts out kind of slow and soap operish but once the carrier departed on it's mission the action moves right along.

One of the best Space navy/fleet scifi books ive read in years. The battles in Space are deploying tactics not described so well since the master and commander series. Also the Aliens themselfes are really creaping me out and the suspense that is built up before battles is almost unbearable. Read IT

The Ark Royal series is an extremely enjoyable read. Massive battles, strong characters, deep and believable technology. This is a strong book 2 and I read it straight through with pleasure. Will buy book 3 and am looking forward to it!

But the idea that England would be able to field monster starships is a bit of a stretch. However, the storyline is great, and the characters are interesting to follow. The cliffhanger at the end is a setup for the next book. I'd prefer that each book be standalone, in that ends are tied up by the end of the book. I've noticed that many authors on Amazon seem to write serials that require one to purchase many books to get to the end. Sometimes it is hard to wait for the next book and by the time it comes out I've forgotten the earlier episodes.

It is always been my interest to look for organic foods. I have seen many books, but this book is different, as it explains the selection process in a very clear and easy to understand way. Not only that, I know that I can now be healthy in a smart way, and organic food is definitely worth pursuing.
Loved it I hope there's more comeing soon I can't wait to read more from Mantra and his group.:) if any of you have not read her books give them a try you will like them.
These books were 95% porno descriptions of togetherness and 5% Seal unauthorized police domestic action.  Wanted to read about what Seals do best -- protecting our country on missions abroad.

These are really fun books, and they portray  a gamut of personality types around the SEALS common theme.The stories themselves are well written and entertaining. The characters are very, very well drawn and very likeable. I would recommend this series to anyone who enjoys a good, uncomplicated, entertaining reading experience.  The SEALS common theme is just a bonus, Sharon Hamilton writes well!

really enjoyed this book.  I love reading the stories about seals and their bravery and sacrifice in becoming the men they are.  These  men are above average and love American enough to give all they have for our protection.  Sharon did a great job, could not quit reading until i had finished all the books. You cannot go wrong with good love stories about seals with this package
I highly recommend this book.  Each book was better than the one before. The author made the characters real & the plots intriguing.
If you have ever experienced devastating loss in your life, you need to read Bob's book. Receive truth. Find hope.  You can Enter Life Again.

My humble and unprofessional opinion says there is no perfect way to lose weight – as each body has its own “infrastructure”. But for sure, no matter what works for everyone there are a couple of guiding principles that should be followed. What I have enjoyed about this book is the fact that it has information about a healthy lifestyle and it has recipes for house made juices. I was buying the ones in supermarkets before but I was looking for something more natural. This book provides the right explanation, advice and recipes about the importance of juices in our life.

I bought this book after watching Fat, Sick, and Nearly Dead and seeing how powerful juicing can be. I was not dissapointed with this book! It is full of simple and straightforward recipes and hints that also happen to be delicious! The weight is coming off so fast! I couldn't recommend this book (and juicing) any more.
This novel was emotionally charged and very funny. There were poignant moments, suspense in spades in many scenes, and incredibly funny turns that had me laughing out loud! Very well done.
The entire series was wonderful! It is a must read. Family is forever! The wedding seemed so magical and beautiful

This book is an easy read for experienced developers as well as less technical folk looking to get started with Bootstrap. There are lots of screenshots, functional examples, and technical explanations to make it clear how you can use the Bootstrap framework starting today! The book gets right to the point and is something you can carry comfortably as a reference guide since it is only about a hundred pages. Looking forward to reading more books from this author
summary: Exactly what I was looking for

reviewText: Getting Started with Bootstrap 3 is an in depth look at one of the most widely used frameworks in the industry.  Bootstrap 3 supports responsive web design and is compatible with the latest versions of all major browsers.  You'll need a basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and some JavaScript.The book gives some excellent practical examples and is a wonderful guide book to get you started with Bootstrap 3.I was very impressed with the quality of information for such an economical price..it really is a deal!
summary: This book is a deal - a lot of info for the money!

reviewText: This book quite literally covers everything you need to know regarding Bootstrap. The author, Ryan Flores, has an excellent teaching style that is easy to follow and understand, something that is vitally important when learning about such a technical subject.The screenshots were a very helpful addition as I feel it is always easier to understand something when there is a visual aid. Whilst this subject may seem daunting at first the book breaks it down in such a way that it suddenly appears much more approachable and manageable.For any web designers out there I would highly recommend this guide as a fantastic resource. Extensive knowledge is certainly not needed so inexperienced people should not be put off.Overall the book contains a wealth of practical information. I was extremely impressed so a rating of five stars is well deserved.

The book is long, very long=it took me 5 days to read, at every given opportunity.I could not put it down. There are some unexpected twists, and not always happy ones,but the insight to the characters of the book were exceptional.. Very highly recommended, it was really unexpected just how good it was.
summary: A really great book to lose yourself.

reviewText: I am not sure how anyone is going to do a great job making money through self publishing after reading this book. However, let me say that I LOVED the cover. That was my main reason for downloading the book.Now to the content of the book. I am glad I knew all the information in this book as this book whets the appetite but does not deliver. The book has such great promise. It is as if the author created a great mind map but forgot to fill in all the areas with the appropriate content.There were basic errors in the book, but I am not normally bothered by a few typographical issues. However, when a word is capitalized and followed by an exclamation point, I take note. The word MUST be important. The word you may wonder - EMMIDIATELY. You see, you should start doing what the author is recommending EMMIDIATELY. The author  needs to correct this glaring error "immediately" as it stands out so boldly.My pet peeve however was the chapter 9 which turned out to be an infomercial for a Kindle Money Mastery service. I do not see an issue with a recommendation for a service, but the entire chapter devoted to following some guy name Stephan who obviously has it all figured out.Of course, it just required a small investment but that would be quickly recouped and exponential benefits reaped. Needless to say I didn't bother with the final chapter 10.I would have probably bought this book for 0.99 but would not spend $2.99 unless it was revised. The book has promise, the author simply needs to do a serious revision on it.
summary: Skimmed over major areas of importance & turned into an infomercial

reviewText: Ein is the story of a woman who helps the poor and saves their children from being sold into slavery in a country that her own is currently at war with.  She also creates her own family after having lost her original one. This all interferes with the plans of some people who stand to profit from slavery leaving her life in jeopardy.  Ein is someone who makes sacrifices to protect her children that many of us might not.  Her strength and her compassion make this a beautiful tail of good triumphing over evil.This book is by turns pure Epic Fantasy yet at other times definitely Erotic Romance.  Black treads further than such classic fantasy novelists as Marion Zimmer Bradley and Mercedes Lackey into the world of alternative lifestyles and relationships.  She also goes farther than such new stars of the literary stage as Shayla Black and Sylvia Day into the realm of BDSM and ménage.  Her writing is far and away some of the best I’ve read in a while.  Poetic and beautifully descriptive she makes you yearn for more once the story is over.I was given a free copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.  I decided I wanted to own a paid copy of this book to support this author in writing more.
summary: It’s an all out smash of a solo debut.

reviewText: I really enjoyed reading this book, I'm not a big fan of erotica but this book has a great plot and I found myself stuck reading it all in one go!

A lovely, enjoyable read, The Duke's Shotgun Wedding was a wonderful historical romance novella. I really liked this short and sweet read.Both characters were good, though I had a small issue with each. Jocelyn was strong and determined to ensure her family's future. However, she was also mindblowingly impulsive, in a way that was just bewildering and somewhat selfish in the way that she didn't consider the consequences. Sebastian was sweet and honorable to a fault, but he could also be a real ass. Overall, though, I liked them both.The romance was great. The sparks were constantly flying, whether these two were arguing or ripping each other's clothes off. But, they were also sweet together, when they took a minute to calm down. I thought they were a lovely couple.The plot was quick and I was kept hooked the entire way through. I really liked the story and the ending was very sweet.The Duke's Shotgun Wedding was a wonderful historical romance novella that I truly enjoyed reading. Romance lovers, if you want a quick, sweet read, then you'll want to check this book out.*I received a complimentary copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review

Stacy is a new author and what an pleasure it was to read her first novella. I love her vocabulary it gives the characters depth ...their first encounter is extraordinary...I felt I was in the room. The novel moves well and is enriched with descriptive lines that breathes life into the characters...well done...I want to read more and I will.

I fell in love with Fiance by Fate! It was fun, flirty, and full of witty banter. Sabrina decides to patiently wait for her ex-fiance who just needs some 'time' to make sure he is ready for marriage. Now me, I would run the other direction if my fiance had already proposed and then decided he needed more time to be ready! Really? Anyway, Sabrina is convinced they are so right for each other but she continues to see him with this other woman.Enter the annoyingly-drop-dead-gorgeous and conveniently single Jack. Convenience and a pay-off for both brings the two into a fake relationship. This is where the fireworks begin! Bring on the swoon worthy kisses and the heart pounding love connection! If only the two can wake up and realize what they have together! I loved the run-ins with Sabrina's ex, the over protectiveness of Jack and the chemistry was sizzling hot! If you enjoy a light-hearted romance with laughter, this is the book for you! It kept me page-turning to the very end! A wonderfully well written book that I will read again and again!Rating: Clean, mild sexual innuendos; language is mildI received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for my honest review.
summary: A fun and lighthearted romance with witty banter!

reviewText: This was a treasure in itself to read by this author. I so enjoy a good romance especially when filled with mystery and intrigue as this one is. This author creates some characters that have alot of body and soul to them which you latch onto right away. Meg has just lost the last relative whom she loved very much her grandfather and she is given some unexpected news with the size of her inheritance but with a catch for the moment. Someone has a petition filed to block the land which also cuts off access to the estate's accounts. The land is also where she was hoping to start a living classroom but in turn someone she soon meets Jake the town's vet would like to develop a wild horse refuge. Trust is hard to come by for her not sure at first if he is the one who wants her land until she rescues a dog. They begin to build a relationship between them learning about each other between the mystery that still needs to be solved on who it is exactly that is after her and the land. Danger is around every corner that keeps you gripped at times to the edge of your seat while the searing romance heats up between the two of them. Comedy also comes in the form of the parents bringing with them a old acquaintance that the mother thought she could fix her son up with. Why do moms do that? I am one and know better than to have tried that with one of mine. Right away he says he has a girlfriend Meg and good sport she is goes along with it. What starts out as pretend well becomes real. The real surprise though is the nut job who is messing with her and who it really is with the danger escalating with can Jake get to her in time. Love shines forth big time in this through it all with it being very enjoyable indeed.

***Received an ARC of this book from the Publisher in exchange for an honest review***Overall Rating:  4 Rockin’ ★★★★Her Desert Treasure is a winner with me!  I enjoyed this well written story by Larie Brannick. It had drama, romance, and two hearts finding confidence to move forward together.  I adored Meg and Jake’s story.  In the beginning, there is a spark of attraction between them that cultivates into a heart stirring romance.  Meg returns home after the passing of her grandfather.  She had been raised by her grandparents since she was five years old and her parents died in a car accident.  After a bad relationship experience, she is cautious.  Jake moved to Colorado from the hustle and bustle of Chicago, and opened a veterinarian clinic.  He has been a loner content with living on his own until he meets Meg.  The author delivers a happily ever after ending that leaves you sighing with bliss. ~Flo
summary: Her Desert Treasure is a winner with me!

reviewText: This D. D. Ayers work is new to me but after reading Necessary Force, I will look forward to more in this series. I loved the idea of the K-9 Series so I had hoped this would be good. I was wrong it is great. For an introduction to the series, it starts right in with the characters and their relationship. I like romantic suspense and this novella had all the elements of mystery, suspense, danger, secrets and romance. It is short; I read it on one evening but finished with the story having a feeling of completeness to it. I will admit that I had figured out the villain by half way through reading the story but that was okay since the journey of catching him was very satisfying.One of my favorite characters is the FBI Bomb sniffing dog, Zander. The connection between Zander and his handler, Brad, seemed real and was enlightening in the world of the K-9 units. I wondered how much research Ayers must have done to give this story such an authentic feel to it.  At the same time, by no means did Zander steal the limelight from Brad or Georgia, his part in the story was well played.I haven’t know many photographers like Georgie but her approach to her work was interesting. She and Brad were sweet and steamy together; which is a hard act for an author to pull off. By the end of the novella, I was hoping that the third time meeting in the park would be a charm they needed for a HEA.I can recommend Necessary Force to those who enjoy suspense with their romance. I see D. D. Ayers as an up and coming author.Copy provided by NetGalley for an honest review.
summary: Great start, can't wait for the full novel in the series.

reviewText: I absolutely loved this book. Toss a wild card or flip a coin. You never know what delicious outcomes it may have. ;-)

Amazing what can be done in so few pages. I loved the way the characters seemed to jump off the page. Every nursery school has the Sexy Dad and the single moms who have each other's backs. This was HAWT too. Five star short story .

Oh, this one was so much fun! I love older-brother's-best-friend stories (why my parents only gave me a younger brother I will never understand), as well as childhood crushes all grown up and back with a vengeance, so this story was like catnip for me. Or would Beckynip be a better description? Either way, it was a guaranteed win.Add to that Celia's propensity towards wearing novelty work-related t-shirts (Veterinary Medicine: Because People are Gross) and the most brilliant t-shirt related proposal scene ever (the fact that it's the only t-shirt related scene I know of is irrelevant), and you'll understand why I'm typing this review while literally giving the book two thumbs up. It's not easy, but totally worth the sacrifice.The chemistry between Celia and Jonah absolutely sizzles in this book--so much fun to read! You could feel her frustration at wanting to be seen as a grown woman by the guy she worshiped as a kid as well as his shock at finding her all grown up--and the hands-off-she's-Zach's-sister vibe that came along right behind it. It all made for some delicious tension, especially since circumstances kept putting them together.Circumstances, and some fabulous secondary characters.Des, Celia's almost-sister-in-law, played a part, giving our heroine a much-needed push into the girl zone after years of trying to blend in with the boys. Even if nothing sticks beyond the pretty underwear and girl-sized jeans, she will have accomplished much, as I'm sure Jonah can attest.But my favorite secondary character here is Anne-Marie, Jonah's paralegal. She alternately tries to mother and bully him into becoming the man she knows he can be, attempting to fix him up with dates when she's not trying to guilt him into helping out at a local camp for at-risk children. Fully half of the passages I highlighted in this book had her in them, like this one:She stood up abruptly, took a small step forward and slapped him on the face, not so hard as to leave a mark, but hard enough to give him a jolt.“Wake up, Jonah! Love doesn’t come with the risk of pain. It carries a guarantee of pain. Of course, you’ll hurt each other. Then you’ll force each other to change and grow into better people. You’ll become stronger, and more vulnerable at the same time. She’ll have more power over you than anyone else in the world and she’ll also make you feel like the greatest man who ever lived.”“She already does.” Instantly, the pressure in his chest eased. It felt like a dam had burst, a plug had been pulled, a wall breached.Anne-Marie pulled him to his feet and hugged him, hard. “There. That only took a year off my life, but it’s done and now we can move forward.”“If I hurt her—”“Shut up or I’ll slap you again.” She shook him with her small hands. “Now, you’ve got a best-man’s tux to try on. You can love her all you want, but it’ll have to wait until after Des and Zach’s wedding. What does the best lawyer in Lutherton have to say about that?”“I’m the only lawyer in Lutherton.”“See?” She beamed at him. “Not so dumb after all, are you?”Love. Her.I've got some lost time to make up for in this series--I read book one last summer, and now this one, but somehow none of the ones in between--because I really need to find out more about the family tragedy that's still affecting both Cecelia and her family in this book. Clearly, my work is cut out of me. Oh, the sacrifices I have to make... ;)Rating: 4 stars/ A-I received a complimentary copy in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Fun story with kick-butt secondary characters!

reviewText: If pressed to review this book in just a few words, I would have to say it was amazing and very hard to put down.Now you know I'm not a woman of few words, so let's go into the whys of my love of Risk of a Lifetime.  First of all characters.  As usual this is a biggie with me and I love that Marcy and JB have a history, they were/are married, he may not know about the still married part, but she does.  They have this bond they cannot sever.  She couldn't sign the divorce papers, he can't help but want to save her and he always calls her "sugar" {swoon}.  However Marcy has stood on her own two feet and JB has continued his life following the dream of being in the FBI.  But when they are thrown back together again the sparks do fly and both characters begin to grow and mature into two people that can make it as a couple.  It takes a crazy man after them both to show them, but they do start to work through things.I also enjoyed the plot.  There are some curves thrown in this one and every time I thought I had this one figured out, Ms. Shelton changed it up on me.  Kudos to her on this one.  It was a great suspense plot to go with the character development.I thoroughly enjoyed Risk of a Lifetime. The characters seemed real and I loved the way they matured enough to figure out how to be together.  I also really enjoyed the suspense.  It kept me enthralled through the whole book.  As a romantic suspense book it scores perfectly on both elements.  Keeping a nice balance of romance and suspense.  I truly will look forward to more books by Ms. Shelton!
summary: Great balance of romance and suspense, excellent characters, a can't put down book!

reviewerName: Rhianna Walker "The geek mom and book blogger...
reviewText: Talk about a big case of opposites attracting. A millionaire with a successful property development business and a loner geek with a computer upgrading business squaring off over the sale of her property. He's slick, handsome and a bit under-developed as a character and she's a strange mix of stiff spined and gutless. Not gonna lie... I had a very difficult time liking these characters. When Will wasn't thinking about how tiny Kate is, she's thinking about how she's not going to sell... not because she grew up in the building—she didn't—or because she can't relocate her business—she could—but because of reasons.THE SEDUCTION GAME was one of those stories where I liked it in theory but wound up not digging it in actuality. It shows both my age and my true geek card that the basic jist of plot reminded me of the 80's flick, Batteries Not Included, which won it a lot of points. I liked the whole idea of Kate resisting selling her building to a big developer. What didn't really work for me was the threadbare character development.While Kate is fairly well developed as a character, the big reason she holds back on selling never feels valid, as if she's being stubborn for the sake of it. Meanwhile, Will is so under-developed beyond his business and a reference comparing him to actor Nathan Fillion, I never quite bought him as a romantic hero. I almost felt like he looked down on Kate (which might have a lot to do with constant references to how tiny she is) both socially and physically. Without a lot of back knowledge on his past, he just never seemed more than a caricature. I could get their physical attraction to a point but an emotional connection seemed contrived. Ultimately, while it wasn't an unlikable story, it just never quite had the warmth I was expecting where the geek gets the girl... or in this case, the guy.Having read both Indulgence titles and Shortt's WAKING UP DEAD, I think my lukewarm reception of the book has more to do with the genre than anything. Contemporary category romances can be hit or miss with me as a reader and as a geek, I have high expectations of a geek romance. That said, if you are a geek you'll enjoy the pop culture references and the nice change of pace from it being the hero who is a geek. Two thumbs up for representation! Not a geek? If you like CEO millionaire types you might enjoy TSG a lot.Notes: ARC received via publisher.

Story Rating ~ 3.5 StarsHero Rating ~ 3.5 StarsHeroine Rating ~ 4 StarsRomance Rating ~ 4 StarsHeat Level ~ 3 StarsEnding ~ 3.5 StarsOverall Rating ~ 3.5 StarsThis was my first read by Sarah Ballance and An Unexpected Sin was interesting enough to keep me turning the pages.I REALLY enjoyed the first part of this book when Josiah and Ann’s relationship started to take off. They’ve known each other since they were younger and they have always had strong feelings for each other. Something very tragic happened all those years ago, and it took Josiah away from Ann. Now he is back to find Ann, the only woman who has ever owned his heart.OH MY! Josiah was such a romantic hero. He always had the best of intentions towards Ann; even though I felt he held back telling her some critical need-to-know information. I really wished he would have been up front with Ann concerning these issues. He also said some sigh worthy things to Ann; here are just a few quotes that stole my heart while reading.“The years have been too long,” he whispered, his lips brushing hers as he spoke. “I have wanted for no one else.”“As much as I ache to know every inch of you,” he said, “it is not my desire to make off with your honor like a thief in the night.”Ann was my favorite character in this read. I like a heroine who knows what she wants and goes for it.The second half of this book dealt with some very dark topics including the witch hunts that took place in Salem when fingers were being pointed at women for being witches and they were being hanged. I wish that there would have been more information added about this topic. I felt it was not used to its full advantage and a missed opportunity; it would have added so much more to the read. However, I liked reading how it all played out in the end.There was only one very sensual love scene and it was wonderfully written. I found myself wishing there would have been more steamy interactions between Josiah and Ann, because Sarah Balance certainly knows how to write a truly hot love scene. Yes, the sexual tension was high throughout, but I wanted more.There is a happy ending BUT, NO EPILOGUE!! I have said it before and I will say it again, I just don’t understand why some authors forgo writing an epilogue! I felt that there were plenty of things that an epilogue could have added to this overall read.

I received a complimentary copy of the book for an honest review.I found the story quite simple in regards to the previous one of the series, it was a straightforward, uncomplicated and had a more light hearted tone which I think made it charming to me.Josiah was honest and true to his feelings as well as Anne, which I found pretty refreshing since most stories are twice as lenghty as this one and the main characters are constantly denying their true emotions. However, since the beginning of the book they both know each other's feelings and have no qualms speaking between themselves about it.The shadow of the witch hunts still looms throughout the story, though not as heavily as the first book, and plays, even if a minor part, and important factor in some of the choices the characters make.I think that by the end of the story what you truly learn from this story is that guilt has a way to manifest itself, in all kinds of forms, even to hinder the possibility of something beautiful to bloom. It also shows you how humane it is and how humans themselves are the ones that bring a meaning to it, illogical or not, everyone has their own way to cope with it.I also liked the cameo appearances of several characters from the previous book.If you are looking for a story with an uncomplicated and straightforward plot, with some romance, and honest characters this is the  book you should read.

Im So fortunate i got an ARC....and i loved Every single second of it...First of all I ♥ u MS. Bielman you are a Genius....So let's focus... Erin it's my hero actually i can relate a lot with her, the way she goes on with life, and seek's adventures because she is no doormat and she knows what she deserves.Troy is my Ultimate boy next door charming, and i just want to hug him and squeeze him to death... reviewText: Having read SF books by Vox Day, I came in with high expectations.  They were met, and more.  Vox handles shorter formats very well.  he sets a mood quite well, the dialogue is excellent, and good plots.  I highly recommend this work.
I have become a fan of Vox Days' books. I strongly recommend this book to anyone who is even curious. Definitely not wasted money.

reviewText: I really enjoyed reading this book. Loved the characters. I need to read the next book The Promised Land. I have to know what happens to Zofia and who was at the pier.
Like all Roberta Kagan books, this is well researched, true to fact, yet fictional.  If you are interested in keeping the Holocaust in everyones mind,  Roberta is ranked among the best in my eyes.
summary: Everything by Roberta Kagan is excellant.

reviewText: I truly enjoyed this book. It was a beautiful story of love and devotion set in during a period of history that was beyond true comprehension. Set during the Holocaust, although the characters in the story were fictional, you were given true insight as to what the Jewish families endured  during this horrific period in history. If you enjoy historical fiction I would highly recommend this book

I enjoyed reading this personal account of a holocaust victim. Even though the subject matter is not easy to read, the author presents it in a factual, undiluted form. I would recommend this as a good read for anyone interested in a first hand holocaust experience.

Remember Me (Shattered #3) Jo-Anna WalkerOk before I start stop reading my review if you’ve not already read Break Me and Always Me.  Remember Me is NOT a stand-alone book and to understand what’s going on you would have had to read the first two in the Shattered Series.In Always Me Garrith and Keisha had their problems actually in both books; however things were getting better between the two of them.  In all these books my book boyfriend is most definitely Sebastian and in Break Me it was made to look like he was killed.  He definitely was shot but Garrith being in the FBI needed Sebastian to take down Jose Alvarez and since Sebastian and Tori both were shot this was the perfect opportunity to get Sebastian hidden let everyone believe including Tori that he died. In Always me everything fell into place and Sebastian and Garrith took down Jose but not without collateral damage.  Keisha was shot and rushed to the hospital.The heart wrenching end was when Garrith visits Keisha and sits with her only to find out she has absolutely no memory of him whatsoever.In Remember Me you realize Garrith took a leave of absence from the FBI and for six months basically dropped off the face of the earth.  He was drowning his sorrows in alcohol.  He was so in love with Keisha this was killing him.  As you continue on with the read you learn a lot of things about Garrith and Keisha when they were younger.  Garrith has always been in love with her from the time they were teenagers.  During the teenage years something happened and Garrith was so afraid that if he started telling Keisha about their past she would hate him again and he didn’t think he could handle a 3rd break up.  As the story unravels Garrith ends up blurting information out and Keisha was trying to digest everything.  Sex seemed to be her trigger where bits and pieces would come back to her with excruciating pain.Ironically Keisha’s memory does come back after a bad accident she and Garrith were in.  Keisha so wanted to remember the man she’s always been in love with.  I don’t want to say much more, however I have to throw a few spoilers in.  Yay Sebastian and Tori get married, Tori is pregnant again.  HEA does come for Garrith and Keisha and OMG wait until you read Epilogue (which by the way happens 6 months later.).  Mathis is mentioned in this read.  He has a tendency of popping up in Jo-Anna’s books like seriously.  You find out a little teenie tiny bit about Lucas,  a friend of Sebastian’s so you can imagine how stoked I was to learn  Book # 4 in the Shattered Series will be about Lucas Crane and Lilly Benson.  I’m real curious in this next book where Mathis will pop up.  The Shattered Series are great reads and you won’t be disappointed.

It’s hard to depict love at first sight, seeing it grow, and make it look real and beautiful and strong. It tends to get into the inexplicable insta-love that sometimes annoys me. But Teodora Kostova did brilliantly at making us feel everything Fenix and Jared felt – the unstoppable attraction, the love bond growing stronger, their joy and their hurt.Two men proving themselves on London’s musical scene start by sharing the same room at the theater to being in the same club at the same time, leading to a first night of passion, at the end of which they just don’t want to be apart from each other. What they know to be true is not what the world sees, and the new hot couple will have to deal with their own schedules, with paparazzi chasing them across London, and close friends demanding attention and voicing their concerns.The most important challenge Fenix and Jared will go through comes from inside each of them. Each will have to decide what is more important in the end, their career or the man they love. Seeing them struggle for their happiness was pure heartbreak and there were a few moments when I just wanted to shove the book in the freezer for a while (Friends fans will know why). It was however worthwhile to see this love story through.The way Fenix’ dancing is described was spot on, just like the way these two see each other, on and off stage. It’s a story of both inner and outer beauty and such a touching love affair that it warmed my heart and made me grin like a silly teenage girl. I loved it and I highly recommend you buy and read it for yourselves!

This was a great story. So many emotions. I love how they connected and through all the ups and downs of their relationship, they were there for each other. Their passion for their art and each other was perfectly shown here.

This story is from Leo's POV.  Usually I don't read those stories because they are just the same words that we heard in the first story.  Please don't let this stop you from reading this one!!!  Instead of rehashing what Lil has already told us in "A Woman Gone Mad", it gives us insight into what happened between Lil's dad and Leo and what Leo went through after he left Lil.  These two stories are not the typical love story you are use to reading, but if you want something different that will have your emotions on a rollercoaster ride then take a chance on these two books!  I must say that I did feel so sorry for 'Lise.  As woman I think most of us have given our all to someone who can't love us in return.  I felt her pain!  If you want something that is more than just a fairytale you have to read this book!!!
summary: A great second part to the story!! vDon't miss it!

reviewText: An interesting take on Jack the Ripper and why he disappeared. The fictional characters all felt so real and I found that I was actually scared for them, like watching scenes of a movie unfold. It is also an essay on life in these times and the desperation that so many found themselves in.

Rating 3.5 starsA year prior to this story, Michaela's boyfriend and Jordan's girlfriend were found having an affair. Michaela and Jordan were friends before, and became better friends after. Jordan wanted to be more than friends, but held off for Michaela to get over her ex, not wanting to be the "rebound guy." He finally is able to make his move though! As the story goes on, we find that there was more about the exes than initially realized, including an FBI investigation, adding some excitement to this book that honestly was just a tad dull at times. That said, I did enjoy it, liking the writing, laughing at several of the quips and humorous moments, and give it 3.5 stars.For fans fo Anna Wells, Michaela is the sister of Donovan from her book "Trust Me." In this book, we get to see him as a protective older brother. I haven't read that one, but sounds interesting! As this book is listed as "The Marsh Brothers #1," I'm guessing we can look forward to the stories of Trevor and Ian, Jordan's brothers.I received a complimentary copy of this book from the publisher via Netgalley for an honest review.
summary: Good start to the story of the brothers

reviewText: I loved this!  Lizzy Ford did it again!I loved this series, something about dragons.  What a great ending to a great story.  Skylar, a strong female and boy did she need to be, and Chace, poor guy, realizing he made major mistakes and not knowing how to fix them. A woman decides to visit Argent Springs to visit an aunt and finds romance with the handsome handyman.  The bed and breakfast also has a ghostly visitor as there are times she can smell lavender in the air.  The sparks fly between her and the handyman, though he resists hoping for the return of a former girlfriend.  Will these two find love and what about the ghost?  She has quite the colorful history as she ran the brothel, which is what the inn was at one time.  This was a fun romance that had a few extra elements to make it even more interesting.

I like that while Morgan has her own story, her happy ending also ties up the first two books with happy endings of their own. I would enjoy more stories with Tinker. I'd like to see if she ever grows up and finds her own happy ending! It'd be nice to re-visit some of the previous characters to see how they're doing too!

Warning: Before reading this information packed marketing book have a pen and notebook by your side. Ms. Davis has updated her first edition of How To Promote Your Children’s Book to encompass the ever changing internet and tastes of people. The over 300 links take you to other expert websites, author websites, and informative blogs where you learn so much more. Each website is an expert in the field of marketing and promotion so you learn much more than you can remember. This is why I say to have a pen and notebook handy!I loved this book and was very impressed by it. I’d recommend this e-book for any children’s author who wants their work to be seen.
