reviewText: As you can see from my 1 star rating and my title I didn't like this book at ALL. Read this review with caution. I have HUGE spoilers but they are tagged spoilers before I delve in. I am not pulling any punches here. I hated this book, it was a train wreck of epic proportions and in fact may be the worst book I have ever read. It was all around HORRIBLE. I didn't like the hero or the heroine the heroes father was the worst person in the whole wide world. It was nothing I thought it would be. I didn't connect with the hero or the heroine and just didn't care about them at all. I wouldn't say it was a romance at all. I didn't like the writing it didn't flow. If you like MC books I highly recommend that you stay far, far away from this book. I love MC books  but this one was just bad,bad, bad. The only good thing about this book was the cover. Please, please don't read any further if you don't want this book spoiled and when I say spoiled I mean almost everything about this book.SPOILERSthe heroes father molests the heroine when she is a teen and beats her, then when she is older and the hero and heroine get back together the MC president(the heroes dad) drugs her and sexually assault her with other club members (when she is the heroes old lady) the hero sleeps with a girl the heroine's brother likes and thinks she has the clap( and doesn't care?). the heroes dad has holes all over the place when the heroine is a teen and now and watches her shower and his son touch himself. the hero and his dad t*g t*am girls the hero is a member of the MC when he is a teen(that doesn't happen). I don't mind "bad language" but this was so over the top I just kept thinking shut up already the heroine was just nasty IMO. there is a member who likes acting like a baby he has diapers, and bibs and walks around the club in one scene with a bib and a pump on(yes that kind of pump). the heroine talks about all the things the doctors like at the hospital(sexually), she knows she is being watched on camera at work and lets the hero perform oral sex on her then, oh my gosh there was a camera there(yeah she just said she didn't care,then she did)END SPOILERSI could go on, and on with this book it was a mess from beginning to end. As you can see (from my review)my brain is all jumbled from this book. I know that MC books are popular and I don't claim to know everything but I wish authors would research what they are writing before they just pick a few things and say ok I know enough and thats what this book felt like.  I know others liked this book and I don't just hand out 1 star reviews, and I almost didn't review this book but I can't not review this book.

The first story begins with Eavan and Talon, their instant attraction that pulls them from their comfort zone solidifying their willingness to be exactly who they need to be for each other to excel not only in their individual lives, but in who they can be together.  I loved reading how they took a chance to find out how they could compliment one another.  Once that concept was resolved, I believed nothing could tear the two of them apart.The second story was about Taron and Ivy.  Their attraction is a force to be reckoned with.  I had a great time reading about the continued lives of the Rebel Walking Band and Hilary Storm has a way with creating a suspenseful story.  My heart went out to the two of them and the adversity that came between them while on tour along with a crazy stalker that didn't understand the word, "No."  They both had soul searching to do before realizing their hearts belonged to one another.  I liked reading how crazy that road was along the way!.Book Two and A Half continues about the lives of Rebel Walking, but in a nice completion of the lives of Taron and Ivy along with Talon and Eavon.  I was happy to read more into the characters lives.  Their desires, frustrations and downright scared feelings that sometimes can blind a person from making a decision even if it is plain as day.Praise for the Rebel Walking Series!  I can't wait to read what Hilary Storm has in store for her next book!

The Ten Thousand Things is the second part of the Dead West series. It's an excellent and entertaining sequel to Those Poor, Poor Bastards.I have to admit that I'm difficult to please when it comes to western novels, but weird western novels are my kind of novels. In my opinion The Ten Thousand Things is - just like Those Poor, Poor Bastards - an excellent example of a good and entertaining weird western novel, because the authors know how to entertain their readers. To be honest, I was impressed by this novel, because it turned out to be an even better novel than its predecessor.Before I begin to analyze the contents of this novel, it's good to mention that it's recommendable to read Those Poor, Poor Bastards before reading this novel. In my opinion knowledge of the previous happenings is essential in order to fully understand what happens in this novel.Here's a bit of information about the story:In The Ten Thousand Things Nina Weaver and the people with her are riding the rails and fight against Liao Xu's zombies. Liao Xu is responsible for unleashing the horde of the deaduns and other creatures against them. He relentlessly pursues them, because he wants something from them...The Ten Thousand Things differs a bit from the first novel, because it brings more depth to the story. The first novel introduced the characters to the readers and now the authors begin to add depth and more details to the story and to the characters. For example, the authors reveal a few interesting things about Liao Xu and his past, and Nina begins to accept her abilities and experiences sexual awakening. The authors also tell what happened to James' family.Nina is a fascinating heroine, because she's almost like a female version of the male western heroes and rogues played by Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef and other famous actors. Although she's a fighter and survivor, she's much more than that, because she has strange abilities that separate her from others. She has a spiritual connection to the People and the Land. She has slowly begun to change inside, because she hears the sounds of the People, their drums and flutes, and their whispers. The realization of this change rattles her, because she has to accept the changes.There are several excellent and thrilling scenes in this novel. For example, the attack of the birds is an impressive scene. Reading about Liao Xu's demon train is also memorable, because it adds a wonderfully otherwordly atmosphere and a malicious supernatural threat to the storyline.The prose in The Ten Thousand Things is surprisingly good (in the first novel the prose was good, but now it's even better). The authors have found the right kind of rhythm and  that they use to move the happenings forward. The pacing is also much better in this novel, because the story feels more balanced than before.One of the best things about this novel (and its predecessor) is that it's genuinely interesting to read about how Nina and the other survivors get along with each other. The authors have managed to write about this aspect of their survival in a surprisingly realistic way.The authors write boldly about sex and things related to sex. I won't reveal what happens in the story, but there's an explicit and passionate sex scene in the middle of the novel that has been written well.It's nice that there's also a bit of humour in the story. For example, the scene in which one of the characters has to drop his pants is a funny scene. I think it'll amuse several readers.Because I'm a Finn, I have to mention that it was interesting that the authors used one Finnish word and a few Swedish words in the story. These words surprised me, because I didn't expect to find Finnish and Swedish words in a weird western novel.It's possible that there are readers out there who think that this series is only about a fight against zombies. I can say to these readers that they're wrong, because the authors have created a story that tells of an epic and desperate fight between good and evil. There are - of course - plenty of zombies in this series, but there's much more to the story than them, because the fight between good and evil is the core of the story.Tim Marquitz, J. M. Martin and Kenny Soward have written an exciting and gory tale that will please fans of zombie stories and weird western novels. I'm sure that the viewers of The Walking and Hell on Wheels will also love The Ten Thousand Things, because this novel is almost like a combination of The Walking Dead and Hell on Wheels.If you're interested in zombie stories and weird western novels, The Ten Thousand Things is the novel to read, because the authors deliver a fantastically gory and entertaining story that's full of action. If you like zombie stories, please take a look at this novel, because it's an enjoyable novel.My final words are: This novel is good and exciting entertainment!
summary: An entertaining and exciting weird western novel

reviewText: Must say it was a bit spicy :) The storylines were easy to follow and not too far fetched. There were actually some that I thought about buying the series to find out what happened to the characters.

This was an interesting read for me. I got the ARC from the author, but not for a review, because I was participating in a blog tour. A review was my idea. I won’t review something I don’t like unless it’s so horrible I have to warn people. In truth, why I am explaining all this, is I thought I wouldn’t like this book, but the opposite happened. I liked it so much I went and bought the first in the series since then. The characters really drew me in and I wanted to know what happened.PROS:I like the storyline, very unique.The characters are extremely well-developed. It’s obvious the author spent a good amount of time creating the characters and their relationships with one another.Everything seemed realistic. Obviously a genetic enhancement program like this would never exist, but the way she writes about it and the actions of the characters, come across as believable.CONS:The writing style was a bit simplistic for my taste. Perhaps that’s how the writer likes to write, but I prefer a little more complexity in what I read.I like my erotica with more sex scenes. There is one good one towards the end, but that’s about it. If you don’t want a lot or even am average amount of sex, then this is the book for you.
I really loved this story but I wished there was an epilogue. I feel like there should be more. I'm dying to know how things work out with Adam and Sage. Please give us more!

reviewText: This book gives you a sense of peace especially in this time we are living. Sad to see the series finished. Would loved to read more about Bonnie.

Alex Destephano is a registered nurse and a lawyer who has a great job in a New Orleans Medical Center called CCMC—Crescent City Medical Center. It happens that the Chief Administator and the Head of Nursing are on vacation, leaving Alex and her ex-husband in charge, just as the novel starts out with a crisis in the ER or ED,--Emergency Department—where a victim has suddenly gone CODE BLUE. Clearly, Author Rocchiccoli knows what she is writing about, because the realism is too good to be faked. Within a few hours more victims arrive taxing the ED and the hospital to its limits. They must call in the CDC from Atlanta to assist in identifying a mysterious virus causing multiple victims and quick deaths. We suspect this is a bioterrorist attack by an extremist cell, hiding in “The Big Easy,” one of whose members has infiltrated the NOPD and another is a trusted grad student at Tulane’s scientific bioresearch center. But, even the cell members are not sure who caused the virus attack, as they mistrust each other, and suspect it is a double-cross by a Russian terrorist from Chechnia. All the branches of law enforcement converge on the city in advance of a conference including the President and 100 or so top politicos. Thus the NOPD, FBI, Secret Service, State Police, National Guard, the Mayor, and the Governor’s office are all a part of the security preparations. Meantime there is a gruesome murder of a promising politician, a friend of Alex’s family, which appears to be a serial murder. The plot spins on with Alex and her associates driven to near exhaustion as more sick are admitted and more bodies pile up. The author does a superb job of handling the technical and scientific aspects of the story, and of building the suspense to a crashing finish.This novel is timely, discussing the very real threat of hidden terrorist cells, bent on killing ‘infidels’ and what they might do. Also, it discusses some of the highly technical ways that law enforcement has of scanning crowds and identifying threats.Highly recommended action/suspense/thriller.Dorothy May Mercer

Rocchiccioli' Viral Intent is a true political/medical thriller, and is one of the best I have ever read!  The story is captivating and terrifying at the same time.  Her research in this book is impeccable and as always, her knowledge of medicine and healthcare is abundant.  Her character's continue to remain believable and true to life.  The plot is well constructed and moves quickly.  It was a quick read for me because she hooked me from the very beginning  I cannot wait to see what she comes up with next.The Alexandra Destephano novels are amazing and they are thrillers that chill the heart. I highly recommend!!

Michelle and Andrew, two children spending the long summer with a mother, who could in all honesty, pay a little more attention to her kids.I remember summers as a child, always trying to conjure up new adventures and fantastical experiences. Alas, they resided only in my mind. When Michelle and Andrew found the secret passage, an entirely new world appeared and an incredible journey began. I loved this book for two reasons. I enjoy fantastical stories. I am a big fan of Alice, Narnia, and the wizard of OZ. I love the way children's minds can be opened whilst reading such tales. Having said that, I also believe that the writing has to be clear, uncluttered, and imaginative. Ms Stotzka manages to pen the right amount of tension, descriptive prose, beguiling words, and she maintains a steady pace, just right for kids and for adults, who do not let age interfere with a good story.The author brings to life characters and creatures in a wonderfully colourful way, yet she also brings forth a delicate subject, which highlights the relationship between mother and child. The universal challenge in todays, fast paced world, is how much time and attention can one afford to give to one's children?A lovely story for all ages. I am so glad I picked this book up and I look forward to the Author's next offering.

4.25 of 5 starsFor original review see The Prism Book Alliance Blog onlineTony and Ro are identical twins. Their looks are where their similarities end though.Ro is hardworking, diligent and constantly trying to better himself. He will be the first in his family to get a degree and puts all his time and energy into trying to make his landscape gardening business a success.Tony lives his life on the fly. His work ethic isn’t strong and he has become enamoured with a trainee Domme at his local BDSM club which takes up most of his time. When the club is looking for gay men to help with training he immediately thinks of his brother and offers him a way of making some much needed extra cash.Ro has no interest in BDSM and is definitely not submissive but needs the money and as he will be ‘subbing’ for women who do nothing for him sexually he gives it a go. When Ro gets caught up in his day job and can’t make an evening session Tony grabs the chance to make his dream a reality but the consequences are disastrous.Lance has been working at the dental practice for almost 6 months. Charming, good looking and extremely smart on the surface he seems to have everything he wants. What Lance really wants and needs is a man to dominate but with his OCD and other quirks finding him has proven difficult. He has almost given up on the idea when Ro lands in his dental chair.Lance will go the extra mile to give Ro back his beautiful smile. Ro thinks Lance hung the stars but is pretty sure he isn’t gay and that if he was what would he see in such a lowly person as himself.  Both these men through their upbringing and previous events in their lives have major hang ups. Although they quickly get together and the sex is the best they have ever had they also connect mentally but there are so many secrets that their new friendship seems destined to fail.The big question is how two dominant men can be in a D/s relationship and when is the right time for Lance to approach his need for this. Ro feels panicked into coming clean about his foray into the BDSM scene but is terrified of how Lance will react and fears he will see him as a prostitute. The secrets just keep building.When Tony finally goes off the rails things quickly fall apart and Ro is left flailing and unsure of everything. Both these dominant men need to find a middle point, and quickly, if their relationship is to survive. For this to happen they will have to be truthful about everything for the first time since they met!

Unholy Matrimony is the second book in the Lucille Mystery Series.  The first book in the series is Confession is Murder. I haven't read this one yet, but it didn't really make Unholy Matrimony hard to read.  You can pretty much read it alone and not be confused at all.If you want a very funny murder mystery, then this book is for you.  I've never laughed so hard while reading one of these type of books before.  The book revolves around an Italian Catholic family. So that right there appealed to me and left me wanting to read it.  And yes this book is written in typical Jersey accents.  So you really feel like you are right there with the characters.The story starts out as Lucille trying to get her daughter, Bernadette, married before she has her baby out of wedlock.  No self-respecting Italian Catholic can do that.  So they find Bernadette a man, Taylor, that is willing to marry her, baby and all.  The problem with that is he doesn't like women.  So Bernadette would never have a happy, real marriage.  But she would be married before the baby was born, which is the objective.Well the morning of the wedding, the groom's mother,Donna, is found dead at the pulpit of the church Bernadette and Taylor are supposed to be married in.  And both Taylor and his father are missing.  Which leaves Bernadette without a husband after all. Which she is actually happy about because she was only marrying him to make her mom happy.The first person that they suspect could have committed the murder was Lucille herself.  She was the last person to have called Donna before she was murdered. And the person who found her dead.  So Lucille and her friend Flo go on a mission to find out what really happened to Donna, because no way is Lucille going to jail for something she didn't do.  She suspects it was Donna's husband Alex. Especially since he is no where to be found.  But as they start talking to more and more people, it seems like just about anyone could have done it.When the murderer is finally revealed, you really don't see it coming.  And especially for the reason why the person who killed Donna did it. It's not the reason you think at all.Oh and if you are wondering if they ever get a husband for Bernadette before the baby comes, well you will just have to pick up this book and find out.

reviewText: The book felt like a drunken confession delivered at five in the morning after yesterday blended into this morning. The book reminded me of a white-trash Bukowski nightmare; I kept thinking the book was a poetic prison sentence. This is one of those few works where the title actually meant something to the composition, as if it were a line that represents the contents of a poem, though nothing in the poem seems to explicitly connect to the title. "County Blues" made me think of "Count Prison" and "Blues" made me think of soul-tearing, painful music sung like all the African American blues musicians Led Zeppelin ripped off and Jim Morrison imitated.Another reviewer mentioned a connection to Kerouac, and I can agree; there hasn't been much in the way of American "beat" literature in a very long time. We don't often get to read about what's happening with the remaining 80% of America's population. These are the stories that people share with each other... this is the voice of a entire demographic, much as Brett Easton Ellis wrote about the wealthy and Palahniuk wrote about generational frustration for the middle class; Jason Wayne Allen takes the David Foster Wallace depressive overdrive and infuses it with brutal honesty.This book isn't for everyone. If you don't enjoy Bukowski or Beat literature or anything that includes common plot tropes/expectations, then forget it. After you and your buddies sit down at Denny's after a very long night, you might get a glimpse of sober truth and longing. Thus, "Rotgut County Blues."

Josie revealed a big secret to Blake he gets pissed and Seth is picking the pieces up. Seth and Blake have not liked each other from day one! They both are in love with her but who will she pick? Can Blake forgive her? Can she forgive Blake? Who will she choose? I know but if you want too you need to read the books! Make sure you read that’s a promise first!

I am getting married next month to a wonderful man who is absolutely in love with my children from a previous relationship. Despite the love that already resides in our family unit, there are ups and downs and he sometimes has a hard time knowing how to respond to, and deal with his future step-children. I read this book in an effort to help understand the process and to help him navigate the world of being a step-parent. This book is extremely informative and gives advice on all areas of step-parenting. It explains that step-parents and natural parents must be on the same page regarding discipline (something we have struggled with) and recommends weekly family meetings. I think that the advice in this book will help us to form a very happy blended family.
summary: This Book Contains Extremely Helpful Tips for Forming a Happy Blended Family

reviewText: Hearts in Harmony is the second book in the Five Senses series. I really liked it. A lot. The story is captivating and the characters are strong and well defined.Clay Mathers is a military consultant for the government and a writer in his free time and Pippa Sanders is a therapist and a single mother of twins. The moment they meet sparks fly.Clay doesn’t do subtle and Pippa doesn’t like his attitude. What they can’t deny is the mutual attraction they feel for each other.I really appreciated the fact that the author didn’t focused on the physical aspect. Yes, she mentioned how attractive and well built he is but that was just a part of his description and necessary for the scene. Instead, she focused on the interactions between the characters and their personalities. The lack of useless details was also very much appreciated. I hate it when I have to dig my way out through details like what they’re drinking, what they’re wearing, what type of car they’re driving and so on just to get to the story.The supportive characters are the same ones that we met in the first book, Cooking Up Love, maybe a few more but not so many as to create confusion or add useless drama to the story.The writing style is good and some of the dialogues are really funny. Clay is an expert at putting his foot in his mouth especially around Pippa.All in all, Hearts In Harmony is a really great novel and I recommend it. You can read this as a standalone but I think it's better if you start with the first volume. It’ll be easier to understand everything that’s happening and it’s really worth reading.Happy Reading!
Finally Evy and Troy got together This book didn't have much action in it. Didn't Like how it ended  Guess have to wait for the next book.  Sure hope it's better than this one.

I have found reading Minimalist Lifestyle to be a very informative book to read. In reading it I have found that I myself does much of what the author describes as far as using up unneeded space. My home is filled with many items that are unneeded that causes clutter and takes away from the actual house. How he describes the way people feel the need to stay with in what society or peers have or do affects their home. Many don't think about the extra work they spend in cleaning or how much dust the items they have collect or the health issues it may cause. Let’s also look at financial effects. Buying unneeded items to try and impress others or to maintain the cleaning produces and if you decide to move the expense or extra time it will take to pack a haul. Author Allen Francis helps by teaching you what things are needed verses what we just want and how both effect our home and how it looks. He goes as far as to go int the issues or financial issues that can follow. I know that based on what I have read I plan to take a good look around my home and get rid or rearrange what I have to help bring the beauty of my home to the front rather than hidden behind a bunch of things that are unneeded. Which in the long run will help with my family’s heath especially since I am allergic to dust. It would also cut down on the amount of cleaning that will be needed or moving things around to clean under.

One definition of an awkward moment, as quoted at the beginning of "Awkward Moments" by Marja McGraw, is: "When you're digging a hole to bury a body - and you find another body already buried there."I've read all of the books in this series and this newest release is another wonderful Bogey Man mystery! I love following Pamela, Chris and Mikey Cross as, time after time, they inadvertently manage to find a body and get involved in solving a mystery.In "Awkward Moments," they're on vacation, staying at an old farm house owned by Chris' brother. Mikey digs a hole in the yard to bury a dead bird and what does he find? A body, of course! Actually, a skeleton that has been in the ground for a long time. And that's just the beginning.

Review written for mmgoodbookreviews.wordpress.comThis is the second book in  the  A Southern Thing Series, you really do need to read these in order. Sending Jack off to Jesus picks up where the last book left off with Jack now being under the watchful eye and threat of his tyrant of a father. In my opinion, Nathanial Miller should be the poster boy for family planning… and he has 10 kids... and a preacher to boot…Sorry about the rant. He has pulled the ‘if you don’t do as I say I will hurt your baby brother’ card to Jack. See what I mean? So, Jack is conflicted. He wants to  hurry up and graduate, hoping for a scholarship so he can get on with his life and make a life for him and his boyfriend Andrew, but if he leaves he fears for Billy who at the tender age of 7 is very girly, and very proud of himself. Now I will talk about characters.I will start with baby brother Billy. For only 7 this kid is a dream. I absolutely love Billy and he deserves a story of his own (hint, hint). He is such a sweet thing, and confident.  In this book it is mostly Jack and Andrew but there i some scene with Billy that is a heart wrencher. I could just see him looking at awe at the photos of the two men and professing “How beautiful” then growling and yelling at his dad how ugly he is... yep the 7 year old is a scene stealer!  Jack is also a very great character. For only 18 he is one heck of a responsible boy.  I can say the same for Andrew. Both are fabulous characters. So I will say if you  like amazing characters as you can see here we have great main characters, supporting characters ( I didn’t mention Jacks mom she really steps up here and becomes a game changer) she is the epitome of character growth. (if Jack’s dad  sounds like meanie of the year you should get a load of Andrew’s dad he makes jacks dad look good.Ok, so let’s move on to the story. As I said it is a continuation of the last book and does end as a cliffhanger too, but if you’re a big Sara York fan you know what to expect.. nail biting suspense!! This story is full of angst, love, strong emotion and suspense. I cannot wait for the next.I highly recommend this if you like ongoing series that end in cliffhangers making you beg for  more, boundless love, spunky seven year olds, amazing character, sweet, but hot sensual mansex, stories that make you think, over-controlling parents,  and nail-biting suspense  and a heart-wrenching story.( be sure to have a box of tissue on hand)

A very enlightening read with useful tips to boost my energy level.  I liked the fact that the author highlighted the main causes of low energy and way in which they can be combated. I think that this is an excellent book for anyone who is looking for a more healthy lifestyle and looking to make lasting changes in their life. All so the steps in this book will benefit anyone who is willing to work through them and commit to improving their energy level. I think that we all get stuck in unhealthy habits, from eating food that doesn't nourish our bodies, to not getting enough sleep. This book does an excellent job of laying the foundation that you can continue to refer to as you make a switch to healthier choices. There are also recipes, a list of high energy foods and and exercises in this book. All of these things make this book a valuable resource. I recommend this book to anyone that is looking for more energy.

This book is good as a summary of the issues around the Inkandla saga.However those who are looking for new insights or new "revelations" will be disappointed.It is probably evident to everyone (including Zuma's closest allies and supporters) that Zuma (1) knew everything about the developments at Inkandla from the outset and (2) That certain "fall guys" will eventually take all the blame for the Inkandla saga. Now does the book add any new insights to these "obvious facts"? Not in my opinion.What it does is add subtle nuances which do not alter the bigger picture in any way.So, Who is likely to find this book interesting?Probably somebody who has been living outside this country and has not kept up to date with developments in SA, who now wants a quick update on South African politics in general and Zuma's administration in particular.
summary: Not much is said  that is not already  in the public domain

It is so exciting I think to be able to read a novel from a debut author and on top of that it is a beginning of a series which I so enjoy. It is triple rewarding when you are finished (which was accomplished in a day) left well sated for a minute mind you because you know must read the next one in this series. Emma was such a wonderful character that this author has breathed to life that starts you on a wonderful journey. Being a single parent myself could connect with her on sacrifices she made to raise her sister. But now her sister has met the man of life and it is Emma's time in a way too. Time to choose something for just herself and immerse herself in it. Laurie has set her up on a date but also to meet others along with her boyfriend Rob. Jake has agreed but goofs up right off the bat, delightful scene by the way. This town is similar to what I grew up in so it made this so easy to connect with the talent of this author. They are all surprised at how young she still is but then she tells their story. Jake is quite the man also-alpha through and through. Takes care of his mom also and does not view it as a burden, a man after my own heart. Being a detective also is quite the career of a man I enjoy reading about. So when she mentions the house she is to look at and maybe buy he is not about to let her go alone because it has been vacant for quite awhile. It just so happens later that evening he appoints himself her protector even when she says she can take care of herself. Sheesh glad there wasn't any arguments there. So this author has definitely hooked you by now and not letting go but where would you go it is so good. Their relationship builds filled with heat that if it was any hotter you would burn your seat. Little occurrences start happening that create intrigue which is another plus this book has to give. Fast pace with a wonderful flow that when you find out all the why's and who done its that is where the man this was wonderful comes in. A must read to find out why it is that Emma is finally home and the wonderful characters introduced to and come to love. A wonderful gift from this author that will satisfy any one needing a fix of romance.

reviewerName: LAS Reviewer "The Long and the Short Of It Re...
reviewText: The love they share is soul deep but the fate of Charma’s family lies in her hands. The memory of every heated touch they share will cut out both their hearts when she leaves him but to save them all, she must run. After nine years of desolation and heartbreak Charma is back. She risks forfeiting her life to warn Brand of an impending attack but she doesn’t hesitate. Brand has her in his arms once more and he will never lose her again.I have waited a long time for this one. At last comes Mating Brand, the long awaited third book in Laurann Dohner’s Mating Heat series. I must say that it was well worth the wait.Brand is finally reunited with Charma in this book. Devoted readers will remember the lost love that he revealed to his cousins in the previous book. Curiosity had me anxious about what happened to tear them apart. Dohner didn’t keep me in the dark long. It was extenuating circumstances that led to their long seperation. Poor Charma. She can’t turn away again so she burns her bridges and rushes to warn her love of impending danger.I loved Brand and Charma together. I felt the story started off strong and kept up the intensity right up until the end. Brand was a hot alpha hero who didn’t waste any time claiming his mate this time around. They make up for lost time in the bedroom too. There was a great deal of conflict in the story because they are supposed to be natural enemies. The plot was riveting with plenty of action when the big pussies attack and lives are in danger. Okay !!! I couldn’t help myself. *grin* It was well developed with family bonds and Pack dynamics being explored. All the characters were intriguing and, and yes, I need to read everyone’s story. Especially Rave and Von.It was no surprise to me that this book was very well written. It was put together quite nicely with a solid plot while at the same time being deliciously dirty. It was an engaging and fast paced read. I read it in one sitting because I didn’t want to put it down. Now, I’m really hoping there will be more books in the series, and that I won’t have to wait so long for the next one.I happily recommend this book. It’s a great erotic paranormal romance.originally posted at long and short reviews
I have loved all of Connie Suttle's series so far and this new one may rival them all. I enjoy how the various stories tie together. Great job!

Excellent novel the world building was fantastic and the interaction between characters was very good. The story line and character development was outstanding. This is my first book by Connie Suttle, I will definitely be looking into her other books and waiting for the second book in the First Ordinance series.

The second book in the series picks up almost where the first one left off. This book should not be read alone, but second, otherwise the reader will miss out on the entire back story.This book focused more on the relationships between the characters. We have conflicts between family, friends, Jackson and Jocelyn… pretty much anyone that could cause harm to their fairly new bond. There were some conflicts that seem will never resolve, that really hurt my heart right along with Jocelyn. The author was amazing at making me feel right along with the MC, her feelings bled off the pages until they became mine as well. And man did she go through a nonstop complete emotional roller coaster. The one big issue I had with the MC is the fact she was already letting her grades slip. Everyone, including herself was so concerned about her getting pregnant and not finishing school, yet her lack of effort right now was never an issue. Most nights she would not do homework because she was with Jackson or researching her own history. I wanted to shake her a little. And can I just say that I felt it was a little old fashioned that everyone didn’t want her to marry because she would get pregnant. You don’t have to married for that to occur, just an FYI. There may be other elements present in this book as well, but the main idea is that this is a romance. Their relationship is at the heart of every action, be it in the past or the present. Jackson and Jocelyn are so very upfront about their feelings, not only too each other but to everyone else as well. At times I felt a little awkward reading this because it was like getting an intimate peek into a private moment that really could have been kept private. It was nice that they felt so strongly for each other, but they were both so intense about it. Also, is it that easy to fake being a high school student? I thought documentation such as a social security number were needed for things like that.I liked that the walls are breaking down between the two times, but I feel like she is so impulsive that something terrible is bound to happen. Also, I believe that both Jocelyn and Jackson overreacted in the most epic of proportions, both at fault in my view. I got so emotionally attached to these people that I need the next book as soon as it becomes available because I am on the edge of my seat. I love them and the honest love they have, regardless of what the world may say, they stand strong.I received this book from the author as well as Goodreads in exchange for my honest review.
I think this is a pretty cool introduction book to rag rugs. It is well put together and includes most basic rug types.

I learned so much about wheat that I didn't know before. This is a good book to help you learn why something we thought was so good is no longer that way. There are very easy to read and follow recipes in this book. The pictures are clear and the information is well thought out and easy to read.
I've read White's other books and this one doesn't disappoint.  I can't wait to try the Shrimp and Grits, Cauliflower Apple Soup, and the Cheesy Chili Popcorn!

And I am happy to see that there will be a 4th installment coming... While I enjoyed the continuing relationship between the 2 main characters along with the supporting characters, the only reason that I didn't 5 star this installment was due to the number of typos in this book as opposed to the first two books. Other than that? Great series & happy to know that another one is in the works..

Okay, but not what I expected...These are paranormal stories.  I liked the first two stories very much.  The beauty and the beast theme with BJ and Brodie.  Hawk and Sarah in the second story were great together and the story was suspenseful and interesting.  There was wonderful romance and deep characters. The sex is not explicit, but vague. It is romantic.  For some reason I didn't like Emma, haven't decided why, and Drew was a murky character.  The new angel in training, Faith, screws up and lets Jonathan die, but puts him inside Drew to go to Emma and find love and get his life back.  It just didn't work for me.  All in all the writing was good, but two out of three isn't bad for the price.  Give it a try.
summary: Okay, but not what I expected...

reviewText: These stories are going to keep you interested and wanting to know more about each of the characters. They are intriguing and you want to find out what happens next. You will love them.

reviewText: I really loved this book.  I've read the first and enjoyed it--I have to say that I liked this one even better.  The characters are great--even if they can sometimes be a little predictable and expected.  They don't feel tired or cliche, they still feel genuine and likable.  Joe is even better developed in this book than she was in the first.  She makes risky, maybe a little foolish, decisions--but it's clear why she does it.You can also tell how much research the author put into this book.  It reminded me a lot of a real historical events that I am familiar with and I think that adds authenticity and credibility.Overall, this was a great read and I can't wait to see what comes next.

This is the not the first book I have read by Brenda Barrett, but this is the best. I have already purchased and downloaded the next two books in the New Song Series. I can't wait to get started.

I was gifted a copy of the book in return for an honest review from the author.Cursed Love was amazing, it told the story of a man who has dealt with some rough things in his life from his childhood and he keeps a strong shield around himself.This story has multiple POV and they are easy to follow along with.Cursed love is about Linc and his story is pretty rough, in the beginning you learn about him as a boy. This will help you really understand his story.You also meet Jo, Daulton and Etty. There are a few others but you really meet Linc, Jo, Daulton and Etty. The characters are great and you will fall in love with them.The ending in amazing and will leave you wanting more.This book is for readers 18+ due to language and sexual encounters.

Omg PLEASE TELL me this is not happening.... I just sat and read this straight through was late to work lol. it is spell binding a must read but just be aware you have to wait till the end of May to find  out what happens. UGH

So I rarely have problems getting threw a book but this one was tough. I just didn't get it. I felt no connection between Jo and Linc just that they were sex buddies until she said she loved him. I did feel some connection between Linc and Etty but they were supposed to be friends. It was just too weird for me. Plus I had read it was a standalone but it has a cliffhanger and I hate cliffhangers. I think it would have been a good story if Jo ended up the Daulton and Etty with Linc. Oh well!

Cursed Love is another fabulous read, can't wait for the next one.  I loved T. H. Snyder's previous series and this one is shaping up to be just as good.  An amazing main character, Linc, even his name is devine.  Can't wait to start off where it all finished.

Like the title says, Life's Second Chance, this is a second chance love story.Ethan Parker has been in love with Leah Ashton for as long as he can remember but a decision that Leah makes pulls them apart. When she chooses Charles over Ethan, it puts her into a life that she never imagined for herself.Charles is a monster and breaks Leah down changing her to the point that she doesn't believe in herself and has given up hope of following her dreams.This book takes you on a journey of Leah fighting to get her life back and the man that her heart has always been in love with. I loved Leah she is such a strong character even though it takes her a while to realize that. The story has a lot of emotion, romance but also gut wrenching, when you read about what all Leah has been through. I honestly hated Charles. You will love this book and fall in love with Ethan you just can't help it.

And the way it was written, just didn't meet it's mark for me. I can see the potential in the author but for such a serious topic, the story lacked.

[...]My rating: 4 of 5 ⭐️On her way to a conference by train, erotic romance author, Olivia Redmund finds herself living out, what could almost be a scene from one of her own books. A hot sexy encounter in a quiet area of the train, with a rugged, gorgeous stranger with magic hands. A far cry from her normal behaviour, which is much more reserved and demure than her profession suggests. Which is probably why she decides to use her pen name, Autumn Winters, instead of her real name....Enjoying the freedom of not being measured by the size of his wallet, Hunter Grayson decides to  keep some secrets of his own, determined to enjoy the gorgeous and passionate Autumn as long as he can. But when those secrets come to light, before he has a chance to explain.....Autumn has disappeared.*****YOWZA!! That is most definitely one hot little number!!A highly erotic story bringing to life a popular 'secret' fantasy of many, I'm sure! Impulsive sex with a stranger in a semi-public location..... Just like for most of us, for Olivia a fantasy was all it had ever been. Except in her case, she would write about them too. But this time she challenges herself to step outside her own box - to be in the moment, so to speak. Grabbing an opportunity to expand on her experience and explore her own limits, something she feels she needs after a bad break up. She is surprised to find herself far more passionate and lustful than she had imagined. Or maybe that was Hunter's influence.....Not used to being looked at for who he is, but mainly for what he represents, Autumn's refreshing innocence and direct honesty is new to Hunter. He is tired of phony smiles and fake orgasms and craves real and natural responses, like the ones he evokes from Autumn. His lack of trust is a result of history and experience, but it almost costs him a chance to pursue what he has craved all along.If you are looking for page-scorching love scenes..... You've found it. But there is not a whole lot to the story. I know, it is a novella, there isn't a lot of book to explore backgrounds and context and a whole lot of depth to go with the sex, but I still missed it a bit. What there was....was undoubtedly well written, there just wasn't enough and it was a little too 'pat'...too easy, in the end. Nevertheless, despite the almost insta-love and the incredibly fortuitous turn of events, I thoroughly enjoyed this short, by extremely talented author Beth Michele!!✨Vivaciously wicked runaway secrets.✨**Copy provided in return for an honest review.**
Who doesn't like a good love story? This one gives you everything; depth, honesty, self-realization. This one definitely captured my heart. Great read.

This is a creepy book. The author does nothing but make jokes about her condition, often in poor taste. reviewText: Oh the wishy washy back and forth... The h has some serious problems arguing with herself... I don't want to be a captive, but I like the pain, the pain is wrong, but it feels good, blah, blah, blah. I wanted a dark erotica where the H buys a slave and has dark tendencies (you know, what you think you're getting from the description). What I got was a H that wants to spoil her and a h that likes the pain and being held captive. The inner dialogue she has with herself is annoying and repetitive. Make a damn decision!
not to much more to say not the most raw I have read but ruby was a great character I felt for her I felt like I was there with her I have nothing to say about Gavin but he did redeem himself

Colin is sometimes so sweet he's unbelievable, but I just loved him. This book is all about seeing the beauty in the person's insides not their outside. Another well though out story in this series. In real life not everyone is perfect and Kirsten addresses it here, both the good and the ugly, I like that about this book. I would recommend this book/series to my friends.

reviewText: The tale takes twist and turns into expanding the tale of Trumpit and Ada. Your heart races with them during the high emotional journey and quickened when they face terror. A good addition to the Eden Project saga.

I must say for a debut novel, Crystal Rister did a splendid job! I couldn’t put the book down! There are many Werewolf/Vampire books out there today and they won’t stop coming, but when you can put originality to it and spin it so that its not the same as all the others you have something great!After a tragic incident that leaves Sara alone and without a family for many years moving from place to place she ends up at a bar back in the state of Kentucky, the state she once called home. However, now she is grown and taking care of herself although still experiencing nightmares of that horrible night and wondering why Jarroth, a boy she grew up with never came for him as he promised he would.  That same night at the bar Sara is attacked by vicious men and rescued by a stranger. When she comes to and calms down a bit this stranger turns out not to be a stranger at all, but the boy she has thought to be dead all these years, Jarroth.  However, Jarroth is no longer a boy, but a very sexy and strong man! Not only that, but he isn’t quite human and Sara soon finds out that the myths about Werewolves and Vampires are indeed real.Loved, loved, loved the chemistry between Jarroth and Sara. I love how he said he was going to wait for her to answer before they went any further than simply kissing or such, but still pushed her at the same time. I love the protectiveness he has over her and being that he thought she was dead all these years and then finding her and not wanting to every let her go is just….ugh..can we say swoon!Having been on her own pretty much since she was about twelve she is very independent, but can recognize when she needs help or protecting. At the same time she trys to act as if she doesn’t know if she can be with Jarroth and be his mate and perhaps make that commitment, but deep down inside she knows that it feels right! Once she comes to that conclusion she gives in especially after another run in with those same vicious men that attacked her the night before. This gives her the opportunity to see all of Jarroth and what he is capable of and the he would indeed lay his life down in order to protect her.Yes the book leaves you hanging in the worst way, but cliffhangers aren’t always bad if they make you want to continue you on with the next book! Even if you don’t have a great relationship with cliffhangers, I would still recommend this for you to read. So much sexiness and some action and some twist and turns you won’t see coming!
summary: I wish this kind of stuff really existed!

reviewText: loved this book. couldnt put it down. u just fall in love with ian & rory. def recommend

I loved the fact that Rory didn't give up on her man or dreams she was determine to get what she wanted.  I balled my eyes out for Rory a couple of times but in the end I was smiling right along with her and Ian.  I hope you write some more novels to this story

reviewText: Short easy read for the beach.  Typical romance formula, but with a little bit of mystery that kept you reading to find out more.

I could literally have enjoyed watching paint dry more than reading any more of this book.  I tried.  It crawls along with nothing to draw you in.  Sorry.  I hate leaving sad reviews, but this one can only be sad.

I could just cry right now because I honestly did not want this story to end. I absolutely adore Abby and Beck's story. Wow. So beautiful. So tragic. Yet it was funny. I laughed, teared up, felt my heart beat in over time, and I fell crazy hard for Beck. Abby was a wonderful character too. They're perfect. Gaaahhhh. Why did it have to end?!?!?!

What would you do if death was knocking on your door, but at the last minute, you escaped it and had a second chance to live? Would you take it for granted or would you understand that life is a gift, and it's meant to be experienced fully...with your whole heart?Abby Mae McAllister finds herself in this exact position after only trying to survive for the first 19 years of her life. With a new heart, Abby's life has stopped being about hospitals, sickness, and dying and started being about experiencing all the aspects of life she was never able to because of her condition.  What better way to let go of the old her and embrace the new her - the one with a bright future full of limitless possibilities - than a road trip! And this is where Abby's story/journey takes an interesting turn - Enter Beckham Dilan Prescott. Beck takes Abby on the road trip of a lifetime. Beck is just what Abby needs; he shows her what it means to enjoy life and be ever present in her life for the first time in a long time.With this Heart is an amazing story about truly living for yourself...owning the life you've been given and never regretting your decisions. Abby is the perfect heroine for this coming of age story; at 19, she has little life experience, so she lights up with every new situation. Through all the highs and lows, readers are right there with Abby, laughing at her banter and crying with her when she has set backs. R.S. Grey gives us a front row seat on Abby and Beck's adventure, and I loved every minute of it.Abby couldn't have asked for a better co-pilot on her journey. Beck has to be one of the sweetest book boyfriends I have ever met. He's romantic and caring; he gives of himself so freely, which is exactly what Abby needs as she tries to figure out the kind of life she wants to live.This is a must read book; it definitely runs readers through the gamut of emotions, but in the end, no matter how many tears are shed, the payoff comes with the most amazing ending. Thank you, R.S. Grey, for taking me on an unforgettable journey and for the reminder that life comes with no guarantees, so it's meant to be lived fully!I was provided a complimentary copy of this book by the author in return for an honest review.5 poison apples (The Fairest of All Book Reviews)
Was totally not what I expected but I've got to say I was pleasantly surprised. What a well written beautiful story. Would recommend this book to everyone.

I can't tell you how much I loved loved loved this book.  Amazing and spectacular don't even cover it for me!This is a spoiler-free review so I won't get into incredible detail but Abby & Beck embark on a journey together.  A road trip that Abby has planned and Beck decides he needs to join.  Only problem?  They don't know each other.  At all.  And, ok - two problems.  Abby's parents - who are very involved parents yet - have no idea she's going.  For whatever reason, Abby feels like having Beck join her is exactly what she needs and soon finds herself agreeing.  Their witty banter, that I've come to love so much about RS Grey's writing, crazy adventures and sweetness pulled me in from the very beginning.This is a story about Abby discovering who she is and what it means to really love & live life, one s'more at a time.Pick up this book.  Please.  You won't be disappointed.  You might laugh, cry, and especially swoon but you won't be disappointed.
This was such a great book , the whole story line was sad, funny, loving .. Everything to A&E a great book!
Great writing.  Loved the female lead. The writing was witty and real.  Storyline interesting.  Lead characters were real. Thank you.

My first introduction to RS Grey’s writing was with Behind His Lens, a story with erotic undertones about the importance of life and love… With this Heart was nothing like that…  not really!With this Heart takes us on Abby’s journey as she takes life by the balls, chooses to live it, and lives it in the company of Beck.  The underpinning driver behind Abby is the gift of a second chance.With this Heart is written with a mix of love, laughs, firsts, sadness, loss, hope, and so many more emotions. The characters are well developed and the story rolls off the pages.  It has your heart soaring, and breaking as Abby goes on her road trip.Abby and Beck are perfect for each other – how they meet is quite unique, but as the relationship blossoms you are cheering for them.  This story has twists, big gaping pot holes and a full circle journey to find the happy ever after tale.I think this is a great NA story, and RS Grey has an amazing gift with the written word.  You definitely are a 3rd wheel on this journey, as you are drawn into Abby’s life.I will say, that while there was absolutely nothing wrong with the writing, the structure or the plot I did struggle initially to get sucked in.  The pages kept turning, but I almost felt like I was pulling teeth to draw out my emotions.  With that in mind – at around 38% - BAM…  something shifted, I was hooked, ugly face crying by the end and seriously needing some happiness to pour out of the page.So my advice is – read this story.  If you find it slow – just treat it like sex, a slow build makes the end all that much more exciting!!  By the end I was in…  I loved the story – I felt the emotions, I wanted the HEA and I sat back and reflected on the very clear message about the importance of living…  Thank you RS Grey.
summary: Reviewed by Kota for Kota's Book Kollection

reviewText: Fun, romantic, full of life and a truly wonderful read. Absolutely loved it and I recommend it to all my friends!
This was my first book from this author and I loved it! I couldn't wait to read more of Beck and Abby. Emotional story with characters that were real and had great chemistry. Worth reading!

I laughed, I cried and I laughed some more and with tears. I loved Abby and Beck's story.Beck is funny and never too much alpha male. Abby is self conscious but not doormat self conscious. I loved their characters and story. I liked not having to wait around for questions to be answered or statements to be made.Loved this book. Will be in my to read again list.
This book is worth more that five stars and I'm so happy I bought it! Can't wait to read more from this author.

This was not just a love story but a suspenceful love story. It had death, intrigue, stalkers, and of course real bad guys. I liked this story alot. Jena looses her sister while she is out to sea. She leaves her 8 yr old daughter to Jena and Chase. Chase is (1) Jena's ex-boyfriend and (2) brother-in-law to Jena sister. Colton the brother-in-law dies years earlier. Now there are secrets that need to come out (Chase) and stalkers to catch. Not all is as it seems in this story. Lots of twists and turns for those who like that type of read. Will look for more books by Lisa DeVore.
The next book in the series is just as good as the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th books!

reviewText: “Marriage. Marriage is what brings us together today. Marriage that blessed arrangement, a dream within a dream.” – The Princess Bride (I always wanted to use the quote)However, much like in the Princess Bride, marriages can have problems (just hopefully not as extreme). This ebook was written to help liven a dying marriage. I could definitely see this helping my parents except for the fact that they’ve been divorced for around four years. I can also see this ebook keeping relationships that are not necessarily dwindling alive (aka not getting to the point of it being a bad relationship).This book also talks up marriage counselors and their good and bad aspects. I feel like this would be a great help for people in relationships that are spiraling out of control as well as people who just want to freshen up their relationship.
this book touch my heart and soul. read in a hour and half. everyone needs to read this book. it will make you understand the different ways God heals.

This is the perfect book for anyone who suffers of this debilitating problem (I know I do!). The author does a great job at explaining exactly what procrastination is, why we do it, and also share some practical solutions to eliminate it! Very easy to read and follow. The author clearly knows what he's taking about. Highly recommended to anyone who needs that extra motivation!

reviewerName: For the Love of Books & Alcohol
reviewText: Colby rescued Lea rescued her from high school hell by taking her dorky, overweight, glasses-wearing self under his wing and including her in the popular group. Now she's a junior in college, living as his roommate and in love with him. They were best friends who were terrified of the feelings they were avoiding. Because of their love, they both wanted more for each other.This was a sweet story with likable characters. I loved that they weren't perfect. They had flaws. They were normal, everyday people; Lea a college student and Colby an aspiring musician. The story had a very natural flow that was nice for a shorter book. Nothing felt rushed or forced in anyway.A lot happens and is resolved in this short story, but it does end on a cliffhanger with new questions that are left unanswered. It was packed with emotion and endearing moments that can only be shared by two people who know each other inside and out.I would happily read the next story in this series. It was a great read for an easy afternoon. I look forward to learning about the next chapter of Lea and Colby's lives.I give this book 4 stars and would pair it with a hard lemonade.This book was generously provided in exchange for an honest review.Read more of our reviews and book/drink pairings at [...]
summary: Sweet novella left me wanting more

reviewText: Great quick read. The characters were likeable and so sweet together. I can't wait until the rest of their story is told.

Forex for Beginners is a book that you do not only read once. You read it over and over because the material is so vibrantly rich with useful tips and information. I was so impressed with this book that I could not put it down. I did not know much about Forex before I read this, now I feel like a professional who has been dealing with trading strategies for years. I highly recommend this book to anyone looking to expand their knowledge base on this subject.

A friend of mine had purchased this book. After reading the first two chapters, I decided to buy my own copy. For those who self-criticize and tends to be a perfectionist, this book explains the causes of these traits and how we as individuals perceive these traits as flaws. The book shows us step by step to embrace these traits and value them in a positive way instead of a negative one. The story about the two pots is a perfect example that without the flaw of one, we wouldn’t have experienced the beauty of the flowers. I recommend this book to anyone who wants to self-reflect and discipline our minds to always think positive and avoid self-sabotaging.
summary: Being a perfectionist doesn't have to be bad thing :)

reviewText: Highly recommend! When a lodge owner retires, Duncan Mahoney sees an opportunity for a flip. But there are complications to his plan, not the least of which is a cargo pilot named Hanna Reed. Add to that gorgeous descriptions about Alaska and this story will pull you in and keep you reading to the very end! Fantastic!
summary: Wild Alaska with an even more exciting romance!!

reviewText: I so loved this book. Hanna and Duncan were so well developed and believable. I found myself rooting for them from the very first paragraph. The way Ms. Woodbury discribes Alaska, and especially this lodge makes me want to go there for an extended visit. She has a very warm, welcoming way of telling a story. I can't wait for her next one!!!
Pretty good first story.  A little less on the lovey-dovey and more about the shifters origin would have made this a five star.

Incredibly well written. From the beginning it pulls you in so much so that you can't put it down. The relationship between Scott and Sarah is like the 2 previous books relationships complex but very engaging. There is this constant sense throughout this book that you are missing a piece of the puzzle but it comes together slowly as each secret is revealed. What I enjoy most about this series so far is nothing seems rushed but it also never lags like so many books do.I can't wait to hear when the release date for the next book is!

I had no idea what I was getting into when I purchased this book. I've read all of Laura's books and I enjoyed each one. This book was a personal favorite. I enjoyed so many aspects of the story. Laura created a clever plot and a great cast of characters. She added in carefully guarded secrets, vampires and ancient history- a great recipe for a great book! The characters were like a group of friends, and I was given the pleasure of knowing each one. Laura has a knack for making her characters feel like old friends by the time you finish any of her books. And she keeps getting better and better. Laura added thoughtful twists throughout and left me guessing until the end. Then she wrapped it all up in a pretty package so I wasn't left hanging. If you like archaeology, vampires, romance, ancient history, mummies, or books with a twist, you will not be disappointed. If you don't like any of these things, you may when you finish! I loved it so much I bought my mom a kindle version and a paperback. Next week, I am ordering another paperback for my mother-in-law!

This and more reviews at The Book Bar.coRiley is back, the [person whose parents are of questionable marital status], and he has answers for us. You need to read Broken Ever After before you read Breaking Her, and trust me, you need to read these books. Mystery, sex and romance all rolled up in a cluster [have sexual relations with] of "what the [unpleasant region of the universe]".I hated, hated Riley when Broken ended. I couldn't believe the nerve of the guy. Our poor girl Oliva had been through so much and she didn't need him to crush her all over again. But he has his reasons.Been there, done that and still wearing the [have sexual relations with]-ing t-shirt to prove it, Princess.Natalie Graham. Breaking Her (Kindle Locations 772-773).Slowly, bit by bit, we learn that Connor Riley has his own reasons for his schizophrenic behavior with Olivia. He was supposed to protect her and maybe, we hoped, take her away from her crumbling reality. Unfortunately, he's being blackmailed.Rose petal soft lips crashed into mine and all thoughts of putting Olivia down and walking away left me. All thoughts left me. I was completely blind to anything but the feel of her lips on mine.Natalie Graham. Breaking Her (Kindle Locations 1052-1053).Riley is completely torn by his personas; pretend to protect Olivia, manipulate her into trusting him, protect his family. No wonder the readers were left completely dumbstruck by his attitude in Broken.[Have sexual relations with] it. I want her. I wanted her in every single way I could think of and there was no more denying that to myself.Natalie Graham. Breaking Her (Kindle Locations 143-145).Breaking Her is a novella and it was just the perfect tease for those of us that are waiting, not very patiently, to find out what happens to Olivia. I love these two books. They are a wonderful break when I need one. The creativity of the writing is captivating and plot twists are awesome . Please Natalie Graham, take care of our Olivia and get her back to us ASAP!
summary: Rating: Top Shelf A tiny, intense glimpse at the logic behind "Broken Ever After"; from Riley's POV

reviewText: Glazov is a love story of sorts. Dark, twisted, dirty and yet intriguing. Its not quite like anything I have read before. I was interested from the start, absorbed into the storyline and entertained all the way through. This is a fast read that is well-written and unpredictable making it difficult to put the book down so I didn't. I read until the end. Eyes popped while glued to the pages.The characters. Are life-life and three-dimensional and curiously flawed. Compelling, to say the least."I would awaken in the middle of the night to him whispering softly in my ear, as his hands swept with expert percussion over my body. His whispers were soft yet threatening; telling me that he would never let me go, telling me he was going to force me to bear his son; as payment for my debt. He would tell me in the same sentence that he owned me, and that he loved me. He would tell me that he would kill me before he ever let me go. Everything that I had ever been taught to avoid in a man; he was......Yet......I wanted him, I craved him, I loved him..."I received a copy of this book in exchange for a fair and honest review

The book had 1026 locations on my kindle. The book was about a woman, named Kathleen and a man, named Alexander. Alexander was a Russian mobster.  Kathleen's assistant, was a gambler, who owed a lot of money to Alexander. Kathleen decided to rescue her assistant, and settle the debt. She met with Alexander, whom she called Glazov, but things did not go as planned. Glazov demanded Kathleen settle the debt with her body, instead of the money, which was owed. Kathleen resisted him, but not for long.  Glazov was a take charge, dark, ruthless, do what I say, kind of man, which I loved. He quickly became obsessed with controlling every aspect of Kathleen's life, even going so far, as to threaten to kill any man, who stood in his way. The book contained rough, descriptive and detailed sex, which was great. The heroine was hit on her feet, when she did not obey Glazov.  I wanted the heroine to put up more of a fight, which is why, I gave the book a 4 star rating.

When an author can take a simple action and turn it into something that tugs on my heart, I'm hooked. This happened several times throughout the book. There were a lot of characters introduced - so many to like...and dislike. :) I was not able to go to bed until I saw the story through to the very end. Well done! I can't wait for the sequel.

This book was fantastic from start to finish. I know that many women and girls will be able to identify with the dynamics of Mama Kakes and Meena's relationship. This book contained valuable lessons that can teach children/teens that sometimes they just need to listen to their parents and those who love them to avoid heartache...yet they must still learn for themselves. This book also can help parents to realize that our sins are often visited upon our children and often our actions can damage them in ways we never imagined. This book teaches that prayer is necessary in our everyday lives as well as a close relationship with God, the Most High, Jah, etc. I do not want to give away any parts of the book but I am anxious to see how this all plays out. What will happen with Meena and Pablo? And what will Mama Kakes and Tony do to save Meena? Great job Michelle...I am so proud of you hunn...Now get to writing part 2!!! lol
summary: Extraordinary Read.. WARNING: Valuable life lessons inside...proceed with an open heart and mind!!lol

reviewText: Can't wait for part two. Loved to see how Mama Lakes and Meena were able to rebuild their lives. Some people never get a second chance to become the people God has called them to be.
this is a great collection of stories that focuses on a few age play families and situations. I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys the age play genre.

Afraid to Love by MJ NightingaleAna Perrot is thirty-four, she’s single and loving it. She doesn’t believe in relationships just really good sex. For the past ten years this has worked for her, none of her partners have ever complained.“She liked them a little younger anyway. They were easier to control and more readily agreed to her conditions, her rules.”Teddy O’Rourke is almost thirty-four. He has been a bartender for the last ten years, he enjoys it and it more than pays the bills and there’s really no stress involved. He enjoys women but he’s never been in love.“Ana had been with many men, but this man by far had the best body she had ever seen.”I met Ana and Teddy in book one, Fire in His Eyes, and liked them then. Now I LOVE them. I wish I could meet Teddy. The way he is described in this book, he’s takes good care of his body, is very well hung and no woman has ever not been satisfied. The sexual attraction between these two is INCREDABLE. The fact that Ana will do anything in the bedroom adds A LOT of spice to this story. The situations these two encounter are real life situations, not the same old misunderstandings in most romance books.  Ana deals with some deep emotional issues that stem from her past and the issues Teddy battles just make me want to hung him and cry. I would have given this book a 5 star review if the editing had been better. I give this book 4 stars with 4.5 hands down the pants.“Size did matter, It mattered a f*#ing lot! Exclamation point! Thank-you very much!”

I actually didn't even realise that this was the second book in the series so while I will go back and read the first one because I really enjoyed Afraid To Love you don't have to read them in order and this could simply be read as a stand alone.Ana has been hurt in love but occasionally her attitude annoys me, yes we have all been hurt but to simply treat all men like she does because of it is a little selfish even though I can understand and on occasions her character does grate on me.Now Teddy on the other hand I loved he has played around but as soon as he meets the one he knows and he goes for it with everything within him, occasionally he could be a little more sensitive but I think he deals with Ana's issues very well.I also loved Teddy's family who couldn't help but love a family like that, I really felt for Monica Ana's sister and I loved Lou her friend.One of my favourite lines sums up the book for me too I think "Family was who you let love you ... Family came in all shapes and sizes, you just had to let them in. You just had to have hope."A well written and enjoyable modern love story that has some heat amongst the emotion and a message that is about family and love that is ageless.I received a free copy for an honest review.

reviewerName: Fictional Men's Page For Book Ho's
reviewText: Afraid to Love is a companion volume to Fire In His Eyes which focused on Monica, the sister of Ana. Afraid To Love focuses on Ana and follows the same timeline as Fire. It is not a sequel, and you do not have to read one to enjoy the other, but the two books do compliment each other well. I liked Fire In His Eyes, but found some of the writing to be a bit off, even though I still gave it 4 stars. But the author's writing has really improved in Afraid To Love.Afraid To Love tells the story of Ana, who has had her heart broken once before when her ex-husband cheated on her. That would have been bad enough, but to make things worse he also brought into their marital bed a serious STD which ended up causing Ana to have a complete hysterectomy at the age of 24. She is now 34, and for the last 10 years she has limited her exposure to men to one night stands and such. Ana never wanted to get serious with another man, worried that he would also break her heart. She also felt that she was only half a woman now that she could never have children of her own. What kind of man would ever be satisfied with that?Everything changes the night she met Teddy. Teddy was a handsome bartender who swept Ana off her feet like no other man had before. For the first time in many years Ana wanted to see a man more than once. And Teddy wanted to see more of this beautiful red haired goddess. Almost in spite of herself, Ana was falling in love with this incredible man. But she knew nothing serious could ever come of it. Teddy was from a large family, and she knew he wanted kids of his own someday. She could never give him that.However, Teddy had secrets of his own, and this is the crux of the novel. How can these two, who obviously care for each other, possibly be together and enjoy their happy ending? Please read this book to learn the answer to that.The sex scenes in this book are fire hot. Ana is very submissive in the bedroom, wanting a man to take control, and Teddy is more than willing to do just that. As a man myself I have to say I found that especially hot and sexy.The book is complete in and of itself. You do not have to read Fire In His Eyes first, although reading it will help explain her sisters journey. which is only touched upon in this book.I loved the book, finding it very sweet, and a bit heartbreaking at times. I found myself with wet eyes more than once. I would encourage you to check it out. I promise you will fall in love with Ana and Teddy too.
Loved Remy and Colt. The only thing I didn't like was that I didn't want it to end. I can't wait for the next book in the series.

The series Hard Habits starts off with Games We Play by author Zayne Michaels.  To say I loved this story is putting it mildly.  Ms. Michaels does an amazing job of bringing a great story, and characters I loved together. The steamy sex was just icing on a really well done story.  The layers in this story kept me turning the pages.  My only complaint, I didn’t want this one to end ever.  The characters even in this short story form are unforgettable and so full of life I fell in love which is what I love to do in any story I read. There is a twist to this story I don’t think anyone will see coming.  I would like to see Tripp get his own story, either way I will be waiting for the next book in this series.Five Shooting Stars!!

Meet Sehn, an elf like no other. Does he have delusions of grandeur, a god-complex, or chauvenistic tendencies? Well, he is quite the unique elf. This is the story of Sehn, his human companions who are not all as lowly as Sehn treats them, leaving Sehn's home city along with Cah'lia and Nero, a beautiful elf maiden and her little brother. The purpose of the journey? Adventure and fortune-or is it? This fantasy is a hilarious and quirky read

I really was burned by my book purchases this week. I've no idea how I found this one but I did pay full price for it so I'm entitled to this review, no matter how many unhelpful votes I get. Once again there were only 5 star reviews so I should've been more cautious. The premise of the story is that the H meets the h, when he goes to see who his brother is intending to marry. He makes a load of assumptions about her and decides that the only way he can prevent his younger brother from making a huge mistake, is by marrying her himself and then annulling the marriage after his brother has found someone more suitable. I found the story melodramatic, the interaction between the main characters was awful and immature and full of misunderstandings and presumptions. The main characters themselves were unlikeable. The name-calling was supposed to be cute, I think, but it really got on my nerves. This goes on for the whole book and when there is yet another drama towards the end, I just wanted to throw my Kindle and be done with this book.+++Spoilers+++One of the very many examples of the problems I had with this book, is when the H decides, after consummating the marriage, to give the h back to his brother.I cannot recommend it, I'm sorry.
I love her books. This book at times made me cry and other tines laughing my butt off. I can't wait for her next book.

I had a garden in past that did quite well, but the following year the plants did not flourish to the same degree. This book gave me some tips and helped point me in a direction for improving my efforts. I also was interested in patio gardening and there was a short chapter recommending certain plants that prosper in that setting.
