Blake never cease to amaze me!!! This is a page turner indeed!!! I see a SHORT FILM or MOVIE necessary fot this BOOK!!!!

Fantastic and well done! Not only do the recipes look deliciously divine (Primal Breakfast Casserole - coming up!), but it was interesting to learn about the study that Dr. Voegtin wrote in 1975 on the Stone Age Diet. The book emphasizes REAL food, including natural and organic and unprocessed. I would advocate taking it a step further and ensuring the meat you eat is all from grass-fed and grass-finished sources. Definitely agree that processed foods have no business in our bodies. Just a note that some of the recipes include the use of dairy (and as the author states, it's important to adapt to your preference) - I am completely ok with that and use dairy as well, and think some of the paleo books out there are too hard-lined. I can't wait to try out the Crustless Spinach Quiche - OMG. The Coconut Chicken Nuggets with "BBQ" sauce are a great idea! Then, wrap up your day with some lovely Molten Chocolate Cake, or Sugar Cookies made with cashews, coconut and tapioca flours. Good times.
summary: A great addition to my Paleo library!

reviewText: Caleb is a hot, dark, and fierce dragon warrior. When he witnessed the slave Lileta being beaten by his Overlord Odage he almost loses it. He claims Lileta as his slave to spare her a death sentence. When he realizes the Gods & Goddesses made Lileta his mate...knowing if he were to act upon his desires the result could be deadly. Lileta is furious Caleb wants her as his own. When he frees her...her anger is suddenly changing into desire, but she knows her past is unworthy of his love.Fatal Desire is the second book in the Guardians series by Valerie Twombly. This was a good fast paced, action packed story full of desire and lust. The leading characters Caleb and Lileta are pitted against one another right off the bat, but when danger comes knocking at their door Caleb releases Lileta of her slave bands to free her and keep her safe. The lust and desire these two felt for one another was palpable and jumped from the pages. I enjoyed their story and the story plot that flowed from the first novel. There were some things that I skimmed over because I just felt it wasn't needed. This is an enjoyable read for those who love paranormal romance. If you enjoyed Sherrilyn Kenyon or Christine Feehan then you will love Valerie Twombly.Reviewer for Paranormal Romance and Authors That Rock fb page

I received this book from the author and from Paranormal Romance and Authors That Rock. This book is a stand alone novel that is part of a series. Lileta and Caleb are destined to be together, there's just one little issue. Doing so will kill him.It took me a little bit to get into this story but Caleb and Lileta's relationship was well written, and sometimes quite steamy. The author did a great job of creating a world that pulled you further into the story. This book reminded me somewhat of J.R Ward's Blackdagger brotherhood, only with dragons. With adult content I would recommend this book to those over 18 who enjoy paranormal romance.4 Fangs

A good night’s sleep is crucial for anyone to function properly in the thought process and our body’s physical wellbeing. Having a new born addition to the family is often times tiring and can affect our physical health if we are not getting the proper rest.  It is also detrimental to the baby to get the proper sleep for a healthy immune system and physical growth. I love the book, Sleep Like a Baby: How to Help your child Sleep Naturally Without Relying on Too Much Feeding Or Rocking-A-Bye Babies by Raven Heidrich, because she has great tips and ideas to help with sleep strategies for your baby. I can’t help but feel we could use some of these tips for ourselves as well.  This would be a great reference book for your collection because it will carry you through an infant to the teen years with your child. A must read for new parents!
This was an awesome conclusion to Kenneth and Nikki's story. Loved it. I'm a fan. Anticipating Patrice and Michael's story.

I received this book from the author for an honest review.The final book in Marina's story. So much has happened for Marina, Nate and the ranch. Most of this book deals with the mystery of John Kelley, and what happened all those years ago when it was thought he committed suicide. Have to say I didn't see it coming. Wonderful ending to that storyline. Nate and Marina have settled into their relationship, they are closer then ever. For all the ropes and whips and spankings, this was really a wonderful romance story.Serena has written a wonderful series of books, that have a fantastic storyline along with erotica. Normally you get one or the other in books. here you get it all, including some mystery and suspense. Looking forward to the next set of books.

On one hand, this was hot. I loved seeing Ali and Alejandro reconnect. But, it just didn't feel like a bad boy biker book. I would have loved to see more action and less sexy dreams. I just feel like the book was missing something, something more. It's not an awful read, and it did not take long to get through. It just needs a little extra plot to it. I can feel what the author is trying to set up, to get you into the next book, the cliff hanger was done well. It's the rest of the story leading up to it that leave me wondering if it's worth reading the next one or not.
Too short for me though...looking forward to the next book!  Probably could have use another story arc to set a more complex tale.  But it was ver good reading.

Right from the start of this book you could feel Gray's heart ache and struggle over his brothers overdose. During all of this Gray finds that its okay not to be the family caregiver. That each and everyone has a choice good bad or in different. During all of this emotional rollercoaster Gray finds Love, companionship, and a best friend. All the while realizing that you don't have to be blood related to be a family. Karolyn James hit this book out of the ball bark. WOW!
Karolyn James is an Awesome Writer! Great Book! Can't wait for the other stories in the series to come out!

I just loved Gray and his story. After reading the Chasing Cross series, had to have this one, and I recommend it highly. These are great stories, not just of rock and roll stars, but of their lives and they are relatable to our own without the rockstar stuff... what each guy goes through we can see ourselves in them too. With his brother in the hospital of an overdose not knowing if he will make it,, that is the only spoiler I will give and I usually don't give them,,,, the story is great how he meets a great woman..  The stories are funny, sad, happy, romantic, hot but not over the top with sex on every page.. I love a great erotic romance story, but I want the story to be top priority and Karolyn James delivers ..... cannot wait to read the rest of each band members story.... awesome...Karolyn Rocks!
summary: great second book, cannot wait for the next one

reviewText: This is a good starter book for people new to the Paleo diet.  Has all the basics plus some new recipes I haven't seen before like Deviled Crab Eggs, Cranberry Sausage Balls, and Paleo Honey Cake... Yummm!

I So LOVE this series..I don't think any review I give can do it justice but I will try....This is the addicted series and Addicted I AM!! The Calloways girls and Hale brothers and Conner Cobalt are characters that will reach inside your every emotion and take you on a never-ending journey filled with complete utter amusement, laughter, angst,gut wrenching sorrow,determination, sexiness-Alot of sexiness - This can be read as a stand alone but I wouldn't recommend it as you won't connect as much to all the characters by not understanding their individual stories and history..and that would be a crime by itself as they are very Awesome characters!! This is Ryke and Daisy's story and the BEST yet!! ( I think I say this every time I read one of these- lol) Ryke and Daisy are such a perfect match for each other, They both are strong and driven and beautiful and the ONLY thing that kept them apart was their age difference, when Ryke first meets Daisy she is fifteen and totally off limits as he finds out ..SHE is his brothers girlfriends sister..SO..after crashing into his brothers life after not caring to be part of his life for sooooo many years No thanks to Ryke an  Lo' s parents- same dad different moms...He wants to be the best support system for Lo his only brother and Daisy is the baby sister and too young..but she doesn't act her age as the baby sister as she is a model whom travels and has had many life experiences just like Ryke..They are both Dare devils and they become friends and he is like a rock to so many in this group that need him..his brother Lo who's an addict(to alcohol) Lo's gf Lily(who's a sex addict) And Daisy ( who's young an  naive about life experiences but pushes his envelope and him at every turn)-So he has fought everything about her until she turns eighteen- they've both dated other people and with the age difference of seven yrs between them and Lo loosing his s*** every time he seems to get too close to Daisy..it's always been just friends..But fate has a way of pushing things - doesn't it? Circumstances happen..and when his brother Lo and her sisters are so busy in their own lives to notice what the little sister has had to endure from ALL their crazy s*** that got leaked to the media from no other than Rykes mom...well who's been their for Daisy?? Ryke has...time and time again...And after a while you no longer can fight the impossible- you just gotta let it happen..And so it does! And were talking full blown fireworks peeps!! No guts No glory- And Ryke and Daisy are full throttle- Non-stop action so sit back and enjoy the ride! I DID:)))) I will forever be a fan of anything these two sisters write - They have the ability to multi-task countless characters going through chaos and take your heart, mind and soul on a tour you will thoroughly enjoy-<<<<<3

Oh Ryke I don't understand your frustrations, well maybe I do, "every morning is about the same. Wake up in Daisy's bed. Try to suppress a horrible effing boner. Take a shower. Run with my brother. Take another shower. Try my absolute effing best to stroke my c*** without thinking of her long legs and that gorgeous effing smile." He's also very blunt, "you know what I effing learned today?" he says, his features really dark. "Rose just told Connor, my brother, and me that you have irregular periods because of your weight." He has so much passion for Daisy, "his hard gaze soaks in all of me. "Calloway, I'd ef you in every corner of every hallway and then do it over again for good measure." My jaw unhinges. "And I'd be more likely to ef you in a stairwell than on a bed." Daisy she's just so damn cute, "how big are you?" I already kind of know the answer. His thin pants leave very little to the imagination." I personally thought their age difference wasn't really a big deal.

I waited on this book and clicked that one click button the second I saw it, after refreshing my browser compulsively! I had to have it! I've read and loved all the other books in this series, and have loved both Daisy and Ryke from the beginning. I couldn't wait for their  story. And it did not disappoint! This is the book that I have been waiting for in the Addicted companion novels spin offs (if that's even what they're called?) I have seriously been waiting for Ryke's story all this time and we now have it and it couldn't have been better. It was everything I could have hope for. Hothouse Flower made me feel all kinds of emotions :) I pulled an all nighter reading it and finished it in one sitting minus a 10 minute break. It was that freaking good! I was hooked from the first line all the way up until the last :) I have never waited for a book to go live on amazon like I did this one lol The anticipation was killing me. But yeah, on to the review!Daisy is the youngest Calloway sister at 18 and is the definition of a dare devil, but in this book we see that there's more to her than that. We find out that she's having terrible nightmares from traumatic experiences that has happened to her over the past year or so and slowly we start to learn all the things that has her so wound up. I liked Daisy :) She was a fun character. At first, I was skeptical if she would be a good match for Ryke because I absolutely adore him. She's only 18 and sometimes she acts like it. I thought Ryke would be to mature for her, but he's a little dare devil himself so they were kind of a perfect match :) I LOVE RYKE! We got to see another side of him in this book. Jealousy? I was a bit surprised by it at first. There were some great scenes and some awkward ones as well (That one with Connor! I almost died with embarrassment for them!) I loved the connection that the two shared. I liked that we saw them build a friendship throughout the series and now we finally saw them get together. But it wasn't a smooth ride. With Daisy being the youngest, Ryke had to go through a lot of people. Lo being the first and he played no games.I liked that played the overprotective brother role. It made the anticipation that much better. I love the brotherly bond that Ryke, Lo and Connor have. Bromance is what people call it? There was so much character growth between so many of the characters in this book. And that double whammy surprise we got from Lily and Rose was like... Now I'm dying to get my hands on the next book. Hothouse Flower brought the heat, the excitement, the suspense and the entertainment! I was extremely excited about this book and it didn't disappoint me at all. I swear I feel like rereading it :)

I know what you're thinking. I know.. I can't believe it either. I struggled with this truly I did. I rated Hothouse Flower only 4 stars! WHAT!? Every other book in the series has gotten 5++++ from me but surprisingly for me Hothouse did not come with the same bang bang pow as the other books in the series.What I liked:I loved how the authors continued to update us on the other couples in the book. I love Richard Connor Cobalt so having his crazy funny sense of humor in this book was great. It was also wonderful to keep up with Lil and Lo and see what was going on with those two. I enjoy how this series although about sisters they are all three very unique and have their own lives, faults and wants. The authors do a really good job at showing this growing sister bond between the Calloway girls while also allowing them to have their own personalities.What I didn't care for as much:And basically why this book only got a STRONG 4 star rating from me.Unlike the other stories in the Addicted seres I did not feel like Ryke and Daisy stood out in their own book. Hothouse was supose to focus on their relationship but I felt like there were so many outside forces that the bond/love that these two share is there but I didn't feel it. When the two enemies Connor and Rose became one even as much as they tried to deny it, we as readers could feel it. When Lilly was out with other guys and Lo was being a mess at the end of the day in their dysfunction you could not deny their love.Now in Kiss the Sky the sexual tension between Ryke and Daisy was STRONG wow I could feel it. So I just KNEW Hothouse was going to be a ride. But other than the motorcycles that bang bang pow that I was expecting to feel between Ryke and Daisy i just didn't. Yes their together, have amazing HOT sex and love each other but outside of reading it on my ipad I didn't feel it. Every time there was an opportunity to expand and show how real their love/connection was it would be short changed by something going on between another character/relatiosnhip in the book.Would I recommend this book (series):YES The Addicted Series by Krista & Becca Ritchie so far is my favorite read of 2014. If that doesn't tell you READ ME I dont know what else will. Even though Hothouse didnt get a full 5 rating from me. It is still a good read and I am probably just being too nit picky. I am so excited to continue reading this series!-JuewelzSMIBookClub.com

Ahhh! Ryke? *swooooon!* I've been obsessed with these characters since the first Addicted novel and I'm so glad that Krista and Becca give us the opportunity to get in the other characters heads in the spinoff series. These novels are so engaging and emotional, it's nearly impossible to put them down until you've read every word. Highly recommend!

OMG! I have been waiting NOT so patiently for Ryke ans Daisy' s story. Krista and Becca did not disappoint with this one. I absolutely fell in love with along with Daisy and Ryke. Can't wait for more!!!

Fix You is the first part of Bash and Olivia's story in Christine Bell's new McDaniels Brothers series. This is the first of three parts for Bash and Olivia, and I thought it was a great way to start the series. I am already looking forward to getting more of these characters and can't wait to see what happens next. I must admit that I am not a huge fan of these short stories and serials because I am always left wanting more and I hate waiting. That being said though, this story was definitely worth the read and I am really glad that I took a chance on this one. I will just have to try and be patient as I wait to find out what happens next.At first glance, Olivia's life looks perfect. She is attending college at a good school, she comes from a well off family, and she is dating a boy she has known for years and was friends with before. But the truth is her family is struggling to make their mortgage payments and she knows that they are hiding something from her. Also, her boyfriend Andy has been drinking more and has been angry a lot lately. When she goes to a bar before spring break with Andy and her friend Echo, she ends up falling and is caught by a handsome bar employee. The attraction between them is instant and both of them feel drawn to each other. But Olivia's boyfriend Andy sees the whole thing and it sets him off. Sebastian (Bash) rushes in to save her from Andy's temper before he gives her a beating that he is on the verge of. When Olivia decides to stay home from the spring break trip to Cabo that Andy and Echo are going on, she goes to the bar to apologize to Bash. Both of them feel the connection, but with so many things standing in their way they know the best thing to do is to walk away. But when you feel a connection that strong it isn't always that simple.I really liked Bash. He was such a great guy. Strong and protective, and willing to stand up for a girl he didn't know because it was the right thing to do. He knew that there would be consequences, and even when it ended up hurting him he still felt like he had done the right thing. He also continued to talk to Olivia and help her despite knowing that he should walk away for both of them. I liked that he was willing to help teach her how to protect herself and that he was always looking out for her. Olivia was smart and she was really kind. She felt so bad for how things had played out with Bash for his helping her and she tried to make things right. She also tried to see the best in Andy, and believed that because of their friendship she could try to get him the help he needed. I really liked her quirky awkwardness and the fact that she tended to ramble on while trying to talk to Bash. It was pretty funny and kind of adorable. I felt like she was so real and that I could relate to her because she seemed like just a cool girl that you would want to hang out with. I loved her and Bash together, and they had so much chemistry right from the start. You could really feel the tension between them and it was clear that it was only a matter of time before things exploded between them.Overall, I thought that this was a really great way to start the series and I enjoyed reading it despite it's short length. I liked Bash and Olivia a lot and I also thought that Bash's brother Matty was great as well. I am really looking forward to getting to know him better also. I did think that there was a lot of obstacles stacked against these two and I really hope that Andy gets what he deserves. I couldn't stand his character right from the start and he ended up being even worse than I had imagined. I liked that this story gave us both Bash's and Olivia's POVs. It was nice to see how both of them were thinking and feeling and I think it really gave the story depth considering the length. I feel like we already know Bash and Olivia really well even though we have just scratched the surface with them. I can't wait to read more in this series, and I think that Christine Bell has done a great job with introducing these characters. I recommend checking this one out if you are a fan of NA reads and are looking for something different. Luckily, the next installment isn't too far off because I need to see where Bell will take the story next!**Complimentary Copy provided by Author**
summary: Great series starter! I really liked Bash and Olivia and look forward to seeing where Christine Bell takes them!

reviewText: You should probably take my review at face value. There's a few things I probably did differently than you.Number 1, first and foremost, I'm a HUGE Christine Bell Fan. I've officially read everything she has released. I love her writing style and because of this I'm bound to NOT hate this book.Number 2 (and probably most importantly) I waited until the entire 3 book series was released. Then I downloaded Book One for Free, Book Two for $2.41 (ish) and Book Three for $.99That makes my entire purchase $3.40 which is, if you ask me, a VERY decent price for 250+ pages.Yes this is a series. No you probably don't like waiting. So don't. Don't start reading until all the books are released.The gripes about serials isn't so much about the money and more about how readers don't like waiting. I get you. I don't like waiting either.Getting into the actual review....I really enjoyed this story. A LOT actually. It fleshed out over the course of three books and yes, if you read them as standalones, the story would probably stink. But I didn't and I really enjoyed it. I really enjoyed Bash & Olivia. The tensions between them was very real. The conflict between Olivia and Andy got to me on a core level. I know what abusive relationships look like and Christine wrote this one spot on.And I really really loved Bash. I'm not one for book boyfriends... but abs of steel and the ability to hold his own in a street fight? Yes please.I feel like Christine writes so many romance novels they should start to sound the same. But they don't. She has this magical ability to make each book unique to the core and I love that about her writing.I DID have a few gripes that make this 4 stars instead of five.1. Editing. OMG. What happened? There were a TON of errors in these books. A lot of repeated words. Maybe an upload error? I don't know.. but it was pretty standard across all three books.2. The ending. I felt the ending was a BIT rushed and the fact that I needed to read the intro to Matty's story to get what had REALLY happened kind of through me. But I'm holding out judgement because I feel like the next story could probably fill in a good amount of holes.3. I wasn't sure about the character development. I finished the series feeling a little bit like I didn't know them well enough. Or maybe it's because I wanted to know them more. Maybe I didn't want it to end. I was up until 4am reading these and it's possible I was a bit loopy.NOTE: I'm posting the same review across all three books, since my review is about all three at once.
summary: I really enjoyed it, even though I waited to start until the entire 3 books were complete.

reviewText: This series is  a definite must!!! I had all three books read in under a day I couldn't put them down...they pull you in and that's all you can think about is what going to happen on the next page!!! I would highly recommend the series to any one who loves a good steamy romance read!!!

The book series was great always keeping the readers on their toes, but the ending was short and abrupt. The ending destroyed the book for me. I hate for paying and taking the time to read all the books to get to a disappointing ending.

Obsessed Part Three is the continuation of the saga between Jax and Ivy.  I liked the story.  I wish that the book would have been sold as a whole unit as opposed to three shorts.  After reading all of the stories I liked the relationship between Jax and Ivy.  True Jax is a little controlling, but the author was able to convey a softer side of Jax, especially in this last installment.  Overall the book was a little like a kiddie rollercoaster ride.  There were twists and turns, but none where too severe.  I do feel like Ivy was overreacting a little towards the end.  I mean the girl had forgave him for much worse and she gets upset that he bought the company that was showing her work so that she doesn’t lose her source of income.  Jax has done much worse.  I also like that Ivy finds her back bone in this story.  She decides that she is going to put her “big girl panties” on and get what she wants and deserves.  The story doesn’t always go as expected, but it was very entertaining and I would and have recommended it to a friend.  The sex is hot, the drama does get to be a little much, but only a little.  In conclusion, I would want to read more about this couple and intend to read Still Obsessed.

I liked the story, a lot, but I wish it had been drawn out more. I mean what happened to Mark? What happened to Liz? What happened to Brooke? That little tidbit resolved itself too easily. I wanted to see people pay. That's one of the greatest features of a romance where someone has been wronged. Was Mark only coming back because of shares, or did he feel remorse? This story was good, but it could have been great. It could have been hotter too.
such a great, complicated, romantic, love story... I truly enjoyed every book. I stayed up all night pretty much reading.. there is remarkable cliffhangers so make sure to have the next book ready..
I really enjoyed enjoyed this series... kept me glued to it from the beginning. Ivy and Jax had great chemistry, awesome love and it was a good story. Loved it.

OMG!! What a rollercoaster read! I could not put it down!!!!Men, conniving sons of biatches! Betrayal and secrets. Poor Ivy.... Like one cheating jerk and a back stabbing best friend wasn't enough, there's worse from Jax???..... or maybe not! An incriminating flash-drive that speaks of betrayals, a confession of illegal activity that can change who actually runs the company, Jax or deceitful Mark either that would leave Ivy with nothing... or maybe not!  Jax may actually be the knight that has been protecting Ivy and rescues her. And perhaps when he said " all I am and do is for you" he actually meant it and Ivy can still get her happy ending and love ever lasting.  Excellent, excellent read, now just sorry I read it too fast! =0(
This series, "Obsessed" is great! I love the characters, well not mark, but the rest are great. I also read "Exposed"  Deborah is a great writer and I hope to read read more of books.

This book is packed with pure golden dating advice on why and how to snag a redhead. Concise and to the point, it's the kind of stuff you should be reading before a date with a redhead just to get into the right frame or mindset. I personally have a little mental routine before I go out for the first time. Early dates can be intimidating and having the right mindset always helps me feel comfortable. I can be myself and focus on my date. I've already added the first part of the book to my pre-date routine with great results. David Woolf (Author) keeps this book an entertaining read throughout.
summary: David Woolf (Author) keeps this book an entertaining read throughout.

reviewText: I absolutely loved this book.  Reading it was almost like watching a movie.  That’s how descriptive the author’s writing is.  You almost feel as if you are in New York City and walking the halls of the high school where the story takes place.  The relationship between Kaitlyn and Will is so incredibly passionate and full of angst.  You will find yourself rooting for this couple to find their peace amidst the chaos, and hoping that they will get their happily ever after.  I loved the supporting characters as well.  The writer does a great job of creating intriguing characters that you want to learn more about.  Loved the book, was very satisfied with the ending, and overall recommend it to anyone looking for a passionate, forbidden, and highly emotional love story!
summary: Loved this book!  A must read!!!

reviewText: Jayne has written another very very good book. I loved how she showed how Bryce and Kaelyn were still in love with each other despite the time away from each other. I also liked how she showed that being rich doesn't mean that you are treated right. I would recommend this book to anyone.

Bryce "Rebel" has hidden his past from his Hot Rods family, afraid that they'd reject him if they found out the truth, but with the arrival of Kaelyn it becomes clear that the secret is out . . . he'd walked away from a life of privilege to save the girl he loved, but now that he has a second chance with Kae he doesn't plan to squander it. Great story of two people separated since their teens, getting back together and making up for lost time. I liked Kae's nonjudgemental, adventurous spirit and it was interesting to see Rebel struggle with reconciling his ideas about who he thought the girl he'd known was and who the woman in front of him was today. Great story and I'm really looking forward to Meep and Barracuda's story, I wish it was next, but I'm sure Swinger's will be good too (Swinger Style, due out June 2014)!

Tony is a man that has a burning passion for leadership and building into the lives of others. His insight, and intuition are valuable assets as he provides this straightforward step by step guide to increase your influence with others intentionally.
Tony's book is like a stick of dynamite; a small package but full of powerful wisdom. Concise and to the point for any seasoned leader an great reminder; for any wannabe leader an excellent how to.

I have had a construction crew I have worked with for nearly 10 years now. Last year, a good family friend, mentor to me, passed away and his family asked me if I could help managing his construction crew until they find a permanent supervisor. I was bouncing around, reading motivational books, my guys in my crew are motivated daily, I really wasn't for sure about my abilities to motivate a new crew.This book was one of the ones I decided to try. I have a MBA and Engineering degree. A lot of this is based on what I learned in Business Management classes, but I'm giving it four stars because it, if nothing else, inspired me to inspire the new crew (in a tragic time at that). I needed that positive push more than any more "proven" methods. This book will give you a positive feeling towards leading people. It does little else, but I can at least tell you these methods work. It's a nice, short read. I would recommend it for those who have already been in leadership positions and are about to take on leading a new group of people. It's a good refresher to get your motivational skills up to where you need them.
summary: A Cliff Notes version of Business Management

reviewText: I love my slow cooker and when I found this cookbook, I couldn't resist trying out these recipes.  I am a big fan of lamb so the leg of lamb recipe won't disappoint.  The Party Menu and Shopping List at the end of the book is also a big help when going grocery shopping for the menu.
summary: Great meat recipes for the slow cooker

reviewText: Audrey returns home to reconnect with her father whom she hasn't seen since her mother left him when she was a child. Audreys father is the president of a local MC and they reconnect while his club is in the midst of a turf war with a rival MC, which Vince belongs to. Hence, this story being likened to Romeo and Juliet in its plot description. This could be compared to Shakespeare's classic-but it probably shouldn't be. Other than belonging to rival clubs there is no comparison. The book wasn't thrilling or particularly romantic to me, in my opinion the story falls flat. The author was unable to hold my attention, and I fell asleep in the middle of the day while reading this book. Maybe I have read too many MC romances and it just takes more to interest me now, but in any case the descriptions never came to life in my mind like a good book does-I didn't have that cinematic sense in my head as I read allowing me to picture the action. The character development was unequal and left me wanting more. The POV's came across as if they were both from the feminine perspective. This book wasn't memorable, I won't be thinking of it or any plot twists. The book didn't pull any deep emotions of pleasure or anger from me. (I just finished Killer and even though it wasn't Sam Crescent's best book to date, at least I felt despair, or anger-Born to Ride left me with an empty annoyance at what I felt was a waste of an afternoon and money.) I'm sorry to leave such a harsh review, but truthfully I won't be following this author any further.

I've been an organic gardener for decades and this is a wonderful book if you've been at it for years or if you're just starting out. Not  too much info but provides all you need for a quick understanding of what you need.

An easy, clear read with lots of remedies for all your common garden plants and all those common garden pests.  Suggestions for ridding your garden of pests are items you have around your home - ie, flour, beer, to mixing in plants like marigolds or cilantro in your garden.  I  just read this book and already have started selecting my veg. and flowers accordingly, and intend to make this book my first go-to reference book if/ when the pests come marching. Host planting is another great idea -- sacrificing one plant to save another variety.  Chemicals are not an option.  I highly recommend this book to my gardening friends.

I am a type 2 diabetic. I have been using the Paleo diet for a year now. The weight loss does happen. My blood sugar is stable and I have been able to cut my medication in half. It was hard at first to give up bread, but I found a good recipe for muffins made of almond flour, coconut flour and zucchini with eggs and dried blueberries, cranberries, and mulberries on the Internet. This book had so many great ideas for other meals! I was missing hummus on crunchy bread. This book has a very good almond flour cracker recipe, and a tasty zucchini hummus recipe. I was lucky to get it for free, but will buy it for a friend as it is one of the better Paleo recipe books I've read.
I love this series so far. It is really hard to put down. I look forward to reading more. So many loose ends that have such amazing possibilities.
Another winner from holly Kelly...they get better and better. I hope she continues to write more for this series. A fun read.

This is a fantastic book for busy families that don't always have time to cook a good meal, but also don't want to go the fast food route. Great recipes and tips that can give you more quality time with your family by not spending all evening in the kitchen cooking. And they taste great too! Highly recommended.

The second in the series, London Dreaming follows Lucy as she attempts to make her impossible-to-please father happy. Lucy is widely regarded as lovely, sweet, and charming, which makes her the perfect director of charitable giving of her family's bank. There's just one tiny problem- her father's biggest competitor somehow wrangled a spot as co-chair with Lucy to the biggest charitable event of the year... And he is bound and determined to destroy her father's company. Lucy is not going down without a fight, though! Sparks fly, and not just in anger, either. In this novel, they both discover new things about themselves and each other, which might just change everything. Five out of five stars for this easy read!

I truly enjoyed the book, I can't wait for the next installment.  I was  a little disappointed in Evan, when he first met Jess he was all alpha male, strong and powerful and then he turn to be indecisive and any time things got a little difficult he would give up quickly and behave like a spoiled child.  I thought Mikael Evan's brother was a cruel jerk but he's definitely was winning my approval.  Any way I really enjoyed the story and recommend the book.  Once you star reading, you can't put it down..
I enjoyed this first book but I am unsure if I like how it ended, or more to the point the direction it seems to be going in. I will read the second book and see.
This book was great. Its an emotional book and you wont be able to put it down.
If you read any of Jennifer Foor you will love them. She is a great author and you will lover her books.

Seumas Gallacher is a well-known authority in the indie social media circles, in addition to his thriller novels.He has written one of the most concise step by step guides to self-publishing sales success that I have ever read.  And I have read a lot.  I wish that I had read this a year ago.Gallacher walks the reader in a thoughtful manner through the stages of campaigns that are essential to publishing and branding.  He hits on the core survival programs such as Kindle, WordPress blogging, Twitter (and tweet management tools), Facebook, LinkedIn, Goodreads, etc.As a successful self-publisher, blogger, and tweeter, Seumas practices what he preaches and has been acknowledged for doing so through his uptake and followership.The guide is an inexpensive no-brainer manual for going out into the world for newbies.  Loved it!
summary: Best Indie Guide to Self-publishing Marketing and Sales

reviewText: The book has plenty of useful advice on juicing that a complete beginner will find very helpful. I liked the common fruits and vegetables used for juicing section, where the author listed the most popular fruits and veggies used for juicing and their benefits, which I found very interesting. I learned a lot about what each fruit contains and how it helps the body.The recipes are ok, even though some of them sound a bit strange. One particular recipe calls for a whole lemon, peel included. Now, the peel is very bitter, so I doubt this particular juice will be drinkable. I might be mistaking, though, I didn't try the recipe. I will try it, and update the review should this not be true.Another thing I found to be faulty was the part where the author states that "You may not necessarily need a juicing machine in order to make juice. You can use a blender for most whole pieces of fruit and vegetables so that you can keep the fiber". Well, that is no longer a juice, it is a smoothie, which is a different thing altogether.All in all, this is a good book, good starting point for a beginner. Are there other juicing books, catered to beginners, that are better than this one? Sure. But for me, if I learn at least one new thing out of a book, it's well worth the purchase. And there are plenty of things to learn from this little guide.
summary: Good book on juicing, with minor errors.

reviewText: What I like best about this author is the character interaction.  It was again a fast read. Simple  and direct little story. Three stars means "good enough". Five would mead that I would buy the hard back. Four would be wow.
I enjoyed that the recipes included a wide variety of vegetables in the dish and that the cookbook was well laid out.

As a very protective mother, I have had re-occurring night terrors that my children are falling. In reality I actually leap out of bed frantically trying to save them. I've hurt myself a few times (and the husband) while trying to "save" them. This has been going on for two years now and there was no sign of them getting better. This book has excellent techniques that I'm using and I'm learning to gain control over these dreams. They're terrifying, dangerous, and becoming a thing of my past. I highly recommend this book to help in all aspects of lucid dreaming.
summary: Helped me with my night terrors

reviewText: In "A Hood Affair" Part 3. Loyalty is very important when your a player in the game of "Life".  Betrayal can't ever hide it's ugly head behind the mask of a life-long friendship.

Loved this book Juicing Recipes! I am a big juicer and love trying out new flavor and juices, so this book was a great choice for me! I love also though that it provides you with information about Juicing, such as why to Juice, and super foods to juice for increased weight loss! I would recommend this book to beginner juicers, and juicing Pro's!

This book was such a joy to read, I'm going to keep it as reference whenever I need a refresher. This book definitely explains how you can take action in stuff that you're procrastinating on. You'll definitely see the personal transformation in your life.We should all strive for self-mastery and this book will definitely get you on the way to achieve that. I'll definitely reread this book soon.

My credit has been really bad for years. I have screened my phone calls to avoid creditors and stashed overdue notices in a drawer in a panic (out of sight, out of mind). My fiancé have been talking about moving from our two-bedroom townhome into a larger house but it has not been an option because my credit score is so low. This book has given me hope that I will be able to repair my damaged credit and move into a new house within the next few years. This book gives detailed, step by step instructions on how to repair your credit and I would recommend it to anyone who panics whenever the phone rings.
summary: I Now Have Hope that We’ll be Able to Get a Bigger House

reviewText: This was well written and had good quality advice in it, I feel its time to tackle my credit problems once and for all, this book has helped me to get started, I encourage anyone who has ducked tackling credit to take the step you will be glad you did.

Personal Growth and Inspiration is a great book full of tons of information. Lots of wonderful of advice and ideas.I feel that after reading this book I have the tools to accomplish anything I want in life. I would read this book if I were you, you won't regret it!
summary: Wonderful book to help you in life

reviewText: When I sw this book, I immediately wanted it. I have always thought of myself as a positive, helpful person, but I always thought I could do better. My husband asks me all the time how I get people to like me so quickly, and it is so hard to explain it to him, but Ms Schnieder did a great job laying things out in a concise, easy to understand way. The bullet points were very helpful, and she gives a lot of great ways to get started on being a positive influence, and how to better interact with people. Definitely a must read book for anyone in things like customer service or sales, as well as everyday life interactions with new people. I am having my husband read this as we speak to get him started on better interacting with other people. A five star read as far as I am concerned.

The Alphas is very appealing to all canine fanatics, but it also embodies a uniquely human element that draws the reader into the story line as they invest in the character's journey.  While beautiful descriptions of animals abound,  this book is at its heart a tale of adventure.The main character,  Carra is drawn into a situation that is more corrupt and dangerous than she ever imagined. The theft of her beloved pet and show dog years earlier was dismissed as a minor crime.  It never seemed minor to her!  The story reveals the true reasons her dog was taken.  When the eccentric dog breeder who bred  her long-lost  dog is killed, she discovers that the estate and its remaining dogs are left to her care and discretion.  This is only the beginning of the strange pattern of events that unfold from two seemingly unrelated crimes!Carra learns more about the show dogs she has adored, and she encounters a plethora of interesting and sometimes dangerous characters as she attempts to solve a series of crimes involving the dogs that will lead her to a motive that nobody, especially her saw coming.  I loved the character's willingness to follow the clues left behind by the dead dog breeder out of respect and reverence for the dog that had been taken from her.I particularly liked the elements of telepathy affecting pack mentality and the splash of science fiction that lends credence to the trilogy series that follows this book.This book is sure to please animal lovers and mystery lovers alike!
summary: Perfect for Canine or Mystery Lovers!

reviewText: I liked the first book of this series.  I read it because it was written by Rachel and i will read anything she writes.  But this second book...wow.  I mean just wow.  The Fall actually made me like The Rush better! This one gets more into the mythology that I think was missing from the first book, but now makes sense that it wasnt in it.  I cannot wait for The Heart!!
Ryder and ivy are perfect in their love for each other! The whole time your holding your breath praying there is a way for them to make it!

I usually leave my reviews on good reads. I absolutely adore this series. I love the infusion of Greek mythology in modern day. Ivy is one of my favorite characters. She's flawed, lives in a world if someone else's making and is trying to right it with the help of a yummy sidekick Ryder.

I love the characters and the story it self but there are some editing problems that make it hard to understand at time and leave sentences incomplete. The lovers fight is REALLY ridiculous and some other issues are accepted WAY to easily and some are just far fetched but overall it's a really good read and I look forward to the next book. I would recommend this book to anyone over 18 who likes mythology and steamy sex. ENJOY!
I really enjoyed this story. It was a little choppy at times but not enough to lower the rating. I recommend this book and will try other books by this author.
summary: A great start to a good story!

reviewText: nice story hope there is a part two i liked the couples want to know how they're doing and the

A very intense but beautiful story! I loved how Dimitri and Columbia came from 2 different worlds and had their own different kinds of scars but was able to come together and save each other. Beautifully written! There are some very dark parts but it all comes together to create an amazing story!! Giving it 5 stars! Jaden Wilkes is awesome!!! : )

I did enjoy The Beast and loved Dimitri. I was enjoying the story up until about two thirds of the way through it and then I felt a bit like it was rushed after that. I still read on and I did like the book but for me personally it kind of lost the build up to that point and seemed like it was a bit of an anti climax after that.

I sure was surprised by this book. First of all it is dark but not as dark and graphic as some reviewers are making it out to be.  The hero is mean, violent and almost unlikable until... he changes. But I can't tell you about that.  The heroine has had a horrible life and is slightly mousy until... she changes.  But I can't tell you about that, either!  No spoilers for you!This is a very interesting, well written story.  It is a totally different type of love story.  It is slick and sucks you in even as you fight it tooth and nail because, like the heroine you know you aren't supposed to like it.  And like her, you do.  Go into this knowing it is dark, different and unusual.  It really isn't a BAD dark.  I'd say more like dark-light but phew.  I think if you can get past the beginning where he's mean, you will see why it is a great story and will also like it!It flows swiftly and before you know it, you're done.  So you almost - almost - wish it were a cliffhanger so you can learn more about them growing and learning to love in their type of normal.  Alas, it is not; it is a standalone.  So I say to the author - please give us more of their story.  It has so many directions it could go.  It is an amazing - albeit strange, unusual, abnormal compared to most - love story!  I don't know why, but I really liked it!!
summary: Dark and Darker, Why do I like it??

reviewText: Both suffered unspeakable abuse as kids and adult, not surprised the reality or normal is so different for them.  Hopefully there will be a book 2.
summary: He pulled her in to the dark side, their own HEA!

reviewText: I am always amazed by the new story lines Austen authors come up with. This one does not disappoint; the scenes in France and later in London add drama and depth to our understanding of these timeless characters. Well done, Ms Kincaid; I look forward to your next book.
love book 3. the story of the youngest brother and the serial killer out to get him. romance with a past love found.

This book is another example of Lindsay's skill at world building. Even from the start of the book this new world seems intriguing and natural and makes the reader want to know more. The two main characters are unique and well developed, and it becomes easy to care about them. The plot moves quickly, making this a solid page turner that ends far too quickly. At the end the story was wrapped up, but I feel like she purposely left some ambiguity there, leaving the possibility of sequels. Though not as steampunk as her Flash Gold novellas, I thoroughly enjoyed this story and thought it was one of her best non Emperor's Edge novels.

I was totally hooked after the first paragraph in the first chapter,the rest of the adventure was even better. If you regularly read any of Lindsay' s books (May I call you Lindsay?) I won't go into a long narrative of just how exciting this is.....it is exciting and just a bit erotic in a few spots....did I say a bit? Okay, a lot!Can't wait to get the next adventure of these two warriors.

As much as the Flashgold chronicles and that's saying a lot. She is rapidly becoming one of my favorites to the extent that I will read anything she writes.However, this novella gave me pause when I saw it described as a romance. I was going to skip it but decided to try a few chapters and I was hooked. By my definition, it is not a romance work though I would be hard pressed to define what that encompasses. Phew !It has a few steamy scenes, no pun intended, and it almost goes past my limit, but doesn't .I sure wish it were longer or had a prequel or sequel.How could I ever begin to doubt her ?Quick reading with characters you can love and hate and snappy dialogue which is what I use to judge a book.Give it a try.Lol, I liked it so much that by accident I wound up with 2 copies. So there.George
Having read some of your other books I was happy to find another book where you have created a new and interesting world!
I enjoyed this book mostly, but just kind of dragged for me in places.  Did want to see "who did it".  Was basically an OK book for me.
I liked the book until the ending. I saw what was coming and everything got tied up too neatly, in "Hollywood" fashion. I still would recommend it.

Jill Stoking is an amazing and resourceful woman, and her book 'Joan's Descent into Alzheimer's' is testament to that fact.Jill's mother Joan is diagnosed with Alzheimer's and quickly becomes unable to cope with everyday life. Jill finds herself dedicating more and more time to her mother, despite battling problems in her own life. Joan's personality disintegrates before Jill's eyes leaving a crippled body and a tortured soul, as Jill constantly battles with care services.Her solution is radical, brave and demonstrates a level of caring, above and beyond that of a mother daughter relationship.Compulsory reading for health professionals and carers alike.
summary: A beautifully written memoir, that will stay with you long after you finish reading it.

reviewText: Good story

“Tainted Touch” is a well-written book full of witty dialogue, which is guaranteed to make you laugh out loud. It's also a book of contradictions. There are humorous lines almost every other page, but these are balanced by some serious angst. The first half of the book is appropriate for a Young Adult audience as there is tremendous drama over holding hands and the first kiss, while the second half of the book includes several, explicit sex scenes. Much of the book focuses on the romance between Cait and Art, but a literary subplot contemplating the meaning of life is also included. Sometimes the overly complex plots gets in it's own way, but overall “Tainted Touch” is a fun, rewarding read.The heroine, Cait, describes herself as “more conflicted than your average bag of snakes” and that's a good description. She was mentally abused by her ex-boyfriend whom she hilariously describes as a “deluded scrotclown”. The scars linger and effect her ability to not only form new relationships, but even to simply touch other people. Cait is supported by a wonderful cast of friends who add lots of life and laughs to the story. It's easy to sympathize with her struggles, while simultaneously rooting for her to get her head out of her ass.The plot doesn't fall victim to the usual cliches, and Cait's issues with self worth seem all too real. However, the books is a bit slow, and seems longer than the advertised 336 pages. At one point Cait says, “We've spent so long on the cusp of kissing that sometimes, I forget that we haven't.” I wanted to jump up and down and yell “Yes, I know. Now get on with it already!”  The author was making a point about Cait having trouble being touched, but the build up definitely drug on too long. The sex scenes were good once we finally got to them, but the explicit language was like a slap upside the head with a wet flounder because it was such an abrupt change from the page after page of earlier turmoil over even touching lips.The hero, Fist Candy - also known as Art, is a mystery for much of the book. He's the hot, new massage therapist whom Cait lusts after at work. When he returns her interest, she's shocked. Art has his own demons though, and his difficult history is revealed as their romance progresses. He's a true blue kind of guy though, and definitely qualifies as an upgrade in the boyfriend department.This review would not be complete without mentioning the cake. It's practically a character in the book. Most of the characters are students, and while their world should revolve around studying, it mostly revolves around cake and Instagram. Vanilla, chocolate, and everything in between are represented. If you make it through this book without falling victim to a cupcake, you're a better woman than I. Be prepared.

I have had sleep apnea for a long time now. I never thought there was anything I could do about it, but this book has shown otherwise.  A very helpful book that I would recommend to anyone with this condition!
Very well written,  hooked me from the beginning, hope to read similar books by this author in the future.  One sit read
awesome as always. Cant wait for the other books to see what happens to the other characters A must read

Actually, I think this book deserves a 4.5 rating. I was gaping in awe by the end. I don't know how the author manages to leave me shocked and yearning for more each time. After the first book, I didn't even waste a second to find the second book ( Poison's Kiss) on Amazon and buy it with just a tap of my thumb. Although at times I was a little annoyed and frustrated with Alyssa and her two beus, that never stopped me from reading, if anything it forced me to continue on. The drama, the romance, the action, and the intrigue that comes along when reading paranormal stories, with their wonderful details of the supernatural, held me fixated to my phone for much too long. I loved the twists and the little clues the author leaves for the reader, just enough for them to suspect something but not enough to fully kill the suspense since we don't know what's going to happen or when. And even when it does get obvious, there's still a little surprise. I couldn't put down this book ( or the first one), and I can't wait for the next one.
I hope you enjoy this series as much as I do because I couldn't put them down. i love a good romance but this has it all. Can't wait for the next to come out.

Today we often find ourselves slapping makeup on to cover up our horrible skin (so what we always think). Of course, we are doing nothing but covering our insecurities and of course making our skin worse (ironic). Mr. Branden does a fabulous job explaining exactly how our skin works over time, how to take care of our skin, and how to improve our skin with many procedures. The best part of the read for me was the breakdown  of skin over ages (time periods), i found this too be great as often we never really look at things this way on our skin care. Although, this was my favorite part the author does a great job with other parts of skin discussion in the book. Recommend this book!
summary: Everyone wants tips on how to improve our skin! Its all inside!

reviewText: This was non-stop action from start to finish.  I love that this author has a real plot with believable (as much as they can be) solutions.  Others are also finding their true mates, and falling in love. Just like us normal folks.  Angus Has also found real family, not just his pack.  This series just gets better and better, hope it's not over yet.

I received this book as a gift in return for a honest review.Ella likes to stay on the ranch and work but her father wants her to settle down and get married. So she decides to put an ad on the board at the local bar, advertising for a man who she can have plenty of "spark" with. In Cam, a newcomer, she certainly has that and more! This is a lovely, easy to read, story which keeps your interest all the way to the end of the story. I didn't want to put it down! Well done! This author is on my to-read list now!

In What a Bride Wants by Kelly Hunter, despite, or maybe because of, the family wealth, Ella works on the family ranch with her father. Her mother died years ago so it's just been Ella and her father, who has decided it's time Ella settled down and found a husband. Ella would like nothing more to find her true love, but so far she has found no one who sees beyond the family wealth to Ella.Until Sawyer. Perceived as the local drifter, there is a lot more to Sawyer than what meets the eye. What begins as a lark between Ella and her father to find a husband for her, soon morphs into something much more meaningful when Ella gets together with Sawyer. The sizzle is hot, the attraction immediate, and soon the two of them are getting to know each other very well. Both of them are falling hard for each otherSawyer's family has a skeleton in their closet though, and it's one of the reasons he has been afraid to commit, afraid to love anyone. Will this time prove differently though? When all is out in the open and needs dealt with, will Sawyer and Ella's new relationship survive it?I loved this novella by Kelly Hunter! Written with a perfect infusion of romance, humor, and a little suspense, Kelly draws you in to Ella and Sawyer's story and makes you hope they will have a happily ever after. The characters are strong and the feelings are real. Ella is strong, independent and she likes to be in control. Sawyer could be the perfect match for her...especially once she gets below the surface. Sawyer is open, he's not offering a lot of information up about himself and his past, but he's not hiding it either. He too wants acceptance for who he is, not what he has or what he's come from. The chemistry between the two of them is great and they have a lot of fun together.I'd recommend What a Bride Wants to any romance reader looking for a fast paced, fun, love at first sight romance.

Sawyer, a hot new Aussie bartender, answers an ad for the perfect lover.  Ella reveals what she is really looking for is lust.  After some playful banter and a few dates they become inseperatable.  As they get to know each other will that lust turn into love or will Sawyer's past ruin everything?
summary: What A Bride Wants by Kelly Hunter

reviewText: Ella would be happy and get married like her Daddy wants, but she wants a spark in her marriage and the men Daddy sets her up with don't have it.  Of course, she didn't think that her father would actually put an ad in the personals when she sort of dared him to, but he did.  Ella wasn't about to let his ad stand on its own in the local bar, so she put one up of her own.  Instead of a 'docile husband,' she wants a lover.  Enter Sawyer, the HOT aussie drifter.I loved these two.  Ella is bold and sweet and Sawyer is HOT and scared of what he feels.  I loved watching these two get to know each other and fall in love.  There is a confrontation between Sawyer and his criminal brother, but the romance/love betweeen these two carries the story.Just one question, what happens next?
summary: Who doesn't want a SPARK in their romantic relationships?

reviewText: The main 'hero' bored me to tears, he was no where NEAR an Alpha status. Long drawn out plot, I couldn't keep track of. Seriously wanted to punch the guy.

Four books for $2.99 is great but when they of this quality it's even better.  Never read any of these until I found the set and now I'm hooked.  So glad I found this  and I'll be looking for more from Adriana Hunter.  Don't pass this up.
summary: Great Deal on a Great Collection.

reviewText: Great story line, makes you want more...lots of twist and turns can't wait for next book!! Great Job highly recommend
I was so worked up over this book. I had a large book hangover after this one. I was so torn about how I wanted this to end
summary: So good but oh so frustrating

reviewText: ***SPOILERS***4  Stars“Knockout” is a truly unique take on a fighter, bad boy novel.  Kellen Coulter has grown up poor and has had a rough upbringing.  He’s a boxer but he also gets into street fights venting his anger that has been a part of his life for as long as he can remember. After being charged with Assault his attorney, Dan Monroe, takes him under his wing because he sees something of himself in Kellen.  Dan had grown up “on the wrong side of the tracks” himself but he worked his way up in life and through college and became a success and he wants to help young boys in similar situations.  So Dan has taken Kellen’s case pro Bono.  He believes that with help Kellen can stay out of trouble and make something of his life.Kellen begins to spend a lot of time at the Monroe household.  He quits getting into trouble with street fights and sticks to his passion, boxing…and he’s very good at it.  Dan and his wife Karen treat Kellen like a son.  The first time Kellen comes to see Dan; Dan isn’t home so Kellen ends up talking with Jenna, Dan’s 13 year old daughter.  They hit it off and end up talking for a while…both comfortable with each other’s company which is unusual for both of them.  But then Kellen meets Laney, Jenna’s older and stunning sister and he becomes attracted to her in a much different way.Kellen doesn’t act on his attraction to Laney because he doesn’t feel like he’s good enough for her.  But after spending a year hanging out with the Monroe family almost daily he finally asks Dan if he can take Laney out.This is the point in the book where things become complicated.  Although Kellen begins dating Laney he is still best friends with Jenna and Jenna is the only person he feels understands him.  Jenna also tries to hide her true feelings for Kellen.  She knows she’s too young to be with Kellen but it still hurts to see him with her sister who Jenna considers to be the ultimate beauty while she thinks of herself as being okay looking but certainly not able to compete with her gorgeous sister.One thing author Tracey Ward does throughout the book is jump ahead through time periods that would be unimportant to this story.  For example, she may go from present day to 3 months later.  I love that she does this because, as the reader, we don’t have to waste time reading filler to get to the time periods that are significant to the storyline.As time goes on Kellen who had been doing well with his life begins to become moody and depressed.  But we don’t really know why.  Ms. Ward keeps us in suspense as to why Kellen has changed when on the outside it appears that everything should be going well.  Kellen has finished college, has a great job and is engaged to Laney.  But there are some things going on behind the scenes that we don’t know about and we are left pondering what is going on.While following the life of Kellen we are also following Jenna’s life.  Jenna goes in a direction with her life that upsets her mom but her dad is happy for her and so is Kellen.  Jenna doesn’t fit into the high class social norm of the rich. She’s independent and real.Now that Jenna is an adult and out on her own she is still best friends with Kellen and I often wondered why Kellen was with Laney instead of Jenna.  But then again how do you break off an engagement with one sister so you can be with the other?  Quite simply…you can’t.But something major happens in Kellen’s life and he begins to re-evaluate everything he’s doing.  Will he finally realize that he doesn’t belong with Laney?  And even if he does realize he doesn’t belong with Laney will he do anything about it?“Knockout” is about learning lessons in life and deciding what to do once those lessons are learned.  Do you make hard decisions or take the easy way out?This is a standalone book…which I LOVE!!!  It also has a HEA.  I highly recommend this book to anybody who likes contemporary romance that is character driven.
summary: A Knockout story with Handsome Hero Kellen!

reviewText: I really enjoyed this story. It covers a time period of approximately ten years, so a lot happens. I love the relationship between Kellan and Jenna. Even though their relationship goes through lots if ups and downs, their love for each other never fades, and that's what makes this story so good. It's the kind of love we all want with someone!There is another book after this but this book does have an HEA. I can't wait to read more about them!

This story teaches young children how to have fun on a rainy day.The overall message is good. I liked the rhymes and the illustrations. But what put me off was the overuse of exclamation marks and a couple of really dark pictures. I believe if the author and illustrator addressed and updated these few issues then this can easily be a 5 star book. I would recommend this to readers who would like a cute short story and are willing to overlook a few editing mishaps.

First book wetted my appetite and continued to do so through the third book, I have not had time to find a fourth.It didn't take long to realize Urth was Earth after some war or other catastrophic event.

Deadly Hunt by Margaret DaleyTess Miller was surprised when a tall dark haired stranger crashed through her front door only to collapse at her feet with a gunshot wound. Shane Burkhart has no idea why someone would be after him. He is a single dad and CEO of DDI. Tess was on much needed vacation from her body guard job but now is guard and nurse over Shane, until she can get him out of her uncles remote cabin. Margaret Daley did a fantastic job bringing the characters to life. I love them and the story line. I highly recommend this book for everyone who enjoys Christian fiction, mystery and romance. I give five stars to Deadly Hunt.

this was a great book. from the beginning it was a page turner. What I like the story had a flow and didn't leave you bore as years went. the ending had a history of what happen with this family.  Please read this you won't be disappointed.

The author has a really good story line but the text needs editing in so far as punctuation is involved. She does a good job of drawing the characters. However, a good editor could show her how to flesh out the story and the characters to make a strong story even more powerful. I give it four stars for the story line. SHEILA HUNTINGTON, author of MORNING GLORY WOMAN.

This book is perfect for all types of people may it be for students, working individuals or for those in a relationship. It distinguishes the stressors and what you can do to change it. I loved the chapter on stress in the workplace because it is highly applicable to me and I can relate to the factors involved.
summary: be stress free and start living your life to the fullest

reviewText: Sable Hunter has done it again.. the 13th book in the Hell Yeah series..This is the story of Kyle and Hanna.. the chemistry between them is electric.. the love scenes oh boy are they HOT !!..I have read every book Sable has written and I have to say this is by far the best.. I have said this before but this book blew me away.. Sable at her very best...Kyle found Hanna..He knew she was something special.. he needed her so much..He  then he lost her..He  searched and searched with the help of his friends.the "Equalizers"..He then found her again.. could he stop her from leaving... he even went to the trouble of learning the message of flowers just for her..Through a terrible misunderstanding she left again...when Kyle found her she had a big surprise for him..How would he react to her and the surprise?? Would she know what she meant to him with a vase of flowers he had for her?.. To find this out read this book.. I will not give the story away I detest spoilers...You will never go wrong ready any of Sable's books.. as an Author SHE ROCKS !! thank you Sable for writing an awesome book I could once again get lost in...

A continuation of the Hell Yeah Series - Book 13Kyle Chancellor - a candidate governor comes from a powerful, wealthy family.Hannah (Anna) Newman Montenegro is an illegal immigrant who sacrifices for the welfare of her family.Bonds of friendships form a powerful brotherhood alliance called the EQUALIZERS of which Kyle is a member.As fate would have it Kyle and Hannah meet - they lose touch but find one another again. Circumstances lead to lost love and reuniting.Kyle and Hannah's love story is that of love that is lost and then found. A story of hope, destiny, and suspense.This quote from Thunderbird says it all in a nutshell  "Separated by circumstance reunited by fate"

Sable Hunter has done it again, another great book in the Hell Yeah Series!! Kyle Chancellor is handsome and sexy, and on his first day home from fighting in Afghanistan, he finds out the reason his girlfriend broke up with him before he enlisted. Devastated, he tries to drown his sorrows, but instead meets a woman, Hannah Montenegro, who is out for a rare night on the town. Hannah has spent her life, living with and helping her family, never taking time for herself. Kyle would like to get to know her better, he feels drawn to her, but due to circumstances beyond his control, at the end of the night, he has no idea how to find her. Kyle and his friends from Seal Team 7, form a group known as the Equalizers, who fight for others who cannot fight for themselves. Kyle, also runs for Governor of the Lone Star state, and the McCoys back him. Kyle, also known as Thunderbird, never gives up on finding Hannah, and when he does it is a long, bumpy road for the two of them. This series just keeps getting better, loaded with romance, love, family, suspense, good times and bad. If you have not started this series yet, what are you waiting for? As for me, I am eagerly awaiting book 14! Thank you, Sable Hunter for such an awesome series!!

The most difficult thing about reading a novel from Sable and Ryan . . . having to take time to eat and sleep. Once I begin I just don't want to put it down until I'm completely finished.Their writing styles blend so well that a reader can't tell who has written what, and I suspect that the things we might think are "obvious" we'd be completely wrong about.Once again, an emotional journey in the Hell Yeah! series that not only reminds us that a love worth having is worth all the struggles, it also addresses issues that are current and relevant, but does it in a way that is not preachy or judgmental, yet definitely informative. While we aren't all living a life in the spotlight like Kyle and Hannah, we all can relate to and appreciate the struggles that they and many face each day.If you are looking for a great read that will touch your heart, mind and soul, "Thunderbird", and the entire Hell Yeah! series is a MUST!!
summary: Another FANTASTIC novel from the writing team of Sable Hunter and Ryan O'Leary!!

reviewText: I like monster stories told from the monster's perspective - "Hey, I just wanted a little snack and now they're all up in my business with pitchforks!" This is a very entertaining story in which a normal kid gets summoned away to be a demon - red skin, horns, tail, and all. Good characters, strong plot and a fun read. There are expositions which I found a bit tedious but they have good information that helps the plot move along later, so don't skip them.Highly recommended. Can't wait for the sequel.
summary: Imagine getting stolen away ... to be a demon slave

reviewText: This book was great. Once again the secondary characters stole the show from the original rook and ronin!  Ford is still my favorite!!  This story was great. It had a lot going on and was more than just a romance which makes me happy!  However it was more about the whole team than it was about Spencer and Ronnie. I didn't mind because it tied up a lot of loose ends!  I would like a novella on the wedding. Can't wait to read Mercs book and Tets book as well, waiting for Sasha's return bc I loved her in Fords book.Let me just say the second epilogue from Number Fives POV was absolutely hysterical and fantastic. I can't wait for more!!  Thanks for a great series. Every book was great. There was no miss so keep them coming!!
I have enjoyed all the books in this series! This one was just as wonderfully written! The characters are so deep and real I just love them all :-) #5 is just to cool I laughed so hard!!
Spencer's book continued the story of the "team".  I really enjoyed this series with Ronin .Ford, Spencer and their ladies. Highly recommend this series.

Man what an amazing story, I was hooked and could not put the  books down but now that I have finished I'm so sad, but I look forward to the next chapter and a new team, number 5 solids AWESOME and I love he has a crush on princess I'm sure just what Spencer will want, if any wait to to see how that one will turn out.
summary: No No No it can't be over!

reviewText: 4.5 Stars. I LOVED this series! The writing was engaging, sexy, steamy, and funny as hell at times. I loved its simplicity and its complexity. Each book had plot twists that kept me guessing and made sure I was never bored. Characters explored love, hate, faith, loyalty, and experienced romance, violence, and even death. Each character had their own bit of crazy or "defect", they weren't perfect and I loved that.This book was the culmination of the 'Rook and Ronin' serious. When all the past cons and lies come back to face the team they must fight to survive. Ronin still has Rook, Ford still has Ashleigh and Kate, and Spencer Shrike has ... no one, because he's keeping a huge secret from Veronica ~ Bombshell ~ Ronnie ~ Vaughn. He's lying to keep her safe. So he's pushing her away from him, putting up pretenses to keep her from getting involved. And it's breaking both of their hearts.I loved the flashbacks of the early days with Spencer and Ronnie:"You will never forget this day, Veronica Vaughn. For the rest of your life, whenever someone asks you what the best day of your life was, this will be in your top three."***"What about the other two?" I ask.***"We haven't made those memories yet, Bomb. But we will."Spencer has so much loyalty to the team and to Veronica that he puts them all before himself. And I got teary-eyed reading about his pain."Because, baby, I love you enough to push you away."Veronica is a feisty character who is very in love with Spencer. Almost to a fault, I think. He doesn't always treat her nicely or with respect, and I wanted her to kick him to the curb many times! I caught myself getting frustrated with her, and felt she almost bordered on pathetic. Not at all like her strong, assured self."See, this is why I need to avoid him at all costs. He deflates me. He sucks all my air out. He collapses me into nothingness."Major s*** comes to town that effects the team. Battles are fought. Love is made. Relationships settled. And I loved it. The wrap up was awesome! And in the end everyone gets there HEA!I just have to say, I am still Team Ford! And I love this quote to him from Spencer."But you're not defective. You're just...a special snowflake."

ok....spencer and the bomb....they annoyed me....but I understood.....and when it ended I wanted more...I understand the drama and the lead up....but being a greedy JA HUSS fan I wanted more...I loved this book, it made me mad, made me cry, made me laugh.  I mean that second epi.....ok I cant wait for stories about the new team.
summary: omg....loved this book, loved this series...

reviewText: First of all, I loved all these books..I loved getting to know Ronin and Rook, I loved Ford an Ash, BUT I FLOVED Spencer and Bomb. He is a caveman and only wants to protect his Bomb by pushing her away. She is only fooled for so long and then she flips. I loved every minute of the suspense of when the other shoe would drop out of this plan. So good!
summary: Can I be on the Team?

reviewText: I have enjoyed reading this series. Once you start you can't stop. Very down to earth situations with friends, love and marriage. The Titles says it all "SEXY". Cant wait for the next book.

Dani you've done it again! I think I'm in love with Oliver;) anyway everyone this is a true love story no spoilers from me but you must read. You will laugh, most likely cry and even more likely be in love with Oliver. So Dani please do share when Sexy Love is expected.
Loved reading about Clare and Oliver's story! Love the secret wedding in Las Vegas. Along with how you still managed to tie in Bea and Daniel and Tilly and Luke. Can't wait for Alexia's story.
All I could say that this story was HOT! HOT! HOT! so read it five stars sexy read you will enjoy it.

reviewerName: Lisa Ruscyczk- Author of the 50 Things to Kno...
reviewText: This book gives many good tips for men and woman to think differently about life.  Boomy makes many good points in this book that are helpful to change the way you think about things.  This book also includes many christian beliefs but is not too scriptural.
summary: Great Book to Change Your Mindset

reviewText: Nice short-read packed with interesting info and facts. Something that will surely make you think some things over, especially the economy part.

Time Square  |  The Shift is set in the 1930′s and is a science fiction tale which blends mystery, time travel, and suspense.
