The story centres around Dr. Rex Hudson – who makes a life  changing discovery deep in the jungles of Machu Picchu in Peru – and his twin daughter and son who inadvertently go along for the adventure of a lifetime when all three fall through a portal that takes them to Time Square – the central station of time travel.Dr. Hudson and his family soon learn that the removal of a strange obelisk from its resting place in Peru has triggered a series of events that may forever change the flow of time.  In fact, fractures in time have already occurred leaving time travelers stranded in unexpected and unknown locations.  It is up to Dr. Hudson, his children, and others at Time Square to return the obelisk to its resting place and to rescue the time travellers stranded across space and time.In a formula reminiscent of the Quest series, the author once again pens a thrilling roller-coaster ride of an adventure with a twist of time travel.  Readers dive right into the story as we come upon Dr. Rex and the other members of his search party as they are attacked by a band of poo-slinging, marauding monkeys.  The quick pace of the story grabs your attention from page one and keeps it until you turn the final page.  The author excels at keeping a young reader engaged by incorporating lots of action and witty dialogue between the quirky characters.  There are definitely many great one-liners that had me laughing out loud!I felt that the author hit the right balance in discussing the intricacies and complexity of time travel to the story.  There is just enough information to keep it interesting, but not enough to overwhelm young readers.  I loved the concept of a central station where a privileged few have the opportunity to travel back in time or to the future.  Sign me up!  The only comment I have is that I felt that the dialogue used among the doctor and his children in particular did not reflect the way people would speak in the 1930′s.  It felt more like the way kids today would speak.  The positive side of this is that children today could probably relate more easily to the children in the book because their language is similar.Time Square  |  The Shift is the first book in a planned series that will see the main characters moving forward with a number of sub-plots including finding and relocating the obelisk as well as finding and rescuing the stranded time travellers.  In short, there is a lot more story to be told and I’m coming along for that ride!My Bottom Line:Time Square  |  The Shift is a quick-paced adventure featuring a quirky cast of characters who frequently engage in witty dialogue; an intricate and suspenseful plot that will keep readers turning the pages; and plenty of humorous moments that will keep the reader entertained.  I recommend this series to middle graders who love time travel and a great adventure. Ages 8+* This book was given to me free-of-charge in exchange for my honest opinion.  All opinions expressed are my own.
summary: Great start to a fun time travel adventure series

reviewText: Advance Readers Copy (ARC) given to my blog for an honest review provided by the lovely authorI was honored that Mrs. Andrews messaged me to review her debut novel The Reason. Because I honestly enjoyed it and felt very connected to the characters while read and it was also a fast pace book which I like as well.But I did feel that Zoey was a little childish at time which just got on my nerves a bit but what heroine really doesn't these days. And Andy Tate, my god where do I even begin?He was sweet, protective, understanding he was the total package. Seriously what girl didn't fall in love with him while reading this.This book just grabs you attention and you will be a fool not to read this wonderful book. and let me say that first chapter made me cry like a baby.But I feel like it was just missing something and i cant put my hand on it. And that holy mother of Andy Tate that cliffhanger!

I was honored to receive this ARC by the talented author J. Kaye Smith for my honest review. Once I started this book it was so hard to put down. I loved Mia but my heart also broke for her as well. I loved the fact that the more I read the stronger she got.Sebastian.....HOLY SWOON!!! He was such a great alpha male who had that mystery to him. I loved the fact that even though he tries to keep himself cut off from everyone there is just something about Mia he can not resist. Once these two got together...my kindle was smoking!!! I loved seeing their relationship progress.I also loved the secondary story with Ricci and Maureen. My heart broke for Maureen. She has been through so much hurt and pain. I can't wait to read more on these two as well. I love seeing these big bad strong alpha males melt when it comes to a great woman!!I was so mad when I got to the ending I just kept trying to turn the page but it wouldn't work!! I need book 2 NOW!!! J Kaye Smith..I will be stalking you and your page until I get book 2 on my kindle!! :)

I do read a lot of books on diets and stuff but needed to know some facts about low carb. I found this ebook had touched the areas that I was searching for and found it was simple to understand. Great information!
I liked this story, but it left us all hanging...what's next?

Aroostine Higgins is an attorney in the same vein as Sasha McCandless. She is of Native American extraction and uses her honed instincts rather interestingly. She is the lead attorney in what was thought to be a "slam dunk" case until things started happening and she almost gets killed. This is a legal "thriller" in just about every sense of the word. A wonderful story of deceit, electronic treachery and legal mayhem. I am looking forward to more about this wonderful character, Aroostine, whose geneological roots stem from an area of the country where I spent time as a teenager.

Oh Gosh. This book. Sonya has outdone herself. I wasn't sure I would get the closure I so badly wanted. but she managed it in a wonderful. I got more then I could have imagined with this exciting and exhilarating journey.These are characters that stay with you. This story is one that you invest in. You hold your breath through certain chapters hoping that the outcome is as you desire.In this installment of the series Jade is where she least expects. Deep into the life of an enforcer. Her memory has been stolen and she is living a life of lies.Lorenzo is doing all he can to get what he wants.So is Elinor.Jade remembers nothing, but that doesn't stop what she can feel. We all know the attraction that Jade and Edge felt in Casted. We aren't let down with Spelled. I could never get enough of these two. Their love is consuming. I was crossing my fingers that they could right this the whole book.Jade and Edge are just the two mixed in the middle of this war, and most of all, more then anything, they just want their life.  They want to Live and Love.Throw in some interesting developments and a few things you didn't see coming and this story has you on your toes. As I said Sonya has outdone herself. This story is masterfully written and I found it very easy to navigate through.  I re-read book one shortly before this was released so I was on my toes and ready for it.Jump back into the world that grabs your heart and holds it hostage. A realm filled with magic and truest forms of love.  Highly Recommend from this Novel Grounder.
summary: Pure Love. Wonderfully Written, perfect ending.

reviewText: In only 45 pages Harlow delivers a great introduction to a paranormal steampunk adventure that features a gutsy, progressive heroine living in a proper London society.Despite social pressures that demand a woman should always look pretty, mind her manners, and know that her purpose is to serve her husband, Verity lives her life as a 28 year old spinster who finds these rules to be of little importance. While other ladies delight in fashion and local gossip, Verity is interested in mechanical gears and weapons. She's clever and ambitious and uses her creative mind to develop life-changing inventions. Of course, the credit for her brilliant work goes to someone else because her family would be ruined if the public ever discovered that a woman *gasp* was intelligent enough to do a man's job.I found it easy to fall in love with Verity's character in just a short amount of time and I have no doubt that she will only get more interesting from here.We're introduced to several other characters, one being the infamous McQueen that you'll find mentioned in the title. It's too soon to form a solid opinion of the American bounty hunter, but learning more about him is something to look forward to as the story continues.As the synopsis mentions, Verity's brother is kidnapped by vampyres and this is how the first installment ends. I can't wait to read about what happens next. I'm anticipating Verity kicking some vampyre ass.If you've been curious about serials but haven't tried one yet, I would suggest following the Hart/McQueen Steampunk Adventures. Harlow is a talented author who doesn't disappoint.
It was okay if you like medical thrillers.  Too much detail to be very thrilling though.
The writing was overall pretty good. Missing something on some parts of plot but like said before not bad. Not a full story- part of series.
good book again it is a book were the curvy girl gets her guy and the skinny girl loses out .  Great read and great job to the author.
Still trying to figure it out. Read it and couldn't believe it was published. But to each his own I guess.

Usually, I write out my reviews after I've had a day or so to think about them. I'm really bad about doing a knee jerk reaction and realizing I was too generous later on. But no. I finished this book two hours ago. Since then I've: made my boyfriend nearly late for work because of the tears, matted the cats fur because I held her sobbing, ate chocolate (I hate chocolate), and stared out the window for longer than acceptable. This book hit me right in the feels. Wow.This book sucked me in SO fast. Usually I read multiple books at a time because I have a hard time concentrating on just one, but not with this one. I think it's the mark of a crazy good book if it can keep my interest for 20% or 30% before I have to switch books. This one kept it the entire time. Last night, I started reading this. I only meant to read a few chapters to get a feel for it before passing out. Did that happen? Nope. I stayed up until 2am. I got to 80% in one night, y'all. That's bonkers. This morning, I voluntarily woke up earlier than normal to finish this book. The story has so many twists and turns. Brooklyn Skye is so good at building the suspense that makes you unable to put the book down. The need to know what's causing Ellie's blackouts and what's happening during them is fierce!I'll be honest. Gwen and Griffin were my OTP. Gwen had a lot of s*** she had to deal with. She was so raw and real. Both of the guys in this book were definitely romance material and sweet. But don't over-think that both word. There isn't a love triangle; at least not like you're expecting. I can't say much about the characters without giving it away. Just know that the characters and their stories are what made me enjoy this book so much.This is a story that feels really real. The characters seem real. The issues seem real. All of this stuff could legitimately happen, so it's bordering on frightening. Brooklyn Skye does an excellent job at keeping the pace and delivering this story perfectly. If you're a fan of contemporary romance and like suspense, you'll love Fragile Line. It's a wonderful blend of fantastic elements.**I received this book for free in exchange for my honest review. My thanks to Entagled Teen and Brooklyn Skye.

Another great book from you.  I love how you keep the main characters in the story together and monogamous throughout the whole book.  It makes a great read.  It is also very hard to do because not many authors can pull it off.  Only the best ones can and your right up there with the best of them.  All of your books are very heartfelt and real for your fans.  Congrats on a job well done.  Can't wait for the next book in the series.  Gina

OMG, I was crying as soon as I started reading......a friend told me to read this, I am so happy I did.  It's a wonderful love story, gorgeous hunk, Ryder, and beautiful life long friend and lover, Alexis......a match made in heaven.  They loved each other from a young age, so happy they found each other later in their lives.  Congratulations,  Bethany Bazile,  fantastic writing........Thanks for the privilege.
Oh Lord up above!! Ryder, Ryder, Ryder...you are the man, the King, the champ, the Hawk...fell in love with this book...keep em comin!!!

I received a complimentary copy from the publisher/author for an honest review.This was a fantastic addition to the Layers Trilogy.  Julian was every women's dream man.  He was kind, patient, compassionate and HOT.I loved how the story turned out to be so much more than the kidnapping.  I was surprised throughout the whole book, which is probably why I finished it in less than 24 hours!!!Kendra's strength and determination throughout the whole book was great.  What was not to love about these two characters!!!I was glad they got their HEA, but just wished for a tad more into their future together.

Enjoyable storyline which was both serious and funny . Deserving of 5 stars.  Layers Peeled book 2 and Layers Deep book 1 set the pace for a great trilogy. Both book 1 and 2 are equally deserving of 5 stars. I have actually read all three books twice. Enjoy a great read.
Just didn't get into the dialogue.  Pretty dry reading and probably over my head!  Didn't finish it. Too many other good stories to read out there!
I felt the book moved well the characters were well thought out I'm looking forward to next one.Awesome Book!!!!!!!

Holy cow! This book was a crazy, hot, violent mess of awesomeness! Love it. While I miss my Ciardis stories, this was a great change of pace. If you think you know Algardis, you ain't seen nothin' yet! Sara will totally knock your socks off(then kick your a$& and take your weapons)!

I am really looking forward to the next book in the series. This story had some very unique elements. The ultimate mystery of this book is an intriguing one and helps the story flow. The impacts of family and friendship on a person and their choices is shown, and I look forward to the next in the series.
I've been somewhat tired of the classic fantasy the last yrs. This was a refreshing read! It flows nicely, not too harrowing and good action thoro
A fun new series with a feisty new lead character with plenty to learn. The character has plenty of room to grow and I'll enjoy future books immensely. Being on book 2!!
This is a fun loose yourself in the book kind of read.  Great for the summer time get-away.
summary: Great for a summer time get-away

reviewText: I definitely need help in the promotion department! I've picked up some good ideas in this book, and have definite plans to use at least several of these ideas, including one or two that don't exactly fit my personality type, but might just be worth  the effort.  Now all I have to do is find the time! Lol!I was given a copy of this through Story Cartel, in exchange for my honest review.

This is a fabulous story line, it is suspenseful and exciting. A real page turner!  I only gave it a two star rating because, it ends so abruptly that anyone with half a brain realizes that something is very wrong.  Did the author forget to finish the book?  Or if there is a sequel it is a VERY STRANGE place to stop the story line.... SO just be aware that you will definitely be left hanging!!!!

Thank you to Entangled Publishing for reaching out for a review.  I was instantly intrigued by this story and I am so glad that I agreed to read this quick novella.  Right from the beginning, I was sucked in. What can I say, I love anything to do with military or black ops and romance.John and Lucie meet after Lucie was held hostage and John's team rescued her and her sister Zara.  When John shows up to Zara's baby shower, he sees Lucie again and the feelings that were there before are still there  When Lucie tells John that she wants him for her 30th birthday, the fun and excitement begins.What happens when old enemies decide that they want what they believe is owed to them?  A thrilling twist to this great story.
I really love this series and hope Kennedy keeps them coming - the sooner, the better
Loved it! Great book, I highly recommend this series. I have read it three times, and no doubt I will read it three more.
It was nice seeing these characters move into adulthood. I love this series! Can't wait for book 2!! Thanks Addison!!

I have followed the celestra series for years. These books I've laughed with, felt silly for crying with. Skyla's life, is a beautiful diaster. But somehow this girl is on fire. I love this book, out of high school and in college all grown up.  I await the next book.

I have been waiting for this book for what feels like forever and it did not disappoint. This book follows the Celestra and the Countenance series which I am a huge fan of, and I would not recommend reading this book without reading both series first.This book follows right were Celestra left off and two years after the Countenance books. Skyla Messenger and Gage Oliver are finally off to college and boy do things heat up fast. Be warned this is no longer a YA series. I am so excited to get into the twists and turns that have already exploded out of this book. It left me reeling and so very confused. I have always been a Gage fan but in this new light I no longer know where I stand in this love square. I just might be leaning towards team Marshal.Cooper Flanders, Wesley Parker/Paxton, and Laken Stewart are all present in this book which was awesome because I have been waiting for the two series to converge and it finally has all in present time. Hopefully in the books to come it might even switch to there p.o.v. I would love to get back into there heads.All in all this book is made of win and I would strongly recommend it to any one who is into the celestial magic that is Addison Moore's writing.
Enjoyable love story that is a short great read.Perfect for one if those hurry up and wait appointments.ENJOY!

I was given a copy of this book for an honest review. Anna gave in to Conor pretty fast, but they do have a history together, so it can be seen in that perspective.  I love how she finally got pissed and let Rebecca know that she wanted him for herself.  That and the reasons Conor gave her about her son that made her finally give in to him were very touching.  It was good that her change wasn't a long drawn out ordeal for her too, especially after all she had been through already with her cancer.  They definitely had a very passionate relationship that comes through. definitely 4 stars!

Time to think about what is really important and what things must go! I love this simple approach to living. This book has got some really great tips for de-cluttering and simplifying your life. I highly recommend it!

This book surprised with the twist of the male submissive.  Eve's character is amazingly strong considering her background yet with the introduction of Guerino she finds that losing yourself can also be a found strength.  Guerino discovers Kenric has a daughter and goes to find her to either kill or protect her, it all hangs on the knowledge if she is like her mother or father.These two have some amazing chemistry.  I can not express how much I love series books.  The way each book builds upon the previous one and the characters continue to interact.  This book is very appealing on so many levels.  With the introduction of Eve and the knowledge that vampires can not have children this adds a new a intriguing building block on this series.  I look forward to the next book to see what other twists this author will provide us.

This is not your normal Tessa story.  There's not as much dirty talking, the characters are young and still finding themselves, but it is no less fantastic! A steamy, sweet and sometimes funny story of a girl running to Ireland to get over a guy. A guy she thinks was too good for her. Willa meets Shane when he picks her up from the airport. Their relationships starts out as one of those “I hate you so much that I want to rip your clothes off” kind of things. The sexual tension is palpable. Add in a crazy Mother, an independent but sheltered sister and two wacky pick-pockets and you get this charming, beautiful story of two broken people learning that they don’t need to be fixed to find love. Excellent!
summary: Tessa Bailey does a fantastic NA!!

reviewText: One of the best books I've read all year- and I read about 2 a week!!!  Loved Willa in 'protecting what's his' and I love her more now!  And Shane?  Drool! Best alpha male in a long while!
summary: Alpha with an accent?  Yes please!

reviewText: Fantastic characterization, bringing personalities to life right before your eyes. I say that because you can "see" her characters not just in your mind. Conversationally excellent, with a wonderful mix of what one thinks and feels.  I read this slower to absorb it all.  You nailed this one girl!

I read the first book in this series in which Willa was a secondary character to her sister and her future brother-in-law and I loved her from the start. This story was really great and so good to see Willa get her own book. Shane Claymore is more than enough man to make any woman swoon and I'm glad he got Willa to see what love was all about!

It would seem that Tessa Bailey cannot write a dud, lol! Dear Lord woman...you are a 5 star magnet!You see, there is this man...Shane Claymore...and he is an Irish dream...all body, and accent...and when Willa Peet finally learns to embrace her true self, she needs an escape to deal with the pressures of just living as herself...she needs a place far away from her recent reality.It is her passion and camera that take her across the world and to the lively Irish landscapes, and more importantly into the life of one Shane Claymore! Willa is a smart'alek, she is hard and sassy, and she is confident! But this is a faade of self doubt and fear of her being defined her rough past, she will never be a "normal girl"....lucky for her, Shane has never fit into the right place and the harder she pushes him the more he enjoys the chase!  Together they are a bundle of fire and tension. From trading insults to pushing each other with attitude and smoldering glances, there is a slow building burn of need, maybe just one night can be enough? When Willa and Shane embrace one another with all guards down, they are rocked at the intensity and the primal connection they have! Neither is prepared for the emotions slamming into their hearts and minds! But is either strong enough to let go of their past and embrace what is right in front of them? Willa does not seem to be as confident as she comes off...Shane challenges her to the fullest...Tessa Bailey created a fabulously engaging story of young love. It was fast and furious yet deep and emotionally connected. It was hot and tense, but it was mostly beautiful. I am a complete sucker for HEA and I absolutely love a Man who is all in...willing to fight for his woman! Seems as if Willa and Shane have found themselves and their home in the arms of one another!
summary: Tessa Bailey is a 5 Star Phenom!

reviewText: Willa Peet is lost, trying to find the whip-smart firecracker she used to be. Reeling from the breakup of the relationship with her first love, and at not even twenty, she firmly believes she's broken, unfixable.Until she wins a photography competition and finds herself in Dublin, and crosses paths with Shane Claymore, the owner of the guesthouse where she'll spend her month in Ireland. They strike sparks off each other right away, but he's got no time for anything but focusing on selling off the family business, and returning to his car racing career.Unfixable is Tessa Bailey's latest release, a spinoff from her compelling Line of Duty series, and her first New Adult novel. (While Unfixable spins off from Bailey's Protecting What's His, there is sufficient background for this novel to stand alone.)Willa's a superb character. Despite thinking she's broken she still has plenty of fire to her. The way she plays Shane at their first meeting is hilarious. Despite the way she thinks about herself, she's more than capable of deep love.Shane is a standout. He's a vintage dirty-talking, charismatic, sexy hero, for which Tessa Bailey is becoming quite well known, but what a complex character. Tortured by his relationship with his father, bearing the guilt of his death, there's nothing he wants more than to escape from the family legacy that weighs him down, and head back to the career he loves. Orla the barmaid says it best, in Unfixable: "Irish men are a complicated sort...don't judge by what you see on the surface, or they'll knock you on your arse when you're not looking".Unfixable is a perfect blend of hot sexy and sweet love. We hurt for Willa and Shane as they hurt themselves and each other, cheer them on as they challenge each other and try to work out a way past their differences and the 'use-by' date that circumstances have placed on their relationship. But it's the growing past the beliefs you hold about yourself that keep you from moving forward, that's a real coming of age. Such good subject matter for this New Adult story, Bailey's first effort in the genre, which she handles skilfully.The setting is absolutely stunning and evocative, right down to the rendering of the Irish burr - it's like being there, walking along Baggot street hearing those voices yourself. The supporting characters are beautifully drawn, including Shane's family members. They're funny, caring, but never sink into cliché. They all have their own wants and desires, their own hidden pain.I highly recommend this book for readers who like their contemporary romance sexy, but like the emotional side too.Reviewer was given an advanced reader's copy as part of a fan giveaway in return for an honest review.
summary: Tessa Bailey knocks it out of the park with her first New Adult novel, Unfixable

reviewText: My Thoughts:This was my first book by Tessa Bailey, and what a pleasure it was!  My co-blogger, Mikki, is the biggest Tessa Bailey fan, and has been telling me how amazing this author is.  Mikki and I have very similar reading tastes, so when she tells me something is amazing, I know that I am in for a real treat!Our main character, Willa Peet, is a strong, gritty, and independent female lead.  She had a tough childhood, with an absentee father, and a mother who was a heroine addict and prostitute.  She saw many things as a child that she shouldn't have, grew up in poverty, and learned how to survive.  Fortunately for her, she had an older sister, Ginger, who loved and protected her to the best of her ability.  Ginger ends up taking her away to live in Chicago.  Once Ginger meets Derek, a nice guy that works in law enforcement, the three of them become a close knit family.However, Willa never loses her sharp edges, and she knows that her past will always haunt her, and has partly shaped her to become the person that she is.  Willa's first boyfriend, Evan, was a good guy, who tried to change Willa in to a softer version of herself.  She got tired of seeing the pity, and disappointment in his eyes from when he repeatedly tried to change her, and didn't succeed.  Willa ends up breaking up with Evan, because she knows that he deserves someone very different from her, but she is heartbroken.  Willa has a passion and talent for photography, and when she wins a trip to Dublin, Ireland, in a photo contest, she knows this is the perfect opportunity to heal from her break-up.When Willa lands in Dublin, she meets Shane Claymore, the very sexy and moody owner of the Claymore Inn.  Right away these two share a very heated and feisty connection, and strong attraction.  Willa also meets Faith, Shane's younger sister, and Kitty, Shane's mentally ill mother.  Even though Willa doesn't plan to form any relationships or attachments in Dublin, fate intervenes!Wow, let me just say that Shane was super sexy!  I could picture his Irish accent, gorgeous blue eyes, and  brooding personality.  I loved all of the feisty banter between these two, as well as the intense sexual chemistry.  Once Shane set his sights on Willa, there was no helping that poor girl!  I loved the way these two grew as characters.  They were both a lot alike, in the fact that they had heavy burdens, shouldered guilt, and were very unhappy people.  When you peeled back the layers, it was obvious that they both were loyal to their loved ones, had huge hearts, and didn't see the good in themselves.  The more Shane and Willa actually got to know one another, the more they opened up, saw the good in each other, and healed.  I loved how the romance was slow-building and believable.  I was rooting for Willa and Shane to get a HEA together, and you will too.I loved Willa's relationships with Faith and Kitty as well.  Faith was sweet, loving, and wore her heart on her sleeve.  What you saw is what you got, and she really knew how to have a good time.  Kitty was mentally fragile, and often showed signs of dementia.  Willa grew fond of Faith as well.Unfixable was a character driven story.  Willa and Shane's conflicts had to do more with their individual inner struggles, and the fact that they wouldn't be in the same country in a month.  This may be my first story by Tessa Bailey, but it definitely won't be my last!  If you are in the mood for a great romance, full of passion,  read Unfixable, by Tessa Bailey!  I give Unfixable, by Tessa Bailey, 4 Delicious, Irresistible, Passionate, Shane-Filled Stars!
summary: 4 Delicious, Irresistible, Passionate, Shane-Filled Stars!  (Lindy@ A Bookish Escape)

reviewText: This book is amazing! I absolutely love all of the characters and the plot moves quickly enough that you just can't stop reading until you're done with the whole book. The two main characters dislike each other in the beginning, and then Willa tries to fight her attraction to him. Once they both accept that what they're feeling is inevitable, things get more steamy.The author added to the story with an adorable but off-her-rocker mother and a sister who breaks out of her shell so there is more to the story than just the two main characters. These additional characters had me laughing throughout the book.Willa grew up in a less than ideal home so has a few issues. She loves photography and wins a competition that lands her in a " bar & inn" that Shane's family owns. Shane races cars and works with his sister to run the bar and keep track of their crazy but adorable mother.This book refreshingly refrains from following the same pattern as other books about girls coming from broken homes. Willa acts with maturity and spunk.The steamy-type of this book is the type where the guy pushes the girl up against a wall, boxes her in with his hands on either side, and kisses her.The last thing I'm going to say is that this book was written very very well. I rarely give books 5 stars and if I could I've give this one 10 stars.
summary: Amazing book! Touching, beautiful, and steamy.

reviewText: Willa is all grown up now. Somehow she seemed older than 19 but that's ok with me. Shane was great for her. I think she found her own Derek in Shane. Heck if it worked for Ginger why not Willa. And hello finding love in Dublin , what more can you ask for. This is a definite reread for me.

Unfixable is a departure from the Tessa Bailey we’ve come to expect. It’s New Adult, and with that, we see a brand new side to Tessa’s writing. The heat level is warm (as opposed to blistering in her other books), but the story is beautiful and emotional. Tessa’s characters are fully developed and gripping. When Willa arrives in Dublin, she does not expect to be challenged by Shane. Circumstances brought them together, but time will tear them apart. Highly recommended.

[...]My rating: 4.5 of 5 ⭐️There were few things Willa Peet really cared about: Her sister, her brother-law and her photography, which is what won her the trip to Dublin, Ireland. Of course there had been someone else, but Willa was determined this trip would heal her heart of that loss. She hadn't counted on the owner of the Inn she was scheduled to stay at, to be tall, dark and dangerously intriguing.Home to look after his sister and mother, as well as run their family Inn after the death of his father, Shane Claymore has had to take a hiatus in his racing career. Something he missed every day, and couldn't wait to get back to, but not without putting things in order for his family. He had it all planned out, and then the moody girl from the photo contest had to come and unsettle him.Like oil and water, at least that's what it looked like when Shane and Willa went at it. Constantly at each other, or throwing hard glares. Underneath all that animosity was a slow scalding heat that was steaming to the surface and once it found even the slightest crack, nothing could hold back the full-fledged combustion. Realizing their attraction only complicates matters.Each have baggage to contend with, timelimits to honor, people to consider and futures to plan....****Surprised!!! Very excellent!!A bit of a dark and angsty new adult story, but with great 'bite'.Tessa Bailey does a phenomenal job creating an atmosphere that is very tangible, both with characters and description. I could walk into Claymore's and would recognize it and its patrons right off. Perfectly set 'in scene'!The characters are wonderful!! Not just the two main characters, but all of the supporting cast as well, with a rich variety, each written with great care for individuality and personality. Often with quirky overtones and a great deal of spunk, but some with a tragic-comedic flavor.Willa herself is a little tragic. Tough as nails and sarcastically funny on the outside, she hides a mountain of insecurity, evidences by her past attempts to change herself into something she though someone else would want. Such low self value, although it doesn't seem that way from the chip she has on her shoulder. Shane seems to be able to see right through her, though.Shane is weighed down by guilt and responsibility, as well as lingering anger over past events he can no longer do anything about. At war between the desire to follow his dreams and the need to look after his family is wearing him down, making him bitter, lashing out at the flippant Willa. Especially when she sees more than he cares for her to see.Two people who are rather lost, are able to help guide each other to clarity.✨A compelling, sensuous and dynamic story.. ✨**Copy provided in return for an honest review.**

This book will take you on an emotional ride. You will go on trip to Dublin with Willa where she meets Shane, the innkeeper. Willa thinks she is unfixable from a previous relationship and Shane is haunted by his past, can they find true love.This books has such emotions, humor, crying and hot sex.I will be rereading this book. I received this book from the publisher for and honest review.

Fun filled story of the hunky pirate Will on land in the Highlands! Will follows his fellow pirate "sister" and her new husband to the Highlands (hiding out from King Henry). He meets the lovely lass Jonet. Still healing from her late husband's bad behavior Jonet takes care of the orphans of the clan. Without giving too much away, she and Will (who also saves children from the slave traders) are thrown together when a sickness hits the area. They travel to Clan Munro and take care of the children there.  I love these characters, most are back from the Highland Hearts series. The story flows nicely with barbs directed at Will, and I was surprised to read how Will handles it all. You learn Will can take a lot and even laughs at himself. I found myself loving Will (who was kind of a pain in Tangled Hearts).  He is funny yet very serious when it comes to Jonet. You will really enjoy this book. I love the way Heather ties in the dragonfly birthmark (Dragonfly Chronicles)...and sets up her next novel about Searc. I really enjoy finishing a book and moving on to the next family member. The way she adds her previous characters into the current books are so fun that we never need to wonder what is going on (or what happened) in their lives. Can't wait for Crimson Heart for sure!!

A must read... And yes, the author does state at the beginning of book that it is NOT professionally edited and you can see that BUT it does not dismiss the fact that this story is great!!! I couldn't put it down and can't wait for the next one. It does have the familiar rocket/ bad boy aspect but characters that have a unique story like none else. Heartbreaking, angsty, happy, romantic, steamy and things that will make you think  WTH???? Hope a publisher picks this up!!!!!
summary: One of best of 2014 in this genre!!!!!

MW damn did you take us on a journey of lies, deceit, betrayal, forgiveness & most of all love. The person you love the most has the power to hurt you more than anyone and did they ever. The final installment to both The Ex-Games and The Private Club Trilogies is intriguing, hot, emotional and with enough twists to surprise even the most keen readers.

They both found the women of their dreams who were able to see past the mistakes. They even got some surprises they weren't expecting.I'm sorry to see this is the end Greyson and Brandon

What else can I say, but JS has done it again!! This is a must read if you loved The Ex Games and The Private Club!! This is a great conclusion to Brandon, Katie, Greyson, and Meg!! All secrets are revealed and you will be surprised at all the twists and turns in this story! After ll the teasers that the author gave us over the last few weeks I couldn't stop reading until I finished this book!!! Can't wait for her next book, she has become an one click buy for me!!

This book is a great start for anyone beginning to knit, very informative with great diagrams explaining everything from beginning to end. Well organized with a nice layout, I highly recommend this book!

With a sickly mother to support, a house badly in needs of repairs, and spiraling debts to pay, Clover Loveday desperately needs her fledgling bakery/cafe, the Four-Leaf Clover, to succeed. So, when she learns that the Upper Crust Bakery chain is opening a new store opposite, she is concerned about the effect it may have on her business and is prepared to tell the boss’s son, exactly whats she thinks of him and his business practices.Liam Sinclair has never questioned the decisions his father has made for their company, The Upper Crust Bakery chain is successful and he is proud of the role he has had in growing it, but he’s never given much thought to the competition, until the moment the owner of Four-Leaf Clover literally falls into his arms. Still, no matter how attractive he finds Clover, business is business, with no room for the personal touch until Clover shows him that the bakery, and his life, is missing a vital ingredient – heart.Four-Leaf Clover by Charmaine Ross is set in the leafy suburbs of Victoria’s Dandenongs Ranges. Told from the perspectives of Clover and Liam, it is a sweet romance that proves the old adage that opposites attract. Liam is wealthy, carefree and a representative of ‘big business’ while Clover is plagued with debt and responsibility and believes in a philosophy of people before profit. They should be enemies but from the first moment they meet, when Clover topples from a ladder into Liam’s arms, the attraction between them is undeniable.Ross does a good job of building on the physical attraction that sparks between her characters. The obstacles to their relationship are believable, from Liam’s past heartbreak and his father’s interference to Clover’s pride and her legitimate concerns regarding Liam’s motives. Their intimacy doesn’t feel forced as they get to know one another, despite the compressed time frame.I would have liked a few more scenes set in the cafe perhaps (maybe even the inclusion of a recipe) and for the confrontation between Liam and his father to have been fleshed out a little more but in general, I think the storyline is well thought out and believable.The dialogue is authentic, though the prose is sometimes a bit awkward. There are some small issues with continuity and copy editing, which I assume will be corrected in the final copy.I enjoyed Four-Leaf Clover as a short and lovely romance novel with a satisfying plot and likeable characters. A tempting sweet treat for an idle afternoon.

This book gave me a lot of mixed messages.  The cover, to me, screams adult book.  The blurb says YA.  The story had me confused between middle grade and adult.  Why?  I'll tell ya.The book is set in Australia and I will admit to cultural differences.  Not so much that I didn't get things, just enough to give me pause a few times.  It might explain my biggest issue with the book.  I'm not sure what high school students are like at a private school in Australia but I do know what high school students from a public school are like in the US.  And this isn't like it.  The relationships screamed middle grade to me.  Yet at the same time, Jaz is dealing with adult issues.  I was just really confused and uncomfortable with it.Jaz is a strong girl that kicks behinds and asks questions later.  She brings the hurt.  She's very drawn to weapons and fighting.  She's also in love with her best friend, though he's oblivious.  She's also involved with "running" the ring (a gym) while the owner is out of town.  I found this strange.  She's been working there since she was 10.  It felt too convenient as a plot element. When Ryan shows up at the ring, he gains her attention with his muscles and good looks.  He's in his mid twenties, which didn't go with her age of 17.  Their connection made the book feel like NA.  It was very confusing.I really liked Taylor and Anna despite their flatness.  There was a lot of potential with them that I don't think every was realized.I guess that's how I felt about the whole thing.  There was potential there.  I liked the premise, though I think it should have been NA through and through.  But the whole thing just didn't satisfy me.  I found myself longing for it to be over and not in a good way.  I just wanted more.I'm not sure who would enjoy this book.  Perhaps a YA would enjoy it.
summary: I expected to like this one more

reviewText: I really appreciated the consistency of Ms Stuart's Regency setting and markers. The story is pacy and the characters are likeable while the storyline holds together well. I like that her female protagonist is not a total wall flower even in the restrictive hothouse of the era in which she is constrained. From a harsh and difficult relationship to love and forgiveness, this story is a delightful romance.

I absolutely enjoyed Lord Somerton's Heir. In this romantic mystery, Sebastian Alder survived Waterloo, barely. As he recovers, a woman appears to inform him that now, he is Lord Somerton. Removed to better chambers and an increased hope of actual recovery, he finds the legacy a great deal more trouble than it seemed to be worth."The Somerton inheritance was a tainted privilege. In some ways he was no better off than he would have been if he had remained a penniless officer of the line on half pay. At least then he only had his siblings and himself to worry about. Now he had a household and an estate, all claiming pennies from a purse that looked decidedly the worse for wear.... Where had it all gone and how, in God's name, was he expected to restore the family fortunes?He had thought the matter through in the tedious hours in the coach and decided that if he thought of the task ahead as being akin to a sudden promotion to Colonel of a regiment, it did not seem so daunting."Sebastian meets the new family, assumes his new responsibility and intends to make provisions for his brother and sister. As soon as he untangles the financial mess Anthony Kingsley left behind. There are hanger's on, wise granny, an aunt and dozens of cousins, plus tenants, retainers and servants to assess and get to know. Always near by, ready to offer assistance or subtle guidance, is Isabel. He sees her wounds, the grief she struggles beneath and that she is trying to reach beyond the sorrows and anger. Through Sebastian's eyes we observe Isabel's healing steps, stumbles and set backs. It was an interesting perspective because generally the socks are on the other foot.This story is slightly Gothic in tone, the writing smooth and gently reflective. There was an old-fashioned pace I really enjoyed. There was no rush of the romance, the story or the ending. The dialog kept you in the period without effort or cliches. Characters were believable, though slowly revealed. Personally I like that but others may find the bits and pieces revelation too old skool. Secondary characters weren't two dimensional though the villains were both over the top once their disguises were stripped away. I was disappointed by the second villain's big reveal. For all the realism it brought to the story, I felt manipulated and a wee bit resentful.I liked Sebastian, his siblings and Isabel. I appreciated how the tragic past was handled as part of the story, not a cudgel to wallow in and create more angst. They were the Ordinary Folks we all think we are until trials come our way and we learn not only is there more to us, but less as well. Confronting their own failings, they have compassion for other's. Mostly, it was absolutely wonderful to read an Awakening Story that wasn't all about the sexual attraction or trumped up conflicts that reduce hero and heroine to argumentative banter based on misunderstandings. They were cautious with each other, kind to themselves even. Taking time, giving support and space as needed, Sebastian and Isabel's story advanced even as the mysteries, debts and confusions mounted to a larger pile.I had a bit of difficulty with the last couple chapters of this book. It tied up "too neatly" for me. I like a bit of conflict left hanging, things to work through together in happily ever after land. In fairness, the financial situation is probably Huge Enough, not to mention the "secret" Sebastian has chosen to keep. I believe that will come back to bite them both in the end. Of course, it could simply be the fact I seldom like epilogues and this one was a bit too sweet for me. That said, I did enjoy 98.7% of the book, the writing style, characterizations, and well-handles story line. Definitely will look for other works by this author. I recommend Lord Somerton's Heir for when you're in a Traditional mood, looking for a meatier story with a gentle romance.~Note I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review. Originally posted at Romance Reviews Magazine
Loved this novella. Lady Julia And Brisbane deserve to be parents and I am glad they are helping Lucy by taking care of little Jack. Well done and entertaining.
Lady Julia and Nicholas at home with more complex problems solved with the help of her unique niece Perdita.A new job and a new family addition as well.

This book is extremely helpful in understanding Foreign Exchange Trading (forex). I had only heard a little bit about it and decided to do a little extra research to see if it was worth looking into and I am surprised. It looks so much like a "Get rich quick" scam, but it isn't if you're smart about it. This book gives you a lot of information about how it works in as few pages as possible, which keeps it from being too boring. It gives you ways to get started and tips and tricks on how to manage it to make money. It's great for people who are trying to keep their heads above the water, especially those who are unemployed. It's even great for people who just want a little extra spending money. I would definitely recommend this to everyone who needs a little extra cash.
summary: Great for those who need extra cash!

reviewText: As somebody interested in the idea of trading, but being a complete novice, I wasn't sure where to begin. Ben Evans book is written in clear terminology for novices like me. The text walks the reader through the diverse cases of trading accounts, I found the explanation of candlestick charts particularly helpful. So was the information on strategies, attitude and approach, minimizing danger and the hints section.
This series is a great read. You love the character's,  wish they would come faster. You get drug into the lives of these people.

* This book was given to me for a fair and honest review*Breaking Alexandria was everything that I hoped it would be and more. K.A. Robinson outdid herself with the story of bad girl Alexandria struggling to come to terms with the consequences of her decisions and decide between Joel, the drug dealer with a good heart, and Landon, the golden farm boy that heals her tortured soul.When I read the synopsis, I knew that I had to read this book. It intrigued me. As I read the book, it drew me in and reminded me how heartbreaking and exhilarating young love can be. It was not a she loves him, she loves him not, gumball, giggly book. K.A. Robinson wrote a book about tests – of courage, strength, loss and love. It takes you on a journey with Alexandria as she figures out who she needs to be for herself before she decides whom she wants to love.Alexandria is unlike many teenage characters that you find. She has balls, guts, she admits her shortcomings and accepts her downfalls. Yes, she does it in typical teenage style with some defiance thrown, which needs to be there or she would have been an unbelievable character. I fell in love with her because she reminds me of teenage me (all those years ago).Joel and Landon are complete opposites and I think that is what makes it so hard for Alexandria to choose her path. Joel is her first love. I believe that he truly loves her but seems to put her in second place. Landon is every girl’s wet dream, but he seems too good to be true for Alexandria. I know if I were in her place, I would have some serious trouble deciding too.I will warn you – you will need tissues, alcohol and chocolate while you read. It is worth every tear that you shed when you get to the conclusion. The book is a stand alone – no cliffhanger. Please, do yourselves a favor and read Breaking Alexandria….Review originally posted to Books Books Books Blog

Plus who couldn't fall in love with a good 'ole country boy from West Virginia.  This authour is amazing.  Love all of her books. I have a few go to favorite authors and K.A. Is definitely one of them. Seriously, in love with her books and this is another to add to the list. I love her writing style, music references (let me know if you need to help with some country song references K.A.), and the plots (always a good twist in the book).So, I've kinda always tried to hide the country girl in me... Then I read this book and found myself agreeing to the stuff about the farm life and remembering similar good times from when I was growing up, like just simple and basic things to be happy doing, not partying it up.On the other side of this story though, I remember feeling so lost and confused some days as a teenager like Alexandria did. However, I busted my tail on the farm and didn't have a chance at considering getting in trouble, lol.This story was so real, pulls you in and keeps you wondering what Alexandria will choose for herself and what she'll get handed next. You also see different sides to both Joel and Landon, which aren't exactly what you'd expect in the story. Gotta love the random plot twists, lol. I'm wondering if there will be a book from either or both of their viewpoints?P.S. #teamlandon for the win. Did I mention I am a sucker for a good looking country boy?-Jamie

How to be a Ghost by Audrey Claire is a fast reading book! The main character is a ghost named Libby.  The book cover attracted my attention where the woman known as Libby looks like a shadow or ghost.  The author has fun writing and has another book coming out soon.  The books will be a set of series and not romance but take you on an adventure with Libby as a ghost. What is the book about? Divorced mom Libby Grace works as an elementary school teacher and has no social life to speak of. The most she has to worry about is finding a way to fix a leaky faucet without a budget for a plumber. The next thing Libby knows she’s standing at the foot of her son’s bed completely see-through!  Libby can’t remember what happened to her. Is she dead? She doesn't know for sure because she can’t find her body, and the last place she remembers being, the local hardware store, instead of her own body, she finds the corpse of the store’s owner, husband to the mayor of her small town.  In order to solve the mystery surrounding her disappearance, Libby must figure out who killed George Walsh. Along the way, she gets help from her reclusive neighbor, Ian McClain, who has a secret of his own.  2014 Jackie Paulson
summary: How to be a Ghost: A Libby Grace Mystery - Book 1

reviewText: This was a funny and odd little book am waiting for next one to come out kept me interested just couple miss names but didn't detract need to proof little better

I received this book from NetGalley and am providing an honest review.Let me start with what the author did well. First, I will say that the portrayal of the verbally and emotionally abusive relationship was quite realistic. Lex's relationship with Brad was toxic and the author did an amazing job of writing about the effects it had on Lex's confidence and her relationships with close others.I also appreciated that Jaron came off as a real person. Despite his being in love with Lex, he cut her out of his life when she wouldn't leave Brad. There's only so long you can watch someone be hurt by others or hurt themselves before you crack and Jaron cracked, throwing away a life-long friendship. While it might not be considered the best reaction, it was completely understandable and probably something I would do.Beyond that, the book was quite boring. I often found my mind wandering while reading, which is never a good sign. There was nothing happening and a lot of thinking. There were some chapters that seemed like they were made up entirely of thoughts. Thoughts about the past; thoughts about whether or not they should do something; thoughts about whether or not Lex would ever be ready for a relationship with Jaron. I needed some action or interaction or drama or something!I also felt that the romance was lacking until the last 15% of the book or so. The first 85% was just Jaron helping Lex to let go of the past, which was fine, but there could have been some wooing in there as well.Unfortunately, this one just didn't work out for me.

Third book in the series and they keep getting better.  I  can tell when an author has me hooked because it gets so tense that I find myself jumping down the page to get to what happens faster.  I have to remind myself to slow down so I don't miss anything.  This is that kind of book.  Would reccommend to any of my friends or their kids.  No uuncomfotable X rated scenes.  Just a great story and interesting characters.  Well edited and only a few typos and one spot where the same character got two names ... Larry/Jerry.

I was recently diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. My doctor advised me that if I can control my blood sugar levels through diet, I will not have to take insulin. I have been researching a variety of new diet plans in an effort to avoid having to take drugs to control my disease. This book is extremely informative and is very easy to follow and understand. It describes exactly what diabetes is and how the foods you eat can affect you. It makes following the diet very easy, explaining exactly what foods you should eat and which you should avoid. It also provides tips for healthy eating if you are on a budget, exercising, and keeping yourself motivated.

This is an easy and quick read, but it is also very enjoyable. The characters were well rounded, which is a hard thing for an author to do is a short story. Then the actual story was very exciting and fast paced. I look forward to reading more from this author.
summary: Found a new author to read!

reviewText: Elle is taken by Luke.  he's hot.  what she finds out later has her very upset.  who to trust is up in the air
I like that Elie was comfortable with herself and the fact that Luke was a shifter and after hearing that her father was a shifter too she still wanted to be with Luke
