reviewText: Ok so here's my honest opinion on this duet... The first book Revival really dragged on for me. I just couldn't get into to it and there were a lot of mistakes. With that being said the book didn't do it fir me. But to each their own and what doesn't work for some work for others.The second book though "Autumn Wish" I absolutely loved it. It was well written and a great love story. Sam and Nikki's story has you laughing and falling in love with each of the characters this book is worth the purchase. I would like to see another book about Sam, Nikki, and Ella. The story was real life fears and struggles and not far fetched at all. So it was easy to relate to what the characters were feeling. As far as Sam goes... I mean come on who wouldn't want a hot man who learns how to take care of a baby?! You won't regret this book at all! Great read!!!

Wow, how time flys Lucent and Elise have now been together for 6 mths. I love how Elise is now writing the story of how she and Lucent met and not skipping all the juicy parts. I so understand where Elise is coming from the library and comfortable she is there. She is so cute about the BDSM stuff as she calls it. And wow the fire starts and we find out that the mansion has secrets, and we found out that Lucent is not all we thought he was....I am not going to say more you will have to buy the book to find out what exactly is going out and you won't be disappointed.

I've been reading Cerys Du Lys' work on and off for over a year now, and I have to say I almost always enjoy the story. The writing is clear and concise, and that wins points for me big time. The stories are dramatic, sweet, sexy, and funny all at once. His Absolute Assignment follows Lucent and Elise as she learns about a darker man behind the one she thought she knew. It's a very morish tale, and I'm curious as to what comes next.
Highly recommended book. I love crime stories and this is fantastic. I'd also recommend the other books in this series.

How am I possibly going to wait until Fall for Book 10?!?!? This series is amazing - I love Sienna and her witty (snarky?) comments. All of the characters are well developed, making them multidimensional as well as easy to love or hate. This series is one that I'm going to miss the characters when I'm finished reading - so I'm happy to know Mr. Crane will be writing books/sequels! He is a crazy good writer!!

I LOVE this series, can not put it down. From the very beggining I was hooked on sienna's story amd jow shes matured through the books from the wimpy girl she started as to the mature leader she turns out to be. Great book great series I highly recommend.

I discovered I had a gluten intolerance about 7 years ago, I wish I had, had this explanation of the difference between the intolerance and the allergy back then.  Things would have made a lot more sense.  And these recipes!  Lots of favorites from Europe, especially the Mediterranean area, some great sides and even desserts. I can't wait to try the no-crust pumpkin pie!
It's interesting, it teaches science concepts, but the story is not in any way engaging.  It does not delight the children.

Author Dan Jackson uses a horse character to tell fun facts about seahorses. He illustrates his facts with really cool photos showing seahorses living in their environment while telling about how seahorses facts. For example you can read:"I wish I were a seahorse so I would be able to be pregnant. [Did you know that the male seahorse can be pregnant? The male fertilizes the eggs in his pouch and then they are transferred to the female]."Recommend.
summary: Facts presented in a fun way

reviewText: I liked the content. Pictures showed okay on the Paperwhite.  Unfortunately, 60% of the book is just bits about other books available -- so, mostly ads I guess.
summary: Facts, photos and "please buy these other books"

reviewText: This was my first taste of English author Pembrey’s work, though I do have his novel – The Woman Who Stopped Traffic, sitting on my kindle.The Harbour Master is a 100-odd page novella set in Amsterdam, somewhere I haven’t yet visited on my reading travelling. Pembrey’s tale was fast-paced and interesting.We had a 54 year old cop being side-lined and pushed out by his superiors as they seek to concentrate resources on cases that attract decent publicity that plays well in the media for their political masters. Henk is conflicted whether to resist or give in and depart quietly. When he’s sidelined after showing an interest in the body in the harbour case, he decides to resist.His wife seems to be facing similar difficulties in her chosen profession of journalism. His daughter is at university and a degree of separation and misunderstanding is an element within the family dynamic. This was an interesting tangent to the main drive of the narrative, but it helped put a bit of flesh on the bones, without detracting from the pace of the investigation.The further Henk delved into the case, the closer his family came into danger.Amsterdam, canals, Red Light District, prostitutes, pimps, Hungarian gangs, people trafficking, local politicians, corruption, influence, police resources, media, murder, death, tattoos, mis-trust, family, retirement and more.I’m not going to pretend this was the best book I have ever read, but it did the job and ticked enough boxes to have me looking forward to his longer treatment.We had enough depth to our main cop character - Henk without getting bogged down with unnecessary fluff. The plot moved quickly and held my interest – I’ve not come across Hungarian gangsters before in either my fictional reading or in following European news in general – so I’m unsure if they are an author invention or a real problem, maybe slightly less bothersome than the Russian mafia. I’m minded enough to find out though.Our setting, Amsterdam was a first for me in a crime book setting and it was interestingly portrayed. I doubt that I’ll be rushing to pay a visit sometime soon. I think my previous perception of every building being either a brothel, sex shop or a church was only partially borne out as Pembrey didn’t introduce many churches into his narrative!All in all – quick and satisfying.4 from 5I was sent a file-copy of this by the author in return for an honest review,

OMG found this book when someone posted it on Facebook. LOVE IT. I am a big paranormal reader and this is one i will read over again. I have never read anything from Ms. Thorn before and this will not be the last one i read. I had already bought book 2 before i was half way finished. Awsome storyline,hot alpha male,strong female , great sex scenes,and some funny moments which i enjoy in a book. Tah is a lion shifter who has no idea he is one.Abby is his mate who has figured it out before Tah.On the run from hunters ,Tah and Abby end up with there own pride of shifters and that is where we will get LOTS more books out of Ms.Thorn, I hope. Do not pass up this series it is fantastic. I wait with bated breath for book three. Now go out and buy this  series.

I enjoy the story of this series, as the lives and connections are revealed by Mary Campisi.  The small town setting is quaint, and everybody knows everybody...this is so true, to small town life.  I will be sure and read the next book in the series due out this fall.

If you have ever dreamed of getting back at someone for something this is the book for you.  The Bully, by Racheal Hoffman is an intense roller coaster of a ride through into the mind of one teenager who has experienced more than most in her young life.  A quick and nail biting read, it is a good book on a late Friday night.  Curl up in my favorite blanket and pajamas I was white knuckled as I held the book, such suspense and drama.  If you find yourself drawn to the teen appeal of the Twilight Series with the severe angst and rage of Carrie then this book is definitely for you.
summary: Great Read on a Stormy Friday Night

reviewText: At first hearing the title 'Organizing your home you life and yourself " you would think it be a boring book but no its not that way. It was helpful for me to see why it is important to be organized. Tells you of some of the hidden stressors be unorgainized can give you. Like how a simple thing as being organized can help with anxiety or stress and your life. The book goes on to inform all of us some basic ways to get better organized. By break down was to become organized helps all of us better our lives. If you unorganized and looking for a better way to organized your life I highly suggest you take a couple minutes and read this book.

This book was very informative! There is a lot of things new parents don't consider when they conceive, or even when they start thinking about it. There are a lot of variables involved in parenthood that you really must think about. Vanessa Pagan outlines a lot of these things in a very concise, well organized manner. Pregnancy is trying on both parties. Everyone can assume that the pregnancy is hard on the mother, but it is hard on the soon to be daddy as well. I would recommend this book to anyone newly pregnant or thinking about having a child soon. Definitely something you should go over together with your partner, so you know what to expect, what to plan for. Everything from growing pains to college funds, it is all covered in this wonderful book. A five star read for sure!

I bought this book for my husband, in hopes that he would take a more active role in the birth of our second child. When I was pregnant with our first child, he just sat on the sidelines, making me feel as though I was all alone on my journey to motherhood. After much nagging and prodding, he finally read the book and it must have flipped a switch in his brain, because literally overnight, he became more loving and attentive. He was even excited about helping me through my pregnancy. He talked about everything he learned and tried to “prepare” me for the road ahead. Although I already knew what to expect, having gone through this before, I realized that this time would be very different, as I wouldn't be going through it all alone. My husband actually stuck to his word and has played an active role in my pregnancy during the last seven months. As we await the birth of our own little girl next month, I’m excited about our future and the bond between my husband and I grows stronger every day.
Finally, what a series! Unbelievably real, raw and intense! Loved Jack and Andrews journey!  Sara York is amazing! Go get this one people!

I literally had to read this in one sitting. I loved the angst, and sexual tension between the characters. I think the story line was perfectly played out. When I got to the ending I wanted to throw my phone, but god, what a great and unexpected ending!  I look forward to the rest of the series!
summary: FAST, FUN, Can't wait for more!!

reviewText: Andrew Hamilton is hot hot hot! This is one of the best books I have read in a long time!
OMG! Uber good! Absolutely love it. She got right to the juicy. The end is an absolute shocker. CANNOT WAIT for the rest of the story. #AnxiouslyWaitingPatiently
Wow loved this book from start to finish I really need part 2 now ! I can't believe it ended like that seriously.  !

I finally found an amazing author! Let me just say thank you....for writing a good and different story from what I've read thus far. I haven't written a five star review in weeks and I've hated it. I don't like writing bad reviews but I feel like its the least I can give back to the author after they spend their time on writing something. I owe them honesty...and I hope that they read my reviews and expand and better their craft!!!I absolutely loved this book...but I wish it would have been a bit longer.....Aubrey... I loved her...and Andrew...omg what a huge male reproductive organ!!!!! This man was infuriating but I loved him and I cannot wait to see what happens next....since I loved the dimension on this book I will buy more from this author happily!!!!
I give this book five stars. It was entertaining, hot as he'll and I loved Aubrey and Andrew. I can not wait I need to read book two.

Holy s***! I need the next book right now! Usually a story this short doesn't appeal to me, but with all of the 5 star reviews I had to give it a shot...so glad I did! Devoured it! This was my first Whitney Gracia WIlliams book and it definitely won't be my last!
I was addicted to this fast paced HOT book. It flew by I loved Andrews blatant honesty. But that cliff hanger....oh my gosh...left me dying for the next book.  I never saw it coming!

If the blurb to this book doesn't grab your attention, you might want to consult your doctor. Having said that, this book was awesome! It's a shorter novella you can finish in one sitting. Andrew and Aubrey had me right away. It made me think of the the show Catfish on MTV and all the people that pretend to be someone they aren't as they hide behind their computer screen living in a fantasy world.This book weaves together a mysterious storyline that will leave you craving more of the arrogant Andrew that you can't help but find seriously sexy. His demands are in your face throughout most of the storyline. His desires are never down-played and most of all, his unique sense of humor will leave you shaking your head. The dynamic between him and Aubrey is intense and there is no room for excuses. Lies aren't tolerated and there are no apologies.Sometimes in life the things you crave the most are the worst for you. In other cases, you simply can't take no for an answer or demonstrate any sense of control when you need it most. You need to read this book to see for yourself everything the author has created. It's clever, fresh and will leave you wanting more! More Andrew, more Aubrey and more answers!

All I can say is WOW! I have absolutely no words for who and what Andrew is!!! On the surface you should dislike him, but I don't. I can't!!! I can't wait to read the rest of his story. This is a serial so don't start reading it and get all pissy about the none-ending but if you want to read about an alpha who is so over the top it's crazy - READ. THIS. You won't be disappointed.

Too short of a story...but I floved it!  The banter between Aubrey and Andrew had me laughing and the heat between them...hot!  Can't wait to read the next book and hopefully more stories from this author.  I let the way she writes...Very smooth flowing easy read.
This is an exceptional book. Well written, great plot and a frustrating cliff hanger. Can't wait to read what happens next.

Ok I will admit that I was very hesitant to buy this book even though it was only $0.99. It was so short (78 pages >.<) that I figured I'd be frustrated as hell when I finished reading it. I was pleasantly surprised at what I found. Yes I am irritated but only because I now get to twiddle my thumbs and wait patiently for the next one (sigh). I have been sucked in yet again!Andrew hates liars. There is absolutely no excuse. Running from a previous betrayal in his life he makes up for it by having meaningless sex with random woman over and over again. His only rule is only one night."One dinner. One night. No repeats."Then he meets "Alyssa" on an online Lawyer-Chat. She insists they can only be friends. No meeting face to face. He wants her in his bed. After six months he is tired of waiting. Then they meet in the last place they would ever imagine.She lied......but so did he.
I Don't usually do reviews but this story was so exciting.  Aubrey was time enough for Andrew. I loved their chemistry together, can't wait for the next two books.  Bring it on :)

Whitney grabbed a hold of my attention Nd kept it through the entire story!! Fat has a way.intervening when you least expect!! This book was.recommended by a friend and I was hooked!! An extremely hot ALPHA with trust issues and a feisty passionate Woman equals an explosion of intrigue and hotness! Can't wait to read the next onr
summary: Yes sir may I have ANOTHER!!

reviewText: Reasonable Doubt gives us the short and steamy story of Andrew and Aubrey. These two are a match made in heaven. Having been burned in the past by reasons we still don't know, Andrew has a rule one night rule with all women. He has very little personal relationships with anyone but the illustrious "Alyssa" with whom he's created a sexually fun friendship with only via the phone and internet. The curiosity this dynamic builds for the reader totally satisfies. There's a slow burn happening and the anticipation makes for a fun reading experience. And, "Alyssa" matches Andrew blow for blow in funny snark and charming banter. Her character has secrets that we are privileged to know but Andrew is not. She's a total spitfire with him and I adored the fight in her. Both characters are charismatic and engaging. When "Alyssa" commits the ultimate betrayal in Andrew's eyes, flaming hot sparks ignite from the slow burning fire they've been slowly stoking. Even though Reasonable Doubt is a novella and quite short, it packs a mean punch. I'm excited to read the next installment to get more of these characters especially after that ending. Gah!

HOLY HOTNESS! THIS BOOK! - I literally stumbled across this one as I was one-clicking another. I saw the cover and the 5 STARS underneath and thought to myself “well what do we have here?”BEST. DECISION. EVER!This is not a novel. It’s an approximate 78 page novella, it costs 99c and it should be on everyones e-reader. I was never one to just pick up a short story. I love a book I can bury myself into on a cold rainy day. But this one needs to be the exception.Reasonable Doubt was one of the HOTTEST reads I have read in a really really long time. It’s quick, laugh out loud funny, sexy as all hell and has left me begging for part II.“Is there super-glue on my floor? Is that why you’re still standing there?”Andrew Hamilton is addicted to sex. He has it with a different woman every time. No repeats. He meets them from an online dating site and then kicks them out. Then he connects with ‘Alyssa’ and they strike up a sexy online friendship that consists of texts, emails and phone calls.“I’m busy..”“Then why did you answer the phone?”“Because the sound of my voice makes you wet.”  – AndrewAndrew wants to meet ‘Alyssa’ in person but she continues to brush him off for fear of ruining their friendship. Then she turns up at an interview at his law firm, not knowing it’s his, and then this is when the story gets even hotter!I could not get enough of Andrew Hamilton. This cocky, selfish, successful, filthy mouthed, stubborn, sexy SOB has me completely addicted and oh my god I need more!!This book is FILLED with hot sex, lies, secrets, hot sex, lots of dirty talk and did I mention the hot sex?Absolutely LOVED it.Can’t wait for more!

Better Date Than Never is a fantastic book. It has a great story line and the characters are so wonderful that you just fall in love with them. Molly Zenk did a fantastic job of outlining the characters and describing them in perfect detail. I love how she used two best friends. Marshall and Cindy have been best friends forever, who better to fall in love with than your best friend. You get the best of both worlds that way. This is one of the best romantic novels that I have read in a long time. I would recommend it for anyone that likes romance novels, or just a good book to read.

If books with a romantic page turner is what your looking for I highly suggest you take a look at " The Better Date Than Never Book." This book revolves around 2 main character who have been friends from the day there were born which just so happened to be the same day. They were inseparable by going to same college and even getting jobs at same company. They had one big issue they each had partners that were jealous of there friendship. As the book goes on you see all the challengers faced with the characters and find out who truly stays together or not.

The Summer Series by by C.J. Duggan has become one of my favorites and I have thoroughly enjoyed getting to know each of the Onslow Boys and the girls they love, and while I do love each of them, my favorite thus far has been Sean Murphy from An Endless Summer, the second book in the series.  Well, I have to say while I do love you dearly Sean, you are going to have to step down from the throne because Ringer has taken your place as my favorite Onslow boy thus far.  While I enjoyed getting to know Ringer in the other books in the series (which are companion novels), I totally fell in love with him in this book, and I can't wait for you to meet him.Miranda Henry is the love interest in the book and the female main character.  She is a biatch to the hilt, but I really did like her a lot.  She was just the kind of girl Ringer needed, and I think he is probably the only one who could handle her.  That said, Ringer is also just the kind of guy Miranda needed also, and probably only one who would capture her attention, as well as probably the only girl who could handle him.  Their relationship was a love-hate one filled with firey passion, and while they couldn't stand each other to start with, they also couldn't deny the chemistry and the desire for one another either.  I have to say that their inner rantings as well as the banter between them was hilarious and proved to provide for one entertaining read..The other Onslow boys make an appearance as well, which was awesome, and we got to meet a few new characters also.This is a 155 page novella, but it packs a punch and leaves you feeling totally satisfied and content with both the content and the ending, giving you more the feel of a novel.  There is also a wonderful epilogue, which I also adored.  I can't wait to read the next book in the series, which will be Adam and Ellie's story, and will be coming out in July.  If you are a contemporary romance fan, especially of the new adult genre, then this is a book and a series that stands out among the many and one I most certainly highly recommend.

From the moment he agreed to help his friend, Max, out for the summer, Ringer James knew his life would change. Whether it's for bad or good, he's not exactly sure. He's tired of seeing his friends all lovey-dovey over their new girlfriends while he sits on the sidelines. Granted, he's always been the bad boy of the bunch, loving and leaving his own women whenever possible. Still, he's sick of being surrounded by so much love and sweetness.Making his way to his summer destination, Ringer never imagines the chaos that ensues. Having almost gotten run over on the way there, he's begun to wonder if the effort in getting away is worth it. Part of him doesn't think so, but he's agreed to do what he can for Max, and he'll stand by his word no what happens. Besides, things can't be that bad, can they?Meeting Miranda Henry soon changes his way of thinking. She's beautiful, brazen, and bad to the bone. In a sense, she's exactly like him, except she wants nothing to do with him. Ringer can't quite fathom as to why since he's never set eyes on her until now. The girl obviously knows what she wants, and it sure isn't him. A fact she makes known whenever possible.Refusing to give in to the way things are, Ringer sets out to teach Miranda a lesson she'll never forget. He's out in the middle of nowhere, determined to do the best job he can. There's nothing he's going to let a mere girl get in the way of. When things start heating up between them, and he sees a side of Miranda he never thought possible, he soon wonders what he's gotten himself. Will he be able to tame the lovely Miranda? Or will she end up being the one to teach him a lesson in return?Another lovely addition to The Boys Of Summers series, this is definitely a book you're going to want to read. The story picks up from Ringer's point-of-view, and tosses you head-first into his hectic summer. Things certainly et interesting when he and Miranda Henry collide.C. J. has created such delightful characters that anyone of an any age can relate to. The camaraderie between each character pours off each page, and you can vividly envision the world and environments she's created. This series is one that you'll definitely find yourself reading time and again. Looking forward to more of The Boys of Summer and what else C. J. has to bring soon enough.Please Note: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Another Lovely Addition To The Boys Of Summers Series

reviewText: Just like every other book by CJ Duggan, I fell in love with Ringer. Of course I mean the character too!He is sexy and knows it. He just wants to enjoy life, no attachments. In order to get away from all the love of Onslow, he take a job out of town as an escape. He wasn't aware of the she-devil beauty that was also returning home.Miranda expected to come back from Paris and not return home. That was until she thought her parents needed her. She didn't  know they hired Ringer. She would have left, but she didn't have a chance since her car gave out on her. Now she is stranded, missed, and making sure the world knows it.Ringer is awesome! I mean the book, duh! It is written from both Ringer and Miranda's POVs.  The book is well written. The characters are perfect. They are very well portrayed. I had a hard time sleeping because I only wanted to finish the book. I really enjoyed this read! Cannot wait for Adam's book!~Alyssa

I really like the other three books and will read the next release. But ...this one feel short for me. the lead female is a spoiled brag and I cant figure out what the guy saw in her to make her more than a quick fling to say he tagged a hot chick over the get away
summary: not as good.as the rest of the series

reviewText: The Evil that Men Do is an edge of the seat thriller/horror story that is right of there with the movies that have been based on similar stories.  I could definitely see this as a horror movie in the future and it would have me and my wife holding each other. Niemiec is great at painting vivid pictures of what is going on and leaving you with suspense over and over gain.  You really are drawn into Brad and Maggie's predicament and struggle and it feels like they truly are your friends.  This book is a great example of how Brad does anything he needs too survive and protect Maggie at all costs.This book is a fast read and I read it in 2 hours because I just couldn't put it down.  It was so suspenseful!

in a fine line of books by TJ Reeder.  This one I had the opportunity to read from cover to cover in one sitting during vacation. As always very entertaining. The characters are all people I would love to be acquainted with in real life. I can't wait for the next edition.

I've really enjoyed the entire series of "When Heaven Meets Hell", but I think it could have been put ALL in one book instead of so many.  This last book was a dissapointment. It didn't have the same "zing" the rest have.  If you have read them all, except this last one, wait until it drops to 99 cents to buy it.  You have probably waited this long to read it, so a little longer won't hurt.  I will be buying more books by JM Dragon in the future.  ( I will really miss the Ladies)

Pushing Boundaries picks up where Pushing limits ends.  This is NOT a standalone book.  If you haven’t read Pushing Limits, then you will be completely lost.Tommy stayed away from Amber trying to decide if he can handle their relationship.  After his ex-fiancée left him heartbroken he knows he can’t go through that again.Amber tried to get Tommy to listen and allow her to explain what really happen, only to be shut out completely.  Moving on seems to be her only option left until Tommy corners her into giving their relationship another chance.Giving in to Tommy demands that they try again isn’t a hard decision for Amber.  Being apart has made her realize just how much she really does care for him.Crazy friends and ex’s, major family drama, and Amber learning to live without her families financial support are just some of the battles Amber and Tommy face as the start a life together.I started off really enjoying Pushing Boundaries.  The first half of the book was mainly about Tommy and Amber and the bond they are forming.  I enjoyed them as they were taking the next step and starting a life together.For me personally, the second half of the book was all over the place.  You have Sally’s the crazy roommate and cousin who is whoring all over campus causing heartbreaks everywhere she goes.  Then Karen and her boyfriend problems, and now someone is attacking women on campus.Amber and Tommy have a very hot sexual relationship. They both enjoy BDSM and Tommy is helping Amber discover what she likes, however that plays a very small roll in the book compared to Sally and even Karen at the end.  So once again, my biggest complaint, and for this one it’s really the only complaint is that the secondary character took too much away from the main characters.  But with that being said, I still enjoyed Tommy and Amber and this completes their story.ARC was kindly given to me by the author in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Good follow up to Amber and Tommy's story

reviewText: Oh man this was a fun read! I have read all of the Brie series and loved them. This book was just great. I would love to read a series full of Brian with Sir. You are an amazing writer!

Another home run by Red Phoenix ... a great twist on her amazing Submissive Training center story ... what if Brie was a boy, aka Brian. I wasn't sure if I would like this spin but it worked, it really worked and brought me right back into the training center world.
summary: Great twist on Red Phoenix's Submissive Training center story

reviewText: The pages are horribly scrambled and I could not pick up a theme without much confusion.  I am removing from my device.

Dax...the emo bitch drummer from Amatory Riot...at least that is what everyone thinks of him. The man has more layers than the road to hell and Sydney Charell may be just the person to peel them back. Danger still surrounds them and more secrets are revealed, but will it be in time? With their enemies now in the open, there is nowhere to hide...and not everyone can be saved.

Followed all five books so far and found it a good read, that has kept my interest so far. Easy to follow and has a good story behind it. love, sex, murder, mystery, and family issues, which everyone can relate to.  waiting for book six Dead Serious
summary: A great read to keep following

reviewText: COME ON!!!!!!! (Stomps feet) Ugh!!! I hate cliff hangers, but damn this series is good. I love Turner and Naomi, who doesn't love Turner. But in this book we get to really see Dax, and he's pretty special too. I don't want him with Naomi. No, only Turner can handle her. But Sydney....Yes, I'm liking them together. I can't really say much about the book without providing spoilers, and for this series, you really need to read it blind to enjoy it. I will tell you that what we learn about Dax, and some of the things from his past will make your heart ache for him and understand a little bit more about who he is. There are some secrets revealed and there is one serious event that just happened at the end that had me gasping and yelling WTF!! So be ready. It's another amazing ride.I cannot wait for the next book in this series entitled Dead Serious. WOW....I need a drink.
summary: Holy WOW!! Did that just happen??

reviewText: 3.5 - 4.0 WRONG STARS!I have spent the past 72 hours immersed into C.M. Stunich's gritty world of Rock and NO if I didn't get another cliffhanger!I will say that Dax McCann is not my cup of tea...He seems to have his own life drama and a lot of connections to the macabre s***going on with the tour, but for me, I will say his story was just meh'.He is the "Emo" guy...you know? He may be in love with Naomi with but he is no Turner Campbell! Perhaps I am drawn to the cocky arrogance and complete idiocy that goes with Turner's actions, so Dax is just a background player for me. I felt his tale was just a pit stop on the tour to buy time.This is also where we are now introduced to Ms Sydney Charell...She is Trey's trailer court sister, stripper extraordinaire, and honestly a somewhat decent gal with some serious smarts! WTH is she even doing in this mix of cray-cray? She is basically a hot chick resembling Naomi who might just give Dax a ride and a fresh start. This read is filled with Turner and Dax bickering, Naomi bouncing with guilt, and some crazy psycho opening everyone's closes filled with ugly skeletons...Sydney is a breath of fresh air that doesn't quite fit the tale only to cause teenage hormone reactions out of one lonely drummer!Dax cannot even get in the same room with this chick without a major raging boner...however, unlike the previous books, the horizontal actions are pretty limited! I was starting to think that Turner was right and maybe DAX liked penis...I mean come on, Sydney is rocking hot and she wants you...take her! Who knows where these two will end up! I will say that they have a much more open communicative relationship and a more emotional connection, but I want the raw grit back!Oh well...it seems as if I will have to sit back and wait for my Turner Campbell and Naomi Knox time to come.
I truly got nothing from this book and wound up flipping through it hoping to find something useful.  It wasn't for me.

Loved this book.  Diana Gabaldon moved the story along wonderfully with this book.  I couldn't put it down and even tried to go slow at the. End so it wouldn't end so soon.  You saw the cliffhanger coming at the end...so not sure if that makes it not a cliffhanger.

Book Review- Beloved Enemy by Lacy YagerEver since Genevieve was taken off the MIT campus by Maggie and Lily and brought to the compound, she has kept to herself planning some kind of escape.  She refuses to stay with these crazy people.  Josh seems comfortable here so she is on her own.She tries sneaking out the garage but runs into a group in a standoff that includes vampires.  She comes face to face with Chad, a vampire who was sent to fight with them. Genevieve screams in fear and strengthens her determination to escape. Her next attempt leads her back to the garage and into the back of one of the SUVs.  When part of the group leaves in search of the CAT, the hybrid vampires, Genevieve is hidden away.  She makes it out of the compound but realizes she is leaving Boston too.  She has to wait and bide her time until they stop and she can sneak away.However, she is found and paired with Chad.  She is then forced to accompany the group in their search.  Chad is not thrilled about being stuck with the human.  In fact he lets his anger get the best of him as he walks away from the group.  Genevieve lets her fear get the best of her and it causes the mission to get extremely dangerous very quickly.  The group barely makes it out alive.Chad protects Genevieve and feels guilty for letting everyone down.  In order to make up for his mistake, he becomes the one to donate blood to help Genevieve when she decides to stay and help.  Her job is to find something that will help destroy the CAT when no weapon they possess will.Chad partners up with her and continues to protect her even though he tries to deny his feelings.  He will never be good for her.  He isn’t whole.Genevieve is driven to find the one thing that will stop the CATs and her own mission which is the cure for cancer.  She can’t afford to be distracted.  Too many are counting on her.I have read a number of books from this series and I really like it.  In fact I request them when I find them up for review.  I have invested in the characters and enjoy the storyline.  The author proves in her books that people can change and enemies can become friends.  The fact that the good guys are becoming more of a group of humans, vampires, warlocks, and chasers banding and fighting together is proof.The book is action packed containing betrayal and even intrigue.  Fight scenes are peppered throughout the story and balanced with Genevieve’s research.  I give it a 4 out of 5 and impatiently wait for the next one to come out.

Really good book for beginners on yoga. Real simple and easy to follow and understand. This book really takes you by the hand shows you step by step in a concise way. You'll be taking baby steps until you find your feet with yoga and a also packed with information on the health benefits on yoga
This is a great book for beginners complete with a series of yoga poses with detailed instructions and pictures so you know you're doing it the right way.

This publication should be titled as " Reminder Notes " . In that context it meets its cut and dried role. You can finish reading these notes in less than 10 minutes. Another 15 pages of additional insights , might have earned these brief notes a 3-Star rating. This is not a book. It is an outline and a very brief one. One $ price justifies its minimal existence.

Nicely revealed the tips and it's easy to grab. It's written so simply, so it is easy to understand and maintain. To look younger, this guide will be a good guide and hope you will get some benefits from it. I already followed some tricks and it's working.

As a woman I am always interested in ways to make me look younger. So when I got the chance to download this book for free I did and I found plenty of useful tips in the book. The tips on the right food, supplements and exercises you can do are great and easy to follow. All together its a well written book and can certainly recommend it.
great Sequel, to a great book

Great story about an Academy that kidnaps kids and mutates them.  Then goes through a process to weed out the weak from the strong.The first book was great and set up this 2nd book beautifully.  The 2nd book builds on the story about the army being made.  This book follows Asa through the 2nd semester at the Academy.If you liked the first book you will love the 2nd.  Turning into a great series for me and I would highly recommend.
summary: I love this story, book 2 is even better then the first!

reviewText: Even though it says this is book 7 in the series, My mistake can be read as a standalone. This was my introductory book by this author. And I can honestly say it won’t be my last. This is a book about fate. After a broken marriage Casey is trying to start over only to go back home and run into her childhood crush. Who she hasn’t seen or heard from for years. When Brent and Casey reconcile as friends, you can just feel the chemistry. That spark is still there! I love it when you are able to get a sense of the chemistry between the two characters and it doesn’t seem forced or pushed. It just flowed. The author did a wonderful job to keep me stuck in. I went through a whirlwind of emotions. And the twist.. I did not see that coming. But I am not going to ruin it. This is definitely a must read and I have already started going though purchasing some of her other work. I can’t wait to read more from this author.Erica ~ The Book Nuts

I was given a complimentary copy in return for an honest review.What can I say about this book... HOTT!!!Lisa came home after her brother died in the line of duty. She ran into her brothers best friend and ex lover Brian. Little did she know what he was involved in and what she would be soon be involved in because of her feelings towards Brian.This book was amazing and it certainly will not be my last of Olivia Rigal's :)
I am really enjoying this book.  I cannot wait for the next one to find out what happens.  I hope it comes out soon.
Great book!!! Very emotional in some parts!!! Definitely left me wanting more!! Some mystery that left me wondering and excited for the next one!!
This book was great just am getting tired of all these books ending with cliffhangers anymore. I loved Brian and the whole plot of storyline. Hope the next one comes out soon.

More lecture about the end of Civilization as we know it.I would have enjoyed it more if the author had stuck to the stories, and let the readers figure out the lecture on their own.What with the antichrist showing up, I will pass on the remainder of the series.
summary: End of the World, Lecture TWO

reviewText: Hmmmm how should I start?  The story was one of a ménage with twin dominant alien brothers.  Amanda, the heroine,  is a feisty woman who is told she is a hybrid alien just like them.  She is told she is  about to mature into a full blooded alien and needs to follow their domination.  There is definite age play and diapers and medical examinations, used to asses her change into alien, but also to dominate her.  There are spankings, and beltings, but nothing too heavy.  There is a battle scene between the bad aliens trying to take her away from her mates and the rest of the knights.  It was a little short and I would have liked to see what the alien change did to her.  What powers she would develop and whether the males would be in awe that the females had power and could do more than they gave them credit for. Alas it ending before we got more of what Amanda could do.  There were many sexual scenes, anal play, and age play.  If that isn’t your thing, well you know.  It was an overall interesting read.

I love this series!!!! I can't get enough! I'm really disappointed in Lamar. He begged for Falisha to go out with him and he does this to her!!! He's such a lame!! In my opinion, Kim doesn't want Lamar, it was the competition with Falisha that made her want him more. So happy that Tammy is getting her a good man! Ralphy needs to get his affairs in order...being a drug dealer is NOT the business!! In Lisa's case, you never mess your water until your well runs dry. Great job!!!!

Romance books need to have characters that are relatable and presented in ways that make you appreciate and like them.At the end of the book I was wanting more.  Which to me is the sign of a great book.Annabelle is a shy smart girl that wants more out of life.  She is thrown into the events that unfold after some "stuff" pushed her to travel and find herself.  Suspense, thrills, romance, and action are all part of this great book.  I would highly recommend.

An Amazing Story with an engulfing plot that left me breathless and full of emotion.I read this book in just one night, it has all of the characteristics needed to last the test of time and truly swept me away. I was enthralled in the storyline of this amazing novel that kept me wanting more.Main character Annabelle Hart was described to perfection. Her overall lack of self-esteem and troubles made me think of a few close family members that could relate to her personality. I will definitely be sending them a copy of the book for them read. No spoiler, but the ending is truly one that will open the floodgates of emotion.Generally speaking the book is really a quick read, that is if your like me and can put down a 200-page book in one night. I wish it would have been a little longer, but overall an amazing read that would certainly take you away in a sweeping fashion. No editing errors and is written smoothly and is a faced paced manner that allows for an easy read. Author Wendy Owens also does a fantastic job with describing the characters and scenery, which I felt, placed me center stage into the heat of everything taking shape.5 Stars!
summary: An Amazing Story with an engulfing plot that left me breathless and full of emotion.

reviewText: This book is not a dry textbook about atheism. It covers all the salient points of why a person would want to be an atheist in a logical, reasonable manner. You definitely don't want to get into an internet debate about religion with other people unless you have this book at the ready! Highly recommended.

Expanding on the first A Dance of Dragons series, while waiting for the 2nd in the series....exciting, romantic, adventureous, tension...this short novella has it all...makes you want the Kaitlyn Davis, the author to write FASTER!!!

The Golden Cage by Kaitlyn Davis is a prequel novella to the Dance of Dragons series. My super short review: Wow. My more extensive review: Just wow. This novella was gripping and full of fantasy and intrigue and I just didn't want it to end. I read it quickly in one setting and I wanted more! Yes...more of this please. I just honestly loved everything about this novella. Not only the concept and the story itself...but the telling of the story is beautifully done. The writing flows well and the author has just written a really solid novella. I cannot wait to read the rest of this series. It is pushing other books out of my TBR as we speak.

This is a novella but it packs a lot of "grab you" in such a small page count! A king with 12 daughters and one son. At his fifth birthday he is gifted a sword with jewels and a sharp edge and because of a small misstep by the servant presenting it to him, the little boy becomes a barbaric image of his father in one small act. It is the last act that gives Leena the push to leave with her lover. She wanted to save her half brother, keep him from being like their father, but seeing no chance of it now, she and her lover plan their escape. As you can imagine, things aren't that simple.It's a good story, Leena reminding me of a strong heroine from other stories. For some reason it feels like this setting is in the Far East, but there really isn't a reason I can say why. Just my idea. I thought at first with the twelve sisters this would be part of a retelling of the Twelve Dancing Princesses. No, not at all. There is the hint of political scheming going on, a barbaric and misogynistic ruler, and adventure. I've read the synopsis for the next full novel and I can't see how they are connected at all, but I am going to read it. The story is not unique, but it is compelling enough that I want to know what happens to Leena and what that next story has to do with her story.If you enjoy fantasy, I think you'll enjoy this one. The world building has just begun but the palace, the place where Leena lives is the Gold kingdom and down it goes from there until the stone meets the ocean. I think this is going to be really good. And even the hint of dragons....I'm ready to read more.

reviewText: very well written book holds your attention and full of action I think I have found another new Author to fill my evenings

Once I started Waiting For Prince Harry, I could not put it down.It exceeded all of my expectations!Kylie was quirky. An obsessive girl who loves personality quizzes and is afraid to speak up.Harry was perfect. A hunky hockey player who was deliciously sexy.Their relationship was like a steaming mug of mexican hot chocolate – sweet and comforting but with a little kick of something special.Aven is my new favorite romance author because:1.) She writes perfect male characters. The right balance of charming, sexy, masculine, and caring. I find many authors try to write a perfect fantasy man and fall flat because they come off as being unbelievable. Instead of making me swoon, the crap that comes out of their mouths sounds like a woman trying to write a perfect male character. Aven, on the other hand, writes my perfect man. Nothing Harry said made me eye-roll. In fact, I was so busy swooning over him that I can’t remember much except for the wild beat of my pitter-pattering heart.2.) She paints scenes so you feel like you are watching them play out. The clothing, the food, the way she describes movements. This book came alive for me and it felt more like watching a great romantic comedy than reading a book. In fact, this book should be a movie because that would be most enjoyable.3.) She makes me laugh. This book was down right funny! I was cracking up over different scenes and little one-liners. It was super entertaining and an absolute pleasure to read. It truly brightened my day.I would recommend this book to anyone looking for a pick me up. It was sunshine on a cloudy day.

I reviewed this at MustReadBooksOrDie with my friend Shelley!Court: We adored the surprise that was Aven Ellis and her writing when we read Connectivity last year so to say that we had high hopes for her sophomore release would be an understatement! But it delivered! A lot...even with what I described to Shelley as Aven leaving us with metaphorical blue balls with sexual tension and fade to black scenes...sigh. lol. Shel: Haha...she fades to black when it comes to the sexy scenes but I respect that. It wasn't needed in order for me to enjoy the story.Court: Kylie and Harrison's story is really sweet...until it isn't...Harrison is really fantastical and swoon worthy...until, you guessed it, he sometimes isn't...And Kylie...Kylie is a confident, well educated woman....until....*echo* she isn't. So I will leave you to ponder on that for a while...Shel: These two are adorable. Court's correct in that they both have a few sensitive spots that cause outbursts and anxious times but I'm grateful that these were moments that were few and far between.Court: I loved the moments of Kylie and Harrison. Every single one. From the unassuming way they met, to how they reconnect (totally realistic and fun...loved that) to how they progress through getting to know each other and adjusting to Harrison's fame as a hottie hockey player. And then...as I mentioned...Harrison has some bouts of insecurities of his own and does not handle them very well...which I was kind of grateful for because it made him seem more rough around the edges and normal than his sweetheart attitude made him to be at first...and we love the bad boys. Shel: I love that Kylie is a smidge neurotic (but she totally owns it) and that he finds her quirks adorable. And, I love that she has absolutely no desire to be connected to Harrison's fame at all. Their love story is quick but the way they connect doesn't seem too fast or too impulsive or too off at all. I found it incredibly sweet and a nice break from the angst-fest we sometimes read (with the exception of some jerks--because there are definitely some jerks that make an appearance).Court: I love when I have actually visited the setting being portrayed and recognize places (Hello, ice skating at the Galleria in Dallas...my experience was about as great as Kylie's...ice princess, I am not) and that was a lot of fun! I loved the book, the writing, the pace, the characters...there really wasn't anything not to love unless you count Kylie's co-workers (bitches). This was very sweet, and I can't wait to read whatever Aven comes out with next. Shel: Yes. Now I feel the need to stalk hot hockey players..all thanks to Aven.Courtney: 5 starsShelley: 4 Stars
summary: Where is our hot hockey player?

reviewText: She did it again! Author Aven Ellis blew my mind with Waiting For Prince Harry. This novel just plain and simply wonderful. What I thought ( while judging the cover and the blurb ) would be a cute read, turned out to be totally addictive! I had such a hard time putting this book down. I took every spare minute I got ( Okay....I was actually hiding from my kids, don't judge me! This book was worth it, though. * shy smile*) to continue reading about Kylie and Harrison.Dear Lord, where to start with explaining their story?Well, let me tell you first that I had the pleasure of reading the authors previous work ( Connectivity) and I fell in love with her ability to create wonderful characters. In Waiting For Prince Harry, the author left me no other choice than to fall deeply in love with not only the hero but also the heroine of the book.The things they went through as a couple were ( in my opinion ) harder than hell and I am so happy they fought through it all. Being a professional athlete is a dream job, but what comes along with that profession can be exhausting for a couple, especially if 2 people are at the beginning of their relationship. So, you can imagine how hard life was for them, right? Who can deal with having THE most hottest ginger/ green eyed hockey player in the history of the book world as a boyfriend? Not me. Even though it would have killed me to stay away ( people, he's one hot, hotter than hot, bbf!) from Harrison, I couldn't have done what Kylie and Harrison went through. Nope.I also loved how the characters struggled to keep things real without trying to change themselves ( that sounds confusing.....read the book yourself....you'll know what I mean ) The love they share for one another is so grand that it will make you want to find yourselves a Harrison too!My head was spinning from the romance and the fun while reading this book. I love myself some great emotions and I was not disappointed at all.I would highly recommend this book to everyone! If you haven't read anything from this author yet, then I recommend you get yourselves one of her books and start reading...like....NOW! Aven Ellis's writing style is fabulous and her stories are easy to read. I'm not saying her stories are light hearted, because they're not. You get your full package of emotions that will drive you mad and also make you smile..:-)The Divas are eagerly awaiting for the authors next work.Would I recommend this book?YES!Would I re-read this book?Hell yes! This is definitely a MUST READ and a MUST RE- READ book.

What an amazing collection of chilling tales and at an incredible price too.Truly terrifying stories from some of the greatest new talents in horror writing, including the wonderful Scott Nicholson and fantastic Ian Woodhead.Don't miss this superb collection.....

Losing your job can seem like the worst thing that could ever happen to somebody but this book puts a new perspective on what seems like a bad situation. It gives great tips on what to look out for if you think you might be about to lose your job and it also gives great insight on how to make the most of it if you do happen to lose your job. It gives hope and light to a dark situation.

‘The Never Ending Tour’ is the story of a start-up band’s meteoric rise to fame and stardom. Anthony is the youngest member of the group, still being in high school. His parents split; his mom is trying to raise him with no help from his father. Anthony plays guitar in the band. Anthony meets up with the neighborhood bully and they become bandmates. Others are added to the group as time goes on.  The story goes through all the drugs, sex, partying, fighting and wild escapades of a young rock band. In the end, Anthony straightens up and gets his act (literally) together and all ends well.

This story left me breathless, mesmerized!  Beautifully written novel that sends its readers on an emotional tour of life's events, challenges, heartaches and courage without tainting the beauty of love and sacrifice.  Ms.Thomas displayed her artistry in every painted scene and character -- what a page turner! Bravo!

This is my first book by Marian Thomas and I was actually surprised on how good this book was. The story follows young girl thinking back as she grew up to be the first black ballerina. There were some twists and turns and the story came along very well. The characters and the writing was developed nicely. I would recommend this book to others.

Though well written, this book did not have the character depth of an adult read - I believe it would better received by a teenaged audience.  Though many issues were covered, the reader was left with more questions than answers. The characters lacked depth and the story lacked real details.  Though there were some surprises - I would have preferred to learn how Ann was able to accumulate enough dirt on so many people to be able to swing so much clout.

This book is full of baloney.The author did NOT ONCE define the word lazy.This is because there is no true definition of this state of being.To judge what that state of being is would be hypocritical.That is all I get from this book.No science but plenty of self-righteous opinions!!!
I really enjoyed the story line it kept me very interested!  The characters were very fascinating.  You are a very gifted writer and I enjoyed your book!
Downloaded this book about noon.  Would have liked to have seen more or the Empress in the book she was the in law from hell.  Mal's brother and uncle were two sick characters

Usually when i have a good read I have to finish the book  think about it and eagered to read. with this book i have been on chap 7 for a week. It started off ok but not  enough to keep me interested. I give it 3 stars because it was only 99 cents
This is a really good read. There are a few typing errors but I guarantee you will not be disappointed by buying this book.

Ever MineNathan Alexander is shocked when his nutty Aunt Millie sends him a plant with a real fairy in its leaves. He thought he was losing his mind when the little fairy started speaking to him, but when she suddenly loses her wings and grows to human size he has a whole new set of problems to deal with.Meet Katenia, she has been kidnapped and moved out of her valley to this strange place that has so many humans and confusing customs. If the elders of her race find her with humans she knows she will be banned from her home for the rest of her life.....and because she is immortal she has an endless array of lonely times ahead of her. As Kat learns more about her handsome rescuer and all the evil he is unknowingly surrounded by, she admits to herself that this human male feels like her forever mate.....but how can this be, when he isn't immortal?As evil witches and bat crazy relatives pursue there own agenda regarding the gorgeous fairy, Nate needs to decide how hard he is willing to fight to keep a love he didn't even know existed for him!ARC received from author and Netgalley in exchange for an honest review.*
summary: Great book, loved the new world!

reviewText: Good finish to a good series. It was all about Nina's pregnancy and shortly after. Glad I read it. 3.5 stars.

This is a great book for cooking simple meals for 2. The recipes are well balanced and are delicious. I tried the beef burgers stuffed with blue chees and my husband is still talking about it! Can't wait to try some more recipes from this book like the crispy potato frittata and the pasta and lemon basil. Two women taking the time to discover true love. A lovely setting sailing in the Caribbean. giving up city life for a peaceful boat. I would recommend this book to my friends.

reviewText: This book got me into the world of essential oils. I wasn't quite sure what are they for when visiting ethnic and wellness shops, now I've obtained some very useful information, bought myself few boottles and I must say I'm very happy with that decision. Even if you're not really into weight loss, this book will give you some interesting insights. Very good read, especially for this price.

I love “Game of Thrones” and, as a history buff, I bought this book hoping to learn something new. The title, however, is somewhat misleading.  Author does not delve deep into the inspirations behind “Game of Thrones”; he concentrates on particular events from the English history instead. Let me give you an example: the chapter entitled “Red Wedding” is not about the Red Wedding from “Game of Thrones” at all; it tells you about Edward IV’s marriage to Elizabeth Woodville and its political ramifications.This book is an overview of the medieval history of England. It’s an easy read without the hard slog, but it’s definitely not what the title implies it is (“the true history behind Game of Thrones”). There are several historical inaccuracies in the book (author, for example, says that Edward III’s mother Isabella died when he was a child while in fact she died when he was an adult).
summary: Sadly, does not live up to the promise of its title.

This was a great prequel to the Seductive Night Series. I really liked Clay and Julia. They have electric sexual chemistry, plus they really just had a great time together. Both seem to need someone to make them happy. Julia apparently owes someone money because of her ex-boyfriend. We're not given a lot of information regarding the specifics yet, but it looks to be a lot of cash. With Clay living over three thousand miles away, it'll take some work, but I hope they can make it work.Looking forward to Night After Night releasing in April.

Really like this story but was kind of confused reading this one because when I read the next one it repeated just about everything in this one!!!  This one pretty much seemed like a waste of money when I read the next one "Night After Night".  The first 25% was of this book.  I was totally confused, but that being said Otis a good story and one more to coming on May 12th called After this Night.

Meet Clay Nichols:“..the voice was rough and gravelly, and sent a charge through her with its masculine sexiness.”“He was tall. He was broad. He had the perfect amount of stubble on his jawline, and those eyes were to-die for – deep brown and piercing.  Then there was his hair – thick, brown, and ideal for sliding fingers through.  She didn’t want to take her eyes off him, but she knew better than to stare.”Meet Julia Bell:“…hot as sin with those curves, those breasts, and the perfect kind of hips that he’d like to get his hands on.  Her hair was lush and reddish brown. Her lips were full and ripe for kissing. As well as other things. But, more than that, she was feisty, with that smart mouth firing off innuendo with every word. She could dish it out, and she could take it.”Clay and Julia are sexually dominant, confident and hot. They each know what they want and they go into this First Night with no expectations other than hot, steamy sex for some needed release.  I love the interaction between the two of them, feisty and full of sexual innuendos. They seem to “get” each other from the beginning.  They get into it right away; there is no romancing and no prolonged back and forth. They just go for it.  The sex is hot and they each want to dominate and control, but they also know when to submit and let the other take control. I love Clay’s commands and dirty talk. Julia knows how to give it and she knows how to take it.  This novella is all about their night of sex.One of my favorite lines: “Do you want a Purple Snow Globe, Clay?” He met her gaze straight on, her green eyes so inviting. “If it’s a drink, no. If purple snow globe is a secret code word for something naughty, I’m game.”This novella is the prequel to Night After Night, which is a full-length novel that will release on April 18th.  It leads us into what we can expect, some really hot encounters between Julia and Clay, and I expect the unraveling of some issues. I am looking forward to Night After Night for more erotic sex between Julia and Clay, plus I am curious as to how they will solve their biggest dilemma ( I am not going to give this one away).

Mrs. Bennett is a great writer. Her character descriptions are flawless. She captures the good within the characters by them learning through the bad. I enjoyed the series. I'm not a fan of novellas but thankfully there was a boxed set option that felt as one complete novel. It had lots of lust and sexy moments. It was undeniably tasteful. My lack of one star is I don't feel Mac evolved as a character as much as I feel she could of. I felt a bit of disconnect. Matt's character fully evolved but Mac stayed dormant. Matt F****** Connover is overused. It's defiantly still worth the read and you won't be disappointed.
summary: Perfect pinch of lust, sex, & love

reviewText: This book will keep your attention until you reach the end. I immediately liked Mac but it took me a lot longer to warm up to Matt. Definitely recommend

Not since Stephen King’s "The Stand" has such an enthralling apocalyptic thriller with a good versus evil theme graced the bookstores. J.E. Plemons introduces us to Arena Power, a fifteen year-old orphan who braves a harsh, new world in this first installment of what promises to be an addictive new series. Best of all, this is a full-length novel rather than the 40-page snippet that some authors try to pass of as a "book" in a series. Not only was I entertained with a rich and imaginative story that showcased top-notch writing, I did not feel cheated when I finished.The end of the world is at hand through the wrath of an angry God. Arena and her twin brother are involuntarily cast into the role of preparing humanity for its demise. The story delves into a character study that reveals an interesting and tragic family history that is skillfully woven together to give us a greater understanding and empathy for the characters as the story builds to a resounding crescendo.An undeniable Christian message is intertwined into the fabric of the story without seeming "preachy". This is, first and foremost, an adrenaline-laced thriller, but the theological elements add a compelling twist that makes it even more exciting, in my opinion. The introduction of religious elements merely sets the stage for the conflict between good and evil, which can be considered a universal part of the human condition.While the physical devastation of the United States has not, yet, reached the catastrophic proportions of King’s "The Stand" or Cormac McCarthy’s "The Road", an atmosphere of impending doom still looms like an ominous cloud. The U.S. is no longer the world superpower that it once was, and it now turns to its former rivals for assistance while poverty reigns in the streets. Like all good apocalyptic and post-apocalyptic literature, the end of the world is attached to an existential catastrophe…in this case, divine judgment.J.E. Plemons conveys a sense of danger through prose that is both haunting and surreal, and he conveys a sense of urgency through the serious and sometimes desperate dialogue of his characters. While this could be considered YA literature, it is certainly of a quality that promises to hold appeal for all ages, and I look forward to the second novel.

Diana Heuser's guide to publishing and selling 100+ copies of your Kindle book is one of the most solid plans I've seen, and it's ideal for beginners.Too many people want to sell reports and courses that offer "one simple trick" (or worse, a loophole) that's supposed to practically guarantee Kindle success, overnight.No. It doesn't work like that. Not for 99% of writers and publishers, anyway. Certainly not for anyone who's planning a long-term career in publishing.Most beginners need to do more than one thing right. In fact, they need to do practically everything right... in the nuts-and-bolts aspects of publishing, anyway.  Worse, most beginners are starting with a publishing budget of exactly zero dollars.This book explains exactly what a beginner can do, every step of the way, to produce a book with a good chance of selling... and perhaps selling very well. Even better, Ms. Heuser talks you through the zero-budget version of publishing. It can be a tricky process the first time through, and Ms. Heuser's screenshots will answer most or all beginners' questions.I like this book because it's simple and direct. It doesn't list half a dozen options that could give a beginner a good reason to pause and "think about it."  (Publishing your first book can seem scary and overwhelming. You need a guide like this.)This book takes the reader from start to finish, publishing and selling a book.While my own publishing techniques are different in some cases -- especially the formatting tool Ms. Heuser recommends -- I can wholeheartedly praise this book because her directions work.  That's all you really need for your first few books.Beginning publishers can take this book and follow the directions, step by step, gaining confidence after two or three books. At that point, you'll move past the "beginner" phase and can start trying other options... with the necessary insights you'll acquire by following a plan like Ms. Heuser's.No two publishers are likely to follow the exact same steps, use the exact same tools, and have the exact same priorities.However, if you just need to get started (in mid-2014), and want to be sure you're following a plan that actually works, you will not find a better book than this.Skip others' hype that boasts "one easy step" or "a sneaky loophole" to overnight success in publishing.  Instead, work with a basic, solid plan like this. It will give you the foundation you need for success as a publisher.

reviewText: Brought to you by OBS reviewer CaroPossible spoilers!bound-to-the-abyss-book 1-into-the-world-james-k-vernonThe Three Moons Realm (A collection of short stories, Vol. 1) by James R. Vernon was released back in 2012, and now, after what seemed like a long wait, he returns with his first fantasy novel titled Bound to the Abyss, Part One.In this new story, we are introduced to Ean Sangrave, who can’t seem to get himself out of trouble. Whether he’s being beat by the village’s gang of bullies, or he’s getting on the bad side of the adults, Ean is always looked down. He is the apprentice of the village’s Healer Cleff, one of the few people that treats him, a little, better, due to the tragic past involving his deceased parents. But, what villagers don’t know is that more than a simple healer’s apprentice, he has a great connection to the Abyss, a place feared for its darkness and dangerous creatures.From this dreaded place is where he actually found the only living creature that has become close enough to be called friend. The imp, Zin, a character that was first introduced in The Three Moons Realm. Zin has returned from the Abyss, ready to help Ean gain new powers. When everything looks brighter for both of them for the first time, the village’s mine is inhabited by a deadly creature devouring all that comes to its reach.Curious to see the creature, Ean heads to the mine, only to barely escape its teeth with the help of his new abilities. When, Jaslen, a farm girl whom Ean is fond of, and Bran, the mayor’s oldest son and Jaslen’s boyfriend, follow him to see the Heroes sent to kill the creature fail, Ean’s life becomes more involved with the village’s safety than ever before, changing his future from that moment on. He is chosen to travel along with Bran to try and find a solution to the village’s problems. As the adventure continues, Ean gradually transforms from the nobody, people saw him as to a skilled healer, friend, and Abyss energy user.I was really happy to know that The Three Moons Realm stories had continued. I really liked vol. 1 and was eager to find out more about the characters and what their futures held for them. Bound to the Abyss is my kind of book genre, so reading about magic spells, creatures, and a boy finding its way in life, was definitely a must-read for me. But, I must say that Zin remains my favorite character of the whole story. He’s witty, wicked, and knows more than what he lets others know, which makes him more intriguing. The story had a good pace and was easy to follow. There aren’t many characters to get lost in, or constantly change points of view, which is more comfortable. Although we meet people here and there throughout the journey, the plot is mainly centered on Ean and his companions.I do have to add that there was a character that I started to dislike halfway through the story, Jaslen. She turned a little irritating and at one point I hoped she wouldn’t end up sentimentally involved with Ean. He needs someone brave enough to stand the sound of an Abyss hound feasting on a Troll. This is where Paige appeared and his life became a little more interesting in that matter, but she was left behind. I hope she makes an appearance on future books.The story is mostly a road trip, in which Ean at first feels dragged into, but then learns that there is a lot of information kept from him and possibly the villagers back home. This sparked an interest in me on anticipating another book. There are questions unanswered that I would like to know find out just like Ean, but I’ll have to wait.The Three Moons Realm has interesting stories waiting to be developed, and Bound to the Abyss is just as good which I recommend you read. If you like magic, a little of mystery, and adventure, this is the book for you.This review and more at openbooksociety dot com

reviewText: Title: Tex-Mex From ScratchAuthor: Jonas CrambyPublisher: PavillionPublished: 4-2-2014ISBN: 9781909815506E-Book ASIN: B00JG8A458Pages: 196Genre: Food/WineTags: Regional CookingOverall Rating: ExcellentReviewed For: NetGalleyReviewer: DelAnneMany think fast food chain restaurants when it comes to Mexican and that Texas cuisine is synonymous with barbeque.  They do do not realize the diversity of both and that an old culinary mix even exist.  "Tex-Mex From Scratch" brings the flavor blend of Mexican and Texan cultures.With a wide variety of recipes you can prepare an authentic Tex-Mex meal. Everything from appetizer to desert is covered with recipes that will have you salivating just reading the recipes.  Show off with your friends at your next sports gathering by  bringing homemade Guacamole and chips you baked yourself.  Stop rushing through your morning to run out the door only to stop at your local fast food joint to pick up something that passes itself off as breakfast.  Take a few extra minutes and you can have fresh  and delicious breakfast buritos or Tex-Mex Pancakes.  Wow the family with homemade tortillas and a variety of fillings, or enchiladas, or a spicy ceviche.  Throw out that old bottled barbeque and try some of the tried and true ones included in "Tex-Mex From Scratch", you will be a big hit at your next family get together.  Or how about the new craze of Beer can chicken?  Don't forget adult time with some margaritas, mojitos or picklebacks.  So many recipes so little time.My personal favorite came from the desert section, Bourbon Pecan Pie. It among the other sweets will satisfy your cravings for something delicious to complete the meal.  These are just a few of the variety of recipes that can be found in this great cookbook.
This was even better than the first book, I trust the last book will really bring it home! I'm purchasing Book 3 in...3...2...1

As a writer myself, I think that one of the true marks of an excellent author is solid, believable character development, and in my opinion, Mimi Barbour is the master of character development.  Special Agent Francesca is a complex woman who can use her martial arts skills to take down the toughest of thugs, and then spin her feminine wiles effortlessly to lure a criminal profiler to her bed.  After learning who her father was from the mother who chose career over child, Francesca makes a conscious decision to meet him face-to-face no matter the outcome.  Fortunately for the special undercover agent, John Hampton welcomes the daughter he never knew existed with open arms.  Barbour fleshes out not only Ham's character, but the rest of Francesca's extended family as well. Her step-mother, Mattie, is a warm, loving woman who makes Francesca feel like she'd been part of the family since forever.  Little sister, Caireann wonders aloud as to what took her big sister so long to come home and tells the FBI agent that she's been sorely missed.Story line development in this thriller is excellent as well.  The twists and turns keep the excitement rolling until the end. As always from Ms. Barbour, a great read!

Fantastic characters, fantastic plots, story lines like real life both honest folk and of crooks. Humor that will have you giggling then full on belly laugh. You may even shed a tear or two at love. You will also have visit from other Las Vegas cops from the Vegas series. All in all Mimi never disappoints, I loved the book and highly recommend.

This is really a 3.5 star rating.One of my all time favourite series is the Chase brothers. I was so happy when Lauren continued the series in Petal as there are so many wonderful characters to continue writing about and the Murphy family has been wonderful to follow.You can never read too much about Polly Chase and Edward is really becoming another force to be reckoned with!Caroline Mendoza and Royal Watson have a wonderful chemistry together and having such a strong female character was fantastic. Lauren made Royal very supportive but also showed how he could be strong for Caroline at the right times as well as knowing when to step back and let Caroline stay true to herself.The only disappointment was further into the book, there were a number of times that I needed to re-read paragraphs as it was difficult to tell who was speaking. Then there were random sentences that didn't lead anywhere or make sense in the context that they were written. It became disjointed in places, interrupting the potential of a free flowing story that you want to be immersed in.I really wanted this to be a 5 star book as I enjoy this series. The storyline was fascinating and the characters are captivating so I am looking forward to the next Petal book.

Oh!  Oh Yeah!  This debut book hit all 5 stars just right for me!It is FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC!!!Jax is the best billionaire character that I have read.  Before you start think to yeah another rich and dominant man, think again he is nothing like your billionaires of the past- Christian or Jesse.  This author have managed to capture an awesome vulnerability and playful side in Jax that is wonderfully refreshing.Raven is equally charming and you will love and latch onto her character immediately.  Somewhat naive but also persistent in her own right, she and Jax are a perfect combination.If you think this story is all about their quest to find love, you are wrong.  I have developed lasting attachments to all the characters, Jackie, the best friend and Max, the body guard.This book takes you through so many twists and turn, you won't know what is coming next.  There is of course the steamy sex and the love story; by there is also mystery and suspense that will have you tearing through the pages to see what happens next.I cannot wait for book two to see how this story continues.Utterly perfect debut Ms. Sederholt!! Congratulations, you have left me with the best book hangover I have had in a long time!
summary: FIVE HUGE STARS .... LOVE THIS BOOK!!
