reviewText: Easy read, but a great story.  These courageous men were truly "American's Greatest Generation" and like so much in history they never got the credit they deserved!  Too bad usurpers did.  These horses are a world treasure and a legacy for generations to come.  Strange that Italy (who invaded Yugoslavia and therefore Slovenia where these horses are bred and trained today) got fewer horses returned in the name of King Peter of Yugoslavia, and the stud farm was stolen from the Yugoslav people in the first place.  Funny that the Vatican got any, what was their claim on these beautiful creatures?  There is no history more fascinating than revisionist history!

An excellent book about saving the ancient breed of horses known as the Lippizan. So much art and beauty was looted or destroyed during WWII that the world is poorer for the absence of treasures we may never know are gone. With all the destruction and death of that cataclysm, including the extermination of 11,000,000 human beings, including 6,000,000 Jewish people, some might not think it matters that a bunch of horses should be saved from annihilation. After all, they shoot horses, don't they? Even 1986 Kentucky Derby winner Ferdinand ended up in a Japanese canning factory. People don't really care much about horses.So to read Stephen Talty's book about rescuing the Lippizaners from the final onslaught of the war restores my faith that some people cared enough to risk their lives and careers to save these beautiful animals, who are bred and trained for the equine ballet known as the "Airs Above the Ground."
summary: Art and beauty saved from destruction in WWII

In this book Drummond demonstrates the rewards of positive thinking. He shows through Alex how his positive thinking carried him through life from a young person to adult hood. Alex had dreams and worked hard to pursue those dreams and in the end accomplished what he was determined in life. Positive thinking is one of many keys to success. Of course you must work hard toward your success but you must also think positively.As a young person Alex is burdened with the responsibility of being the provider of his family. He also seeks a good education, hopes of being a baseball player or a stockbroker. However, when the baseball dream falls through he drives toward the stockbroker options and keeps his positive attitude and works hard to succeed at his goal. His positive thought and actions leads him through to a great and rewarding end. Along the way he is hit with many obstacles but never let them get him down. He stays positive always.If you are struggling with a lot of downs in life and it just seems that you will never reach your goals, then you should read this book for encouragement. It will help you to see the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.

I chose this book because I wanted to do some research on the "work at home" scams advertised on the internet. Most people do not think they could be a victim of a scam like this, but many are sucked into these schemes by high-pressure salesmen before they have an opportunity to do the necessary research on the "business".This book is 20 pages long and gives a good overview of the different scams you will find on the internet. The author also includes a helpful chapter on how to protect yourself against scams. Many of the topics in this book seem to be common sense...yet people fall for these scams all the time.A good rule of thumb is...if it seems too good to be true, it is probably a scam.
summary: How To Recognize An Internet Scam

reviewText: I thought poetry was something I only read in high school, when I had to.  I began to become interested in it again when I read Slammed by Colleen Hoover.  I was re-introduced to some beautiful poetry in Therapy.  Jessica's journal is the completion of Jessica's journey from Therapy.  She shares her inner most feelings, good and bad. Just a beautiful collection of poems.  Kathryn Perez has introduced me to another world of poetry!

I've been to Hawaii but I didn't end up with my own Hawaiian man. WOW, Asher is such a hottie and a sweetheart. The time he and Melanie spend together, although short, proves you can find your soul mate and recognize them in only a short time. Both Asher and Melanie knew it was more than a fling, but that horned BFF Piper made her second guess what was really happening. Thank goodness Asher knew it was more.Very sweet story.

This is a great book for someone like myself. I myself is not a vegan but i love  the idea of cooking a meal in 20 mins and i do like to eat vegan foods. This book has really good easy to follow recipes and which takes a short time to cook which is brilliant for me.

I received this book from the author so I could give a review.Book 2 and just as good as the first one. West is as dominant as Blair and they come together each time like fireworks. West is on tour and takes Blair along for the ride, but old insecurities hit Blair and West. Can they survive? Will book 3 have the answers? Start with book 1, Unexpected, and become just as addicted to these characters as me.
This was a good book written with humor, intrigue, and kept your interest.  It was fiction but could be something believable in this day and age.Well  done B.C.Tweedt

Loved this whole series

How can a book make you feel happy and hopeful and  so sad that you feel like sobbing all at one time!!  I thought I would begin this book this morning and read it at my leisure when I had free time.  That was not to be the case.  After the first chaper, I could not stop reading and everything else was put on hold until I finished and read every single word.  I had  a love hate relationship with every character until the end where  you understand and fall in love with all of them.  I want more Mr Sills!!!  I am an avid reader and Shoveling Snow is absolutely, without a doubt one of my favorites!!!
summary: Heart wrenching and heart warming at the same time

reviewText: The first 2 books were really engaging. I felt this was a rush job just to conclude the series. I was extremely disappointed.
This book was so good I couldn't put it down it was definitely a page turner, I can't wait for part 4!!!

This was a great book on construction project management. The format was extremely easy to follow and was very reader friendly. I had very little knowledge of construction project management  and the book was a great way for me to learn about different aspects of it.  I would recommend this book to students or professionals in the industry attempting to learn the subject on their own.

There's a combination of healthy foods to creative games that can help you improve your memory. The tactics and strategies are simple but serve as a reminder for all of us. Today I forgot to read the morning news and this book reminded me to do it to make sure my memory doesn't go to waste!

Ive always been a fan of eating healthy and the Atkins diet is a good one. This book explains clearly why it is one of the top diets around I like that it gave a list of foods to eat as well because that is often where I get stuck in the grocery store. Good information - especially if youre new to Atkins!

AMAZING!!! Every book I read in this series just gets better and better! In this story we get to know sexy vampire Leopold better and a new character Laryssa. We also get more Dimitri that hot Cajun werewolf beta of the Acadian wolves. This book is just full of action, sex, mysteries, kinky sex, gorgeous supes, romantic sex, romance... Absolutely an amazing read, there were laugh out loud moments, there were teary moments, there were edge of your seat moments and there was a NOOOOO moment! reviewText: A cute story of a "player" bear who has trouble earning his fox girlfriend's trust.  Short & hot story of where trust starts & ends... I was wishing for a slightly different ending.  But a complete story w/no cliffhanger.
summary: TO TRUST OR NOT TO TRUST?

reviewText: This was a nice quick break time read. There was just enough joy and angst to make you want to see what happens with the next couple.

I loved that the hero was willing to give up his career in order to make right the wrong done to his lady. I really wished that he didn't really have to give up what he really loved doing just to get him, his girl back and the culprit that caused the rift between them shouldn't have been able to keep her job. She had some horrible plans in place to make sure that the hero was hers for good if it wasn't for the fact that his brother was the witch in this story was her real fated mate. She nearly destroyed 4 lives in the process, including her own. But, other than that, this book was a great story and one that I would recommend to others.
summary: This was, I think, the first installment of this series

reviewText: Before you read this review, you should know I have a tendency toward addictive behavior; in this case, it's good writing and great character development. I read Don't Tell Anyone by the same author, and met Charlie in that book. I fell "in like" with him as a minor character in that book, and in love with him as the main character in this book. I'd prefer if this book just went on and on and on. Ms. Boris' elegant yet lean prose gently transported me to the streets of New York for a love story. There's no tawdry sex, but there are some sizzling kisses... and there's reality, and hope, and tension... Ms. Boris has promised a full-length novel featuring Charlie later this year. I'll be watching for it.

It may have been a Gay love story, but It was well put together and I enjoyed how Cory brought James out of his shy shell and made him proud of who he is.  Would love a second story about Cory and James.

I found this book very helpful. As I'm a fan of natural healing I've found the home remedies particularly appealing. The book tells you exactly what diet you should follow, and it gives you a lot of great pieces of advice to recover fast. I recommend reading this book.
summary: Great advice to recover from chicken pox fast

reviewerName: Kim - A Novel Love "Kim ~ A Novel Love"
reviewText: These books included in the anthology are so good. Great authorship, hockey and all for a good cause? Yes please! I highly, highly recommend you one click.I have always liked Toni Aleo, Nikki Worrel, and Jami Davenport, and to add to that I found a couple of new great authors to follow.  Each book had different elements to it, that kept me going and wanting to read more and more!  One of the books, Taking A Shot by Catherine Gayle, was so sweet and big fat tears to roll.One click today, you wont be disappointed in the books to read and of course the proceeds go to a worthy cause.

Cancer is an ugly word in my house. I lost my mother to cancer when I was a teenager, my godmother who raised me is currently winning her battle with breast cancer and we lost my amazing father-in-law last Fall to leukemia. This is a cause that is near and dear to my heart. I was so happy when I found out out that some of my favorite hockey romance authors had teamed up to release an anthology, Seduced by the Game, a collection of hockey novellas with all proceeds going to Hockey Fights Cancer.Toni Aleo- TANGLED IN LACES:In Tangled in Laces, Karson King is on the fast track to the pros and Lacey Martin is coming back from a hard fight against cancer and is terrified of him, but their love is too much to ignore. Will Karson prove that he will protect her heart at all costs, or will he live Lacey to pick up the pieces of her life once again?Review: This prequel has me setting up a count down ticker to 2015, it is hot, full of love, drama and just the right amount of angst to catch me.. hook, line and sinker! After this teaser I am so excited that these two are getting their own full length book and can't wait! Toni Aleo has never disappointed me with any of her books and I don't think this will be the exception! Write faster Toni! :)Cassandra Carr & Cindy Carr- HOOKING HANNAH:When Hannah attends an all-star game, she doesn't expect a hockey player of all people to turn her wold upside down. Her sister is married to a player and Hannah never wanted that life. But Scott could change everything. For Scott's part, he has to know the woman who stirred his blood with just a look, and once he does, he realizes he wants Hannah to be his forever. Now to convince her…Review: This was my first taste of Cassandra Carr & Cindy Carr's writing and it certainly won't be my last! I loved the story, it came together beautifully, and holy crap was it HOT! I can't wait for more from these authors and love the HEA they gave me in the small amount of space they had available!Jami Davenport- CRASHING THE BOARDS (Seattle Sockeyes 1.5)Professional party crasher, Izzy Maxwell, needs the cooperation of reluctant party guess Cooper Black, the team captain of Seattle's new hockey team, but Cooper can't get past his anger over the teams relocation to Seattle. Can Izzy melt Cooper's frozen heart or will this party crash along with her fledgling business?Review: Jami Davenport NEVER disappoints! Crashing the Boards is a whirlwind romance, full of steam. I loved Cooper and Izzy and the HEA I felt like I got at the end of the novella… THEN Jami surprised me by announcing that this is just a teaser that Cooper and Izzy are getting a full length book, I can't wait- it is sure to be just as fabulous as this prequel!Catherine Gayle- Taking a Shot (Portland Storm 2.5)Katie Weber has had a crush on Jamie Babcock for almost two years, since he joined her fathers hockey team, the Portland Storm as an eighteen-year old rookie. When cancer takes her health, her hair, and even her friends, she can't bear to go to senior prom… until Jamie intervenes.Review: First off, let me start by saying if you are a fan of hockey romance and aren't reading Catherine Gayle's Portland Storm series, STOP reading right now and pick up the first two books in this series. This author has a way of writing hockey romance that fans of the game and the genre will love. Now, back to this story. I have loved Katie and Jamie's budding attraction in the first two books of this series and had even emailed this author asking WHEN they are getting their story. They are slowly growing up before our very eyes and this book is perfect. Jamie has a crush on Katie from afar (mainly because her father, and his teammate, will have him sleeping with the fishes if he gets too close to his daughter). Katie is battling cancer and when Jamie risks life and limb (reference the previous sentence) and asks to take her to her senior prom it gives her the motivation she needs to keep fighting. This is a sweet story that left me with tears in my eyes and super excited to know that eventually they will get their own book and it is going to be WONDERFUL!Jaymee Jacobs- A Valuable TradeBryan's life gets turned upside down when he gets traded to the Dallas Comets, and things get even messier when he meets Georgiana the Director of Team Services. He's got a lot of work to do to prove his worth to his new team, but Georgian's sure he'll prove to be a valuable trade.Review: I love a story where a girl who is "one of the guys" finds love. This is no exception, this was my first Jaymee Jacobs read and I look forward to reading more about the Dallas Comets.V.L. Locey- Heir ApparentSuperstar Cam Evans is fighting to climb out of a slump that's growing worse with each day of living in denial. Fresh from the minors, Jacobi Neal is hungry for this chance to play back-up for the legendary goalie. Can two men battle each other, their inner demons, and the sizzling attraction building between them.Review: I am not normally drawn to m/m stories, but this novella gave me a taste of what I have been missing and I was hooked. These two men are not only fighting for their careers, but are also fighting for love, this is a hot, tension filled ride that left me wanting more from this author!Bianca Sommerland- Blind Pass (The Dartmouth Cobras 0.5)Nothing could stop Tim Rowe, the assistant coach of the Dartmouth Cobras, from falling in love with Madeline, but love alone can't satisfy every need. Sometimes, to reach the goal, you have to take a chance with a… Blind Pass.Review:  How is their a hockey romance series out that I haven't read? I am so excited this anthology put Bianca Sommerland on my radar and after reading this prequel to her Dartmouth Cobra series,  I MUST find all the books out so far and read them.. Geesh, and I call myself a fan of hockey romance. I am buckled in if this prequel is any indication of this series I am about to go for one fun, hot ride!Nikki Worrell- Captain, My Captain (Prequel to Scorpions Series)Keith Lambert is captain of the Flyers- until he's not. To everyone's shock, he's traded to the San Diego Scorpions. As if that's not bad enough, Phoebe his girlfriend of two years, decides she doesn't love him enough to follow.All alone in a new town, Keith is drawn to Kelly, his take out delivery girl. When she shows up at ice girl tryouts he's lost. She's all he can see. Can he convince her to forget her past and take a chance on him or is he destined to be alone in a new town a little bit longer?Review: Nikki Worrell is one of my favorite hockey romance authors and I loved this prequel to a series I am already in love with! If you are a fan of hockey romance you need to be reading Nikki Worrell and this teaser gives a good peek into her writing style, get out your debit card, you will want to purchase the Scorpion books to date (if you haven't already) after reading Captain, My Captain!If you can't tell from my reviews above, not only is purchasing this book supporting a great cause, but you are also getting a HUGE return on your investment. I enjoy charitable giving, but I think Seduced by the Game is the book that immediately gave me something back, with a collection of hockey novellas that are sure to make any reader of this genre happy!
summary: This is a charitable donation that not only gives back to the charity, but to the reader as well! 5 STARS!

reviewText: This anthology is one of the best hockey anthologies published today. All of my favorite authors in one central location. Plus these authors are proud sponsors of the hockey fights cancer movement and are donating their proceeds to this movement. It's an excellent example of authors together for a greater cause.Toni Aleo's contribution was exactly what is expected from this author. She never disappoints can't wait to read the next portion of this story.Bianca Sommerland's contribution is everything I wanted. For those of you who have loved Tim this is your novella. It's a quick glimpse of what made him and Madeline beloved characters. Plus it gives you a glimpse of a few Cobras we have not got to know yet.Catherine Gayle has introduced me to Babs. For those who know me I am hard pressed to love anyone as much as I love the Cobras but Babs is close.As for the rest of the anthology I can say that it prompted me to buy the rest of the authors previous books. All in all a great project for a great cause. Hockey, awesome characters, and excellent stories. Thanks Ladies!As Always, Heather
summary: Great project for a greater cause!

reviewText: What a lovely book; two people with differing expectations of life learn to meet somewhere near the middle. Nicely done having preconcieved notions about some of the characters nudged aside by their realistic backstories. I liked the strong heroine who managed to be as tough as was needed without being hard. But please, Mitch, quit smoking...

Bobby has written a book that is not her usual legal or medical story line. I think the story line could be expanded and made more exciting.  She has new characters and shows a deep understanding of people who have very high expectations of themselves and then fail.  Read me and find out how a professional women and an ex-Rodeo man work out their differences to create a life together.

Everyone deals and/or has fears (even when we say that we are not afraid).Most of the time it is that fear(s) that prevent us from living or taking any orfew risks.  Enter this book.  The author gives you ways and tips to helpchange your life for the better.  However it will not happen immediately.Worth a read

I want to thank Brenda so much for allowing me to have an ARC and to read her novel. So appreciated. She asked for an honest review and I will give one.It took me a while to build up to the storyline. And my reason? Too much inner dialogue. Quite a few of "I tell them, he tells me, I see, he says."  I also felt that at the beginning there were just simplistic sentences. Short. Choppy. A bit of complex/compound would have made for some smoother transitions.I believe that it came together more towards the end and the cliffhanger was one I thought was coming but I'm still thinking there is also more to the story than just Jim.Angel and Mason were sweet. Mason is the ultimate gentleman and wants so very much to protect Angel. He is able to figure out that something bad has happened and finally convinces Angel to share what has happened. His obvious caring for her is beyond sweet; he makes such a good boyfriend!Sadly, Angel is not protected as she suffers fierce injuries in an apparent hit and run.  Mason is right there with her and while I guessed how this cliffhanger would end, it does leave a chilling feeling.I look forward to reading the next in this series. Thanks Brenda!!

This is a well done short read on helping not only the one battling depression but for those who are trying to help a friend, family or just someone who needs it. Depression is a very common concern in todays society. Most of the time it is very difficult for one to realize where it stems from but more importantly how to overcome this illness. The author does a great job laying out signs and symptoms for one to recognize, as recognizing the illness is the first step to overcoming. The book later does a great job breaking down all the areas of the illness common to people; such as lifestyle, diet, exercise and sleep. I found the most important part of the book to be on the discussion of social support as this will be valuable to anyone trying to overcome depression. Great short book, recommend it to anyone
summary: Well done! Helps understand what is needed to overcome depression

reviewText: In this collection of stories the author gives a close look to the sense of life and to the battle between Good and Evil.In these stories the narrative is the most important aspect and the storytelling is natural, not contrived; it can be poignant and gloomy at times but not depressing.I particularly enjoyed the title story 'The keeper of dreams' and 'The sentence'.'The keeper of dreams' has depth and is touching, the story line is beautiful, with a dreamlike quality, I liked it because this story translates effectively the bitter agonies of life and conjures a palpable beauty.'The sentence' is a strong story full of melancholy, it is very well written and I admit  the author shook me to the core with this story.The poems are nice too but I particularly enjoyed the stories.This book may not be for everyone, but if you enjoy literary fiction and poems you should pick up a copy.I received this book at Story Cartel, in exchange for an honest review.

I thought this was an awesome idea for a book. it was well laid out and planned.I loved the tip on caring for your plants when you're away.would have liked a couple of images for a better visual experience.excellent read
Enjoyed the first book and less so with the next too.  Story doesn't go anywhere.  Same action sequences followed by a meal round the campfire. Character development would be nice.

A great addition to the HOT series. I just love Kev and Lucky! Romance, action, suspense, some drama, and not to forget, humor! An unforgettable story that will keep you entertained from page 1. Highly recommended!!!
Finished in one day!  A real page turner...another great Jon Stanton murder mystery.  This one even has a hopeful ending!
It was a pleasant read, I just wanted a little bit more of a impact to it, for me I just wasn't that captivated as I wanted to be.

I  was surprised that it was interracial novel. Which I enjoyed. It amazing some of the stupid racist comments people make because of the color of your skin. Viviane was who###,but she want to talk about malkla just because she was black although knowing that she was virgin.

Just thinking about the Arctic is enough to make me cold so it's pretty strange that I'd want to read a book about nothing but the cold habitat, right? Well, the arctic is interesting and there are times during the year when the sun doesn't set at all for a couple months, so how can it stay so cold there? This book will tell you that, too! The arctic is a pretty big habitat that has a big mix of land and ocean animals, like whales and seals. I bet some of you have never even heard of a narwhal before, but the arctic has them and this book tells you a little bit about them! You might not have even thought that there would be plant life in the arctic, like me. It's so cold that you'd think no plants could survive, but some species have found a way to do it and they've got my respect. I'd never be able to live in those temperatures, but there are 4 million people that live in the artic! It's crazy but interesting!
summary: Short and informative, great for anyone who wants to know about the Arctic!

reviewText: This book is about the Arctic environment and is great for kids. It includes a description of what the Arctic habitat, the climate of the area, and where on Earth it is located.There are different animals discussed that live in the biome, as well as pictures of some of them. There is also information about the flora around the Arctic, as well as other details about the area.There is a quiz complete with answers to take together as a family or for you to test your child.I would recommend this book to children that want to learn about the Arctic, or families that like to read together.

Peggy Lane has managed to capture the essence of a sense of 'Cool' and 'Fun' that all puppies and dogs have at heart.I particulalry like Smart Dog as it certainly reminds me of one close to home.  As for Beach Dog and Cool Dog, if you were a dog, who else would you want to be?The text is short, effectively connecting the thoughts with the images.The images really speak for themselves in their clarity and humour and the puppies (or stunt doubles) are obviously having fun during the photo shoots.Worthy of a chortle and a chuckle before you adopt the pose of 'Goodnight'!

Angel Kin is a phenomenal re-launch of author Tricia Skinner’s remarkable writing style. I was worried when I heard the Angel Assassins series was going through transition (new publisher) – Angel Bait, the prequel, was a 2013 favorite of this reader. Angel Kin is the story of Cain, a Nephilim assassin, and Katie Logan, a not-so reformed thief.Only The Bound Ones can protect Katie after she witnesses a supernatural murder. Unfortunately, one of the men assigned to protect her has the face of a killer. Rescued as a child by Tanis, Cain is one of only four surviving Nephilim – all others were put to death including his twin brother Abel. It is apparent that Abel is seeking revenge against Cain for past transgressions.“While you lived in Heaven, I was sentenced to life in Hell.” – Abel to CainThe author tugged this reader’s emotional strings – the relationships both romantic and hereditary were very dynamic. The tension ebbed and flowed throughout the story. Every page reflected true realistic emotions between Cain and Katie – tenderness, trust, acceptance, intimacy, and love. I would have enjoyed just a tad more of the bond between Cain, Jarrid, Kas, and Nesty.This review also appears on Harlequin Junkie.Disclosure: This book was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.
summary: Phenomenal re-launch of author Tricia Skinner’s remarkable writing style

reviewText: It's a short story and doesn't cover much beyond the set-up of Allia and The Demon Lord as lovers but gives hints about other characters. The story line was well developed and I am looking forward to reading more from this author.I highly recommend this book.
summary: The Demon Lord is worth a read.

reviewerName: Sophia Rose "Guest Reviewer for Delighted Rea...
reviewText: I really enjoy the Demon Outlaw series and I love that the author wrote the prequel story of the events that set the first book's story in motion.This one does chronologically fall before the first book, but for it to make sense and feel like it's part of the whole, I'd recommend reading it after book one at least.  It's a table setter and not really something that feels self-contained though it leaves things on an ominous happy for now note.Its a quick one and quite simply tells the story of a goddess, Allia, and the Demon Lord she set out to entrap to stop the demons' further destruction of the human world.  Allia and the Demon Lord know from their first touch that they are meant to be.  Both tentatively reach out and relish their secret times together.  It is forbidden love and cannot stay hidden forever.  A betrayer waits for the chance to destroy what is good for nefarious purposes.As I said, this is a table setter for what comes after and definitely a fan pleaser for those of us who wanted to know more about those who played strong roles in setting stuff in book one in motion.  It has a short description to get the reader up to speed about the backdrop and players and then there are a few passionate interludes leading to the crisis.  Because of the brevity, I wasn't as deeply engrossed in the story as I have been with the longer novels of the series.  Still, it was good to get this important part of the series story.  Personally, I found the Demon Lord one of the most engaging characters in the first book. Things in book one make better sense now so I would definitely recommend it to fans of the series.My thanks to Net Galley for the opportunity to read this one in exchange for an honest review.
summary: How It All Began- Quick Read That Will Please Series Fans Interested in Aerie's Parents

reviewText: I was really pleasantly surprised by Don't Bite the Bridesmaid, the first book in this series. It's lighthearted and sweet and most of all funny. Don't Blackmail the Vampire isn't as humorous (at least I didn't think so) and not quite as light. These characters have issues and a lot of angst. But it's still a lot of fun. In fact, it's kind of like the Vampire Winter Olympics with its skiing, ice skating and dog sledding. Not things you expect in a typical vampire novel.We met fiancées Brent and Kristen, Alice's ex-fiancé and ex-best friend, in the last book.This story features Kristen's sister Rachel, who is determined break up her sister's engagement, and Charles, Alice's new fiancé's brother, who is investigating Brent. Rachel convinces Charles to help her with her scheme and it gets complicated quickly. They pretend to sleep together, then pretend he doesn't like her, but he really does, and she doesn't want to like him, but she really does. Like I said, it's complicated. Charles has his own mission to accomplish but keeps getting distracted by Rachel and her schemes.Tiffany Allee does a really good job with this short novel format. A few that I've read have really needed to be longer and I could tell you exactly which scenes I would add. I haven't had that issue with either of the books I've read from Allee, although I do wish she would have done more with Brent's friend Cole in this one. He's just kind of there, and doesn't really contribute much.Although I didn't like it quite as much as the first book in the series, this was a fun way to spend my rainy morning.

Where to start…I truly enjoyed this book, it was different from the Vampire books I normally read. This book is for those who like the lighter side of the vampire/paranormal romance genre.  Instead of the tough Alpha Male caveman type of character and the rough and tough vampire books out there, Charles the main character was sensitive, romatic and caring while still being a great Alpha male.  Rachel was a whitty and fun character all on her own, strong and stubborn but needing some romance and TLC.  The two together were a fun couple to get to know and I loved how thier relationship grew throughout the book.The writing style in this book was really good and it was a really enjoyable read, it holds your attention and makes you want to see what happens next.  The Author has a great sense of humor in her writing style with just the right ammount of romance, angst, and of course at the finish there is a HEA.If you are loooking for a  a cute, sweet romance with humor, a couple of hot love scenes and a touch of mystery this book is definately a great book that has all of those attributes!  I read this book in an evening and I would definately recommend this book to those who like the vampire/paranormal genre.  If you are a fan of contemprary romance you will enjoy this book as well.  I am looking forward to reading more of Tiffany Allee’s books in the future.*free copy gifted for honest review**originally reviewed for welovekink(dot)com
This book is the follow-up to Don't Bite the Bridesmaid. You can read it alone, but I recommend you read the previous book first. It will help you care more about some of the characters.

This was an well plotted romance between Jenna, whose fiancé left her and became engaged to her best friend, and Sutton, the best friends older brother. Their relationship happens really fast, (almost too fast for me), and both set out to save his sister from similar pain. I found the conflict at the end of the book to be a little juvenile and I agree with other reviewers that it felt a little too  high school for me.  Not really my cup of tea, but i am sure many will enjoy.I was given a free copy for a honest review.

I was really excited to read Fall With Me, but sadly, it didn't quite reach my expectations. It wasn't that it was a bad book, (because it was actually pretty good.) its just that it, and its characters were completely forgettable. In fact, I wrote this review a little over two weeks after reading the book because I had gotten an advanced copy and I had to go re-read it so I could better remember the finer parts of the story. The two main characters, Jenna and Sutton were annoying and went back and forth in their relationship with each other. It got frustrating and midway through I just wanted them to walk away. The whole plotline of the book revolved around Jenna's fiancé (Adam) cheating on her with her bestfriend and Sutton's sister, Lacey. Adam and Lacey were both deplorable characters and at the end we were supposed to empathize with Lacey and forgive her and I just couldn't do it. No matter the reasons why they got together, I couldn't forgive it and feel anything besides disgust with her, and I couldn't see how anyone else could either. The plan that Jenna and Sutton came up with to break Adam and Lacey up never really came to be anything, which was disappointing because it was one of the things that drew me to the book in the first place, I was hoping for so much more from it. Also, Jenna and Sutton had known each other for years, so by the time the reader became involved in their lives it felt like I was missing something, I never really got the connection between the two and that was frustrating. I would have liked more backstory to them. Overall, it was a nice, quick read. I would recommend it to someone looking for an easy read.I received a free copy of this book from Netgalley for an honest review.

Historical romance with a nice amount of humor and whit.  To add to the story the author has added just a touch of the modern within the story.  Read carefully and you will catch it.  Charlotte and Sebastian make for a wonderfully, delicious read along with the making of a great start to a new series.

Charlotte finds herself in an unfoturnate situation. When her father died she was left in the care of her brother and sister-in-law who don't seem to particularly care to have her around. Her sister-in-laws solution is to force her hand and make her marry a very gross and horrid man. Charlotte would do just about anything to stop this from happening, so when Sebastian takes her under his wing (so to speak) and offers to help her find other suitors, she hopes that he can help.Or course, this being a romance novel things work out a little differently than any of our characters suspect. Sebastian's mother has a the right of it throughout the whole story, but no one around her seems to notice. This was a sweet romance where the hero steps in to save the day at the last moment - the perfect moment. There is a bit of wit and humor to help top it all off as well.*This book was received in exchange for an honest review*

Secrets and Sins: Raphael follows the story of Greer. She's trying to get her life together after finding her fiance in bed with someone else.....While out at a bar with her brother, Addison runs into Raphael and decides to do something totally out of character. She decides to spend the night with him. If only she knew that that one night would completely change her life.....Her ex-fiance ends up dead, she wakes up in the hospital with no memory and finds herself the main suspect in her ex-fiance's murder........Raphael is taken by surprise when Greer re-enters his life, claiming to pregnant with his child. Throw in the fact that she tells him someone is after her, and now he finds himself in an interesting situation. Unfortunately, events from Raphael's past, make it hard for him to trust and believe that Greer is really pregnant with his child. As time goes on, Raphael begins to trust Greer and they become closer.....Unfortunately, time is running out.....Will they catch the killer before it's too late???I enjoyed the fast pace and flow of the story. The suspense, drama and mystery was great. I loved the unexpected twists. The relationship between Raphael and Greer was great. The chemistry between the two of them was hot and it was fun seeing them go from a one night stand to the possibility of more :)I found this book to be very enjoyable. Even though this was the third book in this series, it can be read as a stand alone.
summary: Can be read as a stand-alone

reviewText: Tough as nails and the supposed scary one of the four best friends, Rafael has a lot of issues from the past. After meeting and later spending quality time with Greer Addison, Rafael gets a surprise from Greer and those old issues come flooding back with a vengeance. Can he trust her or will she leave him just like the last one?Loved it! Raphael is definitely in the lead for book boyfriend of the year. He's the bad ass of the group but underneath he's a big teddy bear. Greer went to the right person when she needed help. The chemistry between them was so amazing that the pages were smoking. Naima Simone has written a fantastic series with sexy alpha men and the women that are meant to be theirs. I can't wait to read more from the Secrets and Sins series!Received a copy in exchange for an honest review.

Secrets & Sins: Raphael was so well written I couldn't put it Down. Ms Simone has created characters that you can almost FEEL. This is the first of the 'Secrets and Sins' series that I've read, and it kept me engaged throughout. The story never bogged down-there was always something new and unexpected happening just around the corner. I was fully invested in what happened to the characters, and the twists and turns kept me glued to the book. I loved it so much, I bought the other books in the series.If you're a lover of romance & suspense, 'Secrets & Sins: Raphael is a must read!!

Tee is in Vegas to help her tribe and the only way she knows how is to work in Vegas with the high rollers.  and her boss wow what a hunk, he is after all a dragon.  who is losing his dragon form is he doesn't find a mate soon.  Leo needs a proper dragon mate and he knows Tee isn't it, but the sexual attraction is there.. kind of a fun book.  lots of dragons and vegas is always vegas.  Leo is also in love with Tee but doesn't know it just yet till trouble starts and they have to fight together..

Title: Stop Dragon My Heart AroundAuthor: Susannah ScottPublisher: Entangled CovetPublished: 4-28-2014ISBN: 9781622665600E-Book ASIN: B00JI12A3WPages: 174Genre: RomanceTags: Paranormal, Contemporary, Shifters, DragonsSensual Level:Overall Rating: ExcellentReviewed For: NetGalley, EntangledReviewer: DelAnneLeonidas "Leo" Ryan and Tallulah "Tee"  Alameda have been avoiding their attraction for one anther since the day they met.  Leo as a lieutenant in the dragon den that owns and operates the Crown Jewel Casino.  No matter how much he wants is Tee he must continue his search for his true mate and since Tee does not carry his mark it is not her.  Tee, casino hostess and daughter of the Chief of the local Paiute Tribe, has decided to it is time to go after Leo full throttle.  So she sets up a time and opportunity to get him alone and seduce him.  Secrets are being kept from Tee by everyone.  Secrets that can destroy her trust and love in those close to her.  When secrets are revealed can Tee forgive them?This is the second in Susannah Scott's series and is easily read as a stand alone.  It is fast paced and filled with humor and lively dialog.  Throw in a great romance story and characters that are jumping off the pages with personality and vitality and you have a book that is destined to be one of your all time favorites.  I love shifter romances and "Stop Dragon My Heart Around" only re-enforced that love.I have yet to read book 1, "Luck Of The Dragon", but that is an omission I hope to rectify soon.  You will find Ms. Scott's books a delight to read.  Pick up a copy for yourself soon to enjoy.

Of course, there are dragons in Vegas!  After enjoying Susannah's first dragon book, I had been anxiously awaiting the sequel.  It's just as good as the first one. My only complaint is I wanted it to be longer because I loved the story and the characters so much!

This book is a perfect continuation of this series! I love the fact that Bee the main heroine is into UFOs. It adds a great twist to the story! Angela Verdenius is one of my favorite authors! I can't wait for more from her!

I'm not really a fan of beautifying and enhancement, but I got this book as a freebie, so I decided to read it. I was quite surprised by how many natural ingredients there are that are quite helpful to our skin! I'm saying goodbye to my oily skin!

Swoon Alert!!!Smoking hot!!!Dripping with lust and passion and beautiful swoon worthy sweetness, Until You're Mine totally kept me hooked till the very end.Archer Brooks is so damn panty dropping hot and absolutely delicious. He was burned in the past and he does not want to love again.Katy wants to have a fairy tale and a HEA. She is a preachers daughter with a rebellious side. She will be the reason why are his walls crumbling bit by bit. She got under his skin so deep that he could never get enough of her.Incredible storyline with engaging, well-developed characters. A story that was flipping awesome! I was not left disappointed.Can not wait for the next novel.≧◔◡◔≦ 5 ✰ read ≧◉◡◉≦

I must say job well done K. Langston! I do enjoy a good love story and this was no exception. Emotional, gripping, nail bitingly good. Katy has always dreamed of her happily ever after but seems as if she just can't catch a break when it comes to love. Archer tried love once and has no desire to ever love again. Will they overcome their past hurts and give in to the obvious attraction? The different emotions and trials that Archer and Katy face only makes their love affair that much more endearing. Not your typical romance novel at all this story is seriously hot!! Can't wait for the next one.**I was given a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review**

Great story with only mild drama unlike other over the top books. I finished this in a few hours since it was only about 200 pages or so. Nothing deep about it. Sometimes you just need a simple book with a nice love story...the sex wasn't too bad either.

3.5 stars.  Like the characters, liked the story with a complete ending.  Would read more about them if a second was written.  Well worth the price, you won't be disappointed.  The biggest problem for me was the lack of contractions halted the flow of the book.  Everything was 'I am going....' or 'we will have dinner.' As I was reading, I found myself changing it to I'm going and we'll have dinner. Maybe it's just me but I felt the writing should be less formal and more the way we'd talk to each other.

A friend borrowed  my kindle to read this so I read it too. Very confusing and I read the other series which I disliked quite a bit. It was confusing and the ending sucked. Maybe I need to reread the series because I am totally confused about some parts. Still not impressed at all.  '

I bought this series on my nook.I love this series. I think it's cute. Has adventure, love, mystery, magic, and etc.Only reason I give it half a star short of 5 stars is the occasional errors (but in this case they weren't bad enough for me to be annoyed) and the fact that Jerry seems to "change" his name to Kip by the next paragraph/page and I would have to go back to make sure that it is in fact Jerry or maybe it is Kip...or maybe the people from the future went to the past or something.--**Possible spoiler if you don't want to know who ended up with who**--I do have a question though is it just me or does it seem that the only way the men seem to find a decent wife is if she is from the future? Save for Arran and Blaire. I mean even the hint for the next book makes it sound like Eoghanan's significant other/gf/wife/whatever is from the future and coming back with him. Don't get me wrong I love the time travel and everything but couldn't she spice it up a bit have a female character fall in love with a guy from the future or something?
summary: Actually 4 1/2 stars -- Possible spoilers -- bought on B&N

reviewText: There are a lot of useful detoxification guides in this book. This is good for those with obesity problem. Even you look healthy, you might want to do some detoxification too. It is important to clear the toxic from our body. I'm following the daily detox plan now. Hopefully I will gain back my health.
Helpful book. You can learn how to lose weight naturally and easy without taking the burdens of dieting. Good source of informations and knowledge about detox. Great!
summary: The Detox Factor: 101 Tips & Tricks To Lose Weight Without Dieting! (Detox Cleanse Book) [Kindle Edition]

reviewText: Too, too adorable. Such a cute story.A road trip vacation to the beach and an unexpected brother?Can Lexie and Ryan make it through?

Picked this up cause I saw it on a friend's read list. I'm so glad I did. I really enjoyed this. I enjoyed the somewhat terrible life Aubrey was living and I definitely enjoyed Ryder coming in and "rescuing" her. Chloe and Jake were keepers. Loved it
summary: Bikers, sassy chick, two great kids

reviewText: This book offers practical advice on how to become a better marketer. Marketing is a crucial aspect of any business, and so I think this book could help plenty of people take their businesses to a higher level.

The book "How to start a business" is a very useful guide for people who want to start a business because the tips are very simple and easy to apply. I loved the "Chapter 3: how to build your team" is in this part where I need to improve to grow my business and I found the information to help me achieve this.

I know, or should say knew absolutely nothing about trading and this is just the type of book I was looking for. As a curious newbie to the whole idea of trading this is a good start. Gave me some good insight into what trading is really all about, the phrases used and what it all means. Plain English and not a lot of industry jargon. I'd recommend it for anyone new the whole idea of trading.

I'm sure this book was written just for me I could relate to most every part of it especially about how people don't throw anything away because they have good memories attached to them. But it also talks about hoarding and I think I do that too. There is a lot of good ideas in this book to help me learn how to let go of some of my memories by taking a picture of the item, throw it away and then put the photo into a scrapbook or a memory box, there are lots of other practical ideas such as this that I can implement in my challenge to declutter a little.
summary: just in time for spring cleaning.

reviewText: We all know the horror's of Hoarding, with shows all over networks making money of people with the issue. This book is great distinguishing the difference between a hoarder and someone who clutters. The one thing I like and never expected is how the author would break down remedies into rooms for clutter. It helps make the task of handling one's home with clutter. Especially if you might have a large home. This book is an easy read and gets right into it. I enjoyed the read and would recommend it to anybody!
summary: Great Way How Remedies Broken Down By Rooms For Decluttering!

reviewText: Attract Money Fast is a zippity quick guide that lays out strategies of the mind to make money fast. These concepts are reminders just how powerful thought can be. The author makes it crystal clear the hard part is committing to practice. Definitely a book to get you thinking lucratively if that's what you're looking for!
I have been waiting for this book to come out to finally have the ending to the story! I recommend reading the whole collection. This doesn't really stand alone but great addition to the series.
Enjoyed the book. Just didn't like how the affair started while the hero was engaged. I am looking forward to Shane and Hanks story. I hope theirs is an interracial story as well.

Jason Lewis' novella Paradise quickly grabs the reader's attention and throws her into a well-conceived world where, instead of a typical post-apocalyptic scene, the environment is crumbling on Earth, forcing inhabitants to seek shelter in Paradise, which is not all that it seems.Lewis has a knack for quickly developing characters through their behaviors, making it easy for the reader to connect and understand the various characters' attitudes toward their situation. By setting up the characters with such strength, the main problems and complexities of the novella are expressed with power and subtlety. The result is a novella that reads very quickly and prepares the reader for the upcoming novel - and by prepare, I mean makes the reader desperately want to know what comes next!

A copy was provided by the Netgalley for an honest review.So the insta-love thing doesn't bother me, who is to say how long it takes to fall in love.  It is the I have had 2 conversations with you (one included sex) and now I will fight and lay down my life for you that gets to me.  I liked the family more than I liked the protagonists.  Dominic and the twins were great, I could have done with more of them.My favorite Jackie moment is when she laid down her line and walked away from Nicky after deciding that she could not accept his violent solutions to life. But argh, who takes their brand new boyfriend to the funeral of the guy they just broke up with?!?  I did not feel I got to know Jackie very well and I am not sure how Nicky could really know her considering.Not my favorite mafia romance.
I really love Ms Adams books.  Will definitely purchase more of her works. It gives you a real lovely feeling.

This book is really exciting. Happy to have read it. Kept me on my toes. The more I was reading this book the more I couldn't put it down.As the story went on I was trying to guess what was going to happen next. Then a baby gets brought into the story and we see another twist. Romance is so exciting and with this one we were on a rollercoaster daily.Then end turned out the way I hoped but not the way I thought it would go. If that makes any sense to you. Just enjoy reading it. Not a dull moment in the way it's written.Happy reading!

Loved it. But then again I love all of Noelle Adams books. There is just something about her writing style that keeps you intrigued and interested the whole book. I have already read this one twice. It's sad, funny, and romantic. Can't wait for the next book out by Noelle.

I haven't read them all but so far the ones I have read are really good.  This one was good but a bit short, although they all seem to be short!  I really loved the Alpha, he was HOT...  I also liked the end where the other character meets her "mate."
I liked the book.They talked too much in the beginning.I lost interest and flipped through a lot of pages.It got better towards the end.

I just love the Howard men. Ms Lee always give us a great story that includes the whole family. Love that. I could only give it 4 stars because of the grammatical errors. Tighten it up and keep them coming Ms Lee.
It was a interesting book she started out doing everything wrong.  When she help someone else her life turned around for good
this was a wonderful read with humor and relationships that were so great to read and enjoy the happiness of a love story.
I was stunned! I think of myself as a fairly black and white kind of person when it comes to the law. This book was totally in the GRAY area and I liked it.

Web of Bones was simply fanfreakingtastic! The way General Solan Fire-Eater plans to place himself in Melisande's life is a great way to show how cunning he is. He is strong, dominant, caring and completely hot! Melisande, thinks that she is weak, because her strength is different that that of her siblings, Solan knows better. The dialogue and chemistry between them is wonderfully "real". Speaking of chemstry, whew! Hot, hot, hot! Break out your ice packs, your cold drinks, and your significant other, LOL! The book also introduces you to some new characters that I hope/know will have their own books in the future. Just as The Dragon's Mage (the first book in the series) did, this one will leave you waiting so very impatiently for the next in the series. This book is definitely good for multiple reads. I know, I've already read it several times, LOL!
This book is that deal it's different from everything thing you read this year it will keep you on the edge of your seat. You can tell this author took her time.

It seems like everything happened so fast. The things things Avion had to go through to see his son was crazy. Yasmine was really trifling & a hater. Everything that happened to her she brought it all in herself. Karma is a bxtch, and baby when she comes back around you get dealt out tenfold.
The book started off a little rocky. The main character was snooty and self absorbed. As the book went on it got better and turned out to be a great read.
One of the best dragon shifter books i have read Can't wait to read the rest that go with this one
I tried this book and I couldn't find the point of the story within the first 20 pages. It was sex sex and more sex. Where was the story line? Not written well and I deleted before page 25.

Great start with a fast pace and great characters.  Lots of suspense, then with almost no warning, an out of context sex scene.  Letting the sexual tension build would have been much more effective, but the author acts like she was instructed that we readers expect sex every X number of pages, regardless of whether it fits in the story or not at that point.  I found this to be the only negative and hope the next book corrects this weakness.

This will be short and sweet, but I loved this book. I enjoy how the author gives her characters such intense personalities. I also love the chemistry between the main characters and the hotness of when they get together. I so love this series and will continue to read the series.

"Mindfulness Meditation" will surely help anyone to handle stress, depression, and a better way to experience a healthy perspective in life. This will definitely help anyone who's starting to try out Mind Meditation just like me :) It'll be worth investing your time to read and perform the step-by-step guide in this book. Kudos!

I'm a big fun of all natural remedies so I loved this book. It gives a lot of great tips. I especially like the chapters about skin, hair and nail remedies. Although I already knew a lot of natural remedies, I learnt quite a few new ones from this book. I recommend you read it.

Ella Frank is an amazing author. This was such a captivating book, I could not put it down. It will draw you in till the very end. Yes the story is  no no, but you will love it for sure. I will be telling everyone to read it. You won't be disappointed.

I picked this book up and put it down several times. I will be frank that the fact that Addison (the female main character) being in high school** bothered me a great deal. But everyone I know around me kept raving about this book, so i pushed on.Definitely taboo. Definitely a roller coaster. I was hoping to find that 'je ne sais quoi' to make me LOVE the book and i'm not quite sure i found it. That said, the characters were fascinating. Doc was my favorite. The plot was well structured. And all in all, a VERY well written book with an extremely difficult (in my opinion) subject.Maybe a re-read to find it when my heart and head heal. I'll be thinking about this book for weeks or maybe months to come.)(** had Addison been an 18 yo freshman in college, I would have found this book fantastically improved.)

I just happen to come across this book and the description Intrigued me so I took a chance and I'm really Glad I did. This book surprised me because I'm not really into the whole teacher/student kind of story, but this book went way beyond that and captivated a love story that was deep, sad, erotic, and sinful all at the same time. Although wrong, it felt so right and you couldn't help but want this relationship to work out for the main characters. I was a little worried at times how she would end the book but I think she did a great job and couldn't be more pleased with her work. I will be trying out another one of her books since I enjoyed her writing in the so much!
WOW! actually was amazed by this book, yet again. great story and characters! loved reading it and enjoyed it very much. can't wait for the next one

Loved the first book Deviant, which made me want to keep reading.  I'm excited to read the next book and find out the ending to Zeth and Sloane and hope that Sloane's nightmare she has been living with for years comes to an end.

Favorite part? How could I possibly pick one part. I love everything about this series. I am addicted!! Oh, and how sweet it is. Ms Hart please keep us reading your Incrediable stories. Can't wait for your next book.

Callie Hart is seriously my top 3 FAV authors right now...OK so lets just to talk about ZETH MAYFAIR, cause ladies i will ALWAYS got time fo that!!! Haha.100/5 star review!!!!These books. This authors writing style. The words. The story.... Uhhh man im crushing super hard on it all... It has pushed me to like things i never used to... Plus this little baby made me want to do ALL kinds of kinky play time with a BLUE ICE BLOCK!*blushes & fans face... seriously people, like no words... just a flushed face*“You gave yourself to me back at my apartment; I’ve never done it before, but I gave myself in return. I may not have wanted to, Sloane, but I didn’t have a choice in the matter. That means we belong to each other now. And it means I’ll come back for you soon. I’ll do my best to find your sister, and I’ll do whatever I can to make those guys pay for what they’ve done to her.”Seriously its sooooo intense.I wont talk bout the story.All i will say is everything u think u know bout books kind of like this- throw it away! This book is seriously UNIQUE & there is nothing like it out there!This coming from a girl who reads a book a day pretty much... Well that's saying a LOT!“She should have run in the opposite direction, but she didn’t. She ran straight for me like I’m her goddamn savior. Like I’m capable of fixing everything. Like I’m capable of protecting her. Like I’m whole enough to help fill in the broken, fractured pieces of her, too.I shake my head, trying not to think it. But it’s an undeniable and dangerous thought, and won’t be ignored.Just for a second there… it felt like she might be capable of gluing me back together, too.”
summary: Callie Hart is seriously my top 3 FAV authors right now...

reviewText: This story has a  hold on me and I can not wait for more. I love Zeth and Sloane oh my they have sunk inside me they are both such strong characters. Callie Hart is a wonderful  storyteller and I look forward to more from her,she's an amazing writer.

Is it wrong that I want a bad boy like Zeth in my life? I find myself hating how short these books are because I'm begging for more. I WANT MORE! Holy hotness! This is a must read. This whole series is!
I really enjoyed this book. It was very showed and abuses is domestic violence can do in the upper class community and the silent rule of don't tell.

Hockey romance is a new genre for me, but thanks to books like "A Most Unlikely Countess", I am in love.  V.L.Locey begins with a most unlikely heroine, gives her some significant family handicaps, and then - pours in a few pounds of humor.  Between garden gnomes and Gandalf the ferret, a most unusual mother, and a wicked ex-girlfriend, the lovers work their way from getting to know each other to finally GETTING TO KNOW each other.  In addition to touching (very lightly) on the perils of caring for a parent with a mental illness, this book explores friendships between women and the occasional people who exist and care for their friends enough to take risks, loudly, as does "secondary heroine" Viviana.  I love these ladies, and am looking forward to getting to know them better!This book is slightly sexual....I would not hand it to my mom to read.  But I would have no problem leaving it at her house, where she would no doubt find it and read it.  And be scandalized.  It would be interesting to find out just which parts of the book she would discuss.
summary: Goth meets guy and goes happy

reviewText: Because of Kian by Sibylla Matilde is full of drama, suspense, and an ample amount of steamy scenes. This novel held my attention from start to finish and kept me guessing along the way.My heart broke for Brynn. She escaped an abusive relationship and fled to a new city for a fresh start. She is insecure and damaged; as she believed she deserved the abuse her ex-boyfriend Evan dealt her. I wanted for her to open her eyes and realize her self-worth.Kian has been captivated by Brynn since laying eyes on her. He sees the potential beneath her shattered exterior, and wants to cherish her. He’s absolutely swoon-worthy and the epitome of hotness. He’s protective, knows how to defend himself, and wants nothing more than to worship Brynn. He stays on the sidelines, watching over Brynn, until one fateful night he steps in to save her from a run-in with Evan.From the moment they officially meet, sparks fly between Brynn and Kian. Their attraction builds and I fell in love with his couple as the story progressed. Each character offers something about themselves that works to heal and complete the other person. I rooted for this pair throughout the novel, but I knew trouble would be lurking and their happily ever after wouldn’t be achieved without work.The plot kept me enthralled as twists unfolded, creating obstacles for Kian and Brynn. I never knew what was coming next. I also enjoyed meeting other characters in the novels and would love to see Kian’s friends get novels of their own. As I mentioned before, the couple’s chemistry is potent and Sibylla heats up the pages with scenes thick with passion.Sibylla Matilde’s Because of Kian is full of unexpected turns, romance, and will keep you engaged from beginning to end. Become familiar with your newest book boyfriend obsession, Kian, and fall in love with these characters and story.

reviewerName: Dr. Joseph S. Maresca "Dr. Joseph S. Maresca ...
reviewText: McDowell explains the classic causes of memory loss like too many meds, depression, poor sleep, smoking anddrinking in excess.The author's solution is to remove the things that cause the memory loss-one by-one.Stress is another classic cause of memory loss.The book documents that older memories tend to stay with us. The section on beating insomnia is helpful too.The author's solution is to reduce caffeine, close the lights for max sleep, yoga, eat less at dinner and cease smoking.Enhance your memory with exercise, meditation, take good vitamins/supplements, play chess, reduce cholesterol, reduce alcohol and don't smoke-period.The section on neurolinguistic programming is very helpful too. In essence, our self-imposed limits are just that.The author covers enhanced learning by association, the use of charts and visualization. Supervitamins like vitamins A,C,E,K, Folate and Omega 3 are cited. Classic superfoods are discussed like milk,red ,onions,honey,potato and water.Other superfoods not mentioned in the book are bok choy and chia.Overall, this is a great purchase you can make to advance your own health and well being far into the future.

As someone who’s a quarter Indian, I still enjoy my fair share of Indian food, mostly from restaurants but this book has helped me bring that unique, flavorful taste right in my own kitchen. There are a ton of recipes to choose from and I love how the author took the time to define some Indian food terms. This is going in my bookshelf along with my other cookbooks.
summary: Got me in touch with my Indian ancestry

reviewText: This Indian Cooking Recipes Book Can Be Used by Beginners, As Well As Those Well Informed About Indian Cuisine. The book is divided into Indian Cuisine, Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Soup and Dessert recipes. I highly recommend this book to everyone.
summary: I highly recommend this book to everyone.

reviewText: A quick and concise look at where marriage can go wrong and possible methods of helping a relationship stay steady. Thoughtful yet straightforward, it's worth a look and could help clear up what's been going wrong.
summary: A quick and concise look at where marriage can go wrong

reviewText: I think Randle is in to some kinky stuff. I would like to see Jasmine put the spin on Randle and make him beg for a change. I would recommend this book to anyone.
Loved how very true to life this story was. I have to admit though it made me nervous right to the end praying for a good outcome. Would recommend this story to everyone.

After reading the first two books in this series I was so looking forward to reading this one. The author certainly didn't disappoint me.I loved the first two books but this one totally rocked. I just love Adam so this book told in his point of view was wonderful to read.This author knows how to affect your emotions. She knows exactly how to tell a story and how to grip you.Really hope this author is busy writing as I want to read more brilliant books by her.received complimentary copy in return for honest review.

In life we meet a lot of manipulative people in different places and situations, this book really helps us understand how to react to this. It gives great techniques and strategies to take control of the situation. I highly recommend this great book!
summary: It gives great techniques and strategies to take control of the situation

reviewText: Oh my gosh.... Run to the store to buy this book! It was such a great read that I could not put it down. Needless to say, not necessarily a good thing when you are a college student and need to study! Hahaha, I don't regret a single moment though. It was that good. Happy reading! PS Loved the ending!!
summary: It was such a great read that I could not put it down

reviewText: I was prepared to like this mystery, but sadly the writing got in the way. I have found that most male authors do not have the insight to tell a story from a woman's point of view. This author is one of those. Disappointed in the whole thing. Couldn't wade through it. Didn't care who done it.

I loved Klay & couldn't wait for A Home for Caroline!  This book from Caroline's POV is so heartwarming & emotional.  Caroline tells about her stuggles of being homeless but getting a job at Rosen Enterprises is the chance to make her dream come true.  Little did Caroline realize she would get more than she ever dreamed of.  I truly enjoyed both books of this very original story!

This was the first time I've had to look everywhere to find the ending to a story. Is it the writer's intention to leave us in suspense, by ending the story at the beginning of  Gianni's  baby brother's story ?? I did rate it a four because of everything that was written. I am hoping we will get to read about Gianni 's love for Anais Cormier. Of course,  wanting Anais to finally find happiness too.
