If you want to know why just making vision boards or chanting affirmations doesn’t always work, this book is for you. Learning to vibrate at higher frequency makes so much sense. Certainly, our power increases the more in touch we get with our true, higher self. This book provides so many great exercises to do just that. I usually read an eBook first and then go back and do the exercises, but here, I was motivated to stop right away and do some personal work. This book helps explain what an integral part your personal alchemy is in the Law of Attraction. As Dobbins points out in the cooking analogy, it’s not just the ingredients and process that influence the end result, the person making the recipe influences it, too. I loved reading this book.
summary: I Learned so Much Reading this Book

reviewText: There are a lot of misconceptions when it comes to the Law Of Attraction. I've always wondered why it works for some people - but not for others? This book helped me to understand the difference between attracting what we want - and keeping it. I loved the many exercises designed to help you get in touch with your true individuality and create a life that is perfect for you and I look forward to spending more time with Michelle Dobbins' work.
summary: Changed the way I think about LOA

reviewText: I really hope that no one thinks that this is a true account of the 13th year of Jesus. It was somewhat entertaining. Had some historical points in it and was over all a fairly fast book to read.

GREAT BOOK!!!!!!!!!!! I am an extremely nervous/quick to exit public speaker, so this is an excellent book for me. My favorite quote is “Owning it is taking in the applause and enjoying the moment”. This is something I never do, so caught up in my mad dash to move on to the next item on my “to do” list. Thanks for the insight.
summary: You are Never too old to “Own It”

reviewText: I received a complimentary copy of the book from the author in return for an honest review.Let me start by saying this is a very short book. I read it in about 35-40 minutes. This is the first of 3 shorts about Riley and Evan. I loved this one, it definitely pulled me in and leaves me needing to know what happens.Not sure what to think of Evan. It's almost like he is two different people, and you have to know more about him.Riley is your rich socialite trying to escape from the life she doesn't want. Will certain happenings make her change her mind and go running back home to her rich lifestyle? Why don't you read and find out.I recommend this book to readers who like short books with lots of drama.

Open My Eyes, Jennifer CollinReview from jeannie zelos book reviews.I hadn't reads the earlier book so at first some things like Emily's dislike of Cassie ( Cassette - who names their child that??) puzzled me, but as the story continued that became clear and I felt for her. I suspect there's more to Cassie's actions too than we see on the surface. Emily, she's running from her problems, and yet they always follow - its something that she knows won't work. She married her ex in an effort to get normal, wanted what she never had growing up and though Geoff was dull he seemed to provide the normality and support she wanted.  Having had a chequered family life as she grew up, then after catching the jerk out, she escaped and stayed with her sisters best friend Ben - and had a one night stand.....then she ran from that too. She makes a new friend in Annie, they come home and share a flat. Emily tries to tell Ben something important several times, but something always stops her.Ben's been trying to get past her, past his feelings for her and make a new start, but found it difficult when she was away, now she's back its even harder, though the attractive owner of the new shop next to his is proving a good distraction.Emily keeps on putting off telling him, despite Annie and Charlotte, her sister, Ben's friend, telling her she must do it. As ever secrets have a way of getting out and this one does that right at the wrong moment. There are more than just this secret that comes out too...The story is fun, it has angst and jealousy ( I love that) lots of drama, and the others involved play large parts too making for an easy to read, light hearted, enjoyable romance. There's more to the story that just the romance, and I enjoyed the sub plots, the side diversions that occurred too. I loved the characters, and would happily read more in this series. I want to know more about what happens with them all. Its priced at just 1.85 for 293 pages.Stars: four and a half, a good fun read.

Somehow I'm eating better. Within a day. After weeks of shaming and blaming (and of course, eating) I'm just back in the head space that lets me love myself, eat well and live without Belly Fat Blues (even though I still have plenty of belly fat.) Thank you Karen Donaldson. You hit the right chord for me, and I'm empowered by you.

There is something for everyone here. If you're on the Paleo Diet and don't know how to get started, then this is a book I can highly recommend. Breakfast, lunch and dinner plus any other food category you can think of (that's low-carb of course) - it's got you covered! You can still enjoy many of your favourite meals except they can be made low-carbohydrate by following the recipes here. I was pleasantly surprised by the wide variety of foods on offer and will be trying some out. Great recipe book.
summary: Yummy and easy to make paleo recipes

reviewText: While a huge fan of Elliott Kay, I gave this only 4 stars because it is a bit light compared to other works.  A definite read for any nerd who has rolled 20 sided dice.  Characters and landscape could have used a little more development and the plot was just thick enough to hold the story together.  HOWEVER... as Brain Candy for an aging gamer, it was a fun romp through that blew the dust off of a misplaced Player's Manual.  Carefully inserted references to modern video gaming also added moments of amusement.  Overall, a fun read.
I'm sorry but despite the reviews I just could not get into the book, it was just dragging beyond belief and I started flipping through pages just to get to the end.  sigh......

This is a collection of public domain novellas and short stories by three of the most important pre-pulp science fiction writers: Jules Verne, H. G. Wells and Arthur Conan Doyle. These are adventure stories first, with important scientific speculations embedded, rather than space opera romances or hard science fiction. They are the works that inspired many of the leaders of the post-WWII scientific revolution as well as the serious pulp science fiction writers from the 1930s to the 1950s.Among e-book compilations of public domain literature, I grade this a B. The typography is consistent and attractive, and works at a variety of font sizes. Headings are clear and I found no obvious spelling errors, omissions or other errors. There is no extraneous or repeated material. There is a table of contents with links, both within the book itself and supplied in metadata for your reader (however the in-text is organized differently, which is a bit confusing). On the negative side, the contents do not distinguish between chapters and books, so it can be a even more confusing.The book does not include internal links, nor definitions of unusual words or characters. There are only single-paragraph biographies of the three authors and no forwards or notes. Publication details including year, edition, translator (for Verne) and so on are sparse or missing entirely. On the topic of translators, the Verne translations are quite bad, but not the worst. However much of the scientific detail is garbled or omitted, and the prose is clumsy and wooden. Sadly few of Verne's works are available in really good English translations so readers with no French do not a lot of better options.The material works best as stories--energetic, imaginative, compelling and brilliantly told. These are the still-fresh originals of characters and plots that have been imitated into stock jokes. Even the lesser efforts have considerable literary merit and are fun to read. There are stilted Victorian and Edwardian conventions in these stories, the clothes, role of servants, attitudes toward non-Europeans and women can charm or repel at various times, both when prejudices of the time are breached or honored. There is some offensive material: antisemitism, racism, imperialism, protofascism and other unpopuar isms. However all of the authors have much more on the other side of the balance, positive ideas that transcended both their era and commonplace acceptance of injustice. If you're looking to be offended you will have no trouble finding objectionable parts but in my opinion, taken as a whole, these are some of the good guys.None of this is great literature, the stories and speculations take priority over stylish prose or emotional depth. Dramatic events, bold characters and fascinating ideas keep our interest, not realism, philosophic subtlty or character development. Most of the science is hopelessly outdated, of course, but the curiousity, rationalism and courageous willingness to challenge common sense speak clearly to true seekers of truth of any generation.If you love good stories and scientific curiousity, you should read these works. You can find them free on the Internet, but these have been formatted for convenience on an e-reader. You can pay a little more for better physical editions, and in some cases for better electronic editions. So this is a decent compromise choice.
summary: Great fiction for the price, but some warnings

reviewText: This story started slow at first during the story world development, but it quickly picked up steam when the actual story started and the characters actions began to take shape. By the end of the story, I was hooked, and I can't wait for the second part of the story; I'm dying to know what happens next. This is a great read.
summary: Interesting take on the space opera that packs a punch.

reviewText: There is great chemistry between Adam and Isabelle which will draw you into rooting for the success of the book's couple.  However, Isabelle's constant mantra of being toxic and wanting only casual sex even though her actions were the opposite pissed me off.  I know the author wants to create a conflict, but chapter after chapter of her saying she can't do a relationship was getting tiring.  I couldn't understand why Isabelle didn't want to find a way to trust and love anyone.  She mentioned she went to therapy, but it didn't help, and gave up.  What is up with that?  Adam should get a medal for his relentless pursuit and determination to be with Isabelle.  I wanted to love this book because I admired and supported Adam, but I felt he could do better than Isabelle.
summary: Hot chemistry, but story bothered me

reviewText: I like the storyline. I like heroes more then the heroine, she's a little whinny. I think the story would be better if longer. Might read this author again if she writes a novel.

This wonderful book picks up where The Promise left off. Now you get to follow the ups and downs of Sophie's relationship with Chase and Ana's relationship with Drake. There is so much humor in this book my stomach hurt from laughing. There is plenty of hot sex and drama to keep you entertained. I would even say The Choice is better than The Promise, which is high praise because The Promise was so good! This book will leave you with your mouth hanging open and an intense need for book 3,which is in the works. Luckily, there is a Facebook support group (yes, you will need it) called The Promise Series Support Group. But, don't go until you're finished reading! Enjoy!
summary: Fall in Love with Chase as Sophie lets her broken heart heal

reviewText: Everything in this second book felt in line and cemented.....until.....No really, it was a scorching page-turner filled with heartfelt love repaired. The passion play in this one was thru the roof hottt as well. I love it when Chase and Sophie play!! But the love written out between these guys is monumental and dare I say "One of a Kind". They have a connected chemistry even through fights, misunderstandings, attacks, and jealousy.* But now they will no doubt face a huge mountain of shock and struggles*Sophie will have to choose her past or her future.I want to also add that I love this series so far (both) BUT.....the 2nd story is so much better (for me). There were so many times in this one that I was in hysterics laughing at the characters dialogue, while still being balanced with the steamy romance and drama. All these things make the perfect story for me. Well done Kate Benson!!!!!5-Stars >Happy Reading

This book will be a perfect present for my many nieces and nephews. Great for  younger children, with a lot of illustrations. It is a very positive and fun story about a German Shepard puppy going to the vets for the first time. In many ways, it is like a children's first visit to the doctor when they have to get shots, so in a way, it also helps children to prepare for this situation. The doctor is shown as very kind and caring, as well as the puppy's family. It is a feel good story, good to be read any time, and at bedtime. Highly recommended!

This is quite good, certainly in the upper third or so of the SHTF sort of stuff that one finds for Kindle.  If I could give this 3.5 stars, I would.This book continues the story of Kyle Tait, who walked/biked from Texas to his home in Montana.  Mr. Gorham's writing is smooth, and the editing is good, and in my view, the predecessor book "77 days in September" is among the best of the various "get home when the SHTF" books available out there.  Here, Mr. Gorham goes into additional detail about how a small town community in Montana (I picture Deer Creek as being one of the towns in the Bitteroot valley) tries to survive the coming winter.  The author does a good job of discussing how the community handles conflicts, how the new economy develops, etc.SPOILERSSome additional observations:- The book focuses quite a bit on the main character's marriage and family.  Many reviewers found this sappy and perhaps overdone.  I did not; I thought it added a dimension to the story that is often lacking from these kinds of books.- There are some inaccuracies and things I would change regarding the description of guns in the book.  For example, many people in the community of people who read these sorts of books don't like the phrase "assault rifle".  In any event, while there is good action in the book, it is not an army field manual, which is fine.- Unlike some reviewers, I liked the trial sequence and thought it added some drama (although no suprises) to the story.  However, I think the author really missed an opportunity to talk about how a justice system would evolve/be implemented in a post-SHTF isolated community.  For example, at some point the community needs to have a discussion about what criminal procedures it wants, so that everyone can be confident that they get a fair shake if they are falsely accused.  There has to be buy-in for the procedures.  It would have been nice to go into that kind of discussion a little more.  Also, if I, like Tait, had been railroaded to conviction in a kangaroo court like that, I would have a hard time forgiving and forgetting.  This is sort of thing that historically has sparked generations-long bloody feuds.  That might have been explored.- Finally, the author does a good job of pointing out that everyone is skinny and hungry, but I think he really could have rubbed the reader's face in it a little more.  People talk about how bad places like Phoenix or Las Vegas might be without power or motor vehicles.  I don't think that the northern rockies would be much better.  With such a short growing season, and brutal winters, places like Montana are also pretty marginal for big human populations without modern technology.
summary: A worthy sequel to a very good book

reviewText: Enjoyed the book. The author made me care about the characters. Makes you think and yet was entertaining as well. Thanks for sharing.
The sequel is well written. The story of Kyle Tait continues after his journey from Texas to Montana. This book describes how the community manages after the terrorist event. Good dee
People in this story, including family were way too willing to think the worst of someone.  Also seems that in many cases injustice rather than justice prevailed.
I loved this series!  The characters are so loveable and real.  The author has a way of drawing you right into the world of Monster Haven. A joy to read.

Liked the protagonist, his sense of duty & history.  Liked the final battle that involved & questioned the heros worthiness.  Plot & dialogue needed more sharpening, lame &  trite float in for discriptive adjectives .  Magic was not well explored & zombie army, well what can one say about zombies....

Been waiting a while for a new book to be released  by this author, and I was not disappointed. I've enjoyed your books and this one was as good as your other books. The characters were good and I hope that you continue with stories of the other Blake brothers.  Will be looking out.

I really needed to hear some of this info with the way my life was going right now. I enjoyed the book very much and thought the author did a nice job of breaking things down for me to understand which was nice. I really got the most out of chapter 2 where they talk about autosuggestion and visualization as a tool for success....great stuff. My Rating: 4.5 of 5 starsDelaney(Laney) has two personas, the hard working graphic artist and her alter she calls Double-D who drinks to the point of blacking out and hooks up with a different, anonymous man every weekend. Jackson is a hard-working entrepreneur who owns multiple tattoo shops. He also happens to be smoking hot, covered in tattoos and pierced up! When these two meet there is immediate chemistry followed by a wild night. Unfortunately, Delaney does not remember a minute of it. When she awakens in his bed, she runs like she always has. Jackson, however, doesn't give up so easily."Laney, like a thief, steals time, because at that moment it feels like the hands of time have stopped for us."It takes time, persistence and a lot of patience, but Jackson knows Laney's brand of crazy is it for him. He just has to convince her to change her ways and love herself to let him in."Sometimes the heart knows things that the mind hasn't figured out yet"This is the first book I have read from this author. It was a great storyline, the characters were well developed and the sex scenes were hot! This is a standalone with a HEA! I highly recommend it!I was given a complimentary copy by the author in return for an honest review.

I don't often review or rate the books I read on Amazon, but this book was fantastic.  I was hooked from the first chapter.  I had to keep reading to see how that chapter fit with the rest of the book.  There was a point or two when I actually had to go back to reread the first chapter to make sure I didn't miss a key detail.And the plot twist.... I kept asking how things  were going to tie together, but I truly never saw THAT coming!  I actually had to stop  and hold my head in my hands, and then I went back and reread 3 times to make sure it really happened.  I don't know if everyone was caught off guard like me, but I never expected what happened-- which makes this book truly fabulous to me.Then the tears came.  I haven't cried while reading a book in years!  I think the last time was when Dumbledore died in the Harry Potter series (Ok, I admit I am a nerd, but still!)!The character development was so thorough for a single novel, as opposed to the current trend of writing trilogies.  I felt a connection to these people.  Though I didn't love either character's name (which will keep me from reading a book) I was amazed at how close I felt to them. Win was not a helpless, whiny woman.  She was tough and strong, which I liked. Mav was awesome!There were a few holes which I wondered about that the author didn't fill in, but it didn't detract from the story.Overall, I think this book is worthy of a best sellers list-- any-- if not the NYTIMES!!!!!

This one was a great surprise. I stumbled over it and took a chance, as I often do, and I loved it!!I loved the dual POV's and the frank honesty, particularly from the H.The only issue I had was how incredibly arrogant the SEAL team came across. I understand that this is probably realistic, however, I sometimes felt like punching them. I was also disappointed in their choices of women that you met at dinner. It seemed like the only reason the men were with them was because of fake blonde, big boob looks. This actually says more about the quality of the men rather than the idiot women.Aside from those small issues, this was a really great book and I look forward to more from this author.

I loved this book and the ride it took me on. I was heartbroken at time and cried a lot, but also felt the love and connection with the characters. This is one of my new favorites and I will probably read it several more times.

This book really held my attention from beginning to end.  The writing was witty and the characters were entertaining.  The only reason I stopped at 4 stars is because it was so sad at times it made me grieve.  This is probably the mark of a 5 star writer, but I'm a sissy and I can't shake the heavy feeling that goes along with it.  It's like watching a really scary movie and then trying to sleep in a haunted house alone.  The movie may have been good and ended well, but you still have that felling of uneasiness.

I did not think that I would get into this book at first. When I read the summary I was not intrigued by the Deal aspect. But that quickly changed!! I fell in love and got wrapped up in the story of Mav and Windsor!! Must read
This book was such an awesome story I was instantly stuck in. I laughed and I cried like a baby.
summary: Could not put this book down.

reviewText: Ahhh I want more. It was so good. You had that bad gut feeling most of the book. I couldn't figure out if the dude was sincere at first or not. This book has everything. It has the love, cheating, sex, drama, loss, pain, heartache, the blunt best friend, hot men and everything in between. I couldn't stop reading. The ending was perfect and I'm excited Morg will get her own book. I was just in the mood for one of these random books. I saw it on Amazon, it didn't have a lot of reviews, but the ones it did have were good. So glad I purchased it.

OMG all I can say is I really loved Crazy Good. It has been a while since I have felt this way about a book. I laughed, cried (boy did I cry at them letters) I felt it all.I'm not very good at giving reviews but all I can say if you haven't read Crazy Good yet it really is a must & if you have read it, I'm sure you are just like me & feel it all & just loved it too.Thank Rachel for sharing this breathtaking, amazing, wonderful story with us I will always remember Mav & Win xxx
summary: Best Read In A Long Time

reviewText: I really enjoyed this book. More than I expected. Windsor is a character that you grow to love more and more throughout the book. She starts off as a real bitch.. But in the smart mouthy cool way. Taking no crap she gives maverick a run for his money. He actually had to work hard at getting her attention. And what starts off as a challenge turns out to be his salvation and redemption. As the story progresses Win shows a more vulnerable side, she is so loving and forgiving and is so good for Maverick.I won't get into the storyline, but as in all good romance novels, there's drama, and Mav he broke my heart.. I was so mad but I still couldn't get myself to dislike him, because I understood why he did what he did. But my heart also broke for him..I would love to read a follow up, perhaps about Morgana, who is a character I was very fascinated with. Talk about powerhouse!I give this a solid 4 star. The only reason it didn't get 5 was due to the fact that the story starts off with a big revelation but the follow up fell flat. And I was disappointed. However, the rest totally made up for it.

Frank Florence has done anyone who reads his book, “Sell Products on Amazon with Fulfillment by Amazon”, a great service by writing this book.We live in an age where job security is a thing of the past and a helpful manual like this can not only allow someone to live the life they always wanted (and travel the world as Frank suggests), but more importantly provide the second or main income that keeps a person or family afloat in tough economic times.The book is very detailed in outlining the specific steps someone must take to sell their product using Fulfillment by Amazon.  Frank is obviously familiar with the process and provides easy to understand instructions.  He is also truthful enough to let any reader know that building this type of business takes time and effort, but by following his guide it can lead to great success.I did have two issues with the book.  In two areas that I saw he repeated text.  For instance in talking about the “Variable Closing Fee – This is a fixed-amount fee that is based on the type of item you are selling.”  One sentence later he repeats the same text.  I found a similar error in another part of the book.  If you are projecting yourself as an expert in the field, as Frank is, spend the time or money to proofread your work.  It is the least you can do for your audience.Secondly, if Frank has a commercial interest in any of the websites or services he writes about in the book, in the interest of full disclosure he should make those known.  I don’t begrudge anyone the opportunity to make money, but if you are telling me a website or service is the best, and you have a financial stake in it, you should make that clear.Other than those two points I found the book helpful and full of useful, actionable material.  I would recommend it to anyone looking to supplement their income using Fulfillment by Amazon.

each crossroad seems to be better then the last this one really went after those who had hurt the shifters and built a good relation between the couple. very cute moments. wondering if the crossroad will branch of to those who dont need the crossroads

I got 'Frugal Cooking with Dry and Canned Foods' simply because I love cooking and learning new ways to do it and trying out different recipes. Donna K Stevens has put together a solid book with not only great recipes but also awesome tips and tricks of the trade! She also shares how to save some money when cooking and that's a huge plus during these hard economical times. I'd Highly Recommend this title to anyone who spends more than 10 minutes a day in their kitchen! A strong 5 Stars from me.

What a lot of fun I had with this book. Mai Tai Man by Sabrina Devonshire is a lusty, exciting story told just that way. Two strangers caught in a storm in Mexico and just about anything can happen, and plenty does. It’s a fantastic read (the first I’ve read by this author, but it won’t be the last!). Highly recommended 5-stars.

I've read Ms. Chaffin's work before, but for some reason this story just seemed to resonate with me.  It's set in small town, sixties America and the author succeeded in completely transporting me to that town, to that time.  The love story is one of those universal tales that I think everyone can relate to on some level, and the story itself was just the right amount of suspense to keep me reading, but not drive me crazy.  I loved the H - rooted for him throughout the novel.  It was just an overall, great read.  I'm typically a historical romance junkie, but it was easy to fall in love with the story.  I recommend it to anyone who enjoys romance.
I was mesmerized by this story from start to finish! I can't wait to read more from this wonderful author!!!

Leah has been with her boyfriend for 6 years and after giving him an ultimatum, he proposes. But things with Charlie haven't been great in awhile. Truth be told he's a total douche and she just doesn't see it. He works long hours, says out all night, isn't affectionate with her at all and he is clearly getting sex elsewhere because they will go weeks without.Lonely one night, Leah decides to look up an old crush from high school. Daniel was the one that got away and from her cyber-stalking he seems to have gotten even better with age.After an intense reunion where the sparks fly, Leah has to decide what and who she really wants for her life. Charlie, who seems to be hiding something and appears more embarrassed of her than anything else or Daniel who wants her from the moment he lays his eyes on her.When Leah is betrayed by one of these men in the worst way, she must decide how to trust and move on and open her heart again.“I learned what love was. Real, earth-shattering, heart-stopping, world-changing, love.”I think Louise Bay did an amazing job with her debut novel. The characters were likable, funny, and well developed. I think the editing was done extremely well (which sometimes with first time authors this isn’t the case) and the story flowed beautifully. I look forward to more from this author!

This is a good book to have on hand if you’re having a difficult pregnancy or have already suffered a miscarriage. It gives you the signs to watch out for with miscarriages, how to prevent a miscarriage, and how to cope if you do suffer one. It’s a great book to make pregnant more aware of what miscarriages are and why and how they happen.

Full disclosure: I received an ebook copy of this work in exchange for an unbiased, honest review.Like its two predecessors, "Cursed Children" is set in the land of Naor, telling three stories connected only by their focus on the great forces of good and evil playing out their battle through the singular and unlikely. Like its predecessors, it is intensely descriptive and includes a many-faceted, highly variable cast that will surprise and impress you as they draw you onward. Also like its predecessors, it seems to have lost some of its sheen in translation, as errors abound, though hey do not detract some of the comprehensibility of the story.Again, the stories come from frozen lands, a medieval countryside, and the mysterious desert. The protagonists are each strong in their own ways, but have a lot of growing to do, especially in the third story. We spend a comparatively short time with these characters, but I found myself growing very attached. All in all, three solidly-told stories.Bottom line: If you liked the first two, you'll like this one as well; if you didn't, you won't. If you've never read any of them before, but are a fan of high fantasy with the severity of realism, this might be for you. A warning to parents, this is a violent, sexual work, so - not for your small children. With questions or comments, feel free to post here to contact me at SeanOnAmazon@gmail.com.
This is a GREAT series!!!  I purchased the two remaining books in the series.  I recommend purchasing the whole series; you will love it too!!

3.5 StarsThis was a very quick read and I enjoyed it for the most part. Things moved VERY quickly and I found myself wishing for a little more story development. I'm still not sure what happened to Gavin and why Harper thought there was more to the story than just a simple accident.*I received an ARC from the author/publisher in exchange for an honest review.

I was so excited when I got the notice that this book had been published and I wasn't disappointed.  It was so nice to travel back to Medieval Scotland again.  I loved the way this book tied in with the others in the previous series.  I always enjoy when an author brings back some of our favorite characters so we can catch up with what's happened to them.Another hot and sexy story, can't wait for the next book in the series to find out what happens.
I would say this is more of a prologue. After reading I can't wait to see what the rest of the stories hold..

I have to do a review on this before I forget my thoughts. That is possible to happen, yet I was so annoyed/pissed/ranty/ragey by the end of this little intro to this massive book collection that I might not forget it.So, a group of authors are doing what is called Invitation to Eden. For the next few months I speculate three short stories will be released at a time and it all takes place on Eden and island in the Bermuda Triangle. Well, this is the story about how it came to be, and who owns it, and why.Well, I didn't hate it, but I also really hated it.You see, I loved the whole concept the author was rolling with here. She was great at the whole Alpha male thing. She also spun the whole 'he's a beast thing.' You feel so bad for him, you want to wrap him in a bear hug and make it all better while allowing him to flog the crap out of you.Enter Joely.This is where the story went horribly wrong for me.They were given great banter, chemistry, even some attraction. Then what does the author do? She has the anti hero hook up with some fantasy submissive that is oh so perfect and like the bestest submissive ever!I was like UM WHAT!Now, I had to read it again. And the author basically tried to tell you with all the subtly of a sledgehammer to not ship this duo. "Oh, your not my type. Oh, we aren't attracted to each other. Oh, I'm not here for your and your not here for me." Those are the exact likes but Joely basically screams at the reader:DO NOT SHIP THIS COUPLE!DO NOT SHIP THIS COUPLE!DO NOT SHIP THIS COUPLE!Well, guess what I SHIPPED JOELY AND V!!!!!!!!The idea of a tiny little spitfire brunette and a man they call a 'beast' and is a huge hulking dominant--ummmmmmmmm you kind of subconsciously created Belle and the Beast and now I want my ship or I will throw a massive tantrum all over this book series!So, that was my adventure last night. I like the idea of a bunch of authors writing one similar verse so I'll be reading all these. It looks like in May, Lauren has another book in this series, with a Blonde on the cover, and why do I get the feeling this magical submissive is going to be his HEA?Sighs....The only hope for this is Joely getting someone. They just... sighs.... nevermind.... I'm prepared for the disappointment.

Freelance writing is possible for most people, if they are determined enough to push through some failures and make it to the other side. This book provides an excellent guide on knowing zero to getting your first few paid jobs. The checklists in there have easy to follow steps and are realistic. An overall good book

This was a really good book full of information. I like to write and though I don't plan on becoming a freelancer I read this book mainly for information and I honestly feel like I would have the information to start a freelance career if need be. Great read for anyone trying to get into the field.
summary: Super easy to digest, packed with good info, and a breezy read

reviewText: This book is a great read for children because it is all about jungles.  There are quick facts as well as loads of really interesting information about this type of habitat. There is even a quiz to take in the back of the book.Also included are locations for jungles, what types of plants and animals live in jungles, as well as brief notes about some species. There are even a few pictures throughout the book.I would highly recommend this title for inquisitive children to read, for you to read with your child, or even for adults that want to learn more about jungles.

First I just want to say that I loved the book however I did have a couple of dislikes. I hate the cover, it's nothing close to the description of Reno or Jimmy in the book. It actually was a major turn off for me. The next dislike was the jealousy Jimmy has toward his dad. It doesn't fit and also is a turn off, it makes him seem immature yet he's dating and marry, Now with that out of the way I do like the story itself as Jimmy struggles to fit in Reno's world as a man and not just the Mob Boss' son. The love this family has and the way this latest "entanglement" played out did not disappoint. I can't wait for the next installment

A slow start and then bam it was on.Boy that was so exciting,I didn't want it to end. Jimmy is definitely Reno son, don't mess with the one they love! Can't wait to see what's next! Please don't let us wait to long.What's going on with Tommy and Grace? I'm waiting for Sal and Gemma also. I know you don't want to rush great writing, but I just want to know what going to happen next! I'm so anxious?????

Jimmy Mack Gabrini has really come into his own. Sometimes son needs his daddy and sometimes son wants to be like daddy and sometimes is even confused by daddy. But when it counts, son understands the things his daddy went through and stepped up to the plate.This was a good story. Reno and Jimmy did not disappoint. The bad guys are forever after Reno for one thing or another. This time, Reno and Jimmy took care of them. Trina could hold her on also.Keep putting the Mob Boss out there Me. Monroe and I will keep reading them!
WOW!!! From the first story until now it just keeps getting better!!! Now what's going on with Tommy and Grace???
The story was fun and cute but it was just to short to really feel anything about the people in the story.

The first one was great and the 2nd did not disappoint...I'm so mad at Dontay..And I hope Jazzy doesn't stoop to his level with Free....Diamond and Q, I love them...I hope they get it together...Carina...as bad as I dislike her, I hope she gets her life and her baby daddy back....I loved the introduction of these new characters and the p.o.v from some of the old ones who didn't have one in the 1st book....great job Tiana

I got this book for free and felt compelled to read the story. I wish the author hadn't added the senator steamy scenes to the mix because it distracted me.Another thing, the author might not have noticed but if the MC is forced to perform a bj then that's rape. I don't know how she pretended it was not.
summary: I read to the end and never got bored

reviewText: Boring, sorry, this book did not do anything for me

With all the stories of witches and fantasy out there, simon kewin has found a interesting twist to add to the genre. He created a world in which our world and an alternate world collide in epic proportions. A great twist to this type of fantasy he has created.Cait is a normal teenager or so she thought. Her friend danny she secretly likes but doesn't decide how much until they go through this high stakes adventure together in this book.Danny is thrilled when they are revealed to be dating but even more thrilled with the world he is now in. He has Cait and is trying to help her prevent catastrophe from occurring which could kill everyone witches and humans alike. Especially since it is seen humans are unknowingly being used to help sustain evil. What happens to turn Cait's world upside down and make her go from normal teenager to witch extraordinaire? Going to the library to visit her Grams. here her world is turned upside down and so is Danny's. here there is explosion, undain's trying to kill witches while trying to get a Grimoire. A very valuable piece of the Grimoire. In the alternate universerse Fer kills a undain and ends up on the witch's isle where their archives are attacked for a Grimoire. The grimoire is not found but it is revealed that there world is about to be turned upside down and not in a good way. So a group is set out to come to england to try to prevent or slow down this bad topsy turviness that is about to occur. It is in England working with Cait's mom and grandmother that Fer feels she belongs somewhere. the side characters of Johnny and Ran are great as well. the Archeon that helps has a wee bit of a snarky attitude but I guess if you are a book worm you can. I love what happens when he is introduced to the smartphone and information highway.It takes Caits life being in danger for her mom to wake up from her despair of losing her husband and embrace who she is. A witch  descended from Ilminion. Not a good dude. Glad he's dead phew. Anywho Cait, her mom, her grandmother, danny, ran and fer are set out to stop the Lich King from gaining more power while being chased by Genera. A wonderful ending that has a wee bit of a cliffy..a great fantastical book about witches and finding your strengths and growing into yourself and your confidence in yourself. I love the romance that  began with Danny and Cait and hope his heroics in the end are not in vain. I would like to see them together at the end of this trilogy. A fun light read that will have you smiling.

Not only does Ford cover how to grow organic berries, he includes a bit about which ones will work in containers and which won't, even down to specific varieties, and the pros and cons of container versus yard planting.  Good primer!
This story is perfect for taking the reader away from their own world. It is a romp through a foreign with a little romance, a little intrigue, and some likable characters. Delightful.
I really enjoyed this book. A great story of the daily life of a woman and her struggles as a newly single parent in a new country dealing with old folklore and traditions.

I enjoyed this book very much. Thank goodness "Friday's" problems are not my own, yet I could identify strongly with her. The story has its tragedies and its moments of heart-break, yet I laughed until I cried through most of it. It's SO hilariously funny!

I loved this book about butterflies; I must say I learnt quite a bit myself. The book is split into two sections the first a light hearted approach that younger children will love, humanizing the insects. The second half is full of facts about butterflies, which means it caters for a growing child who may become more interested in facts later on.
summary: An ideal book for the growing child

reviewText: This book is  It is really two books in one. First a wonderful adventure of Mandy the Monarch Butterfly. A delightful story you can read to your kids. (a great parent.//grand parent bonding tool)  Of course the children will learn about the life of butterflies by listening to the story. The second part is a beautiful set of brilliant color photos of all stages of the butterflies and their lives. With the pictures you are given some little known facts about the butterfly. If you have children or grand children you should have this book. The kids will love it and request it over and over, and you will enjoy ti.
Another excellent story by Selena Kitt!  Hooks you instantly and you won't want to put it down till it's gone. Can't wait for more! #powerplay
This book had moments of entertainment but unfortunately it started to really drag. I did finish it but I'm not interested in reading any more of the series.

Let me introduce to the band OBLIVION. NICK, SIMON. DEACON, GRAY AND JAZZ.. Their band is finally taking off . They are on their first tour and loving it. The Deacon meets Harper Pruitt a up and coming chef , working in the kitchen on the road. Boy do sparks fly with Harper and Deacon. Will they survive the 5 weeks together or will they flame out before the band makes it big.Cari and Taryn take us on a world wind love affair between two people who did not think they belonged anywhere. Deacon the tall hot guitarist with a heart of gold. He is so good looking, one tall drink of water if I do say so myself. He is also the peace maker for the band . When things go bad he tries to bring everyone back together.Harper is an up and coming chef , who loves being on the road. She works in the kitchen to help get her career going. She loves the work and loves to cook. She also loves to spoil the boys in the crew and the boys in the band. Then when she finds Deacon . She tries to control herself around him. She keeps telling herself that as they grow closer and closer. But when it comes right down to it will Harper run or keep it going with DeaconI don't usually don't read rocker books but Rocked really caught my attention. Its is a sweet sexy book. The main characters are written with such love. You know that Deacon is falling hard and so is Harper but they don't want to let go of the past and what has happened to them . All the characters are well written, my favorite character has to be Jazz , that girl can rock and she is just a happy bundle of joy wrapped up in a cute little rocker chick body.  She is the little sister everyone wants .Both Cari and Taryn can write individually but together they are a dynamic duo. They are writing dynamo. They really know how to write a great book with characters that seem to be broken and it takes that one woman to help them out.They create such a great backdrop to the stories , the intensity of the scenes rock big time. The best scene I like was the tattooing scene. Where Harper is all over the place like a bunny rabbit on Ritalin. It was cute. There are tons of sweet scenes in the book and also some very hot and sexy scenes also. They rock heheheheheheheheSo if you want a great rocker book check out ROCKED, trust me you will not be disappointed in the hot sexy men and the music and women they loveI give this a 4 out of 5 booksI give this a 4 out 4 on erotica scale

I was really blown away when I first read Grisham's novel "The Confession", only then to discover that he is famous for his best-selling works in the legal thriller genre. Just thought I'd read this book out of curiosity. Really FASCINATED at his life... very impressed at how his previous career in law translated well into his creative works. Great to learn his principles for success here too.

Little Orchid's story is emotionally charged and heartfelt. The author captures the innocence and wonder of a middle aged child so well. The story is very descriptive without being overly done. The vividness of the descriptions will help readers to be fully immersed in the underwater world and also the small world of Singapore that Little Orchid and her family live in. I recommend this book especially for children who are suffering with low self-esteem or with the "middle child syndrome." This book will encourage children of all ages to never give up and have faith in their own abilities.
summary: Heartwarming and Encouraging Tale for Kids of all ages

reviewText: I loved reading this book! I have tried many different diets over the past couple of years but have always had a hard time getting started and sticking to it. That's why this book was great for me since our has the days laid out. Overall I am very happy with my purchase!

So I am about a year behind on my TBR list.  My friend knew I had this book and insisted I read it as soon as I could.  WHEW!  What a read!  I don't do spoilers, but I will tell you that the POV is from Blake the rich pretty boy.  I don't know about you, but I LOVE when I get to read a book from the male POV.  We are women we know what we like and such, but to hear from the male.  MMMMMM...Surprisingly, there is no sex in this book, but a lot of taking care of one's self.  A lot of crude talk (like I said, if you are prude...).  That don't bother me in the least.  If you like a fun flirty book about attraction read this series.  OHHH...Make sure you have book 2 on hand when you finish this book.  MAJOR cliffhanger!  Now off to hear Blake whisper in my ear what is going on in book 2 :-)
summary: If you are a prude, then don't read this book.  For all others....AWESOME!!

reviewText: Though sex is the main theme of the story, I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't the main event.  Amazingly enough there is a story line. Characters are developing, a story is unfolding, things that many of these erotic romances writers seems to forget is needed in a truly good story. I had hoped the story would be a little more humorous then it is, but it is light hearted and fun. I do have difficultly  believing that the heroine would waist her time with much less be engaged to such an obvious schmuck, I guess we all have our blind spots.I will be getting the next book.

I really enjoyed April and the Single Heart. If you're into fun, easy-to-read romance novels that aren't too ridiculously over-the-top, you'll really dig this. The dialogue between the characters is natural and humorous. I always like to say, the test of a good romance novel is - would I like to read these people's conversations if there wasn't some sex in this book? And I definitely would. There's a tinge of Sex and the City-style interaction that adds a great, entertaining level to this book. Plus, the steamy scenes are nice and HOT! Five stars!

Armageddon Heights is a well crafted and creative thriller that kept this reader enthralled throughout the entire story.  The unique story idea is combination Sci-fi and intense mystery suspense novel.  The characters are well developed, and the author's gift for describing scenes and situations is excellent!  Another great thriller from D. M. Mitchell

Wow, I never knew you could lose weight just by drinking water. That's a new one for me. After reading Tiffany story, I truly understand what she is going through. It took her 5 months. I went through a stage of depression which made me have a low self-esteem about myself. At a young age, I decided to go on a strict diet. I barely ate and lost maybe 20 pounds. It took me a few months or maybe a year. I can't remember. I didn't like how thick i was or how I looked at that age. Now that I am grown, I realized that God made me the way he wanted me to be. I have to accept the fact that I am kind of thick from giving birth to a child 4 years ago and deal with it.
She makes a great case for water. I have never liked water, but it is time to give it a shot. I`m on it.

How I Lost 80 LBS in 5 Months By Just Drinking More WaterThe title of this book immediately had my attention.  This was such an enlightening book about something very simple.  Tiffany Young shares her story of being obese, having diabetes, and being depressed.  Her weight had a devastating effect on her body and at this point, she knew she had to do something.  After her Mother discovers the H2O diet, Tiffany does a little research and decides to give it a try.  She takes us along with her on the five month journey, month by month.  Tiffany shares with us how she incorporates water into her daily activities and the results she achieves each month.  I recommend this book to anyone who has tried every diet out there, with no results.  Who would have thought that just drinking more water could make such an extreme, positive, difference?

This story was as good as the first book, Losing Me, Finding You. I LOVED LOVED LOVED Beck. Just wow. And I was glad he fell for Tease and their ending was what I was hoping for. You cry, laugh and get fighting mad reading this story but oh is it good. Well I am on to the continuation of Austin and Amy's story. The last book in the series. After that, I have purchased the Rock series I am looking forward to reading.More great works from C.M. Stunich. I would recommend your books to anyone who enjoys a great book.
summary: THIS WAS AN EXCELLENT STORY IN THE SERIES

reviewText: I just finished reading For Better Or For Worse. It is written by Krissy V. It's about a woman who marries the man of her dreams. After getting married, he turns out to be a different man then she thought he was. She becomes scared and confused. She doesn't know who to turn to and she feels alone.Before I talk about how I felt about this book, I want to give Krissy V. a salute for being able to write this book. It must have taken her a lot of courage. I respect and admire that about her. I really enjoyed this book. It through me through some loops, but it kept me on edge through the whole thing. It was dramatic and suspenseful, and it was also sweet and seductive in some points.The only thing I really didn't like about this book was that I felt that the main character was portrayed as a little childish. I get that a lot of abused women start to take on this quality, so I'm not saying this as a bad thing or an insult against the author. I just feel it kind of contradicts here trying to get the jobs she's going for interviews for.I fully recommend many women read this story. I especially recommend it to women who are or have been abused in their life, or those who know somebody who is or might be abused. This was a powerfully intense story. It's well worth the read!
I really liked this book it has certainly opened my eyes to becoming more of the person that I really want to be.I really recommend this book!!

Have you ever wanted to see what the bad boy hero was like before he met his perfect match? A lot of books make mention of his wild ways, but in Forever Steel, MJ Fields gives readers the tattooed brothers in all of their manwhore glory. In this prequel of sorts, we are invited into Cyrus’ housewarming and Xavier’s birthday party extravaganza with all of the booze, women, and illicit acts you care to find and experience. We get the no holds barred versions of Jase, Cyrus, Zander, and Xavier; they may be brothers, but they definitely have their own personalities and sexual appetites, and MJ does a great job of illustrating who they are individually as well as the bond that they share. Their view on women in this prequel is quite different from what they feel as they connect with the love interest in the series full texts. Women seem to be only the brothers’ playthings; they use them for what they want and send them on their way. There’s no overnighters, no feelings…just the experience and that’s it.Forever Steel provides a quick and sexy introduction to the Steel brothers and their friends. It provides a bit of their backstory in terms of their bachelor ways and helps readers to see how far they truly have come when their current story is told. If you love the Men of Steel, you don’t want to miss seeing who they used to be.A complimentary copy of the text was provided by the author in exchange for an honest review.4 poison apples (The Fairest of All Book Reviews)
summary: Great look at who the Steel Men used to be

reviewText: I could just faint! why would you leave your readers like this? I have to know what happened I have too many questions, let's get to the end of this saga.  I truly enjoyed part 2 just as much as part 1. the ending had me stuck , mouth hung and all.

Jane Porter takes us back to Marietta, Montana for a sexy, fun, small town romance that's impossible to put down. Troy and Taylor's story shines and makes it well worth the trip. You'll love this addition to the Montana Born Copper Mountain, series.

I didn't finish this. I couldn't stomach what was done to the heroine. I'd like to wipe those things and images out of my mind because I feel bad every time I think of her and this bookI've read of other heroines with horrible pasts and stories but maybe the lack of overly detailed facts helped me to keep reading.

4:5 ****Oh my what a raw and gut wrenching ride. Rose an orphan from a defunct MC has grown up in a care facility in Quebec since her biker family was obliterated when she was twelve years old. Her Father's enemies offer her a future of pain and sin of the like she can't even contemplate but she doesn't have a choice if she wants to survive this hell on Earth. The author has gone out on a limb and wrote a gutsy and shocking lifestyle that reveals a really dark side to what most biker books only touch on. I applaud her confidence to say it how she did and weave a devastating drama filled with such a vivid tone of cruelty. I couldn't put this book down and hated the bad guys and pray Rose will seek revenge on all the men who have torn her apart. I'm rooting for Rose and Josh her knight in shining armor to ruin the filthy bikers and finish them all. Great story telling..........
You must write book 2!!!!The book kept my attention for several hours. Well worth the read. But it now!
Liked it, ready for book 2.

A really good book; I bought this and read it in one day.  I really enjoyed the story line; had a lot of good action thrown in with a clear-cut good guys and bad guys.  Can't wait for a sequel.  More, more, more, more......................
Always a good read from Cia Leah - everyone reading this will enjoy
Terrific story but wish it was longer.I have read other  books by this author and have enjoyed every one of them
to see the purple hunks back at last was awesome. the story was pretty good and the characters had me smiling. if u loved the other abduction books in the series then youll like this one.

This erotic alien romance is an out of this world read that tickles the reader.  I found the world fascinating and entertaining and the characters fun and captivating. I was totally engrossed in this enjoyable alien romance from beginning to end and since I haven’t read the other ones yet, I’ll not only be doing that, but I will be looking for more in this series.  Did I mention that purple is my favorite color?See my full review at: The Jeep Diva .com

I love Eve Langlais because she includes a lot of comedy, along with hot alpha males an steaminess. This was by far my favorite purple alien. He was so bent on being a hero, it did not matter if the woman wanted rescuing or not. Loved it!
This was an incredible page turner!!  I was shocked by events in this book and was left wondering where do we go from here?

Michael Thomas, Kudos on not only a great ending, but also a great series. you are a master story teller sir. also I only saw ten misspelled words in this one, hopefully your proofreaders will continue to get better and earn their keep, so you can focus on more great ideas. lol
What a cliff hanger,  waiting for part 2.... great job I hope he can save Sierra. I , REALLY enjoyed this book.
Oh My God this is a must read, this is true die hard love, and you know we love our kids but who would really go through this, all I can say is HE DID THAT.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book, another wonderful cosy murder mystery by an author who has become one of my favourites.  This time set in Kent and the Isle of Wight – places I hardly know in real life,  but now  I just have to visit!This is the 13th in the Libby series – and I’ve read and enjoyed them all.  Lesley Cookman certainly hasn’t disappointed with the latest adventures of Libby and her friends.  I just couldn’t put the book down,  and as I have done with the other Libby books, read it in 2 or 3 sittings.  Although the books can be read out of sequence, I do recommend reading them in order to get the most out of them.  The characters have developed since the first book, and so has the writing -  I’ve enjoyed the journey immensely – so much so I plan to re-read them all as a treat to myself this summer!  I do wish I liked tea as much as Libby does (can’t stand the stuff) but I do like fresh coffee, and love all the talk of food and wine being a bit of a foodie myself!Libby collects friends with each story, adding them to her group of friends, such is the warmth that flows through each book.  Whilst reading I too feel part of that inner circle of Libby’s – she and her friends leap out of the pages of the book  and surround me with their warmth.  I adore them all – and can’t wait for the next book!  Keep on writing please Lesley Cookman!
summary: Loved it! Another fabulous Libby Sarjeant mystery!

reviewText: This gives a lot of good advice and sources for finding markets for a variety of freelance writing. I will come back to add the fifth star someday, if I ever actually sell something.

Received this book from story cartel ,for my honest review.This is a very interesting way of doing a book,with all the unexpected life lessons.Sherlock Holmes is a very good detective,this book brought it into a more modern times.Most of the classics should be used in the school room,like we were growing up.Very anxious to read the rest of classics.

I love the collection of recipes and how they are sorted out depending on the vegetable. There are also pictures to help readers identify the vegetable if they are not familiar with it and there are many recipes to choose from which are not time consuming and are easy to follow.
summary: I'm starting to turn vegan with the help of this book

reviewText: I was quite wary of Children Of Na at first. Within the first few pages, we jump from an antechamber of a mysterious planet run by a genetically engineered creature, to WWII Russia. From the maps provided before the prologue, it becomes apparent that the story can only get stranger from here.As other reviewers have mentioned, this is definitely an interesting mix of genres, hopping from science fiction to WWII adventure to pre-Civil War drama and more. While I enjoyed the interplay of the different genres, I felt that this was also a hindrance at times. I found that the WWII sections with Yakob had the strongest and most refined writing, while the Plantation sections felt the weakest and most raw. On their own, each of these storylines could be expanded to a short story or novella that ties into the same plot, but by being put together, there isn’t as much space to focus on the separate threads as individual stories, resulting in an unpolished feel in some parts. The dialogue is also a bit heavy-handed at times, bordering the line between realistic dialogue and caricature dialogue.Even with these drawbacks (and don’t get the wrong idea, they are quite minor nitpicks of mine), I still enjoyed the overall plot greatly, if not for the interesting concept, then at least for the gutsy decision to try to pull it off (and be mostly successful). The story definitely starts off a bit slow, and because of the hopping around, the pacing also feels a bit off at times, but it definitely picks up in the last two-thirds of the book. I could see some people not liking the book because of what feels like a lack of focus due to the genre-hopping, but I could also see some people really enjoying it the blend of genres. Of all the genre fans, it would most likely appeal to science fiction fans the most, as the other two genres feel more like a result of the plot instead of being plot drivers. While it’s not for everyone, I’d still be likely to recommend it to fans of science fiction.

Hope starts off at a comforting pace. The characters are introduced and come to life within this rest home. The descriptions are vivid and precise. I am curious as to where this will lead. It's a very easy story to get sucked into and I ended up reading this charming story over one sitting.The storyline covers a very important subject where a persons dignity is concerned. Doesn't everyone deserve to keep their dignity no matter how old or how frail? This is an empowering story written with heart and soul. "Hope" is full of humanity."I would like dignity myself," Mr. Dry said to himself. "At times I feel like I am only a pawn and that I have never fought hard enough for what I believe in."

Wow, what a roller coaster ride of emotions Mr Swisher takes us through. Boredom, despair, uselessness, loneliness. The struggles of the state, welfare of our loved ones, plus their dignity and the need to interact and have fun! The characters are wonderful. I could see many people reflected in these diverse men and women. You will see friends and relatives with some of these traits.  The antics of some of the men are are hysterical. The women heartfelt. Harold is such a joy!I HOPE I will recall this sweet book often as I approach getting older so that the importance of hope never fades from my life.

A sad but touching tale. Overall, it is very well written.This is the sort of book that makes me think. I think about the obvious things, like what my life is likely to end up like when I'm older, but also about other things, like what I treasure in my life.I like books that make me think and remind me to value the positives in my life.
summary: The kind of book that makes me think (in a good way)

Blake’s intense feeling for Kaitlyn left me in utter aww. He was a mix of pure tortured evil as well as gentle and protective.I absolutely loved Blake and Kaitlyn’s story. reviewText: This book is a necessary guide for those considering college. If you are still in high school learn from Mr. Ibarra's experience and get as many dual enrollment classes as you can. You will be glad you did when you have a few tens of thousands of dollars to pay back when you are done with college. Alvaro Ibarra gives some very important tips in how you can get the most out of college academically and socially. Some of his tips are also easily applicable outside of a college campus and that can serve you just as well in business. I think this would make a great read for anyone about to head off to college. Get the most out of college with these ten tips.

This is for both soon to be college students or current students.  The vast majority of college students are in for a bit of a culture shock.  There is more then just going to class and studying.This book is about avoiding debt, being adventures, how to be safe, get a job and be social.  Plus so much more.  Great advice from front to back.  I highly recommend it.

reviewText: Rating:  3.5 StarsThe story of Grayson (member of Defiant Motorcycle Club, ex-prisoner, would be hero) and Promise (member of the Faithful Last Disciples and Saints religion, midwife, cousin to Rachel).  Promise is forced/coerced into marrying an older leader of her religion.  Needless to say after the 'wedding night' things did not go so well for Promise.  When she runs into Grayson and begs for his help, the relationship between Promise, who is trying to heal, and Grayson, who wants to protect her, is born.From the beginning, this book was intense and contained some uncomfortable brutal scenes, well written, but brutal.  Grayson was a gentle soul.  If it was not for the motorcycle, you would have no idea that he belonged to a MC.  I was emotionally drawn to Promise in the beginning.  She went through a lot and stayed strong.  The action drama...AMAZING!!  I was sitting on the edge of my seat screaming at my reader!  Several characters from book one, "Know Me" were weaved into this story:  Kira/Orion, Rachel/Casper, Maddox, Brandon, Teague.  I hope more books will be coming in this series about some of the secondary characters!Why Not 5 Stars?Rawness of the MC -  This did not feel like a Motorcycle club.  I had no idea what the club did for money or what they were into.  In fact, if you took away the bikes, this was just a story.  I like my MC books raw and edgy.  Other than the biker's use of profanity, they have a squeaky clean club.  Grayson, while he was sweet and tender, I did not see any of his hardness throughout the book.  *Sigh*Change in Character Personalities -  I was endeared to Promise in the beginning.  However, she totally changed and none of her previous qualities remained after she got busy with Grayson.  She all of a sudden turned into some hard chick.  It was just not believable.  Don't get me wrong...I loved her for the fight scene...she rocked it!  Kira, what happened to her?  She came off as a 17 year old high school girl who bounces into rooms.  This was not her personality in "Know Me".  I did not understand the need to change it.  I hate to pick on Grayson again, but after the scene where he initially meets Kira, that was the last time we saw our tough, kick-butt hero.  His character turned into a wuss.  Very disappointing.Unfinished Business -  I had several unanswered questions:  There were many ends that needed to be tied up.Edit, Edit, Edit!!!  I typically breeze by editing mistakes.  However, there were so many that I noticed them and it was distracting.

This is the third book by this author, and her writing just keeps getting better and better (and it was fantastic on book number one, so you can just imagine what the level is at book number three!). Ms. Brent has a very keen sense about the human psyche; she intuitively knows what drives people and their need for survival or growth. She writes about two subject (human bondage and an MC club) that is realistic yet sensitive, heart-breaking yet humbling, and enraging yet enriching. That is the beauty of her writing~ the dichotomy that it entails. I loved Promise and Grayson beyond all words.You don't have to read the 'prequel' novella, but I would suggest it just to become familiar with some of the characters. It certainly won't be wasted time as Kira and Orion are their own brand of wonderful.And if you have ever visited or lived in Arizona this book will also bring a smile to your face as Ms. Brent brings back all the sights, sounds, and smells of the Sonoran desert. Don't forget the javelinas!I hope that Ms. Brent is writing more for her Defiance MC group. Brendan, Maddox, and the guy who owns the garage in town (forgot his name- he was a blip but he made a mark) need their stories told as well.Awesome read, and highly recommend any of her books.

For me this was a very powerful love story that reaches out through 26 years of lost, wanting, need for closure, secrets, and love. The author spins a story so compelling it will bring a grown man to his knees and make women weep. This story will reach deep in your soul to bring back those memories of your own lost love, your own heartbreak of the one that got away. As you read the author will take you into a story of many characters each having their own secrets, wishes and desires, each wanting and needing closure. You will fall in love with each character even those you want to hate will be your friend. There isn't a character in this book that I couldn't identify with and feel their pain. Once you start this book you will not want to put it down, the author will leave you with wanting more. This is a story you will want to read over and over again, you will put it in that folder of must reads. It is sure to be on your top 10 favorite reads of the year.Each of us remembers our first love but not many are with that person. Can you imagine having a person you grow up with from childhood, loving that person they are your everything. You both learn every lesson in life together from walking, talking, loving, this person is your first lover he/she is your everything. One mistake, one night all that changes, your world is torn apart and you lose it all. That is what happens to Noah and Jules one night of passion and life as they know it is over. Their love is torn apart each not being able to forgive the other. Decisions have to be made, which are taken out of their hands. It just broke my heart to see them torn apart.This story starts at 26 years later when all the heartbreak is over or is it. Jules and Noah moved on lived life the best they could but neither is able to forget the other or what they lost. Jules is now a mother with a normal teenager that is driving her crazy. One ex husband who could never live up to Noah memory and knows it. She still lives in her hometown where everyone knows but has swept her secret under the rug for so many years. No one talks about it but no one has forgotten it either, it is as much a part of her life as it was 26 years ago. Each day she remembers and each day she wishes and dreams for what she has lost. She has put walls up that no one can get through, no one will ever touch her heart again, and never will she feel such pain. Her mother was a controlling women, Jules worse nightmare just came true she is her mother, doing things and living her life just as her mother has done. Jules is like most mothers doing the best she can for her daughter, not wanting her daughter to make the same mistakes she has. Life isn't like that we all must make our way, make our own mistakes, the more we are pushed the more we will go the other way. Jules is about to find this out the hard way. Just as she learns this lesson in live in walks Noah and her world falls apart.Noah is fighting his own demons trying to get over his pain of the one woman he has never forgotten or forgiven. When life got tough he got going, drove right out of town and kept on going. His teenage years are over and he must grow up fast. He has lived his life, grown into a wonderful man who just got out of the military and has a great future. He still can't forget all the pain and lose. He is back to help his family run the business. He isn't alone, he is engaged and she is expecting and the plot thickens. How do you forget the one woman who as a teenager was your everything and the secrets you left behind?The passion is still between Noah and Jules has with stood 26 long years which is still as strong as the day their world came crashing down. Will they give in to lost love or will life stand in their way, there is more them just them to think about now, each has a family who means the world to them.I just love the grandmothers they are way to cool, so funny, loving, she gets her point out and show her love and support but gets right to the point. I just loved Nana Mae, agree letting the crazy out is a good thing. "My wise old Cajun Maw Maw used to say, "Hide your crazy, girl. Ain't nobody wanna see that s***."Maw Maw died of a heart attack at the age of sixty-two. My other grandmother, Nana Mae, who is neither Cajun nor known for being exceptionally wise, is still kicking at eighty-five and says it's because she lets all her crazy out." Nana Mae said "It was better in my day" When we'd leave the house, we left the grid. No cell phones to track you down." "Same here" I said "Although I had neighbors that were more efficient than any electronic device. Still do. Mrs. Mercer next door nearly called the cops the first time Patrick came over on his bike."I just loved that I thought it was so funny. I loved the scene on the rules of not skipping school with Jules and her daughter I had to chuckle. I can't tell you how many times I myself have said "This is why wild animals sometimes eat their young."Totally loved the part where Mark meets Becca mother for the first time. Mark just comes downstairs from Becca room and Jules goes into her nice to meet you and you have no respect to meet me the right way. Then she said "Mark, I would've liked to have met you a different way, but since I didn't, let me fill you in. Becca isn't allowed to skip class. Don't know if you are, but she's not. You aren't allowed in her room. Ever. You will respect those things, and keep all your personal property in your pants, and we will get along just fine." What an outstanding lady, I laughed so hard.Jules mother I understood why she did what she did, I didn't like it but she did what she thought was best for her daughter. It seems she has secrets of her own, now that I have a hard time forgiving or understanding. I can't say I didn't like her character, yes she made me mad but she was understandable and I feel a lot of mother in that day and age would have done the same things.Noah father what is there not to love about man who was deeply hurt as well. He doesn't let a day go by that he isn't showing how he feels or letting Jules forget. 26 years of bottled up pain is a lot of pain to push around, he has no problem making Jules as unhappy as he can. Everyone has secrets even Noah father, will his bring the family together or tear them more apart?I wanted so much not to like Noah girlfriend Shayna and the mother of his soon to be child. I wanted so much for Noah and Jules to get back together, to make a wrong a right. What is there not to love about this sweet caring women, everyone likes her even Jules. Even Jules ex Hayden is like able even with all his issues. This is all I can tell you without giving the book away, I hope it has interested you enough to go buy the wonderful outstanding book.There are so many places in this story that will make you smile, laugh and bring you to tears, each better then the last. Most will stick with you for day if not years. This book by Ms, Lovelace is a keeper, 5+ star that will keep you hanging on to each word as you spin your way through all her twist and turns. I highly recommend "Don't Let Go" the name fits it so well, you won't want to let go even in the end.
summary: One powerful store of 26 years of lost and secrets. This will be one of your top 10 favorite reads for the year.

reviewText: Reviewed by Pat Henshawfor TheRomanceReviews.comA mentally and physically scarred veteran reluctantly returns home after fourteen years only to find home is where his heart is.At thirty-two, Jed Cooper knows his military life is at an end because of a chronic stomach disease and the debilitating wounds he received during his last deployment. When his younger brother Nick visits him in the hospital, Jed agrees to return to their small hometown of Ashton outside Portland.Since Jed wants to get to know Nick's wife Kim and their two daughters, and because Jed has nowhere else to go, he at first accepts an invitation to stay with Nick's family. When Nick's townhouse begins to feel too crowded and Nick's drinking worsens, Jed agrees to move into the spare bedroom at the beachside home where Kim's adult brother Max lives.Twenty-five year old Max, an epileptic, and his service dog Flo have carved out an idyllic life in their cabin by the lake. Max creates hand-hewn furniture to sell and lives an uncomplicated life, raising his own food. When he has seizures, Flo is trained to get help, so Max is fairly self-sufficient.Jed and Max seem to rub on very well together, forging a friendship and then falling in love. In fact, for a while Max is even able to concoct meals that Jed's chronic stomach illness can tolerate.However, instead of healing, Jed seems to be losing ground as PTSD and his physical wounds get worse. When Max has a particularly bad seizure and Jed discovers that Max and Kim aren't who they said they were, all of their lives spiral downhill quickly.Jed is a particularly interesting man. Having been kicked out of the house by an alcoholic father when he came out, Jed joined the army, turning his back on his brother Nick who proceeded to suffer the brunt of the old man's abuse. When Nick turns up at his bedside, Jed realizes how much he let his brother down, just as Jed blames himself for leading his eight-man army crew into a lethal attack.In order to find personal peace and build a new life, Jed must work through forgiving himself for past mistakes as well as make amends for leaving his brother. His physical condition, however, makes it difficult for him to see beyond his own aching, scarred body.Max too is an intriguing, loving and giving man. While he and his sister Kim had a frightful childhood, they have a chance at happiness, a chance that they are diligent about expanding. Most people, including Jed, are blinded by Max's illness and don't see his inner strength and stability. When push comes to shove, Max isn't a wimp but a survivor.ONLY LOVE is one of those romances in which readers will be pulling for Jed and Max as a couple to grow and bloom. Both fight for their right to happiness and even though their story is rocky, readers will be at their side every step of the way.
