This first book from Sam Schall is a definite winner - his style is reminiscent of David Weber, action packed and with great character development.I can't wait for follow-on books.And thanks to Sarah Hoyt via Instapundit for the tip.
I couldn't get enough of this book. we all know how love stories end but it is nice to see a new out look on how it happens.

Classic Mark Steyn, except it's non-political, so liberals can enjoy it, too. Informative easy reading, with touches of the Steyn humor. Learn facts and fables of some of the famous and not quite so famous folks of history.
summary: so liberals can enjoy it, too

reviewText: Elaine Viets writes two mystery series. The Joise Marcus: Mystery Shopper series set in St. Louis and the Dead End Jobs series set in Ft. Lauderdale. Helen Hawthorne is the star of the Dead End Jobs series, taking low paying work as part of her PI work. Helen lives in the Coranado, an old town Ft. Lauderdale apartment complex. Margery Flax is her landlord. Killer Blonde is a flashback story Margery tells Helen one night.In the  1970's, Margery worked in a office. The office was and is presented accurately, exactly what office work was for unmarried women in the 1970's. Think "9 to 5" , not "Mad Men".The guys are jerks. People drink on their lunch hour. Any woman advancing is thought of as slept her way to that position. The bosses steal good ideas.Vicki and Minni are in a cat fight. Vicki steals ideas. She undermines her workers. Someone kills her. Margery tells the tale of the days leading up to Vicki never coming back to work.Enjoy the tale that Margery has kept under wraps for 40 years. I did.Elaine Viets is a great story teller. This is no exception.
This book was a good ending to the series  fun light reading, banter between characters that had me laughing... Sex was HOT

I am a middle eastern American, smart, professional, attractive.. I have never failed to attract a guy and make him die trying to get me, but I have always lost him after we get in a relationship. And finally, I'm divorced!Everyone is in shock.. How could a woman like me be divorced!This book tells you how a man think and act..I thought this was the mentality of Eastern men only! That I have always hated, and though I married one of the most liberate guy there I failed!Now I know what I did wrong from choosing him, testing him to marrying and living with him.. I wish we read such books early on in life..

This was a fast moving story that made you want to not put it down till the end. Zoe and AJ both have had a rough upbringing and now have to help save the world and defeat the bad guys. Love the way they go through kidnapping, gun fights, and things blowing up. You are rooting for them through all the action and you are rooting for them to get together.

Wow let me just say this book took me on an emotional ride.  I felt the heartbreak of these characters . I cried for the devastation Emmy endured as well as the heartbreak and choices that were made.  I received an advanced copy of this book and I'm so glad that I did I feel I might have missed an amazing story otherwise.  These book is definitely a must read about love, life, and the choices we make .
I thought it had a slow start but once I gave it a chance it was good. It was heartbreaking, romantic and hypocritical all at the same time.

Everyone knows that Minecraft is a popular game. Do you know that there are many stories for Minecraft as well? I really enjoy the reading of this Herobrine's Resurrection story. Just noticed that there are many more books from this author about the Minecraft. A highly recommended book for children as well as youngsters.

I have loved this series. Books 1-3 were really good. Well written and the story and plot lines were easy to follow.  From book 1 Raven and Jon stole my heart, so ultimately I wanted them to always be together.  Book 4 was not as good. There were plenty of plot twists and suspense but the plots seemed to be all over the place.  This book would have received a higher rating had it not been for how poorly it was written or edited; improper grammar and sentence structure was unbelievable (considering how well the other 3 were written).  If there was an editor, they should be fired for allowing such statements like “Elise stepped walked out…” or “Are you going with us the museum.” This is just a sample of the many mistakes in this book.  Even with the flaws of this last series, I am still a Nicole Dunlap fan and will read her other books and the new series.
Great ideas and information in this book.  Having a great relationship and loving yourself is very important.  Would recommend to others!
This was such a fun read!  The characters were well-drawn and of course Paris is lovely however you can enjoy it, whether vicariously via a book or to be actually there.

This 50 page book could make a great introduction to the Personal Development world for a teenager or early twenties.It is simply written and does share some very good tips and ideas to think about and act on. Gopesh also lists practical steps to take that will result in some positive changes in your life.I received this book in exchange for an honest review and I found it to be well worth reading through.
summary: A Good Starter for Young Person Interested in Personal Development

reviewText: I was given access to a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.It was the illustrated image of a very surprised chicken perched precariously atop a large egg in a nest which caught my attention.It was the title, "3 Hours Before Breakfast," which kept my attention.It was the subtitle, "What is Getting Up Early Worth and How Can You Adopt This Habit" which got me hooked enough to want to read this book.As for the content ... the good news is the entire "book"is only 30+ pages.

I enjoyed this cozy.  'Bitters' Loveless is a bartender/match-maker.  The book's main setting is at a failing country western bar.  The current owners aren't  doing well & fighting.  Bitters has visions of soul mates but spends much of her time waiting for her soul mate to return.  So she's going thru her own romantic struggle.  The bar owner is found dead in the bar...the mystery is eventually solved & Bitters finds love at the end.  Believable & likeable characters - small town setting.
First time reader of this writer and love , loved this book. Look forward to the next book in series.

My ‘Blogging Reader’s Review’ after reading an ARC copy of ‘DOUBLE COVERAGE’(Love and Sports series book #2) by Author Meghan Quinn (via: Booksmoviesfandoms.wordpress.c o m):I was thrilled to be invited  to read and review the ARC early-copy of the second novel of the ‘Love and Sports Series’ by Meghan Quinn titled ‘Double Coverage’ because I loved the first novel so much. First off I have to say the end of this novel left me saying, “Wow, just wow!” This story definitely takes you on a whirlwind of emotions because of the roller coaster these characters go on while dealing with feelings and the relationships they are involved in.  As with the first novel, you will also get this story in multiple P.O.V’s, eight P.O.V.’s to be exact from:  Piper, Mason, Lexi, Jake, Jax, Ryker, Hannah and Brooke.On a flight to see her long time friend Lexi’s special day, red-haired beauty Piper Shores, had no clue how an obnoxious hot guy she meets on the flight would become more than she expected.  After an eventful weekend of wedded bliss and new acquaintances, Piper gets back to her life as a waitress at a local Denver sports bar with her co-worker and friend Hannah.  She becomes intertwined in an unexpected relationship with a sweet-loving southern guy named Jax, who she starts to fall for quickly.  But Mason, with his alpha-male persona, seems to make her feel strong confusing emotions and won’t stop pursuing her once he realized that she makes him feel alive again.Mason is Jake’s best friend and a professional football player in Denver.  He met a female who was dressed with a hoodie and sun-shades, on his flight to be the best man in a wedding. After meeting Piper, he comes to the conclusion that she is rude but one sexy woman.  Mason likes how Piper seems to make him feel alive again after having had his heart ripped out by his ex-fiance Brooke.  Even though it takes him a little time to finally realize that Piper is who he wants, he has to deal with the fact that he might not be able to completely have her.  But the one thing about Mason, is that he is determined to make Piper his.Then, you have Hannah, Piper’s co-worker and friend.  She’s sweet, nice and a good-girl who is dating a guy who she sees when he’s not away for business.  Once she meets Ryker, Masons teammate and friend, he begins to never stop letting Hannah know that he’s interested in her. She is determined to wait faithfully for her boyfriend Todd, for the day that he’ll propose to her.  Ryker on the other hand, is determined to make Hannah see that she should be his and until then, he offers her friendship.In ‘Double Coverage’ you’ll get a chance to get to know all of the characters well. We get to experience the relationships as they blossom and we witness some as they are destroyed.  As the reader, you’ll sometimes feel at odds about which people belong together.  These characters seem so realistic because of their imperfections, their emotional turmoil and the choices they make while trying to figure out what they truly want.  And let me warn you…there are many moments of hot interactions, filled with body on body,  steaminess that will leave you breathless and make your toes curl.Will Piper stay with her safe and sweet boyfriend Jax or will she follow her strong feelings for the hot-alpha-male Mason? Can Hannah stay happy waiting for Todd or will Ryker’s persistence pay off and win Hannah over?  Find out where Brooke and a hot model named Ashlin fit into the equation.  I recommend this book because it’s from a great new series and the characters of the the story keep you interested in seeing where the story will take each of them. The ending is left good and ready for the follow-up novel of this series! Check this one out for sure.My Blogging Reader's Star Rating for 'DOUBLE COVERAGE' is: 4 out of 5 stars! :)Visit my Blog and see Memorable quotes and photos of how I imagined Mason, Piper, Hannah, Ryker, Jax, Ashlin and Brooke while reading DOUBLE COVERAGE.
summary: My Blogging Reader's Review after reading Double Coverage! (The 2nd Novel of this series is a knock out! Ready for #3!!! :)

reviewText: Okay I think I'm so confused by how horrible this book was that I might just give up reading for at least a week! What's funny is that although so dumb because of piper and mace I really liked ryker but Hannah was just as freaking stupid!!! She plays so innocent but she's almost just as slutty as piper. I mean really?? Really piper!!!??? Your a woman for crying out loud. Who in the heck uses people like that and is that unbelievably stupid!!!  But on another note I did like Jake and Lexi just like I did in first book.

Brian Walker works for Aegis Security, namely, Jake Ryder.  Grace Ryder is a songwriter, who is being stalked by someone.  Grace happens to be the younger 1/2 sister of Jake.Since Grace does not want any type of security detail, Jake sends in Brian, undercover, to keep an eye on Grace.  Brian sits at the bar, and just watches Grace.  But Grace has other ideas, and hits on Brian with a proposal he cannot resist.  And Brian turns out to be just the thing that Grace needs to finish the last two songs on her contract.This novella is short, only 101 pages.  But it packs a wallop.  There is steamy sex, but an underlying mystery that needs to be solved.  The last chapter of the book sets up some secondary characters that would be fun to see in books of their own.The book is well written, the characters are interesting, and could prove to be the start of a very interesting series.  I would recommend this, and I look forward to any possible additions to this series.
summary: Could be a very interesting new series

reviewText: Accept the truth is the hardest part in our life especially for those painful truths. However, to effectively overcome the depression, we have to learn to accept. This is the first part of the book, guiding us the way to accept. A simple but informative book to understand how to overcome depression.
Interesting and practical guide including few really useful tips on how to improve your memory. These advice seem really reasonable and I can't wait to apply them.

Finally I get to know what Tai Chi represents. Heard so much about this exercise but never knew until now.Learned the true benefits and philosophy of this movement art through this simple book. This can help many people in their struggle to battle modern day stress and anxiety.
This was a really good book and a very fast read. My only complaint is I wish there were more pictures
summary: Good book, could use more pictures

reviewText: A very good read. I especially enjoyed the Christian principles included and the way the characters expressed their beliefs. I would recommend that  this book be placed in young adult Bible classes.

I absolutely loved this book. It was one of the best books I have read this year. I loved Vi. She grew a lot in this book. I really loved the father/daughter relationship between Bear and Vi. It was so sweet. Mac was a dream come true. He was amazing. I hope there will be other books in this series. I would love one about Mitch.

Amateur Radio  does not use satellites to talk across the globe. While there are amateur satellites long distance propagation occurs because the ionosphere refracts some radio signals. Ham radio callsigns are nothing like those used in this series. Up to five letters only one number for US hams. There are no mountains near Kerrville. I live in the Texas hill country. They are simply hills. The only mountains in Texas are in Big Bend NP and the Guadalupe National Park east  of  El Paso and one small one just outside of El Paso. It rarely snows in the hill country. Certainly not enough to worry about planning for it. A skiff of snow every few years and once in a lifetime maybe a significant snowfall that doesn't last more than a day or two. Flooded lead Acid batteries as described in these books do not have copper plates,  they are made of lead.  These  silly errors notwithstanding. I've enjoyed the series so far.
summary: great read. a bit thin on factual points

reviewText: I wasn't too happy with book two but this one, book three, was much better. Now we are starting to see humanity's ugly side which is more realistic. I love the characters in this series. They grow on you. I think my biggest complaint would be that the author should have more confidence that he has a following with his readers and quit putting in "teaser's" at the end of his books!! We are being ripped off of several more pages of reading because of it....or he's introducing other books he's written. I don't feel it's right.

I love love love this series. It has felt like a long wait for this book to come out, but I finally got my hands on it, and it was worth the wait. I love the characters and the small town setting in this series. While each book could be read as a stand alone, I totally recommend reading them in order. I love getting to read updates about favorite characters from the previous books, although the updates on Jason and Hannah have me worried about what's really going on there. Between that and the little cliffhanger epilogue ( no worries, it's not related to this book's main characters), I will be anxiously waiting for the next installment. As for this book,  I totally loved it. Both the suspense and the romance were spot on. Robbie made a great leading man in a sexy sensitive alpha kind of way. It was a great story of best friends finally admitting they are more than friends. I devoured the story in less than a day, enough said.
If you are looking for a great shifter series, I totally recommend this one! I have read numerous shifter sets but, this is by far one of my favorites!
Hey great book I did at least help me understand Rich, cant wait until something else come out pertaing him

Wow This was  a first read by this Author for me and I must say I was not DISAPPOINTED...Rich was a dirty slimy no good dog...I hope  gets his in the end...Kayla I am glad you shoot that bastard..I will be adding this to my book club must read list.Nicki WilliamsSouth Side Divas Book Club

I am loving this series I do hate that they are so short I'm not sure I would have been strong enough to sign that contract I think I would just let myself die but Lilly is set on getting her revenge I'm still so lost as to why Jeremy is doing this when he is handsome and rich he can find willing women does he need to rape and strip someone of everything choice to get off? If I was in the same room as this man and had a loaded gun I would not think twice about pulling the trigger.  I will continue to read all of the up and coming books. You Ms Edwards are a gifted writer to get this strong of a reaction out of your readers.For those of you just starting on this journey please read the first book.Edwards I found the cover on the first book to be quite beautiful. Keep up the good work!

I loved this book - i have been left with a cliffhanger and cant wait to read the follow up book.This book is emotional in the sense you cant believe what is happening to her.  You cant believe what JS is doing to her.He is sick in the sense that he is cruel to a degree and then it is like a switch that flips over and he shows kindness, but not in emotions.I felt such hatred for this man and wanted to scream at him to let her go.  Love a book that gets me so emotional and this author has done that to me - Cant wait for the follow up book Scarlett, happy writing from your new fan
This series is awesome, it keeps me interested 100% of the time and I can't wait until the next book is out.

Once again another totally awesome book in the Sensor Series.Melena has come to accept the super naturals around her like they are family as opposed to in the beginning when she hated them.I love the strong female character of Melena as she constantly learns more about herself.  Also Lucas - who is totally hot by the way - and his love for her.  They are often at logger heads being strong willed, but it seems to work itself out.Do yourself a huge favor and read this series.
I was so glad this next book came out with the two heros in separate places and the chance of get together slim to none. If you like to root for the under dog like I do you will enjoy this book.
So yes the ending wasn't great but overall i loved this series!! It was good and i will miss reading about Sacario's crazy self
This book was so worth the wait omg it's so juicy that I couldn't put it down literally. Well worth the wait and more I would give you 20 stars if I could!!

I didn't realize there were so many ways to compost!  When I was a kid we used to have the big "open pile" hidden in the back of the yard that you never wanted to get too close to because it REEKED!  Marsden's guide show you how to do it that way, or quicker and more cleanly.  Great guide for however you want to do it.

Note: Yes, I heard an updated version was released that I'm assuming was cleaned up. But I bought and read this book in its original release version, that is the version I'm reviewing.In this story we get to see the humanization of Sorilla Aida. She's always been an incredibly interesting character that was well developed, but now we get a peek at her motivations and the heartache caused by some of her previous missions. The plot itself was another highlight as we get to see the Alliance as an imperfect political conglomeration of separate worlds that seem to only be members because of a fear of two powerful species that keep each other in check. Even though Currie seemed to be pre-apologizing for this story in the foreword, I found it compelling and a great introduction into what I assume will be a interesting continuation of the series.So, there were many, many high points to this story. Frankly, they were the only reason I kept reading and the only reason this book gets three stars and not one. The bad? There was at LEAST one significant error on every single page, and that is no exaggeration. These ranged from wrong word used, missing words, repeated words, misspelled words, wrong names used for characters and alien species, capitalization errors, punctuation errors.... It was so bad I refuse to believe that this wasn't just a rough draft that got tossed up for sale. This would have been bad for even a first time author offering his/her work for .99, but this is a well established author writing in a well established series and charging $5 a pop. It's an insult to the readers that he couldn't be bothered to make sure the book was edited and polished before it went up on sale. Now here's the kicker... this is the exact same problem with the previous book in this series. That one was also simply loaded with errors that were corrected at a later date. (I pulled my review of that book since the author decided to attack the review in the comments section and it was a conversation I had no interest engaging in.)Currie is one of the more imaginative authors out right now, but presenting such an unprofessional product while simultaneously charging premium prices for a self-published work is a habit I don't find endearing. So, my choices are to simply give up on these stories (because the editing is that bad when it comes to trying to enjoy them) or remember not to buy a book from this author until a month after the initial release.
summary: Good story ruined by a complete absense of proofreading.

reviewText: Currie writes fairly dense, well thought out stories with great character development.  Love the detailed political scenes, the shift from character to character as they consider information and plan their moves.  His on-going comments about the machinations of societies and cultures are amusing as well as insightful.  Great combat scenes as well; lots of thrill with nice speculative sci-fi to back them up.  More, please.

I read the previous books, and felt they had a spark.But after this one, I am dropping the series.There were few new ideas, little plot, not much tension.Now just another Star Trek galaxy...for which there is zero evidence and little likelihoodThe author does not consider the fact that the galaxy is old.  If civilizations were whizzing around, FTL, theywould have found earth long ago.  Instead there is silence.Moving on, someone must have something fresh.
This is typical sci-fi with a real kick-ass lead that pulls you in.If you've read the other books then I don't have to say much.It doesn't let you down. I can't wait for more.
summary: I love this series and the characters

reviewText: Excellent continuation of the series, moving from the open war to this new phase. I think the transition was handled well by Currie.

Loved it, I'm still hooked to the Trap Secrets series. No matter what. I still can't choose between Rylan & Fetti although I'm pulling towards Rylan a little more. What Fetti did was beyond messed up. I still hope there's a turn of events with Iman & him, hope he's okay, and maybe they can be cordial with one another at least. Rylan & her are meant to be though lol. Can't for the next part!

Barb Asselin's book, "Love to Write?" is a niffy little guide that should get just about anyone interested in writing inspired. And yes, you can get eBooks published on Amazon for next to nothing, but it does require work and a knowledge of using software programs. If you don't know, you can learn as you go. Like anything else in life, we ain't born knowing this stuff. However, with books like this one, there is absolutely no reason why you cannot be a successful published author, regardless of your background. I am living proof of that. So, if you are interested in getting into the game, this is a good place to start. Well done and worth the time and money, this one I can recommend. Thanks,
summary: A Neat Guide that should get you Inspired

reviewText: As a fellow author I appreciate the work Barb put into this book. She has laid it out in a way that you can actually take action and start publishing. I know it is possible because I am doing it. Having authored over 20 books I know the steps Barb tells you to take are the right ones and they work. If you want to start making some extra monthly income writing about things you love then grab this book.

This book is such a wonderful resource for anyone interested in learning various aspects of being a writer & a publisher.Barb Asselin's step by step detailed teaching and many screen shots are very helpful in changing OMG " how do I do this?' into " I think maybe I can do it ".  It will stay on my desktop as a  reference guide for a long time.

This is a fun take on the zombie apocalypse.  A rock band wishing they could still attract the living, instead of the undead when they play live.  You know, you got to play your music, no matter what life brings you.  Jack has a great grasp of the needs for musicians to make music. There is humor, and a new twist on what you have to do to get protein during a zombie apocalypse.

Lindsay, thank you so much for writing an eighth book to finish off this series. I thoroughly enjoy all of your books and you are one of my favorite writers. The Emperor's Edge series is my favorite, though. Keep up the good work!

The sequel to the Emperor's Edge series, this book is every bit as exciting and adventurous as the rest. In addition to  the main plot, there are several underlying plots that kept my attention. There is also the  perfect amount of clever humor sprinkled through the book.
summary: I could not put it down!!!

reviewText: I've been on a Laura Kaye kick for the last few months, and Dare to Resist did not disappoint. I can't say it was my favorite of hers (Hearts in Darkness holds that honor) but it was hot, steamy, and so romantic. Colton and Kady were perfect together, their conflict was believable, and the resolution absolutely fit them.I thoroughly enjoyed their comfort level at being geeky together, I loved the bickering and conflict, and I loved the dark side to Colton. I haven't read any of the other authors that are continuing this series, but I will definitely be checking them out just to see the way Kady and Colton's relationship plays out.Basically, loved it.

This was one of those stories that has all of the elements that make a quick read impossible to put down!  Kady and Colton knew each other well thanks to him being her big brother’s best friend, and they clicked on a level that made everyone else pale in comparison. And after a stolen moment that left her panting, for Kady no one lived up to Colton in other ways, too.  It was one of those maddening “almost” situations, where Kady got left in the lurch wondering what went wrong and Colton swore to never let his guard down again…but when two people fit so well together, it’s hard to fight all of that pent-up passion!I really liked Colton and Kady together.  Even though there wasn’t a lot of time for detailed back story, we get enough of their relationship to see why they click and what draws them to each other.  They think a lot alike, which makes them work well together both in their career choice and their personal lives.  The issue with them vying for the same contract wasn’t a huge factor in the storyline, which meant more time spent on their interactions as Colton tried to deny how much he wanted to have his way with Kady…so big plus in that column!! Kady was a smart, strong gal though, and I definitely enjoyed her personality.What was cool about this story was that it's more than your typical 'guy trying to deny his feelings for his friend’s sis'.  Colton wasn’t just the bad boy who didn’t think he was worthy, though there was some of that.  He also had some…needs…that weren’t what a woman would normally expect or be into, so he feared both hurting Kady and scaring her off.  Your heart kind of has to go out to the guy; I mean, rough play is certainly sexy but it’s not really the norm, so when Colton judges himself for wanting Kady that way it’s understandable.  But he’s smoking hot and even more so when his dominating alpha side came into play, so I certainly wouldn’t have been complaining!!Overall, this was a fun and sexy read that I devoured in one sitting, so a definite recommend from me!

3.5 starsTucker and Sophie's story is the second in the Paint River Ranch series and I started this immediately after reading Cole's story in Book 1. Tucker and Sophie meet at a county fair. They are drawn to each other, instantly attracted, not looking for something serious, only out for a bit of fun for just one night.Sophie is dealing with recently losing her job and caring for her invalid mother, taking up all her time and worry, so a relationship is out of the question for her at the moment. Tucker, however, who is used to quick hook-ups with no promise of tomorrow, feels a pull towards Sophie but goodbyes are said and they part ways. Neither of them expect to see the other again, even though they both have lingering thoughts about the connection they made the night before but fate has other ideas and throws them together again at the ranch. Needless to say, they still feel a connection, but I didn't quite feel it all the time. Once they connected I wanted to feel it all the time.What seems like a sweet, easy romance turns out to be quite an emotional ride. The story is written in dual POV's which I really appreciated. Both characters have self-worth issues, both are struggling to come to terms with their past experiences and both are drawn to each other and not sure how to handle it. Overall I enjoyed this story and look forward to Levi's story.
summary: a great addition to the series

reviewText: Temptation in ShadowsLove Gena Showalter, she never disappoints! Loved this new story. It has everything we have come to love and expect from her. A strong female lead and a handsome protective Alpha male, with a great paranormal twist!Meet Gabrielle Huit she is a young woman who was kidnapped and had a mini computer implanted in her brain. This has given her the ability to download information off any computer or cell phone within her immediate area. This has also made her a huge security issue for our government. Although Gabby has never abused her abilities, she still realizes that not only her government would use her abilities to ferret out information on secret intel; but other governments would as well. Knowing all this has forced Gabby to constantly be on the run and never stay in one place too long. Gabby knows she needs to be moving on soon, she has already been in this city for 6 months.....but she just can't force herself to move just yet! She has become attracted to a sexy, quiet bodyguard and she needs to stick around and see where this might lead. Gabby isn't interested in forever, but she isn't opposed  to a few nights of screaming fun!Meet Sean Walker, he works for a government funded group who protects and finds people with special abilities. His latest assignment finds him working in a nightclub and trying to gain the confidence of the lovely Gabby. He needs to gain her trust and somehow convince her to come work for his company Rose Briar. Sean knows how it feels to have a special ability and to want to live off the grid. He has the ability to wrap shadows around himself and he knows how it feels to constantly be on the move. He wants to protect Gabby, and show her a new way of life. Although he is in lust with her, he knows that he can't have a lasting relationship with her, but he will take what he can get. As Sean is keeping track of Gabby, he realizes that someone else is too. Now he must try and hide her away from everyone, until he can figure out who wants Gabby dead!Begin the sexy, funny adventure that will have you racing through the book to find the clues and the answer to who wants Gabby dead and why! You won't be able to stop until you turn the last page! Although this is a novella, it tells a complete story and you won't be disappointed or feel cheated by its length! The very talented author gives us a satisfying story, without any wasted words!ARC received from talented author and publisher. As well as Netgalley in exchange for an honest review.*
summary: Loved it! Hope this becomes a new series!

reviewText: I can't get enough of him. He makes a vanilla seems bland. He so hot and sexy. I could only imagine what he looks like. Anyway, I love his personality and how he fight with Alana all the time. Alana, was not my favorite person in tempting the player. I wanted to smack her a few times. But she redeemed herself in this book. She tries to be so strong and mean to help maintain some control of her life. I am so glad Chandler was able to set her straight.I love this book it shows a different said of her and of Chandler the protector. Great read J. Lynn love this book.

This was my least favorite of the three books. This one was okay, but nothing jumped out at me and I ended up skimming the last 30%. I just didn't feel any connection between Chandler and Alana. Plus I couldn't stand Alana in the second book!
summary: This was my least favorite of the three books

reviewText: We all love the gamble bros and this story did not disappoint. Chandler is more of the responsible brothers with raising his brothers and make sure the family is good. Alana needs to control everything and with Chandler there is no control at all. I loved how the couples came together and how the story surrounded the brothers and their relationship and the sex was just there. I hope to catch more of them soon.

I enjoyed this book! It was informative, well written and gave me insight into cleansing in general. Also, there are several recipes that I am looking forward to eating. This is a great resource for learning about the cleansing process and how to make recipes. If anyone is thinking about doing a juice cleanse, this book is a great tool.
summary: Really yummy recipes in this book!

reviewText: When Trey's past collides with the present, his life changes forever. Jesse is a fellow pilot and the woman he once thought he would marry. Suddenly, life becomes more complicated than they could have ever imagined. Every relationship is eventually tested, and it looks like their relationship has failed the test. Will Trey and Jesse be able to face the unknown together, or is it time to call it quits?I've read every book Shirleen Davies has written and this one might be my favorite. This story touched my heart in a way that brought tears to my eyes. Trey and Jesse face one of the most difficult challenges a couple could face, and while Trey steps up to face his new responsibilities with courage and maturity, Jesse crumbles under the pressure. Miscommunication and hurt combine to push the couple even further apart. This book is filled with realistic, likable supporting characters and also revisits some favorites from Hard Landing. The way the MacLaren family gathers to support Trey reminds me why I like these books so very much. The author really gets into the hearts and souls of her characters in this book, which is probably why I fell in love with the story the way I did. Wonderful, wonderful story.Note: I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

This one was hard to follow...I got that he was a bear but not what made him a bear. He didn't know either and that made it harder to understand. And the fact that Amy just went with the flow was even stranger. Not really sure I could recommend this book.
Got this book as part of the Bad boys and billionaires set. Hot, quick read with potential as a serial but was definitely left with unanswered questions.

I never know what to expect when I read one of author Scott Prussing's new series. Well, I was completely blindsided by this new series! I fell in love with the characters right from the start.  It is a totally original and fast-paced story. I highly recommend this book, it is unlike anything you will ever read. When I finished, I wanted MORE!K. R. Jordan

reviewText: I've been a Stephanie Plum (Janet Evanovich) fan for years & years and have always wished I could find books with similar tone -- something that gave me a lovable heroine, a total hottie, danger, mystery, and TONS of humor.  Addison Holmes totally fits the bill!I already was a Liliana Hart fan... and it pains me to say this, but as much as I love the MacKenzie's, I think I love Addison Holmes more!Great for a fast-paced, easy and lighthearted read!!
Really enjoyed the girl and all her silly hang ups , but Nick and Savage were really cool also. I would recommend this book to anyone

After I finished reading Lone Wolf Rising, I bought this second book first thing the next morning. I kind of went in knowing what I wanted to see - more ability training, more information on the Winters family and some deeper looks at their characters and this book delivered all of those things!The reason I took a star off the rating was because of the love interests again, because I kept thinking that what the characters were doing didn't match what they were saying and I didn't understand or root for their relationships because of it.I still really enjoyed the book though, there's a lot going on in the plot and the conflict between the siblings works very well. I also have a new favorite character - the little brother, Hunter, so once again, I can't wait to read the next book!

Find this review and more at Lusty Penguin Reviews!An Aria in Venice is an emotional coming of age romance by KaSonndra Leigh. Once again, Leigh uses alternating first-person voice, telling this story through the eyes of Adriana Dostovsky, Luca Martuccio and Nikolai Belikov, characters that were introduced in the first book in the Musical Intrude series, The Prelude.At twenty-one, Adriana is at a crossroads in her life. While she is trying to become a lead ballerina, Adriana’s love life is going nowhere. Adriana has had eyes for Nikolai ever since he saved her while her family was escaping from her father and Russia years ago. She tries everything to get Nikolai to see her as a woman and not as a little girl any more. Thanks to the alternating viewpoints, the reader knows that Nikolai very much want to be with Adriana in just he way she wants, but he fears that she cannot handle his darker passions. Doing what he thinks is best, Nikolai pushes Adriana away, realizing too late that he will really lose her. Adriana, to her credit, moves on and turns her attention to Luca, the other man who has caught her eye. Luca is completely enraptured by Adriana and sees her as his next conquest. Because Adriana hopes to lose her virginity with Luca, she agrees to go on a five-day trip to Venice with Luca and his family. During this trip, Adriana and Luca’s heartfelt conversations about their past hurts bring them closer together and quickly change their relationship; they are falling in love. While in Venice, Adriana gets to know Simona, Luca’s mother, and experiences firsthand what a mother-daughter relationship should be like. Especially since her own mother, Katerina, is a controlling and vindictive character that you just love to hate. Unfortunately secrets, lies, and intimidation threaten to break up this young couple. During their separation, Nikolai hopes that Adriana will return to him, but Luca is really her true love. The beauty in this story comes from Adriana and Luca learning to forgive, trust, and truly love one another. Furthermore, they realize that together they can do anything, which makes them a couple to cheer for. Leigh does a masterful job of showing how all of these characters grow throughout the story. Adriana’s growth is the most stunning, as she absolutely sheds the scared little girl to become a strong-minded woman.Passionate, memorable characters who experience intense emotional development make An Aria in Venice hard to put down.I received an eBook copy of the book for the purpose of an honest review. I was not compensated for this review, and all conclusions are my own responsibility.
summary: An Emotional Coming of Age Romance!

reviewText: “Like everyone else, he’s too busy loving me to really see me.”—AdrianaAdriana Dostov has been in love with her brother’s best friend, Nikolai, for years. He loves her back fiercely but refuses to admit it to her. Determined to get her mind of off him, she agrees to join the gorgeous and sexy playboy Luca and his family in Venice. He was only supposed to get her mind off of Nikolai, not fall in love with her and steal her heart. And Nikolai? Now that Adriana has the chance to be happy with someone else, he’s ready to fight for her. But so is Luca…“I can see you for who you truly are, Adriana Dostovsky.”—LucaAh, what a sweet song. When I picked up this book, I was expecting a light-hearted and simple story where the sweet girl reforms the playboy and happily ever after. Instead, I got a complicated tale with a strong heroine, her scandalous family, a super sexy and challenging love triangle, and an emotional storyline. I didn’t want to put this book down!You can pretty much apply the phrase “poor little rich girl” to our heroine Adriana in that she’s rich and well loved by everyone but still unhappy. Not that anyone would know it. She hides her pain away and clings to what makes her feel safe—like Nikolai who has given everything up to protect her. Her mother is dismissive of her while being controlling and her mobster father is nowhere to be seen. I love how feisty and adorable she is despite her notorious and over-protective family. She goes after what she wants and yet she’s fiercely loyal to and protective about those she cares about. It’s easy to see why she catches both Nikolai’s and Luca’s heart!Oh, and what a sexy conundrum (a high heat one on the romance scale)! Do you go with the gorgeous sex god with assassin tendencies who has protected you during your worst nightmares? Or do you go with the gorgeous sex god with poetic tendencies who makes those nightmares fade? Usually in love triangles, there’s a clear cut answer who the winner will be. In this case, I really wasn’t sure while reading through most of the book, and I loved not knowing! I would flip back and forth between the two as secrets were revealed and feelings shared. Oh…dear…what a lucky girl—or I guess unlucky for having to choose between two men who love her fiercely. Nope, I’ll stick with the first statement and call her lucky.I loved the story, particularly the part in Venice where Luca and Adriana fall for each other. Told in the viewpoints of the three main characters, we really get to know them, which makes her choosing one so difficult! There’s also another story going on with Adriana’s brother and love interest that seemed kinda random, but I’m guessing it’s because he has his own book and the stories are happening concurrently so we’re getting snippets of it. We also get some background on Luca’s fascinating brothers, so I’m assuming they’ll be getting their own books one day, too (crossing fingers)! Overall, this is one song I’d put on repeat. This is a 5 out of 5 for me!(Originally posted on my blog; I received a NetGalley copy in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.)
summary: One song I’d put on repeat!

reviewText: This sequel was absolutely brilliant. I would definetly recommend both books. A decision you won't regret with enough drama to keep you reading until the last page. Loved how it ended and I am expecting more great things from Ms. Jones!!

reviewText: If you have come to the realization that you lack motivation as I have then this is a good short book that will help you get back on track on whatever it is that you didn't complete due to lack of motivation. This book has really good advice, I enjoyed reading it. It is easy to read and most of all, very practical.. You can start putting everything you learn in practice right away, and if you can do that then you will get back in control, I really recommend this book if you need motivation in your life.
summary: Good way to help you find your motivation

reviewText: For a short story, Ms. Severn delivered on all points: characters, voice, plot, and suspense. I really do hope she’ll write another book about Demi and Jack.Demi Sheppard who is a professional breakup artist. Who’d have thought there was such a profession? The author gets a point there for creating something unique. Demi’s hired to break off a client’s engagement, and when she goes to meet him to inform that the job was done, she finds him dead.Talk about bad timing. She’s then accused of murder and has to find a way to clear her name. In the process, she ends up shacking up with Jack Austen, who happens to be an undercover agent investigating organized crime. With Demi’s help, Jack gets a break in case and Demi’s name is cleared, but not before the two get down and dirty.I love me a good short read that still takes some time to focus on two people and their conflicting emotions at the most inconvenient times.If you’re looking for something fast paced, thrilling, and a touch of romance The Breakup Artist is for you. It’s also a quick read and can be read in 1-2 hours.
summary: Fast paced, non-stop action. I want more of these characters.

reviewText: Great book.  I read it in one sitting.  It was a fast-paced read.  Amanda Legend was between a rock and a hard place.  She wanted to protect her family, but in doing so, she ended up being the one hurt.  Ryan is someone that at first you want to hate, but in the end the bad boy does a 360 turn around.  Hollywood and all of its glamour covering up all of the less pleasant parts of life are in this story.  What is also in the story is the opportunity to do the right thing, and turn your life around

This is an imaginative Sci-Fi. Tegon Maus has created a world that really draws the reader int.  The plot flowed smoothly and I didn't feel like anything was forced or majorly missing. I found the writing style to my liking as well.This is one of those stories that will start off with a bang and not let up until the very last page. It really keeps on a great pace throughout.There was action, surprises, and a plot that kept giving to the last page.

Not only has Ernie Lindsey written this book with much passion for facts but he has taken you into the jungles of Peru & with his magnificent writing, you actually feel that you are there. This is a great book because the GI Joe team are called upon to protect The Mann Power device from Cobra, the world's most dangerous terrorist organization. There is plenty of action & suspense that you will not want to put the book down until you finish it.I am very pleased with this book in that Ernie Lindsey gives you the thrill of being in the jungles of Peru while you are actually in your pj's drinking green tea.

This book did not deliver so I returned it once I had gone through it.The book claims to provide recipes that are ketogenic diet/lifestyle, i.e. very low-carb and high-fat intake, but looking through the recipes you will see many that call for all-purpose flour and other high-carb items. WTF? I do keto diet as part of my training and those recipes are not any that trainers recommend to keep your carb intake low. I can see them being part of the carbo-load days (if on cyclical keto), but if you want normal food, you'd be better off getting free recipes from the Internet.Do yourself a favor: don't get this. If you're seeking ideas for keto recipes, this book will steer you wrong. If you're not on the keto diet but the regular one, get better and yummy recipes for free at Food Network, epicurious, Allrecipes, etc. You get the idea.
summary: Not Exactly Keto or Low Carb

Reviewed by Breannfor TheRomanceReviews.comSTITCH is an anthology of stories written by Sue Brown, Jamie Fessenden, Kim Fielding and Eli Easton. Rather than write an overall review for the entire book that won't do the four unique stories justice, I thought it might be better to rate and review each one.The Golem of Mala Lubovnya by Kim Fielding: 4.5 starsThere was such depth created by the author for such a short story. It had a dark, gothic and gritty feel and yet, the relationship was loving, sweet and very real. It felt like a folktale with this giant creature that was created to ensure the safety of the town. As the tale develops, we find out there's a lot more depth to golem's character than his master had intended.Oh, how I adored Emet and Jakob's slow-building relationship and their discovery of each other. Everything about them felt real and believable. From Emet's secret admiration of Jakob to the way they slowly built a friendship that turned into more.Watchworks by Jamie Fessenden: 5 stars!This is my first read by Jamie Fessenden and it certainly won't be my last! The steampunk worldbuilding was fantastic. I could see and feel the era and atmosphere without a lot of time devoted to the descriptions. It was all shown through the characters' dialogue and interactions.Harland and Luke's romance was full of emotion and discovery. The way Luke 'required' Harland's help weekly was cute since we know that he knew exactly what he was doing. Even though he was pretty innocent, he found something that he wanted and he went for it. He was just a great character.Reparation by Eli Easton: 3 starsAnother good story for this anthology, although not quite as good as the others. I loved the sci-fi setting and how the recons were made and used. Some interesting stuff right there!What I wasn't feeling was the relationship. Knox and Edward were on their way to being a great couple before they had their big fallout. I guess I didn't like how things were resolved between them. It all seemed rather melodramatic and caused some major eye-rolling. It didn't fit with the rest of the story.Made For Aaron by Sue Brown: 3.5 starsI keep going back and forth on my rating here. I'm waffling between 5 stars and 2 stars. Not too many warring emotions, right?I loved that this story was so different. All the stories are outside my norm, but the plot in this one really struck me. I can't even begin to imagine how Aaron was feeling seeing his husband of 10 years walk away from him willingly, but the author captured his emotions perfectly and I could really feel his devastation. I don't agree with Aaron's choices but can see where he was coming from.On the other hand, Aaron had no one else besides his husband in his life and would keep telling people, 'we didn't need anyone but each other'. Uh, dude, yeah ya do. He was very immature when it came to other relationships in his life, or lack thereof. He really rubbed me the wrong way sometimes.But it ended up being a great ending to a fabulous collection of dark and gothic love stories.

I like how Sami belongs to a very loving, close knit family, who actually like to spend time together. Both father, uncle and brother look out for Sami, dishing out discipline when necessary but lots of hugs and kisses as well. In this story, both Sami and Michael (brother and sister) find someone to share there life with and instead of making the family grow apart it brings them all closer together as both Michael's Jen and Sami's Rich like the family dynamics. This is a nice innocent story with the romantic relationship developing slowly.
This book was so good that I just could not put it down.  I loved the characters it was well written. I felt like I was part of the story. The intimate scenes were smoking hot without being trashy.
OUTSTANDING WRITING!
Although when reading one could predict some of the outcome, the book was a great read nonetheless; I love Delaney Daimond books and look forward to reading other books

This series is awesome!! I absolutely adore these characters.Sydney makes you want to pound the HELL out of the reporters. this girl has lived in such fear from the actions of psychos.I will be rereading these books for a very long time. can't wait for the next book.

Even though I have gotten tired of "a Rock Star" stories, this one's synopsis got me interested, and I had never read this author before.  So, I gave it a try and so glad that I did.  Really enjoyed getting to know Dalton and Holliday and their rocky road to romance!

I have been in a book slump here lately. I am avid reader but lately I have been getting tired of the same story over and over. But this one was different, it was a great read, some angsty parts where you feel like punching someone... I loved this book, I loved that Holli made her own money, she was not riding any coat tails. Dalton was completely swoon worthy! I thought it was refreshing! I must say that I would love to read more from this author, Dex definitely needs his own book!

As always I was anxiously looking forward to a new release from Ms Scott and this one did not disappoint.I loved the meeting between the main characters so much and her total oblivion regarding who Dalton most obviously was. It is not easy to craft a love story with a famous character in it and convince me as a reader that fame is not part of the attraction but the author succeeds here wonderfully.This story takes place on a rich wonderful canvas and I am always pleased with how wonderfully well developed the supporting characters are in Ms Scotts stories!!!! (even when they make me SOB)thanks again for another gread escape from reality -- cannot wait for the next outing
I really enjoyed this love story about two people from two unlikely backgrounds finding their way through the maze called love.

"I always wanted to be somebody's muse." I say, lightheartedly."You've always been in here," he says, patting his chest over his heart. "We just hadn't met yet."I was totally entranced by this book. I'm not usually one for "rockers romances", but this is not your average rocker.I loved the dialogue between Holliday and Dalton. I've read too many books lately where the majority of the book is almost entirely the characters thoughts. Their banter was so refreshing and made me smile.I loved that Holli and Dalton were so much about actions. They really showed each other how they felt and laid their emotions on the line. But, I do have to say I would have liked to know a little more about Holli. So many things about her past were briefly touched upon, but were never fully explained to the reader. I can understand though, that this was Holli and Dalton's story as a couple, so I can look over that. This story just flowed so well. The writing was wonderful and really immersed you in the scene and how the characters were feeling.
summary: Checking Myself into The Johnny Outlaw Rehibilitation Center for Once Functional Women

reviewText: No resistance here...I simply love this book.  Dalton/Johnny is dreamy!  He is gentle, but rugged; sweet, yet raw and complicated;all things yummy in an alpha hero including talent, tattoos, humor, gorgeous abs and a sexy voice, both internal and external.  Holliday is strong, clever, talented and delivers wit worthy of the Bard at his best.  She is lovely and more than worthy of the HEA our hero (finally) provides.  Actually, he is really the lucky one here.  She is that amazing (although the "Danny" sitches were avoidable and annoying, but probably necessary to the angst as the story muddled through it's darker moments).  For a "rockstar" novel, this book was really different in a very good way.  The author focuses on the core relationship between Dalton and Holliday (great name) allowing the band and rocker lifestyle to play a secondary role.  Thank you to S.L. Scott for delivering a well-written, we'll-edited FULL LENGTH, COMPLETED novel!  I would enjoy following Johnny and  Holli as their adventure continues, but appreciate that much of their story is complete.  Hmm...  Possibly a story for Dex, even Danny, or maybe even the chance for another to find love again?  Regardless of where the muse leads this new author, I am likely to follow!
I have absolutely fallen in love with this couple.  So many emotions throughout this book.  So much love so much loss.  This is my first book by SL Scott and I'm definitely a fan now!
This book contains a variety of recipes to suit everyone that loves a paleo diet. The recipes are full of flavour and will not leave anybody hungry!

I always enjoy rich and creamy casseroles at the end of my busy day.Thanks to Alexa. This book offers a wide variety of recipes to choose from. Tried the Creamy Herb Chicken stew for my family; it was absolutely divine. The added bonus of dessert recipes was a nice surprise. I never thought making desserts from a slow cooker before. I look forward to try it out very soon!
I have tried several recipes and most were very good.  I have to buy a larger slow cooker to try more recipes. I had to adjust some ingredients and burned one or two.  This is a good book.
Excellent. Enjoyed the detail and explanations in the book. I never really thought that one could develop this type of analysis accuracy.

reviewText: M.Kircher has such imagination. I love it! How do you come up with this stuff?! I was sucked into these dreams with Emily. I honestly couldn’t get enough of it! These action packed, fun, suffocating, panic stricken dreams!I am unable to go into much detail without spoiling this book…I do not like giving things away.

This was a great novel. I can truly say I love Covington Falls, Georgia. I enjoyed watching Addison as she tried to deny her feelings for Ethan but knowing that her Aunt Ruth, Ethan's kids, Jason and Carson, and her step-son, Aaron would make her come to the the right decision in the end. I loved watching as Addison took the school musical and made it into a true love story for the kids she was working with. I love how she made a difference in Michelle's life. Not only that, I loved how Addison was so clear-headed when dealing with problems in her life. I wish I could do that with a similar grace.I actually had started reading MARRY ME, the first book in this series, but at work I started reading ACTIING UP and I just couldn't put it down. I is definitely amazing. I will read all the books in this series for sure. I'll make MARRY ME next on my TBR list.If you like Christian fiction, you will adore this. I had no idea this was a Christian book when I first started reading it. But I think people who haven't tried Christian fiction would like this too. I mean, who doesn't love a story about a soap opera star coming back to her small town hometown and finding love. It is a no brainer!5 Sars!I received this as an ARC pdf copy from Astraea Press in return for an honest review. Honestly amazing.

Disclosure: I received a review copy from the author in exchange for a honest review.Sell-by Date is a short story that takes place (in the same world) before Dead Spot. In Dead Spot readers meet the heroine, Scarlett’s roommate Molly…but we never knew how they came to be roomies.  Sell-by Date answers that precise question, how did Scarlett and Molly meet?Sell-by Date is narrated by the oh-so-funny Molly as she navigates the human world and the new L.A. scene. You see, Molly was turn when she was 17-years-old and even though she is about 90 …she can’t order a beer or stay out late after curfew without having the cops card her. I really enjoyed reading this short story and seeing a different side to Molly. In Dead Spot, Molly came off as a fun and outgoing roommate that kind of roomed with Scarlett so that she may ‘age’ (because any supernatural being that comes within a 15 mile radius of Scarlett becomes normal/human again). While that is definitely one of the reasons why, it turns out there’s another entirely different reason why Molly so desperately wanted Scarlett as a roommate.I loved Molly ever since I met her in Dead Spots, and after reading Sell-by Date I would really like to read more of the old world from Molly’s POV. I think the author is planning to write a spin-off from her Scarlett Bernard series, so finger crosses that Molly gets a full book! I highly recommend this short story to already fans of Scarlett or if you’re interested in checking out the series (Dead Spot, book 1) this is a great introduction to the world, characters, and the author’s writing. I highly recommend it! Sell-by Date was a fun and cute short story!

I am so glad that I got this book.  I have heard about LinkedIn, but never really understood what it was, so I never gave it much thought.  After having read this book and finding out exactly what LinkedIn is and how it works, my next mission will be to sign on.  I highly recommend this book.

This book is a fantastic resource. After reading it i had a better understanding of what I can do and how I can use Linkedin to my advantage. It encouraged me to do things like utilizing forums and forming relationships with others. I'm sure that there are other books that cover the subject, but this as a quick, easy to follow book that will get you on the right path!
When I first saw this book I was skeptical.  After all, how many websites promise to make you money? The truth is, if you use Linkedin right, you can.  I did it and so can you!

This was a good step-by-step guide to building your business as a writer on LinkedIn.As the author points out, this is not an instant success process but rather a helpful guide which must be diligently and consistently followed to achieve desired results.All good things take dedicated work and this is also true of the steps one must follow to build a successful writing career.Worth the read.

reviewerName: Kiki Read Hear "Kiki from Read This ~ HearThat"
reviewText: This is turning in to one hell of a page turner. This book just keeps getting better and better.Willow has to be exhausted, pretending to be one thing and getting reality mixed with fantasy. This book takes a crazy turn, well more like insane twists and turns. Ebon's past makes a huge splash in this book. You meet some unwanted intrusions and it really "Blows" you away. reviewText: I am so in love! The first one, i wasnt to into it. Then i bought and read the second one, loved it! It got better with each and can not wait for the fourth! I'm sure there wont be disappointment!!

I like that even though this is the 3rd book in the series I didn't feel like the story was getting old. She gave me some answers and some new question. I like how she's letting the characters grow.I can't wait for the next book.
I love this series.  Great characters, strong, funny, sexy :) always leaving me satisfied but wanting more.  Off to read the next one.
Loved it can't wait for the next one to come out. Please don't keep us waiting too long do  the next book

I've read all three books in 2 weeks time. You just can't put them down. The action and the love with it deception is amazing. I'm wait for the next book to be released. Although I have to admit I wish it was available now.I hope everyone enjoys these books as I have.

Sometimes you get so attached to fictional characters that when a book ends, you miss them. Such is the case for me with Sasha, Stefan, and Charles in the latest KF Breene series. The third installment in this story was released yesterday, and I happily and greedily got sucked back into their world.This is a compelling series, full of mythological creatures and beings remade so skillfully that they seem normal. Paranormal and fantasy isn't my favorite genre, because it takes a skilled writer with a firm grasp of reality to write a story that seems legitimate and relatable. KF Breene is exactly that kind of writer, and I thoroughly enjoy reading everything she writes.On A Razor's Edge picks up more or less where Braving the Elements left off, with Stefan and Sasha totally in love and screwing every chance they get. With the much anticipated arrival of the Regional - essentially the Boss's boss - we see Stefan in a whole new light, and learn more about how Stefan's people fit into our world. There is also another species of almost-humans and a road trip involved. Lots of magic, lots of information, lots of fun.Honestly, the real world seems pretty boring and staid in comparison.The more I read this series, the more intrigued I get. Yes, I love the hot sex and the proliferation of physical beauty, but it is the magical power and the non-human creatures that really fascinates me. I am a bit wistful for their almost-real world, and after each book I look at our world a bit differently. It's possible there are other human-like species walking around....it's possible that humans have the ability to wield magic, if only we knew how....it is all very possible....This third book lives up to the high standards of fun, interesting, and hot established by the first two books. It is a enchanting read, and while several important issues are satisfied, it will leave you hungry for the next book.

I re-read the first two books and just finished the third one.  I can't wait until the next one comes out to see where K.F. takes the characters.  I enjoy the relationships between the main characters and getting and getting to know them.I like the fact that Charles talks too much and the way Stefan and Sasha love each other.  The new characters are also interesting and have their own agenda.

I love Riley Hart and her writing. I feel in love with her with Collide and it was only strengthened with Stay. All the characters have real issues they need to figure out and sort thru which just makes them more relatable. From beginning to end, it was an awesome journey to see Braden and Wes grow, both individually and together. As I told Riley, Jessie stole my heart, Wes broke it (Jessie too) and Braden just seemed to be there to pick it all up and put it all back together again. Great story by a wonderful author with lots of good feels! Thank you Riley for continuing these books....can't wait for the next one!!
summary: A full circle for my happy heart!!

reviewText: is when you find something you were not looking for. And that is what these two men experience. Wes is the pessimist who seems always to see the glass as half-empty, while Braden is the optimist in this story. Wes tends to remember those who left, rather than those who are still there. Braden on the other hand is always looking for what is over the next hill. Slowly they get under each other's skin (while little Jessie is perhaps the glue i this mix). At the end Wes (literally!) paints the picture Braden was longing for, but had problems to ask for. I have enjoyed reading this book. My rating: 4,75 stars.

So as I'm reading this story, I'm highlighting the paragraphs that just blow me away...the problem I noticed was, by the time I finished, I think I highlighted about 80% of this book!!!!!! I just want to say that I absolutely love Riley Hart.....her writing is flawless, her characters are real, lovable, everyday folks like you and I....no billionaires, no international spies, no drug lords....Stay is the second in the Blackcreek series....this is the story of Braden and Wes....and I can't forget Jessie, fWes's 4 year old niece...and of course with appearances from Noah and Cooper from the first book, Collide....We meet Wes in Collide when he comes into town to stay with his terminally sick sister....Well, the inevitable happens and Wes, a single, gay, almost thirty year old is now the sole guardian of Jessie....Wes's sister had faith in him, saw something in him and/or felt that this responsibility was just...right....Braden, who actually hooked up with Wes for one night, winds up back in Wes's life, or should I say pushes himself into Wes's life bit by bit...I loved Braden....he was funny, conceited (in a lovable way!), determined, great-natured....there was not one thing I didn't love about him!!!! As he pushes his way back into Wes's life and his heart as well, he falls crazy in love with little Jessie...the relationship between the three of them brought me to tears so many times and yet, made me laugh at others....the love, compassion, passion and tenderness shown between Wes and Braden blew me away...the way Braden  took it upon himself to help Wes with Jessie was amazing....so natural and effortless.....I just loved this story!!! I can't wait for the next in the series which will be about Mason...I love you Riley Hart!!!!!! ❤️❤️❤️

First, I stumbled upon Collide (book 1 in her Blackcreek series) a few months ago and really enjoyed it. Then, I read Broken Pieces (not part of this series but seriously epic) and had my heart ripped out and then put back together. So when Stay was released I couldn't resist purchasing it right away. This past weekend I finally got a chance to sit down and read it and Wes and Braden stole my heart.Probably my favorite part, was how freaking cocky Braden was and how unapologetic he was about it. He didn't come off as being a complete jerk, but he also knew that he was worth keeping around and he just had to convince Wes of that.This book is amazing and will warm your heart with the love these men have for each other and for Jessie.10 for 10, would recommend. :)
It was a sweet, romantic, fun & hot ride! I really enjoy the story & the characters! Buy it & read it now!!

Having read Collide and being completely taken with the characters, their story and the emotion, I couldn't wait to read Stay. If you haven't read the first book I really recommend; Wes and Braden were secondary characters, but their story began in Collide.This book is slightly different in that both characters are comfortable with their sexuality. But ultimately the same message is reinforced. Love is love, and this is shown perfectly by the fact that Braden is bi-sexual and it's simply a case of him waiting to find the one, be it a man or a woman. The man is a treasure; witty, fun, kind and thoughtful, he inserts his foot into his mouth regularly and is completely endearing with it. Wes is struggling; everyone he loves has left him in some way or another and following his sister's death, he is raising her four year old daughter. He is full of fear and self-doubt, but he simply needs someone to make him see what a stellar job he is doing. And that man is Braden.Kids can either make or break a book; they can be ridiculously unrealistic, or perfect. Jessie is the latter. Her world is untainted, as it is to all four year olds. She says what she sees and thinks and her growing relationship with Braden bring so many moments that made me smile. She is a sweet loveable little lady.My heart ached for Wes and his fears and I wanted to throw my arms around Braden and squeeze him tightly for his patience, understanding and sweet gestures. And when Wes lets his barriers down, he too is a wonderful, witty man. You can't not want them to find happiness and it is this that makes for another captivating read. Whilst Collide had the edge based on the storyline, this is a very worthy sequel and one I highly recommend.I hope we see more of Coop, Noah, Wes and Braden in Mason's book.
Riley Hart knows how to write passion.  You can feel the emotions between the characters.  I've loved all her books and I can't wait for the next one.

It was too short!! Definitely left me wanting more! Please finish the story, Jade Jones ASAP.  I hate that the story left us hanging like that. Such a tease but I will be waiting for the full version!!

The constant switching back and forth between present and past from Jayde's point of view to Hero's made this story difficult for me to enjoy. I would've rather read more about how Jayde ended up in that predicament than the flashbacks of her "relationship" with Hero. Overall, I feel that my lack of enjoyment boils down to personal taste. This turned out to be very different from what I expected or wanted to read. I'm sure others will feel differently.

reviewText: “You are an incorrigible rascal, aren’t you? I fear that when it comes to you, căţel, I may have inadvertently opened Pandora’s box.” - GaiusI really enjoyed this book. I liked the JP's writing style, it's quite different from what I've read before.Dominus is the first installment of this series. It takes place in Ancient Rome, and it deals with a lot of issues that were part of the era. Slavery, of course, is part of this.Gaius is a very important man in Rome. He's a gorgeous man, a warrior that has fought for his people for a very long time. Gaius has a weakness: his boys. Gaius' boys love him beyond belief and would do anything for him and to stay by his side. Gaius, for his part, loves his boys and does anything to keep them happy, and more importantly, safe. While Gaius is a wicked, lusty bastard who's never really been in love before, but that changes he meets Allerix, a beautiful Dacian, who keeps rebelling himself against his Dominus' orders.Allerix has a secret and tries to keep it safe. If his secret sees the day of light, there's a chance that he won't.This novel is about a forbidden love between to men that for being who they are will have to struggle a lot to be together.I'm really looking forward to read the next book! :)
Kept you turning the pages wanting to know what happens next.  The only critique I had was how quickly Olivia went from strong, take no crap persona to being biased around and meek.
Wonderful spin on the cinderella story.  He's the poor rich boy who just can't seem to find himself and she's the strong willed yet seriously strong woman who won't let him fall.

Govan is from the north. He doesn't approve of the slavery that goes on around him and has no desire to ever own another man. When he sees Jon being beaten by his owner, Govan can't help but feel a pull towards the waiflike slave.He longs to free Jon but at the same time, Govan's attraction to the man is so strong he can't imagine ever letting him go.Damaged by his past, Jon doesn't understand Govan's kindness but can't help but feel safe around the gentle innkeeper.With a world of differences between them, will Jon and Govan find their way to love, or will Jon's vengeful owner destroy their chance at happiness?Jon is a well written short story with characters that pulled at my heartstrings from the very first page. Another wonderful tale from one of my favorite authors; I always enjoy Hollis' imaginative worlds and happy endings!Adult themes including physical abuse and descriptive sexual encounters make this story appropriate for adult audiences only.

reviewText: I have been interested in coconut oil as I have been trying to find healthy alternatives to butter and olive oil in my cooking. This was a great book to fully understand why coconut oil is beneficial, the various uses and benefits of its use. It does not teach you directly how to use it (beyond the basics, as in there are no direct recipes, etc.), but it teaches you why you should use it and how it is going to react with your body in the way that it is used. Everything from Alzheimer's to weight loss, seizures to dry skin... this book describes how coconut oil could be the solution! Very informative and great information.

Book Readers ReviewPatriot by A.S.Bond is a winner of an Honorable Mention at the San Francisco Book Festival 2014.  A well deserved award.  Bond's novel is a thriller full of intrigue, conspiracy,  and suspense.  An ambitious young reporter takes a dangerous and terrifying journey to the remotest parts of the world.  Brooke Kinely receives information from a source in the Pentagon of a high ranking businessman's part in terrorism.  A sophisticated weapon wipes out a U.S army patrol and Brooke tries to uncover a traitor and stop a devastating attack on America.The author throws you straight into the action, which continues and even gets more exciting.  The main players are authentic and technical aspects are obviously well researched.  Bond’s creativity leads the reader to conjure up pictures with just enough descriptive writing without being too bogged down with detail.  I love conspiracy theory, spy, political espionage, action, and suspense.  All of these are in this book and more.  Add a little personal experience and travel of A.S. Bond to the exciting mix. I give a rating of well earned five stars.  Patriot should be on everyone's book shelf, read and even re-read.I received a Kindle copy from NetGalley to review for a virtual book tourRead More:[...]
summary: Thriller, Suspense, Action all make for an exciting read

The book is full of tips that will help you as a parent and I found it to be very realistic advice. If you are looking for a quick concise read on parenting this book will be right for you.

Another great read. Em feels betrayed by Gavin and has to get away from him. She calls Tristin and he comes to the rescue. She gets a job and makes a friend and that friend knows Gavin. Tristin finally tells Em he has feeling for her and he wants her to give him a chance. Gavin finds out about the threats , but it is it too late? She is accused of stealing money and is going to jail.Can anyone help her? I can't wait to find out what happens next.

I felt this book was kind of a way for the author to gain more money, I loved the first book, I felt like this book did a poor job on how Liam got help if he even did, I also took Vivian as a weak person as well. It is so hard to find an author that can write a decent sex scene and not write "shattering" when explaining an orgasm.Thank you Haleigh.They were very refreshing sex scenes, very steamy.It was so hard not to cry when they boys were writing their letters before their mission, so heartfelt.I was very nervous about how this book would turn out with Liam's PTSD consuming him along with his guilt.I'm so glad it took a turn for the better.
