This book is a brave account of a women who is willing to put her life out there for others in the hopes that her experiences will help another.﻿Nancy Fileccia begins her story as an ordinary family. She has two daughters Lindsey and Lauren and has a loving family like many others. She feels lead to open her family up to give others that love that so many deserve but are not getting. Her family proceeds the action to adopt a child from Guatemala and before they know it their son Cameron is added to their family. The love for this child is instant. Love of another can occur whether biological or not biological. We are all God's children so the reason for that is simple. Not long after that Lindsey is diagnosed with Tourette Syndrome which leads them to homeschooling. Nancy's husband Rusty is a doctor and so that provides them with some comfort.Little did they know that their lives were about to change in a big way. God was leading them to a little Girl in China named Candace Kate. They went to China to pick up Candace but when they got there they found out that she was deaf. The family felt lead by God to continue the adoption. Little did they know the challenges they would face as Candace was more than deaf. Later they would find that she had a rare disease called Batten Disease. This disease does not have a cure and so the story really begins as Nancy takes us through the rest of Candace's life, which is filled with Dr. appointments, therapy's and lots of question. Nancy is upfront with her feelings of frustration and hope as she shares some of her personal thoughts.This is a very gut wrenching story. Grab your tissues.I thought  that I might be able to relate to Nancy's story because I have dealt with illness myself. I have had to handle my significant other having heart failure and diabetes. We went through a really tough time period. However he lives with these things right now where Candace lost her fight. I also have close family member with Cancer and although that was a fight I still have that family member. I could however relate  to the many medical appointments and the feelings of being angry with God. I appreciate Nancy sharing her story. I think that handling a child with terminal illness is completely different than an adult and so with that I hope that her story will help another. I know that sharing my emotions really helped me .Sharing those feelings can be healing. I am sorry Nancy that you had to go through so much.God really choose you for a reason. May this book bless all those who read it.

Slowly we Trust is a slow paced and at the moments confusing read.It was a good and satisfying read, but there were some things that really dragged and made the book a longer read than it should have been.I like Will and Aubrey journey. Aubrey is not my favorite. She did frustrate me quite a few times. Will is a more complete character. He is caring, patient, sweet.I really wish that the characters had more depth and the plot was better developed.≧◔◡◔≦ 3.5 ✰ read ≧◉◡◉≦

Audrey and Will are the next couple in the Fall and Rise series. Audrey is holding big secrets and Will is trying his best to discover them. Will tries to understand Audrey's reluctance to have a relationship and her constant push-pull with him. Once she commits herself to a relationship, she continues to hold big secrets from him. I will not give away her secrets, but they are big and life altering. Will is very understanding when they become known and stands by her side. Audrey was a little tough to like throughout this book and, although her parents were extremely moralistic and unbending, she made mistakes also. Overall a good read. If you liked the other books in this series, you will like this one.

I loved this book so much! It may not be "great" literature but I will remember the story for a long time. Of course, the story had me from the start as I've been a lover of dog books since I could read. Partly because it's a slimmer volume and partly because it's for kids aged 8 and up.
summary: Enjoyed reading this with my kids!

reviewText: This is the best dog book I have read! And I don't speak in superlatives very often. If you've ever had a dog that became an integral part of your family, you will love this book- even if you're an adult! Bungee's story is heartwarming and wonderful. I don't want to spoil your pleasure by relating even a speck of the details! Just read the book and enjoy!

I like this book mostly because of the places to travel or retire. Much of the retirement information presented, I already knew about and have implemented several years ago. However, the places listed to travel to when you are retired are pretty cool.

It's difficult to write a useful review of Century Village without any spoilers. As a reader, you want to share some of the surprises, but as a reviewer, I'll do my best without.Mel Weiss is retired and living in Florida with his wife and many of his lifelong friends.  They all share their Egyptian heritage, Jewish faith, and the rut of a daily routine in a retirement community.  One morning, Mel wakes to find his wife, Judith, gone.  There is no note, no sign of a disturbance, but Judith and some of her favorite things have disappeared.Suddenly alone, Mel grapples with losing his wife, the ambiguity of her disappearance, his family, and what he wants to do with what is left with his life.  He sets off on an adventure, only to be forced to return home and experience another adventure, but one not of his choosing.Century Village is a fun story, and the author does a fine job of making the characters come alive--in some ways, they are the stereotype of a Florida retiree, but in other ways, each has their own unique voice.  The book is also very well written for a debut novel, and shows that the author has true writing talent.Full disclosure: I received an electronic copy of this book for my review, and the opinions in the review are my own.

Two people who lost everything find eachother in a wilderness that user belong to the Cherokee!Panther a Cherokee boy finds Avery a mixed blood little girl lost and wounded. Panther decides to take her home So he can take care of her and protect her as long as he can.This is a story of a sweet Love that turns into true love.

4 Stars  I really enjoyed this book by a fresh new Author. the story was exciting and held my entrest well with just enough spice to add a tingle. I enjoyed it and look forward to reading more of her work..
summary: The Shaman's Song by Elle Marlow

reviewText: I love reading book series. I always find myself way to wrapped up in the characters, but I'm guessing, that's just what the authors want. When I found out that Epiphany was going to be the last book in The Destined Series I wondered how it would end.  And with complete trust in Ashley Suzanne, I knew she wouldn't leave us hanging.I read it in a day, absolutely could not put it down. Once I finished, I quickly text a friend who I also knew was reading it, if she finished? She hadn't but asked my opinion, I replied, "cried my eyes out, it was wonderful."  And it was, and I did.Well done Ashley Suzanne. Thank you for and incredible series and an excellent ending.

I read a lot of negative reviews about this book, and almost didn't get it. I am one of those that just go with the storyline, believeable or not. I liked this story. The steamy parts were excellent. This was a quick read, don't expect this to last you long. I was wanting, and possibly will buy the other books in this series, but at the moment, I can't pay that kind of money for a quickie that will leave me hanging for the next book. BUT, personally I thought this was an excellent book. I loved the characters, and the author was good at her weaving of this story. I think some people expect more than they should with books anymore. Sit back and enjoy!  I did!

My busy schedule really gets in the way of me losing weight. Thankfully, this book offers alternatives and solutions for me to cut back some extra weight within a short period of time. The tips are really helpful and the rules are very easy to understand. So far this book has helped me keep track of what I eat and with the help of it's plan, I'm confident I'll be shedding off the pounds.

I liked Jays character; from beginning to end he remained a no nonsense type of dude. The bond that BMG had with each other was one only some could maintain. I loved their loyalty and I was sad at what happened to Brea. Can't wait to see what happens next.

"The Two Towers" is the kind of novel that I just can't help but dive headfirst into. Using strong world-building and a fast-paced plot, this post apocalyptic novel explores not only the realities of living in a world that is hard and unforgiving, but explores the concepts of society and social classes as well. Jamie A. Waters easily draws readers in with a smooth story that mixes danger, intrigue, drama, action, romance and mystery to weave a novel that is as memorable as it is entertaining. The evolving story between Kayla and Carl has a strongly evocative and dramatic tone, adding in layer after layer of intrigue to the story... bringing a human element to the dystopian/post-apocalyptic storyline.The well-written novel has a lush and descriptive writing style that paints each scene with a fine tipped brush, adding depth and intricacies to the story... making for truly engaging novel. The author has a lot of talent in storytelling building up the plot and laying the foundation for an even more satisfying series that has me eager to read the next novel in The Two Towers Series.Overall, this was well worth the read and is definitely a novel that I would recommend to readers looking for a fast-paced apocalyptic novel to sink their teeth into. It's a post apocalyptic, dystopian, romance drama that has all the makings of a great series... one that is worth reading.
summary: A Promising Start to an Imaginative Series

reviewText: This is my first time reading anything by E A Price.  I discovered it while perusing paranormal books on my Kindle.  I downloaded a sample, it sounded interesting, so thought I'd give this new author a try.  I was not disappointed.  While the story material and general writing style is slightly similar to that of M L Breiers and A B Lee, that works for me, as they are two of my favorite authors.  The storyline was good and it held my interest.  The typos/grammatical errors were a bit distracting for me.  But for the price of just $1.00, I feel it's a bargain.  If you are as entertained as I am by fictional stories of Witches, Lycans, and other "shifters," then I can certainly recommend this book to you.  Note:  This book does contain some cursing and a few sex scenes, but nothing that you wouldn't ordinarily find in stories of this type.
Another great story from the Grey wolf Pack can't wait for more great stories in this series. Definitely worth the price and more. ENJOY.
GRRRREAT READ! Please don't keep me waiting too long. I fell in love with Nicole. lol. keep up the good work! (Smiling)
I've read one and two in a day. All I can say is I really can't wait to read three
Wow...A real pager turner...I couldn't put it down...You will not be disappointed...Will leave you wanting more...Can't wait to see what's next.

I have heard many of my friends explain that their fast metabolism was the reason for the way their body looked, but I never really understood what they meant.  After reading this book I now understand that you can set your diet up to help your metabolism improve.

I completely fell in love with this book and the characters.  T.E. Ridener did an amazing job with this book and I am happy that yet another author is bringing awareness to a problem that we have.  The characters in the book are so relatable.  I love Rowan and Kasen.  It was difficult to read some of this book just because I have seen people go through similar things that both these men have to go through. T.E. Ridener did an excellent job at bringing attention to the problem without sugar coating it and also without being so graphic that would make it hard to read.  I could not help but want to jump into the book and protect both of these men.  I loved the journey that I got to go on with them.  I would highly recommend this book.
summary: Amazing story with an Amazing message!

reviewText: This "serial" is great!!  I still object to having a book broken into parts.  I still object to having to pay several times to complete the Book.  I usually don't even get the first part of a broken up book, but I made an exception with this one and I can't wait for the next installment.  I will certainly be looking for books written by M.S. Parker.  I'd just like to think the next one is one full book!!
This was hot!  Gavin and Carrie are back on.  Obviously there will be more added to the story in the next one but I am looking forward to it!

This book continues the saga that began with book 1, I really love the way Gavin and Carrie interact with each other, there's also a miseries side Gaving is not showing and that keeps me intrigued what it is and what will be coming now. The descriptions of the sexual act are great, you can really imagine you are there with Gavin enjoying all the wonderful things he does to Carrie. I'm so happy I found this series nearly complete because I' m going for the third part just in one day!!!!! Impossible to wait a minute for the next book. Thank you Miss Parker!!!

Counting Calories is such an inspirational story and the illustrations make it all the better. Jane Olson is an awesome writer. She brings out the humor in the worst situations and makes you feel like your the main character.Jane is an overweight woman trying to make the best of everyday. She goes from being completely ignored by everyone she , passed up on business trips becuase she's  " fresh or  bright" to being asked to be a guest speaker for the Ymca and getting a major job promotion.Jane also provides her meals for everyday of the week. What app she used to help count her calories. You will feel the determination and dedication Jane gained and witnesse the storybenefits it came with. 5 stars

The author of the book Illustrated Counting Calories has wrote a wonderful book of encouragement for those that have suffered from being overweight. I found the pictures in the book to be just amazing and I really feel that it makes the book so much more alive and understandable for the reader. As I read I find a little bit of myself in the book as the girl stands in the mirror and stares at the reflection that she sees. I too at times look in the mirror and find myself saying to myself that I need to lose some of the weight and that ugly fat roll that I have hanging under my ribs, ugh how I wish it would just disappear in the night. Trying different diets and all the other promising lose weight programs are just so familiar to me that it's not funny.  Many times I had found myself giving up and just denying the fact that I really needed to find another way to go about losing the weight. It's very hard to except that being overweight can cause so many problems even for a person's everyday life.  It makes it hard to get out of bed, take a shower, keep yourself clean, get a good night sleep, breath when trying to get dressed, and so much more.  I begun to have lots of back problems a few years ago and I really didn’t want to admit to myself that all that pain was caused from being almost 180ilbs and should have only been about 130lbs max for my height. Heck I'm only 5'4" and 180lbs didn’t seem like a lot at the time but once I tried a calorie diet I begun to feel the difference. I lost over 45lbs and was at a nice 133lbs. I quit my diet because I became fatigue due to low iron. I have gain back a few pounds and now I weigh in at 148lbs. I know it don’t seem like a lot to those of you that are bigger then I but please you have to remember I am only 5'4" and my normal weight is only between 120 and 130. I look in the mirror and just know I still need to lose some more weight.  I really feel that this book might help me to do my diet again by helping me to understand what foods will keep me healthy and still lose the pounds. Maybe I will be able to do it this time without the low iron problem.  I am defiantly going to try out some of the recipes that she has listed in the book. I won't hurt to try it.
Short quick erotic read. Joelle is looking for her knight has she found him in Liam? Or is it just a night of hot sex.
I loved the story line, hot bikers, sex...but WAY TO SHORT...I'd wait till its free. Not worth $2.99, but was a good story.

Omg needless to say this book brought me to tears!!!! (And I'm not a cry(er)) There were so many things I did not see coming!!!!! I think I may just read the entire series again!!!! Great job sis!!!!!
summary: You know a MrS book is always a banger!!!!!

reviewText: I am very pleased with this new addition of H.P.Mallory's books. I look forward to reading where she takes us next.
summary: Wonderful start to a new series!

reviewText: I was so happy to still be able to follow the lives of my beloved Rand,Jolie and of course Sinjin! The book immediately had me hooked and I found it difficult to put it down. I have already recommended this book to everyone that I "book chat" with. Hurry up with the next one!!
summary: Allowed me to continued my love of these characters

reviewText: I enjoyed reading this item. One thing I did not like was 20 percent of the book is devoted to her other series...we get the samples here...I have read them, do not need more hawking. This is what is causing a 4. For those of us, who ave read her other works, you will be pleased. For the newbies, read her other series, you won't go wrong. Thank you, hp for a continuance of a favor?ed character...
summary: another good story, with a cliff hanger

reviewText: I love these characters and was on pins and needles waiting for this next installment! It was so good I tore through it now I'm left on pins and needles till the next one comes out!

It's nice that the author included this statement in her description of the book:Warning: There is no HEA, there is a cliffhanger that will piss you off, and this is the way I like it ;)I'm assuming this is possibly a bit of sarcasm, but is antagonizing your prospective readers with polarizing statements the way you like it?I really do appreciate the heads up about the cliffhanger - it would have pissed me off had I wasted my time reading your work.
summary: Author's attitude = I'll never read her work

reviewText: I choose this book because I'm a curious person about all things it was a simple but fun read and it was enjoyable.
I enjoyed this book but it was very short. There must be another book because there was no ending. The characters were good and the story line was good.

Samantha Green propose in this book to follow a vegan diet on weekdays and them resume a normal diet on the weekend if you are not fully ready to become vegan all the time. I think this is a interesting concept. She  explains what it means to be vegan and gives a list of the benefits of being vegan. There is 5 breakfast, lunch, dinner and snack recipes. I made the creamy mushroom polenta and it was delicious. Will definitively make others recipes from this book. Well done!

I have to say that I stumbled across this book and was quite surprised at how good it is. In the beginning Gwen meets the perfect guy who has a secret of sorts (I kept thinking he was an alien for some reason), which we don't find out in this book. She then meets his bother who is extremely flawed. Gotta say, I liked the brother Nathan way better than the perfect guy because the author allows us to see why he is as he is. I believe this book is undervalued at its current price. It is a really good book that will have you checking the authors home page; like me, to see when the next book is out.Edited----Added an additional star after I read the book again. I think I love it more the second time around.
It was a very interesting the only thing I would of like is a different ending to many don't end happy. This I think could have had a happier ending.

They say don’t judge a book by its cover but with this one you should.  Don’t get me wrong the grammar is more professional than the book cover but the author needs to take some time learning how to tell a story which is more important. I can only image the glowing reviews are left by friends and family. Where I had to force my way through because I thought maybe it would get better but it was slow and boring the whole time. The characters were boring, I would rather hang out with my grandmother and listen to her tell me about knitting, I wasted a week of my life trying to trudge through this never again.I’m pissed I wasted my money on this because I trusted the recommendation from a friend who was apparently just trying to support another friend in their attempt to write a book. Mainly the book was just EXTREMELY BORING if I had to sum up on one word that is the word it would be. I’ll give actual reasons though but since there are many to choose from I’ll only use a few.So here are some clips of how horribly exciting this character and her life are.“I wondered if Josh would be much longer. How typical that the one night I didn’t want to be stuck in the office was the one night I was forced to wait for him. It had been a long week and I was tired.”That is for real in the book. Office lady who has to wait for someone she doesn’t want to wait for. I read books to escape the boredom of real life not to be told about some fake two dimensional character’s same boring experiences. Grabbing a coffee from the break room at my day job is more thrilling than this character’s life for most of the book.And overwritten sentences, “He raised an eyebrow at me questioningly.” Where was the editor for this book or was there one?The worst part was all the boring summaries like these, “Josh chose that moment to walk back in. We ate our food in relative silence. I picked at mine, moving it around inside its foil tray but not really eating it. Josh didn’t finish his either, and fed the rest of it to Connor.”Are you still awake reading this? I don’t think the author was while writing it.And passages where the author tells you about relationships. Where is the character development? “Robert’s interest in me had always been odd. I’d never understood it, but when it was nothing more than messages on my answer machine I could ignore it. I’d had other things on my mind, things that consumed me.”This is the character’s problems. In a word, boring.Then when the characters are in stressful situation the passage is written with complete lack of emotion, like this, “The light from the lake was all but gone, leaving us in subtle darkness. She appeared human again, her strange countenance vanished. Even her snowy gown had been blown away by Josh’s words.”It’s not bad writing, well maybe a little “Even her snowy gown had been blown away by Josh’s words” is flowery, but mostly the problem is its just emotionless. Something crazy happens and the character talks about it with the same passion one talks about a cloudy day in June. The last couple chapters were the only parts where the story was even remotely interesting but the writing was so devoid of passion that it fell flat and I didn’t connect. It didn’t seem real. Things like that don’t happen and people just be like, oh this happened.Sorry to be so bitter, I hate being ripped off so don’t blame me. Maybe she has more friends who will like this book but why can’t authors share their books with friends without pretending it’s a real book and then people waste money buying it. If you aren’t her friend and considering reading this just be smarter than me and read a sample first, I knew it was going to suck once I started reading but thought it would get better. It did at the end but not good enough to be worth paying for.The best thing about this book was the end but only because it meant it was finally over. I can’t believe I finished reading this. I will not be reading more by this author and the friend that recommended this, last time I take his advice on books if he can’t be honest and is going to try to sell me books that suck just because he knows the person that wrote it. Some people have no integrity.

This is my favourite so far of the Emerald Springs continuity. Daniel runs the resort and is wanting to upscale it as a retreat for celebrities escaping the outside world and also introduce some spa therapies that might benefit people with cancer. Daniel was probably the brother most close to their mother and when she died of cancer it was a serious blow for him emotionally.When he meets Rochelle while researching an Australian resort she has an instantaneous effect on him. Not just physically but emotionally.Rochelle, like Jen in the last book, has some problems with her mother that impact on the decisions she makes about how she wants to live her life. Daniel doesn't fit her plans.Both Daniel and Rochelle have big plans and how they deal with that and also the fact they live on opposite sides of the world make for a good read that keeps you hooked. They both make mistakes but it's how they deal with them, especially Daniel, shows the true calibre of their character.Overall a good read with a nice touch of angst and a really lovely hero.
summary: My fave of the series so far.

reviewText: I really enjoyed reading DANIEL'S DECISION by talented author Nicole Flockton. It's the fourth of five books in the Emerald Springs Legacy continuity series and I have only also read the prequel, Trouble Brewing, not the rest of the series itself. Ms. Flockton smoothly includes enough character development of Daniel's brothers, family, and friends that I felt I knew them and I had no problem enjoying the story, even without reading the other books in the continuity yet.DANIEL'S DECISION is about Daniel Whitman, who is in charge of the family's resort hotel in Emerald Springs and the last of the three brothers to remain a bachelor. He has great fun teasing his brothers, especially Chad, for having fallen in love. He feels safe doing so since he is convinced he'll never be bitten by that bug. Daniel has plans to expand the services the family's resort offers in order to attract a more discriminating level of clients. He has heard great things about some innovative changes Kulang, a resort hotel in Australia, has made and decides to take a trip for research. The moment he arrives he meets Rochelle Harris and knows he'll do most anything to get to know her better while he's visiting Australia.Rochelle is the marketing manager at the Kulang and it is her ideas that have brought so much recent growth and success to the resort. She is a strong, ambitious and fiercely independent woman who is solely focused on advancing in her career with no time for men. It's impossible not to admire her and root for her happiness and success, she came from a rough beginning and has made her accomplishments all on her own. She tried having a romantic relationship once before and it left her with nothing but a broken heart and a threat to her career advancement. The minute she sees Daniel she knows he'll be nothing but trouble for her and vows to avoid him.Daniel, the sworn bachelor, is almost immediately smitten with Rochelle, who as fate would have it tries every trick she can to avoid him. One, because she doesn't trust herself considering the intense attraction she feels for him and two, she knows he's from a competitive resort and believes he's there as a spy to smooth talk her out of trade secrets. Daniel although usually all about business is more interested in smooth talking Rochelle into his bed. The draw between these two is irresistible and the chemistry magnetic. It's a sweet story and so well told.  Rochelle doesn't make it easy for Daniel and there's a bit of a hiccup before they can work things out, but Ms. Flockton does in the end give us a glorious HEA. Thankfully so, because Daniel and Rochelle are perfect as a couple and their love story was a pleasure to read. 4 stars~Complimentary copy received in exchange for a honest review.

Nicole Flockton's newest release Daniel's Decision is part of the Emerald Spring Legacy series and can be read as a standalone. I enjoyed this story immensely and loved watching brooding Daniel Whitman become instantly smitten with Rochelle Harris upon meeting her. I so enjoy when the hero has to "eat his words" since he insistently informed his younger brother that he was not in the market for a relationship and that he would not fall in love any time soon. Poor Daniel is surrounded by happy couples and the one that's especially hard for him to deal with is his father's newfound happiness after his mother's death. The author did a great job portraying the closeness that Daniel and his mom shared and the deep loss he still feels every time he thinks about her. It was deeply touching and it broke my heart as he recalled their special moments together and nearly had me in tears. I love when I can connect with a character in a story and can actually feel his or her pain.Daniel is also struggling to convince his dad of his new business proposal for the family's resort and it does not help his demeanor when it's rejected. He travels to visit an Australian resort successfully managed by Rochelle to learn more and get ideas for his own resort in the US. Rochelle is extremely wary of her growing feelings for Daniel and hesitant to act on them due to being deceived in the past. I liked that the heroine was portrayed as an intelligent, successful woman who was able to rise above the hardship and painful past. It was great to see these two express their feelings with each other about their parents and their mutual love of operating a resort. I also enjoyed the unexpected twist and turns as they must overcome a misunderstanding and let trust shine through. I really liked them together and their love scenes were sexy, sweet and romantic. This author continues to write heartwarming love stories that I have come to love and always look forward to reading.
Can Link and Rocky resurrect their lives and get some normalcy back? Another twist to leave us clinging to the cliff at the end of this book.

I love this series. I have read all of her books and the variety of stories blows my mind. This series lives up to the title- it is awesomely dirty. I strongly recommend this series and her other books as well. You will not be disappointed.

"You have always been mine and I have been yours. Our love may not have been easy. But it has always been worth fighting for."Vengeance, the third and final book of the Rising Trilogy, does not disappoint. With action and adventure around every turn, this book will definitely keep you on your toes. After Illyria returns from her honeymoon, she is captured and sent to a foreign planet. Who can she trust? A blue-eyed stranger who seems so familiar?Yes, Bastien is back and he's determined to protect Illyria at all cost, even when things seem impossible. The relationship between Bastien and Illyria is heart breaking, because she's trying to remember him and he's dealing with the consequences of his decision. Can their love be saved?"Easy way out?" Bastien's head whips around. I blink shocked to see tears in his eyes. "You have no idea what that decision cost me. I lost everything I cared about the day I walked away from you. Nothing mattered anymore. I worked. I slept. I went through the motions but it meant nothing. You are the only good thing I ever had in my life. The only thing worth fighting for." A lump forms in my throat as I swallow. "Then why did you stop fighting?" He hangs his head further, so far that it looks like his neck is broken. "Because sometimes surrendering is the only way to truly save the person you love."Will our favorite characters get their happy ending? The twists and turns along the way will keep you on the edge until the very end, and trust me, the ride is definitely worth it. I'm sad this series is over, but I love how Amy Miles wrapped up the trilogy. It wasn't what I expected, but I'm very satisfied with how it ended. She never disappoints!
summary: An Epic Conclusion to the Rising Trilogy

reviewText: It was pretty good but really left you hanging. I hope the rest are longer. I definitely will be reading them.

An above and Beyond 5 Star Read..... Highly emotional and yet very loving, sexy and sweet all rolled into oneMy gosh, I can honestly say I don't know where to begin except for the fact this book was just sensational in every sense of the word....Absolutely fantastic!  Being married and together for 25 years wow this book really hit me hard.  I haven't experienced this to be able to relate to the betrayal but I can certainly relate to alot of the emotions this couple were facing!  I was so blown away and talk about crying, wow, I cried I mean seriously in a gut-wrenching way cried...... I read all day and finished before bed, yep, big mistake because I didn't get much sleep since this book seriously impacted my thoughts all night long!  This author wrote this story in a such a way you felt like you were actually there reliving it all with them..... I absolutely LOVED Sophia, I mean loved and yes, Brandon too and although I had a real hard time letting it go myself, lol, I did truly love that guy too.  Tia and Anotnio, OMG, I was thinking one scenario and then when some truths came out I was so blown away, I mean I had no freaking clue THAT was coming and omg, I was crushed! When that twist came at the end, it blind-sided me completely and that's when the dam broke and the tears kept coming uncontrollably, what a freaking shocker!  Honest to goodness this book was written so perfectly and I have to say sometimes you read a story that makes you at times skim or read quick becuase it loses focus, well not this story because it was THAT well written that it kept me engaged from start to finish.  This may be one of my top highly emotionally charged reads of this year..... Maybe because I can relate with the married life after many years and kids, etc.... maybe because I am in my 40's, lolol, but wow this story really hit a cord in me like none other.  Congrats to an asbolutely PERFECTLY written and executed book, I can't stress enough that it is a MUST read!  This story was a wrecking ball to my emotional well being, lol!!!!!
summary: 5 Super Emotionally Charged Stars, A Must READ!!!!!

reviewText: B.N. Toler took me on quite a ride with this one.  Brandon and Sophia go through quite a bit in their marriage.  We get a glimpse at how they met and forged a relationship together through flashbacks that were helpful.  Tia does her best to get Sophie to quit living for everyone else and to live for herself.  What happens at the end is sad so, if you are not able to read a book with a sad theme to it, then this one will not be for you.  Tia showed great strength and courage and was able to bring Sophie back to her former self.  Brandon did his best to be the man he needed to be for Sophie and was able to overcome his mistake.  Overall a good read.

A charming and steamy story of a married couple that hit a wrong turn and are forced to decide whether or not they can recover.Brandon was a total playboy until he met Sophia. He’d never had to work to get a girl in bed and he always made it clear it wasn’t going to be a serious thing. But from the moment Sophia hit him with her volleyball, Jake became a tongue-tied, stumbling idiot for the girl he just had to have. Sophia had heard of Brandon’s reputation though, and as the confident, self-assured woman that she was, she made Brandon work for it. When they finally got together, it was fireworks and magic, passion and fire.Life has a way of calming down even the hottest of flames over time and the once passion-filled romance eventually turned into a comfortable marriage with two daughters. Brandon was focused on his career and Sophia was a supportive wife and mother handling everything at home. Then one day she walked in on something that never should have happened and her entire world crumbled to the ground.The story is told in two parts: the past and the present. In the past, the reader gets to experience firsthand just how magical the romance between Brandon and Sophia could be. In the present, Sophia’s sister convinces her to go on a trip to figure out how she wants to move forward and more importantly, to rediscover the confident, adventurous woman she’d once been. I could identify with Sophia in every way: from the way she handled her life-changing crisis to the way she struggled over how to move forward. And Brandon, I loved reading about just how much he adored Sophia; it was evident in most everything he did and it made their crossroads that much more painful. What I loved most about WRECKING BALL was the way Ms. Toler created two characters that you could completely empathize with and fall in love with, which made their split hit that much closer to home.WRECKING BALL is sad, steamy, romantic, and fun all combined into one fantastic novel. If you’re in the mood for an emotional story that will tear you in two just to put you back together, WRECKING BALL is the book for you.**Complimentary copy provided by the author/publisher for an honest review.

This is the PERFECT bundle to start with if you LOVE angsty love triangles! Pamela Ann is the queen of them!! She pulls you in and makes you fall in love and hate with all of her characters! You'll find yourself cheering for characters one minute and then find that you want to jump in the story so that you can choke them the next! Pamela Ann does not disappoint with this series!!
summary: How to choose?! Bass or Carter?!! Perfect starter bundle!!

reviewText: Pamela Ann is one of my most FAVORITE authors!! This series is a based around a love triangle - Emma, Carter & Bass. I won't spoil the ending with who Emma ends up with but this story is full of love & angst - what could be better?!?! There are one-offs contained in this bundle - and it is an AMAZING  deal! You won't be disappointed!!

Drew's latest work is short and easily digestible. His writing style is much different in his fiction than in his work for Deadspin and GQ, so if that's all your familiar with, be prepared for a change. My one complaint is that I hoped that it would be a little longer, but for only a dollar, I don't exactly feel ripped off.

after reading Tripp I waited to read Miles... I knew Willows story would be difficult. It was great! And I LOVED Willow and Miles story! HJ Bellus ... I would like some trailer park boys, any chance of a little bit of Luke?

reviewText: Well I read this book all in one day. Thank goodness for weekends off. Loved this series!  It made me laugh and cry. Thanks Chloe Walsh!

This was short and unfortunately a bit rushed. I found it hard to connect to Alex or Nina, and their emotions didn't quite click to me. I love a great bear story, but this one wasn't for me. The reason for three stars is the cover is great, the writing was fine and I was able to finish it and I didn't hate it. If you enjoy quick supernatural reads, then this might be for you.

Almost five centuries after his death, the life, loves and political and religious machinations of Henry VIII continues to grip our imaginations.Author Terry Tyler’s modern-day portrayal of the Tudor king as the dynamic, driven CEO of a UK real estate corporation is a unique and satisfying glimpse into the swirling maelstrom of power and prestige, lust and loss, and dark moments that marked the monarch’s reign.The novel is told from the perspective of key figures in the king’s life, freshly painted in 20th century clothing and attitudes, but retaining their 16-century significance: his six wives and his childhood friend, Charles Brandon each take turns narrating the action from their points of view.Their combined stories paint the picture of a brilliant—if unethical—titan, driven to continually prove his prowess both in the business realm and the bedroom.Anyone familiar with the Tudor saga will know what’s coming. However, Tyler’s strength is that she’s able to breathe new life into the well-worn tale.She draws in the reader by cleverly re-imagining such historic figures as Anne Boleyn (rechristened Annette Hevers) and Catherine Howard (Keira Howard) as women of today. Tyler presents them with warmth and empathy—refusing to resort to their easily clichéd depictions—but never shying away from their tragic failings.She even manages to find a sprinkling of sympathy for the brilliant but tortured Harry, a king among men, even if only in his own musings.“Kings and Queens” is the perfect read for anyone captured by the drama of almost 500 years past, as well as those who simply appreciate the battles that can rage in ones’ own heart.
summary: The girls are just wild about Harry

reviewText: What I liked about this one is unlike other gluten free recipe books, you can make these recipes without having to buy some weird exotic brand of gluten free flour for all of the recipes. So you can create these a lot easier, straight out of the kitchen using your existing ingredients, and that's really helpful to me.

Anyone who loves desserts but don't want to feel guilty after eating it will enjoy this book. It has health information at the start and packed with delicious desserts recipes which is easy to understand and easy to follow and ingredients which can be found from most supermarkets.
summary: ... don't want to feel guilty after eating it will enjoy this book

This book is definitely not for me.  The characters are very young and the language is way too vulgar.  I don't anyone I would recommend this book too.

The feelings, descriptions, dialogue and characters were spot on.  I know some will say too much sex, but it was true to the story and the college scene - remember the characters are older than the other students and this is what happens in real life.  I am looking forward to more stories by this author.

Without going into massive descriptions about the details, I'll say that this book, fourth in the Roxton series as has been mentioned, is very intriguing.  The heroine is unusual in that she has physical imperfections.  The hero is different, in that he has emotional imperfections.  They make a good couple, as each can help the other in some way.  It's just getting to that point that makes the story fascinating.  I'll read this one again, often!

The book was well entertaining and a great distraction from the real world. There were some minor issues but the overall story made me willing to over look and not take seriously. Keep up the good work.

I love author for this fantastic book, I feel that I finally understood what actually been making me shy and sad and worry all the time. The great thing about it, is that you can learn to use some specific tools to start practicing your positive attitudes. I'm grateful that I come across this work !
summary: I'm grateful that I come across this work !

reviewText: This is a great series too read. I finished both books in two days that's how much I couldn't put it down. I hope the third book comes fast

4.5 stars. Hunter is still confusing but a little less so. Whereas it seemed unclear exactly how he felt about Sadie before, it's becoming apparent he feels a lot for her. Some information gets revealed, but not the whole story. Sadie is still uncertain about everything and I don't blame her for making certain assumptions. I do find it hard to resist liking Hunter, though. He may seem guarded and potentially untrustworthy, but he also seems genuine and sincere in his affection for Sadie. However, that's not enough and Sadie gets this. He's hesitant to tell her too much and as things begin to unravel more, even more questions pop up. At the same time, the information explains Hunter's behavior more and more. He and Sadie are very hot and cold but not because they don't care for each other, because Hunter is always thinking about her but he can't get past all of his secrets. When a big shoe drops at the end, things come crashing around Sadie in realization.
Again as with the part one, I can only say INTENSE!!!! Definitely don't read unless you can read all three together.

Poor Sadie, like her life hasn't been hard enough she's stuck with cold/indifferent parents, low self esteem due to her surgery and now she also has to deal with lies, distrust and more lies from  Hunter... poor Sadie!Growing up sick, the miracle of having someone else's heart giving her a second chance at life to be tainted by Hunter lies, to now find out he's engaged!!!!! And to no other than to her heart donor sister!!!!  Someone who he said was cold, calculating and self absorbed! That's damm cold Hunter... or should we now call you Zander!  What a DB!!!Thank God Sadie has her friend Alexa to support her.... Can't wait to read more drama in book 3!

Ms McClendon this has to be one of the best stories you have ever written. Not one Character in this story was without a flaw. Not one Character did not touch my emotions on some level.  I am not a crier. During this story I cried more than I have in a year. I do my crying on the inside. With this story it was all consuming and I couldn't control the tears. I was a child raised by my Grandmother. I credit her for so many things in my life. So Nana really touched my heart. Like my Grandmother who always wanted to help people. Nana was so real for me. Lizzy and Dylan's story was broken and beautiful with so many ugly things trying to keep them apart. I was transformed into the lives of the characters. I felt everything they were going through. I can say enough about this amazing story. Not only will you cry but you will laugh too. It's an emotional journey. I read this story in one sitting and I find myself thinking about the characters hours later.I don't think I can read anything else for a few days. I'm having a book hangover. I totally recommend this story. If I could give it 10 Stars I would. I love all of Shayne McClendon's work but I have to say I could tell this story had her blood sweat and tears all over it. It was beautiful.

As usual and with all honesty I can say you got me again Shayne. I made the mistake of starting to read this book just before bedtime. So there I was 3 in the morning silently crying so as not wake up hubby, again. I really needed this book to bring back to me that the road to love is not always easy, sometimes it can be an impossibly long and pain filled journey for all parties involved. I have read 95% of all of this author's books now and I have enjoyed all (but one) everyone of them makes me run the gamut of emotions. Most of her characters are damaged in someway but as is oftrn true in human nature in the middle of all chaos and destruction there is one person who shines in the darkness, that person is Elizabeth. I don't want to give spoilers and unfortunately I cant seem to review a book without sneaking one in so I'll  just say this, if you love well developed characters that both weak and strong, a mature telling of their story, love so strong it remains throughout the years when other emotions fade this book is for you. I am often wary of 5 star reviews because seriously how many books are that perfect? But this story was just bursting from the pages wanting to be told, dramatic without being drama filled (so sick of that type of book) there is so much love in this book. Love of life, love of people because of who they are not what they are with all their labels just pure love. Dont be mistaken that this book is all hearts and flowers because of the whole love thing though, its dark, so dark in places you wonder how those involved ever see the light again , but they do. Im rambling now so I'll stop, just buy the book and read it, you won't be disappointed.
summary: WOW! Not ugly , silent tears for me

reviewText: This is a predictable tale about a woman down on her luck, overbearing parents, and a very narrow outlook to life.  The hero is interesting, to an extent, but Natalie managed to completely dominate and ruin this book.  Her overriding self-pity and bemoaning of how "everyday normal" she is was ridiculous.  She is jealous of her best friend's misfortunes for the simple fact that at least she has something to set her apart from everyone else!  I forced myself to plow through the drudge, but the entire book was "woe is me, woe is me."  When her ex-boyfriend, the H, dumps her and then needs her, she jumps all over his case because gosh darn it, events of the day were really rough on her.  (I don't want to spoil it for you, so if it's vague, I'm sorry.) This day's event was massively huge for him and she completely screwed it up by being a selfish cow.

I like my heroines to be strong, but this one acted like a virtual doormat. In this day and age; no man should treat a woman this way, and no one should stick around and take it. But then again this woman acted so immature and whiny, and I could see how that might get on someone's nerves. Plus.... they both have mental issues, as far as I'm concerned.
summary: Definitely not my kind of book!

with essential oil, I was going to find out more on it's application in facial mask for oily skin to sort out my acne but the recipe for "Sensual eau-de-cologne" caught my attention. A bonus!

reviewText: Really enjoyed this short horror story. It takes place in a lone trucking diner during a storm. Even though it is short and a quick read it was great on atmosphere and characterisation. The characters weren't one dimensional as you often find in these short stories.  I had no difficulty imagining the diner, storm or characters in my minds eye.It's a very well written story by a master storyteller of horror and well worth a look.

reviewText: The Copper King is a cute little shifter story, with wonderful 'lady luck' to it.  The characters are bouncy and fun.  The friendship undertone is believable between the two male characters.  If you're looking for a kickback, relax read, and a bit of sex, here it is.

A good mix of surprises and mystery books. They are all great and intriguing stories. Well written with believable characters and intriguing plots. Would recommend this for anyone who loves a great book and wants to keep reading more.
summary: Mortal Crimes: 7 Novels of Suspense by J Carson, Melissa F Miller, M A Comley, Carol Davis Luce, and others.

reviewText: Aroostine Higgins is an attorney in the same vein as Sasha McCandless. She is of Native American extraction and uses her honed instincts rather interestingly. She is the lead attorney in what was thought to be a "slam dunk" case until things started happening and she almost gets killed. This is a legal "thriller" in just about every sense of the word. A wonderful story of deceit, electronic treachery and legal mayhem. I am looking forward to more about this wonderful character, Aroostine, whose geneological roots stem from an area of the country where I spent time as a teenager. FIVE STARS !!!In my opinion, thhis book alone is worth the price of the set.
summary: (Review of Critical Vulnerability) by Melissa f Miller

reviewText: Many times we want something but we are afraid or doubt within us, we have negative thoughts and they manifest in he external world then we ask why the things happen in a particular way, that's just what we have inside, the law of attraction It's based on we get what we are inside! This theme is really interesting and this books covers it in an interesting way. Very good book, I really like!

So I learned about how this theory got established, and what do you know it was created in 1930, from a study that boosted 75 years of stock market, that's a lot of knowledge!! This theory is difficult, but that does not mean a trader can not be successful, if this theory is executed properly. Impulse and Corrective phases are discussed,which when these two are put together it creates the "Complete Elliott Wave" Young goes into the Fractal Nature and what it entails, how to trade using the Elliott Wave, Bull Markets are highlighted, and Trading the diagonal. There's a lot of high level information in this book, you must pay attention and take heed to the content given. The graphs in the book helped with the visual aspect of this reading (it was like looking into the heart of trading), I recommend this book to the traders that are interested in a difficult strategy to not only challenge them selves in the trading market, but also just to have that knowledge available for use if its ever needed.
summary: Dated Back to the 30s! Packed with Info!

reviewText: for more reviews please visit www.sizzlingpages.comhttp://angelas-sizzling-pages.blogspo...Arc received from author in exchange for an honest review - SPOILER FREEFive glorious stars for The Promise, another poignant love story from the imagination of Kristen Ashley. A magnificently written tale of passion, healing, hope and the importance of family. So moving, it lured me in, forming an instant bond with all the characters. I have to say, this may be my favorite book in the ‘Burg Series! KA earned all five stars and more. Her brilliant story telling talents, the attention to detail, plot twists, character development and trademark epilogue made this read EPIC. Benito Alessandro Bianchi is one sexy Alpha - Strong, powerful, determined and dominating. He is my dream man.We first meet Frankie and Benny in “At Peace”, which I would recommend reading before The Promise. But don’t fret if you haven’t. KA does an amazing job explaining their background and events from the past.“You made me happy, tesorina.”I fell desperately in love with Benny and all his passionate, Italian macho Alpha hotness. He is tender and sweet, yet a man of great strength. And whenever he calles Frankie “Tesorina”, it bought happy tears to my eyes. Italian for little treasure, the meaning behind that endearing sentiment means so much more. It signifies what a man like him values most and holds dear to his heart. Francesca is his treasure. And within its bounty holds the promise of love, happiness, the fulfillment of dreams and desires…sharing a life together. It pulled on my heartstrings. The way Benny unearthes the treasure he found in Frankie was truly beautiful.“Every day is a new promise, Ben, … Every night I go to sleep knowin’ it’s a promise, every day I wake knowin’ in some way it’s gonna be fulfilled. And repeat. For…hopefully…ever.”I adored Frankie’s persona. She is a woman who sacrifices all for those she loves. My heart ached for her, seeing all the sorrow she experiences. Her incredible character transformation touched my soul. Her determination and compassion was an inspiration. She’s also sassy, feisty and takes no one’s bull. Frankie may not be a full-blooded Italian, but she certainly inherited the hotheaded gene, and I loved it. Frankie was one spicy chick.And the best part…the passion they share. Benny fuels Frankie’s desire with blinding hot sex, he had me swooning and gushing with all his sexy dirty talk and dominating ways. Benny is a sensual man who knows how to take control in the bedroom – it was deliciously titillating. That alone made Benny one of my favorite Alpha heroes.“Could fall asleep buried inside you.”Family and Food…Why The Promise touched me so deeplyThere is an intimate relationship between a writer and reader. When I enter a world created by Kristen Ashley, I embark on a wondrous journey meeting new characters and seeing their lives. But the attachments I formed with the Bianchi’s was greater than any I have ever encountered. The family dynamics, the bonds of affection shared between parents, children, and friends were all too familiar. This family mirrored my own. From holiday gatherings to Sunday dinners, KA’s depiction of the Italian – American lifestyle was remarkably beautiful. Theresa, the matriarch who is the glue that holds them all together. Vinnie Senior, a man who guides his children and loves them despite their faults – a man of virtue and honor. My feelings for them were so strong, as they embodied characteristics of my own parents. Needless to say, this story ran the gamut of deep emotions for me.And of course there’s the food. KA has the gift of making me extremely hungry and horny all at the same time. She has the knack of evoking some pretty powerful urges ;)The Promise was a magnificently written, moving love story that left me blissfully happy. Discovering new characters, visiting some old friends and an attention grabbing storyline made it a fantastic experience that I never wanted to end. I hope you enjoy The Promise as much as I have. Another great heart warming, arousing romance from the amazing Kristen Ashley. Bravo e Grazie Bellisma!
summary: The QUEEN Does it again - Five glorious stars for The Promise

reviewText: There is a reason why I love Kristen Ashley and it is because she writes books like this.  We finally get to read Benny and Frankie’s story and I loved every bit of it.So in order not to give anything away since the book is so new, I am just going to list out what I loved about this book.  Let the list begin:1.) What I found surprise is that there was more to this plot than just passion and danger; this book was filled with truth, forgiveness, friendship, family, and love.2.) Talk about alpha male at your finest!  Benny was in charge this entire book, he never took crap, and it was hot.3.) Benny’s love for Frankie.4.) Frankie’s love for Benny.5.) Benny and Frankie’s love is not always easy.  There are bumps.6.) We got to read more about Cal (Joe) and Vi and their family!!!! Score! I absolutely loved their story and love their comeback in this book.  In this book, their story wraps up!I am sad to hear that the next ‘Burg book will be the last of the series.  I don’t want this to end just like I didn’t want the series Rock Chicks to end but I feel like KA will keep on bringing us amazing stories with wonderful women and sexy men.~MC
Another classic book that I could not put down!! I loved At Peace and was so happy to get more of Joe and Vi. 😄

I am on Adriana Hunter's mailing list, and no wonder! I can't get enough of her books, and this one is no different. The heroine is a BBW who gets knocked over by a bad biker boy, only there's a twist. He's a thief! That makes him bad and bad throughout, except that our good girl heroine is very attracted to him.Adriana has her usual steamy love scenes inside, and the plot does not disappoint, as usual. 5 stars from me!! (And an extra star for the sex scenes!)

I thoroughly enjoyed this book as I have all the others in the series.  The epic story telling, and technological imagination keep me coming back in  spite of what I see as minor writing flaws.  The author spends to much time explaining things that happened in the past, and some of the dialog is a bit wooden.All in all though it is a enjoyable read as I don't think I have ever read a series that did such a good job of combining massive star empires with individual character plot lines.  It is exactly the scale and depth that I like to read, and I will continue to read every new installment.
summary: An Excellent Addition to an Excellent Series

reviewText: Great book! Definitely gets my recommendation. For those that are not familiar with Support and Resistance, this book is a perfect read...and learning this will definitely help you in your trading life.Support and Resistance is technical, but is one of the most used concepts in training, and with the info presented here, along with the graphs, you will have a full understanding once you've read this....and how to implement it into your trading (including how to use support & resistance to cut losses). Kenneth Walker has written a very detailed (without being wordy) explanation!Keeper!

In my little world, it is simply the 'ceiling' and the 'floor'.  Support and Resistance is a very helpful tool traders should utilize. This author, Kenneth, has my vote!  I am big on graphs, being a visual person, and the illustrations are extremely helpful. I enjoyed this eBook and feel confident about having this in my library.  I personally am a fan of Spread and Barriers.  I recently learned more about the Bollinger Bands and knowing that S&R can be used along side of it, SMA's and Fractals made me even more elated! I like that one can utilize many options of trading and investing and spread them out over many different options. Utilizing S&R gives you the same flexibility. I have been looking at adding the Bollinger Band strategy to my arsenal of options, taking S&R and adding it to the other options I am interested in is also amazing. Instead of placing a stop loss to early and yes, you can gain a few extra dollars if it rises a bit, but going up higher (if you have the funds and ability to loose it) assist in extra profits. Patience and discipline is very important in trading. Not to get emotion in trading is important as well. Therefore, observe initially before you get involved, utilizing S&R, with a spread of other options. Apply your breaking and stopping points near the ceiling and floor instead of in the middle and have patience. Then collect even more than you expect. The down side is the unforeseeable events externally with a Trade or Company, etc. The market can be predicable and unpredictable. You can loose more than expected as well. So know your investments!  Good book, I enjoyed it.
Aaawwwwwesommme! I love the way Latrivia get in her Medlov zone! Dmitry is the Echelon of  Alpha Male character genius!!!!!

Dmitry, Dmitry, Dmitry. This is the first time I have read a book about Dmitry, and didn't quite feel like I was getting the real Dmitry. I know it's hard to talk about real anything when speaking about a fictional character, but I think that this author has historically done such a good job of building out this character that her readers feel like he is a living, breathing, man. Unfortunatley in this volume, he comes off as a weak and naive man, which is very different than the smart, strong, intellgent Dmitry that we are all so used to. In fact, this felt more like an ode to the madness of Ivan, than to the strength of Dmitry. Perhaps that was this author's intention, and if it was, kudos. Once again, Ivan gets away with the most despicable things, right under Dmitry's nose. But it wasn't just Ivan, it was Elsa also. I suppose no one is perfect and this could be the set up for Dmitry to fully become the Boss that we all know he really is. Perhaps this is where he begins to distrust the love that blinds him to the misdeeds of his brother and his lover, and makes him into a true Czar? We will see. I'm looking forward to the next volume, and to the re-emergence of the real Dmitry.

Helios and MJ book is extremely well written.  It is full of pathos, jealousy and secrets.  It is a romantic tale of of a young woman's love for a man she considers a Greek God who owns a motorcycle club. This young man loves her too, but because of a vile act of repudiation in his past, he does not acknowledge that love and can not understand why he is so jealous and emotional when MJ talks to other men. He humiliates her and cuts her heart to pieces.  This book does not end here, it has a cliffhanger. Hopefully we will read the ending in the next book and not five books down the line. Saying that, buy the book and enjoy it.
summary: The Art of Shattering Your True Love's Heart

reviewText: I would have given a higher rating. However, I had found so many spelling errors and many other issues that took alot of pleasure from it. Looking forward to Linc and cassie's story.

4 1/2 stars! So I have to admit, I am a sucker for a fairy tale retelling. Especially when it is twisted into something original. This is a really fun version involving Sleeping Beauty. I enjoyed seeing the two girls adapt (and grow) in their new settings. I loved that they took charge of their own destiny and didn’t wait for things to happen to them. I loved that Jenny came from a functional (yet crazy) family and that both girls had a support system within their family. It was also a cause of angst for me as the story progressed, but (no spoilers) it was resolved nicely.The bad guy is sneaky and scary. I ended up staying up way too late reading this book because I just had to know ‘what happens next.’ And the cute guys and the kissing were a nice bonus :).If you love fairy tales, magic, cool girls that can wield swords and adventure, this is a book for you.
summary: Fun fairy tale retelling with a twist!

reviewText: This book connects the first book with what I hope will be another great one. Excellent writing style, attention holder and don't put it down till you're done kind of book.
I'm dying for the next novel to come out, and this just intensified the longing. Such a great tease in the countdown to October!

It has been a while since I read Timebound so I was trying remember what happened. This book was as enjoyable as the first. I do hope that there will be another book. I love the characters and what they need to do to be together. I highly recommend this book to all readers. I will keep my eyes open for a following book.

A sweet story with a wonderful happily ever after.It's been two years since the death of Laurent Fletcher's wife, Brooke.  The kids are out of control and he doesn't know what to do with them anymore.Emma Peabody, has come all the way from England to be a nanny for Jerome and Evie.  Leaving a painful past behind her, she decides to make a new life in Montana with this family.Emma and Laurent become drawn to each other but their memories are still so vivid in their minds.  Laurent doesn't think he could ever love anyone again.  Putting the memories of the past is always difficult, but they just might find a way to be together.
summary: The Unexpected Bride (Montana Born Brides) by Joanne Walsh

reviewText: I have recently gotten into affiliate marketing, and have been researching the topic non stop. I came across this book and what I liked most about it is there is no filler. It`s straight forward, informative and very helpful. The chapter how to jump start you marketing career was very helpful as well. A great read for anyone looking to get into any kind of marketing.

Anna and the Magic Paintbrush is a lovely children's story that also teaches kiddos the meaning of kindness. I was provided a complimentary Kindle copy in exchange for review, to read with our 8 year old daughter. She enjoyed the storyline and illustrations, and needed help with a few words, as this is more challenging than I anticipated! Here is a little snippet review from Lydia Mae! "I like when Anna shared the water with the old man. I like the grandmother's present of flowers because they are pretty. And Anna's friend is cool because he looks like one of my friends!" And that is another Mommy Daughter Tag Team Review!
summary: Lovely Children's Story That Teaches Kindness

reviewText: I've been reading a few of these Motorcycle Club romances and it is clear that Ms. Isan knows the genre well. I was drawn into Cassie and Logan's story and was rooting for them and their intesnse story the whole time. I will be looking forward to the sequel!

I read a lot of westerns and western romance because, let’s face it, who doesn’t want to escape the strange and insane world we have now. Who doesn’t want to escape to a simpler time or place? The Christian romance category is listed just beneath the westerns and since I’ve always been fascinated by Amish culture, I thought I would give it a try. All I can say is, WOW! I’m now an Amish fiction fan and more importantly, a Ruth Price fan. This was the first Ruth Price novel I’ve read and I truly enjoyed every word. I love the honesty and simplicity of Amish culture and I loved the way the author crafted the story. The story and characters seemed very real.I’ll bet that somewhere in Pennsylvania or Indiana or Ohio there are young Amish people going through the same emotional turmoil as the two main characters, Katie and Zach. The temptations of the modern world spinning by can test an Amish man or woman’s character and beliefs. At the heart of this wonderful story is the romance between Katie and Zach but the story is much more than a romance. There are twists and turns and surprises and suspense to keep you turning pages. I’m so glad I read this wonderful book.Escape the rat-race of today’s world for a time and step into a simpler way of life. Step into the sweet world of Faith’s Landing.
summary: A wonderful mix of Amish culture, romance and suspense

reviewText: All this time I was fighting devils I didn't know, it turns out that I invited them into my living room and didn't know it"...A slower read from part 1&2 but still good.

Mine to Spell is a fantastic follow-up to You Are Mine, in which Cynthia, Serena's sister, finds her own way to rebel against a misogynistic society.The negatives:Not exactly what I expected from the blurb.The synopsis makes it sound like this book is all about how Cynthia makes this big sacrifice and allows herself to be sold and then somehow finds love and freedom because of that decision. Well, that's all kind of true, but Cynthia being sold is only the focus of the very beginning of the book. And she certainly doesn't gain anything from that decision - at least not directly. Most of the book is actually about how Cynthia is a woman who is actually able to perform magic (something that their society has always insisted is impossible) and how she goes about proving to herself and the world that women are just as capable and worthy of magic as men are.What I loved:The worldbuilding.Once again, Falor does an excellent job of portraying a miserable society in which women are considered nothing more than property (or breeders). We also got to learn more about the people who are fighting to change that!Cynthia.I really enjoyed Cynthia as a main character. In fact, I think I enjoyed her point of view the most out of this series so far. Cynthia has spent her life pretending - pretending to be a sweet, brainless girl who wants nothing more than a handsome warlock to take care of her, while she's really secretly been suffocating. Her one joy has been learning magic. I thought that Cynthia had a realistic mixture of strength and self-doubt. She really wanted to do what was best for her family and for herself, but she didn't always know what that was. I loved that she wanted to be a role model for her little sisters and show them everything that they could be.Lukas.I loved Lukas, the gentle stranger who comes into Cynthia's life and helps her to come into her own. He was Cynthia's protector, but he also encouraged her to be brave herself and to not let go of the ideals she was fighting for. As Lukas and Cynthia grew closer and sparks started to fly between them, I found myself loving their romance!The magic.We really got to see more of the magic of this world in this book, which I was so excited about! Not only did we see the hexes and the defensive spells, but we also got to see a fun and beautiful side to the women's magic. There was plenty of magical action in this book as well!If you're a fan of YA fantasy, you should definitely check out this series! I can't wait to see what Falor has in store for us next (actually, check out my interview below for some hints!). I give this book 4.5/5 stars.***Disclosure: This book was provided to me by the author in exchange for an honest review. No other compensation was given. All opinions are my own***
summary: Another great book in this series!

reviewText: The Mine series is set in Chardonia – a place where women are possessions and male warlocks use hexes, spells, and the threat of being tarnished (magically made to be bald, tattooed, and unable to have children) to keep them under their thumbs. In the prequel to the series, Mine To Tarnish, Katherine refuses to be owned and finds herself among the tarnished. In book one, You Are Mine, Serena realizes what it means to be free and finds freedom within her grasp. In Mine To Spell, Cynthia (Serena’s sister) has reached the age in which society dictates she be sold to a new owner – one who will only value her for the magic contained in her blood.Everyone in Chardonia knows that only male warlocks can do magic and the magic in women only exist to be taken by men to increase their own powers. But everyone is wrong and Cynthia refuses to let her magic be taken. She sets out to prove that women are not merely possessions and that they are as capable as any man – even if she has to become a martyr to do so.A budding female equality movement set in a background of magic and romance makes me really love the Mine series more and more with each book. I love to cheer on each female protagonist as they pave new roads in the quest for recognition as people and not things. I also really like that romance and independence are not pitted against each other. Cynthia could find love and be her own person at the same time; loving a man didn’t make her any less of a strong, independent woman. Another trait of hers that didn’t make her any less in my eyes was her insecurity. That Cynthia was insecure, scared, and unsure as she set out to change history, and yet still refused to back down made her someone to be admired even more. She knew that she wasn’t just doing this for herself; she was setting a precedent for females all over Chardonia.I love this series and I can’t recommend it highly enough. Beautiful writing flows into beautifully told stories of women finding their own power in the face of oppression. Lovers of women’s fiction, romance, and fantasy will all find something to like here.*I received an ARC of this book to review.You can find this review and others like it at BookAndCoffeeAddict.com, along with recommendations for a fantastic cup of coffee.
summary: Lovers of women’s fiction, romance, and fantasy will all find something to like here.

I'm convinced that Gloria Daniels is actually a garden fairy. She must be, for her gardening books are fabulous and open up so many possibilities even to someone like me who's never had much of a green thumb, something that I am delighted to change. This book has given me a lot of ideas, and I just love the concept of small container sized micro-gardens. If you are new to gardening or want to expand your repertoire, this book is right for you!

I felt compelled to read this novelette. I am a lover of history but know little about the period around the late 18th century and in particular,1798 and the Irish conflict. Whilst I feel for the Irish, D Cook's portrayal opened my eyes to the problems that they and the British encountered. This is a gritty historical novel and I wish it had been longer.The author's use of language and exquisite dialogue held me from the first page through to the last. His use of period language and descriptive prowess just goes to prove to me that there are some brilliant, as yet, widely unknown historical writers, who are more than ready to enter the international stage - David Cook is definitely one of one

This is great collaboration of family style recipes. The author shares some great recipe that you can share with your family, whether it be big or small. My favorite ones so far would be the "cowboy supper" and the "crunchy tortilla chicken". Great recipes that are easy to follow. Good buy!

The Right Bitch Trio is a series of three connected short stories about the dogs who, together with their handlers,  help protect their humans from magic smugglers.There is a sense of more happening (why are people attempting to smuggle magic, for instance?) but this is a dogs-eye view. The dogs don't care about the greater political scene and this is how it should be. Their job is to sniff out illegal magic and their concern is doing it well.Shiba (the bitch in question) has to first train her new handler, Tallon, who just doesn't understand. Then she has to cope with Sabre, a male dog, with whom we sense a romantic interest. And, in the final story, puppies.A quick read, good fun and an excellent sense of a dog's world. Well worth a little kennel time.

As the story progresses the man discovers who he really is and what he really wants out of life. I am at a loss for words.  This book is powerful and dark and honest, and hot and .... see I can not even put together a coherent sentence to fully encapsulate all that makes this book amazing.  Lydia's life is nothing like she thought it would be.  The person who was supposed to love and take care of her did anything but.  While she has someone occupying her bed nightly, she is completely alone.  Can she be stronger than the alcohol and sex addiction that rule her life?  Her new neighbor Aidan thinks so, but is she ready?  Such a powerful, powerful book.  It is clear that the author did a ton of research and yet I never once felt preached to.  I simply was sucked into Lydia's world and found myself cheering her on, crying with her, and at times wanting to shake sense into her. This is the first book I have read by this author and I feel like kicking myself for not having read her books earlier.*This is a complete story.  There is no cliffhanger or any dangling loose ends that make you want to scream.
I read this with dread and anticipation at the same time. It's not long enough. I need a novel, not a novella! I'm looking forward to reading more!

It has taught me how to look at things from the other persons point of view which will definitely make me more understanding in the future! I would recommend this book to people who suffer from Jealousy, and also people on the receiving end of Jealousy! Great Book, thank you!
