I LOVE this book so much SE Hall andAngela Graham are freaking AWESOME such a great sexy read #oneclicknow

“You are my world Caro. And you’re MINE”- SebastianFirst let me just say that this is my first book about forbidden love and about older woman and younger man and I was a little hesitant going into it because of a huge age gap. This book had been on my TBR for so long and when I got to know that the author will release a bundle of this series which include a bonus chapters and epilogue  I just dive in reading it. And WOW! I’m hooked…..it’s simply CAPTIVATING.I gottta say that I had a hard time reading the first part of this book because my HEART is beating so fast with every scene. Every single thing between them is forbidden and dangerous and I always held my breath when I thought they were going to get caught.“Everything had a price; every glance, every kiss, every stolen touch…”I really adore Sebastian and Caroline’s love. It’s not all about physical connection BUT it’s all about what they saw in each other that made their life complete. They both longed for love and found it with each other. Their journey had been a tough one; there had been a lot of factors that always made them pull apart and some life circumstances that is unexpectedly happened.I have to say that I’m madly l in love with Sebastian because of how intense his love for Caro it….he’s a young guy but at some point he’s been actually the adult making the best decisions with their relationship. He’s the sweetest, kind, loving guy I ever know even if he’s life and parents sucks.The writing style of the author is AMAZING. She made me FEEL every emotion that just made me wrapped up into the story. The fear, worries, uncertainty, jealousy and possessiveness is too much to bear while reading it. It’s making me freak out sometimes.I actually cried at the end of the first part and at the middle part of the part two because of some intense moments that broke my heart. I didn’t see it coming how painful this book could be.And what I really love about this book bundle is the added EPILOGUE and bonus chapters. I don’t want to say more about it but I assure you that you’ll love it so much.Over all this book simply PHENOMENAL. The angst, romance, heart ache is all worth it. I love the writing style of the author and I love Sebastian and Caroline get the happy ever after they deserved.

This book cover is fairly dull but on the other hand you will notice that it is not over the edge a good way to describe it with one word is simplistic. There is a good reason for the choice of this cover I believe after reading this, the book itself very much resembles the cover while giving accredited and useful tips and insights to give you the one up you are looking for. The author does a great job at keeping the book in a simple readable form that anyone can refer to. I used to think I had to be a marketing genius to sell my books after publishing 6 books of my own. I can see where I could use some improvement in several different areas thanks to this book I am looking forward to writing in the near future and using this tips as well as improving what I already have to see if I can improve my number of readers as well.
summary: Perfect cover for this book and there is a reason for it.

Ok, so I got this box set for 99 cents which is an automatic bonus as far as I am concerned.The first book in the set is Him as told from Sarah's POV. It is about Sarah's feelings for Will (a.k.a. Him). I feel like this book kind of sets the backstory for the next book in the set (Her). It is good but rated almost PG-13...meaning the sex scenes aren't super graphic which makes sense because they are young in most of the sexual encounters in this book. This book goes back and forth from past and present, all from Sarah's POV.  This book was a little slow for me, although I am not entirely sure why.The second book in the set is Her as told from Will's POV. Although there are some scenes that are reiterated, it's not a complete re-tell of book one. And, the sex scenes are a bit more steamy and definitely move out of the PG-13 range. I LOVED this book, finished it in one day. It seemed to move quicker because all the backstory was given in book one. While book one alternated between past and present, this book started at the "beginning" and only moved forward. Also, there is additional present day story in this book that was not in book one!  Hooray!  There is no epilogue though.  Maybe we will get some of that in Sawyer Says (the spin off book)!!

reviewerName: susanne leist, author of The Dead Game
reviewText: I haven't read such a delightful love story in years. It takes place during a dark time in our history--the stock market crash of 1929. The main characters, Rose and Charlie, having lost their fathers because of the crash, must work hard to help their families during the difficult time.They meet and both of their lives are turned around. Charlie, who once was a famous artist in Manhattan, sells his paintings on the boardwalk. Rose, who comes from a wealthy family in Manhattan, cleans at a hotel. They meet on the boardwalk in Wildwood, New Jersey. Charlie is immediately drawn to her.They form a partnership, where Charlie's paintings are sold at Rose's house, which has become an art gallery. They make money not only for themselves but for the whole community.Charlie finds that he has to make a tough decision--whether to stay with Rose in New Jersey or take the new job offer from an art gallery in Manhattan.I recommend reading the book to see what happens.
As well intentioned as this book might be,it contains very little news as to the treatment of diabetes.Thank You for your efforts but give us a little more next time,Jay.
I THINK I AM REALLY GOING TO ENJOY THIS NEW SERIES BY CINDY BELL. IT WILL BE INTERESTING TO SEE WHO SHE DEVELOPS HER NEW CHARACTERS. ALL OF HER BOOKS HAVE BEEN VERY ENJOYABLE.

4.5 stars!Daisy and Daltrey were neighbors. Bonding as two 5 yr old kids who lost their moms. They were each other's best friends, each other's everything. Until Daltrey left their senior year of high school to pursue his dream of a rock band with his brothers. Daisy was happy for them. So happy she went along on tour at first to help them get their get break. And when they did, she had to return to school.Things happened while Daltrey was gone. Things Daisy can't even think of without having a panic attack. She hasn't spoken to Daltrey in a year. She can't think of him without having a panic attack.Daisy meets Paige and Karen, fellow freshman who won't take no for answer when it comes to friendship. They talk Daisy into going on a Ransom tour road trip. Thinking she can handle this, she contacts Daltrey to let him know she's coming.Daltrey is trying not to get his hopes up. What happened that she cut of all contact a year ago? Was she mad at him?I really loved this book! I loved the relationship between Daisy and Daltrey and the sweet, innocent flashbacks they both had of when they were young. The author wrote about Daisy's struggles as she over comes her fears and faces her past. There wasn't much written of the relationship between Daisy and Daltrey. Just a lot of shoulda, woulda, couldas of their relationship.I loved the characters! I laughed with Paige and Karen. Especially the part on the road trip with the talk list. I would've loved to have been in that car! And I cried with Daisy and Daltrey. Especially with what he tells her at the end. *swoon*I would've liked to have read more about the aftermath of Daltrey's trip to Ohio. There were snippets in the Epilogue which satisfied my curiosity and I was able to fill in the blanks. I hope the next book focuses more on their relationship and how they are as a couple.***I received a copy of this book from NetGalley in exchange for an honest review***

This is a self help book about achieving your life dreams using a very well written our system.  I found step by step tasks to help be design and plan achievement for my life goals.  I like books that clearly give me action plans rather than theories to us to figure it out, so this was a great read for me.  The book is full of techniques, like the Think and Rest technique, which is backed by research and I found very interesting.  The author includes engaging stories and anecdotes to keep the reader engaged in each section.  Several times the unique analogy of a video game was given for life itself.  Our lives are like video games in which we have accomplishments level by level and without the adrenaline to get to a level, it's hard to have any passion for life.
summary: Very well written with a checklist of activities

I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for an honest review and I am really glad I did because this book was a fun fantasy Gem. This book was a long journey and at times I would have to admit it was a bit slow but I pressed on and I'm very glad I did because it was worth all the description and world building because it all came together in the final half with not just one epic battle but a few and it laid the framework for an epic series.When Arima learned of her fate and set off on her journey I was worried she would be alone but along came the stoic and handsome Blythe and to top it off he is a vampire with a crazy past that brought him to Lady Spirit. Not only does she have Blythe but she has her Unicorn as well so I guess she was never really alone but even with the bond she shared with her Unicorn it was nice for her to have other people to talk to and to protect her from all the evil that surrounded her, and she also meets some vey interesting allies and enemies along her way and I really enjoyed the lore on each one, it was fun to see how many of the creatures were familiar but had such a new and interesting take on them.I wish there had been more on the other Ladies but I know that is yet to come but I really want to know who they are and how they will find each other and how each one will contribute to the upcoming war.There were many spelling mistakes and they threw me off a lot, in a book this intense that requires full focus I was bummed that there were so many scattered through out the book.I think this is an excellent start to an epic fantasy series, the world is beautiful and the characters are enchanting and love able, for all those who love a great fantasy read this book is for them.

The drama in this book will keep you reading but there were confusion on who was speaking a lot of times through the book. However, I have to recommend this book because, as I've stated, the drama alone will draw you in. Congratulations Tanya!
Laszlo does another fine job with character development.  My only con to this book is that it seems he rushed through the ending.

I do not experience hip pain but I have a relative who is very close to me that has this problem. She has arthritis . I wanted to help because I couldn't watch her suffer. After reading the book I came to the conclusion , the best exercise  for her was the foam roller to loosen her hips. I also showed her the YouTube video for a demonstration. Thank you for this much needed remedy to help with her pain.

For a writer-to-be like me, this book is both a guide and a source of inspiration. The step by step guide on formatting is clear enough but the best part we can download free templates from Derek's DIY book formats webpage. Did I mention that we can get free professional-looking covers as well? The inspiration comes from the many quotes sprinkled throughout the book. It is a great feeling to know that others have gone down this path and we are not alone. Not every quote is going to stir you up or touch our soul because that depends on our state of mind at any given time.A word for those who didn't like EVERY part of the book: What do you expect? A custom-made book just for you? Go write your own biography.
summary: A must-read for any inspiring writer-to-be

reviewText: A great thing about this book is how much is covered succinctly. The quotes between sections helps break up the information into manageable pieces. I particularly liked the self-editing tips—some I’d never thought of before, and the ideas about promotional giveaways and how to increase your newsletter subscribers. And, of course, the big notion that you can do a lot, maybe even everything, without spending any money, or very, very little. But it’s all good. Highly recommended.

The plot is a little more complicated in this last book of the series.  There is a lot going on and I was baffled to who the attacker could be.  Again like in the other books there was a part that I laughed so hard that tears were rolling down my face.  The mystery of the Bled sisters and Mercy's parents continues and keeps getting better.  I was expecting the ending with the art collection and what the plot for the next book will be.  I can't wait!  It's a subject that is interesting and hope has a lot of accurate history research.  Hope we don't have to wait long.  I love this author!
summary: Can't wait for the next one!!!

reviewText: Loved getting to see what happend next with Jake and Eve, getting a feel for how Eve lived in Newport, and get to know one of her daughters more! Can't wait for the next installment!

This was exactly what I was looking for. When My father bought me the Amazon Fire TV I didn't understood very well the instructions that came with it. Then after searching for some time i found this book. I purchased it too see how much information it contains. Well, this truly gives u in-depth knowledge about your Amazon Fire TV. It's written in simple and easy to understand words which can be deciphered by anyone whether it's child/adult/old aged.

Every tale makes me fall in love with the original versions over and over again! These authors did an Excellent job retelling them with an Adult spin. I can not even tell you which one is my favorite because they are all superbly written. Read them all and enjoy!
summary: Written for the Adult Fairy Tales lover

reviewText: I really had to think about my old pets whose behavior I once thought were impossible to manage. My heart goes out to them, and other owners who wish to have the best relationship with their pets -- They really are a reflection of your direct efforts. And there's a deeper psychology to consider so that your dog is the best it can be. I'm glad there's a studied science for it, and it's all included in this book. It details -everything- you need to train your dog, and a great section for home training. Understand the meaning / problem / need behind every behavior, so that you know exactly how to emotionally react and how to manage your pet. You can develop trust this way, and you'll have a better experience as a result! Great investment if you plan on seriously having a dog!
summary: In-Depth Dog Training Methods by Joseph Moore

reviewText: This read was like the best box of mixed chocolate ever. There was sweet and spicy and super hot all over. If you're  looking for a few short new reads that will make your blood hum and your breath catch, then this is for you. I'm happy to have found great new authors and exciting new series to boot.Bravo...alphas have never been this hot!

This is the boxed set to have and I guarantee you will love all their stories... these are authors who know how to grab you from the first page till the last,, no skipping any boring parts and they don't have any.... I have read well over a hundred books in the last year, probably twice that,, and a lot from these authors so this set is the icing on my cake to have so many of them in ONE boxed set for so little money... what a bargain, best authors, best stories, best price,,, this is a win win boxed set... outfnstanding!

reviewText: This is a quick read book, I did not want to put it down, it is a page turner. I thought he was an ass and he was but for a good reason ( only to himself)

Coming from a southeast asian family (non-chinese), I originally thought it’s just that mirror thing people put above doors. After reading this book, Feng Shui is more than just that; it’s a way to maintain your home so clean and clutter-free. If this was a religion, it would be one of the more practical ones (and less violent too!). Works great in the home AND office, as the book covers both. For those who believe believe in superstition, or even those who want to keep a good looking house or office, get this one
summary: More than just that octagon mirror.

reviewText: I don't like sequels.  I almost never read them.  I did not want to read this one, and I put it off for weeks.  At Any Price was the best ebook I've read this year, and I didn't want the story to be dragged out and potentially ruined.  I loved it how it was, and wanted that to be the end.  But it wasn't, so I finally made myself read the follow up.  I was slightly intrigued with getting to read Adam's POV, and I really liked getting inside his head.  I'm happy to say I came out of this still loving his character, though he was far from perfect.  Mia, however, was less likable.  The way she kept something so big from Adam made no sense.  The constant back and forth between Mia and Adam became frustrating.  I hate when characters don't talk to each other.  I hate even more when characters don't talk because some perfectly timed contrivance gets in the way.  That happened way too many times in this book. But, in spite of that, I enjoyed the story.  It wasn't a chore to read like I thought it might be, considering my initial resistance.  Every time I put my Kindle down to attend to real life stuff, I would think of it at some point and look forward to when I could start reading again.  I'm still invested in these characters and their story, and I will read the next book when it comes out.  I still don't like sequels, but this one is an exception for me.

I read a lot of books, and I have to say this is one if my favorites, the dialogues are so funny and the chemistry Mac and J share is wonderful to read and sexy.  I look forward to reading more books by this author.  You should defiantly give this book a chance and will not be disappointed and will need to give yourselves enough time to read as you will not to put the book down.

PI Mackenzie Williams is a funny , witty and well rounded man ... The onlky problem is the capacity to do the smart thing and to believe in forever.His newest client is everything he’s looking for in a guy. Jordan Channing is charming, beautiful, intelligent, and successful. There's only one problemn... Jordan is not exactly gay.Mackenzie and Jordan start forming a friendship but Mac feels Jordan will never want nothing more.Jordan is for the first time in his life ... Confused but he has to admit , he is attracted  another man.Jordan will have to decide what he wants ... Mackenzie has to decide to let himself love and be love.The story is really well written , I won't denied at some point I was conflicted but also I really enjoyed the book.I look forward to more from this author. It is a great debut.

The Tinnitus relief tips listed here are super helpful. I've had Tinnitus for over 10 years since working in the music industry -- in part, caused by stress, TMJ, caffeine and depression. All of which are listed as main causes. There are several possible reasons and it's wise to study further if you feel that you're starting to go through the ringing. My best advice is to reduce as much stressful factors from your life and body as much as possible. There is more detailed science in the book which I highly recommend for your research.
summary: Best way to go is prevention

reviewText: Sloan is living a perfect life, but she gradually comes to realize that she is living to please her husband, her mother and even her friends. When she learns an unpleasant truth about her husband, she has to face reality and go back to her roots. This is a beautifully sensitive romance, well written and thoroughly enjoyable. I will look for more from this author.

This book was one of the better books on the topic of natural cures. This day and age it is important to remain healthy and avoid over medicating ourselves. Some of the medicines we talk now have worse side effects than the actual Illness we are trying to treat. This book was very thorough and had tons and tons of Herbal remedies. More than the average book on the topic I buy on Amazon. This book is a super recommend if you are looking for a natural way to heal yourself.

The ancient Greeks are the ones who came up with the word 'meteorology' - study of the atmosphere. Leonardo daVinci invented the hygrometer to measure humidity, Galileo Galilei was the one who invented the thermometer and Evangelista Torricella invented the barometer. Learn more about the above instruments plus many more in their individualized, dedicated sections.What can crickets tell us about the temperature? Find out here!Want to make your own weather instruments? The author includes brief instructions on how.This book, for older children, is well written and a great educational resource. There is also a FREE downloadable word search at the end of the book. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
summary: Learn about the barometer, thermometer, hygrometer and more....

reviewText: WOW!  I am so incredibly happy that I found the Destined Series.  The book set is now in my list of favorites.  The writing Ashley Suzanne has done is fulfilling.  She has created the characters with such depth and feeling, you can only fall in love with each one of them.I was very surprised when I came upon the first "twist".  I was eager to continue reading the series.  Her writing style grabs you into the book to live in its world.Thank you for writing this series.  I also want to thank you for having appropriate pricing on your ebooks as well as having them available for Amazon Prime rentals.  You have a fan for life. I look forward to your future work.
summary: Destined Series, a must read for romance readers!

reviewText: this is a good series to read, you have to watch to see he is talking because they say the same thing with a twist and that can make you thing you need to re-read. My heart really broke for Danny, but I get that she loved Skylar. We all need a bestie like she had and I would take a shot with them. It was a little odd with the dream from the coma, but over all a great read.

Nobody does taboo goodness quite like Ms. Zara! I enjoyed this story of a naughty brat getting what she deserves (and craves!) at the hands of two hot men. Menage is pretty rare in works like this, and it's even more rare to have it written this well. Michael and Kevin are total studs. It was delight to watch them take their place as men of the house in this smoking hot story.Five flaming stars for this wicked little short! Definitely don't miss it if you like your stories intense with plenty of steam.
The first 2 were great, then the stories fit predictable and slow. If it's a great deal pick it up.

I LOVE this series.  For any Tamora Pierce fans (as I totally am)  I highly recommend Terah Edun  who has spun a tale of intrigue and romance in a magical world of epic proportions.  Her characters are so well developed and her high pace tale contains so many twists and turns that I have read all 5 books in as many days and am only disappointed by the fact that I have to wait for the summer to get my hands on the sixth book.  If you like books set in the times so well described by Ms. Pierce, you will love this one.  It is a more 'mature' setting in that this does not start with young children rather with mid to late teen heroes.  This is such a fun story and so well written that I couldn't possibly give it anything less than 5 stars.
summary: Courtligh Series by Terah Edun is a WINNER!!!

reviewText: I liked this one he finds true love after he is in a marriage and a family how they fight their own true feelings for the sake of what's right
she did it again!!! Tallulah rocked out another amazing book!! And boy is it a hot one.  Enjoy everyone. You will definitely have a book hangover!!THANKS TAYLAH!!!!

This book was truly heart wrenching, deep for me. Avery and Nate were an awesome couple.  What an uphill battle for them.  Poor Avery and her  brother so much unanswered questions for so many years.  So much raw emotion.  This was truly a great book.  Another great story for Bella Jewel.

The setup is not new. Rich guy with weird dad needs to marry or he'll lose her inheritance. Girl is desperate for money. They meet, hit it off, and the temperature rises after that. This novellette delivers the goods, steamy and sweet by turns.

This series has been so in depth and gripping that I wasn't sure how in the world the author was going to tie everything together, but she did it with amazing results! It's hard to say too much because it is one of those series that has tons of parts and spoilers but I can say that it is the best paranormal series I have read, ever. There is no lag time, it picks right up where the last book left off and propels you forward into Maryah and Nathan's story. Maryah has no idea to trust, a huge decision that she can't remember why she made, and a fight against an enemy that she can't remember. This book left me breathless and with a deep sense of what family truly means. I highly recommend it and really hope Hollywood picks up on how fantastic this is.

I absolutely loved this story and I need more of the kinderly saga. Please, please, please give us more of Maryah and Nathanial's love affair.  A short story of their honeymoon would be a great place to start.

It's a cute series.. I liked the concept, and the characters.. I loved M & N.. The ending was jammed packed and I felt very satisfied. I lucked out that I was able to buy all 3 at once, so no annoying cliffhanger, lol.. I'm going to say this about all 3 books - great beach/vacation/travel ride books.. If you need something for the beach, pool, plane, train, car, etc, totally get theses. It's worth it!
The book itself was really good and had you hooked from the beginning. But I have a problem with so many authors making one book into a series just to make more money.

I love Olivia! She is committed and ready to whatever it takes. Heartbreaking, because she really has no choice when it comes to Bash. Emotional? Don't ask. So good. Can't wait for the next one! Comes out in less than three weeks! Yay!!!

Bash's life is a mess, and all thanks to Olivia. Bash is ready to walk away from Olivia but when he see's her he knows he can't. Now Olivia needs to find a way to make things right for Bash. Things get worse for the McDaniel's, and Bash thinks he has a way out.Hot Steamy scenes. Cliffhanger ending.

The story is about a man named Reggie who is sitting and armed, waiting for his zombie daughter Elissa to come out of a closet.  But what's riveting about the story are the descriptions, how Reggie struggles to do what he knows he ought to do.  The final scene is also compelling in showing Reggie succumb to fate, yearning for it to end.Overall, this was a quick read that was gripping and well written.  I highly recommend it.
The heroine had lots to do...gather flowers for friends, customers and a wedding. Plus solve a couple of mysteries along the way. Busy, busy, busy.
This is a great book for anyone who likes mystery mixed with romance and humor. Overall I liked the book a lot.
Loved book 1 and couldn't wait to read this one. Fun characters and almost  reminded me of the Trenton NJ gang that Janet Evanovich has withStephanie Plum if they were Mormon & live in Utah.
Every part keeps you on your toes to read more. Should go back & get book 1. Might be better to read in order.

This is no where near what I thought this was going to be.When I think of vampire books, I think of hot sexy men, lots of blood lust etc. This did have a hot sexy male but it also had a food fight club. I kid you not....a food fight club. Where people pay money to have food fights. Granted we are talking about New Orleans where anything goes but come on...really?This book could have gone so much farther. It's one saving grace was it was multi pov. It was a super short read and I finished in only a few hours.Now here is the funny thing...I'm curious to see where this series goes, so I'll be reading the next one I'm sure.

reviewText: great set of books.

Girls, hold on to your skirts and thongs! Xavier is in town and will power took a powder.This character is absolutely determined NEVER to fall for a woman and become so whipped that he loses his identity. Women swoon for him. Men find him a good buddy but are leary of his effect on their girlfriends. In Xavier's mind, falling in love would make him ... no other way to say but just come out with it... "pussy-whipped". He is controversial, cocky, domineering, stubborn, foul-mouthed... but in the end, he possesses and gentle heart for those he loves. Like all our Men of Steel, he is loyal to the death.Xavier is the most rebellious of the Men of Steel. Being the youngest, he has been able to experience first hand all the mistakes his brothers have made. Although he loves his family deeply, he wants to go his own way and build his future by his own smarts and means.This book is the masterpiece of MJ Fields who has brought us so much love and bad boys in the past. It does not disappoint. It is well written in the slang of the Jersey shore, with strong characters and delightful scenes not to be forgotten. Loved this book! Cannot wait to see what MJ writes next....
summary: Girls, hold on to your skirts and thongs!

reviewText: WOW!!!! What can you say about those "STEEL" MEN  Loved the complete seriesThey are the sexiest men ever...

Don't expect to be able to put this story down until you finish. From the first page to the last, this book was everything I've come to expect from this author: fast-paced, gruesome and intense, with some of Mr. Glaze's twisted humor thrown in for good measure. George Romero should be kicking himself for not coming up with this! Way better than Night of the Living Dead in my opinion. :-)

"Health, Wealth, and Murder: A Plain Jane Mystery" by Traci Tyne Hilton , the fourth book in this series is a five star book.Jane Adler, a house cleaning college student dreams of being a missionary someday has solved four murders but cannot get the police to take her seriously so she enrolls in some crime solving classes.Her roommate who is also her cousin goes to a meeting that a well respected and influential preacher  is preaching at and while there the preacher is murdered at this meeting!Jane is hired by Josiah Malachi's  ( the preacher) wife and personal aide to clean their house for them. But the personal aide really hires her to found out who killed him.Jane has always known that Josiah Malachi was a quack but she never really know how much of one until she starts to hunt for the murderer.Nothing is really as it seems. There is the case of the missing daughter, but is she really missing? Is the young wife in the wheelchair really a victim of polio?This mystery keep me reading till I finish the book, I just had to found out all the answers! Just when I thought I knew the answers, another murder attempt was made. Have I got you curious yet, read this book and end your curiosity!You will be surprised at the outcome! I certainly was!I have written a little review on the other three books in this series and I will repeat this series was worth my time reading and I think there are more coming! I downloaded the first book " Good, Clean Murder because it was free and I was given a ebook copy of " "Health, Wealth, and Murder:" by the  author for my honest review and I say it is "Great".  I am eagerly awaiting the next book in this series!I want to know if Jane ever gets her detective license and if she ever becomes a missionary!
summary: Is things ever what they seem

GO get Storm and read it NOW!!!!! Then Firece caz Scott and Harlow's story is an absolute MUST!!!!I loved the Scott and Harlow scenes, I cannot wait to read more on them I think there is more to be told.There are some spicy sexy scenes in this story, that pack a punch.Again another commendation for the writers style of writing Brilliant!!!!All up another great read from Nina Levine definitely on my automatic buy list, and I can not wait for Nash's story next
Amazing Book By an a amazing author one of my favorites. This book is a must read you will not be disappointed.

I read the 1st installment in Bend and was pleased to here that the 2nd was released that same day! Very Unique story,we all know that a lot of books have the same story just tweaked a bit. This Is a must read but has a cliffy:/ can't wait for June 16th for #3!!!!!

This book read really fast and like a movie, when you can't believe you are already at the end, it is just that damn good!!  I need more of Red and Wolfe, their story is getting very interesting and can go oh so many ways. Red is on the island, infatuated with Wolfe and the same can be said about him.  She is in a vulnerable place and isn't sure if that is what is attracting her to him, because really he has been nothing but an ass to her.On page two you will already be fanning yourself.  Ella James wasted no time getting to the good stuff and keeps it up through out the entire book.  We are learning more about Mr. Wolfe, what he does there on the island and what he is doing to keep hidden.  Red is still a bundle of nerves and questions, not knowing what Wolfe's real motives are.We are again brought to a crescendo and are left waiting to see what is going to happen.  The series is beautifully written and sexy as hell, leaving you wanting much, much, more.
summary: Oh I Need More of These Two!

reviewText: This was an ok read.  There doesn't need to be a  sequel.  There was nothing excitable about either the H/H. Mrs. Fabriccio was the more exciting character.
I really enjoyed this story.  cant wait for part 2. hopefully it will be as enjoyable as part 1, with a happily ever after ending.

First of all I thought this was a  unbalanced story. More focus was on the female charcteer and not wnough on the male lead. After a point the female character's constant concern over her looks / worth in general became annoying. The story line was not original enough - read this story several times before (girl not good enough per clinging parent). The story would have so much better if more time was spent developing both characters and their relationship.

My CommentsI’m finally able to review the conclusion to this AMAZING series, Knight has quickly become one of my FAVE YA authors as her writing just transports me into these pages and I forget everything else around me!!  The first three chapters are INTENSE, but definitely stay true to the story and just when you think you know how the plot would progress, it all changes again….. so if you think you know how things will transpire in Balance after this incredible journey with Semara (I certainly did), you would be very, VERY wrong.  However, that only shows Knight can be true to the story AND brilliant with plot twists.  This story is not for the faint of heart (which I consider myself to be), but it IS worthwhile to courageously follow Semara and her friends as they finally win this ongoing battle.  The Rebels are coming for you, Mandesa, your time is up!Like I mentioned, the first three chapters take off just as Pendulum ended so there is no gap in time as Balance begins.  I cried a little at the sadness of this beginning, some soldiers die here, and the battle rages on.  Nothing graphic is described, but it’s tangible as Semara fights back with her fellow rebels.One of my favorite scenes happens in the beginning, the Arc leaves the ocean and goes airborne!!  In my mind, it happens in slow motion…..gradually the submarine leaves the depths of water with the awesome Raeth navigating this change!  The propeller, the engine mechanics, and all other underwater functions cease as this change occurs and as the vessel goes into the air the water and debris melt off giving it the momentum it needs to go forward.  The view changes to go in front of the ship as it travels upward and we see it pass by in the air as it engages into warfare, avoiding the blue mist/buildings/other obstacles and starts heavy fire to help Freedom escape unscathed!  This scene is over in a few seconds, but I loved it and this is what I envisioned :)Everything changes for the Triune in this book and the plot slows down while they recover.  There is less romance in this story, but I considered that a good thing because Balance is more about Semara’s relationship with Harrison than anyone else.  As much as I enjoy the romance, a girl needs her dad and this book shows their relationship improve beautifully.In the first part of the story, Ryder gets traumatized because of something he experiences and his connection with Semara literally gets put on hold.  Even though I sympathized with the guy and still believe he’s perfectly suited for her, he REALLY doesn’t get her in the first half of the book and that was a small disappointment.  There’s a huge misunderstanding between them as they both must work to overcome new issues, but I kept wondering when they would get a break as a couple.  There are also a few brief sensual scenes with them and I find myself wishing that there was a middle ground for them.  Nothing inappropriate happens, but Semara misses his touch desperately.  Just as he recuperates and things improve, he tries to win her heart once more, but will he be too late?  I do believe that Ryder makes up to Semara whatever distance settled between them, but it slows the story down.  *Come on Ryder, get it together now!!*Semara gets another huge revelation in this book, but the moment she finds out I felt like screaming at her….”STOP asking questions when you know it’s bad news!”  It’s in the past, but it throws another twist into the plot that I did NOT see coming.  There’s also a traitor (possibly more than one) among the rebels and they have to be careful until they find out who that is.  Semara does not get to use her powers for much of the book and that changes the dynamics of the story.  Also, Semara turns 18 and this changes everything (good and bad).  The brief moment with the kids was utterly sweet!Dear Semara:Please hear me out because you are such an extraordinary character and you deserve to be at peace with yourself.  You are and NEVER will be NOTHING like Mandesa!!!  After living in her evil custody for a decade (or longer), she did EVERYTHING she could to break you and turn you into her, but she couldn’t!  You are your father’s daughter and an amazing leader.  You think that everyone around you is brave and capable, but you missed one very important revelation.  You have GREATNESS within you and you’re a born leader, YOU CANNOT  FAIL.  Things happen unexpectedly and they definitely go wrong, but that’s not because of you.  The people who have died for this cause have done so willingly and their memory will be honored long after Mandesa and her tyranny have ceased.  There is evil, injustice, and unfairness in this world, but there are also leaders like yourself who will make whatever sacrifices are necessary to thwart them.  Please don’t give up hope, you deserve to be happy and free just like your friends.  I have been with you on this journey…..I have laughed with you, cried with you, and cheered you on through this.  You have inspired me and given me hope.  You have provided refuge and survived the impossible.  I have faith that you will continue to overcome and do the right thing.  I know it’s difficult figuring out who you are and where you belong with such a confusing and dysfunctional past, but I have always believed you would get it and you don’t need anyone else to be your strength.  Your instincts and your dreams are more accurate than you realize.  Keep fighting, Semara, hope is not lost and the victory is yours!!  Keep defying the dark, Semara, your readers are with you ALL the way!!My favorite characters in this book were Harrison and Dred.  Their love and support for Semara enhances the plot beautifully!  There is also more of Maggie and that kept me smiling, you just GOTTA love that woman (there’s one scene when Semara nearly knocks her over in a hug and that’s EXACTLY how I would’ve reacted)!!  Something else I loved in Balance is Penton and his “special” inventions, wow :)  Can I keep him?  Also LOOOOOVED the children’s safe place…..Wow, such a GREAT scene that I would love to learn more about if any part of this series gets extended!!  Raeth made me SOOOOO proud, I was just amazed by her character growth.  She goes from being terrified of assassins and unable to cope in so much of Escapement to bombing assassins in Balance, go Raeth!  She’s also an incredible pilot, feisty, passionate, totally in love with Penton, and no longer terrified of anything.I want to honor both minor characters and one main character who do not survive Balance.  One of these characters is Lanena, Semara’s real mom.  Lanena was murdered before the series started, but she has a very loving presence in the story that strengthens Semara in amazing ways.  Even though this is a fictional story, it became personal for me and I loved these characters.  So it’s my pleasure to honor the fallen for their sacrifice and their allegiance to Semara and the Rebellion.  The one main character was someone that loves Semara and was able to give their life helping her succeed.  I was deeply saddened with this person’s murder, but they will not be forgotten.Other scenes that stood out to me that were just amazing…..there’s a very special celebration in the story that is a “FINALLY” moment and just beautifully written, that alone is worth the price of this book!  Also sooooo enjoyed how Harrison communicates with Semara, Ryder, Raeth and Penton with his mind.  That is DEFINITELY a gift that comes in handy several times!  And there’s a moment where Semara, Raeth, and Penton get inked together (special tattoos); Ryder gets re-inked and it’s just a very special moment in the book that symbolizes they’re already a family…..such a beautifully descriptive moment!The ending of Balance gets kind of wild because it’s a total showdown with Mandesa, but it’s so worthwhile.  Another main character gets injured and it’s slightly gory.  Balance is not my favorite book in the series, but I was very satisfied with its conclusion and I felt that the violence was necessary even though some of it is sad.  It was interesting because Semara has been fighting for so long, she doesn’t consider what happens next putting a new Council together and restoring the evil Mandesa left behind.  She is finally able to move forward and it was an absolute pleasure to see that part of her life.I’m relieved to finally see the conclusion to this wonderful series, but I’m also partly sad it’s over.  Does anyone ever feel like that when they grow to love the characters and the journey you’ve been on with them ends?  If I HAD to choose a favorite in this series, it would probably be Escapement, but I connected with the series overall.  Even though each book can be read as a standalone, I highly recommend reading them in order so you can appreciate and follow along accordingly.  I didn’t give Balance five stars because of certain aspects of the story I didn’t agree with.  There is some profanity and the sensuality between Ryder and Semara was just unnecessary for my reading taste.  I’m soooo happy they’re in love, they connect with one another in profound ways, and they’re so well suited for one another…..that’s soooo great!  However, these brief scenes did not enhance the story for me.  That being said, The Neumarian Chronicles is one of my favorite YA series along with Uglies by Scott Westerfeld, Starters by Lissa Price, and Anomaly/Luminary by Krista McGee!  Semara and her friends are such great characters that are easy to relate to and root for as they overcome bombardment, misunderstandings, war, betrayal, suicide bombers, MORE assassins, treachery, the unknown, seeing innocents being murdered and enslaved, and other traps that come their way.  Yet they discover in Balance that it’s not JUST about surviving, but also not letting yourself become hardened and allowing yourself to love those around you without fear of losing them.  You have to fight for freedom, but it’s worth fighting for!!I want to thank the author and author’s assistant April for the review ecopy of Balance provided (the rest of the series I purchased).  I also want to thank April for answering my questions and discussing the book with me to help me understand and get the closure I needed for this book.  It was such a pleasure reviewing this one!  I was not required to write a positive review.  The opinions expressed are my own.
summary: Amazing Conclusion to this Epic Series, Go Semara!!!

A marriage is never truly tested until it undergoes hard times.  After Bill loses his lucrative job, suddenly his loving 10 year marriage is in danger of falling apart.  Unable to obtain a new job, in dire financial straits and almost homeless, Bill inherits some land and a house from a long-lost aunt on Mateguas Island.Linda Watkins did a really good job at setting the stage on the relationship between Bill and his wife Karen.  I felt like I was on that ferry with them as they approached the island for the first time.  She also did a good job at highlighting the differences in personalities between the adorable twins, Terri and Sophie.  The characters were well fleshed out and the settings were dynamic.  I booed at Bill for his roving eye and infidelity, but had to applaud him for his actions when he finally Manned UP and did right by his family.  And who wouldn’t want to have a sexy Dex around just for eye candy.The story starts at a decent pace but got bogged down in the middle.  Too much everyday life interspersed with the ongoing story and trying to solve the mystery of the swamp hag.  I realize drama needs to build, but it went just a tad bit too slow for my taste.  But once all the action started and Karen understood what she needed to do to save her family, the pace went pretty fast.  The parts of the story that stick out in my mind, are when Karen first discovers the magical field / swamp, Karen’s fight with the owl and Bill’s confrontation with the swamp hag.  Something I wouldn’t want to meet on a dark, stormy night, alone, unarmed.Even though I like the story, there were 2 points that niggled at the back of my mind.  One, Karen professes to love her kids and family through the entire story, but part of why they were on the island to begin with was her selfishness in not getting a job after Bill lost his.  Also, swamp land is on bottom land.  Yet the house and property were at the highest point on the island.  There was no description of how the swamp lay in regards to the house.  There was the backyard that led to the woods that led to the swamp.  Was it a hilly wooded area?  Did the backyard slope down to the woods?  Who knows?  Maybe something that could be elaborated on more in the sequel.Overall, if you like dark mysteries and family drama, this is the book for you.  I give it 4 feathers.
summary: Linda Watkins did a really good job at setting the stage on the relationship between ...

reviewText: Jane is a fortunate woman: marriage that is full of love, lovely daughters and a wonderful husband in Jacob, who sees her as more than simple chattel.  All are rare in society marriages in Regency England, and Jane is truly aware of her fortunate circumstance.  Until, that is, Jacob has a terrible accident that leaves his future in doubt, and his plans in turmoil.If Jacob were to die, the rules of inheritance state that his distasteful brother Arthur would inherit, and Jane and her daughters would be left at his mercy.  With no male child, Jane’s status would be severely reduced, or endangered should Arthur decide she would marry him.A scandalous and rather unusual solution to the situation comes to Jacob: his cousin Matthew is kind, generous and most importantly willing to help.  His rapport with the couple is much more to both their tastes, but can they manage to produce a male heir before anyone discovers this unusual arrangement?Surprisingly for a novella Viveka Portman manages to define character and voice, and add an emotional component into what could be an incredibly tricky situation.  Both thrilled and appalled at the solution, all three in this triangle are struggling with their own feelings of jealousy, envy and insecurity as the bond between Jane and Matthew grows: none more unsettled by the emotional turmoil than Jacob.  Portman has cleverly given us characters that are risking emotional pain and suffering for the best of intentions, even with deception at the heart of the arrangement.  Fast paced and tightly written, readers will be drawn into the emotions as the story progresses to reveal some very steamy moments on the way to the conclusion.  A quick and steamy read that doesn’t lose sight of the love and determination of one man to protect what he cherishes most: his family.I received an eArc copy of the title from Harlequin Escape via NetGalley for purpose of honest review. I was not compensated for this review: all conclusions are my own responsibility.
summary: Portman has cleverly given us characters that are risking emotional pain and suffering for the best of intentions

reviewText: Wow! This book does not disappoint!  It had everything!! Two very highly anticipated weddings!! That I was very happy about! A very beautiful love story between two people trying to come to terms with it. A little drama… Not a lot. This book was just right… For me anyways.Jayson & Cooper are like night & day.Jayson is a construction worker that owns his own company. Lives his life very privately and not in the open.Cooper is the drummer from Ivory Tower. He’s lived his whole life in the fast lane. Never really had to answer to any one. He’s lived his life like that for so long. That when he finally met someone who can finally ground him. It through him for a loop!It through both of them for a loop! What started out as only hook-up’s. Turns into something way more than both of them ever anticipated.When Cooper bumps into Jayson (literally)…& they both look into each other’s eye’s. They both knew there was something different about each other.The sexual attraction between Cooper & Jayson was out of this world! Omg! I loved it! The author did a very good job making you feel what they felt!!! The build up.. Anticipation of seeing each other. It was off the charts!!I liked the the pace of how everything unfolded for Jayson & Cooper. It wasn’t one of those look into your eyes or spend one night with them & they are already saying I love you’s. They author build you up to all that. I loved that!!I was also really happy when my favorite couple Ryan & Dagger were in this story!!! & Alex, Chase, & Danni. They were in it.. But didn’t take over the story! It was just perfect.This book touches on a very serious subject about not being excepted for who you are.I will never understand why anybody would even care about who you are with. Boy boy or girl girl.. Or in a 3 couple relationship. Who cares. It’s so dumb.Just let people live their own life’s and you live your own lives. It’s as simple as that!!I’m so looking forward for the next book in The Rock Gods series!!!

I have to say the author did a wonderful job of choosing the illustrations for this book and combining humor and good content to get the message across about the serious subject of weight loss. What really makes this book a hit is the author’s ability to tell an honest and frank story about the challenges she faced adhering to her juicing and exercising plan, while still connecting intimately with the reader. If you are planning to begin juicing for weight loss, you do need to do your research, understand that it is an uphill battle, and realize your own personal results are your own. These are some of the messages that are shared in Maggie’s story. There is also a lot of valuable information on the nutritional value of juicing and on making important lifestyle changes. Some very handy juicing recipes were also included! Maggies’ story will be a great inspiration to you because she is very sincere about the real challenges you are sure to face attempting to reaching your ultimate weight loss goal.

This book is a departure for Ann Gimpel in some ways because it is a stand alone book - most of what she has written lately has been series'. This departure allowed her to focus more on the "Happy Ever After" ending that is often missing in a series book, at least until the last book. They usually have a "Happy For Now" ending that leads into the next book but sometimes there is a cliffhanger ending that leaves you desperate for the next book to see what happens to your characters! However, if she wished to continue to write in this world I would be thrilled because I am very sure there are more stories to be told and it seems like an interesting and enchanting place.That is not to say that this book isn't full of action and some pretty awesome fights between the minions of evil and Luke, Abigail and other Coven members on the side of good! The magic that each Coven member uses is as elemental as each person is different so the way they fight and the types of spells they use is quite interesting to read. The evil that they are facing is quite insidious, lurking inside the ones you least suspect until you are confronted by it in a situation where you have very little time and a small chance to figure out how to save the ones around you that you must protect, let alone yourself!There was so much of this wonderful book that surprised me! There isn't a lot else to say without spoiling anything and I won't do that in a review. All I can do is highly recommend this book to anyone who enjoys a bit of steampunk style in their books, anyone who likes anything to do with magic and the ongoing battle between good and evil and anyone who likes a book that engrosses and entertains you and makes you smile and leaves you with a good feeling when you are done!I received a copy of the ebook from the author in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Recommended for everyone who loves a magical good read

As a long time fan of Rebecca Forster, I couldn't resist this opportunity to explore similar authors at a great price! I wasn't disappointed. The books are all legal thrillers but each has it's own distinct voice. My favorites are the books by Forster, Seigel and Levine. Forster builds the suspence with believable, fully developed characters and plot twists that keep you guessing. Seigel's wisecracking lawyers are a divorced couple who work together and ocassionally still sleep together - sort of exes with benefits. A really fun read! Levine's ex football player turned lawyer, Jake Lassiter has a twisted sense of humor and an attitude that makes him perfect to take on the seedy side of Miami. Some of his characters and plot twists are exaggerated beyond believability but that just adds to the enjoyment. You can't go wrong with this bundle and, like me, you'll probably want to download other books by some of these authors.
summary: Explore new authors at a great price!

reviewText: With every book I read by this author I am more and more impressed with the depth of her writing. I adore her other books but this one showed me exactly what I knew that Anna's writing was going to astound me once she high her grove. The depth of this book will blow you away. Although this is a series I don't feel like I was left hanging in any way. I will be waiting for book 2 but I believe it will be worth every minutesIf you like a story that will make you feel this is your bookGreat job this book is my top 5 I've read this year
When you out of town fun is all you want then you find it and can't get it off your mind!! Great story can't wait for more

Love Grim!Even bad boys can be broken. .. Gypsy Red rocks Grimm's motorcycle club shaking out the good the bad and the ugly.  Showing a side of Grim he wasn't sure ever existed by allowing himself to care about something if even for a moment.  Compromise for the future and the defeat of the past line up making everything difficult  and a couple of sudden turns complicates everything for the entire club.  I couldn't read the book fast enough to see what happened next. I'm so excited to see where Grim goes in book two.  A bad boy you can't help but love.

reviewText: I have just finished reading the 3rd book of the Rushed series, and I loved it as much as I did the 1st and 2nd book of the series.  I love the character Eric in the book, along with so many of the other characters.  Please, Brian Harmon, I need more Rush books.  I am ADDICTED.

My system rebooted mid-review, so I apologize if I somehow end up posting two reviews.I recommend this book and this series to all of my friends, so I can't do any less for complete strangers.  Dale is a massively talented writer that spins detailed stories spanning numerous books, and his character development and plot development are top-notch in my opinion.  This book expands on characters from the prior books and continues the overall story line very well.In a nutshell - I recommend this series.  This is one of my fallback series to read when I don't have any other new books striking my fancy, and that's pretty high praise from me.  It's not often that I pass on authors or series names to people, but when I do, Dale is at the top of the list every time.

new author's Alicia and Nikita have created a great love story with the drama of the paranormal!  If you haven't started the series start it, if you have .....time to find out how it ends,,,angels and devils and passion...oh my!

reviewText: Rosalind never disappoints.  Was so excited when I found out there would be another Escape to New Zealand book.  Love all the men in the series & after reading Hugh 's story he is no exception.  You can't help but love Josie & the advice her mom gives her should be given to all couples. Thank you Rosalind.

This is another great addition in the Escape to New Zealand series.  The story is fun, the characters so likeable, and the romance is great. And most importantly like all the other books in the series - this one is well written!!

Of course I loved this book, just like all of Rosalind James books!  I have fallen in love with New Zealand through her books.  And the sexy rugby players are awesome.  This was a great story of the hardships life brings you and struggle to work through and overcome them.  Wonderful story and great characters. Keep them coming!!
Read the entire New Zealand series.  Good reads anytime.

4.5 stars for a great, pathos filled romance about two people who appear to have it all, but still need that one special love to make their lives complete, and give them the courage to do the right thing.
summary: 5 stars for a great, pathos filled romance about two people who appear ...

reviewText: Every time I've read one of the Escape to New Zealand books, I decide it's the best and declare it my new favorite. So, sigh, Just not Mine is my new favorite. Hugh and Josie's story made me laugh and cry and was a joy to read. Also loved the appearances of favorites from previous books, like Koti, Finn and Nic. Can't wait for the next one!

That’s what this book felt like to me: One of those great, snappy-dialogue comedies of the 1930s, only with, in addition to the glam roles (sports star and TV actress), a couple of pretty realistic kids thrown into the mix, all of it updated to modern-day New Zealand. Normally tough and self-assured rugby player Hugh Latimer, already nursing an injured arm, is trying his best to balance suddenly having to take care of his much-younger half-siblings with the fact that he now finds himself living next door to a fun, quirky, drop-dead-gorgeous-&-a-half soap opera actress who’s got problems of her own. You really can’t help identifying with Hugh, who, on the one hand, is entirely smitten with Josie, and on the other hand, just wants to get back to his comfort zone -- because he’s pretty up-front about the fact that, in the role of parent, he doesn’t know what the hell he’s doing (Who does?). When Hugh and two of his rugby teammates are invited to play a brief scene as themselves on Josie’s soap opera (set in a hospital), things start to seriously percolate, and… well, I don’t wanna give too much away here. But James knows exactly where she’s going with this, and it’s a pretty fun ride getting there. Hugh isn’t perfect, but he’s a profoundly good guy, and you want him to get together with Josie, who deserves a break in life too, because, even though her life looks pretty sweet from the outside, that just goes to show, the outside is by no means the whole picture. No vampires here, or secret agents, ticking time bombs, critically misdirected telegrams, etc., just a couple of nice, smart people drawn together almost gravitationally by mutual attraction in the modern-day New Zealand setting James has made her romantic playground. Good stuff.
summary: In a better world, Preston Sturges would be alive and directing the movie of this novel.

A love story with many heartbreaks .

reviewText: Disappointment is not in this book. All I can say is "oh my God" ! I laughed so hard and even cried as hard. Ms Brock has let you see what the Walkers were really about. A thoroughly enjoyable collection of very cleverly written thrillers, I especially liked the stories “Brand of Cain” and “Irish Rose”. The latter has an ending that’s just begging for a sequel, just the idea of…. well I don’t want to spoil it for anyone but you’ll get the idea when you read it for yourself. Not to forget "Daughter of a demon” that one was brilliantly written but was more of comedy thriller the way that ended. Overall, a highly recommendable read, Jason has bundled together some good thrillers worth purchasing.
Excellent book.  I loved it. These little old ladies are charming.

First of all, I feel that I should point out that I have read quite a few friendship/relationship-related books in my time, but I can definitely say that 'The Relationship Triangle' is by far not only one of the most insightful and and educational books on the topic, but also one of the most pleasurable to read due to the relaxed and almost conversational tone that blends perfectly with the writing style. The author has found that perfect medium of keeping the book informative - while also preventing it from feeling like a chore to read; this is something that I can't say for many nonfiction reads that I come across, and it's ultimately a huge part of why I enjoyed this book so much.The author offers some great advice regarding life skills in general for any kind of interpersonal relationships; this isn't a book solely dedicated for relationships between partners - it instead offers great info that can be applied to literally any kind of friendship or relationship and everything is expressed in a concise and straightforward manner and writing style that makes the best use of almost every single page in the book.Overall, I am more than impressed with the content and I know for a fact that I will be applying much of what I have learned essentially in my everyday daily life - what I admire most about this book is that it is full of actual PRACTICAL information that I found could be applied literally right away, I can definitely say that a large majority of the book really struck a chord with me on a personal level and almost the entirety of the read made a lot of sense to me. Although I am left satisfied with the read, I do wish that the book was longer - as I simply think that the author truly has a knack for giving relationship advice. For this reason, I am giving this book 4 stars, but I ultimately still consider The Relationship Triangle more than a worthwhile read, and I will definitely be recommending it to others.

The Beam is just as good in the second season, a fully developed world with compelling characters, exciting and thoughtful story lines, and some really great character quirks (and transformations). My only complaint - and it's a big one - is that as soon as I finished I wanted to know more, and more isn't yet available. So just like after reading The Beam, I have to wait for these guys to write the next season. Damn them for needing food, sleep, and personal lives when my curiosity is at an all-time high.I could advise you to wait until there are 3 seasons out so you can just call in sick to work and gorge on The Beam for an entire week, but by that time this will probably be optioned as a movie or HBO series and the previews will spoil it for you. So go ahead and read the whole damn thing from start to finish and patiently wait it out for Season 3 like me.
summary: Now I have to wait for Season 3? You're killing me, guys.

reviewText: Received an ARC for reviewI didn't know this was the third book in a series. You won't be lost if you haven't read the first two. I have to say I have no desire to go back and read them cause Reese (or Gabe) won't be in them. The story moved along at a nice pace. There could have been more romance, but Reese was hot enough that it didn't matter too much. There was a nice ending with no cliffhanger until the epilogue. Now I want the next book.

And just when the path to happily-ever-after has been re-established...Dun Dun DUN we get nosy family interference! Well.... This book is quite different from many I have read. I have read gay, straight, and bdsm. This book is different in all aspects. Yes I read the whole book but it was hard. The story seemed to drag on. Feel that it could have ended sooner. As for the transgender aspect, it was ok. A little weird for me but hey everyone is different

This is book 2 of the Blackrock Series, and you must read Scarred Hearts to understand.  So, if you have not, read book 1 first!!  This book picks up exactly where book 1 finished.  I gave this book 5 stars as well.  Bailey & Knox stole my heart in book 1 and I’m so happy to be able to share my thoughts on the continuation of the series.  Word of advice, this book will tear at your heart, have a box of tissues handy!Bailey is definitely a “fighter” in more ways than one.  If it wasn’t for Knox’s love, she wouldn’t be able to get past some more rocky situations in their relationship.  The sender of the notes, and dead roses reveals himself and tries to make his promise come true.  But Bailey is not going down without a fight.Bailey, Knox, Max & Paige all experience their own dilemmas throughout this book.  Their solutions don’t always bring them together.  They find themselves all dealing with personal problems and they need each other to get through all their trials and tribulations.  This book is equally dramatic, definitely tugged at my emotions and made them raw, so be prepared for an amazing emotional read.  I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.
summary: must read, but make sure to read Scarred Hearts first, book 1 of blackrock series!!

reviewText: Fat (Labels #1) by Saranna DewyldeErotic Chick Lit (kind of). Stand Alone."You're Pretty. For a fat girl."Immediately I was able to relate to the heroine in Fat (Labels #1) by Saranna DeWylde . I can't count how many times I've been told what a beautiful face I have (thanks, I know, the rest of me is hideous). Growing up with a gorgeous, skinny mom and two gorgeous skinny sisters don't help things.I enjoy a book with a heavy heroine, though for some reason, I just can't stand a book that is labeled BBW (this isn't). I mean, why does it have to be a genre? Can't it just be a romance with an average heroine? Aah, but I'm getting off track here. Saranna has written a book that she says will make women feel better about themselves. Well no, it didn't do that for me, but it was nice to read about a character I could relate to.I have read other books with curvy heroines that I just couldn't relate to, no matter how good the book was. These were confident women. Women who embraced their curves and wore leather and sparkles. I'm a fat girl who hides. I love fashion, but it looks awful on me (though I still try). I've tried to be a confident woman but I can't. I have eyes.Claire Howard is 5'10" and a size 26. She is a big girl, but apparently she's still pretty damn sexy! Maybe it's the bodacious tatas she has poking out of her clothes. Maybe it's the great line of clothes she is wearing from her website Chubbalicious. Or maybe it's because Kieran, her roommate, is a male stripper. But to me, I think it's because of her outward confidence. I know a few women that size who just come off totally hot to me. Partially because they are, but partially because their confidence makes them that way. Claire is confident on the outside, but inside her body negativity was like reading the post I wrote for Starting on Monday but thought it was too much of a downer to post for weeks."I had him fooled, I had most of them fooled. There were days I even had myself fooled and I believed everything I said about thinking I was beautiful and sexy at any size."Claire and Kieran are roommates and best friends. She spend a lot of time at the male strip club he works at and kind of has an extended family with the guys. She has always been attracted to Kieran, but never acted on it. He has a steady stream of woman and she's just fat."They'd all wonder if I was his sugar mama, if I was paying his bills, or what exactly I had over him that might explain why a guy like him would ever date a woman like me."But when Kieran suggests she date Brant, a fellow stripper, who has been attracted to her a long time, Claire says no. Why? Because he is 5'6". Pot, meet kettle. But after she hears Kieran giving her friend a 'birthday gift', Claire decides to give in and go out with Brant. I loved Brant. He was confident (he's a stripper!), sexy (again, he's a stripper!), tender, warm, funny and smart. And dirty...giving Claire a big O in public on their first date. (I have a major Brant crush!)"I'm going to make you come so hard and long you'll beg me to stop."But when it came right down to it, I was totally able to relate to Claire. I was able to relate so much it made me cry at the same time Claire wanted to cry."I didn't want to be bare in front of him, my body exposed--all of my fat out there for him to see.""He still wanted me. But I didn't want myself. So I didn't understand how he could want me."But when Kieran realizes that Brant is with the woman he's wanted...he joins in.Though I'm focusing on the sexy stuff, this isn't really an erotica book, nor is it a romance, though it has elements of both. There isn't a run off into the sunset happy ending. It was a book about labels. And living and loving your life despite them. Claire is fat, Kieran is gorgeous, Brant is short, Bex is a slut. We all have labels to overcome.Likes:•I was so able to relate to the heroine! Though I'm not as big, every drop of negative self talk has been in my head on a loop for the past 20 years.•Hot sex.•Menage with two male strippers, no complaints.•I liked all of the side characters.Dislikes:•I found it a little depressing, despite the fact that the fat girl got two gorgeous strippers.•All of the negative self-talk got a bit too repetitive after a while (though it never shuts off in my own head).•The book was about learning to love one's self and becoming comfortable in your own skin. Well hello? If I had two gorgeous male strippers who wanted me I think I would be able to feel a whole lot better about myself too!•What exactly is Chubbalicious? Who is the designer? At first I thought she designed the clothes. There wasn't enough elaboration on the business that was such a great part of the book. So little in fact, that when it launched, what happened made no sense at all.Rating: 3.5-3.75 stars, 4.5 heat.Fat by Saranna DeWylde is a very different book. Since it is more about a woman's journey to overcome her own labels than a romance, it left me a bit melancholy. The heroine was so relatable it was like reading my own thoughts on paper. There was a very strong message in the story, and it's almost too bad that the author felt the need to push it so much with male strippers. Maybe if the guys were a little more average I would have bought the whole thing. Maybe it would have more easily convinced me to join her in her journey to love herself. Send those two strippers here and I'll start feeling good about myself too! The book was well written though, and I think I would enjoy reading the author's other books.See more at http://anasattic.com/
summary: A woman's journey to overcome her own labels

reviewText: Claire is a woman that everyone can identify with.We all have our insecurities and we all have been labeled at one point or another. And we all are our own worst critic.I have been the "fat girl". People used to say hurtful things and just like Claire, I learned to push them down and pretend that I was unaffected. I have lost weight but I still see the fat girl in the mirror if I don't focus on the positives.Reading Claire's story struck a chord in me. I felt like I was reading my own story and also reading my new best friend's story. I wanted to be there to give her a hug when she was upset and I wanted to smack the people who hurt her casually. I was thrilled that she examined her life and made some changes as well as letting go of her negative inner voice.I will admit that at first I was a little angry with her roomate Kiernan but then I realized that he has issues and self esteem problems too. and then, mostly I felt pity for him.Actually many of the characters in this story struggle with labels. It doesn't matter if they are male or female, fat or thin, beautiful or plain. They each have their own demons they struggle with.Claire is fortunate that she got a wake up call and started addressing her problems. Many of the others aren't even close.I cannot wait to read more from this series.I know that they will be just as equally, strong, blunt, heart rending and funny. I know that I will sit down and think about myself and others and how labels affect us long after I turn the last page.As always, Saranna Grabbed me by the heart and pulled me along for a thought provoking ride.
Nice book & good read. But it does leave you hanging for the next book, which isn't available...
I love this series so far and I think this book was my favorite. I love Rachel's smart mouth and court's loyalty. Great story!

Save Me (Make or Break #3) by Amanda Heath4 out of 5 StarsFinally Courtney Pierce is done with Annabella!  That's what kept going through my head as I read this book!  I didn't like her in Break Me, so I hurt for Court/Pierce, but man I was done with her!  So to read a book from his POV where he is healing and moving on with another wonderful, spunky, sassy, appreciative young lady was just refreshing!Attached to Annabella from the age of seven, Courtney Pierce is willing to change everything about himself to keep her love and to protect her from the world.  The only ones he can't protect is everyone from her, including himself.  Broken, alone, and disgusted with himself Court is shocked when Rachel Sanders, his longtime enemies’ twin shows up at his door seeking comfort. Not knowing that one night of comfort might turn into so much more and that Annabella might come back to ruin it all, Court takes comfort where he can find it.  Sometimes two broken hearts are the best medicine, but then again sometimes they just continue to break.I really enjoyed reading this continuation of the Make or Break series!  Catching up with Wesley and Royal, Paisley and Channing, and waiting on Ashley and Victor to work things out has been a great world to live in once again! Heath’s writing is very fluid and easy to follow and I find myself enjoying the character’s interactions even though I am a couple of decades older.I have every intention of finishing this series to the end and would recommend highly!*A complimentary copy was given in exchange for an honest review*Pepper, My Secret Book Spot
