great story plot and it helps you keep reading. it has a few good twists to keep you thinking. good read

I didn't care for this story or maybe it was just for Jinx.  I felt she was to forward and desperate for love and sex.  She was very aggressive for a virgin.  The story started off very promising with Roam being dropped to Earth to search for remaining humans.  I thought it was amusing the way he treated normally dangerous animals to humans as cuddly pets (lions and alligators).  But somewhere in the middle I lost my interest in Jinx and Roam's story.  At one point in the story, when they were back in the spaceship, Jinx had a thought "Just the thought of imagining Finn's huge body pressed against her made her hot".  Where did that come from?  This is not even her mate.  That sentence through me for a loop.  Why would she think of another guy that way when she has Roam?
The first part of the book was good i cant wait to read the rest of the basketball wife books

This book explained in a simple yet detailed manner how to read candlestick charts and save time by using them to identify market trends. I found the tips for understanding patterns useful along with the charts provided. I recently read ‘Support and Resistance’ by Kenneth Walker and I think it complements this book well if you are new to trading.
summary: Very easy to follow and to the point.

reviewText: It was ok.

This the third instalment in the Dragons Down Under series and is a wonderfully funny romp through intrigue mayhem and romance. The characters are well written and the descriptions well thought out to give a reality to them both as dragon and human.The intrigue starts in the Dragon realm with arguments as to how to deal with events that came to pass in the previous two books which lends to a great continuation of the series. This leads to some funny interaction between the two dragons concerned in this story, the arrival of  Amber, the beginning of the intrigue and mayhem and then the introduction of all the previous characters that were in the other books of this series giving a great sense of continuation from the very first two books that began all this. The very first were the introduction of the Moonshadow agency people who continue to visit in each story which in turn help to make it a very rich world to visit for some great fun, and some very sexy Dragons.

New short-novel in the Beyond series written by the authors known by the pen name Kit Rocha.The series Beyond is really amazing and as I say every time gives a real addiction to the O'Kane and their stories and thanks fast pace of writing and publication of the authors, we can read very soon another wonderful story with Beyond Solitude.When a motorcycle accident leaves Derek Ford riding a desk at the O’Kane compound, the last thing he needs is a sexy new assistant upending his office and his life. But Mia isn’t scared of her domineering boss. The friction between them generates an undeniable heat—but Mia will not be kept, and Ford will do anything to protect what’s his.Ford and Mia's takes place simultaneously to Beyond Jealousy.Compared to other books I read so far, I found this story a little different from the usual, more focused on its characters, their individual stories, their past that has major repercussions on how they decided to ho on with their lives. Ford and Mia are very different, but together they are perfect for each other.Ford is gruff, proud, lonely, he made a serious motorbike accident and the damage still gives him big problems in walking because of the pain, but he tries to hide his disability to others because he doesn't want to receive pity from anyone. He prefers to stay away from the famous party of the O'Kane and he works body and soul, helping to increase Dallas' business.Mia comes from Sector Two, where the girls are trained to be the perfect lovers, prostitutes of high board , and become the property of men that buy them. Following the example of Lex, Mia run from all this, she wants to live her life freely, she wants to be appreciated for her real skills, which also include a sharp and intelligent mind.The attraction between them is immediate, but Ford tries to keep her away, with his gruff behavior, but Mia can read over his facade.I loved both of them, Ford so grumpy and terribly hot, but with Mis he becomes protective, he makes small gestures proves he has feelings for her, he tries to make less difficult the girl's life and encourages her to use her skills and intelligence in her work with the O'Kane.I liked Mia for her willingness to follow her dream, in spite of the difficulties and dangers, she prefers to live a hard life, but free, she's always with a smile on her face and despite her insecurities,she tries to go on her way.She is not officially part of the gang, but all the O'Kane consider her part of the family and they make her feel at home and protected.An amazing and engaging story and as always, when it comes to O'Kane, very very hot.And now I can't wait for Trix, after the big cliffhanger in the end of Beyond Jealousy
summary: Always Sector Four! This is an amazing story

reviewText: I loved the book. Anything Nina Lane writes is always great. I am never disappointed by any of her books. The way this book ended I'm hoping we will see another one to follow.

I enjoyed reading Amiron and Demitria's story. He was smart and knew how to treat his lady. She had been hurt and abused by those that should have cared. It was a little heavy reading at times, but there were many laugh out loud moments too.  I could not wait to find out who and the reason someone was having Amiron followed.  There w as s just one revelation after another. Add this book to your collection. Would have been 5 stars, but when I have to figure out what a sentence is really saying because of missing and misspelled words, it lowers the rating.

When Jamila was one & a half Symone came & took bet away from her grandmother & uncle. Sometimes Jamila hated her mother, she knew that was such a strong word but at times that's how she truly felt. She treated her child like trash & treated her man like a king. She blamed all her problems. Symone blamed all her problems on others never once taking responsibility for her own actions as a grown woman. She couldn't fathom the thought of seeing anyone else happy. Even worst, she was jealous of her own daughter. She was still hurting from her father's death & took her anger out on her family. Every child deserved a childhood with them just being a carefree kid. It was sad to see a child lose faith in God because of the actions of someone grown. Glad Jamila learned that she shouldn't worry about if people liked her or not. She wasn't their to impress people but people were there to impress her. I liked how even though Jason missed the first few years of Jamila's life he was still the father she needed. I loved Uncle Mikel, Jamila's well being was always his main priority. The kids in your stories are always funny. I know Granny Delilah didn't want to see her daughter behind bars but sometimes the decisions that have to be made May be the hardest thing another person would ever have to make. Jamila needed to forgive the people who had wronged her so she wouldn't have to be burdened with that load on her conscious. Walking around with so much hate on you will do nothing but hold you back.  Jamila had an amazing woman in her life to show her that forgiveness is one of the keys to happiness. & even though mama didn't raise her, she bad a supportive, loving & caring family that did. Her mother didn't raise her but she made it a mission to never have to deal with her children murmuring the words, "Mama didn't raise me."

To Die Once by Miranda A. Uyeh was more than I expected, beginning in a country I've never visited before in a novel, Nigeria, and taking turns in the plot that should give fans of romantic suspense a lot to chew on. One twist/turn was a bit too far-fetched for me to completely buy into, personally, but it was a creative idea that brought the story together. I liked getting into Rodrigo's head from the beginning of his romance with Jennifer, to see what else was behind his smile besides desire. I also liked how Jennifer wasn't the only one with a hard, private plight to face in this relationship, and truth be told, I personally found Rodrigo's side of things to be the more interesting of the two.It wasn't long before Rodrigo "won her heart," but it didn't appear to me that it took much beyond his looks and physical advances to make Jennifer's heart open and available to him. I found a deeper and more convincing explanation about why he might love her than why she'd love him, especially so quickly. After a while, though, I went with it.I've seen the issue of Christians marrying people outside of the Christian faith addressed before in fiction, and I applaud the author for boldly addressing it in this novel. Since this theme coursed throughout the book, one thing I would have liked to see delved into more thoroughly is: why? If Jennifer was going against her values and beliefs by getting romantically involved with Rodrigo, what were those beliefs, specifically, beyond the "cardinal rule" that was applied to mean "don't get married to someone who isn't of this religion"? If Rodrigo had just been a nice guy Jennifer met without the shocking truth that would shake their world (as the book blurb describes), what principles would have made the rule she believed in important, beyond the surface "do's and don't's", when it simply came to Rodrigo, the human being? However, it's just a question, one that would likely be beside the point of this story.As I'm a reader who loves stories of hope, I found the message of hope in this novel to be a big plus. "No matter how dead something may look, if you never give up on it, you just might give it a chance to live again." Yes!____________I received a free copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

"Would you like to go on a date one evening this week?" He doesn't like things about his woman injured, or upset, "the thought of her vulnerable, injured...eff. When it comes to his woman the boy is just all animal, "...his mate's scent of pure lust was relentlessly teasing him. As she slowly continued undressing him, his patience snapped, as it so often did when it came to Margery. Grabbing her hips, he stood and headed for the bedroom." I can't wait to see whose up next in this series.

I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads Review TeamThis book jumps directly into the action there is no waiting at all, it keeps going from there. I enjoyed the story as a whole. Gabby accidently reveals her Sary form (from what I understand sort of like angels that are to stop people from committing suicide; it's the best way I know how to describe it) and as a result she should lose her wings and become mortal. Jassen wants her to stay with the Sary for more than one reason and his evil twin wants to use her for his own evil plan.The only thing that did not sit right with me was when Gabby had to make amends and people just accepted the fact that she was what she was, there was no flipping out or anything. To me it did not sit right, her best friend who pieced it together I understood that because she figured things out from having spent so much time with Gabby.I would recommend this book. At age 36, Jesse Damon has spent twenty years behind bars for a murder committed by one of his brothers. Now on parole, he’s driving forklift in a plating factory and trying to stay out of trouble. But there’s a hard-nosed cop who wants to pin every crime in town on Jesse. This time it’s a theft from an ATM machine, and there’s video footage of Jesse committing the crime. But he was at work, with his foreman as his alibi.A dangerous chemical spill at work is blamed on Jesse, and his on-again, off-again girlfriend Kelly took his advice and went to an AA meeting, only to find another man.“Brothers in Crime” is the fifth book in this gripping series. Rockwood gets all the details right, even down to Jesse’s pathetic gratitude to a store clerk who gives him a couple of sub sandwiches—a treat from his usual lunch of peanut butter on bottom of the line bargain bread. This is a series with no glamour but a lot of hard truths, and one I’ll want to re-read.
summary: A hero with no glamour but lots of heart

After receiving a copy of the book from the author, all I can say is, THANK YOU! I have been dying to see how this story would end. I am a huge fan of Drezden and Lola. I was hooked with the first day of their journey. These flawed, hurt characters crawl under your skin and make you want to root for them. This last book in this series is by far the most explosive of them all. And it covers the rest of the tour, instead of one day. It is an amazing journey of growth for them both!In this book, Lola is realizing that she has told Drezden a lot about herself, her family, and her demons. She is worried as to why Drezden can't or won't tell her about his past. Drezden has a truckload of baggage, and he just does not want to dwell in the past. It eats at Lola, until she lets her brother take her somewhere to get the answers. That journey could be one way. You have to read this ending! There is no way you can possibly dream of what we learn in this book! This is by far, the most telling of all the books, and the scary moments will have you on the edge of your seat. I can't wait to see what Nora writes next! If its this good, I will one click that book so fast. I could not put this book down for a second! This series in on my re read list for sure!
summary: Great end to a great series!

Great read from beginning to end, Hood is a loose cannon , I'm liking Nick & Ron, can't wait to see what happens with everyone in part 2

Born and raised in some dire conditions love and friendship still flourish enough to give hope in this new dystopian world that MT has dreamed up.Born and bred to fight and die in a war that has been ongoing for as long as their clan can remember friends Winter, Cedar & Tallow, are given a life line after a huge discovery and some revolutionary acts.Winter is the prime hero in this story and she is indulged with two love interests, although I found her confusion, deep feelings and then switchero a little shallow I must remember she is a mere 17yrs old,  MT gives her calm and wisdom beyond her young years. Cedar is thankfully the comedic scene stealer.Cedar manages to fall in love several times with various kilt wearing gents via her new found love of reading romance, always seems to pop up from behind some rock to over hear a private conversation and generally bringing some humour to a harrowing situation/setting.Thrown into this seemingly endless and selfish war machine, the trio struggle to survive the onslaught, barely equipped, under nourished and most definitely not trained to fight.As the various clans in the war spar and try to gain ground or make alliances it is Winter who shines, discovering a unique talent and is shown her true destiny.But can she live long enough to fulfil it?I enjoyed the lack of guns and the epic sword fighting scenes.The treachery, deceit and double crossing is amazing and I can’t wait to get my paws on the next instalment.Another element to bring the Talbot clan into another universe, that little bugger gets around. Even the epilogue is filled with Talbotisms!*Spoiler alert*How I loved reading about Trip again!
summary: a new chill is in the air

reviewText: Wow. Once you read this, if you know a vet, you'll be compelled to give them a hug. What Eddie Livingston experienced in his life should be an example to us all of how we shouldn't treat our veterans, and how the systems we have in place don't work for everyone, even those who deserve the best treatment.With real documents, photos and letters from Eddie himself, this book is a heartbreaking message to us all. If you've never been a prisoner of war as most of us have not, we'll never know what happens in the mind of the wounded and imprisoned warrior. I can't imagine what Eddie experienced mentally, but I know he deserves better than what bureaucratic BS our system gave him.
This is one of the BEST books i have read to date!  Violet Duke is amazing and her books will keep you reading til you finish! I highly recommend this book to anyone who likes a good story!
Love the Cactus Creek series! Can't wait to read the next one. Hudson and Lia are awesome. Violet Duke never disappoints!

Bruce is in trouble; his car has been repossessed, he has no money and his credit card is near its limit. That doesn't stop him and his four hear old son Cody from driving to Elderwood Manor, where his mother lives, when she calls him though. After they arrive, Bruce can't help but have the feeling that they are being watched. The feeling gets stronger after they enter the mansion to search for his mother and strange noises start to be heard...This was my first book by Fulbright and Hawkes and it was a blast! The authors introduce the creepy factor slowly at first, letting the reader come to their own conclusions before cranking it up to full speed! People might think that this is the same old haunted house story but I assure you, it is not. The plot is unique, very engaging and impossible to put down. If you've never read anything by Fulbright and Hawkes, this is an excellent place to start! Highly recommended!
I disliked all the charactors! They whine and are just too corny for me. Maybe the book is just too young for me. Anyway I quite reading it at 40%

I am quite impressed with the information contained in this book bundle. It is full of knowledge and inspiration to get your life headed in the right direction. I am always looking for a great motivator and this set is at the top of my list. Each book in this bundle is well written and organized. I found them easy to read, not dull or dry like some non-fiction books can tend to be. If you are in need of a boost to your self worth and your lifestyle, then I highly recommend this set. In my opinion it is worth every cent!Thumbs Up!

I loved crazy fun strong Trixie in book # 1. In this book you follow Trixie as she struggles with issues from her past that keep her from moving forward. This story is filled with so much emotion, I laughed cried and screamed.  Will "Mr. Orange" be able to show her to the light? No spoilers so you’ll just have to read it.

4 starsReviewed by Donna Elsegood for Kindle Friends ForeverI read book 1 Belleza and was hooked so when Alias was released, I was intrigued to learn more about Trixie who made a few appearances in Belleza.This is a story of a woman that has had a lot of hurt in her life, and why she turned to escorting.Trixie is a colourful character with her flamboyant dress sense and some of the clients she is hired by are entertaining to read about.In steps in a client known as Mr Orange he is a handsome Korean wealthy man who hires Trixie on a regular basis. Wherever Trixie goes he suddenly turns up and you begin to wonder if he feels more. I certainly think Trixie felt more for him and thought with her line of work it was impossible. This is about her strength and self discovery of what she wanted her future to be.There was sizzling hot sex between the pair and you really rooted for them to give into how they really felt about each other.Of course it contains a lot of emotions, angst, sadness , happy scenes and some heartbreaking topics. I was not expecting some of what happened and I still hung to the hope of an HEA.The author put everything into the story of Trixie and all the sadness and heartbreak she endured. There is a delicate topic which I think is dealt with sensitively. I certainly enjoyed Belleza series and I look forward to what's next from Ms Heron.

This was a very well-off woman who did not need to marry.  Her bluestocking proclivities, thus, did not need to be hid, as, since she had no plans to marry, she did not need to hide them from a husband, and being a bluestocking itself would not have barred her from society.  That was the one complaint that I had with this book.  Aside from that, it reminded me a great deal of Georgette Heyer (whom, if I recall correctly, DID have a bluestocking heroine who did not hide it, and that woman was welcomed in all quarters, as she was financially secure and didn't need a husband).  So refreshing to read a REAL Regency Romance, not a sex book trying to disguise itself as a Regency Romance!
summary: Excellent book but no need for thie bluestocking to stay secret

reviewText: I may need therapy after this episode. Lol! It never ceases to amaze me how deeply involved I get emotionally with the characters and stories by Rachel Higginson. It always feels as though I am a part of it and that the characters are real. Episode 7 is heart wrenching to say the least. And,as always, we are left hanging on the edge wondering what will happen next. But instead of life or death survival we are left wondering if the heart will survive. It's a whole different level of suspense. Well played Ms. Higginson.

Great book!! I can't believe the author left me hanging again!! That Lele is CRAZY!! But my man is back Calico.  He is the only character that can cross over in books..get it!! Can not wait until part 3!!

I really enjoyed this book, but everything I have read by Danielle Bourdon has been excellent.Chayton is part of the Royal Elite, a group of men that rescue the innocent who have become targets in a society obsessed with power, money and greed. Chayton comes to the rescue of Kate Fairchild who is being pursue by the evil Anton Bertini, who wants Kate to marry him so that he can control her millions. Anton wants Kate money at any cost and will force his will on her with violence and manipulation, including murder.I have read all of "The Royals" and then The Royal Elite" books that start with Mattias, then Ashan, then Chayton. I can't wait for Leander to come out in June.Its a must to read the whole two series to understand the Royal Elite Men, they're a group of very rich men, and their sole purpose is to protect the innocent from evil.
This author is outstanding.  I have read her Royals series and the Roy Elite series and if you don't read them you are missing OUT!

K.E. Saxon never disappoints me with her books.  I love all of her Medieval Highlander books.This story of Robert McVie and Morgana was supreme in my opinion.  Robert McVie who had always been known to bed anything with a skirt could have never imagined what would happen with a surprise twist in his plans.  He has to obtain coin to help his clan and get them out of the dire situation in which his father had left him.  At court he enters all of the tournaments he can to get the coin, but it is still not enough.  He must pay his father's debts to the king if not he must forfeit his land.  Therefore, he has a plan.Morgana had been traumatized in her youth where her family had been tortured and killed.  Because of that event in her life she became mute out of this horrendous ordeal she experienced when she was just a child.  Now she is at court with her older wealthy cousin, who has several lovers vying for her attention.  Morgana has her eyes fixed on the knight who has been winning the events at the tournament.  He happens to be one of her cousin's lovers.There is such a great amount going on in this book that you are never bored.  It is long but worth every page turn.  K.E. Saxon' s books are not for the faint of heart in reference to hot steamy highlanders.  I love my highlanders hot and steamy.  Ms. Saxon does not disappoint she delivers the goods.  I want her never to change her style.  She is exceptional.  She has been one of my favorite Highland Romance author's.  Her books are keepers for me.  The only thing, I wish she could release books sooner.Again, if you love hot steamy highland romance books and are not skirmish about hot and steamy passionate scenes and also love a tremendous storyline, then pickup a K.E. Saxon book.

This book was full of great resources to help me find work. And as I'm writing this review from my new desk, I can say that it has been a success! I like the way the book was laid out in bite size ideas and techniques, so each chapter is full of pragmatic, useful tips and ideas that really applied to the job marketplace. I think this book can help anyone who wants to genuinely wants to work, and it works quickly, so don't be surprised if you buy this book and then days later you're getting phone calls and interview requests.
summary: Pragmatic guide to getting you into work

Well all I can say is that Mercedes has done it again. This book was straight fiyah it was so much drama that I couldn't put the book down until I was finished can't wait for part 2. I really loved the relationships between Gena and Cese and Giselle and Aaron

Why is it so dang hard to finish a book..  ?? Every good book has damn near 3-4 parts and leaves me hanging every time ...this book is a good read and I did enjoy it but now I have to wait for part Three...uugghh just sayin....
Can't wait for part 2.  This book was short but good and ending made me want to come back for more.  Hope Trigger and Denise make it.

When BJ Harvey said Blissful Surrender was HOT she wasn't lying! Although this book does form part of the Bliss series, with characters featured in previous books Blissful Surrender can be read as a stand alone.In BS we meet Samantha Richards, strong, smart, sassy and a police officer. She's comfortable in her life, loving her job, surrounded by great friends and enjoys a casual no strings attached relationship with Tanner.We also get to reconnect with our favourite Dom Sean Miller - charming, charismatic and sexy as all get out. Ten years ago these two had it made, they were the loves of each other's lives, their relationship was rock solid, until it wasn't, and when someone who should of had Sam's best interests at heart persuaded her that Sean was too domineering and wrong for her she listened, mixed communications followed and Samantha walked away from the first person to ever truly get her.Ten years later, Samantha and Sean reconnect but are they strong enough to let go of the past and take another chance on each other?Sean possesses all the qualities we like to see in a Dominant, but for me the true hero of this story is Sam. While she is definitely submissive in the bedroom, out if it she is strong, sassy, confident and the kind of girl you'd love to be friends with. The sex is steamy as hell, and if you enjoy your stories a little more erotic this is definitely one for you. I'd definitely recommend having plenty of batteries or a willing partner on hand after reading this. I can't recommend this series enough, grab a glass of wine, put your feet up and settle in for a fantastic read.

Would recommend for people who want to change their habits and be more productive. This book is so concise yet extensively covers all there is to productivity. I like it! Now I just have to apply this to my life. That's the biggest challenge!
This was a great book! I really liked Prudence and Cash. They are just two lost people looking for a simple arrangement because they are scared to love again. I cant wait for #2 to see what happens!

Why the HELL do authors do this to me?!?! I fell in love with Pru and Cash within the first few chapters, and the more I read the more I loved them!Prudence along with her band came to LA for 3 months in the summer to try and make it was a band. Pru is pretty sure that they will not be discovered but uses this as a way to move on with her life. She meets Cash and things change. Both have have been hurt badly in the past, so both don't want a relationship. So that makes it perfect for their arrangement. Well guess what, they both fall in love with each other, but don't tell each other because of the arrangement they have made. Just as Cash was going to tell Pru she leaves, him and the bad.And this is when I really hat Abby right now...I WANT TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS!!!!!! When is Book 2 coming out????

Really? 2 more books at $4.99 each? Who in their right mind would buy that? It was an ok story, but it easily could have ended with a HEA after one book. The whole book they hid their obvious love for each other, which was ridiculous.  I have no desire to read 2 more books about them hiding feelings for each other.  Been there, done that. If the author would have wrapped this up into one book, it would have been a really nice story.

I am new to reading this author, but I can say that I liked Abby Reynolds style.  Cash and Pru, loved them, I like how they got each other, how they connected and how they loved, even though they both thought they would never love again.  Jeremy was a good secondary character, loved how him and Pru were close, and I also loved Cash's family too.  The band mates, eh, they were hard to connect with fully as they really were not in this much.This was a good simple read, as in my mind was free to get into it.  Being a wife and mom of 4 kids to say my life can be crazy hectic at times is a severe understatement, so sometimes I am looking for a book to just read and escape too, and this book was it for me, I loved it, so kudos to you Abby, I look forward to reading more of your books!

This was a book filled with angst and "Come on don't do that" moments. I enjoyed it but warning, there is a cliffhanger. In general I do not like cliffhangers but in this case I cannot wait to see what happens next. The book is well written and definitely kept me wanting to read more.
Ice Station Wolfenstein was a really good read! I thoroughly enjoyed it, it grabbed me right from the start and never let go. I recommend it.

I love this series and absolutely adored Olivia and Trace in the first two books. I couldn't wait for Trent's story and I have to say that Micalea Smeltzer did such an amazing job with this story.  I felt all of the emotions that Trent and Rowan felt. It was an emotional roller coaster ride and you may want to have a few tissues handy.Rowan is just 21 years old but she has had more responsibilities than most girls her age. Her mother is a drunk, her step father is a sleezeball,  and her real father left when she was little. Her mother is both verbally and physically abusive to her and basically tells her how worthless she is, when in reality it is just the opposite.  At 21 years of age Rowan should be worrying about her friends, her classes, boys, what she will be doing on her weekends, the normal stuff that most college aged girls worry about.  But life for Rowan is not the norm. She has been taking care of her brother and sister for as long as she can remember.  She works hard, goes to school and is more of a mother to those two kids than her mother ever was.  Rowan deserves happiness and love in her life, but the meaning of love to Rowan has been scarred because of her childhood.  There is one person in her past that has always been there for her.  One person who understood her and loved her.  But she pushed him away the minute he expressed his true feelings.  And now five years later he wants her back.Trent Wentworth grew up in a very privileged household.  Never wanting for anything.  He is one of the sweetest, caring young men out there.  He has loved Rowan since they were 16 and never cared what her family life was like. But for Rowan, Trent is so far out of her league that she feels she doesn't deserve him and pushes him away. But Trent knows and feels what is between them.  And he will do what it takes to make her his.  But Rowan has a secret from her past.  And once that secret comes out it could ruin any chance that they have together.Trent was just amazing.  His caring and thoughtful ways will completely melt you heart.  If you loved Trace in the first books then would will fall in love with his brother. My heart broke for Rowan for what she went through.  But she is one strong woman who will do what it takes to make sure her siblings are cared for, loved and have a good life. But despite her strength when it comes to those two kids, she has her own insecurities, not feeling that she deserves the love that Trent has for her.  As much as she wants to be with him she knows that he deserves better.Tempting Rowan was a fantastic read. When Rowan's secret comes out I was so afraid of what would happen next. I loved them together and knowing this secret could destroy their love just made my heart ache for them.  And if that heartache wasn't enough there was this "holy crap" moment where I found myself with tears in my eyes praying that it would all be ok.  It's was an emotional story, between the moments that followed the big secret reveal, to the way Rowan's mother treated her to her own insecurities about how worthless she felt at times.  But it also had those moments that will melt your heart.  I loved every minute of it.  Ms. Smeltzer knows how to draw you in.  She knows how to make you feel the pain and the emotion of her characters.  I think she completely outdid herself with this one. I honestly didn't see the twists coming and when they did I was afraid of where it was heading.  What I also loved was that we also got an added bonus in the form for Trace and Olivia.  I especially loved the moments towards the end with Trace and how amazing and understanding he was.  Excellent job.  Cannot wait for the next one.

✯✯5 HUGE STARS!!!✯✯I am so in love with this story. I am so in love with Rowan & Trent. This book literally lad me laughing one minute. Then, I'm crying or I have my hand over my mouth in shock. This book had 1st love & then 1st heartbreak. It had a little bit of everything in it. And, I for one. Loved every single thing about 'Tempting Rowan'.Rowan is completely closed off. She has a mother who hates her. Is always so drunk she's never awake. And, when she is awake she's very unpleasant. Her step-dad has a very serious hand problem. Every time he was around I cringed. Rowan feels broken & empty inside. Unable to be loved. She feels unworthy. Then why stay around? Rowan stays around to take care of her little brother & sister. Who every time they were around you'll have a smile on your face. Rowan vows to graduate college, get a good job, make enough money and take them and run. So, until that happens she keeps everyone at arms length. Including her 2 best friends Tatum & Jude.Then, Trent comes home from school & throws a wrench in her plans! If you read 'Finding Olivia & Chasing Olivia' then you know how perfect Trace is. Well, Trenton Wentworth is just as perfect as his older brother! He has been in love with Rowan since they were 16. The night they lost their virginity to each other he let her know how he felt. Rowan on the other hand ran & never looked back. Now, Trenton is back and is going to do anything & everything to get her back!!Every time Rowan turns around there is Trent. He follows her to the food stores, the library where she works. It's driving her insane. Because, when she goes home he invades her mind, her dreams. It's killing her because he is the only person who has ever had her heart. The only person she'd give it too. But, deep down Rowan knows he'll never except everything she has to offer.Over time Trent finally gets Rowan to agree to go on a date with him. Trent breaks her down and gets Rowan to see that it's OK for her to live. For her to do stuff for herself. Rowan is definitely enjoying her time with Trent. He's there for her when she needs it. I was stoked to see Trace & Olivia there as well.Then, Rowan's secret comes out. I literally dropped my kindle. It's a big wow moment!! She has some explaining to do. Trent & Rowan must figure out whats next. Even if there is a next.There's so much going on in this book!! I literally felt for Rowan.There hasn't been a character in awhile that has affected me the way she did. She's such a beautiful, strong woman. Yet, she can't seem to see that. Jude & Tatum (who you'll love) have known her for awhile and even they don't know all her deep dark secrets. I can't stand her mom & step-dad with a passion!!!! Trenton is just as sexy and perfect as his brother.When I tell you to get a comfy place to sit and read. Get your tissues too because you'll totally going to need it. I can not wait to see what Micalea is writing next!!!
summary: Micalea Smeltzer keeps out doing herself!!

The story line was fairly predictable, but the two main characters, Joe and Laurel, were very likable so that lifted the book. I didn't care much for who the murderer turned out to be. It seemed a little wrong; but that's just me. Still...a good tale. I'm a long time author myself and it is hard to please me in the books I read...yet this one did please me. I rooted for the two main characters and for the mother and daughter to be, at long last, united.

reviewerName: Blushing Divas BR "Blushing Divas Book Reviews"
reviewText: 5 Blushing Stars!!!!!Great debut novel!!! Love the cover of the book and the synopsis had me hooked. The book surpassed what I thought it was going to be and left my jaw hanging on several occasions. The emotions that these characters go through is brilliantlywritten and makes you feel it right to your core. I loved this book and can not wait to read more from this author.

I've been a fan of sites and apps sending me daily emails/updates of my astrology prediction. And I realized, why not own a copy? Found this book and I learned new things about my loves zodiac and mine as well. Would you believe this is the first time I read something about my daughter's sign, Libra?? I find this book really interesting to read. Especially that I liked what I am reading about (hehe). Astrology and understanding the zodiac signs may not clearly show you the future. But for me, they're a great guide on how we treat and see other people. If you and your spouse are not compatible, then it must be a good sign to make the differences work for you both not against it.

A good book to help us cure candida disease. This book is a complete package of recipes we can prepare to avoid and help us cure candida disease. What I like about this book is that it give us information on what food to eat to fight candida and what food to avoid.

Yay! Seductive Chaos was so much better than book two. Vivian and Cole are cray cray. They get off on it. Vivian is a drama queen, she loves to be the center of attention. Even though she has no claim on Cole it doesn't stop her from going into a jealous rage anytime she sees him with another girl...and he loves it. Sometimes he gets caught on purpose so Viv will bring out her claws.For two years they've been playing this game but Vivian is done. She's tired of looking like a fool to her friends and she's starting to have feelings for the self-centered, womanizing, lead singer that she feels will never commit to her.Now not only has Cole lost Viv but there's trouble in the band as well.Very good book. Along with the drama it was actually pretty funny. Vivian's date from hell with Theo was classic. I'm so glad I kept reading this series. I'm really looking forward to Mitch and Gracie's story.

I'm a fan of this series.  Masie and Jordan drew me in, Riley had her quirks, but Vivian is by far my favorite of this series so far.  She is human.  She has flaws, she makes bad choices and she knows they are bad choices but just can't help herself when it comes to Cole.  And I mean lets face it, who hasn't done that?  It makes her extremely relatable.  There are parts of this book that make you want to scream because of the communication issues between these two, but I think that's half the battle.  Cole is a handful, but you know from reading the other two books that he is going to be worth the chaos.  I really enjoyed this book and can't wait to continue the series!  I have a feeling I am going to love Gracie even more than Vivian!
summary: Vivian is my favorite so far

Many years back, when my grandmother was a lot younger, she claims to have astral travelled.  But when we pry her for more details, she says that was not aware of how she actually managed to do it, let alone remember what she did back then.  This book reminded me of her and I got a copy to understand astral travel, and to ask my grandmother if something rings a bell.  I still do not know whether to be amazed or spooked, but I am in the middle.  The book is great as it explains in detail all about astral travelling, and how you can do it yourself.

'Adventures of Huckleberry Finn as Retold by Sherlock Holmes' is a unique pairing of characters from two sets of stories as unlike as New Orleans and London but somehow the blend works.  That is a testament to the skill and artistry of the Holy Ghost Writer, whoever he or she is. The premise is that Sherlock Holmes is narrating to Watson the story of the adventures of Huck Finn as told to him by Finn himself when he attended Yale no less!  The story is light hearted and funny, and it is so rich in its descriptions the reader is able to sink into the pages and experience the adventure right along with Huck.  The sidebar of the interaction between Holmes and Watson and the added spice of learning what happens to Huck as he becomes a man is a great tale in and of itself.  This is the first I've heard of the Holy Ghost Writer, but won't be my last purchase of one of these books.  The author is an excellent writer and the story grabs you and won't let go until you've read it all.  Finally, on top of the entertaining narrative, the identity of the author is not only an intriguing mystery, but solving the riddle can make you some money!  What's not to love!  I highly recommend this book to those who remember the tales of Huck Finn and Tom Sawyer, to lovers of the Sherlock Holmes and Watson accounts, and to anyone who just likes a good read.  You won't be disappointed!

I had the honor of reading this one while still in the editing stage and what a great story. Allyson Roberts has the perfect life or so it seemed. She has just gotten engaged to her boyfriend Ronald Graystone. The Graystone family is an old family, old money, certain values and looks out for only themselves. Her dream job lined up as soon as she graduated college in a few weeks. But while Ally and Maddie, Ronald’s twin sister, are shopping for a dress for Ally to wear to dinner with Ron and his parents, her world falls apart. Ally’s father is arrested and his company is going down fast. But Ally can’t believe what is happening. When she finally talks to her father’s lawyer, she can’t understand who would do this. She wants to help but her father wants her to stay clear of all this mess. But Ally knows that it can’t be true, but who would want to destroy her father and his company? While Ron lets his mother control his life with Ally, they split up. And while everything around her is falling apart, Maddie is standing stead-fast and always by her side. Ally finally finds a job but it is a secret type of job, kind of like the C.I.A. for the energy department. She is sent to a secret location for training and there she meets Instructor Jake Morrissey. There is something that pulls them together. Will Ally pass the training and be able to use this new job to clear her father’s name? With a little help from her new coworkers, will she be able to take them down? Another great beginning to a fantastic series by Marie Astor. It has a little bit of everything, pain, loss, intrigue, love and bad guys needing to be taken down. Great job Marie!

I live in Shreveport and can see the target casino across the river. If there will be a tornado around it will hit over there; the second target is usually Broken Bow, OK. I was thrilled to read the  familiar place names as they met their end. There were a few slips in keeping I-49 lettered in the excitement.  Overall the attention to detail really compliments the rolling bad news.  Gangs and drug lords and murderers, oh my.  Can`t wait for more mayhem.

Google “how to make money off a website” and you’ll end up in a whirlpool of buzzwords, anecdotal advice, and dated articles. Among the most popular topics in that search will be SEO, search engine optimization. SEO is one of those things that is so vital to any online business, yet that so few people know about, and even fewer understand.This book is a short, concise guide to setting up your websites (yes, plural, because you should diversify) to maximize your site ranking. Higher ranking = more views. More views = more exposure. More exposure = more views. This book will set you up with practical, real-world, and most importantly, modern/up-to-date advice. Definitely recommended.
summary: Short, sweet, and to the point

reviewText: When I first began reading That Which Destroys Me, I thought it was going to be yet another typical DOM related romance.  What a shocker for me!First of all, Stell for all of her horrific background is not a weak little whiney victim.  She's ballsy and funny as hell.Even Wes with all of his arrogant, prick ways pushed his way into my heart.They are witty, well developed characters, even the ancillary characters remain with you.The sex, well yeah, those scenes are hot and steamy!  ~Rowr~Let me say that I have always been a horror, gore, twisted psychological thriller type gal, and am a little disheartened with happy endings all of the time.  That Which Destroys Me, shocked me, yet made that dark part of me dance with glee because Kimber S. Dawn delivered anything but a happy ending.I wish that I could give this more stars simply because this was anything but a typical Romance/Erotica book.  I loved the intertwining of sick, twisted story line and would absolutely freaking love to read more stories like this.If you are looking for butterflies, rainbows, flowers, this is not the book for you.  So, don't get your panties in a bunch when you read this and everyone isn't skipping off in the sunset in the end.
summary: My Twisted, Deranged, Black Heart Danced

I enjoyed this book a lot. To tell most things about the book would give it away, but Tessa is kidnapped, along with her friend Heather, while vacationing in Monterrey, Mexico. Both the bad and good guys suspect she has been smuggling drugs or is trying to make a drug buy. She is protected from what the other Mexican mafia guys want to do to her by bad guy Kris, and Tessa and Kris have very sexy moments as she is being held for ransom. But is Kris a good guy or bad guy? Tessa's heart and body don't seem to think that's important, and it's a very interesting storyline for the reader.I give this one 4 stars and recommend it those who like romantic suspense and a hot alpha maybe-bad guy.Thanks for reading!And thanks to netgalley/the author/Entangled for a review copy. As always, my review is based on my reading of the book and my honest reaction.
summary: Kris is one hot and sexy alpha (maybe) bad/(maybe) good guy!

reviewText: Phenomenal debut book.  Sexy, intriguing and great plot. Cant wait to see more from this author.  Shes a new auto add list.

It's appropriate that this book is in an imprint named Ignite. The romance between Tessa and Kris is scorching. Both characters leap off the page. The chemistry between them is potent from their first eye contact to their final scene.Tessa is a strong woman who the reader cheers for when she fight back during a kidnapping.I'm hoping the next story in the series features Tessa's best friend, Moni.Fantastic debut for Ms. Roberts.

Tessa decides to celebrate her new house purchase by heading to Mexico.  While there, she is mistaken for a drug mule and is taken captive.  That is where she meets Kris, a man in the middle of the drug runners and the cartel owners.  Can he save both Tessa and do the job he was sent there to do?  Great read.  The story is exciting and sexy, I loved the chemistry between Tessa and Kris, very hot.I was provided a copy of this book for an honest review.

I received a copy of this book from the publisher and the author in exchange for an honest review.  I was not compensated in any way.This is a story that makes the doctor seem more human and shows that they go through the same types of things us "normal" people do.  Greg is also one smooth talker - will Carrie stand a chance?  You'll just have to read in order to find the answer to that question.  This is a case of love can be found anywhere.  For those single readers - this may give you some hope to keep your eyes open to all possibilities.  Having an open-ended ending was great.  This leaves it up to the reader to decide where the couple can go from here.  If you like this book, you may want to check out Audra's other two titles from this series that are out now.  They are titled Falling for the CEO and One Night in Santiago.  It's a novella that doesn't read like one - well worth your time.
summary: A Novella That I Didn't Want To End

reviewText: I really enjoyed Healing her Heart, it is my first read from Audra North, but I will definitely be looking her up again, when I am in the mood for something quick, sexy and a little different.The beauty of life was in its complexity, and death and desire were both a part of it.It is not often that you read a love story that is in the main conducted in an Assisted Living Facility and I liked this little twist in the story, it gives you the added bonus of senior characters that are just that characters! Greg Stanton being an ER doctor on the verge of burning out, and Carrie Jankowski as the manager of New Beginnings Assisted Living Facility tend to only run into each other at the gravest of times. Greg for the most part is the Doctor with the responsibility of telling Carrie that another senior in her care has passed on. Their attraction for each other is strong, but the circumstances in which they generally meet up aren’t really conducive to taking things to the next level.The woman he met far too frequently in the worst possible circumstances.Greg and Carrie are both strong independent characters and I liked that, both are battling a few demons, but not in an overly angsty way. Carrie helping Greg at his lowest point is what prompts him to seek her out and take the next step, after deciding to take some time away from the hospital he makes her the offer of a week of no-strings casual fun, that they both think they been looking for...Sex. Lust. Desire. No strings attached.If you are stuck for what to read next, and are looking for an enjoyable filler while you make up your mind then Healing her Heart is a perfect novella to do that. I was pleased to see that Audra has written 2 other novellas in this series as well, which I will definitely add to the e-reader for just such an occasion.ARC provided via Netgalley, in exchange for the above honest review.
summary: 3.5 - "He'd left her limp and sore but ready for more." Stars!

reviewText: 3.5 Stars - This is a short read with a bit of angst, a bit of steam, and a lot of color – mainly from the elderly residents at the Assisted Living Residence. When Doctor Greg finds himself over-stressed from his job as a cardiac surgeon, he decides to take a week off to recharge his batteries and try to rid himself of the anxiety that he has been feeling. What he doesn't expect is being propositioned by Carrie, the director of the assisted living home, whom he has gotten to know through the visits that her residents frequently make to his ER. Of course her proposition isn't as steamy as what he would like – she invites him to volunteer at the facility during his week of vacation. Doctor Greg has other ideas in mind though, especially since the attraction between him and Carrie is sending off some serious sparks. When Greg and Carrie embark on a one-week, no-strings affair, will they be able to just walk away from each other or will they find that there is something there to fight for.Greg and Carrie were a fun couple to watch as they struggled through the issues from their past and tried to maintain the parameters of their one-week relationship. There was definitely a lot of sparks between the two, and it seemed that everyone but Greg and Carrie could see that they made a great couple.I especially loved the residents at the facility, and how Carrie had so many life lessons that she had learned from them.“Working with some of the wisest members of society – the elderly – Carrie had learned years ago that emotions didn’t separate themselves into nice, neat compartments that a person could experience, one at a time. The beauty of life was in its complexity, and death and desire were both a part of it.”I enjoyed this story, but would have liked to have seen a bit more to the ending, which I know is sometimes hard when you are trying to keep the story down to novella length. This is my first book from Audra North and I would definitely pick up another one!I received a copy of this book from the Publisher in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Good read - a bit of angst, a bit of steam

reviewText: Wow! I'm so excited that this is the first book in a series because it was amazing. We just got these nifty new "Hot Pick" buttons, and I'm definitely giving it to this one. Arif al Najimi was absolutely everything a hero should be. He was also exotic, an animal lover and ecologist, and saved Aly's life a couple times. While his views of women sometimes seems a little off, it really helped make him just a little too overprotective, but in the best possible way.Aly was the traditional pretty and intelligent girl that didn't trust in her own beauty. But this time there was a very good reason why. And her reason why tied into so many other things in the story so beautifully that the whole back story was about as seamless as you could get. I loved how she kept running off and driving Arif al Najimi crazy trying to keep an eye on her.Watching Aly and Arif al Najimi hunt for turtle nests and try to find out why they were dying off was a great story. There was a lot more action than what seems possible in a turtle nest hunt. There were even several times I found myself getting excited right along with them at a new next found. The side characters served to boost the story and enhance the personalities of the characters in just the right way. I don't think I could really find something I didn't like about this one.*This book was received in exchange for an honest review*

In this Entangled Indulgence novel, part of the Johari Crown series, we are treated to the story of Arif, a sultan's adviser ( called a Cup Companion) in the country of Bagestan and Aly, a researcher visiting the country on a scientific mission. Arif's role in the country's government is as an environmental minister but as a sheikh he has lived a life of luxury and power. Aly's determination to save the precious sea turtles considered sacred to his heritage draw him to her, as does her shy and unassuming behaviour and her down to earth treatment of him. The question remains whether two people from such opposite lifestyles can find common ground.I thoroughly enjoyed this story. The setting plays a role equally as important as the two main characters. The description of the clothing, the luxurious locations, the sailing and the breathtaking scenery all combine to bring the reader into an enchanted world.Arif is cast as the strong, dominant man used to taking what he wants yet he sees Aly's insecurities over her appearance and knows he must coax her out of her shell to trust him. Aly is strong and confident when in her element but reserved and shy without, emotionally damaged by her upbringing and feelings of unworthiness. How their romance develops is skillfully written, blending sexual tension and emotional moments. The story moves at a fast pace, with some mild suspense and action scenes thrown into the mix. If you are looking for a romantic fantasy world to take you away for an afternoon, this book definitely fits the bill! 4 enchanting stars.

At first blush this was a typical category romance, heroine who thinks she's ugly (but of course actually isn't), arrogant CEO-type (prince in this case), etc. But once you get into the story, it isn't that at all. There was a lot more to the story, an understanding of why Aly thinks she's the way she is. I liked the imagined history of the Johari people. And of course, having such a wonderful cause that Aly's a scientist for (the Johari sea turtle) touched a tender chord with me.I enjoyed watching Arif go from his somewhat cold "prince" persona and grow into the man who's willing to fall in love with the little scientist. I also like how the leaders of Johari insist their cabinet members (the Cupholders) shed their prince personas for a month a year and mix with the common for as common folk (be nice of politicians had to do that, yeah?).Nothing in this book actually didn't work for me. It was a seamlessly delightful way to spend a couple of hours.Thank you to the publisher and Ms. Sellers for letting me read it! Four gargoyles!Book provided by publisher in exchange for an honest review.

An arrogant & panties dropping lawyer verses a curvy sexy female doc! Who will win?Dr. Calla Roberts was highly skilled reconstruction surgeon in Chicago, but now works in Hollywood at the Seacliffe Cosmetic Surgery & Spa because she is in debt up to her children's eyeballs. With a brother who is a quadriplegic in 24/7 medical care & an ex-fiancé who cleaned out her bank account, she needed to go to where the money was. On the plus side, her boss, Helen Ridgeway, runs Helen's House which is a free clinic & Calla gets to use her extensive skill to help make a difference to the ones who need it the most, like Alicia Deleon, a hit & run victim.Alex Hardy is a high powered LA lawyer know for his ruthless honesty. His Grandma Maddy was a famous 50s star & he knows the ins & outs of Hollywood. Alex just tossed his money hungry, cheating with his ex-friend & fame starved ex-fiancée to the curb. He has a kooky family trying to baby him & boost his confidence, but really they love to jerk his chain. Will he ever find a truthful woman without stars in her eyes & her hands out?Calla's life sucks with all the patient's photos & info being leaked left & right to the media & also has an actor, Jeff MacKay, stalking her because he was the hit & run drive that almost destroyed Alicia leg & hip. So why is the most arrogant, tactless & panties dropping Alex Hardy, the spa's legal rep, sitting in her office? Alex asks her if she is selling drugs to kids, because he saw her handing pills to a kid in the parking lot. As far as misunderstandings go this one is a whopper, but she explains her poor hit & run patient's son came for antibiotics. Alex is so turned on by her righteous anger, so he decides that he needs explore this white-hot need of lust, for the little curvy doc.Since his family is driving him crazy, he decides to ask Calla to go to his Grandma Maddy's kooky, squabbling, insults flying & sometimes knock down drag out fights family dinner. He offers her a deal, free legal consul for one night of pretending to be his GF! Calla is so stressed that having dinner with a famous movie star says like a HOOT! What she doesn't expect is the driven need to crawl into the sexy lawyer's lap & let her hormones go into hyper drive! Soon all their passions are like a out of control tsunami, Calla's is accused of dealing drugs, paparazzi everywhere, a mysterious romantic admirer, more media leaks, creepy actor still stalking & a meddling famous Grandma & quadriplegic brother join Fairy Godperson powers to slap some sense into this hopeless couple. Is a few days enough time to fall in love? When will Calla learn to trust love again? Will Alex honesty bite him in the a$$? Can he save her medical career & heal her heart? Who will play who in the movie?Julie Rowe is a new author to me & I am a true historical romance geek, so I really enjoyed this contemporary romance because it had a historical flavor to it. Calla played a brilliant surgeon, but doubted herself as a desirable woman, a bluestocking. Now yummy Alex is a lawyer with a famous family & just wanted to be loved for himself, a Duke. Ms. Rowe wrote fantastic scenes up against the walls, a headboard & on the bed for Alex & Calla. These two would have problems, if they stayed in bed. Fairy Godfolks are a favorite of mine, whether they are furry, 4 or 2 legged, male or female, so long as they are determined to throw, slam, collide & mix up the lovers' world! Why? Because it makes the story unique, kookier, ROF"hyperventilating"L & UNEXPECTED! Ms. Rowe is a new author discovery for me & plan to SHOUT (insert pompoms here) IT OUT! This contemporary romance with a historical flair get my score of 4 fingers up & 8 toes.NetGalley ARC was given for my honest review.
summary: A CONTEMPORARY ROMANCE WITH A HISTORICAL FLAVOR

reviewText: Melody Swan doesn't believe she's good at the physical side of romance. After a few disastrous encounters, she's looking for a relationship based on logic rather than lust. Heath Starr has the well-deserved nickname of Ladyslayer, and a recent imbroglio has him wary of women wanting more than just a good time with him. Melody is committed to staying in her small hometown where she's a partner in a car repair business and also the main support for her mom. Heath is only helping out at her garage for a short time before he leaves to pursue his new career in photography.These two people seem fately ill-suited, but that doesn't stop the sparks of attraction from flying.This is a great little read with two complex and sympathetic characters.Note: I was gifted a copy of this book by the author.
summary: A short, sweet romance that ticks all the boxes.

reviewText: I found this to be a slightly humorous and fun suspense novel with a small side of romance.  I really enjoyed the sleuthing skills of Cara as she aids detective Cole.  I hope there are more books in the series and we get to see their relationship develop.  Fun book that I really enjoyed.  I'm looking forward to the next one.

Do you have an hour or so to spare for an enjoyable read?  If so, check out Opening Act by Suleikha Snyder, a fun and realistic contemporary novella.Saroj Shah has been in love with Adam Harper since the day they met as freshman in college, about seven years ago. Unfortunately, Adam has never considered Saroj to be more than a good friend or sister, much to Saroj's dismay. Now they are both in the workforce, Saroj an entertainment reporter for the local paper and Adam, a restaurant manager.  Adam is also a hot bass player with a local grunge band.  Because of Saroj's feelings for Adam, she has been one of the band's groupies for years. Now she is required to hear them play because it is her job to cover them for the paper.Adam is basically clueless and has no idea that Saroj has feelings for him.  He is shocked when he finally finds out and needs a little time to regroup. Unfortunately, Saroj is tired of waiting. However, they are able to work through their issues and discover a possible future together.I liked this novella.  The writing is good, the characters are well-developed and the plot is heartfelt as well as realistic. Saroj is a bit whiny at times, but it is understandable because she has waited seven years for Adam to come around. Johnny, Adam's band-mate and best friend, is funny and a bit devious, which adds another dimension to this gem of a read.A gifted copy was provided by publisher for an honest review.

OH MY GOD! I loved this book so much I loved the dialogue between Carolyn and Reed:"You murmured something about taking you to bed or losing you forever.""Oh," I muttered guiltily. "I watched Top Gun way too many times. How about we hit restart? Can you get dressed, pleased? It's very distracting, but really nice to be plastered against you. But I get the feeling that you're just not that into me."The girl has this tendency to not know she's speaking her thoughts loudly:He had a trail of silky dark hair from the bottom of his navel to the tip of his bobbing co**, which twitched at my words. I want to trace my tongue down that line."Go ahead," he said."I've got to stop thinking aloud," I said and crawled across the bed toward him.I mean the girl has got it bad, "finally, some gear that could stand up to the elements. I wasn't riding on any more dragons unless it was Reed in human form and all hot and sweaty." I hope Jack and Arianna get a book because I loved those two as well.

reviewerName: Book Nook Nuts "I am Tammy Payne. I am an avi...
reviewText: New to me Author ..I am an avid Dragon Shifter lover so this book was right on the money for me.  I however was not prepared for what I read.  This is Unique.  We have Dragon Shifters who live among the humans doing day to day things. Now with that said.In this story we have only a few Female Dragon Queens who must keep producing with hopes of having more females.  Females are worshipped and also been kidnapped.Carolyn is a human or at least she thinks she is. She keeps having vivid dreams and believes in her heart she is a dragon who is just late to shift.  Only a few believe in her.  Enter Reed who hates humans. But things change when Carolyn shifts and is kidnapped.Can Reed save Carolyn? And can Carolyn win Reeds heart?What a shock as to who has been kidnapping the female Queens.Pickup your copy of this awesome book and give it a read !!!"Complimentary copy provided  for my honest review."

I adored this book, it made me laugh and cry. I didn't want to put it down, it was just soooooo good. It's the best love story (Veronica & Finn) I have read, I will be re-reading this time and time again.Thank you Gina Gordon for writing such an awesome book!!

**Complimentary copy provided by author for an honest review**Seducing the playboy is another great enjoyable read in the Hot Night Series by Amanda Usen. Although this book is the second book in the series, and I have read and enjoyed the first one, I fell that this book could be very easily read as a standalone book without feeling lost or feeling like you are missing details.Jenna Cooper is a recent culinary graduate who is determined to be the one to save her failing family’s restaurant, Cooper’s. In order to do that she needs to pick the brain of Roman Gallagher, her brother’s best friend who is known for turning restaurants around. She’s looking to help him with his desserts, have him help her in return as well as finally getting her fantasy with her teenage crush, but she thinks she can have her way with the infamous playboy, get his help while getting him out of her system and then head back home to save Cooper’s. Roman on the other hand has a rule, don’t sleep where you eat on top of her being his best friend’s little sister, so he tries to fight the feelings and desire for her.This book is a really good enjoyable read. I really enjoyed the storyline and the buildup between these two characters. Jenna was a really great strong character who was out to prove everyone wrong and show that she could succeed. Mix that with Roman, a hard working dedicated chef working to succeed in his own way by proving to his mother he could take over the Gallagher empire and run things, while playing the playboy but realizing he wanted more. The buildup and the coming together of these two didn’t follow the normal pattern and I really found that refreshing. These two had some really great hot sexy scenes and I really enjoyed the banter between the two. I did find the start of the book to be a bit slow but once I got a bit in I found it to pick up and not lose momentum. Can’t wait to see more of these two in the upcoming books in this series and can’t wait to see who’s story is next and who’s going to heat the pages up and set things a blaze.

Rating:  4 1/2 starsI received a copy of this book from the publisher and the author in exchange for an honest review.  I was not compensated in any way.I feel that this book should come with a warning - it's going to make you hungry.  Our author shows her readers that there are all different types of hunger and she definitely knows how to feed that need.  She also does a great job of seducing and teasing her readers.  There's just enough to get a reader's imagination flowing.  And then there are the fantasies.  The sad part is that you can get this book read in one day.  I'm glad to see this is a series. Into The Fire is the first book of the series should you need to get caught up.  Another sad part is that I can't find anything about book three.  We'll just have to be patient.
summary: This Book Will Leave You Hungry For More

reviewText: Holy Hotness, Batman! Avery Flynn is as yum as her characters are. This is the second book in the Killer Style Series and I have to admit I read This Years Black in one sitting.Allegra `Ryder' Falcon is a heroine that had me smiling from the first chapter. After having a one night stand imagine Ryder's surprise when he shows up. I enjoy Ryder sass and determination to keep it all business but really how can she resist Devin? I know I couldn't.Devin now here is an absolute charmer, sexy, witty he definitely hits the top of my hotness meter. He needs one of the best investigating firms to uncover who has been taking money from the family company what he did not expect to find is the one who left him old.Want to read more go to: [...]
summary: Sizzing PR Presents: This Year's Black by Avery Flynn Spotlight  & Review

reviewText: Non Spoiler Review**NetGalley provided me with a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for my honest review."This Year's New Black" almost lives up to the hype amassed by the book's synopsis. It is a decent read with a healthy balance of Romance, Mystery & Humor. While the book is a decent read, I honestly wouldn't read it again. But I would recommend this book to readers of the Romance Genre. I will however consider reading more from this author.Ryder is an all black wearing badass chick, who is hired to find an embezzler that stole millions of dollars right from under Devin's nose. With a looming deadline above their heads Ryder and Devin are forced to team up and catch this criminal or risk ruining their careers. And trying to fight the attraction that still lingers over them, even after their one night stand, proves to be difficult for Ryder who places herself on a one year commitment free dating period. As the mystery unfolds both Ryder & Devin will reveal secrets from their past but will they be able to be able to catch a criminal and make it out alive?
summary: Decent read with a healthy balance of Romance, Mystery & Humo

reviewText: For whatever reason, I started following author Avery Flynn on Facebook. Maybe she is a friend of a friend? Really, I haven‘t a clue how I found her. Anyway, she has been heavily promoting her new book and seems to think it totally rocks. As she seems normal enough, and I was very intrigued by the title - what does that even mean?? - I decided to give it a try.Overall, it is a pretty good book. Ryder the ass-kicking forensic accountant, and Devin  the rich boy turned MMA fighter turned department store executive, make a great couple.  Having them hook up for a single night before the story even begins is a nice set-up for a love conflict, and not one usually employed. The crime-solving aspect, the fashion world setting, the traveling to an exotic locale all make for a fun read. It’s a simple, fluffy romance, masquerading as an action novel. Oh, and there is loads of sexual chemistry, and some very hot sex.The forward story is written fairly well. The backstory, however, is not. The book reads as if the author just plugged information into dialogue to bring the reader up to speed. The first conversation in the entire book is one in which the two characters present announce the age of the other person. “You’re too cynical for a 25 year old,” he says, and she responds by also listing a quality of his and stating his age. Who speaks like that?Later in chapter one, Ryder has a conversation with her brother in which they both repeatedly state their relationship. I am positive that both little sister Ryder and big brother Tony are well aware they are siblings and do not require reiteration of this point in conversation. Repeatedly.The worst example of this telling through unnecessary dialogue is with Ryder and her friends, at a coffee shop. The scene involves only her two besties and her, yet when they get on the topic of Ryder’s last Terrible Boyfriend, the two friends give a detailed account of what was bad about the relationship and what ultimately ended it. As if they are telling this to someone unfamiliar with the story instead of to Ryder herself. What is most puzzling about this exchange is how thoroughly unnecessary it is. A few chapters later the story of Ryder and her crappy ex is revealed in a smoother and more appropriate manner. Why then bother with the strange coffee shop conversation?The main story is written pretty well so why the author used such a clunky method to fill in these blanks is beyond me. I think she can do better.I also think she needs a new proofreader, because it is “guerilla” warrior, not “gorilla” warrior. Right in the middle of a serious scene, the precursor to the climactic battle, and I get an image of two apes bashing each other. Which is not at all what actually happens in the final battle scene, btw. I thought the mistake was funny, and then (regretfully) wondered what gorilla warfare would actually entail. It is much more gruesome and disturbing than I expected.Avery Flynn shows promise as a writer, and I am hoping she steps up her game in the future. The badass romance novel heroine is a favorite character of mine, and seems to be Ms. Flynn’s specialty. If she works past that telling conversation mud pit I will happily join the ranks of her fans.
summary: Fun story, hot sex, painful backstory

reviewText: Avery Flynn has a witty and sassy writing style and I just love it! This is the third book of hers I've read - the second Killer Style novel - and loved every page. Really enjoyed the premise of this story and the characters had spunk. The chemistry and dynamic between the two main characters was great. Brava, Ms. Flynn! More, please! :)
summary: Avery Flynn is always in style

reviewText: Candace Shaw has a nice way of making you connect with the characters in her books.  I found this book to be interesting and well written.  I thought the storyline was cute and entertaining. The characters evolved nicely and I totally enjoyed reading about them.  I look forward to reading the next book in this series.

Finally Mine was a fun read for me. Vin was a lovable bad boy and I liked Keira, she didn't take Vin's crap and she called him out on everything, plus she had a touch of bad ass, I liked hearing her stories about her car racing with her mom. Their story entertained me and kept me reading straight through from start to finish. The sweet, tender moments between Vin and Keira made me sigh, I loved seeing them just being themselves with the other. Keira never cared that Vin was from the wrong side of the tracks and when Keira ended up on that side of the tracks herself, Vin did everything he could to keep her safe, even though some of his ideas (like him pushing her away) made me want to shake him lol! We also get great secondary characters with Keira's BFF's, Lily and David. They were fun and I liked how they took Keira under their wing. Overall I really liked Finally Mine, I liked the writing and banter and Anne gave me a nice blend of drama, romance, steamy swoony moments and a few action scenes that made my heart pound. I look forward to the next book (about a different couple, don't worry this is a stand-alone)

just finished reading Taylor Stevens’ The Vessel, atasty little morsel of a novella/Kindle Single. Last week I reviewed The Catch by Stevens and loved it. This read was a superb follow up.If you have not read any of the Vanessa Michael Munroe series, this little read is a fantastic way to enter the pool. It works well as a stand alone, as do any of her books. After you’re done reading this, though, you won’t be able to resist reading her other books (unless you hate action, drama, and a great story).If you are a reader of the series, this will really float your boat (or your Vessel). This is book 3.5 of the series, and the ideal follow up to The Doll, filling in some of those holes left at the end of the story.Get on it, read this one. It’s a fantastic quick read. Fun and fast moving, perfect for an afternoon at the beach. And, at $0.99, it’s the perfect price!!!!
summary: Perfect bite of Vanessa Michael Munroe at a perfect price!

reviewText: I felt compelled to write a brief note, and will expand this review when I have the time.  Transhuman and Subhuman is outstanding, highly recommended commentary on science, science fiction, and fantasy.  Wright kicks off and scores with his first essay on Transhumanism, and follows it up with essays on how to write fiction (clear instructions with examples), Swordplay in science fiction and a movie review...His review of Peter Jackson's "Desolation of Smaug" is worth the price of admission, a very funny telling of Wright's own meltdown as he watched Tolkien's fine book destroyed by artistic license and stupidity.My highest recommendation, the writing is first class and the thoughts are deep.

This is Book 5 in the Bride Series from Montana Born Books. I know that I have said it before, but I am sucker for these books. I love how they are interweave with each other.This is Monty and Risa's story. Monty is a soldier that has seen the horrors of war in Afghanistan finds something special in Risa a girl he meets on leave and proposes to her after only knowing her for 1 week, he feels that with her he can have the happiness he never thought he could, but while deployed Risa because of personal things that happen (I don't do spoilers) takes off and buys a flower shop in Marietta. When Monty returns home and finds that Risa has taken off and didn't tell him, he tracks her down. They decide to get to know one another and see what happens.I thoroughly enjoyed the story and in a way reminded me of my own parents. I wanted to give the story 5 stars, but there were some discrepancies that distracted from the story. I still recommend the novella and if you are following along with the rest of the Bride Books, you will enjoy it.

This was a quick read for me, a heart felt story about how two people get over problems and love again. Risa is a florist who returns to Marrietta Montana while Monty was on tour in Afghanistan. Light, fun romantic read! This story is part of the bride series of books based all in the same small town! Recommended!!

As a reader, found myself drawn into this story from the first sample pages. I just had to read more, so I purchased a copy and kept going.Ella is a well-rounded character whose story is believable and heart-warming. She is searching for answers, for purpose, and a place, and she finds all of those in a growing friendship with a homeless boy. After an unexpected twist, she discovers that there's more to Ayden's story than she knew.The only thing that holds me back from giving this a five star is that I almost felt as if Ayden's unexpected twist made things a little too easy in some ways. However, from the way the book ends and the blurb for the second book, I think that Kai Strand will address this in the next book.I am thankful for the clean, sweetness of the characters in spite of the grittiness of their lives and situations.
