The characterization and world-building (setting and background) is very well done. The writing drew me in and held me close to the hearts of the characters.
summary: Draws You In and Holds You Close

reviewText: Finally the story of Parker and Kaitlin, first seen really in book 4 (featuring Ash and Emily).  Parker is Ash's best friend while Kaitlin and Emily are friends.  We learned in book 4 of the series that Parker grew up with foster families, until he met Ash's dad and hence Ash.  In this story we see more of his story, and learn he has a lot of trauma to overcome from his past.  Kaitlin's special psychic skills are just hinted at in book 4 but shown in this book.  Parker needs Kaitlin to ease his pain and accept him with all his scars, emotional and physical, while Parker is someone Kaitlin can touch without pain due to her special gifts.  In other words, they are of course perfect for each other.  The timeline in this book is parallel the one in book 4, same events and timing but from the perspective of Kaitlin and Parker of course.These books in this series are all on the shorter side, but Sabrina York manages to pack a lot of emotional punch in a very short work.  This one, like the others, I wish there was more to the back story, but was there is interesting and packed.  These could all have been 300+ page books given what happens packed into 100 pages or so, but this author is able to pull it off again and again.I can't wait for the next in the series, hopefully Drew or Patrick maybe?  I would love to see more of both of these characters.I received a copy of this book from the publisher via Netgalley for an honest review.
summary: My favorite so far in the series!

reviewText: This story is about the relationship an Earth woman who has a diplomatic job at a space station has with an advanced alien race who have adopted the "crude" Earthlings and her attempts to find a place in the Station hierarchy and among friends and station residents.The main character is a woman struggling to understand what is expected of her in her job and to manage the quirky and sometimes conflicting feedback she gets from the aliens who "oversee" her job.  Under the guise of being given a "gift" of free dates by her friend in the alien run "dating service" that is operating on the station, our heroine helps to expose criminals and shifty elements operating on the space station. Unfortunately for her, SHE thinks she is just going on a simple blind date!Amusing adventures and exasperating capers await her on her "supposed" dates.At the heart of the story is good old fashion hope and romance with the book having a HEA.  This not an erotic novel and does not feature strong sexual content (really none at all) but the story is very engaging, fun, and ultimately a good old fashion HEA.It's well worth your time to read and download.  I think those who enjoy a sweet Sci Fi Romance with a HEA will enjoy the story.
Ms. Bradshaw has done it again! Didn't want to put it down & waiting impatiently for her next book. Totally enthralling & delightful!!

The saga of Rainey Bell and her penchant for stepping into trouble continues.  What starts as paying last respects to one of her father's friends ends up with Rainey in deep water, in handcuffs, fighting for her life yet again.  Ms. Bradshaw has penned another nail biter with twists and turns to keep the reader guessing and turning the pages to see what next befalls our hero and her family.  Bound to be another award winner for this talented author.
Note to author: a proofreader is not optional. Get one soon and resubmit this work to Amazon -- your professional credibility is seriously at stake with the typos in this version.
summary: Great action and style. Nice take on apocalypse.

reviewText: Freed, was about growing and the characters finding themselves in this book. At the end of Used they all seemed a little lost, well maybe a lot lost and I think in real life we are all lost over something that is happening in our lives at one point or another. In Freed we as the readers got to see the growth in Denver. The Author had a way in her writing that made us feel Demver’s highs and lows to want to support her in everything she did and decided to do. Ransom, oh Ransom what do I say about him! I wasn’t too sure about him in Used but he made me in Freed. The was he spoke to Denver while in the bedroom was HOT! Even out of the bedroom he wore his heart on his sleeve for her. You could feel the love. I really enjoyed the first and second book in this series! I give this book 4 stars!-Harper

If I could give this book more than a 5 star review I definitely would! I read it all in one sitting! It was just that good of a book. Angel is now under Roman's control. After falling pregnant, she feels that she will now be connected to him for life. She tries numerous times to talk to and see the one man she loves, Kevin. After failing several attempts, Roman's mob beats up Kevin sending him to the hospital. During an outing with her roommate, she sneaks off to see Kevin. Angel eventually loses the baby from all the stress and Roman tells her it's over and leaves, without even a goodbye. Angel is free from his control and runs to Kevin's house, where she confesses her love for him. I highly recommend this book along with the other book that goes with this one. They were such awesome reads!Reviewed by: Amber Cromer

This book has an interesting and compelling story that really grabs hold of the reader... Followed far too often with silly dialogue or unbelievable decisions or plot holes and gaps that are incredibly frustrating.I wanted more history about this universe. I wanted a more believable plot within the pretty believable universe. It reminded me a bit of the fifth element in a good way. Some characters were brilliant even if over the top... I'm looking at you Ivan!But this is ruined for me partially by weird or silly things. A bar, no a private bar on a military ship only for spec ops guys. A spec ops guy who brags like a PX ranger with no idea about operational security but wait that's ok because the private bar complete with bar tender is only for people with double top secret clearance. And because he gets a threesome outa the deal.Or later a ship is in danger and even though it could shell the target earlier, inexplicably can't or won't later because it's convenient. And hey huge other problem but let's just run away instead of attempting to take out the potentially universe ending problem... But it's ok because the author wanted to fit a clever deus ex machina that only worked because they we're followed... And video chatted... With the bad guy in the right place... And jeopardized the whole ship to do it...This author can and will go on to write some great books. He needs a couple sci fi editors, a couple navy guys, maybe an infantryman or marine. People to give the books a bit more realism. It really won't take all that. Maybe just some research and a choice editor or beta readers.But I hope the author puts out more books, I will read them! And definitely worth reading at twice the price.

I buy books for their stories. I'm not a romance reader really. I bought this based on the reviews and am glad I did. This was a fun story with a lot of suspense and great plot twists. I really felt for her as she described her musical career and her quest to find love. I especially liked the descriptions of music and each character. Great read. Very highly recommended.

reviewerName: Sheri V "For the Love of Bookends"
reviewText: I really enjoyed this story, it’s a quick read and a great start to a new series. Both Aimee and Kenton are great characters, and Aimee’s ex adds a nice level of suspense and tension to the story.I highly recommend this story, it has tension, conflict, lots of romance and left me feeling their love.I received a copy in exchange for my honest review. I was not compensated for my review.
Love this series

I thought I might read this novella because it was free and before I started Inked Armor. This follows Chris who works with Hayden at the tattoo parlor. It's just a small peek into the beginnings of Chris and Sarah's relationship in the aftermath of Tenley leaving Hayden to head back home. Not sure how necessary it is but not much is revealed in this novella and about 15% of it is a look at the start of the next book.
summary: Doesn't seem to be a necessary read

reviewText: Super good, just like the other ones. Each character is so perfectly written and different from all others. This is not a group of friends made up of carbon copies.I love this book as much as the others in the series. Once you try one, you're hooked and devour each book.Cecilia did it again. Highly recommended.

Reviewed by Deltafor TheRomanceReviews.comAny time you can effortlessly combine porn stars and police to make a sexy, drama-filled read, it’s a win in my book! In this third book in the <i>Texas Nights</i> series, Ms. Browning takes the reader on a fun and frisky journey featuring a very private heroine who will steal your heart.When officer Beck Childress gets a call about a break-in at Eden Durant’s restaurant, he immediately goes into panic mode. Beck wants Eden with an almost debilitating ferocity and being so close to her in such a charged situation makes him insane with desire. Eden isn’t immune to the sexy lawmaker, but she can’t afford to let the man get to know the real her. Maybe she can just sleep with him, scratch the itch, without her heart getting involved…Beck knows Eden is holding something back, and when it becomes clear that someone is targeting her and her business, he makes it his mission to learn more about the woman who stole his heart the second he laid eyes on her. Eden knows that if Beck or anyone else learned the truth about her past, she’d get run out of town, destroying the peaceful life she’s created for herself in Shelbyville. Can Eden protect her heart from the man who wants to steal it?PROBLEMS IN PARADISE is the third book in the <i>Texas Nights</i> series and if you thought the others were delicious, you ain’t seen nothin’ yet! Both fast-paced and well-written, PROBLEMS IN PARADISE will touch you in myriad ways, leaving you wanting more. I loved Eden and Beck together, especially the contrast of this stoic cop vs. the porn star’s daughter. Eden’s reasons for staying away from Beck were actually legit and realistic, not just overreaction like in a lot of books.Beck was a great lead character, though I was kind of put off by the lack of consequences given to the people around him who were causing trouble, especially his own sister. I can appreciate wanting to protect your family, but man, was Clare a terrible troublemaker. I think that Ashton said it best when she explained that “spoiled rich girls can get up to a lot of trouble when they’re bored.”  I hated that Eden couldn’t stand up for herself or even confide in anyone even though everyone wanted to be there for her. Overall, this is an excellent addition to a terrific series, and one I wholeheartedly recommend.
I really enjoyed reading how the H/h worked toward reaching their HEA. This is the first book I've read written by Marie Harte but it will certainly not be my last!

I love a really good contemporary romance - especially when it involves a hot Marine!!! ;)'A Major Attraction' was a great start to the new Good To Go series from Marie Harte.Hot & sexy with a healthy dose of passion and tension.. Marie writes a great story with a good bit of 'will they/won't they' thrown into the mix!!!I liked the characters of both Kyle and Olivia - though at one point I could quite happily have started slapping Kyle and not stopped!!!I thoroughly enjoyed book one and I'm really looking forward to more in this series!!Definitely recommend this series to both fan of Marie's and those who have not yet read her work!!** I received an ARC of AMA from the publisher in exchange for an honest review. **
summary: Great start to a new series!!

reviewText: “Two Can Play” is an erotic romance novel set in an exotic locale—Venice, Italy, where two people with their own painful pasts manage to connect and blossom into love.When Katrina meets Aaron, he’s just tried to steal her cab in the pouring rain—when she jumps in too, they’re instantly drawn to one another. They are both attractive Americans in Italy and are both millionaires (her through a Russian oil-tycoon father and him through the music business, though they keep this from each other). As they slowly get to know each other, they both realize that the emotional distance they from other people is breaking down—and they can’t keep their hands or their thoughts off of each other.I’ve really enjoyed the other K.M. Liss books I’ve read, and “Two Can Play” is no exception—she has a talent for writing likeable characters who aren’t perfect but who have interesting backstories. The story is told in alternating perspectives, so you get to not only know the two main characters but also see how they view certain shared events in their lives. Katrina is emotionally wounded from a trauma in her past, and Aaron is a cocky womanizer—but he is able to be so tender and supportive of Katrina once he finds out her secret that he became my favorite male lead in Liss’s stories. The dialogue between them is sparkling and electric, and it allows you as a reader to see them connecting on more than a physical level (though physical connection is plentiful in the book as well)—in the end, their emotional compatibility makes them a couple you come to care about. The sex scenes are sensual and hot, and I also enjoyed the themes of family that run through the book—how it shapes us, how we handle it, and how there’s always the potential for change.I would recommend “Two Can Play” to readers who enjoy romance, erotica, and character-driven fiction.
summary: Erotic Romance Set in an Exotic Locale

reviewText: Sam Crescent has done it again and given us another hot MC read.  We're back with Chaos Bleeds and this story revolves around Ripper and Judi.  Hot, sexy, and tender.  Recommend!

I have been looking for a good pressure cooking cookbook, so I can save some time on my daily cooking and yet whip up meals like beef stew.  My husband likes tender meat that practically falls off the bones, so a pressure cooker is a savior for cooking meals like that.  Pressure Cooking Cookbook for the Healthy you has easy to prepare recipes that truly are healthy and I like that it includes pressure cooking tips and guidelines, such as safety.  It has a lamb stew recipe to die for!
summary: Lots of Healthy Recipes for a Great Price

reviewText: I was given this book for an honest review and I have to say that it got better and moved more smoothly than the first book. We got to see some of the things that young people think about when they're falling in love for the 1st time. It reminded me of what it was like to be "in love" all those years ago in high school. I believe that teenagers would be able to relate to this well. It would be a good series for teens to read to let them see that what they're feeling and going through is what many have gone through before them. Young love is exciting. It seems to depict a teenage boy's thoughts pretty accurately. All in all the book left me curious about book 3.

I've read lots of meditation books already and this is another book which has good information about meditation. There are new things I've learned from this book too like there's different meditation style depending on religion and as to why meditation is getting popular lately.

This was a hard book to keep reading because I knew it was the last to be written about Ava and Mason and i didn't want it to end.  The story still brought the twist and turns and amazing hotness after them being together for 20 years.  The hell they go through and always finding their way back to each other.  This series was amazing.  The way D H Sidebottom closed out the series was just wonderful and I haven't seen a writer do it that way before.  Cheers to Dawn for an amazing series that captures you from the first page all the way to the last.... <3
summary: A fantastic ending to an amazing series

reviewText: Oh god I don't know where to even start with this...... We all know how the last book ended, if tore out our hearts, So we all know what D H  is capable of. SO as you can imagine I was TERRIFED to read this book. Literally shaking when I picked up my kindle. BUT I am so happy that I did.  The subject the book ended on is a sore point for me. After having went threw this with some family members one of which was my dad it cut me so deep. I was afraid at what way it would be portrayed. BUT I shouldn't of feared a thing. DH had it in the bag from the beginning.And what she did, showing one side of this EVIL thing that can tear apart family's in the matter of minutes was AMAIZNG. She showed the side of what happen's to the people closet to you. YES what the person is going threw is HORRIFIC and no words can do it justice. BUT people forget that its not only the Sick that are put threw the ringer. The family take the punches right right there with them. She showed this AMAZINGLY!This book was such a bitter sweet one. I wanted to hate DH so much while reading it. But my heart loves this author so much that I couldn't. I REALLY REALLY wanted to but I couldn't. Even thought parts of this ripped my heart right outta my chest and into millions of little pieces my love for DH just shone threw BECAUSE she no matter what was giving us More Mason and Ava. This was the good bye....There will be no more, and even writing that I'm getting a lump in my throat. I feel like because of how DH created them that I know them, yeah know? Like I'm gonna head down the local the weekend and there gonna be there with waiting open arms.....This book may have been the end BUT Mason and his Little Warrior will live on forever in the people who LOVE the ground that there fictional feet walk on. This will be a series I will turn to again and again, no matter how much it tears me apart.And the best way to look at DH is, as I've recently said to her.....She is this Evil Sadistic Mother figure who created Mason and Ava. SO at the end of the day she done what was best for her 'Kids' And I for one am happy that I got to meet them and go along for the ride. After all what A ride it was..... <3

Ahh..Mason and Ava Fox, right from the very first book they gutted us with their love story, but we kept rooting for them and falling more in love with these characters. Now with FORTITUDE, the final conclusion of the Heart of Stone series, we are once again glued to the story. Get ready for another emotional ride when reading this book. My heart was pounding, I was hyperventilating, screaming at my kindle but I was also smiling, laughing and sighing at the beautiful deep love these characters have. I am a huge fan of D H SIDEBOTTOM who is a brilliant author that manages to consume you with her writing . ***** A fantastic Climatic Conclusion to this great addictive series*****

I've been on the emotional roller coaster ride of Mason & Ava. I laughed, I cried, I wanted to punch the wall! Just WOW! The depth of their love prevails & pulls them through. So glad they had their HEA. The entire series was amazing & worth reading!

The author did an excellent job discussing cameras and the elements they carry.  Ad she did it in a fun easy to understand approach. I enjoyed thins book a lot. I enjoyed how she included physical ailments that are connected to the Chakra when they are out of balance or closed.
summary: A good book to study Chakras

reviewText: The story was great but the lack of editing was a real distraction. A little time spent on details would have made it so much better.

All four books in the Grey Wolf Pack series are a must read. They are not the usual mundane cliche Werewolf stories. Exciting story lines, and the characters  have engaging personalities. Each book could be read as a stand-alone, but it's more interesting to read the complete series. There's something In each book for everyone's reading pleasure. Comedy, intrigue, Murder, love and we all know where there's a big strong sexy arrogant wolf, there's gonna be sex.

The Rose, VS shifter series has it all.  Erotic romance, mystery and humor.  However, the editing has mot been done well at all.  Some of it has to be read at least twice to figure out cc what is who"!  Regardless, still looking forward to book 5.

As good as the others , better sense the 2 main characters Melody & Hans seem to despise each other but can't stay away, buy, read & trust me you will love this story. I've read every one of these books in the series & they just keep getting better &better. My only wish is that she'd write faster!
LOVE E.A. Price's Books!!!!! Great Stories and Great Value!!! ;)

This was another great awe-inspiring love story by Cardeno C. I began the story and couldn't put it down. The developing relationship between Reg and J.J. was sweet and loving and downright erotic...it certainly called to the hopeless romantic that I am. I highly recommend this book and 5 stars fails to explain how great this story is to me!

REVIEWI was delighted to be asked to do this review as I think my favourite book boyfriend has to be the rock star. This book is a M/M love story with a rock star at its core. When Jeremy Jameson or JJ met Reg Moore in a back street bar he didn't in his wildest dreams think he would find a best  friend never mind the love of his life! JJ comes from a family of celebrities and a life of fame and fortune, but no love. Reg is almost the opposite and he strives to show JJ how important love and friendship is. JJ takes Reg on tour with him and Reg slowly shows JJ how good love is. JJ never thought he was gay until he eventually fell in love with Reg. Their love is passionate but very sweet at the same time. I love how a simple touch of the hand from Reg can instantly calm JJ down. Reg is very touchy feely with JJ and it turns out that this is just what JJ wants and needs. They have a lot to overcome from the paparazzi to insiders trying to sell sex tapes, but they do it together. Reg is strong for JJ and the two balance each other. I have to say that these two softies just made me want to go annah! They really are just perfect together. If you want a beautiful love story with some hot sex and a rock star then this book is perfect. It really does deserve to be read. I am going to go and look for other books by this author and will spread the word on how great this book is. I give it 5 stars!!!!!

Jeremy has lead a very sheltered life. He is the child of two very well known celebrities, a A-list actress and a rock legend. As an adult he follows his father’s footsteps and becomes his own rock star known as The Jeremy Jameson . Life under the watchful eye of the paparazzi and adoring fans has become too much to handle. He is always heavily guarded and always told what to do and apparently how to feel.It is almost as if he’s living life in a fog. Not really caring about or connecting with anyone until he meets Reg, a friendly bartender in a no name town. Reg is lots of fun and Jeremy wants to have fun. He wants to hang out with a true friend and not worry whether people around him are using him for his influence.I liked Reg! He is carefree and full of adventure. He doesn't cater to Jeremy the way others do, he treats him as a normal person…a friend. It is exactly what Jeremy needs. The two became inseparable after Jeremy asks Reg to go on tour with him as his “boyfriend” although Jeremy claims to be straight. Having Reg with him would ensure that he doesn't get forced into making public appearances with annoying supermodels and the like by his manager. Jeremy is not at all bothered if the world thinks he’s gay. He shrugs it off like “So what, Who cares.”Reg and Jeremy start off as fast best friends but then their connection becomes so much more. It is a story about letting go of the past and learning to trust. I liked these two together, true love. A very sweet relationship. I loved how Reg would calm Jeremy’s freak outs! I only wish there was a little more to the story to fill in a few lingering questions but still a great read!
summary: 4-4.5 stars! I liked these two together, true love.

reviewText: I loved this story from the beginning to the end. Only thing is I wanted more to the end, but that's because I'm a sap and selfish lol.  I hope to find out more about them(sequel maybe, say yes!) to see how their relationship works outside of the road.

I absolutely love this book.  This is the type of the book that just makes me smile.  The characters have a good dynamic that makes for a great book.  Jeremy could have come across as a spoiled brat of a diva but actually makes me feel sympathetic toward the 'poor little rich boy'. He was so adorably vulnerable.  Reg was just my hero.  He was laid back but strong enough to stand up to Jeremy and protect him at the same time.Very well written.  I like this style a lot better than the home series where the author does flashbacks and flops back and forth between present and past.

This is a difficult review to write because I have such conflicting feelings regarding this book. Firstly, the two leads, Jeremy and Reg, are immensely appealing. Loveable and memorable characters are practically a Cardeno C. trademark, and this book is no exception, but there wasn't a whole lot going on otherwise. Very little to no conflict, etc.- I didn't experience any breadth of emotion. Sure, I had a small slip of a smile throughout ( how can you not with those two?), but I wanted more. I need more from this author. And, however enjoyable, the plot was ludicrous. Thankfully, I'm a master of suspended belief.I'm neither expecting nor desiring a literary masterpiece, but I would like something to chew on, something with substance rather than being spoon fed complacent fluff.That disappointment aside, I still liked the book. I'd still read and purchase it again. See? Entirely conflicting. But, if you're already a fan of Cardeno C. I'd say go for it- with the above issues in mind. However, if you're a new reader of this author I'd recommend first reading: "Walk With Me", The Mates Series, "More Than Everything" to get a better glimpse of her capabilities.

I’ve attempted to knit before with very little success. I decided that this time I need some help, and so I downloaded this book. The pictures are really helpful, and this book has so much information! Now for me to try and make a scarf with the help of this guide. An awesome book!
This book tells you everything you need to know to start knitting. I think beginners would learn the basics and be able to start knitting without a lot of frustration  .

Got this for my sister who is currently pregnant. She has learned quite a bit of helpful information from this book and has been implementing it to ensure a healthy pregnancy. Would recommend this to any pregnant soon-to-be mother.

Because pregnancy is more than just baby-showers, cravings, and rainbows, this book takes care of everything you need to know from the first trimester until delivery time. I personally can think of two uses for this book, give it to a couple that wants to have a child, and the other is give it to whoever you see that wants a child like if it is a new doll and help them understand how things really are before they go do something they are not ready for. It is a really good read, I recommend it.
I just finished book 2 in this series! I can't say enough how much I loved them!! I can't wait for the 3rd one to come out!! 2015 can't get here fast enough!

Wife Tales was a great introduction to these"best friends". Troi was on point and gave you just enough of a storyline on each character that left you wanting more. Hopefully we won't have to wait long for part 2 because the drama just starting. The ending was something I didn't expect.

Checked this out to help a young couple planning a wedding. Less stuffy than more traditional etiquette books, easy to understand. Covered a lot of topics. "Wedding Planning" is my first purchase and I blazed through it. It stresses the fact that planning is key to a successful day, and then proceeds to take you step-by-step. Easy to read, lots of helpful tips on questions to ask and what to look for if you've never planned a wedding before or dealt with certain vendors.

Looking for a wedding guide, then this book is for you.You are engaged, the wedding preparations have to start, and this book has the right guidance for everything. Starting with how to pick the perfect wedding dress for yourself, great ideas for your announcements to how to make that all fun.It gives advice on to write your wedding vows, covers all the necessary details like choosing colors, flowers and cake.I found this book to be well written, every detail is considered, even a emergency kid.Planning a wedding is lots of work, and this book is definitely a great helper.

Terry Towers is one of my favorite authors, and she doesn't disappoint again! This one follows Samantha, who is a party girl and also a model. But when she spirals out of control,, her mother sends her to a cowboy farm for her to be (ahem) trained by Connor. But Connor, a hot cowboy, who is known to be hard and dominant, finds himself taken in by Samantha's charms.I love this book!! I love the ending, and I love Connor and Samantha. Highly recommended!
Just the right amount of romance and drama.  Wasn't overdone or simplistic, they both had problems and grew together.  They both healed and learned to love and trust...good read
AMAZING! I couldn't put it down once I started and was left wanting slightly a little more...perfect storyline though and just what I needed.

4/5 starsThis novella is one of the stories in Dark and Deadly.  It's my first time reading Alyssa Day's writing.  I actually have enjoyed this novella because of the right tinge of humor, romance, and supernatural all together.  I wish it is longer.  I want to read more of the Cardinal Family's craziness, especially Sue and Granny.  I am guessing that this story is a spinoff of "The Warriors of Poseidon" since three of the main characters (Alaric, Ven, and Lord of Justice) from that series have played a little role in this book.  I am now inclined to read that series, most especially Ven who is also married to a witch.
I wish writers would say chapter 1.  It gets aggregating when you get into a book and then it ends.  BUT the chapter itself was a really good read so far.
summary: Mostly good read, but not enough could have been a 4 or 5.

reviewText: Very exciting but too short.  I like to read longer books.  I have to buy the rest to find out what happens.

I know nobody cares if a book has a dumb title. Anyway, like Black's vampire series, CORA'S CHOICE, this thing takes off like a rocket. Maybe you don't like a "bad girl" who, uh, leaps on top of a situation, but, boy, I do! Also, this is another side of the same world described in the CORA series, and that is really fascinating. There are all kinds of paranormal beings in this world, and I hope she does a series about every one of 'em-- it would make such a fascinating layered experience. Also hot.

If Marvel had to make a middle grade novel, this is what they would have made. Like a young Peter Parker, Seefer Elliot learns how to deal with his abilities while being faced with adversity he may not be ready for. Without ever saying it, I could help but hear Uncle Ben’s iconic “With great power, comes great responsibility” in Officer Booth’s speech at the turning point. Whether he lives by that credo or not, Seefer Elliot demonstrates that his abilities do not necessarily grant him an easy path through life.

I received a copy of this book in exchange for my honest review.Many times the second book/movie/etc doesn’t quite live up to the original, and this is one of those cases where it manages to surpass it. Following the brutally gut wrenching ending of Evolution: ANGEL, Candice is left to pick up the pieces of herself and face two huge new threats, the minions of HEX, and her heart.The story had a great pacing that balanced the romance, action, and everything else well without overdoing anything in particular. We get to see more of the other ANGELs both in and out of action, and get the full story on a few things that hadn’t been explained in the first book.True to format though, not only does SAGE leave some fun story threads dangling out there for us to tug on later, it leaves off on one heck of a ‘to be continued’ moment!

This is a fun concept, expertly executed!  It never gets dull because the magical umbrella works differently on different people.  Learning its tricks is part of the fun.The romance is sweet and clean.  The book is well-written and well-edited, and it has a very attractive design.  I am grateful to the authors for the review-copy.We follow the four adult grandchildren on their umbrella-and-love-discovery, and we also follow the late-romance of the executor of the grandmother's estate.What about the morality of magically making people love you?  That is dealt with too, but the grandchildren are all moral people, so as they discover the power they have in their hands, then make the right decisions.The characters all feel like people one would want to know in real life.This is light reading divided into chapters that make for nice sized reading bites, that each tell a complete story.  Together, the chapters tell a bigger story.It's Raining Men (and women) is a romantic comedy, but heavier on the romance than on the comedy.  This quote from one of the grandchildren explains the quest of each of them:"A deep feeling of satisfaction coursed through me.  I knew I had found my place in the universe.  And suddenly, I knew I could tell her my whole story, without reservation, and she would understand."
summary: Sweet, clean romance with a fun concept, likeable characters, exotic locales, quality product

reviewText: I love the character's in this series as each book feature a couple and the character's are made real,I hope Marie treanor does more books in this series I will try more of her books but waiting for more serafina

This was a beautiful western romance! I loved the story of Rebecca and Seth.The storyline grabbed me from the beginning and held my attention until the end.I would love it if the author wrote the story of Rachel and Jason. Looking forward to new stories by Melissa Maygrove.

I really enjoyed this book. It was a sweet read. It had my attention from the get go. From the beginning I thought OH my what is going to happen to her after the train left. She was so resourceful. Becca and Seth was ment to be. I  would recommend this book.

“I’ll never take you further than you can handle, but I will take you to the edge. I will give you more pleasure than you ever thought possible.”For King and Country is the debut Erotic Romance from Geneva Lee. What a way to begin her journey into the writing world, this book is beyond erotic and addictive.Clara is an American living in England; she has graduated with her degree from Oxford University and is ready to start her career. Life is predictable and boring until the night of her graduation reception lands in her in the presence of a mysterious stranger. In his arms under the spell of his magical lips, that is. Left swooning and more than a little confused by the encounter that has left her with an unsatisfied ache, Imagine Clara’s surprise when she finds herself on the cover of a tabloid the following day in the arms of her mysterious and magical mouthed stranger…the Prince of England…The characters for king and country are sharp, quick witted and just plain fun to spend time with. Even the ones you will learn to despise and there are more than a few, just so you know. Clara has secrets from her past that she is trying to move on from and leave in the past and well Alexander is a member of the royal family, so his closet has more dirty laundry than a Laundromat. This does nothing to dampen their attraction for one another. It seems to fuel it, even. The sneaking around, the thrill of being caught only fuels the inferno that rages between them. Clara and Alexander have both agreed that this relationship is a physical one only; feelings will not enter into the equation. We can all see where this plan is dubiously flawed am I right?“Alexander intoxicated me. Without his touch, I forgot how to breathe. He had become the center of gravity I returned to after being stretched past my limits.”Alexander is dominant, secretive, seductive and relentless in the pursuit of what he desires and he desires Clara. Clara is intelligent, sassy, and jaded from a previous relationship. She is independent, unattached. She is powerless to resist the draw Alexander has on her body, against her own better judgement. This man that reduces her to a proverbial puddle no matter how she tries.“If you run, Clara. I will follow you.”Beyond erotic, For King and Country is a sublime debut. Erotic Romance at its best, you will become enslaved to Clara and Alexander’s story. I was completely enchanted. Royalty, scandal, secrets, villains, impeccable writing and pacing, beautiful characters… it’s brilliant. With scenes that are sensual, seductive, passionate and naughty, it’s a thrilling debut, to say the least. I cannot wait for In His Majesty’s Service  the next installment in this new series, that I already need to read, right now. You will be left as I was at the end of For King Country, breathless and panting, heartbroken and lusting for more.
summary: A debut that is erotic and intoxicating!

reviewText: WOW thank you for creating/writing such a story.  It was captivating all the way through.  A great author is one who can hold a readers attention and you definitely delivered.  This book had so much of everything and then some.  You won't regret picking this stellar book up, and so looking forward to book 2.

Aliens at the edge not interested in any from of relationship. Suddenly they seem to be up to something but no-one believes they will do anything. Meanwhile back on the human side lots of politics, infighting, corporations vs worlds and a general attitude that the military Re a waste - each corporation wants it's own. In the centre of this are the Legion, tough, uncompromising and great characters.When all hell breaks loose they are in the front line ... And there are also traitors working with the bad guys. If I have one gripe it is that I do not believe they could have masked their activities as completely as they seem to have. Hopefully book two will show more on this and also what the 'real' aliens look like and are motivated by. I'll leave that unclear, it' worth reading to understand this better.I will buy book two when it is out.
summary: military sci fi evil aliens and a lot of tech, good characters, blood, sweat and tears

reviewText: Great story, wonderful characters and action scenes that are so vivid, you are there right in the middle of it all. This is a narrative that's been well thought out and written so well. I am waiting with great anticipation for the rest of the series. All I can say at this time is 'very well done'.
summary: The best military science fiction I've read

reviewText: I think the ending could have been more but it did tie up the story nicely. I hope she puts all the books together now that she is done with this series.

Quick read at the end. I wish we could have got a little more detail about the pregnancy but I understand she can't talk about every little detail. Good ending. Wish there was one more when we could see the other alphas baby. (not going to spoil it for the readers;)

I so looked forward to part six in this shifter series having read all the other books and fallen in love with the characters. I did like this story but it felt a little rushed, and was suddenly over. I would have liked to see the author give Asch a little more attention towards the end of the story. All the same, it was great to be 'among the wolf community again', and I could happily recommend this story especially if you've read the other parts.  I'm hoping that Viola Rivard is true to her word and revisits the characters again in other books. A lovely series, lovable characters and an interesting story journey.
summary: So looked forward to part six of this lovely shifter series

reviewText: I gave the book four stars because I thought it could be longer, but I loved it. Can't wait to read about Mark Essien.
summary: When is the next book coming out?

reviewText: This book is very well written and it leanos no stone unturned. Finally you will find a guide that tells you how to use herbs and prevent and cure many illnesses, to strengthen immunity and many more!
This book is good it has a lot of twist and turns but long as you stay with it it shouldn't be a problem. I would say read it I couldn't stop.

Very simple and easy to use. I've tried a few of them and so far, they are good and it hasn't seemed like a big issue finding ingredients and cooking them. I will say I have done some little changes like not broiling and just toasting a low-fat english muffin. I have lost some weight with in a weeks time and feel it hasn't been hard doing so.

Lady Isabel Avenbury is a widow whose marriage was less than passionate and now she’s seriously considering taking a lover but before she can see to her own happiness, she must get her youngest sister properly married off. Acting as chaperone to Serena, at a country house party being held by the Marquis Lyndham and his mother to find him an appropriate wife from the many potential young brides available in the new Season, she hadn’t any intention of finding a lover there but then again, one must never say never.Seth Rowland the Marquis Lyndham understands he has a duty to his family, and has agreed to find himself a proper wife. Things change when Lady Isabel Avenbury enters his home with her young sister. Isabel catches his attention more than any other woman does in attendance. Even before Isabel married, Seth had noticed her and now she was here, in his home, looking as beautiful and desirable as ever, plus she was a widow. Everything told him his mother, and society would never approve of her as a wife but unable to keep himself from her, he was willing to settle for being her lover – or so he thought.The Ladies’ Book of Pleasures series by Jess Michaels centers around the naughty inspirations brought on by a book, which appears to have been written by a Lady of the ton - a book giving advice to the young Ladies of the ton on how best to give pleasure to their men as well as gain pleasure for themselves. A MATTER OF SIN, book one in the Ladies’ Book of Pleasures series is an enticing beginning to what I hope will continue to be an intriguing, fun, sexy, and eventually mystery solving series. What mystery, you might be wondering – who wrote the Ladies’ Book of Pleasures, of course. I already have my suspicions about who the author may, but can’t wait to make the journey through this series to find out if I’m correct.In the meantime, A MATTER OF SIN by Jess Michaels is delightful, beckoning, sexy, and romantically naughty according to society but keeps you turning the pages, and cheering for Isabel and Seth, for the ultimate in pleasure is falling in love and finding happiness together. I highly recommend this series starter if you love a country party filled with gossipy women, interfering friends and family, and sexy midnight trysts. A MATTER OF SIN by Jess Michaels is erotic historical romance at its best and this series is looking to promise even more as we all learn what the Ladies’ Book of Pleasures holds in store for us.***eARC provided by author in exchange for an honest and unscripted review.
summary: Fabulous beginning to a new Jess Michaels' series. She just keeps getting better and hotter.

reviewText: Good start to the series

This third book in the Deliver Us series is really a turning point. It had less of the darkness of the first two and wrapped up a lot of the storyline, while opening up a whole new avenue for the characters. I would not go into this if you haven't read the first two as it really is a continuation of the story.While Trace and Micah are the focus, Gabe, Dare, Kyle and Ben are very much involved. Although their secrets have previously come out, the effects are still rippling through the group and there may still be someone looking to hurt them. We now find out that Trace has a secret past that is threatening the business he has built and could potentially bring harm to the friends he considers his family. Trace finds the greatest comfort in his collared sub and lover Micah. Into the middle of all this worry, Trace's former lover Gray is paying a visit under the guise of an inspection of Diadem by the Master's Circle, but they too have unfinished business.Micah is also struggling to overcome his own personal losses. He has had an open marriage with Iliana and although she is aware of and involved with Trace, she is unaware of the extent of Trace and Micah's relationship. Although they had problems long before Trace entered the picture, Micah still loves her and does not want to end the relationship.This book begins an integration of the world created by Jack L. Pyke in the Don't...series as Trace was trained by the Master's Circle. I think the introduction of Gray, Jack and Jan into this story was well done and fans of that series would benefit greatly from reading this book. Also, if you have read Ms. Kelling's Whatever The Cost, you will be familiar with The Company, another one of Trace's past employers and just why Trace has good reason to be so scared. Enough background is given, however, so it is not necessary to have read these books.Lynn Kelling infuses plenty of emotion into the story, as well as a lot of hot and heavy BDSM. The interplay between the three couples continues to be quite complicated as lines between friends, Doms, subs and lovers continue to blur. This is definitely a must read for fans of the first two books.

The 27 recipes from this cookbook all look delicious and healthy. There are cookies, muffins, brownies, fudge,  chocolates and cakes.  I tried the chocolate hazelnut fudge bites and they were amazing. None left.... Next , I will be making the classic paleo chocolate cake.  Recipes are easy to follow and there is a full nutritional value for each one. Very happy with this cookbook.

Leo Kallstrom does a wonderful job at explaining what bitcoin is, how it works, and how it can be used as an investment option. This is the best guide on bitcoin's I've come across so far! Very informative read for beginners. Easy to grasp, quick to digest but full of top-notch pointers, this guide served me well as I ventured into this new territory! Highly recommended!
Considering the time and the personalities of those involved, I had expected a lengthy study so I was somewhat disappointed. The writing was good but depth was missing.
What's not to like with a little mystery, a little romance, and old high school drama.Read it for a look at family dynamics both good and bad.
Wonder where life will lead her next? Will she somehow find a way to continue and use her medical training?

This is book two in the Fierce series. Hunter and Autumn are at the prison waiting for Jessie to be released. When Jessie first comes out of the prison Hunter freezes, Jessie introduces himself to Autumn and when they are in the car Hunter and Jessie start to fight about Hunter joining the gang. Hunter joined because he wanted to get his brother out of jail, Jessie is the only family that Hunter has. Autumn defuses the fight by asking where they are going, Jessie wants to go home but Hunter doesn't want too. Autumn leaves Hunter after they have sex because it reminded her of the bullies back in school, The next day they talk their argument out. Hunter and Autumn go back to college while Jessie goes to find a job. They proceed to have another argument in class about him cheating. Autumn wants to know more about Hunter, but he doesn't want to talk about it. Hunter receives a call from Jessie saying that he got a job, the problem with Jessie and jobs is that he can never keep them. Hunter quits college and when his brother finds out he isn't very happy, he starts throwing things in the house. Autumn wasn't very happy when Hunter decided to quit because she thought that he wanted to make his brother proud. When she goes into the house she finds the notebook that he keeps his notes in so he can remember.Jessie is Hunter's brother, has ADD and becomes Hunters manager. Hunter becomes an MMA fighter, Autumn's boyfriend, to me he is a very loving,protective and loyal. Autumn is leafy and to me that she is a very loving caring and loyal person. She wants the best for Hunter.Jaret to me he is a wise and helpful person, Jessie's friend. Evie is Autumn's friend and roommate, to me that she is a very caring and loyal person.While reading this book I felt a lot of different emotions from happy to laugh out loud. One of my favorite quotes is “ So? I don't care. I told you I get what I want, and what I want is you.”Clarissa Wild does it again! I was hooked from being to end. I read this book in less then a day. I loved how all the characters came together.

Clarissa out did herself again. Just loved it. Couldn't get enough of Hunter and Autumn story. She made me laugh and cry. Everyone needs a Hunter in there life. He has a heart of gold. I would give it 6* if I could. You need to pick it up.

I just finished Flame and I really liked it. This is apart of the Fierce series, so you do have to start with Fierce to be able to really understand what is going on. Fury is followed by that so Fierce is Autumns point of view while Fury is Hunters point of view. If you have been following the series then you know this starts up where Fierce had left off. Hunter has in the past done some things that he is not proud of but he does them to take care of his family. This story is picking up from one of those things. He had been helping to get his brother out of jail. With this accomplished he and Autumn set off to go get Jessie. Hunter is still dealing with his insecurities and he even though he and Autumn are at a good place with her, still is scared that she will leave him. There is always obstacles in a relationship and they continue on in this one. Will the past and the present catch up with each? What will happen once he goes home and really shows her how his life was and still is? Can there be an understanding when the are so many insecurities? You will have to read and see....I really liked this story, to be honest I thought this one was better then the others. I think it was because for me they seemed realer? If that makes sense. They both have alot of things going on in their life and that to me felt real. I also thought that I had the story down and then things happened that I didnt see coming. I was shocked but love how it was intertwined in the story. It didnt come out to early, was just right on time. Love when an author can do that!I love Hunter. He is so sexy and so alpha when the time is right for it but is super sweet too. And he is a fighter, for his family.... What more could you ask for? Autumn is such a sweet girl and I just love how she is there for him no matter what. There is a time or two where she is not able to handle it but with persuasion it all unfolds really well. I can say that the chemistry between them to was HOT! No matter if it was in between the sheets or out. They will have you happy, sad, angry and horny that I have no doubt!Seriously, this was a good series to read and more importantly for me it had me at the get go. Trust me you do not want to miss out on this one. You will love it!Story 5Smut 5Overall 5Reviewed by Beggin from Mommys a Book Whore
Another fab book by Cali and I am looking forward to reading the rest of the series.  The characters are full of life and you get a real feel of them, good and bad.

Very interesting story, and something that probably happens way too often in this culture. The author writes well and this is well-paced with just the right amount of angst. My only complaint is that book 2 isn't out yet and that's always irritating when you're into the story and don't care to wait around forever to see what happens.
summary: Very interesting story, and something that probably happens way ...

reviewText: When I started reading this, I didn't know what I was in for.Eighty-four pages of stomach-roiling angsty goodness. This novella packs quite a wallop from page one until the end. I was entertained from the get-go and intrigued by each character. Plus, there's an excerpt at the end for the next book and I almost cried reading it.Paige and Mitch were sweethearts. Mitch was in college miles away from Paige. I think it's quite obvious from the title and the blurb that something happened and these two characters are dealing with the fallout. Mitch thought Paige deliberately trapped him thus compromising his future. What follows is some of the best I've read in a while. I hated Mitch but at the same time I felt that because his background it's easy to see why he would feel that way. He is flawed, flawed, flawed. I wanted to junk-punch him. I wanted to shake him and knock some sense into him.Paige was a likable heroine, which was a pleasant surprise. NA heroines are often unlikable and whiny to me but Paige wasn't. She made a mistake, a lie of omission but she was never cruel nor manipulative. I loved how she stood up for herself. But they were both young and made a mistake that affected their future. That said I'm looking forward to how the story continues in the next book.I also really liked the dual POVs and almost all of the secondary characters. Beverley Kendall is a new author to me but I'm really glad I read this book.Anyone who is looking for some angsty drama might want to pick up this book. I can't wait for the next one!

Loved this book.  Tasmin was such a free spirit.  Loved Marcs and Jasons banter was funny. Was glad that Marc was able to get past his illness being a disability and to go after what he wanted; his woman.

We’ve all dreamed up the perfect man at some point in our lives.  He looks different for each of us, but I think that we can all admit that we have dreamt of him.  In Dreams of Perfection by Rebecca Heflin our heroin is best selling romance writer Darcy Butler.Darcy has just hit the big 3-0 and her biological clock is ticking big time.  The problem is that a traumatic breakup in her past has left her with a deep seeded fear of commitment that prevents her from going on more than 1 date with any guy.  That is, until the man of her dreams steps right out of her latest romance novel.  She is in heaven and it is killing her long time best friend, successful lawyer meets boy-next-door, Josh Ryan.  The truth is, Josh is in love with Darcy and has been for years.  Will Darcy’s dream man be the one or will Josh get the girl.  If you enjoy a great romance novel and want to know who Darcy will choose pick up Dreams of Perfection.  I loved it and I’m sure you will to.
summary: Who hasn't dreamed up the perfect man?

reviewText: What a great book!  When Rebecca borrows money for you new business from her father she thinks she has time to repay him, think again!  Add in a few hitmen, a hunky newbie Wiccan and his sister with amnesia and you have a mix for a funny read that you won't want to put down! Cannot wait for the next in the series!  Chase has done it again!

I've read the other books in the Sarah series, and this one didn't disappoint.  In this novella, Sarah butchers emails and has trouble with cell phones.  When Karen faces a dangerous situation with men who want to harm her, it is imperative that Sarah use those "irksome gadgets."  Tomas, the Warrior Angel, steps in at the last moment and helps Sarah.  This book is funny, inspirational and filled with romance and fantasy.  It's easy to read and made me feel good.  I'm ready for another Sarah adventure.

This is a pretty good basic overview of essential oils and I think I learned a lot about what oils do what and how to apply and use oils. It's more than I anticipated. I have friends who swear by essential oils and I promised to research it and this book has enough info I feel like I've completed my task and learned some good tips too.
Great book!  Has pictures of every recipe!  What's a cookbook without pictures?  That was a nice surprise.  Can't wait to try the bean and spinach enchiladas and the squash lasagna.

The surprises start there and continue on with lots of great spankings and sex! At least 5 stars for this one! Fun, sexy and exciting!

I totally love all the different shifters. It keeps it really interesting. However, I have no idea how Lynn keeps up with that many different characters. I have to say the ending made me laugh out loud on several occasions. *This is a full length book!

Lynn Red is a new-to-me author. This is the first book of hers I've read, and it's in a series called The Jamesburg Shifters. I'll admit, I'm buying the other books, however many she has out now. This particular story is funny, touching, has some hot love scenes and well worth the money. Admittedly, if you are looking for a serious type book, don't try this one! It has some kooky characters and some funny funny moments! The only thing keeping this from a 5-star rating is there were a few spots that seemed to drag on the pace, but overall, I'd give it between 89-92% good.

The 3rd book in Jamesburg series by Lynn Red is nothing short of awesome. I gave the book 5 stars.This latest book is action packed,with supernatural tendencies(evil professor,a sinister book..yes sinister) tons of drama,comedic at times,laughed and cried and sex(wild and tender and sensual).And damn it a lilac smelling green bear(Atlas,lol) and Atlas's trusty witch doctor in toe. Curvy, quick-witted and a little shy Lilah Jorgenson is a raccoon shifter w/ a white streak in her hair, is a painter and part time Jackie of all traits(lol). She just wants to belong, never having had a family until the Jorgenson's took her in,wants a mate- someone to love and to love back,it won't happen..or will it? Lilah, clocks into the jail where she works( same old boring night)  and who does she run into..none other the bear of her dreams! Rex Lee,widowed,inked beyond belief, ex military( could explain the rippling biceps)...having lost his mate,he doesn't believe in love, that is until he spots the dream coming towards him..luscious curves, gorgeous two toned eyes and a wickedly sexy grin. He just can't believe he has to claim her, posses her, he just wants to devour her..she has to be his forever,she is his mate! Lilah wants to know why he land in jail, he was only protecting his cub! That's it, she is hooked..sprung..that's her future! Someone is taking shifters powers and it's up to these two to stop it from coming to fruition..Will they be in time to safe Lilah's sister and the other girls? Will these two find the love they have always wanted and will one bear cub(Rex's daughter) get the one thing she wants..a mommy!This book has everything and so much more.Can't wait for book 4! bravo Lynn Red!

If you have not read the first two seasons then this review may contain spoilers!! I have enjoyed the first two seasons quite a bit and would recommend them to anyone looking to read some old fashion vampire fiction.—AH! It’s the start of a new season for In Darkness We Must Abide! I’m trying to keep my fangirling to a minimum but I’ve been dying to know what happened after last seasons ending and I finally get to find out!So right off the bat we get to learn more about some background on characters! Greg is playing a bigger part, and as sleazy as he is I love him! It’s great seeing him be around Vanora who is not interested in taking any of his crap and pretty much his exact opposite. We even get to learn more about Carlotta, including her past and her connection with Armando.Without saying too much we also get to see what Leto is up to, and learn a bit more about what Vanora is truly capable of. I can’t wait to see what Vanora is like once she “powers up” and gets her self ready to face off with Aeron. It’s even cooler now that we have some werewolf lore and history being thrown in, and we even get a taste of the ‘origins’ of the vampire!So once again Rhiannon has given us an episode worth freaking out over and I can’t wait to read the next one!

This book is an excellent resource for people suffering from OCD. The book is very well organized in that the author has a very systematic approach to explaining OCD. The book explains all aspects of OCD ranging from developing an understanding to getting treatment and support. There is great advice in this book. If you have a loved one, a friend or anyone you know that is suffering from OCD, this would be a great resource to recommend.

I really liked this book because I've been having trouble with my meditating style. I found this book at the right time because I've been trying to look for effective tips that are easy-to-follow, cause I really wanted meditation to be effective for me, and this book is a great help to me!
summary: A companion book for my anxiety relief...

Serenity Jones is a psychic with a successful cable show. But things are spinning out of control now. She'd had a war widow who wanted to contact her late husband, killed in Iraq while saving other soldiers. But the contacted spirit tells a different story and Serenity is stuck with a poltergeist.Next she tries to repair the damage when the son of a politician, primed for a run at the Presidency, disappears. That doesn't end well either.Interesting short.
Very good book. Keeps your interest all the way through the book.
I have always enjoyed her books,and was not disappointed.would have loved for it to go on for much longer.if you enjoy this author be sure to select this one!

I really enjoyed the character Serenity, and the story had some fun twists and turns, my only challenge was how quickly and abruptly the story ended, I really wanted to read more.  I'm looking forward to Jodi Piccoult's new book this fall to read more about Serenity.
I have read books by Jodi picoult. what I have read has been intense. this was a light read, short story. left me wanting more
Jodi Picoult is truly one of my favorite authors, but I have to say that I really didn't get the point of this short story.  I am happy it was a free download. I would not have liked to pay for it!

Even in short story format, Ms. Picoult manages to catch the reader from the first sentence and does not let go until the final word.  Not easy to do without lengthy plot lines, character development, or in depth dialogue. The main character, Serenity, is a TV celebrity psychic who is at the top of her game until she has on a new widow of a war veteran.  It turns out his death was not at the hands of the enemy and Serenity is his means to let the world know.  Of course, a missing child of a prominent Senator thrown into the mix can't hurt to move this amazing story along rapid fire.  Pun intended.

I hated to wait for so long for book six, but it was well worth it, what a great writer Ginny Dye is, she is so detailed without being boring, I love the way she brings all the characters together, and everyone of them is interesting.  Can't wait for book Seven. Every book in this series is a wonderful read.

It takes a certain type of writer to turn a dark, true to life tale of two people fighting awful odds of life into a love story, and Emerson St. Clair has done it with Dirty Nights. The sense of realism and despair that pervades this novella makes you root for both Skylina and Ryder in the hope that life for these two will just get better.Skylina's essentially sold to the highest bidder by her own mother; an idea so awful you wish it weren't happening to thousands of young women (and men) everyday. But happen it does. What she's faced since she was a child would be enough to make a normal person feel like puking. She's been involved with perverts and sickos as a teen, graduating to erotic dancing and turning tricks in adulthood.Ryder was a spoiled-brat rich kid with a talent for dancing that he lost just when he thought he could make it big. Pain and grief made him an addict, more to escape the reality of losing his dreams that to just cope with his physical difficulties. His parents have finally decided that tough love is in order and Ryder will just have to shape up or find himself on the street.I've often wondered how sex slaves (in my opinion, prostitution is akin to slavery) feel when faced with a "client" that is physically abhorrent, horribly unhygienic, or abusive. I found an echo of my imaginings in Skylina's nauseous, despairing thoughts as she performed her services. Not a surprise that she has low self esteem to match.Ryder's drug crutch may be unbelievable to some, but I have had a Ryder of my own in my life. After an accident destroyed a young man's budding art career, the morphine that was supposed to take away his pain started him on experiments with other drugs that would give him a "better" high while being less addictive, according to him. Rehab always failed and the addiction ended in his death less than a year ago. There is so much truth in Ryder's suffering that it sparked happy and painful memories more than once.If there is a constant in life, it is hope. Second chances exist, but taking them depends solely on the person involved. Ryder wisely took his way out, Skylina isn't so sure about hers. These have nothing to do with their relationship, though, despite the instant attraction they have. Are they simply making each other a new form of addiction or escape? Or will the desire for each other help them to get stronger?This is a beautiful story, so why did I just hand it 4 stars? It gives me that "Flashdance" vibe, with a beautiful young woman doing a stint as an exotic dancer while being coached by a former ballerina to get into a formal dance job. While this is simply a backstory to the main, it did bother me, down to the necklace given to the girl as a gift. Slightly too much of the inspiration. There seemed to be an echo of White Knights in there, too.However, Ryder outshines everything else. He brings the whole tale, since it is more about him healing and helping Skylina along the way. He's a fantastic, strong man and I'm glad his family didn't give up on him, practically pushed him to recover and reach farther than he ever thought he would.Dirty Nights is a story that should be read. Not for the dancing or the hot sex, but for the stories of people who go beyond what is expected of them, despite pain, nightmares, and hardship. Emerson St. Clair (A.M. Hargrove) has a gift for showing people's souls and giving them the happiness that they deserve.

This was a delightful book that was beautifully illustrated. The writer does an excellent job making it sound exciting to play outside. I hope many children and their parents read this and find fun ways to enjoy life away from the television and the computer screen.

reviewText: Great series, loved it. Not much on buying short story books, but these were worth it. I plan on reading more of her books.

I am no expert, but I have had some experiences with dieting and the effects that this has on certain conditions. This book contains some really important information on certain food groups that I honestly had never heard of. Casein in particular. There is some really good advice on foods to give up, the effects that they can have in exaggerating chronic pain, and also some other holistic exercises and other ways that you can self-treat your pain. Very well written, I would recommend reading it
summary: Causes of chronic pain may surprise you

reviewText: Awesome book! The final battle alone makes this book a must read, but the character development is also great. We get to see the two main characters develop slowly from fresh, optimistic young men into somewhat cynical adults as they get knocked around by the world. But through it, they maintain their friendship and love of flying.
Because love can be complicated and ugly and not what you want. This story was gloriously cathartic, and I cried unabashedly. Thank you, Megan. You have a true gift for telling a story.

In this busy and stressful decade, we might feel lost, alone and uncertain. Having a connection with God for those who believes in God is extremely important. Sometimes, it is better to have faith on God rather believing in nothing. We are not as strong as what we think. This is a book that leads us to get closer with God. A good book to read.
summary: Ease the Suffering and Stressed Mind

reviewText: Sawyer Sterling is a very independent and driven person. She has a very sad past which leads her to keep everyone at arm’s length. The only people who have been constants in her life are her best friend Sarah, and her childhood friend Jared Keller. When she and Jared cross the line of being friends to sleeping together, Sawyer has reevaluate herself if she can be the person that Jared deserves. She starts on a journey that reveals more about her past, which leads to her asking more questions about the person she really is. I could really connect with Sawyer’s internal conflict as to whether she could be the person that so many have told her she is.I have to say, if I could find a Jared Keller in real life, I would be all over that! Jared was so incredibly patient with Sawyer as she dealt with her own insecurities and past. I mean he even gave her space when she needed it to get herself together, and encouraged her to get the answers to all of her questions even if he couldn’t be there for her.I would give this book 4.5 out of 5 stars. It was such an emotional journey into Sawyers past to help her discover who she is capable of being. I highly suggest this read!

4.5!!!! No one captures the raw emotion of loss and pain quite as beautifully as Carey Heywood. I fell in love with Sawyer during the HIM series, partly because of her devotion to her friends, her in your face strength, her quiet vulnerability, and her confident style. I knew that her story would be powerful and heartfelt, and Carey definitely delivered. I love the way that God places Angels in our path to help us find our way, and keep us encouraged and loved, and though Sawyer had many, Jared was her Gabriel. His constant love and devotion was so precious; and I loved that after each chapter, we got a glimpse into his mind and heart; what a sweetie! It was also nice to see Will and Sarah happy and doing well. Carey let us experience Sawyers journey through the realization of her past, while completely dispelling her previous perceptions of who she is and what she deserves; her metamorphosis was beautiful to witness. Thank you Carey for another touching story.
summary: Another beautiful story from Carey Heywood!

reviewText: I swear there is a life lesson in every book Carey Heywood writes. She speaks directly to me in every one of here books I've read. Her writing style is from the heart and it shines through with love and laughter. I truly believe we were kindred sisters in another life.When I saw Carey was writing Sawyer story, I couldn't wait to read it.  I have always loved Sawyers character in HIM & HER. Sawyer’s character has always reminded me of Carey herself with her gutsy sense of humor yet insecurities only few know.I see in Carey’s writing how much she has grown so get ready to see her bring on the heat! I think this is my new favorite of the HIM series.Sawyer Says can be a compliment to the Him series or an spinoff to the series or even as a stand alone. I loved it.

reviewerName: Thomas Baker "Thomas is the Past-President of...
reviewText: "Deadly Secrets" by Angel Sefer is a story that merges mystery and romance in a hybrid genre that sets a new standard. This novel is set in a fabulous location, namely, The Greek Island of Mykonos. The protagonist, Helena, goes to visit her aunt Sophie. While there, she meets Dimitris, a character who is quite likeable. With the romantic elements in place, we now turn to the mystery of her father's disappearance many years ago. A diary serves as a source to drive the plot forward. Slowly, but surely, a realization dawns upon the reader. Finally, we come to question whether or not Dimitrius is everything that he appears to be on the surface. For me, that is the most significant dilemma that Helena must deal with in this book, ultimately... Highly recommended.Reviewed by Thomas Jerome BakerAuthor ofHow to Coach A Debate TeamI received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for a fair and unbiased review.

I've been to Greece a few times and I adore the Greek Islands. Have yet to go to Mykonos but after reading this, I plan on doing so very soon. First of all, what a wonderful, aesthetically-pleasing setting for a mystery novel to be set in. Helena, our protagonist, is a deeply involving character whose heart belongs to Greece and it's here where the story unfolds. Full of romance and intrigue, with an unexpected twist - worthy of five stars.

BEAUTY AND THE BOOKWORM has to be the funniest book ever!!  I'm an avid fan of gay romance and have read close to 600 titles in the months since I first bought my Kindle.  I don't limit myself to any ONE particular kind of story.  I read the GFY stories, and the Coming Out stories, and the Sweet Love stories and the angsty Dramatic Love Stories, and even a few of the BDSM stories------  But my favorites are the stories that have some comedy in them.  Nick Pageant gives us a  TOTAL comedy.  I laughed at every page--  Every kind of laugh from chuckles to belly laughs to tears-streaming-down-my-face uncontrolable laughs.  The lead character, Mason has a sense of wit and self-effacing, urbane humor that makes it impossible not to laugh at every bit of his dialogue with the other characters in the story, as well as an hilarious  INNER dialogue in his head that he shares with the reader!  But, please don't think there isn't a real, hearfelt love story going on beneath all the humor.  Mason isn't the character that we see in so many of these gay romances.  No, he's not 6' tall with gorgeous eyes and muscles on top of muscles.  Intstead, he's 5'5" tall with a so-so body, and he constantly wears cardigan sweaters.  He is what I call a "pocket gay"---  a cute little sweetheart that you just want to pick up and put in your pocket.  And he's not a football jock or a business tycoon.  No, he's a LIBRARIAN!!!  We all know the stereotype of the quiet little librarian.  But that is NOT Mason!  He's a fiesty little guy with a wicked sense of humor and a funny outlook on life.  I could so easily fall in love with him if I ever met him in real life!!  And that whole librarian-thing is an added bonus because I was a Library Science major in college and worked for a number of years in various libraries.  Where, oh where was MY "Mason" back when I was in the stacks?  If YOU think YOU are a Mason-type of guy, give me a call so we can run away together and live happily ever after!  (just kidding.........or not)Don't think for an instant, though, that Mason is the only funny, real-life-like character in Pageant's book.  No, not at all.  Pageant fills the story with an array of delightful characters........from Mason's lesbian, biker Granny, to Mason's sassy best friend, Twyla (every gay man needs a sassy best friend, of the female persuasion), to the lovable jail-bird, Shawn.  And for those of you looking for that tall, well-built, jock type of guy----  There's Shane.  Shane is the kind of guy that we THINK would never be interested in a short, wiry librarian like Mason.  But it turns out that Shane is a real sweetheart and he's been lusting for Mason ever since they first met (when Shane's running shorts got pulled down exposing his pink no-no in a minor jogging accident).  I would explain that in more detail, but I don't want to spoil that hilarious scene for you before you get to read it for yourself.  Now stop waiting around and go out and buy this book. After you've wiped away the tears of laughter from your face, you'll thank me for suggesting that you read this book.And to Nick-----  I'm going out to read your other stories as soon as I have this review posted and on its way.  But I'm begging you!  Give us more stories that include Mason and his gang!Thanks----------- Lee
summary: The funniest book I've ever read

reviewText: "33 Healthy Smoothie Recipes for Weight Loss and Vitality" is a great guide to start making your smoothies and loose that extra pounds that you've been wanting to get rid off. I personally have started drinking a smoothie just as I wake up, and it gives me a kind of energy and vitality that I've never experienced with coffee or any other beverage. reviewText: I have always loved looking to the wisdom of others when I am struggling through a problem or a crisis of faith of any sort. Quotes have always been an interest of mine, as I think it's fascinating that certain words, said in certain ways, can somehow stand the test of time and be linked to one person's mind. They are short and succinct pockets of advice and wisdom, and yet they transcend time and cultures to communicate knowledge to us. My father suggested that I give this book a try, knowing my penchant for quotes, epigrams, sayings, and adages. He was right. I loved it, and I particularly liked that many of these epigrams were not ones I had come across before. The author does a great job of creating an admirable collection that I will certainly return to time and time again. We always have troubles, but the advice of others sometimes seems so much more relevant and powerful. This isn't something you read cover-to-cover; just pick it up and flip to a page; you're sure to find something that does you more good than you'd expect.

reviewText: I had fun reading the book up until it got stupid."SPOILERS"She gets kidnapped, punched in the face, bashed in the head.  An injured ankle, dragged across the country side. He runs a bare foot drunken two mile race. His feet are in shreds, discovers her missing, wherein he puts on hiss boots on and drives a cart,he only knows how to ride, takes off after her, gets himself shot, dragged by a horse. She finally sees his feet and comments on just how bad they are. He puts on his boots and blithely continues to walk.  They, both, are stinky, dirty,and tired but an hour or so later they are rolling around naked in a hay stack.Some reviewers comment on how self centered and controlling she was. I, however, saw a woman who at age fourteen had to make a life for her father, her aunt and three younger sister. She was running a farm, responsible for the welfare of her tenants and a brewery at the same time, of course she was controlling. Jeez.  Let's see if any of you can keep that many balls in the air and not be physically and mentally exhausted.Three and a half stars. I was compelled to take off half a point for the stupid parts.There are a lot of loose ends to be tied up, but maybe they will be in the next two books.
Too much raunch for me, and the character development was non-existent.
First I really liked Nancy Grace 1and 2 but sorry I didn't like 3 at all an I'm not even gonna bother with 4 so I'll give you 1 star because the editing was on point.
