I received this book for free in exchange for an honest review. This does not affect my opinion of the book or the content of my review.For me, Jenika Snow’s name has become synonymous with quality MC romances. Her latest installment Inked, just cemented that reputation.What makes Ms. Snow’s MC series so wonderful is her ability to write interesting characters that I enjoy reading about. She is able to show the hero’s sweet and caring side without detracting from his macho, alpha, tough guy reputation. She also writes her heroines as smart, sassy, independent women who inspire their men to be better people.Cadeon and Stella are just two more examples of this. Stella is the daughter of the Vicious Bastards MC Club so she is no stranger to the dangerous life of an MC Club. She has always been loved and protected by these dangerous men so she has no fear of them. But Stella has been afraid to go after the man that she has been crushing on for three years. Cadeon is the owner of the tattoo parlor where the Vicious Bastards get their ink. He has lusted after Stella from afar ever since he met her, but has too many concerns about getting involved with her. First of all, he’s almost twice her age. Second, he doesn’t consider himself a nice guy and thinks that Stella deserves better. Finally, she’s the President’s daughter and that comes with its own risks.When the two finally get together, their romance actually turns into a sweet, loving story. I enjoyed watching Cadeon realize how much Stella means to him and his desire to be the man that she deserves.  Their relationship was authentic and I didn’t even mind their age difference because they still had so much in common. They made sense as a couple and I was absolutely cheering for them to get their happy ever after. And let’s not forget their chemistry because it was definitely hot.Ms. Snow also devotes as much attention to the secondary characters as she does the main ones because they are just as interesting. I especially enjoyed the interactions with Stella and her father as he learned to accept that she was an adult with a love life.Inked is a quick read coming in at less than 100 pages but Ms. Snow did not shortchange the reader. Inked is a standalone book but I’m secretly hoping this is the start of another great MC series by the always dependable Jenika Snow.
summary: Another hit for the always dependable Jenika Snow

reviewText: I was given a free copy of this story in return for an honest review.Harrison has just months to choose his bonded trio.  He has always known that Michael would be one but the woman he has always loved has declined the offer to become a member of the Trinity Masters.  But with time running out, he makes her an offer he hopes she can’t refuse.  Alexis can’t understand allowing someone else to choose your future partner much less the idea of not one but two.  But she is willing to accept the sex that Harrison offers even as she doesn’t think a ménage relationship will last on a permanent basis.  But with the threat to the Trinity Masters closing in will Harrison and Michael be able to convince Alexis of a future that includes them all together?Forbidden Legacy by Mari Carr is fourth in the Trinity Masters series.  Harrison has been trained from the cradle to be the Grand Master.  He is used to making decision that affect others and making those decisions alone, but his time is running out.  He has kept his best friend in the dark and the strain is beginning to tell.  Michael has trusted in both the Trinity Masters and his friend but as others find happiness he is ready for his own family.  But will Alexis come to love him as she already loves Harrison?  Can he accept that Harrison is opening to others in ways he doesn’t open to him?  And Alexis is learning that loving two men isn’t as hard as she thought but is it just sex?Ms. Carr tackled these questions in more in this installment of the Trinity Masters.  She took us on twists and turns as the identity of the blackmailer is revealed.  Harrison, Michael and Alexis learned something about themselves and what being a unit entailed in reality not just in theory.  And while I was disappointed in the ending I was not disappointed in the story that she gave us.

THIS WAS MOST DEFINITELY A PAGE TURNER FROM BEGINNING TO END, I COULD NOT PUT THE BOOK DOWN.. GREAT STORYLINE WITHOUT ANY NOTICEABLE ERRORS... THIS IS A MUST READ IN ANTICIPATION OF A PART TWO.. IT CANT END HERE, WE NEED MORE...

Loved it, loved it, loved it. I started reading this book early hours this morning (with coffee) and finished it this evening (with a glass of wine). Mr Luke you know no bounds with your creativity, articulate writing, and imagination. I followed the world tour with you and loved EVERY paragraph, I was lucky enough to be picked for one of your inspiration paragraphs, Thank you.The added paragraphs were read with as much ease as you probably wrote them. I was astonished as to what you came up with on the world tour on the limited time you had. And the added paragraphs are even better!!!The final chapter, the added bonus one for In Love with a Master, was .......... YES <<<<<< NO WORDS. You are and always will be in my eyes the man who holds the word Anticipation close to his chest, you never faulter with that word or loosen your grip. THAT is what makes Vignettes of a master a 5***** read.**SPOILERS**I would RECOMMEND you read Interview with a Master first before this book as there are spoiler type paragraphs throughout.But this is a book you MUST ONE CLICK TODAY. Jonah Noble is a Gentleman you have to meet, and Leticia Fall is a Woman you will want to be........ With added characters and familiar characters it was a pleasure to read.....

I don't even know where to begin..this book was EVERYTHING!!! Raimone thinks he's got it all...a wife who would do anything for him and their beautiful daughter. Across town he's got a mistress who is tired of being the side chick and wants to have him to herself to help raise their daughter. Things quickly get out of hand when his mistress makes a power play to break up his happy home. What once was any man's ultimate dream...two women and the ability to do what he wants, soon turns into his worst nightmare. When his wife finds out his secrets things turn deadly and someone is forced to pay a huge price but is it the right person? I can't say more without spilling some secrets but that ending blew me away!!! I can't wait to find out what happens next. Ms. Johnson you did it again..YOU KILLED IT!!!

The storyline is interesting. However, the author stated that two years later, when it was more like four years, since Aaliyah was graduating college. I was lost many times. One being Eron calling Aaliyah on the phone and his saying she was still mad so he stopped by a jump off's house. I had to go back because there wasn't an argument. So how did she get mad?When the doctor's were introduced. They were introduced as one name then it changed to Dr. Brown for one but they were suppose to be brothers. The grammatical errors were too much! Words missing, the wrong words in the sentence and then misspelled words. The college graduation? You don't call different colleges. Names are called according to the college that they graduate from. So Aaliyah was graduating from computer science and Dior from psychology. Two different college disciplines.I'm good with "hood" books but don't write them as though I have no knowledge.  Lastly, I'm wondering if T.I. is paying the author for advertisement?Good start author, but work is needed for your sequel!!!!

This novel features well rounded and believable characters with competing motivations and desires, and I was dying to see how events would unfold. 4 of 5 stars~ Review by CarolineFor original review see Prism Book AllianceLuc Laurent oozes sex appeal whilst straddling his bike and speaking provocatively in French! He is a widow with a grown up son and an owl shifter who suddenly finds himself face to face with his mate. A very young human mate who has no idea that shifters even exist.Dylan Sudderson walks with the aid of crutches after being hit by a drunk driver. He is cosseted by his parents, particularly his mother, and is terrified of them finding out he is gay. I liked Dylan. He needed someone to love him and look beyond his disability and scars and to help all the self doubt he carried. He was so desperate for Luc to want him, but so sure that he wouldn’t that it made you want to cry for him.Besides the love story this is about a very mixed group of shifters who have to deal with an out of control Alpha who is kidnapping and torturing humans. The shifters are diverse in their nature and are joined by a couple of vampires. Luc is a loyal member of this group and an ideal candidate for Beta to the new Alpha Dorian.I am going to go back to start this series from the beginning. It didn’t impede my reading of this book but there are so many characters involved in the story that I really want to know more about them all and read their individual tales. I think this is a series that will hold your interest and have you wanting more and more purely because of the diversity of the characters.  There is a platypus!! I had to Google that one just to check what he looked like.As a final note I want to give a big shout out for Dylans dad!!  What a cool and important character who was supportive and loving.  Who would have guessed the secret he knew!!

4 Stars and a warning--- be prepared for an unexpected endingI was absolutely entranced by the story and enjoyed it immensely.  We follow Sadie as she makes a move from Chicago to Texas after some family issues have arisen and the ending of a 6 year relationship for her.  When she arrives in Texas she meets Lisa, who I absolutely loved.  She is the kind of girl that everyone wants to have as a best friend.  Lisa introduces her to the oldest of the Johnson brothers, Landon.  After the ending of her previous 6 year relationship, Sadie has vowed off men, but that was before she met Landon.  She tries and tries to hide the fact that she's attracted to him in the beginning.  I really felt that this allowed them to become closer and a friendship develop first, especially once they discover a lot of similarities between them.  The writing is absolutely wonderful and flows so smoothly.  One of the only reasons this wasn't a 5 star read for me was the ending.  I just felt abrupt and incomplete.  It was such an emotionally intense ending, I actually felt my heart break (and you know you have an awesome author when they have the ability to make you feel real emotions from a story).  But I just wish there would have been more.  It felt to me as though you were thrown this major curve ball that rips your heart out, you're given a short epilogue, and then it's over... BAM... end of book... the end.  I just wanted a little more to be able to see how the characters moved on with life and dealt with their feelings.  But overall, it was an awesome read worth reading, just be ready for the ending! :)~*~Lauren~*~
summary: An awesome read worth reading, just be ready for the ending!

reviewText: I start these books and can't put them down... Please write more of them and quickly! I devour them in about two days!

My slugs often have mental issues, ranging from anxiety to depression and so have undergone CBT, (Cognitive Behavioural Therapy) and have found it most useful. Their smiles have returned and they can continue to lead rich and fulfilling lives. This book by Jonny Bell is an excellent starting point, has been well-researched and gives great examples. We're all very impressed and happier in our household for having read this book.
I absolutely LOVED this book. The characters were so relatable.  The drama between each and every person keep the storyline going. Cant wait for part three
This was a great read. Can't wait to read pt.2!! The ending left me speechless, keep it up because your very talented

You definitely put on fa our city!  Aside from this being an outstanding read, it was the first of many New Orleans based BOOKS that I've read that actually captured our true dialect, our culture and that die hard LOVE for the place we call home!This is one soap opera you would hate to miss out on! The heartache s of love, having to choose between your so called life partner or the one who truly makes you happy!  After realizing everything you need you already have at home but the streets just won't let go! Being a womanizer for so long and finally meeting your match, to being so insecure from past experiences that you are missing up on the best thing that has ever happened for you. And you know there is always a us that one hoe that pretends to be your friend but are really hanging around for ya man. Yep, this book has it all.  It has literally kept me on edge and I am so anticipating the sequel!

LOVE KNOWS NO BOUNDARIES was SOOOOOO GOOD. I was PULLED in and ENGROSSED IMMEDIATELY. The STORY was VERY WELL WRITTEN, with REALISTIC ISSUES.  DRAMA, DRAMA, DRAMA, LIES, BETRAYAL, JEALOUSY, BACKSTABBING, a LOVE TRIANGLE and MORE FILLED the PAGES. It was NEVER a DULL MOMENT. I NOT ONLY WANT, but NEED pt.2 ASAP. COFFEE, A JOB VERY WELL DONE..........

I was very worried about how this series would end. I enjoyed all of the characters and fighting in the books. This story had lots of description of the scenes but hardly any character development so I was happy with the strong ending. I will continue to read books about this realm. I hope this gets made into a mini series on Tv because it has lots of good imagery.

Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. This so-called book ended @ 68% in and this author wants me to buy the next installment to see what happens?! I don't think so! This may have only cost 99 cents but that is 10 minutes of my life I will never get back. Really getting tired of these "wannabe" authors writing these little snippets and charging a dollar here and a dollar there. It starts to add up. This little snippet did nothing to pique my curiosity.

I enjoy this author and her stories. This one is very focuses on the relationship of the mates. It was fine. I just like a bit more suspense. Yes, I will be buying more of her books. ( Not suspenseful, but still entertaining.)

This trilogy has everything. I mean love, sex, secrets, sex, blackmailing, sex, murder, and sex. I LOVED EVERY second of it and the pages flew by. If you love billionaire romance with a lot of love and action, read this. It doesn't disappoint.
summary: LOVED IT, LOVED IT. LOVED IT.

reviewText: MY SISTER REALLY LAID HER WHOLE LIFE STORY OUT FOR US! I TRULY APPRECIATE YOUR HONEST AND BEING SO UPFRONT ABOUT THE TRAILS, TRIBULATIONS AND TRIUMPHED COMEBACK YOU HAVE EXPERIENCED IN YOUR YOUNG LIFE.  YOU ARE TRULY AN EXAMPLE TO SO MANY WOMEN THAT ARE STRUGGLING THROUGH THE EXACT SAME THINGS AND DON'T HAVE ANYONE TO TALK TO AND GUIDE THEM TO TURN THEIR MISFORTUNE S AROUND. IT IS HERE ALL IN BLACK AND WHITE!  I PRAY THAT YOUR LIFE STORY AND MESSAGE TO OVERCOME CAN REACH THE MASSES THAT REALLY NEED TO HEAR IT
BRAVO!! Raquel girl are indeed a strong black woman!!! OMG! The things you've endured were horrible but made you who you are today. I salute you hon! Keep on keeping on!

well I totally couldn't stop myself from reading so I have managed to read all three books in less then 24 hours. Hunter is so lucky he came back I was getting really worried but now I need to know what happens next.
Good continuation to part 2. progressed seemless from wher part 2 left off. Keep on the e4dge of my seat and looking forward to the next part.
I really hope this was not the last book in this series, it is the kind of series that keeps you wanting more.

I love, Love, LOVE a Touch of Revenge. It begins about a year after a Touch of Betrayal. .Everly has been been preparing for the physical aspects of getting revenge for the murder of her parents but she is till working on recovering from the emotional shocks she received in A Touch of Betrayal.Everly and Pierce are hot on the track of the people responsible for the death of her parents.  This trail leads to Ireland where we get to know Pierce's parents. How awesome!  Nothing turns out the way Everly expects but the story is as awesome as it is complicated.  I was so excited to meet a new character who enriches Everly's life.As much as I want Ms Charles to get the rankings for the new book, if you have not read the early books in the series, you must read them first!  This book is absolutely NOT a standalone.
summary: L.j. Charles has given us another outstanding novel with a complex mystery and beautiful friendships.

reviewText: So badly written. Obvious plot. Potential with interesting side characters not explored. But the writing was the worst offender. Done.

Isabel Santiago, the Vampire Sage of Bucharest, arrives at the Fae court. She hopes to help ensure the continued success of the Wraith Accords, an alliance formed between the Vampires and the Tuatha de Danann.Fianna warrior, Aed mac Goll, is assigned to protect Isabel while she is at court.  They find themselves attracted to each other, a dangerous situation for them both.I enjoyed Isabel’s cunning personality.  She is quick-witted and smart.  She is highly practiced in the art of politics.  I liked that she possessed the skills to survive the Fae court but not sink to the level of some of the Tuatha de Danann.I love that Aed is fiercely loyal.  He will protect the Tuatha de Danann even from themselves.  I appreciate that he is strong both mentally and physically, and that he is willing to admit his mistakes.Lila Dubois does a great job describing the environments and reactions of the characters.  She has created a believable world that I truly enjoyed.Carnal Magic is an intriguing and entertaining novel.  I liked the combination of Vampires and Fae, although allies, neither faction trusts the other. This makes the story all the more interesting.Complimentary copy provided in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Carnal Magic (Wraith Accords #1) by Lila Dubois

reviewText: I can never go wrong when buying one of this author's books.  They always contain lovable, funny, bickering characters wrapped up with battles and making up with erotic sex.  Just couldn't give this one 5 stars due to the price of the book and the I have read better from her.

These were great books. I had the chance to buy the 1st 3 books as a package deal for one price. the 1st book dragged a bit in the Middlebury that's really my only complaint.The authors have done their research on military and weapons. The team they have put together is realistic and believable. I like that these guys are not indestructible too. They do suffer injuries and loss along the way too.I'd recommend to anyone that enjoys Zombie novels. I've read some absolute garbage in the Zombie genre (You SUCK, Dennis Larsen novels!!!!!) and I've found some good ones too like these books. I'll definitely be buying the next couple books to see what happens to out heroes next!
This book was so good and easy to read. I finished in no time and cannot wait for the next book.

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for honest review*A novella from Kirsty Moseley...Yes, please!!Bronwyn Reynolds is unhappy in her loveless marriage.  She is married to what I can only describe as a good for nothing a***ole. She is working two jobs whilst he sits around spending his time drinking, grumbling, and having affairs.  Her treats her like s***, and she's only staying with him for the sake of her son Theo."Many women went through their lives in an unhappy marriage. I was no different to any of them. Not everyone found their Mr. Darcy and lived happily ever after, some people just had to take what they could get and be grateful. Clearly I was one of those people."Harrison Baxter is her brother in law's sexy business partner, the man she has sexy thoughts about. A man who is so not like her husband. Harrison is a ladies' man, but has always had had a thing for Bronwyn, but knows she is married, and off limits, but can't get her out of his mind and can't resist flirting with her every time fate seems to bring then together."Harrison Baxter. The one that made my panties wet every time he smiled at me"Reason Not To Fall In Love was a heartwarming entertaining read. I felt for Bronwyn at times the way she was treated by her husband over the years had left her will low self-esteem. I'm sure there are many women out there who are in the same situation in loveless marriages as it easy to stay than to leave. But at the same time I wanted to shake her and make her see that she worth so much more.Bronwyn and Harrison were great characters. You could feel the magnet pull between. Love the flirting, chemistry and the banter they share. Love that Harrison saw something more in her, always made her smile, and I couldn't help but want them to be together."I don't just want one night Bronwyn; I never did, not with you.""His voice did funny things inside I was lost for words"Overall I really enjoyed this novella it may be a short read, but it was a good read, (There will be no comments from me about how long it was ;) ) once I started I didn't want to put it down, and one I easily read in a few hours.  It was another well-written story from the talented Kirsty Moseley who kept me guessing with a few good twists. Loved the last one. If Kirsty choose to continue Bronwyn and Harrison's story then I will happily read it, but if she doesn't then that is okay with me as I liked the way it ended for them. Bronwyn and Harrison do not need the drama they have their HEA.If you're looking for a short heartwarming entertaining read, this is the book for you.
summary: A short read, but it was a good read

reviewText: Such a great read! I hope it isn't done yet! I need to know what happens! Lucian Bane is an amazing author!

This was a very quick read that packs a lot of emotion into a very small amount of pages. It gives you a story of hope and happy endings. Great characters and captivating storyline.  It's a great way to spend an evening. Full review at [...]

Isabella Hargreaves captures the essence of war, postwar trauma and falling in love wonderfully.  Her descriptions are vivid. Her characters amazing. You will certainly be taken on a journey with this little treasure.

Even though I have been making candles for a while now I decided to pick this book as a refresher course. There were tons of great tips and idea's that I had never thought of. This book was very informative and the author did a great job of making this a fun easy read. If you are interested in learning candle making (which I suggest you do) this is the perfect reference guide for you.

This book was a page turner from beginning to end.. Once I started, I could not stop. Normally, I hate to read about controlling men, but for once, this book allowed the woman to come out on top!!!! I thoroughly enjoyed, the characters, story line, and most importantly, the revenge!!!!!

This was my 1st read by this author and if I could give it more than 5-stars I would... I could not put this book down; I laughed and I thought my own past situations with the Mitches in my past.Brandon and Andre got exactly what a Mitch deserves...I cannot wait to see if this author adds a sequel to this...

It is always a good look when a woman can expose a man's b$&#@ @$$edness and get paid, find a real man and come out on top. I loved Vanessa's get back and how she linked Andre and put the hush on him. She could have ruined him but she didn't. In the end Heather was all he deserved Vanessa got the last laugh. Brandon was a grade A punk and Trina ended up getting more than get back. She wanted her five grand for him selling her furniture but came up quadruple that and a job. Loved it!
U really enjoyed reading this book. It had some very good twist and turns and it definitely held my interest.  Job well done to the author.

I was fortunate enough to read this novella as part of the infamous "Bend" anthology.  "Kick" was one of my favorites in the book.  I actually read it 3 times because I didn't want to miss a single detail.  This was the first I read from CD Reiss and will definitely NOT be my last.  Intriguing story, gritty realism and ** SPOILER ** no HEA made this really hard to put down.  Great story and I look so forward to the rest of the series.  5-stars for sure.
summary: Thought-provoking and Hard to Put Down

reviewText: Omg I was so drawn to this book and I was so into the writing that I could not put my kindle down. It is driving me insane that I don't know what really happened to Deacon. But it keeps me guessing and wanting more. I look forward to read the next book. CD is such an amazing writer can't wait to see what she comes up with next

For artists, businesspeople, marketers, and freelancers, creativity is a must-have asset. But often times, creativity is quite difficult to explain; some people can produce work with flow and ease, while others need more thought and time.Thankfully, after reading this book, it does cover a great amount of the psychological science behind creativity. It also covers plenty of the aspects of creativity - from sport, to art, to even interpersonal skill. Overall, a great guide to explain how creativity works.
I really liked the way this book was written as it was much more than what I expected. I thought it was well written and was helpful to me.

I would have loved to have had the help of a Date Shark when I was going through my dating days, especially if the Date Shark was quite certain Mr. Eli Walsh. This book is a lovely read for someone wanting a 'clean' read but with passion and romance in spades. Leila is a timid young woman who wants more for herself and with the help of Eli's services she gets it. The story becomes something of a love triangle and who Leila eventually ends up with is for you to read and discover. But what I can say is that both men have positive attributes and both help and Love Leila in different ways. Overall this book definitely have me the 'feel good factor' and I would definitely recommend it.

Mia is a self proclaimed nerd that is on break from school and is visiting her dad, a former tennis star that now grooms up and coming tennis jock in his academy. Mia is dared to pick one of the new hot jocks to have a one night stand with. She is not experienced and wants to pick someone that will play her game to prove to her bff that she can me bad.Enter our hot male, Kye. OMG book boyfriend bad boy. The boy your momma, daddy, and grandparents told you never to bother with. Or is he? Kye is quiet and just not into the scene at the academy like the other jocks. That's what caught Mia's eye. Well what Mia wasn't counting on was the HOT AUSSIE.They are both looking for an escape from the scene that has brought them together. They both find themselves instantly attracted with one another but, this is a FLING. Flings end as soon as vacation ends. These two kindred spirits find themselves growing as individuals during their time together. She keeps telling herself that it will end. He keeps thinking he isn't worthy of her.This book is a sweet love story of two people from two completely different places finding themselves and other things they never expected. The growth a person must live and experience to love another is seen here. Well written story by Nicola Marsh. I am eager to begin book 2.The characters grow on you and you want nothing but the best for them.How far would you go to be with the one you love? Kye will show you and he will not disappoint
summary: Gorgeous geek girl meets handsome Aussie Tennis Jock. Beautiful Love Story

reviewText: I have read most of the books in Susan Leigh Carlton's Mail Order Brides and thoroughly enjoyed them; however, I think The Widow Finds Love is the best so far. A lovely sweet romance with great characters that I really found myself warming to.  I also loved the historical aspect - the aftermath of the American Civil War, which the author deals with particularly well. It had me reaching for a tissue on several occasions! Highly recommended.
5 out of 5 StarsI so loved reading Matt's story, he was every bit of alpha as I have come to love with the Steele Family. Overall this was a nice easy read that will make you appreciate a good man.

I have wanted to start a Journal for a while now, and definitely believe that a journal can help people heal, which is why I am interested in it. There is just something about writing things down that helps me to let go! I really enjoyed this book, Write to make it Right, because I didn't really know where to start with Journaling. This book has been great, it has helped me to use Journaling to get rid of some of my day to day stress, and I love the chapter on Tips and Tricks! This book can definitely help you if you are into Journaling and I would recommend it to anyone interested in an easy way to reduce stress!

We all have secrets, but some secrets are the kind that will change everything you ever thought you knew.  Between Vincent, AJ, and Kristen the teen drama is hilarious and believable.  This book flows well, the character development is smooth, and the humor and drama and not overdone.Considering Angela Yseult is a newer author is the ya world, I am very impressed.  4 1/2 stars!  Keep the stories coming Angela!  Can't wait to read what you come up with next.  :)

So this is my first Monica James book and it most certainly will not be my last. So when I finished this book, I am pretty sure I sat with my mouth agape for like a good 15 minutes processing all that happened and I was still thinking about it like an hour later. This book is THAT good.Mia/Paige is running away from horrendous past, a past that will make you cringe and cower in a corner; one that most people would not be able to survive. But Mia is a survivor, she is strong, tough, feisty, determined and pretty much downright fearless at least when it comes to defending herself. But there is something that Mia fears and its letting someone into her heart, letting someone get so close to her that they find out her secret. You see Mia has never had anyone, no friends and no true family that cares for her. She has been taking care of herself and trying to live through her situation all on her own. So what happens when she finds herself in a small town surrounded by people who are willing to accept her despite her secrets, well Mia's world is flipped upside down but in a good way.Mia becomes immersed in a world where she doesn't have to be watching her back constantly, a world where she can laugh and smile, a world where she can possibly love those around her. But soon that world is threatened and the past comes chasing after her like bat out of hell. I don't want to give too much away but this book is quite a ride. The emotions and intensity run on a constant level "holy guacomole and OMGs" there is not one dull moment in this story and never once did I feel like any of the plot was dragging. James does a flawless job of expressing the emotions and mental anguish of some of the characters sometimes by just simply describing the situations rather then using inner dialogue which can be a challenge. I loved how all the characters in the story added something different to Mia's life. They all play a role in who she is to become and what she will have to do. James creates a story where all the players have their own individuals flaws, fears or secrets but all together they make a unit that is both loving and powerful. This book will leave you wanting more and I totally cannot wait for what will happen next!!

WoW! What a mess I was when I finished. Tears of joy and pain throughout. Allyn broke my heart, and Dominic's selfless compassion and healing overwhelmed me. Fantastic story and a definite must read. 1 click today.  Margaret you rock!

I'm a big believer of the importance of a healthy life so I'm always looking for new information on the subject. And I must admit this book blew my mind! It's a really nice compilation of advice and ideas on how to treat diseases with natural remedies, avoiding harmful chemicals and pills. There are many illnesses than can be treated in a more healthy way. Go ahead and grab a copy and take a look. It's totally worth it!

I love anything to do with Health and Healing that isn't suggesting medication and this book is Great! I love the Herbal Medicines it mentions, some i haven't used before such as Pot Marigold for stings and bites, and Sage which i use all the time, but i never knew its magical powers for Digestive problems! The Mind Healing section of this book is also a favorite because i want to start working on my mind and what i am thinking and this book has given me some great idea's on where to get started! This book is a must read for anyone who wants to learn to heal naturally! Full of Information, and easy to read, i couldn't put this book down!

This novella is good enough to read once, but isn't going to inspire you to remember the author's name. There isn't anything terribly wrong about this book, just a lackluster story overall.The idea is fun. An ordinary lady is in need of change after a failed relationship. She buys a remote house site unseen. The house is haunted by two ridiculously hot guys who instantly fall in love with her. Only she can break the curse, but they are mostly limited to light touches and cold breezes so communication is an issue.The lady is an author, which is a cliche and overused career. The book has fairly explicit erotica. Everyone has the stereotypical no tension / instant acceptance response to a menage, so no tension there. The biggest problem was the minimal interpersonal communication between the romantic partners, which leaves the guys about as interesting as a pair of vibrators. Another problem is that the fight scenes are poorly done; the author would benefit greatly from enrolling in a martial arts class.Rated "P" for predictable, this light erotica has an appropriate price for the length.

I love sarcasm. The sharper the tongue the better and this heroine has to deal with two alpha males stuck in limbo and very horny. The romance develops fast and the sex scenes are very hot. A fun, quick read.

What a great deal to get eight contemporary in one bundle. I have read Getting Out of Hand by Erin Nicholas, and just love the first book in her new series. I am looking forward to reading the other books now.Getting Out of HandThe first book in a new series Sapphire Falls, by Erin Nicholas, will not disappoint readers. I read this book in one day, could not put it down. I love to read how nerds turn hot in adult life and that is what Mason does. He returns home after being gone for eleven years for a class reunion where he meets Adrianne, new to town. There is a sizzling chemistry between these two.There are plenty of secondary characters just waiting their turn for a story. Looking forward to many return trips to Sapphire Falls.

Good characters, good guys and bad guys, decent plot with different twist.  Very few if any typos or editing problems, thanks to his mother he claimed.  But for me something was missing and i don't know what.  Still good effort and good reading.Problem was price.  This is not bad $2.99 book but way over priced ar $4.99.

I absolutely loved Rebound & Resilient so I've been anxiously awaiting the next installment!  Charlie is a great, dynamic character and I loved the back in the 90's theme here!  Another quick read for me because I just couldn't put it down!  Can't wait for the next one!
summary: Another great one from Nikki Thompson!!

reviewText: The Ex Who Conned a PsychicSally BerneathyHow would you feel if your husband was murdered just before your divorce? Well, imagine if he came back as a ghost and was attatched to you and you were the only one who could see or hear him.  Then along comes a high school classmate who can also see and talk to him!! Then, she is charged with her soon to be ex-husband’s murder.  Wouldn’t you do all you can to help prove she is innocent?  Yep, that’s exactly what Amanda faces in this installment of Sally Berneathy’s  Charlie’s Ghost.  It’s a crazy sometimes scary romp trying to find the real killer with a very annoying ghost attatched to it.  I love the way Sally can pull her readers into the middle of the story line and make them feel like they are right there in the book.  Can’t wait for the next one to come out.
summary: Good grief Charlie, leave the girl alone!!!

reviewText: Crystals.  What an absolutely fascinating book, I don't have a lot of knowledge on this topic and this guide has given me a way forward.  Now I know the benefits of all the crystals and their meaning behind them. Recommended.
Read the first story of this series, hopes there's more! Good read.

I am loving this series.  The characters are wonderful flawed people; who do amazing things while working for a mysterious organization.  Oh yea there are killer sharks and a moby Dick type whale  involved.  Cant wait for the next one.
summary: huge killer sharks on drugs. what more can you ask for?

reviewText: This book was everything. Blunt outdid herself yet again. There were a lot of surprises and twist that I didn't see coming. This is one of the best series I've ever read. I'm looking forward to part 4 👍
summary: This series is getting better and better

reviewText: This book deserves 5 Stars but there are some missing crucial points. Had some of them been explored the book could have panned a little longer giving it more depth.Wonderful story about young love and vindictiveness. How many foolish women have trapped a good man with a baby? Had Gabe disclosed Lissa's evil plot to take Cam away if he didn't marry her........Well sometimes men are just stupid! The courts would've granted custody rights. Needless to say her plan backfired & she waisted years of her life resentful of a man who was not ever in love with her. Ouch!I feel that Cass was aware of Maya & Gabe's love but the writer didn't give him closure. This was an opportunity to confirm that Gabe or her love for him, had ruined her for any other man. There was also the tremendous burden of discussing their past relationship with both set of parents, the apologies both eluded to and the idea that somehow Anna Ben knew about their love affair. These are the makings of a great read. These are important details to be included. Dang, I was so looking forward to getting the backstory. Especially a mom so entuned with her only son that she knew he was sharing some secret intimacies with the love of his life. ( Maybe a revised version will be released.) I think that the editor should have gone through a full read a pointed out the gaps. Screw deadlines, better stories sell more copies.Ms Riley is becoming one of my faves writer. I looking forward to more. Casualties of Love was my 1st for her, it wasn't a bad read. I was happy about its ending. Hey, is this all the ending I get in this book, he's off in the field, Cam has a girlfriend? What about a reflection on the wedding? Is Gabe happy? Can he not wait to get home to her? Again, details

Absolute power absolutely corrupts and this story starts from there.  This story is driven by women and men in control who have no regard for anyone or anything that gets in the way of their personal preferences.  I read the disclaimer and thought I was prepared, yet I kept expecting to find some tender feelings.  Nope.  Anyone with any type of power coldly punished when and where they wished.  Anyone who dared question or challenge their power was destroyed.  It’s a powerful story so well detailed that I was chilled right to the end.  I forgot it was futuristic it felt so real and, since it felt so real, I had to read straight through to the end.  I’ll be thinking about this story for a while.  If you’re looking for Disney, give this one a skip.  If you are willing to look at the darker side of life, give this one a try.
summary: Absolute power absolutely corrupts and this story starts from there ...

reviewText: Having greatly enjoyed the first book in this series I approached the second with a mix of excitement and anticipation. The story picks up from the shocking events that unfolded at the end of the first tale. Harvey Goldman is now in jail after being charged with the murder of Kelly’s sister but all is not what it seems. He protests his complete innocence to Kelly and a flicker of doubt enters her mind. Maybe it’s the fact she’s developing strong feelings for him or it’s possible she genuinely believes his pleas. Whatever the case, it is up to Kelly to delve deeper into her sister’s life in an attempt to finally uncover the truth.What follows is an intense and thought provoking tale that grips you from the very beginning and refuses to let go. All the reasons I loved the first instalment in this series have been included for this sequel ensuring it is just as enjoyable. The brilliant writing style allowed each page to flow effortlessly ensuring there were no lulls in the story. There are enough twists and turns in the plot to keep you second guessing right to the end.Overall I really liked it. With a third instalment still to come I look forward to once again immersing myself in a truly fascinating story!

This is the first story that I have read from this author but it definitely won't be the last.  I loved it and can't wait to continue this series. Great take on the fairy tale.  Red and Wolfe are combustible.
summary: Who's afraid of the big, bad Wolfe?

reviewText: Love Red's sass and spunk. Can't wait to see if she finds out who Wolfe really is and her reaction. Want to know more about her Grandmother Gertrude and can't wait for part 2. A definite must read. Ella you did fantastic as always!
summary: Red and Race are quite a pair

reviewText: One again this author has done an excellent job with the story, the plot, the depth of the characters....that is right up till the end. Everything was perfect except the ending. Normally a reader can feel the loose ends being wrapped up and everything coming full circle so that when you reach the ending you give a sign of completion. This one, however your reading along and can sense things coming full circle and then BOOM!!!!the end. Left me with the impression that the author was put on a pg restriction and realized it to late.

Over hearing an argument from a snobbish couple at a coffee house while leaving an application for employment, then to witnessing them throw away an envelope for a vacation at "The Castle", what is an out of work, living in her car girl to do?  Well, after debating, she boards the bus to the Castle for 10 days. It is prepaid and a place to live and eat, while sending out resumes looking for a job.  What a total shock to Chelsea, never knowing what "The Castle" really is, an adult getaway for whatever sexual pleasures or proclivities one can imagine.  Then on the bus she is befriended by Selena and from there, everything goes out of order due to Selena's enthusiasm.  But Chelsea plays along out of fear of being found out a fraud.  Chelsea becomes a challenge for a seasoned Dom like Kade.  This is their story and it will not disappoint.
I don't usually like threesomes, but I did this one. All the characters were strong and the story moved along nicely!

Yay! Got this awesome book at last for a recipe guide! Me and my sister had been doing on a diet now, and we perfectly bumped into this book! This really is a great investment of time and money, just a great read. My favorite recipe that we already tried here is "Stuffed Mushrooms" oh how I really love eating mushrooms and this one is really yummy. Kudos to this awesome writer! ;)
summary: I just purchased an awesome recipe book!

reviewText: This so good it really holds ur attention once u get into the book it just flows it keeps u wanting more an more u don't want to put it dojwn
summary: so good it just leds u to the next book

reviewText: Part two of this series remains smokin, but, also more unanswered questions. I do like this story, but the parts are too short. Could use a lot more info besides the steamy scenes. I like steamy books, but want more story with it, not liking a chapter here than wait until next month for another chapter tidbit....I don't know why this seems to be the thing now...am going to check out part three in June, but if we don't get some real answers, stopping there.

I am terrible with money and was looking for a short and to the point book which made budgeting doable and easy. I was very pleased to find this book to be exactly what I needed. There are a lot of easy to follow helpful tips that made budgeting so much easier. A must buy.
summary: A compete steal at the current price

reviewText: The Luthier's Apprentice is a short novel with a very interesting premise.  Emma Braun is a sixteen-year-old American girl living in Brussels, a budding violin virtuoso.  Her violin teacher , Monsieur Dupriez, has gone missing, as have several other violinists.  She and her best friend Annika decide that they are going to investigate, eventually joining forces with Corey Fletcher, another of Monsieur Dupriez' students.  The three of them stumble upon a truly imaginative mystery that they have to solve in order to save lives, their own and others.This book is a wonderful mix of mystery and fantasy, even a little bit of light romance.  But it was the intrigue and mystery that was the foundation of the plot.  I was initially disappointed because I figured out who the villain was very early in the story and I assumed that it was going to ruin the rest of the book.  However, while I figured out the "whodunit" fairly quickly, it was the "whydunit" that was truly the heart of the story.There was a lot of suspense and anticipation in this story which kept me turning the pages.  Sherlock Holmes fans will appreciate the plethora of references to him throughout the novel.  The target audience is young adult, but the story is easily engaging for older readers.  Although I have found no reference to this book being a part of a series, there is a bit of an opening at the end that would lend itself nicely to at least a sequel.Things to love...--Corey.  I love that there was a male character who was as much a part of the story as a female character.  I have sons and I am constantly looking for books with more male presence and this one fits nicely.--The interesting take on an old theme.  Making a pact with the devil is a common theme, but I liked how Calvani used it in a new way.Some Quotastic Goodness--At first she had thought they were a string of coincidences, but not anymore. While scowling at obnoxious Billie Lynam during school recess, for instance, she wished he would fall flat on his face… and half a minute later, her wish was granted (Loc. 60).--To her horror, someone was already hiding in there. Her gasp was muffled as a strong hand closed over her mouth. Another hand yanked her inside and closed the pantry door (Loc. 565).My Recommendation:  This was a great book with a fantastic new take on an old theme!  This is a must read!This review originally appeared on my blog:  [...]

Mayra Calvani’s “The Luthier’s Apprentice” is an imaginative short novel composed of elements diverse enough to appeal to a variety of readers. As the story opens, sixteen-year-old Emma Braun discovers that her beloved violin teacher, Monsieur Dupriez, has disappeared, as have several other violinists around the world. Determined to emulate her favorite literary hero, Sherlock Holmes, she sets about investigating, forming new alliances and uncovering centuries-old secrets about her family’s luthier craft and her aloof grandfather, to whom she is apprenticed. Suddenly the strange feelings she has been experiencing and the puzzles associated with her heritage begin to become startlingly clear, thrusting Emma into a bizarre realm in which all that she loves becomes endangered.A mixture of paranormal fantasy and science fiction with a light romantic element, “The Luthier’s Apprentice” provides enough excitement and mystique to engage readers without being overtly frightening, and fans of Sherlock Holmes will appreciate the myriad quotations that Calvani employs. Given the characters and simple yet descriptive writing, the target audience is young adult, although older readers will enjoy this story as well. A slight caveat: there are a few instances of mild profanity during some of the more tense scenes, and Italian phrases and terms are scattered throughout the story, although with either an immediate translation or sufficient context clues to figure out the meaning. Short chapters keep the action moving at a steady pace so that there are no lulls, and the story does come to a logical conclusion, although Calvani cunningly leaves the door (or should I say portal?) open for a sequel.

reviewText: I really enjoy reading this author's work this is my first time reading her stories and I must say I've enjoyed every book in this series so far. I loved Scott and Damien's story there was so much drama and sadness and that was just in the beginning of the book and it just grabs a hold of you from there! I mean I could not put this book down until I had read the very last page there was so much heartache and misunderstandings that lead to a lot of rough starts and anger between the two characters. Add to that a well meaning and over protective twin and pack trying to look out for their pack member really made things for the two just a little bit more difficult to sort out and overcome. But they did and they also learned some hard lessons along the way like there's way more to leading a pack then just the men it takes everyone women and children too no one should be left out also how to rely on each other in troubled times and realizing that sometimes you have to fight to hold onto what you want in this life and you don't have to fight your battles alone anymore you can rely on your partner to help you and be your strength when needed. Very good read some errors but it doesn't take away from the story I can't wait to read the next installment of the series.

This insightful and personal biography about American Modernism artist Georgia O'Keefe is unique in its focus on her earlier works from 1908-1917. It also explores the rising influence Zen Buddhism had on art education around the time that Modern Art came into being, influence that is clearly seen in O'Keefe's works. I also enjoyed the enlightening discussion on O'Keefe's mentors, Dow and Fenollosa. This is the first I've read about these two important art educators and artists, and gave me further insight into her art.The delivery is excellent throughout the book, allowing you to get a more personal impression of the artist. Fitzgerald also offers up a wealth of resources for further study on both O'Keefe's personal and public life. She's certainly left me with a deeper understanding of Georgia O'Keefe's art, as well as a desire to learn more about both her art and American Modernism.

This book is great for anyone who tangles already or for those who want to learn this exciting new art form.  The downloadable patterns provided are worth the cost of this book.  I especially love the Victorian Woman Silhouettes, the paper doll pattern, and the bird pattern.  Don't hesitate to purchase this book...you will be pleased!  This author has several other books out...her Upcycled Art books are amazing...check them out!EDIT:  RESPONSE TO NEGATIVE REVIEWSI purchased this book at the full price and have left the positive review it deserves. As a self-taught artist, I use books like this to expand my artistic repertoire.It is a wonderful book!  I sincerely hope that those leaving bad reviews read the book and rewrite their reviews to reflect it's true value.  It is so much more than a Zentangle design book.  Zentangle history is explained, with full credit given to the original creators of this art form.  The book also contains several projects and printable images that can be adorned with the tangled patterns...or decorated otherwise.  The downloadable, printable silhouettes, birds and tea pot images would be great for Iris Folding or window cards.The author clearly states she is NOT a certified Zentangle teacher.  Most people don't have the time/money/dedication to spend four days learning how to doodle!!!  I wonder if the negative reviewers have ever painted, sketched, created ATC's or made any other kind of art....all techniques which were derived (or in their own words...stolen) from other artists...if so...they are hypocrites!!!  Donna Cyr's generalized harsh words are inaccurate, and border on being libelous...in fact, if I were the author, I would consult an attorney.  To make such accusations as "stolen all of her work" and "con artist" in a book review are damaging to the author's reputation.SMH!Linda Tagg
A small guide on 5 tips to read faster. I love to read but haven't thought about training myself to speed read and will try some of these techniques

This book is great; it took me back to my college days. As a business major I learned quite a bit about leadership and motivation. I am always looking to expand on what I have already learned and this book does a great job of that. The book takes note that just because you are at the front lines of something such as a parade if you are not leading the direction the parade is taking then you are not truly leading. This book also explains that anyone can become a leader they can learn the skills needed to do so; it is up to you whether or not you want to lead and take charge or sit back and wish about it. This is a great book, with awesome information.

You are probably asking yourself how can a book about Landscaping be inspirational?  Well, you must read this book by Debra Johnson to find out.  It is a book about Landscaping.  Debra covers where to put your garden, what to plant, different types of soil, etc.  All of this information is very helpful and I learned some things about gardening.  However, the real HEART of this book is told later on when an elite group of young adults take on the project to restore a neighborhood.  This group recruited teens and pre-teens from various youth organizations as helpers.  Their hopes were to give these youth something that would give them a sense of pride and hopefully keep them off the streets. What happens next will warm your heart.  This book is a must read for everyone.  I highly recommend it.

All winter long I sat and looked at my yard and all I kept saying was that i wanted to have a garden or some flowers when Spring got here. Now it's almost summer and I still haven't planted anything at all. I have always been horrible with growing plants! After reading this book I now understand why! I never considered the different types of soil or which plants would grow in what I have around my house. I plan on heading out this weekend and buying plants that i think will do well here now, and I think that if I use the advice given in the Landscaping Design book that I just might be able to have a beautifully landscaped home by the time I am finished! This was a great little book and one that i will definitely be putting to lost of use as i design around my home and see what amazing beauty can be created!!

I got this book for my son who is obsessed with minecraft. He already knew most of the stuff in here but he did learn a few new things I think and he enjoyed the pictures and sharing it with his friends who aren't quite a s much of  a minecrafter as he is.
