Okay, like the others, I LOVED it.  AND Eva and Gabriel were back in a way.  Layla and Michael finally got married and honeymooned ;)  I love Annie's writing style, I love the romance and mystery in Annie's stories.  Of course, now I can't wait for Crossroads.

I enjoyed this book. If you area fan of Tessa Bailey's book well you will like this one.Julie and Reed meet during a week long stagette/bridal party festivities. She is the maid of honour and he is a groomsman for his best friend. He is a hot SWAT officer, totally in control and is the loving leave'em type of guy. However, he changes his tune when he meets rich socialite Julie who happens to be sweet, beautiful and into organizing events and well life.The story develops quickly, it has humour, steam and yeah so hot scenes.This book though part of a series, is a stand alone, has no cliffy and a HEA. Great read.

I loved this short story, surprisingly enough because I am not usually a fan of the the wedding party contrived plot-line. I love this author's writing and her H's who are swoon-worthy, to use an old term yet it fits.
I love these stories, they are quick reads, with likable characters, a few laugh out loud moments, some serious hotness, and some sweetness all rolled into a predictable, yet very cute read.

Best Man with Benefits by Samanthe Beck concludes the Wedding Dare series.  Colton's little sister Sophie is shy and just beginning to try and be more assertive.  Colton wants to make sure she has a good time during the festivities and doesn't try and skip out of them.  He asks best man and best friend Logan to do the honors.  Logan is seriously overstressed with his company.  Sure he built it up by himself and sure it's really hit the big time, but now he doesn't even have time to do the things he loves, the whole reason he started the company in the first place.No doubt Colton realized this too and figured asking Logan to look out for Sophie was a way to kill two birds with one stone. He just didn't realize how well it would work.  Sophie is really into Logan and boy is he ever into her.  But every time things start to get comfy cozy, work intrudes.  Good thing Sophie isn't too demanding, she'd have left Logan in her dust.  Once Logan figures out Sophie's the one for him, he needs to figure out what he's going to do because he needs some serious time for her.  The "big misunderstanding" happens late in the game and by the time it happens, it's pretty obvious that it will be resolved quickly.The epilogue completing the series was cute and funny and really brought the whole series to a close in a nice package.  It was a very enjoyable series and the hook was cute.  I'd definitely recommend the series for a nice relaxing read this summer.RATING: 3Heat Rating:  HotREVIEWED BY: Monique NeavesCourtesy of My Book Addiction and More

so many new authors(esess?) to read...great story, so glad to see Sophie grow into herself, and a few times i just wanted to smack Logan!!! But with it to read as Sophie learns to stand up for herself, not only against Logan but against who i think of as her Step-Monster, but without the 'Step' part...will be reading the rest of the Wedding Dare Novels (and novellas!) and getting into the McCade brother's history...so many books, so little time...
summary: now i gotta read all of the rest!!!!!

reviewText: This was by far my favorite book of the Wedding Dare series (Tessa Bailey's is a very close second) and my favorite book to date from Samanthe Beck. Oh my goodness I did not want to put this one down. With a mix of wit, banter and steamy sexytimes, I just couldn't resit this one.I loved the heat and chemistry between Sophie and Logan. These two were way hot together and it definitely had me all hot and bothered but in such a good way. I really enjoyed watching these two "fall".I admit, there is just something about a sexy hero who is so busy with his job and everything in his day to day life be brought to his knees. I'm not sure why I like these types of stories but I do and Logan was no exception. He's the founder and CEO of his company and is now starting to realize that there is more to life than making money. I liked that he was able to unwind with Sophie and realize that he wanted more with her. *sigh* Plus, he was just so damn cute with Sophie. Loved them together.As for Sophie, I admit at times her negative thoughts towards herself was a bit much. I just felt bad and wanted her to see what everyone else saw. I liked that she was able to be honest and open with Logan and it was great watching them interact with one another.This was a great book and I can't wait for more from Samanthe Beck.
summary: Hot and sexy and oh so good!

reviewText: Rules of Survival is the story of Mikayla (aka, Kayla), on the run for the past year for the murder of her mother, that she didn't commit. Bounty hunters, some of which have been after her and her mom all her life, are after her now. When Kayla is cornered by Patrick and Shaun, two of the hunters, while trying to figure out how to clear her name, the game of survival just kicked into overdrive. Honestly, I have mixed feelings about this one. There were parts I really liked, parts that were exciting, parts that were mysterious, parts that were predictable, and parts that just didn't work for me. Here's a bit of what I liked and didn't like:What I Liked:• I would place this between Mature Young Adult and New Adult. I liked that this is a gentler transition between the genres. Kayla is 18 and Shaun is 20-something. But it's from Kayla's POV and reads as an 18-year-old. While there is sexuality, it is not the heavily-ladled borderline erotica many "new adult" books are putting out there.• The main characters had sympathetic pasts that had a decent complexity. I enjoyed getting to know them. Kayla is a tough girl, a survivor, who has lived a very unique life, and she never quits. I liked her, even though she was easily distracted by a cute boy. And Shaun's backstory, especially the bits with Patrick, was both heart-breaking and sweet. Once you get past the superficial, Shaun is very endearing.• There was a certain complexity that Accardo created that made the story interesting and not run-of-the-mill. There's mystery and suspense, trying to puzzle missing pieces together, trying to read through lies, deceptions, and misconceptions. While some of it was predictable, it was still interesting and thoughtful.• Though the mistakes here were big and far-reaching, it does showcase that even parents make mistakes, and how a child might cope with those mistakes, forgive, trust, and unconditionally love.• I liked the ending and the story itself felt complete. Not everything was all rainbows and flowers in the end, but what started as a very difficult reality for Kayla, ended with peace and hope, and I liked that.Not so much:• The first chapter sets the precedence for the tone of the book that didn't sit great with me, and affected the rest of the read. Kayla doesn't run away. Kayla kept trying to read the letter instead of stuffing it in her pocket for later when she was out of mortal danger. Kayla's eying Shaun like she's never seen a cute boy before. Kayla says there's no alternative exit when there's suddenly an exit. No one seems to have any weapons or protection. Of course, if she had the letter there would have been no story, but I was still bothered by the girl's poor choices. It set a precedence for future blunders.• Insta-whatever it was. I don't mind insta-attraction or even insta-love in general. I remember the first time I met my husband fondly. But for me the "insta" between Kayla and Shaun just didn't work for me considering the delicate situation they were in to begin with. In the first few chapters, reading about all the flirty looks and lusting and being so easily distracted just felt far-fetched and forced. They were in a life-threatening situation minutes into meeting each other. There should be no googly eyes! Their growing feelings felt more realistic, but the beginning kinda ruined the spark for me.• A couple predictable parts I figured out and was just waiting for Kayla to catch up. And there were a few things that were just off or plot holes, which I won't spoil. The book was still enjoyable, but these left it a little less satisfying.Overall, this standalone was a quick, enjoyable read for me, but nothing to jump up and down about. I love Accardo's Denazen series, and her writing here was still really good, I just didn't like it as much. But I am still a fan of Accardo and will continue to read her books. But don't let me discourage you. If you are looking for a suspenseful read, a bit of a whodunit with a sweet romance, and some action-filled moments, then Rules of Survival may just be for you.

She did it again, loves!If you read my preview reviews on Jus Accardo's writing you probably alreadybfigure out I fangirl BIg time over her. I love anything she writes and Rules of Survival is no exception.Rules of Survival is the perfect combination of suspense, action, witty comments and raw feelings.Makayla Morgan has been on the run for a year now after beign acused of murdering her own mother, but in truth, she's beign running her whole life. All she's used to it is to blend in, to never trust anyone and to use her brain to get her out of difficult times.But Kayla had to go back to the place her mom died to try to figure out what and who she's running from. And that's where we first find her.Patrick Tanner is a bounty hunter. He's been after the Morgan girl all his life and this time he has a little help to capture Kayla. Meet Shaun Denver. Hot, smart, witty, tattoed (we all love some inked guys) and absolutely infuriating.Where Kayla is the kind of person who needs a plan to feel secure and know where she's going, Shaun is the type who jumps into the situations and goes with it. Kayla is the brains, she's not a fighter AT ALL but she can deliver some serious BS to get her out of trouble. Shaun on the hand will use those pretty muscles without a second thought.What I loved most about this book is how Jus managed to keep the suspence, giving us little pieces of information at sthe time to keep the story going but still being able to surprise you with the final outcome.The characters feel real. Both have past that haunts them in their own way and things they aren't ready to face. Jus managed to make them  Bad-Ass and vulnerable at the same time.And of course the fact that (like any of her books) Jus just throws you into the story in the first page. It manges to capture and hold you in until the last page and then, it leaves you wanting more. She presents the story in a easy short way and continues with an opening act full of action and just goes from there.Rules of Survival is an intense read you don't wanna miss!
summary: We All Make Mistakes In Books Reviews

reviewText: I really liked this book! It was a pretty crazy ride from the get go. I liked Kayla's character and felt awful for her the whole book. And Shaun man won worthy :p. this was a great read - the only thing I wish there was a little more to the ending. Maybe a prologue  a few years in the future or something, but that's just me I like to have a little more to the endings. But it was still a great book that I suggest to anyone who likes New Adult reads.

I read an ARC of this book. I give it 4 stars. Or can I do 4-1/2? LOLRegan Wakefield is a woman who knows what she wants. She is a professional in both business and in private life. Everything in her life must go according to a plan. She hasn’t had an easy life and has worked hard to get to where she is. She does not have time to play games and has her mind set on what she wants. In this instance, what she wants is Logan McCade. He is the CEO of his own company, driven for results and gorgeous. He fits her plan perfectly. What else could a girl want?Brock McNeil is a country boy. He has never really put himself forward to reach his full potential. He has been happy to slide along doing what he has to do to keep his father happy. He lives in the shadow of his older brother’s seemingly perfect existence or so he would have everyone believe. But when he spots Regan as the bridesmaid at his best friend’s wedding he decides that some things may be worth working to achieve.One night together. What could it hurt? Regan figures it won’t hurt anything as long as she can keep it on her own terms. Then she can get back to putting herself in front of Logan to try and catch his eye. He is the type of man for her, after all. But after one night, Brock is left wanting more and trying to figure out a way to convince Regan that she really does want to take a chance with him.Regan is a hard character to like at first. But once you catch some glimpses at what she has gone through to get to where she is and the insecurities that she faces, she is much more relatable. Brock is lovable from the start but he does have a thick headed. I would have liked to be able to give him some advice part way through the book.I really enjoyed this book. I would give it 4-1/2 stars. I did read another of the Wedding Dare series and the characters are all linked together in the books. I loved that I could place what was going on with the other characters that I had already read about while I was reading this book. Knowing the ending of this story before reading it made it a little different. I really like books with multiple points of view and this one did not disappoint.Now I need to get the rest of the series and read them!!
summary: Another great book in this series

reviewText: Emmy comes home to her sister Margery’s three-week wedding extravaganza at their grandmother’s Marietta, Montana home and ends up meeting Griffin who left her go into the military and never looked back. He broke her heart, has been gone for 10 years. But the two are not children anymore and their chemistry is still there. Griffin is all tattooed up, very alpha male!Though the plot of this story moved extremely fast for my taste is was very well told. This book is part of the Montana Born Brides series of books and stories. I highly recommend for romance lovers!!
summary: Unanswered long lost love,a great read!

reviewText: Love this MC BOOK!!!!I loved the first, but by all means, this one is far more!!!  I love it all!!!

Daisy"little flower" & Preach's story.  I loved this series!!Daisy has always been in the Renegade Son's life her father is a member so she knows what will happen when she turns 18, but not wanting to be an "Old Lady"  like her poor excuse of a mother, she chose the only way she could still be a part of the club. She meets Preacher and he is the only one she would be a "Old Lady" for but he hurts her over & over again by being with other women & his drinking like her father. Preach has a secret that could make him choose between her & his biker family.In the end can Preach turn his life around? Or will it be too late and he has lost her forever?

Preach has endured pain and hardship early in life but when he meets Daisy the sun shines on him. Daisy is the sweetest little flower in the bunch. You just want to protect her and keep her safe. He wants to be her protector and give her everything she wants until one decision changes their life.I kept asking myself, if I were Daisy, would I be able to forgive? How much would I be willing to forget?I’m not sure I would have done anything differently. The pain Daisy felt was palpable. I do think her youth and naivety played a big part too. This, in no means, gives Preach a pass. His actions caused chaos for years.While I loved the book, I wish someone would have been a bigger advocate for Daisy. She was born into this crazy life and often times struggled for her voice. Only at the end did she come into her own.Just like the last book, I am looking forward to read more about the Renegade Sons.
summary: I am looking forward to read more about the Renegade Sons.

reviewText: I loved this book! I like being able to follow the characters thru live as they go. It makes it feel more real. Love all of the Renegade Son's!

Tessa Teevan has done it again with the third book, Inflame, in the Explosive series! This oh so sweet and sexy read will grab you from the first page.Solider Kale Montgomery meets school teacher, Lucy Dawson on the day he is fulfilling his godfather duties for 'Bring Your Daddy To Work Day'. They immediately hit it off. However, Kale is known as a ladies man. No settling down for him. Soon enough their playful banter turns into flirting and eventually into friends with benefits. With Kale's upcoming deployment, the 'what are we question' arises. Neither one wants to admit it, but they have fallen for each other. Hard. When lines are crossed, their past comes back to haunt them. Obstacles are thrown their way. It challenges their beliefs of  love. They are reminded why they always stayed away from love. But this is Kale and Lucy. Their love is like no other."I have every intention of making her mine, but until I know she’s ready, hell, until I’m sure that I’m even ready, I’ll bid my time and continue to be her best friends... I know that in the end it’ll be more than worth it. Waiting for her will be worth it."Time apart does nothing to dim the flame (pun intended) between Kale and Lucy. Their passionate summer fling is so much more than they ever imagined. Friends with benefits? Sexy times with your best friend? What more can you want? They soon learn that the thought of being without each other is no longer an option. Life makes so much more sense when they are together. Even when life throws curves, Lucy and Kale face them head one. No matter what, Kale and Lucy always find HOME within each other.“Home isn’t just a place for me, babe. It’s wherever you are. So we could be at my place, at your place, or in a van by the river. As long as I’m with you, then I’m home.”Inflame is so much more than a friends with benefits or friends to lovers story. Why? Because it goes much DEEPER than that. The connection between Kale and Lucy is felt the moment they met. The reason they never found true love? Because their souls were still looking for each other. That is the kind of love that exists between them. Their love goes beyond what they could have ever imagined. They found love when they least expected it-when they weren't looking. But love doesn't work that way. It finds you when you're ready. With the right person. Inflame attests to that.“All my time with you is the best times infinity, Kale Montgomery.”Kale Montgomery. You have absolutely stolen my heart when I least expected it. You are not only drop dead gorgeous, you are kind and you also hold the most beautiful soul I've ever met in a hero in a story. Kale loves with everything he has. With all of his heart and soul. With conviction. Kale. Just. Loves. He protects. He is possessive, yet compassionate. He will make you laugh. He will also make you cry. And you will love him even harder through both."And just like that, Lucy Dawson shines the light in my life and my dark thoughts completely disappear."While you can read Inflame as a standalone, I highly suggest you read the other books in this series. The author has a talent for allowing you to go beyond reading her stories. You live them. You want to crawl inside her books and become friends with these sexy men and their sexy, sassy, and fierce women. Her characters are genuine. She holds nothing back. As a reader you experience raw emotion in her books, and Inflame adds to that.

It's official.  I'm hooked.  I absolutely have to follow the story to its end.  It's unusual for a plot to be this fascinating - rather like the first time I ran across Laurell K Hamilton's Anita Blake, and woke up 20 books later, ready to start back at the beginning.  It's gonna be a keeper.Jgtimm

0.99 was too much to pay for this compilation. The first story was moderately good. Good plot, good characters, some story problems but ok. After that?!! Jesus! I kept going, "maybe it'll get better..maybe it'll get better" and it never did. By the last book, I knew which movies she had knowingly or unknowingly ripped off to write that one! Ritual suicide would have been less painful.
I couldn't find one story that kept my attention. The characters very one dimensional and the bestiality was a bit much for me.

Extremely enjoyable story and look forward to reading more from this author.Darcy left behind a high-profile law career to open her own B&B; in Magnolia Bay. Only problem is that the house, Magnolia House, has a shady past, and there are people in town who don't want it to be restored. Trent, a former golf-pro who has come home to help with the family business, actually wants to help her.I truly loved this story. Hilarious story and makes me want to move there to hang out with the group of women who form Darcy's circle of friends.

Sweet Home Carolina isn't your typical romance! It's so much more too! The story is about Darcy and Trent. But I also enjoyed the secondary characters in this book and how everyone helps their friends! This was a great Southern story and Ms Boykin portrayed that really well!

Darcy gave up being a lawyer to buy a house in Magnolia Bay, SC to convert into a Bed and Breakfast. She used her life saving to buy a big old house, but the towns Historic Preservation Society did not approve of the house since it had once been used as a Bordello. Trent took one look at Darcy and felt an attraction to her and tries to help her. Trent has to start working for his father, who is building a big resort close to Darcy's house. Trent's Dad wanted to build his entrance to his resort on what was part of Darcy's property. Darcy felt all was lost and she was going to lose everything. She didn't think Trent would be able to help.I really enjoyed reading about Magnolia Bay and hope to read more stories set in the town.

In Kim Boykin's Sweet Home Carolina, Darcy Vance has taken her life savings and purchased Mimosa House, planning to turn it into a stunning historical Bed and Breakfast in Magnolia Bay, South Carolina. Unfortunately, the house was a brothel in its past life, with ties to the leaders of the local Historical Society that they would rather forget. Darcy has an uphill battle trying to convince the Bloom Sisters to allow it onto the Magnolia Bay Memorial Day Historic Home tour. With little money left, this is the only way she can make it successful, as her advertising budget is zero.Trent Mauldin is a hometown boy who made it big in Pro Golf. Home recovering from an injury and trying to figure out his next step, he runs into Darcy and is intrigued. He signs himself on to help her finish her renovations and, hopefully, help with his stubborn Aunts.There is definitely a hot romance between these two, but that is only part of it. Darcy meets and makes friends, and they rally with her to help get her through every curve she is thrown.I loved this story, and I love Magnolia Bay! I am thrilled at the prospect of reading more!
Very sweet book with wonderful and likable characters.  The chemistry between Darcy and Trent makes this a fun read!

*ARC for a review*Willa Dunn has grown up knowing at least one thing for sure:  the Loveless Brothers are EVIL.  Their construction company has always been at odds with her family's historical preservation business.  Now, not only has her baby sister has turned traitor and agreed to marry the oldest Loveless Brother, the middle brother just out-bid her on her dream house.Knox Loveless can't fully fathom why he lets Wilhelmina Dunn get under his skin, it's just been that way since a teenage bet changed their relationship all of those years ago.  It's none of her business why he joined the Historical Society Board, or that building "McMansions" with no character irritates him.  When he discovers that Willa's dream house is for sale, and that she might be out bid, he steps in and buys it himself.  Now, Knox is once again public enemy number one.  Can another bet change their relationship again?Willa is often described in the book as being passionate or high-strung.  That is actually a spot on description.  I loved how the author doesn't leave out the ugly bits of a passionate personality.  Passionate people do tend to be self-centered and make a habit of walking over people to achieve their goals.  Being passionate is not a terrible thing, but people like that do need someone in their life (a friend, family member, or partner) to ground then and keep them from alienating people.All of the characters in this book have massive flaws that the author uses to benefit the story.  The "drama queen" sister isn't chastised, but accepted; the blustering father isn't turned into a villain, just a typical big personality; the "other guy" is actually likable, despite committing a huge social gaffe.Overall, I really liked this book.  The way that for every situation, both sides of the story were told with equal weight, appealed on many levels.  Plus, the resolution was actually very satisfying and didn't feel forced or rushed.

I really, really enjoyed this book. The characters were well-rounded and quite well-developed, and the story flowed smoothly. I loved the subtleties and the nuances throughout. Altogether, it was a great read. I would highly recommend it.

I just loved the story of these two.  There was just enough chemistry and playfulness that it was absolutely believable.  It kept me turning pages and I really didn’t want to see it end!  My first by Erika Marks and I’m already into her “Pick Me” which is the third installment in this great series!  Grab this fun read and enjoy!

Bet The House is the first book i read by Erika Marks and I'm glad I gave her a try.It was so funny and I loved how the heroine and hero hated each other for so many years because their families are professional rivals but it turns out that there is a fine line between love and hate!The story takes place right after Knox bought a bungalow that Willamena was planning to buy for many years  and she is very upset for losing the house to Knox so when he offer her a way to get the house if she'll win a bet.I loved he heroine Willamena's sense of humor and how sarcastic she was.I also enjoyed the second plot about Willa's younger sister Peach getting married to Knox's oldest brother Brady, it added to the story.It seems like there will be more books about the rest of family members.Edit to add-Pick Me (Magnolia Bay Book 3)came out a few days ago and  it's about Willa's sister Thea.
summary: I'm glad I took a bet and read Bet the House by Erika Marks

reviewText: I don't even have the words.... this book was simply one of those reads that leaves you smiling through tears. It was a beautiful and thought provoking read about life and love and I wouldn't have changed a word of it.

It was a good read and I think the storyline was interesting but I just couldn't get into it as much as I would have liked to. First off, I am confused about her being 19, I understand that she missed a year but wouldn't that have made her 18 starting her senior year, that would have made her only a year older than her peers. Next, I would have enjoyed a little more about Mr. Daniel's family. Also, the sex scene was not in the right part of the story for me, it was bad placement for my taste. Then, I felt like the end was rushed. There could have been a few more chapters at the end added. I did think the story was well written and I can see the author has a lot of talent.  I'm still interested in reading the author's other work, just because this storyline wasn't my cup of tea doesn't mean I didn't enjoy the way the author writes.

I searched my mind for a title for this review. Nothing came to mind because words are not enough. I've read over 500 books since getting my kindle December 2012. I've never been so emotional while reading...EVER!!! I cried throughout the book and when it was over, I cried some more. I didn't want it to end. I want to know what happens next. This a story of pain, growth, life, death and LOVE. It's a story that should be read by everyone. One of the best books 2014.

I'm a big fan of student/teacher fiction, but, this story had me in tears.  It's perfect.  I loved the back story, the side characters are amazing, soo much going on and I'm an emotional wreck.  This author has serious talent.  So happy I finally read this incredible book.  It wrapped up the story, but, would love a sequel!  :) A huge 5 stars and I'm so stalking Brittany Cherry' s blog!

I received a complimentary copy from the author in exchange for an honest review.Let me start this review by saying I usually do not read teacher/student romances. I read only one in the past and it didn't work. I honestly cannot remember how I came across Loving Mr. Daniels but I read the blurb and thought why not give it a chance, it sounds decent. Disappointed? oh no!!!I actually enjoyed and even loved it. The writer has a great way of writing that had me drawn into the story. Her characters were believable, loveable and I wanted to cause bodily harm to Daniel's brother a few times within the book.Loving Mr. Daniels had so much intensity, love, laughter, sadness and most of all love. Any book that can make me cry is definitely a good book because I am not an emotional person. I felt that the book was a little more than the teacher/student romance. It contained stories of drugs, murder, homosexuality and cancer. Tie everything I just mentioned into a book and I got a GREAT read.The Story revolves around Ashlyn. Ashlyn who is broken because of the lost of a love one is trying to find out how to live with that person. Her relationship with her parents who are separated isn't the best and a decision is made for her to move to Edgewood, Wisconsin. On her way to Edgewood, she cannot keep her eyes off the strange man with blue hypnotic eyes on the train."His eyes were so blue and filled with interest. For a second, I thought they were a passageway to a different world.Beautiful.Breathtaking.Brilliant.Blue eyes."Daniel Daniels is sweet, loving, a musician and a man with a deep and secretive past. He is a favourite amongst his students but didn't expect to see Ashlyn in one of his classes. I loved that he tried so hard to resist her and his love for her. I was actually rooting for their love to make it through the book. Did they find their happily ever after? You will have to one-click Loving Mr. Daniels to find out :)I would recommend this to anyone that will listen to me. I don't think I can put into words how much I loved this story and wanted, no I was hoping for another book about Ashlyn and Daniel.I rated Loving Mr. Daniels a 5 Star*****
summary: What a great story, I loved it!!!

reviewText: I thought this book was fantastic.  I have read a lot of books in 2014 already and this just went to the top of the list.

I bought this book by accident. I meant to download a sample but bought it instead. It as recommended by readers who loved Colleen Hoovers Slammed. I almost returned it, but thought why not try it. Oh. My gosh....what am AMAZING book! I laughed, I cried, I cried again and then laughed. It was everything you want in a love story. I wish I could give it 10 stars!
This is a wonderful read and enjoyed every page!

I wasn't sure I was going to like Mazie after reading the first book.  I'm glad I was wrong, I really enjoyed her character.  I also enjoyed Steve, although I would have liked to get to know him better.  The "twist" with his background was very interesting and something I didn't see coming but I would have liked more!  The story was engaging and I learned even more about this new world that Erin has created.  4 stars instead of 5 because it was a little too short - would have liked a more in-depth character development of Steve.  I look forward to the third book in the series.

I received an ARC of this book from the Publisher, via Netgalley, in exchange for an honest review.I got into this series because of Darkness Falls in Dark and Deadly: Eight Bad Boys of Paranormal Romance, which I thoroughly enjoyed.Maise has been working in the illegal side of Reve as a courier in an attempt to earn enough money to start her own business. Steve is the head of Chimera, an organization attempting to police the Reve.What is the Reve? It is dreamscapes-personal and collective, and with the right hardware, or the right talent it is possible to link up with others to share dreams.Honestly, I did not get quite the same buzz from this as I did Darkness Falls, because I knew what the setting was and some of what would happen. There were still a few new surprises that opened this world up though, plenty to keep the reader intrigued and wanting the next book.Maise is such a fun character; she's strong, tough, practical, and vulnerable. Steve though, he's the mystery man. He has all kinds of complicated layers and secrets. I can really see Maise and Steve, as different from each other as they are, doing well together.But Vincent must have some pretty serious skills and secrets too, and I'm really hoping the next book is his.This fast-paced novella  gives the reader a slice of what looks to be a very complex world. There isn't any of that onerous info dumping, so you really need to read these in order to understand what is happening. Thoroughly enjoyable, I am giving this book 4 stars.

NUMBER OF HEARTS: 3REVIEW:Lay Me Down was the 2nd novella in Erin Kellison’s new Reveler series was pretty good.  I think that I enjoyed this one a little better than the first novella.  I am still struggling a little with the world.  There seems to be a lot going on in such a short period of time and everything was a little rushed.But again I believe I will give book 3 a try and see if it is working for me.Disclaimer:I received a complimentary copy of the book from NetGalley & Fire Flower Publishing, LLC  in exchange for an honest review. This review is my own opinion and not a paid review.

I was given this book in exchange for an honest review.This was a short but fulfilling read.  It is the second book in the series, but it can be read as a stand alone.  Warning though - once you start, you won't be able to stop!

Lay Me DownThis is book 2 of this series and I really enjoy the creative word building the author gave us in crafting such a separate world that we can enjoy.Meet Maisie Lane she is a 21 year old woman who has been forced into working with hunky Chimera agent Steve Coll, Steve is trying to recruit Maisie away from working for a shady group as a courier. Although Maisie is highly talented she isn't using all her capabilities to there fullest, something that Steve can assist her with, when she starts to work for the good guys! But Maisie is as stubborn as she is beautiful, she had already decided not to continue working for Graeme and although she might be ordinary in the real world she is highly talented once she is Darkside. Maze is used to figuring out how to get out of trouble on her own and doesn't need the stuffy,nerdy, but sexy Agent to save her! Who cares that he has the perfect body, and sexy, kissable lips! She will be able to ditch him as soon as they get to the Darkside.Meet Special Agent Steve Coll, he has been sent to free Maisie from the group that Graeme works for, and convince her that as an agent for Chimera she will be more fulfilled. Steve knows that Maze is afraid to trust him, but he is more talented than even the Chimera knows, and he is feeling highly protective and possessive of the funny and sexy troublemaker. Steve knows that Maisie is hiding something about her last job, but he can't figure out what, and he also can't help but think of how good it will feel to kiss her and explore her body; but fraternizing with a recruit is strictly forbidden!Join Maze and Steve in this fantastic adventure as they lead us through a world of shadows and beauty, as they struggle to figure out that some rules were made to be broken!ARC received from author and Netgalley in exchange for an honest review.*
summary: Dreaming has never felt so good!

reviewText: I will read anything Laken Cane puts out regarding shiv crew. The characters are dynamic and mesh so well together. Rune is one of my favorite heroines and I read a lot! This book was just as good if not better (romance wise) than the first three. I love where Laken is taking the crew.
I won this book on library thing . It was okay, I think it would have been better had I read part one first. It's great for a short story.

If you want stories of erotic romance, this anthology is perfect for you. Just One Night by Caridad Pineiro is a scorching friends to lovers story. Jason Hart and Nicole de Salvo have loved each other forever but never told the other of their lustful dreams. Now he's a Marine and is being sent to Afghanistan, they have just one chance to reveal their heart's desire. Will they take a chance? I loved the sexual chemistry between Jase and Nickie. They turn up the heat with their intense fiery attraction and passionate love. Their romance makes for a quick and entertaining read. The Jersey Shore provides a perfect back drop for love. The story has lively banter and a wonderful cast of characters, but their passionate romance complete with a HEA is the centerpiece. Lucky for me that this isn't the end. Next we'll see how Nickie's brother, Tommy, deals with love.
summary: Just One Night by Caridad Pineiro

reviewText: I have read every Crossroads series book and liked them all.... some more than others.  When I saw that this book became available, I knew I had to read it.  Sadly, this book did not measure up to the expectations.  With too much inner dialogue and very little interaction between characters other than the H and h (and even their interaction was limited to either memories of the past or how intense these two seem to be), I just seem to be struggling with this book. I also had an issue with how immature this story felt.  Especially when the heroine can hold a grudge and be so tight -lipped about it.  It appears that this type of angst is more on the level of a child than an adult.  It was very frustrating to say the least.  Also, through most of the book, even our hero seemed a bit whipped towards the heroine.  He did not exactly "fight " for the HEA.  He played her game better than she did in order to win.I could only give this book 3 stars.  It had potential, but painfully missed the mark.  I just hope that this is not the beginning of a steep decline for this series.
summary: Not the greatest of the series....

reviewText: This was another winning novel by the writing duo. Have loved every single one of these books and  I can't wait for the next to release.
This was an easy read and it was fun to read. Kept me wanting to keep reading it not put it down.
This was a very good book.  I liked the main characters.  The Sister and Mother were something else.  I am glad I purchased this book and will look for more from this Author.

I think this is my favorite of book that Rosemarie Naramore has written.  It really kept my interest.  I could picture life in a small town and the hard work that goes in to making a small business thrive under tough circumstances.  Kristine did not give up and worked hard.  Fortunatey, she met some one like Joe and ultimately found love.

This is a great story of how Cuba and Dovey meet and begin to fall for eachother... You also get a good glimps of what is going on in Cuba's life.  I can't wait to read Very Wicked Things to find out what happens with them.This is another amazing book by Ilsa that you will love :D

well I luved Very Bad Things and I wasn't to sure what I was going to think about prequel...well I luved it!  I luv Cuba!! I can't wait to get started on Very wicked Things..can't wait to see how Cuba and Dovey's relationship evolves  = )

I read this because I wanted to get a better feel for her writing before coughing up some dough to read her actual novels. Read a blurb of it in: Breakaway: A New Adult Anthology. Read this and HAD to read their story. Some heavy stuff. I don't always go for light reading but dddaaannnggg girl. This writer does not hold back. You will want to strangle both characters but for me that makes them real. Humans with all their lovely folies. Definitely enjoyed it. I'll need a break with some sappy stuff to get back to this one.

These two were meant to be together. Two totally opposite people thrown together. Right side of the track and the wrong side of the track. Sports jockey and a Dancer? Wow! Talk about opposites attracting, in this story they do! I loved how no matter what they have been through, they both have overcame hardships. I loved it!

The Queen of Hearts is the second in "The Jayne " series and it is my favorite so far in this series . I think author Jamie Denise has went and hit her self a home run with this book. This book start where See Jayne Play ended . As soon as I sat down ad started reading this book I was hooked. This book was full of a lot more action and drama than the first book. This book had so many different kinds of emotional roller coaster of emotions . This book made me laugh so hard , it made me want to cry , it had me yelling at the characters so many times it was not funny. I fell more in love with all most all the characters in this book. The sexual chemistry was so hot is was sizzling. This book a few sexy hot Alpha men in this book that will have your panty wet . This book is full of love, friendship, passion and family what more could you ask for in a book.Jayne decide to leave Las Vegas the only place that she know as home. She leave with a her heart ripped out and nothing to lose now. She decide to run away from the only man she has ever love because she think he has betrayal her and lied to her. For all his betrayal it cost her father life . All she want know is to start over some where no one know who she is or what she has done in her past . But when she finally find a place where she want to live and start over and she can find other that she can trust. But what she was not planning was for her friend to come and find her . But as he told her in the past " He'd never give up on her ". But after he leave her she starts to re think what she wants . She decide to go make to Vegas and look for Flynn but what she finds after a year of being gone all most take her to her knees . Can she for give Flynn or will his betrayal she thinks he has done be to much for her to handle.Flynn Maguire has all ways got what he want when he wants some ting. But all that change when he met and fell in love with Jayne . He has made up his up his mind he will not at nothing to have her in his heart and mind. But he knows with a women like Jayne he has to make sure he does every thing just right or he will lose her forever. The day he let her walk out of his life he had not choice but to let her walk away. But he has made up a plan to get her back in his heart and his bed . But to get her back he will have to take down his father and he know that will not be easy. But in the end will it be enough for him to get back his women or will it be to late for him to have a happy ending.Their is so much more juiciness that I did not share about this book. I cant wait to read more from this author in the future .

I really liked Very Bad Things and I was looking forward to the next book in the series.  Unfortunately, Very Wicked Things didn't work so well for me. I think there was simply too much going on (unplanned pregnancy, Russian mafia, suicide, prostitution, blackmail, drug overdose, child neglect, Alzheimer's) for it to seem realistic for high school seniors.  I also missed some of the humor that was in the first book and having Dovey and Cuba's relationship told in flashback lessened the emotional impact.I'm still a fan of Ilsa Madden-Mills and will read her next book since she writes well, but this one missed the mark for me.
I enjoyed Cuba and Dovey's story.  The author does a great job writing their story and capturing their emotions.  It was a rollercoaster of teen angst!!

The SAGA CONTINUED with LIVING FOR LOVE AND DYING FOR LOYALTY 2. JUST WHEN I THOUGHT it COULDN'T GET ANY BETTER, it DID. I FELT LIKE I was WATCHING an URBAN DRAMA MINI-SERIES. EVERYTHING I READ was SO VIVID. PICTURES were PAINTED with WORDS. I was on a ROLLERCOASTER RIDE of EMOTIONS. I LAUGHED, and was ANGERED. I also was DEEPLY SADDENED by SOME EVENTS. I'm LOVING this SERIES, and TOTALLY HOOKED. SECRETS, REVELATIONS, and an EXPLOSIVE ENDING, has ME WANTING pt.3 NOW. LADY P DID HER THING, TRULY GIFTED. A MUST, MUST, MUST READ...........

I loved the "Moments" series from the first words I read in "A Moment" and after reading "Right Now", I couldn't wait to read more about Tor as I fell in love with his character."This Time" solidified his place as one of the greatest book boyfriends ever.Tor, who years ago moved from Norway to the US, definitely will remind you of a Viking or a Norse God. Strong and protective, he is also sweet and tender. He is a gentle giant that isn't scared of his emotions and of showing them. He isn't afraid of loving although due to his past he would have every reason to. The confidence to be who he is, to not compromise, to allow himself to feel and be true to those emotions, makes him not only super out-of-this world swoon-worthy but also sexy as hell. He knows his priorities and is his own person - always true to himself.There is nothing, and I mean nothing about him to dislike. It doesn't mean he might not have any flaws, but they are damn hard to notice or care about. He might be the most perfect book boyfriend ever written - perfect without being irritating or unrealistic. I really don't think my words can do him justice.The way he loves Jamie - wholeheartedly and unconditionally without disregarding his own feeling, the way he treats her with devotion and reverence and utmost respect, it melted my heart, took my breath away and made me smile so big I feared my face will split in two. Despite his past he isn't bitter or cold, but instead emotionally available and open. He is all male and yet sensitive. He does the sweetest things without being corny and his actions, feelings and thoughts made me melt like ice-cream on a hot summer's day.Really, I could go on gushing about him for hours and yet, I wouldn't manage to paint a picture that is true to his character.Jamie, on the other hand, I was prepared to dislike. She seemed all hung up on her on-and-off waste of a space boyfriend and my first instinct was to slap her for using Tor. Damn, was I proven wrong. Unlike my assumptions, she isn't one to play with anyone. She is just an extremely loyal girl, who out of guilt and a sense of obligation sacrifices her life and happiness for a love long gone wrong. She has a hard time letting go of what has been her dream for a fairytale future, disregarding the fact that the frog is no prince and that the fairytale has turned into a nightmare. It is not that she is ignorant to reality. But sometimes it is hard to accept the truth, despite seeing it clearly. And that is the situation Jamie is in. Torn between her longing for happiness and the guilt that keeps her stuck in a toxic and unhealthy situation, it takes Tor thundering into her life  and after one night of passion flipping it upside down, for her to consider that life has to offer more than constant misery and agony.And with a complete new future that fate forced upon her, step by step she finds the motivation to let go of the guilt and obligation that keeps her captive and to allow Tor to win her heart. With every touch, with every word he proves to her, that he is there for her no matter what and shows her that true love is beautiful, sweet and gives instead of just taking and destroying everything in its path. She realizes it is important to let go of the past in order to have a shot at a future.And for Tor she is willing to do just that. She learns to let him into her life and into her heart.Despite their pasts, they both get a second chance at love and it is beautiful, yet bittersweet at the same time. The way they are with each other touched my heart with its sweetness and brought tears to my eyes. The love they share made me weep and sob at times - even more so when they share their feelings with us readers at the end of the book. They might be scarred, but not broken by their pasts.But sometimes the past worms its way back in and Jamie's past threatens to destroy the second chance her and Tor got, threatening their happiness and their future. True love is worth fighting for though and fight they did.Do yourself the favor and don't miss out on this beautiful, bittersweet love story and let the gentle Viking win your heart.5+ emotional, true-love-that-is-worth-fighting-for stars.
All of these books were awesome.  l have read all of them. What a storyGlad they found each other
I could see someone reading this book to a young child. Teachers could create activities from the book as well. Might be worth checking out hooking a device to a screen for a class to view.
summary: I learned a lot about baby animals

reviewText: An Awesome romance that started in the best possible way: Between Friends! India and Mikael have been friends since they were toddlers, so when one night they get drunk and test their relationship. To her surprise, India ends up pregnant from their night of passion. Then she learns of their Grandma's contract. Whoa, what!? Gran and Brownie are the scene stealers in this book. Loved them! A must read for those who like 'friend-to-lovers' stories.Great Job Ms. Rose!

I have already made my first cake using this books instruction and I totally nailed it. This may not seem impressive but I have had some terrible attempts in the past so this seems like a minor miracle! Well done Alexandra!
I am enjoying trying different dump cake recipes.  It is a new concept for me to make dump cakes and fun to do.

reviewText: This a good guide to the more common vitamins and supplements that can contribute heavily to your health. If you are curious about what each vitamin does for you then check out this book. With our diets today we can quickly become deficient in nutrients and it is a good idea to safe guard yourself with supplementation.
Really enjoyed this hot and steamy read.  You could feel the passion that Rachel has for Dominic and it is breathtaking.  The scenes are hot, spicy and well written.

I'll give the author an A for effort, but that's about it.  There is so much left out of this story.  What happened to the Pastor? Did the wife talk to Joni anymore?  Where there more secretaries after Joni? Etc., etc., etc.  I guess you get what you pay for and I got this book for free.
Loved it Loved it.

I swear scrapbooking is a cult now. Everyone I know that does it hides in their basement in groups and spends hours doing whatever they do. Now my daughter is into it so I get to dive into the world of scrapbooking. This book did a good job of explaining what to expect and helped me quite a bit.

*I received a copy of this book for a fair and honest review*This is a quick read, not only because it is a short novel but because it is so fast paced. I love that you got to see the story from different character perspectives, it made you feel as if you were in the thick of it, uncovering the crime with Max and her odd ball partner. Even more so because Ms Steele does such a good job with resonating the characters feelings on the page throughout the book. I’m glad to have stumbled across this author!

This is a novel that most definitely falls in the Crime and Detective genre. Although set in the present day, this is very much a good old fashioned detective story and reads very much like a Ray Chandler or Sam Spade novel; if it weren't for the occasional references to modern technology, the reader could almost imagine themselves in a period 1930's murder investigation. It's the classic story of an old school detective teamed up with a tenacious young female reporter, determined to get to the bottom of the of the seemingly motiveless murder of a high class call girl: Throw in a Senate Governor, a jealous wife, and a mysterious killer lurking in the background, and you have all the ingredients of a an engaging and fast-paced 'who and why they did it story.' There are a number of sub-plots and unexpected turns that slowly and cleverly fall into place to form the overall story. The ending was not what I was expecting, and is suggestive that this might well be just the first in a longer series of such stories.If I had but one tiny criticism it would be that I do think there is just the slightest over reliance on semi-colons in the first half of the story, but again, I say that based on my own reading and writing preferences, and I suspect other readers may well disagree with me on this.Despite not being a dedicated fan of ‘classic’ detective novels, I did find this story to be well written, enjoyable and entertaining. One of the things I don't usually enjoy with some detective novels is when the author tries to impress with almost Sherlock Holmes levels of analysis and clues that would take a super computer to figure out. In ‘Max's Mayhem’, Amber Hawkins manages to get the balance more or less just right to intrigue and hold the reader's interest without drowning them in procedural detail, relying instead on the detective's and the reporter's respective instincts and experience to move the story forward.At sixty two pages, this is more a novella than a full length novel, but packed within those pages is a story that fans of the murder, crime, and detective genres will really enjoy.
Read the entire series, could not wait to get to each succeeding novel, really hoping Jay Allan keeps it going!!

While I wasn't ready for a main character to leave the fold, I was glad to finally get this one.  I found the twists to be entertaining while keeping my mind occupied trying to guess the next tweak.  Good read by any standards, Jay hits another homer.  Cant wait for the next installment and the tangent series to get started.
Not going to lie. I wasn't sure where this story was going, and I am not sure that I was ready for the ending. It is an incredible read, and the best of the series I think.
Good story for a short one.
Okay short story with an odd, but interesting plot. Always look forward to Dean's newest books, but the newer ones just don''t grip me like his older books.
summary: but the newer ones just don''t grip me like his older books

reviewText: Dean Koontz tells a great story always!

Started out as a great story; ended a little strange and incomplete.  I know this story is a precursor to The City, but it fell a little flat for me.  If this is what I am in store for in the next book, I am going to be upset!
summary: Started out as a great story; ended a little strange and incomplete

reviewText: It was way, WAY to short, even for a short story. Even for only $1.00, we deserved more. But as always it was a good story.
As usual Dean Koontz takes you to the brink and keeps you there.  In your mind you're pleading, "don't go up there" or "don't open that".  Heart pounding!  Well, he's dependable as always.

This is a short prequel to Koontz's upcoming title "The City."  The story is complete within itself - it does not need to be read before "The City," although it will whet your appetite for the book.  Koontz is at his best here - the story is tight, executed well, and engrossing.
While the plot was interesting, the lengthy, turgid language kept losing me. It could have been more tightly written and a better story.
Great introduction to a possible new book to read.  Never read much by Koontz, but have always liked what I did read.  This story was no exception.
summary: Want to read The City now

reviewText: The Neighbor was my first Dean Koontz read - I enjoyed it from start to finish, although I have to say it was a bit predictable. I will very likely "graduate" onto The City - the writing style is placid, the words flow, I see it as acceptable entertainment.
Dean Koontz has always been a prolific writer, and he just keeps getting better. I love these stories of introduction before the novel. This one made my mouth go dry. Keep it up Mr. Koontz.
summary: A story that raises your hair on end

reviewText: The story captured my attention from the start. The characters live and breathe as if they live in the house next door. I did not want it to end.
Always like Dean Koontz. Not a great tale but a quick read and shortie.

I wasn't sure what to expect in this book. Being a huge zombie geek, and a huge fan of Mr O'Brien, I was not disappointed. I believe I have read every book by this amazing writer. He's given me hours of reading pleasure, and this book just reinforced what I already knew. John O'Brien is one of my favorite writers! Check out this book, you'll love it!

I could not wait to get my hands on this conclusion and let me tell you, Olivia Luck did not disappoint!I'm in love. Harris stole my heart in book one but he chained it down in book 2.I loved In Pursuit but this book glided along even more smoothly for me, if that's possible. Again, I felt like I was right there with the characters and often had to pull myself away from them to go to bed!I won't give away any spoilers. What I will say is that you will love these characters even more in this book. The story moves along without a hitch. Timing is perfect, story line solid, and a blossoming love absolutely breathtaking. This all attributes to the wonderful writing style of Ms. Luck.She is for sure, without a doubt, one of my favorite authors and I'm very much looking forward to all of her future works. I highly recommend you do the same! :)
summary: Another Hit for me!! Loved it!!

reviewText: This was a page turner in the best sense of the term. From start to finish I could not put Girl of Rage down. (It may have accompanied me through my kids’ bedtime routines, kept me up past my bedtime, and infiltrated my dreams even after I had finished.) Where the middle installment of many trilogies fall flat, this one captured my attention and held on until I lost several hours buried in the book.Girl of Rage picks up right where Girl of Lies left off. And from the very beginning the action is on. I was grateful for the way it picked up. It’s been nearly half a year since I read Girl of Lies, and as I opened to the first page, I couldn’t remember exactly what had happened, except that I was worried about Dylan. The ending points of the first book were subtly referred to without taking up a lot of description, so that my memory came back without it being too much retelling for people who may read them back to back.Each sister and their parents have their own mysteries to work through. Rachel’s illness has taken a backseat to the turmoil the family finds itself in. Julia and Crank face issues with their business. Andrea and Dylan are still on the run and out of contact with the rest of the family, causing added stress for Alexandra. Adelina and Jessica are also running on the opposite coast. And amidst all the danger to the girls, no one hears from their father.The secrets that are revealed in Girl of Rage begin to answer the question about what is really going on, but there are just as many new questions as there are answered ones, and the truth is far from clear.The one thing some might question about Girl of Rage is where is the romance. Several potential romantic pairings have been hinted at, but the root conflict in Rachel’s Peril as a whole is the family secrets, which don’t need to be confused with romantic overtones. I never missed a romantic storyline through either Girl of Lies or Girl of Rage. There was far too much action to miss anything!This series is one of my favorite spin-offs. It has taken the families created in the original trilogy and turned everything we thought we knew on it’s head. It was so fast paced, filled with so much mystery and hidden truths that I couldn’t help being sucked right back into the Thompsons’ lives.I was gifted a copy in exchange for my honest review.
Whoa. Erotic, erotic, erotic. I don't quite know what to say except, those are some fantasies definitely fulfilled.

UnRaveled is this brilliant story about a marriage that's gone a bit stagnant. Away in Italy to celebrate their tenth wedding anniversary, Lilly finds herself a bit alone and a lot frustrated. This was their trip to refresh the magic that once ran rampant through them.A couple of drinks later and a lonely walk back to her hotel room, Lilly wakes in an unfathomable situation. Her mind racing through the possibilities, nothing could prepare her for what happens next. Plagued with not wanting to enjoy something taboo, Lilly resists and denies as much as she can.But with a promise from her captor, and Lilly decides her best option is to do as she's told and not fight the situation.You find yourself just as bewildered as Lilly as K. Bromberg weaves this story that unravels the rational parts of our minds with the intense pleasure that has you questioning your sanity.And in the end, your reality is destroyed. What was up is now down and the inside is now out.Open your mind to the unimaginable, take a deep breath, and allow yourself to escape in this orgasmic fantasy. What fantasy would you want filled for your ten year anniversary? Twenty-five year anniversary?
summary: Holy H-E-L-L! What an amazing short story! Yes, this is dark and admittedly, I LIKE DARK.

reviewText: This book was so different from the Driven Trilogy and we find Kristy stepping into her darker side! In such a short story we got it all, a good story a good connection to the characters,and lots of steaming sex! Congratulations Kristy! I look forward to more of your work!

This lifestyle change from the standard American diet-- that is high in unhealthy fats and processed food and is ordered and eaten rapidly and usually alone-- is radical. This is a life change such as cutting up your credit card and paying only in cash, or selling your car so you will go everywhere by bicycle and public transportation. The book carefully guides you through this transition and you must be prepared to purge your kitchen of every food that is unhealthy and would be a stumbling block to your new resolve, your new life.

The heart of the diet is fresh vegetables and fruit, seafood instead of meat, whole grains, nuts, olive oil and red wine. But this is not a "fad" diet or a diet simply to lose weight; this is a lifestyle change. This intended lifestyle emulates the way of life of those who lived on the Mediterranean coasts and whose daily exercise and moderate healthful eating produced longer and healthier lives. It includes joyously lingering over your meal with friends and family.
summary: Love the meal choices- Great book

reviewText: I love Easy Greek Traditional recipes style cooking, and wanted to get healthier. I have a good number of Mediterranean books already, but decided to purchase this anyway. I'm so glad I did! The others sit on my shelf due to lack of time to cook...this book is by far the simplest, easiest book on Mediterranean eating I have seen. I have been following the menu plan for several days and my energy is skyrocketed, and it is just plain awesome. Buy this book'  use it, possibly lose weight and live longer.
summary: The simplest, easiest book on Mediterranean eating I have seen

reviewText: I've bookmarked several recipes already. They look delicious and healthy. I can't wait to make them! They'll be a welcome change to my routine.Healthy recipes. Most are intriguing combinations of foods I already eat while others tempt me to try something new. Great ideas to keep meals interesting
I can hardly wait to try these recipes. They look tasty and simple!! Who says vegan cooking has to be time- consuming?!

I must admit I found this book quite hard to get into at first but after the first few chapters I was sucked in to a new world were your dreams can be influenced and danger can lurk both awake or asleep. Jorden knows her sister is up to now good yet again and goes which her in the Reve to protect her, only they discover that they are in serious trouble as Maisie's employer's and others are fully aware of their unique gifts and will stop at nothing to get the girls on their side. This story was amazing and I absolutely loved it, learning the world of Reves and their dangers we see the girls collide with the sexy agents of Chimera who police shared dreams and their chemistries ignite as they fight to save and discover the evils lurking in the Scarpe and discover that somethings just won't be denied . Full of action, suspense, hot romance and major twists keeping you on the edge of your seat.
summary: Wow what an amazing new twist to Dreams xx

reviewText: I came across this new Reve series starter in a bundle, and I really liked it. I thought that the world building associated with Reve, which on the surface gives people ability to experience shared dreams, but looks to be way more than that, was really intriguing. And I liked the intelligent heroine and the way she wraps the dark and deadly hero around her finger. I will definitely be on the look out for more of this series.
summary: Great start to a 'dreamy' new series

reviewText: I enjoyed this story a lot. It has just about everything I look for when reading. Hero, action and a good story line.

JT Sawyer did an outstanding job with both this and the first book in the series. It was well thought out and had very little, if any, of the "miss-steps" so common to many of the Indie authors. The premise is good, the southwest description is excellent and the characters well developed and quite believable. If one is a fan of apopolyptic stoties and don't mind zombie-like protagonists, then this series is for you! get them and enjoy. I am waiting with anticipation for the next in the series.
summary: Mr. sawyer should quit his day job!

reviewText: I like his survival skills that the characters use. Maybe it might be helpfull to somebody in reality sometime. I say this with my medical background. Only complaint is I wish it was a book and didn't have to wait for more. Patience is not one of my best qualities. I loved the twists and turns and I love his characters and how they are developing. Keep the good work up!

A sweet follow up to SHINE NOT BURN that made me laugh and swoon a bit. I wasn't as invested in the relationship or the love interest as I would have liked and the build up fell somewhat flat for me.A sweet, simple story that is sure to make you giggle.
The first book in the series and I love it. The brotherhood and sisterhood in this book is so powerfully supportive and deeply loving. The love between the characters are intensely endeavoring.
Looking forward to more from this series.  Likeable characters, good story even though I found it hard to believe the characters were that young but hey,  it's fiction...

The story was definitely not bad, but it wasn't great either. The editing was lacking, lots of incomplete sentences and starting sentences with 'and, but, and though.' The storyline was good, but reminiscent of other stories that I've read such as Penelope Douglass' books 'Bully' and 'Until You' to name a few. I think the character development was lacking. I never really felt any real emotion to any of the characters, even the main characters. When I was finished I wasn't desperate to find out what their story is beyond this book. The subordinating characters stories were lacking so much that I do not feel any real desperation to read the following books to find out more about them either. Is the book worth the 99 cents that I purchased it for? Yes. Will I read the following books? Maybe, depends on if I come across them or not. I certainly won't be looking for them on purpose.
I enjoyed this book, but I didn't connect to it emotionally as the characters were 18 years old. A little young for me. But the story was strong and heartbreaking . A good read.
I enjoyed this book. Felt very sad for kids who have dad's like this though. I was glad they were able to finally get together.

I loved this book so much I couldn't put it down, and I read it straight through within twelve hours. I absolutely and thoroughly enjoyed this book and I can't wait for more from the Inked Brotherhood!!

I give this a 5 out of 5 Fighting stars.Audrey is an eighteen year old college bound woman. She had a tragedy strike her family not too many years earlier and she ended moving away but now that she is college bound she moved back to her hometown. She thought things were going to be okay until she saw the one person she didn't want to, Asher Devlin.Asher looks like your typical teenager on the outside other then his tattoos nobody sees what he hides. He has a father that is abusive to him. He hides the bruises most of the time but his one friend, Zane, knows what he hides. Asher doesn't know what to do after years apart from the one and only girl he has ever wanted.Asher and Audrey were best friend in school until one day thing just suddenly changed and Asher started avoiding Audrey at all cost. The his father had caused a tragedy to not only his family but also Audrey's. She moved away but when she came back things that she didn't know before start to come to light for her. Asher wants to stay away from Audrey because of his father and he also thinks he is no good for her.That all changes once Audrey starts to get what Asher has been through.Asher tries to solve problems on his own but when Zane leaves for Christmas holiday and Asher is left in his apartment he starts to try and figure out how to raise money to live on his own but that leads to more problems that could put not only his life in danger but also Audrey's. What Asher does scares him and could leave him dead. Does he reconnect with Audrey? Can Asher put part of his past to rest to move forward? Does Audrey get past her hurt to give Asher a chance?I would recommend this to my friends.~ Lisa The Book Nuts
This was a very easy book to read. My heart broke for Asher and Audrey. I can't wait to read the rest of the Inked Brotherhood stories.

I always love collecting different recipe books, and always love to try something new.  I am a busy person and always in a hurry and I really need dishes which are easy to prepare. This recipes book is really great, not just easy to prepare but It really looks delicious. I love this "Slow cooker recipes in 15 minutes", very well written and the author did a great job by sharing this good cookbook. I recommend.
My son was hooked in this series. At first I bought them based on reviews but he loves them and keeps looking for when the next book is coming up.

This is a perfect book to read if you have a lazy afternoon, and want to read a short, funny, easy and amusing book. I recommend it for kids ages 7-12. However, it will be a lot more interesting and fun to read if you read all the books in the series. Read this book!

While this story is easily identifiable as part of "The Little Admiral's" universe, it is definitely its own story.  Caleb has a somewhat different style and I really enjoyed seeing his perspective on the story and its overall arc.  This book stands on its own, so you can enjoy it even if you haven't read any of the other novels but for fans of the admiral; this is a great expansion on how the Empire's pullback is affecting the wider region.KT
summary: I love that they are expanding the "spineward sectors"

reviewText: Erectile dysfunction at a coming of older age is common between my friends and family members that's why as early as now, I do everything I can to avoid it from possibly happening to me.  In this book, I was able to raise awareness in myself through the causes and factors of erectile dysfunction. Even though I don't have any erectile dysfunction, I took note of all the possible treatments listed in this book since these could greatly help me in prevention.  Moreover, I generally liked how diverse are the choices and information I got in this book!

American Angst follows the lives of Lucy (Campaign Promises, November Surprise, Blue State) and Robin (The Holdout). Each chapter is a short story focusing on a ‘moment’ in the character’s life (sometimes Lucy is narrator, sometimes Robin). When I say a moment, the story may stretch over weeks or months but revolves around a central idea. I love this technique of slowly revealing a character through a series of vignettes. It worked so well in Lucy’s earlier books and just as well here. The author’s talent for writing dramatic scenes lightened with comedy was well displayed again. I particularly loved Robin’s email competition with her friend in chapter two – just the right amount of humour with the angst. I’ve long been a fan of Lucy’s blog so, even though I’d already read most of the material in that chapter as updates to the blog, I really enjoyed reading it again as a complete story and I’m glad that I now have it available to me in this book. Makes rereading much easier. Really looking forward to the next publication from this talented author.

You guys. This series. Seriously. I can't get enough. While I'm reading, I don't want the episode to end and once I'm finished, I'm desperate to get the next installment. I am completely, utterly hooked.The third episode has the steamy, sexy scenes I've come to expect from this series, but there are also some serious confessions and revelations made. I'm as emotionally invested in these characters as they are in each other. Each new bit of Fin that's uncovered surprises me and endears him more to me. I can't talk a lot about the plot because I don't want to ruin this story for you.Things were just about to get seriously hot when this book ended, so needless to say, I can't wait to pick up the story in episode four when it's released in a couple weeks. I just can't get enough of this pair and their complicated and racy relationship.I received a copy of this book from the author in exchange for an honest review.
summary: In Review: Deep Surrendering (Episode #3) by Chelsea M. Cameron

reviewText: Im so glad this book was free ! It was silly to me ! Im disappointed because I thought this book was going to be good but all I got from this was a waste of time ! Im having a hard time finding a good book lately what is going on!

what I love about her stories and characters is that they are all heart. You can really care for these characters. Casper has opened his heart to a man, so much like the fiance of ole. He has been through hell trying to overcome heartache. Slater is a hot militant man with a great sense of self and a sense of humor...he will be tested...I wouldn't change a thing but I would add " Can I keep you?" said by Casper in "Casper the movie", which is apart of this story. I also think Mason's family needs to come to terms with who their son/ brother was. I would like Michael to become part of the gang....maybe Ramos ??? wouldn't mom just love for all her boys to have boyfriends....

This one I enjoyed more than the other two. There  was no insta love and what won was persistense and what prevailed was love. I liked the chemistry between the two mc's which was sweet and sexy.  The argument , make up, and declaration of love kept me reading even when I was tired.

A Fighting Man is book three in Sadrine Gasq-Dion's Men of Manhattan series. This was a cute, sweet little novella. It is short enough to read in one sitting and low angst enough to enjoy regardless of my frame of mind at the time. There is a little angst, can't have a romance novella without it; just not enough to bring me down.As a sequel, it was good to catch up with the characters in the previous two books. One of the main characters in A Fighting Man is the brother of one of the main characters in A Marrying Man. Slater Cassidy and Casper Kennedy actually met in the previous book, but this is their entire story.Since Slater laid eyes on Casper, he has wanted him. He is an Army Ranger on deployment in Afghanistan, but that doesn't stop him from pursuing Casper relentlessly. He tries everything from flowers to a strip-o-gram to win Casper's affections.Casper has suffered a deeply painful loss in his past. One that has made him determined to close off his heart, especially to a soldier. He has to admit that he finds Slater almost irresistible. He is front and center in many of Casper's solitary fantasies.Both of these characters are funny, sexy, smart, and my personal favorite, sarcastic wise-asses. Ms. Gasq-Dion has written some very funny, fast paced dialogue between the two men and also the supporting characters in this story.A tragedy occurs that brings up painful memories and feelings for Casper and brings out the worst in Slater. Watching them both struggle to overcome their emotional and physical hurdles was a really good read. In a book like this, you kind of know how it is going to end, but getting there was great fun this time around.A few secondary characters that we meet in A Fighting Man are prime candidates for books of their own. I could see another couple of books in this series. I will be one of the first on line to buy them if they come about. The Men of Manhattan are an enjoyable lot and I hope to read more of them.

I am just too stoked with Ms. RR's talent at weaving her magic and cannot give her less than 5 stars.  I enjoyed S & B's story so much and although I have only read Ivan's story, I love reading updates on all the couples.I have read some of the comments on S & B's being rushed and it was; hoping these were missed opportunities will be in the next sequel.  For example, I wonder if Ten is just biding his time to hit on B. and will S. promise to himself come true--you know, the one to beat Ten down?  There is also the mom unbelievable swift turnaround from ingrained beliefs--was it because she found out B has her own successful company?  Would have loved Serge's pov on the argument between him and his mom.Looking forward to your next sequels on these sexy, badazz Russians.  Oh, and I'm sure you know Ten will need a strong, silent woman, bc he is a scary man with zero tolerance for BS.
I loved this book. I actually couldn't wait for 5.5 to come out and Roxie did not disappoint. Sergei and Bianca are my favorite couple.

I was ecstatic when I realized Roxie Rivera had planned a sequel to SERGEI, and I wasn’t disappointed.It is always fantastic to catch up on what’s happening with our couples after the HEA, but even more rewarding when the author shows that not all journeys are smooth sailing.Knowing Sergei’s background with the Russian Mob, it was refreshing that the author wasn’t afraid to acknowledge that total separation from his past, was not necessarily going to be obtainable by Sergei, much to his distress.With death, violence and mayhem ever present, this story highlights the difficulties Sergei and Bianca may continue to face as a result of his shady past.But don’t despair, our lovers are resilient, and their undying devotion to each other may just conquer all.
This was pretty good...a great Part II after the first book. I really hope there is a third part because the Bianca and Sergei story is pretty great!

It was ok, but as another reviewer said, many of the major issues were just glossed over.  The book felt rushed and more of an update on other characters rather than a book about Sergei and Bianca.  Had it been longer and more involved, I would have given it higher points.
