This book was definitely worth the wait. Very, very well written. I cannot possibly put into words how much I have enjoyed not only this book but ALL the books in this series. Can't wait for the next one.

This is a really well written and thought out book that includes so many natural uses for essential oils from pain relief, massage, improving your mood, through to common ailments that may be helped or eased with the oils like acne to stress relief. I always prefer a natural solution to something like the common cold or sprains over anything pharmaceutical.I really enjoyed the section on using oils to make your own skin care and body lotions.  It covers each different skin type and the instructions on how to make them are simple and you don't need a lot of expensive ingredients to get started.A very comprehensive book that is full of great information if you want to start with essential oils and their health benefits.
summary: Very helpful book on essential oils

reviewText: Isaiah and Joss meet when they are called into the principals office because Harper, Joss"s daughter was involved with bullying Natalie, Isaiah"s daughter.  These two did not begin amicably, in fact disdain is what they felt for each other. Their physical attraction to award each other grew but they both tried to resist it. Ghosts and troubles from the past tried to thwart the budding feelings that they had for one another. Isaiah and Joss were both strong characters with past baggage. Their relationships with their daughters seemed real and not book fake. Although  Joss"s ex husband seemed psychotic and her choices involving him seemed far fetched she began to make better decisions about her life almost immediately after meeting Isaiah. Their relationship suffered some set backs, but the story does have a hea. I appreciated the fact that Joss was not so weak willed that she perpetuated stupid behavior.  Also I liked Isaiah because he was alpha without being  a bully.
I never get to the point of having to be as crazy as that! But I am certainly not way! Enjoyed this short story, yet like others, wish there was more. Maybe there will be, sometime.
The story is about two women who  shouldn't  ever live together.  Some how they manage to survive each other and support each other.  I want more!  Please continue this story.
was looking forward to a,quick read was disappointing couldn't connect to characters didn't grasp the plot I'd skip it read something else
The story was enjoyable but was very short and the ending was abrupt no conclusion.  Left you wondering what happened.
This book was so unimpressive that I don't even remember what it was about.
Terrible. Would have given it 0 stars, but that's not allowed! Don't waste your time.
Really couldn't get into this book.  What was it all about.  Very confusing to me.These trailer court had some weird people living there
There is good humor in this book but it ended unexpectedly and went no where.  There is a longer, more in depth story here but the author just quit.
a short funny read, wish there had been more to it as I think it could have been a great read

This spin off series of the Redstone Security series is worth the time and money to read.It's no secret  to anyone who has read my reviews, that I absolutely love Katie Reus books.Can't help it, the lady knows how to write a damn good story. Great character development,hot hero, sweet damsel in distress and always a happy ending,I really  don't think you will be disappointed if you give this box set a try. Happy reading.
Each book is it's own story. For the price you can't beat it! I really enjoyed each book and would recommend this collection.

Emma Hart knows how to grab you from the first sentence.  From there, you're hooked and can't seem to put the book down!  I read these books in a couple of days...they were THAT good!  I would recommend them to young adults and beyond.  The price is a steal...worth so much more.  You won't be disappointed!!!

I couldn't wait to read this book.. I loved Letting Go by J.M. Witt and was super excited to read this story about Cal and Jane two characters that were introduce in the first book.Hiding away is the timeline as letting go. We actually get to read about the same events with Cal and Jane that we read about with James and Cassidy in Letting Go, but of course its through the new couple's POV (Cal & Jane).Jane is on the run for her life and has secrets. Cal is a police officer, he is an alpha male but he has a sweet side and he wants to have a good time and enjoy being a bachelor until he meets Jane all that changes.This book is about the journey they take together from the first time they meet and everything in between. then we have the last words that leave you with a cliffhanger...This is a great read it has drama, romance Hot love scenes, heartbreak, humor and a lot of emotions.I really enjoyed this book I did feel like it was fast pace, moved very quickly. I would have liked to see more detail and see the storyline slow down a little.It does have a cliffhanger that leaves you wanting to scream and leaving you wanting answers now it is a good read and if you like this kind of read then pick it up...
The first in her new series of books captures the imagination and the cliff hanger at the end keeps you waiting for the next book. This is a great read.

Margot you're killing me!  I am still hooked on this series and as usual I am frustrated that I have to wait for the next episode.  It is difficult to come up with a review without spoiling it.  All I can say is Yay Steph!
I like her writing.
Too short! Lovely story of mother and family. Is there sequel? Would definitely like to read more about the families
Not a good read

reviewerName: Kim - A Novel Love "Kim ~ A Novel Love"
reviewText: This is my first book by Lizzy Ashworth.  It was a bit slow to start for me, as they both lusted after each other and did not want to.  I am however so glad that I stuck with the book.  After a few chapters I really started to feel for Cara.  Her and her best friends relationship reminded me of the way my best friend and me can be.  We can snap and be hurtful to each other but in the end if we need each other we are THERE for the other.  I liked that Morgan wasn't just the same old rich guy.  Here is a man with struggles that is fighting for all he is worth against being with someone.  Cara is heartbroken from the loss of her husband, but Morgan's touch from the beginning ignites a passion in her.In the end I was happy that they got their HEA.  You fall for these characters and you want them to overcome anything to be together.I will be looking for more of Lizzy Ashworth's work in the future for sure!

Wow. I was not expecting a sequel, so I guess you could say this was a happy surprise. I loved V is for Virgin, and I love Kelly Oram. She is such a wonderful author, and if you haven't read any of her other stories, well, you need to. Thanks Kelly, for another entertaining, amazing, all those other good adjectives, story.
I give this book and this Author a chance. And she didnot disappoint. This was an awesome book. I love Rye,very Alpha man. That didnt take Lacey's crap.I am excited to read more from her.

I just had to write a review and say Ms Linden has a new follower. My only complaint is the price for less than 200 pages seems a little high to me.  Other than that, I thought the numerous sex scenes were HOT and tastefully done.  Every character introduced played a part, from Monica, Lisa, to Ms Katie.Of course our guy was sprung and it seem sex was the only thing on his mind for a while.  It was great reading about how their feelings deepen for one another as the affair/relationship progress.Lacey insecurity quirks got a little old, but she had so many things, including family members stressing her that her actions were understandable, but she brought the heartache on herself.I would love to read an update on Monica's mom past affair---a Governor's son just doesn't disappear.
summary: This was loaned to me by a friend, but...

reviewText: I ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT! . Proper editing allowed a seamless flow. The characters were well thought out and I LOVED them!  Keep them coming, Please!
This book was well worth the wait!!  As usual a great romance with a side of awesome intimacy.  A must read if your into BDSM
Absolutely loved it!! I am a big fan of Cherise Sinclair and have read all her books. I really hope the next in this series is about Dixon and Stan. Can't wait for the next one!!!

Love everything by Cherise Sinclair but this has to be one of my favorites. The delicious interplay between the characters and terrific storyline combined with just the right amount of hot sex, suspense and feel good moments makes this story one of her best. I cannot wait for the next Dom of Dark Haven's story. Please write really fast, okay Cherise?

Lindsay and Zander, Dark Haven, loved it.  This story has it all, a dom, a sadistic one at that; a submissive, a strong, caring, intelligent one.He is quick to jump to conclusions, she is frightened, by actions in her past.And we get to catch up with the couples from previous books.Nothing negative to say.Highly recommended read

Cherise doesn't really write anything that's NOT hot, so no real surprise there! Another great addition to the Doms of Dark Haven series. Really enjoyed the characters in this series and love catching up with them in each installment. Hot, hot, hot, as always.

I will start by saying that I LOVE Cherise Sinclair! I have everyone of her books on my Kindle, but I was actually a little disappointing with this book. Please don't get me wrong, I didn't have a problem with any of the characters, plot, or ending. I just found it a little better than ok. Yes, I am glad that I purchased it, but I did not experience the satisfaction that I ordinarily feel when I see "The End" in her books.Pros:Characters were awesome, supportive, and constant throughout the novel. Often, I have felt the Dark Haven series doesn't have the sense of family that her Club Shadowlands does. This book changed that for me. There was family and community. I really loved the support and domination of the characters throughout the book.Cherise was pretty funny. She incorporated a lot more humor in the narrative, and I really appreciated that Lindsey, who is clearly not a masochist, was a little feisty.  She definitely has a mouth on her and deVries was more than cool with it. Sure, he went into dom mode a few times as a result. But in reality, not every sub is tight-lipped. So I really appreciated that we get a sub that is feisty, asserts her independence (even if she isn't successful), and is isn't punished or considered recalcitrant. So tons of points to Cherise for that.We get to see some new types of play introduced by The Enforcer. Electrocism and knife play are there, and of course she writes the scenes with excellence. Unfortunately, I didn't feel the steaminess that many people have written about, and I really wish that I did. But to be clear, they are great together, and I believed every scene. I just was not as hot for them.deVries is a sadist, and while Cherise mentioned that she pushed her limits a bit when writing him, I think she did an excellent job with his dialogue. I found his responses very realistic when he was being a top. I believed them, and that really made me happy.Cons:It was predictable. I pretty much guessed A to B to C. Of course she threw in a few elements in each step that I didn't anticipate, but I had a general idea of where things where going.As a few other reviewers have mentioned, the end did seem a little rushed. But to Cherise's credit, I don't know what I could have suggested differently. The ended wasn't dissatisfying, but it did seem short and quick.Maybe a spoiler, but for once, we have no final scene at the end. WHAT?!! That was a surprise and one I wish had not been there. I think it would have been nice to have scene to help with dealing and healing some of the scares from the past.deVries. Oh deVries..... So he has some issues. That is acceptable to me. I have no problem with that. And yes, he is kind of a teddy bear, and I think that represent many sadists. But I found myself frustrated with him going back-and-forth, and by his inappropriate responses to things not involving intimacy or bdsm play. He jumped to the same conclusions inappropriately a few times, and that was irritating, though very human. Yes, you know it's a great author when they can create a character that makes you frustrated and feel a certain way. But we all have our opinions, and I am not as in love with him as her other characters. Perhaps it was because I found him far more compromising than her other alpha doms. But I do think he has great character and is a good sadist who has needs like the rest of us.Over all, I would put this novel a little better than Master of the Abyss which is Jake and Kallie's novel, which I rated as three stars. I never thought I'd have to rate one of Cherise's books so low again, but I honestly found it just okay, and I'm genuinely sorry to say that. But I would recommend it because you might find it exactly what you're looking for, and I sincerely hope that you do!
summary: 3.5 rating, and I'm sorry I couldn't round up

reviewText: I really liked Edge of the Enforcer (Mountain Masters & Dark Haven #4) by Cherise Sinclair. As with This Is Who I Am (Masters of the Shadowlands #7), Ms Sinclair wrote a great story filled with a good plot, tasteful, descriptive and HOT sex scenes and an alpha male who is not only a hero but a card carrying sadist.Even though Zander deVries is a sadist he has the softest underbelly, a full and caring heart. Having lived a life filled with hurt, sadness, betrayal, and violence carried out in the name of the greater good, he seems to have control over his life. It is his need to satisfy his sadistic side, within the safety and Non-judgmental environment of Dark Haven, that allows him to find that control. Seeing the whole person and not just his sadistic nature reminds the reader that what one does sexually doesn't dictate the type of person they really are.The books heroine, Lindsey is on the run from her past. She’s a strong, outspoken, not gonna take any crap women, whose afraid to let other’s get too close to her, fearing they will be drawn into the mess she is hiding from. She’s a sexual submissive, but not a masochist.The pairing of deVries and Lindsey is the story of polar opposites, a couple who find a middle ground to allow their relationship to bloom and grow into a constant bouquet of love and need.. Their path is plagued with mis-steps by both parties, angry words that never should have been said, and assumptions that never should have been made. The connection between deVries and Lindsey starts in the beginning of the book (or should I say seemed to have started in My Liege of Dark Haven (Mountain Masters & Dark Haven #3)) and just never lets up. The connection and chemistry is strong, and the sexual scenes between the two are creative, exciting and hot.Supporting our H/h are characters we've met in the previous Mountain Master / Dark Haven books, the friendship, support and non-judgmental attitudes are prevalent in this book as well.This is a standalone book, no cliff hanger, plot complete with no loose ends, and a satisfying HEA. The writing is good as is the editing.For me a five star read, and a big soft spot for deVries

Just finished Edge of the Enforcer (Doms of Dark Haven) by Cherise Sinclair.  I know, I know, normally I buy the books and have them read in a day.  But I’ve been busy and I must say I’m glad I got the chance to take my time and savor this one, because it was delicious!!Zander is a sweet, kind hearted, SADIST!!!  Yeah didn’t think those would mix but he pulls it off and Cherise’s writing makes it believable.  The scenes were hot!  Even though my rational mind is screaming I would never let any one do that to me, because I don’t like THAT kind of pain.  The writing was so good your rational mind takes a vacation and you are sucked in wishing you were the one he ran that knife over or maybe the flogger.  :)Lindsey is running from the law and has a new name, in short she has issues.  Of course every story needs conflict and Lindsey’s is a doozy.  But she didn’t grate my nerves or make me feel she was to weak.  Yet still submissive, there was a good balance in her character and I like the Texas charm she showed.At any rate it was a good story that I would recommend to friends.  With the disclosure that you have to like this type of story.  This is a BDSM romance, no not fifty shades of watered down grey, this is the real deal.  So don’t pick it up if you can’t handle flogging, caning, knife play, hot sex, some man on man hotness, and as far as I’m concerned all around good fun :)As per usual Cherise Sinclair has written a book that’s got me all hot and bothered!  Five out of Five from me!  Loved it :)
summary: Of course I loved it... Cherise did it again, naughty gal!

reviewText: Seriously this book is a must read! Apart of the Masters of the Mountain/Dark Haven series, this book continues the story. The notorious Enforcer falls hard for a pretty little strong-willed trouble Texan. I simply couldn't put the book down.

~Reviewed by ANN & posted at Under the Covers Book BlogAn interesting thing has happened to Lindsey. After being involved with a dangerous man, she is fleeing from false murder charges and finds herself in San Francisco. Worried that her past might come to haunt her, Lindsay takes on small jobs to keep under the radar. However, with that comes a lot of life hassles and less than hygeineic living conditions.When deVries, the sadist of the Dark Haven BDSM club, finds out about this, he takes her under his wing. His helping hand scares Lindsey at first because she isn’t used to comfort coming from deVries – just pain. While deVries starts off as a mean bastard in the beginning, he softens, showing readers a different side to him that had me falling in love with him. At first their relationship starts off strained. If you’ve read the last book in the series, you know that Lindsey still owes deVries a blowjob and anal sex from the games. When he wants to cash in, it puts Lindsey in a vulnerable state. As a sadist, deVries likes to inflict more pain than she can handle, so a lot of the book is Lindsey trying to meet his needs.What I love about this book is that the characters feel very real. There are several dimensions to them. Sometimes you love them. Sometimes you hate them. Sometimes you question their decisions and other times, you cannot be more than happy with them. Having readers go through those type of emotions in a single book is hard to do, but Cherise Sinclair is one of those authors who is able to do it each time with her books.I love the suspense subplot to the storyline. It’s one of the things I love most about Sinclair’s books. While she takes some leaps, they never seem so out there that they seem foolish. This realistic aspect to the book always makes it believable and that’s why I always find her books so entertaining to read.There is one scene in this book that didn’t do it for me. I’m not a fan of edge play. Knives freak me out, so that particularly scene was read pretty quickly. However, as you can expect, the rest of the sex scenes are well-written and will no doubt stay true to the characters. Depending on personal preferences, Sinclair does have something for everyone. This is, once again, something I love about Sinclair. In every book, she tries something new. Another kink is explored. She is never limiting herself and her books continue to grow because of that.*ARC provided by publisher
I'm glad Jane and Ace got it together...I couldn't really see them with anyone else..This book picked up right where 2 left off and was just as great...Wonderful job India....

I have to say, I am endlessly impressed by the consistent quality of this series. There are no unbelievable plot twists or insurmountable character flaws...Patrick and Lisa are strong and intelligent characters who are slowly revealing themselves to each other. The love is warm and real between these two and transcends the play time spent in the infamous Examination Room...Patrick has had a rough week. No one should be asked to operate on their dying ex-wife, yet that's precisely what Patrick was called to do in the last moments of the previous books. We journey with him as he faces his past head-on and looks to make a lasting relationship with Lisa.Lisa is trying to find a blance in this new relationship with Patrick. She is attempting to overcome her past and enjoy this safe and sane relationship.They're growing closer together:Patrick spends some time with Lisa's parents,They're meeting each other's friends,and having blazing hot moments of playtime.Everything is coming together for these two...But danger lurks around the corner...And a betrayal threatens to tear them apart...I guess we'll just have to see what happens to Lisa and Patrick in the next book!See my full review here: [...]
summary: I simply can't stay away from Patrick & Lisa... And their wicked games...

reviewText: I am going to have to agree with the 10/10 people who gave this book 5 stars. They got it right.While this is a story that contains a brutal rape (but not so detailed and gory that you can't bear to read it), that is not really the main theme of the story. Yes, the story is the mystery: who is the monster that is terrorizing and hurting Cat, and will justice be served?But the beauty of this story (and the reason I think everyone has given it 5 stars so far) is deeper than that. The beauty of the story lies in the strength of friendship and the determination, courage, and grit - the strength of character - to overcome and triumph against the most traumatic and violent event in your life. To stand up to evil and not allow it to crush you.But just who would do this to Cat? Who would try to enter her door night after night? Terrify her? Attack her? Traumatize her? She soon realizes it must be someone she knows, but who would do that?Join Cat as she tries to discover the identity of her monster, and witness her triumph as she refuses to be defeated.

This series has really kept me interested throughout the entirety of it. That's surprising because most series come to a head and this series...Idk it's refreshing. Anywho, let me get to the review itself..Claimed: I love Baird! He is my favorite male character from the entire series..he's sweet, strong, loving, caring, sexy as all sin, and most important of all, understanding. He goes very slowly with Liv so that she can be comfortable and he allows her to feel as if she is in control of the situation. I like Liv but she annoyed me at first, I hated her hot and cold attitude. When I thought more about her situation, I was more sympathetic and the story was great. I love the background of all of the stories as well, it's very interesting and exciting.Hunted: I really hated Sophia's stuttering throughout the story...that was the only thing that bothered me. This book was exciting, the mutated animals hunting them and their time on Sylvan's home planet, it was all just phenomenal. I enjoyed Sophia's incident at dinner...that was absolutely hilarious!!Sought: Kat is my favorite female character overall...She's feisty and witty. She ends up linked to Far & Deep and they have to go to their home planet to save Kat. They have to go on a journey to the ancient areas of their planet to find a flower to heal her. This one was a definite tear jerker.Found: Xairn! Oh man, he's a doozy. Since he had his first scene in the book I knew he would end up being a good guy. He saves Lauren and takes her to a foreign planet to escape his father, the leader of the Scourge. Lauren has a few mishaps with a certain trader of the flesh...yikes! This book felt like it had more length and relationship development than the others. It was enjoyable being able to be along for the journey.Overall, this series is worth every penny and more.

I can't believe the turn around Blake has made. He is now like the ultimate boyfriend and I love it so much. I can tell you there was one thing that drove me crazy in this book, I mean like ultimate pet peeve. Jennifer's complete and utter lack of trust and faith in Blake. There were so many times where I wanted to slap her because she immediately thought he was cheating or had moved on. WITHOUT EVEN TALKING TO HIM. I just wanted to send her a text or memo and say HELLO! COMMUNICATION IS KEY! ... anyway. Other than that, I loved this little book. I loved that it wasn't just unicorns and fairy tales, Nelle throws some major hard hitting drama in there. Don't get me wrong, we get our fairy tales and unicorns, or tigers, but we get DRAMA! I mean who would have expected the way things tied together!?!? I did NOT see that coming!! I just can not believe the way the story unfolded, as far as the drama goes. Did I mention Blake's grandmother? Because she has to be on the of the best characters in the book. She is just down right hilarious! I love love the snow angels! and snow globes! I think Nelle did a great job with this book.

I bought the book as soon as it went live last night and finished it early this morning.  I was so engrossed that I was nearly late for work.  In the beginning of the trilogy I very much wanted to dislike Blake given his cocky, arrogant attitude but slowly he started to grow on me.  I love how Blake and Jennifer compliment one another so well, he is strong where she is weak, etc. This book wrapped things up so nicely without being sickly sweet with the "fairy tale" ending.  The characters in the book are fun especially Libby and Chaz. A great read and a wonderful ending to the trilogy.

The second book was the best. This book started off so sickeningly cutesy and sweet my teeth hurt. Luckily it didn't stay that way. Jennifer was very annoying though. All in all I liked the end and the series was worth the read.

This book was absolutely powerful and passionate. The characters go though some much twists and turns though out the book. Phenomenally written book was awesome to read. Thanks for writing this amazing book. I can't wait to read moreabout the characters in this book.
Wow with friends like these who needs enemies,This book goes into the lives of 2 females who lives get turned upside down by the ones closest to them. Will there's lives ever be the same..
This book was net helpful or informative unless one has never had tinnitus or has had it only a, short time.  Nothing new or exciting here
summary: A lot of words to say little

reviewText: I knew going into this book that it was the start of a series plus only 98 pages lets us know that it's a short story.In Hidden we learn about our characters.In the area - it's forbidden to have any interaction between wolf & bear. However Samson was told that he would be a protector of a bear cub. He has distanced himself from his pack for the day when he would rescue a small cub - Elaina.Now that she is 18, her only friend is Samson's grandson Liam, and the mating fever has hit - she runs away.First she finds the wolf pack and is injured. Liam arranges that she can stay for a few days while recovering.Then she finds Cullen & Damon - two bear brothers who take her back to their village and mate with her.Lots of conflict in the village and Cullen is being very demanding.

I can't say this was an enjoyable read for me. The sex and steam was pretty hot but shortly lived. I despised both "hero's"  The entire scenario had me cringing. Throw in a naive and clueless heroine and this is what you get. Even the ending (or should I say lack of ending) sucked. I'm usually more generous in my reviews for books offered as freebies but this was an exception. I wish I hadn't wasted my time and there's no way this is a series I'd continue. It was just lacking in so many ways.
summary: Ugh.....This just left much to be desired

reviewText: Were books are always so lively, intense and full of action. They are officially my all time favourite books. I wants to read more from this author and I especially want to read the conclusion of this book.

This book was given to me by the Author  for an honest review. This was a really good read I enjoyed it from beginning to end and cant wait for the next installment of this story .Fast paced with lots of emotion action and passion this is a page turner .The author has created amazing characters you just can't get enough of.I am so attached to Elaina and can't wait to see what happens next on her journey .I'm Hooked .I highly recommend this book to other adult  paranormal lovers who enjoy serials.

'His Captive Bride' was a well-crafted encounter between a sexy TV actress and her bad boy biker dude stalker.  As the story evolves, Mandissa develops an attraction for her stalker Drake that is as intense as it is dangerous.The author does an admirable job of building anticipation by building the familiarity of the characters with first-person descriptions of the lustful needs of both Mandy and Drake.  Drake always gets his way - an alpha male in every sense, with the good looks to get him in the door with any woman.  This time, his infatuation in Mandy, who is a bit of a bad girl in her own right.Sexual tension reaches a boiling point at just the right time and the story yields some very hot scenes - sure to satisfy any reader's needs.  An excellent book for summer reading - bring it with you to the beach, if you can contain yourself after getting to the end of this one...*I received a copy of this book for a fair and honest review*

I've always been optimistic, and I love to buy books that help feed my mind's positive atmosphere, otherwise, you're likely to allow the negative energy some people are mired in to affect your state of mind. I found this book to be very helpful, like a refresher on the positive effects of always seeing the bright side of things, never thinking the grass is greener somewhere else. Recommended!
summary: But the Glass IS Half Full!

reviewText: As this story resumes, it finds Emma & Craig, Hawk & Vivian finally stepping into their futures as couples who have endured & survived many obstacles. And an abundance of love found in the twins 'lost' family. Loose ends being tied up??? Or are they? There is a new mystery to unfold.Recommended reading...waiting for the next story....

A very good insight. I love the way the author explains much on minimalism. This book is full of very useful information and it's really educative. I can now live a minimalism lifestyle and still have fun. You should have this book as it is very easy to read and understand. I recommend it to all.

Thanks for a free book in exchange for a read and review for Wicked Reads.This was a cute story with a hell of a lot of characters and even more going on. As the book developed the author seemed to be pairing everyone up in twos. I was mainly trying to focus on the first relationship developing, without all the additions, and I thought they made a cute couple with an interesting story. The story premise for this book caught my eye, and what can I say. The title was aptly named, more than I asked for. Overall entertainment was three stars. This was my first read by this author, and I would read from her again.
summary: More people than I asked for

reviewText: More Than I asked for is a romantic, funny and sexy romance that you'll enjoy digging in. I love how TJ Tims incorporated all of the three to arrive at this novel. Both Lucas and Genevieve are easy to feel and relate to even if their families are poles apart.Aside from the hero and heroine, the brothers and friends of each party are a joy to read about specially Tara and Aryan. This book is like reading about warm friendship and warm family ties that it's hard to not get touch by it. I also like how the sexual tension was built between Luc and Genevieve. And the way Lucas cares for her was totally endearing.This first book in the series is really something you couldn't have anything more to ask for.
summary: An easy read complete with humor and romance

reviewText: nice book that makes a lot of sense. will be passing this along to my family and friends!

What a great story about several good friends that had what we call a blended families. It doesn't matter what time period the greatest gift is always love. Calla, Rebbie and Jamie found that gift through things that they struggled through. This is one of my favorites in the series although I have loved them all.

Storyline left off from the first book. Action packed, intriguing along with some steamy romance between Lucas and Leah. Lucas has come to realize he will do anything to protect Leah. Though they've not been together long, Leah just wants to be with Lucas and accepts him for the werewolf he is. This series continues to capture my attention making me want more. It's definitely not the like any shifter biker storyline I've read before.  Can't wait until the next book comes out. Would recommend.

Hell yes, Vee is my woman! I want to be her best friend, truly.I love a story where the man doesn't swoop in and save the damsel in distress. HERE. IT. IS."Unleashed" picks up where "Unstoppable" ended. We see Mike "Ripp" Ripton become a little more vulnerable. You come to love him more this time. I didn't even think that was possible. His introspection pulls you in and you "feel" what he's feeling. You feel his fear, his worry, his pizz...Vee is a beast. We get to see her confidence and control as she dominates the courtroom, and Ripp on her "playground." She is what I love in a female character. She's not weak. She can handle herself and slam it to others. Case in point, parking garage. Prosecutor. She hands him her "refuse." YES!Yet, she submits to man in the bedroom, or parking lot, or.... Holy hot steamy ~squish~ sexy-ness!58 minutes, 57 minutes, 56 minutes? Well, hello Ripp and some Lickle. These two love hard and play hard. We get to see a little more silly-ness between them this time too.We're also treated to some great humor. I will always love and laugh every single time about the finger story and "dirty chicken." Now, I will never look at Fiat's without thinking of car tippin'. And there's "Knife Hands" too!I'm looking forward to seeing perhaps extended stories on A-Train and Austin? These two ancillary characters that I want to know more about.This book is more than erotica. It's family, friends, love, fun,hope, life. <3

I liked this book.  However it wasn't as good as the first one. I was so excited to read it because of the cliffhanger from the first. But this one just wasn't what I was expecting. Like I said I  ?  Liked it and would def recommend it but just be warned not as hot steamy and attention grabbing as the first.
summary: good read but doesnt stack up to book one

reviewText: to many book about the earth.

I loved this novella. It was such a beautiful and moving story of heartbreak and grief but also hope, joy and love.{Was he that transparent? Was it so clear that he searched for anything to fill the void that had become his life?}Andrew grew up in a world devoid of love, hardly ever seeing his parents, looked after by nannies. It left a void in his life, one he has filled with aimless pleasures but, deep down, he has always been seeking something more meaningful in his life.{She longed to feel it all. To feel anything but the imminent horror of her mother’s lingering illness. An illness that had slowly stolen her mother’s vitality and ensured that any dreams Ophelia had were but distant memories.}Cast aside by her half-brother, after her father died and shunned by society, Ophelia is living in poverty in a small, rundown cottage, caring for her dying mother. Her zest for life and her dreams of becoming an artist have slowly faded beneath the pain and sorrow of losing the person she loves most in the world.{A soft smile played at her lips, one that bore all too much knowledge. No crushed flower was this woman. In that smile, in her withering gaze was an understanding of the world not many ever obtained.}For me, Lady Darlington is the linchpin of the story. She loves her daughter and wants only her happiness. She recognises the goodness in Andrew and knows he is perfect for her daughter. She gives him the mother’s love that he has never had.Even within the constraints of this novella. Ms Claremont infuses her writing with such emotional depth. Ophelia and Andrew ceased to be simply characters on a page and became people I really cared about. Their journey was my journey. Their hopes and fears, their joy and tears were my hopes and fears, my joy and tears. It’s difficult for me to convey in words just how beautiful and poignant this story is and so here are some moments in the book that touched my heart.{In his eyes for one brief, holy moment, the world spun in a different direction, touched by beauty, touched by hope, touched by a strange sort of wonder.}{To his absolute chagrin, to his utter perversity, he was overwhelmed with a dancing, boyish glee.She’d come.}{And so Andrew faced the piano with the mother of his heart, a little boy who finally knew he was loved, and was suddenly aware of how wonderful life could be.}{And suddenly she was struck by an alarming realization. He was her other self. Her wild soul.}{“…I have lost my heart to you, piece by piece. Your strength, your kindness, your passion for life, they have all awakened what I had been so sure was dead. My soul. You have awakened my soul, Ophelia, because you are my other half. The joy to my cynicism. The passion to my jaded nature. You have taught me to live with hope again.”}Oh yes, Andrew’s friend, the mysterious Marquis of Vane….what secrets is he keeping?  He promises to be an intriguing hero!{Once, Vane had been the most mischievous, the most boisterous, and the first to laugh of their school set. Now? The man looked as if he might be suited for the position of undertaker. No. Not undertaker. . . executioner.}Lady Wild is a unique and beautifully written story that is both heart-breaking and uplifting. Highly recommended.REVIEW RATING:  STELLAR 5 STARS
summary: A unique and beautifully written story

reviewText: Mama was very good character in this story she is dying but does not pass on till her daughter is taken care of with another person with a broken soul.  They heal each other and cope with the death of Mama.  Happily ever after at it's best .

THIS TO THE AUTHOR:  I HAVE BEEN READING REGENCYS FOR FORTY YEARS AND YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY ONE OF THE BEST. I ADMIRE YOUR STYLE. THE TRUE ART OF A GOOD BOOK IS THAT IT CONTAINS A LITTLE BIT OF EVERYTHING,  JUST THE WAY REAL LIFE DOES. YOUR MAIN CHARACTERS HAVE GREAT PERSONALITIES AS WELL AS YOUR BACKGROUND CHARACTERS (WHICH USUALLY DO NOT)' I LOVE FUN AND ADVENTURE IN A BOOK AND YOU DELIVER THAT. YOU BOOKS PROJECT TRUE ROMANCE AND LOVE AND NOT USING EXPLICIT SEX (WHICH IS KIND OF LIKE READING ABOUT EATING-IT MAY SOUND GOOD BUT IN THE END YOU ARE STILL HUNGRY)ALSO YOUR STORIES ARE NOT FULL OF FILLER-YOU KNOW LIKE REALLY OVER  DESCRIBING A ROOM WHICH HAS NO BEARING ON THE STORY. BOTH OF YOUR BOOKS CANNOT BE BEAT, I AM SO HAPPY YOU BECAME AN AUTHOR,  GOOD LUCK TO YOU, BUT WITH YOUR TALENT IF YOU KEEP ON, YOU ARE GOING TO GIVE GEORGETTE HEYER A RUN FOR THE MONEY

I really liked the first book in this series so I was excited to see the second one had come out. I think this one is even better. The characters are interesting and believable, likeable without being too perfect. The zombies are old school Romero zombies, the way nature intended.The main quibble I had with the first book is that one plot point between two characters was (to me anyway) was too obvious in its foreshadowing. It didn't ruin the book or anything but the eventual outcome wasn't the surprise I think it was supposed to be. This book does not have that flaw. I was surprised several times during it.The author has grown and improved in her skills, which is great because I thought she was pretty good to start with. I would definitely recommend both books and I hope she's already working on a third.
This is one of the best (top three) zombie apocalypse series out there. You will definitely become attached to the characters and feel their elation and heartbreak.
Loved it! This story had lots of plot twists that did not see coming.  I can't wait for the next book.
As usual, this book was fire! S.K is awesome...............I need more, come on with the next book! And please Hurry!

Let me start by saying this....this book was the absolute truth!! I absolutely love the writing skill of SK! She has a way of pulling you into the book with the characters that makes you feel like you apart of their world and they know you! OMG....believe me when I say that you will not be sorry when you purchase this one. I originally purchased it for when I was getting ready for a road for something to read, silly me! SK's books are not for road trips, why? because you will definitely need the quite time alone to enjoy. I strongly suggest a nice big glass of wine, a tub, some candles and your imagination! If you are familiar with The Sin City Heat Series, than you know exactly what I mean!!You are guaranteed to fall in love with Lyrica & Roman and Tracy & Gavin. The dynamics of these two couples was explosive! I loved the strength that both Lyrica and Tracy possessed. Yes they were flawed, but they loved their men hard! Don't get me started on Roman and Gavin! Oh sweet Jesus! Talk about ALPHA MALES to the max! Honey (fans self) They loved their women and loved them hard and for as long as it took! Lol.The other secondary characters helped to add that "Aww damn" moments in the story. Shania, Gavin's baby mama will make you go out and look for all the sorry triflin baby mamas and whoop they tail! Cane will make you eventually fall in love with him, especially when you see he's connected to Darrell! Can't wait!Trust me you will be happy glad you purchased and read this one! Oh....one scene I know will definitely be enjoyed is the Gavin and Tracy bedroom scene! All I can say, she will never lock another door on him!!!!!

SK in one of my too fav authors. This story as with the other series are indeed on point. I'm going to be honest and say this was not her best BUT it definitely is a great read. I can hardly wait to read more about theses characters.  That's for the wonderful read SK.

This is great ! I've manager to stop my dog barking every time someone rings my door bell, that is truly amazing !!! I saw this book and thought to give it a try and BooM it worked, author has provided some great techniques for dealing with bed dog behavior and they worked for me. I'm very very grateful and amazed at the same time !
summary: I'm very very grateful and amazed at the same time !

reviewText: I was looking for something to read this morning and after 4 books couldn't muster getting my attention I stumbled onto this book and I will say that I am supremely glad I did. This book was so good, it was a super cute and easy read. A perfect way to spend a summer afternoon. Looking forward to reading more from this author.
summary: Didn't put it down till it was done

reviewText: Everything I've made from this cookbook has been EXCELLENT. It also has some really good advice for how to manage your cooking and food prep so that you aren't stuck in the kitchen for hours every day. This is really useful if you're trying to transition to a more paleo-style diet. For all the people out there that want to eat clean but don't have a lot of time to cook or aren't naturally talented at it, this is the book for you.

I'll admit, as much as I love the first two books, Damien was never my kind of guy. He wasn't.Mark, on the other hand, is totally it. Yup, I love him.Sam is more like me than Allison ever was, so I found this story even better than the previous too.We get to learn about Sam and the past that she believes ruined her.Mark comes in, offering exactly what she needs, and sweeps in under her radar, knocking her whole world off balance.He's happy to do anything just to have her, because she's sure she doesn't want more.Go along for their ride through their ups and downs, and see where they take you.
summary: Got to love Mark and Sam together

reviewText: Promise Me by Kristin Mayer is book #3 in the Trust Series. The first two books in the series follow Damien and Allison and their crazy love story, book #3 is about Allison's best friend Sam and the football star that heals her heart.If you have read the first two books in this series then I'm sure if you are anything like me you already adore Sam. She is hilarious, beautiful, supportive and loyal. It had crossed my mind several times that she would end up with Martin, Damien's childhood friend. I am so glad that the author chose to have her character end up with Mark! Mark is so perfect! He is just the man that Sam needed to help her get over a traumatic experience from her past. Book #3 has a different feel to it. It is more a sweet love story about someone overcoming their fears and moving on from the past. The previous books had more suspense and mystery but like the previous books this one is off the charts hot as well. I also enjoyed the few peeks into Mike's POV at the end of the book! What a treat!Low on drama and angst but with just the right amount to make the story interesting Promise Me was a great ending to this series and I am looking forward to the spin off series!! BRING ON ADAM!!
I enjoyed reading about Sam & Mark. There was more descriptions of the sex scenes than the other books. Another believable story that was an easy read.

What a perfect ending to the series! I think the story between Sam and Mark was so believable and I could relate to so much in the book! It was great to get some time with Damien and Alli after being married for a bit and knowing their love was still strong. Once again a perfectly written story to captivate the reader! Bravo Kristin Mayer another book I can recommend to all my friends! I look forward to the new series I can tell it is going to get my blood pumping!!

Professor John Dunn, widower, mid 40s moves from the East coast to Corbin's Bend to live the lifestyle he craves and never had in his 20 year marriage.  He had two BDSM relationships, but never the fulfillment he was seeking.  He accepted a position at Sandy Ridge College in the History Department. Sarah Harshaw, 21-year old, was a student at Sandy Ridge and her parents live at Corbin Bend.  Sarah is in John's Western Civ class for her Senior year.  Sarah went to John with the intention of seducing him and in the process agrees via contract to be his submissive.  This is their story, where he introduces her to the D/s lifestyle within BDSM that both of them crave, but with love between the two.Note: This story includes an adult professor/student relationship; explicit sex, oral and anal sex, the use of sexual toys and spankings, including the use of a cane.
summary: Corbin Bend's Professor and Student BDSM style

reviewText: I liked the summary. But then the h just gave in to everything so easy. Too accepting and everyone just liked her. Not much drama. More like an intro to biker life. However, besides sex and some talk of murder and illegal things, nothing else was mentioned which made all the guys seem likeable. Sarcasm and funny lines made me like it more. Tame sex scenes.
This book made me want to be her she found love and a family. The MC fell in love with her too. Witty, funny and heart warming. Liked the jealously of the MC brother macking on his lady too.
I really liked this book. sweet story and for once the biker was not a cheating ads.  I hope there is another one with Arrows story.

Not sure if this will be a series but it would be a good one.  Faye is hilarious and wraps the bad ass biker's around her little finger.  She evolves from a scared pregnant (from a 1 night stand) girl to a confident take no names woman!  Really enjoyed this one.

SUMMER'S BOOK BLOGAs a huge fan of Chantal Fernando, I knew this was going to be another great read, it was, and so much more! I could not put it down and devoured it in one sitting! It was filled with so many amazing moments, funny, emotional, passionate and everything else you would want to find in an fantastic read.Dragon's Lair is book one in the Wind Dragon's MC Series and is about the love story of Faye and Dex.Faye is a feisty, strong willed, absolutely hilarious girl. After finding her boyfriend of years in a compromising position, she decides that it is time she starts living her life and concentrate on her studies. A decision to head out and let loose ends up bringing her much more than she bargained for. There she meets up with the sexy, dominant and dangerous, Dex, her ex boyfriends brother and childhood crush.Dex is the V.P. of the notorious Wind Dragon's MC and when these two re connect after all these years apart, sparks fly. The one night of wild passion leads them down a path that will change their lives forever.I loved these two together, each gave each other something the other was missing and needed in their lives. Their banter was hysterical and the passion off the charts. Filled with unforgettable characters, a spell binding story line, this was one great read. With twists and turns, ups and downs, this novel will have you on the edge of your seat, biting your nails to see how the love story between Dex and Faye pans out.I can't wait to read about the other sexy men in the rest of this series and am anxiously awaiting their stories.Will the beauty tame the Dragon ?What happens when the Dragon ensnares the girl into his lair ?Read and find out !!
Great book, I will reading more books by this arthur, it was funny, romance, and  about family go buy this book

Great continuation of The Seduction of Monet Dawson: Confessions of a Military Wife. This picks up right where the Author left off. I have had the privilege of reading the first novel and must say that this one was exciting for me to read. The author does a great job of telling the story and filling it with the type of feeling/suspense that makes your hands sweat and your heart flutter too. Paranormal occurrences are fascinating to me and the author shows a bit of uncertainty in his own story but it makes for a good read, the romance is not as I was hoping for but again, read "Confessions" and you will see what I mean (this is only a personal preference). I would suggest starting with Confessions though to get the whole story (otherwise you may think some of the details in the book are useless, but I can assure you they are not).
summary: More of a Continuation than a Stand Alone

reviewText: A great historical western romance where the male is the mail-order spouse. A great way to relax and enjoy a good book.

I have read many books by this author. And enjoyed every one. The down side to her books they end to QUICK. And feel like they have been rushed. On this story I was slightly disappointed. Because I felt Mindy sue. Was a tad  wimpy. I like when a girl has more back bone. I felt she let the ranch hands run over her. It was her pa"s place to teach her how to handle the ranch. Until she got married. And later in the story just before it ended. She was knitting. My question was if she was raised by two men and was isolated. To the ranch. How did she know how to knit or do embroidery? Being raised by two men. You would think she would have been some what of a tomboy. She was way to feminine. With out the benefits of a woman. It didn't fit the story.. as for Brett he was a great hero. I liked him and I really don't have much to say about him. The only thing. I wished was that there romance could have been a little more built up. On one page Mindy wasn't even sure how Brett felt. And she was worried. How things were going to work out because she didn't really want to be married. And the next they are in love. The story is cute. And kept me from being bored. ...
summary: Good book of course. I love Cia Leah.

reviewText: I gave part two, 3.5 Stars.This is the second part in The Alphabet Games, Stella is left reeling from Gabe’s dishonesty at the end of part one and she is now even more suspicious of her stepfather and his business.Gabe and Stella are growing closer together despite Gabe’s best efforts to keep things causal. There were a few instances when Stella showed her feisty side and stood up for herself and I really liked this, Gabe deserved to be put in his place.Her best friend Ronnie is in rehab so Gabe really is the only person Stella can rely on. With a private investigator and some digging of her own, the mystery surrounding Gabe, his family and Stella’s stepsister deepens.The sexy ‘Alphabet Game’ continued and this added some lightness to the story, it was fun to see what Gabe came up with next, and Stella certainly wasn’t complaining.I enjoyed this second part more than the first; I felt the author’s writing was more coherent and flowed better. The mystery plot was a little slow on moving forward but we did get to see Gabe and Stella’s relationship progress. It ends on another cliffhanger and I have many theories running through my head. I’m so glad I can dive into part three immediately! ~Ava*I received a copy in exchange for an honest review.*

I enjoyed this book so much.  I read it straight through, as once I started it, I couldn't put it down!  There is lust, love, passion, friendship, loss, and a few twists to this story.  Very believable.  The reasons she couldn't have it all with Jason are told to us through time.  The avalance is devastating.  The secret Blaine keeps is revealed and heartbreaking.  The resolution is well worth getting to.  Loved the friendship and more that developed with her true love as time was taken and realizations were made.
summary: Snow and love in Breck.  it doesn't get any sweeter.

reviewText: I was given this book by the author through the M/M Romance Group’s ‘Don’t Buy My Love,’ review program for an honest review.'Chosen by the Billionaire' is the story of Liam Jayson, personal assistant to CEO Sebastian Haley and their growing relationship during the backdrop of a reality dating show that Sebastian is staring in.Like Liam, I don’t like reality shows so wanted to see how the author could write an interesting story around a reality show that didn’t bore me to death. Surprisingly, the author did.Liam Jayson is the assistant to CEO Sebastian Haley. Liam likes Sebastian, but Liam is also a stickler for rules, and one of those rules is, don’t get involved with the boss. He sticks to this belief almost until the bitter end.Sebastian Haley appreciates all the help Liam gives him, but has never looked at Liam in a romantic way. When he’s offered a chance to appear on a gay reality show to find a partner he goes for it. Part of the reason is that he believes it is good publicity for a new dating app that his company is producing. The other is he really is looking for a partner.Liam and Sebastian become more closely involved with each other during his time making the show. And as the contestants are voted off, Sebastian realizes that he’s comparing all the men to Liam. Liam’s feelings for Sebastian increase during this time, but he’s sticking to his guns on not dating the boss.I knew how this story would end, but I was curious how the author would go about solving the problem. I liked the little twist that happened to make everyone get their HEA.A few times Sebastian seemed insecure and he let Liam take the lead in making decisions related to their relationship. Sometimes the scenes between them, when not focused on the show or work, seemed like teenagers muddling their way through a relationship. At the end we find that Liam likes being dominated, and following orders, and that might have worked in Sebastian’s favor if he had pushed the point of them dating during the show.The part where I had the most trouble with the story was the ending sex scene. I can only describe it as ‘Harlequin Romance.’ It was like the author was describing a romanticized version of a sex scene between a guy and a girl where Liam, sounded like the girl. Even the actions were almost an idealized wedding night between a guy and a virgin girl. I had a hard time trying not to skim read through the sex scene. I also didn’t feel the connection between Liam and Sebastian that had been building throughout the whole story. The sex and the ending were a disappointment for me.I enjoyed this story quite a bit. It was sweet with not much angst. It might be a little on the slow side for some people, but I liked the gradual build-up of Liam and Sebastian’s relationship and how Sebastian came to realize that Liam was the one for him. The writing was smooth, easy to read, and I didn’t find many errors. The sex scene was the only part of the story that I didn’t enjoy, and it could just be a matter of personal preference but may appeal to others. I give this story 4 Stars.

Julia has sworn off men after a horrible breakup until she meets Ben. She decides that she wants something different this time around. Like is never easy and love can be messy. What is constant is friends...and cupcakes. I have been a fan of AC Netzel when she wrote FSOG. She writes sexy and angst well along with cute clumsiness. I laughed, was hot n bothered and teared up before it ended. This is her first published book and I feel so proud that she's following her passion.

I have fallen in love with SE Hall and her writing. She writes more than just your typical romance novel she writes about life. Cannon was a great character that brought out changes in others. The mystery behind the accident that changed Conner forever had me guessing until the very end. I hope that there will be stories written about the other band members finding their HEA.

I love S.E. Halls books and as soon as seen cover I was hooked I needed to read like yesterday. She may have outdown herself on this one, oh wait she tops herself every time. This is by far my favorite of S.E. Halls books.You have Liz who has her 2 close friends Rhett & Jarett where they take the bus to different gigs to play music. Liz takes her brother on the bus also talk about so sweet how protective she is it just warms your heart. She is strong female who is independent hard to let outsiders in so no doubt when its time to add a new band member the group shes a little tough. Thats when you meet Cannon Blackwell talk about swoon worthy sweet guy. "Take a deep breath in for me, now blow it out slowly, for you." yep had to do that a few times when he was talking.This book was amazing S.E. Hall seems to be making a habit in her books to get me to laugh and cry all in one book which I love. The emotions this brought out me were like no other books I have read and I was beyond pleased with it. From begining to end I was glued to this and wanted to savor every moment of it not read to fast as wanted the story to continue. You will get your HEA as this is a standalone.

Lizzy is a young woman who has taken on the responsibility of taking care of her brother after she turns eighteen. She hates her father and blames him for many things. She also has a band that travels all over for shows.  After getting rid of one of the band members she is forced to find a replacement on short notice. What she fails to realize is that she can find one at a rest stop.  She sees Cannon with a guitar and a small bag and mistakes him for a hitchhiker. She has to be careful who she brings on the bus out of worry for her brother's safety. After putting Cannon through tests as a group her band decides to give him a chance.  The attraction between them grows and their journey begins. Together they help each other find what's needed to learn to love and let go of the past. It was well written and the characters were well developed. Highly recommend v
summary: Beautiful story of love and family

reviewText: I absolutely love the other series this author has written. I could easily re read those any day.  Her characters are usually relatable and funny but it seemed like a totally different author wrote this book.  I have never felt so bored with reading a book like this one. Lizzy got on my nerves. I really loved conner's character but there just wasn't enough details in the beginning to hook me in with the story.  I can't wait for the final book in the evolve series but I would not continue this one.

There are books that you change your views on life, this is one of them.  I loved the flow of this story.  I will definitely be reading this again. S.E Hall has a way with words that have you smiling one minute and then crying the next.  Thank you Mrs. Hall, you have wonderful talent and I'm glad that you chose to share it with everyone.

Pretty Instinct took me on an emotional rollercoaster for the past 8 hours. Lizzie and Cannon together, speechless. The characters were flawless and complemented each other perfectly. I laughed, cried, cringed, snorted a few times, cried, and fist pumped. I definitely have a book hangover after this one. Go, read it, NOW!!
summary: Get ready to fall in love

reviewText: Pretty Instinct is the newest book by S.E. Hall and boy, does she hit a high note!  It is the story of Liz, her brother Conner and her two best friends Rhett and Jarrett (who also happen to be scrumptious brothers) as they travel together on their tour bus playing different venues along the way. After Liz kicks out a fifth, obnoxious and utterly useless member, they need to find someone to replace this band member. Lo and behold they happen upon my new boyfriend (and yours as soon as you read this book!), Cannon Blackwell just sitting on a bench. Is he a deranged serial killer? Hitchhiker? Or the perfect man to step on to the tour bus, join the band and take control of Liz’s heart?Yes, much of Pretty Instinct takes place on board a tour bus with a band – one woman three men and a driver.  But that is where whatever you may be thinking a typical book about a band on a bus touring the country playing in bars ends. SE Hall takes this book in such a different and glorious direction. Music does play a large role in the story and is important to both the characters and the setting, but the book centers more around the relationships and the characters’ journeys as they heal their hearts and themselves. You will laugh, cry, swoon – in other words SE Hall will run you through the gamut of emotions and touch you deep inside your heart with this winner!I highly recommend Pretty Instinct. And for those of you that are concerned about series - while it is the first book in The Finally Found Collection it is a standalone novel :)
summary: Follow every Pretty Instinct you have and buy this book!

reviewText: Hello Cannon Blackwell! This book was gifted to me by a friend who loved it. I gotta say I agree! Wow can the author write some steamy, make your cheeks go red scenes! I apparently missed the "erotic" part when I started reading! I can't wait to read the other books by SE Hall.

BEAUTIFUL, EMOTIONAL,FREAKING AMAZING!Get ready to rock out, laugh, and cry!SE makes you feel as if you are right there with them, part of the gang.Hard as nails Lizzie, always taking care of everyone else's needs.  Never gave much thought about her wants and dreams. Enter HOT man candy Cannon! Sweet, sexy and ready to knock down walls and shake things up a bit!So sit back relax and hang on cause it's gonna be a bumpy ride!"One in for me and out for you"

What can I say except that everything S.E. Hall writes has this uniquely amazing quality to it that I can't quite put into words. I love everything she writes.  She has a way with words, a way with making you fall in love with the character and the story.  I look forward to reading more from her, I can only hope she continues to write and publish!!!!!

I ADORE SE Hall and have loved EVERY single one of her books! The Evolve series is probably my most favorite series...EVER. I really never thought she would write anything to top it...until I read Pretty Instinct. O...M...effing....G!!! This book is beyond AMAZING! Yes, it is a love story, but it is so much MORE than that as well. It is a story about friendship and family and finding yourself. Liz, Conner, Cannon, Jarrett, Rhett...I fell in love with every single one of these characters.Liz is an incredible, strong, sassy, stubborn, hard loving, funny as hell and devoted woman who has had a s*** hand of cards dealt to her in life. She is making the most of it and is totally dedicated to her brother, Conner, and her two best friends, Rhett and Jarrett. The relationships between these four is so heart warming and sweet. I truly envied the way they loved each other and how dedicated they were to one another. And while Liz is certainly not lacking in friend/family love, she is severely deprived in the romance/sex department. This is just one of the many sacrifices she has made to care for her brother. Thankfully, her luck is about to change....enter one Mr. Cannon Blackwell...Cannon Blackwell...SA...MOTHEREFFING...WOON!!! This man could charm the panties off a nun and a Baptist preacher...if a Baptist preacher wore panties ;) Seriously, Cannon is maybe the most perfect book boyfriend EVER! He is gorgeous, funny, charming, takes control in the bedroom;), protective, understanding and just all around PERFECT! Did I mention that he sings and plays guitar? I'm getting all giddy and a little damp just thinking about him...for reelz! Cannon comes into Liz's life just when she needs him most and he is her soul mate. These two are MFEO...made for each other. Their banter and their sass will have you laughing out loud...often. And their steaminess....good LAWD...it will have you fanning yourself and waking up your hubby or BF for a little "relief" if you know what I mean ;)Seriously, I can't say enough about this book! It is an amazing, over the top, crazy good 5 plus star read!! Do yourself a HUGE favor and buy this bad boy the minute it comes out and drop everything to read it...I promise you won't be sorry!
summary: Every book by SE Hall just gets better and better!!

reviewText: SE Hall creates the most fantastic characters!  I fell in love with Cannon Blackwell.  Talk about swoon.......sigh.I loved this book, I loved the characters, I loved the story line.While reading this book I was swept away.....I wanted to be on that tour bus with all of the characters.One click this book, get swept away and enjoy the ride!
summary: SE Hall has done it again!

reviewText: Incredible.  I could not stop reading.  At some parts I had to put kindle down to wipe my eyes.  True love story but some sad parts especially her talks with Rhett...  Can't wait to read more of s.e. hall's books.  .....

This book gets 10 stars in my book.  I am absolutely in love with Cannon Blackwell he is my book boyfriend forever.  This was such an amazing read, I love SE Hall's writing so much.Elizabeth "Lizzie" is a tough girl who lost her mom, takes care of her older brother and can't fathom every forgiving her father.  She is living on a tour bus with her brother Conner and 2 best friends Jarrett & Rhett when they meet Cannon.  Cannon has been dumped by his fiancé on the side of the road not sure where he is going next.  The playlist to this story is so perfect I have a few new favorites.  I love the letters and the way Cannon talks to Lizzie, he is poetic, lyrical and just beautiful to read.  Hot Hot Hot I will be reading this one again just to make my heart swoon and I recommend to all.  I read this 2 days ago but couldn't get my thoughts down until today.

I enjoyed reading this book. It kept my interest and provided an escape from reality.  I read it in a few hours.  Both characters are likable.  I loved the H, a good guy who gives the impression of being a partier and a player who isn't.  He was also jealous and possessive, which I love. I had no complaints about the h other than she ran away too much.  Good smexing scenes but not too much.  Also I loved that it is HEA.  No cliffhangers, which I hate. I am looking forward to reading the next book in the series, which will be about difference characters.
summary: I am glad that I took the chance

reviewText: This was a wonderful book. It had likable characters, not to heavy on the angst, and an actual build up to a romantic relationship with the main Characters Kade and Raya.A few things I really enjoyed about this book.........It was really well writtenCaught my attention from the very beginning and was able to hold it all the way throughIt wasn't filled with just a bunch of "filler" to make it more drawn out.Raya was a great leading female character that was a sweetheart through and through.Kade was a sweet and lovable guy and didn't pass judgment on Raya or her situation regardless of what Raya thought many different times through out the story.I know this isn't really a review as much as it is me just giving you a list of things I liked about the story but I feel like you should really pick up your own copy and find out yourself how great it really is. I've listed a few great qualities I found to be important to me about this book and hopefully something I've pointed out will help you make up your mind on giving it a try yourself. I do however think you'll want to continue the series after reading this first book.
summary: Kade is so lovable but Raya is a sweetheart through and through! :) :) :) :) :) :) :)

reviewText: I hate cleaning and organizing and wish I could just hire someone to do it. I figured I better get better at it so I don't waste time so I got this book. It was very helpful for me to come up with a plan on what to do and how to do it.
Here's a great story that once you start reading, you can't put it down. Great characters and plot that rolls along at a good pace that keeps your imagination in high gear. Again, great story.
summary: On The Imperium' s Secret Service

reviewText: Protecting you had me laughing in the first ten pages. The characters are witty and smart and have great banter.  This book should come with a fan because leaves you in need of a cool down. If you like crime stories with a healthy dose of steam, you'll love it
summary: Funny and Sexy. I couldn't put it down.

reviewText: What a fun start. Joella is a police officer and has worked undercover in the past. In the first few opening pages, Joella is given an assignment to work as a stripper at a club owed by her bosses friend. When we meet Brendan he is running behind in the morning, answering his doorbell in nothing but a towel... lets just say the laughs came easy! I was immediately drawn to the chemistry between Joella and Brendan. Joella is a witty, intelligent women. Although she is not happy with the position she has been placed in, she embraces her role. Brendan feels an instant connection to Joella, and once he sees her working in his club, he wants to protect her at costs. While there were times I felt disconnected from the story, overall this was a wonderful read and a great start to a new series by S. Donahue. And I can say, the twists at the end, I did predict either. Getting ready for book 2.
Really good story telling. Enjoyed this book. Characters were on point. Couldn't put it down. JOsh was good to be true.

In the mood for something down and dirty...this is the read for you! It certainly satisfied my inner bad girl! Yes, Lacey is promiscuous, she says as much, and I honestly thought it would be a problem for me, but it wasn't. Why? Because she' s also smart and sassy, and generally a very likeable character, she just happens to enjoy sex...lots of it! Once she hooks up with Mason and Hunter, a relationship of sorts starts to form. Both of them are panty melting hot, sweet, just plain adorable and very generous in so many ways! Pure delicious fantasy wrapped up in male perfection! I also laughed a lot, the author has a great sense of humor, especially the banter between Hunter and Lacey, he talks the dirty talk and she has no problem holding her own, gives it right back, and it made for some entertaining reading. Where Hunter is brash, Mason is a little withdrawn and it takes him a while to warm up, once he does though, things heat up fast!As much as this was a very sensual, sexual, passionate read, and believe me they are quick to hop in the sack, it wasn't bogged down in sex. There's an emotional story here, which adds to the depth of the characters and the overall plot. For most of the story it's the three of them, but it can't stay that way, because while Lacey is attracted to both Hunter and Mason, her hearts belongs to only one of them. It sure was fun while it lasted, but someone is going to get hurt!Please tell me that the one who didn't get the girl will get a book of his own...I need this story Aly Martinez!!!!! *fingers crossed*There's a wonderful epilogue...left me feeling good!Don't let the beginning of the blurb throw you off, I was hesitant to read it myself, Lacey is of age and it was all good. Count out your pennies and buy this novella, so much packed into 92 pages, it's worth every bit of 99 cents!
summary: 4.5 Stars! HOT TAMALE...that was a savory tidbit! Actually, this was so much more than I expected, what a delicious surprise!

reviewText: I enjoyed most of their stories. A few I wound up skimming through. It was overall a good buy and recommended

I really had only understood fasting in the religious sense of the word, and I understand it's practical application in that area. When I saw this title, I immediately wanted to read it, because it just makes sense: you can lose weight by not eating. The author does a great job of outlining what fasting is in the weight arena and how you can get it to work for you. If you are searching for a good method to lose weight, read this book!

The third book in "The Prayer Box" series gives closure on many levels to Tandi Reese. And it was a great end to the series. (Although I would love to read more about the people in the series.)  These three books built around The Prayer Box and Tandi and the Outer Banks were a wonderful read and a very pleasant way to spend a couple days. I will be reading more of Lisa's books.

HURRY UP WITH PART 3. CAN'T WAIT TO SEE WHAT MICHAEL HAS TO TELL.  This is an awesome novel and a page turner. The first time I read a book of this type but LOVED IT! in part 1 I was in the middle of chapter 1 and had to stop and download the second episode that's just how much I loved it.

This is an excellent read that should be shared with others, and I'd definitely recommend this book for everyone to read. After reading this book you will be sufficiently imbued with a deep sense of respect and most importantly, patience, to begin the journey of discovery and reflection that will occur when you read this magnificent contemporary fictional novel, "The Tenth."This is a well crafted story and I absolutely enjoyed reading it from start to finish. It's an absorbing and attention-grabbing work that had me engaged from the beginning. The story flows from scene to scene effortlessly, and the author shows exceptional ability when it comes to storytelling. There's an abundance of well illustrated scenes that really make you feel like you are right there in the story, and that's something I really look for in a good book.Although it's a story that you may not want to get personally attached to, the author displays an ability to allow the reader just to observe also. It really is a moving read that stirs the heart.The story had every element a good story should have. An exciting plot, attention to detail, but best of all fleshed out, well-written and well-rounded character development. This interesting and compelling work, as I said, had my attention from the start and there are twists and turns in this page turner that will take the reader on a compelling and emotional journey! Also, the writing style is friendly and straightforward which makes for an enjoyable read.It's one of those stories that come along once in awhile that makes you want to read it non-stop until you get to the end. I'm giving nothing further away here. And this, I hope, will only add to the mystery and enjoyment for the reader!I'll certainly be looking forward to reading more from Smadar Shir in the future!
Robert J Thomas never fails to deliver.  To Hell And Back is just chock full of interesting characters, bandits and indians and a very good story line.  I can't wait until the next book is out there.

This is the second in this series and I can hardly wait for the third... hot hot hot but Apollo romantic as well....  not the same old same old that so many authors get stuck in.  Even the puppies give it four paws!!!!

Freedom is power! Why it is beneficial to be powerful. This book is full of impact! It cleverly explains the advantages of power. Contains brilliant and honest strategies on how to maximize your power and influence that can be successfully applied in an uncomplicated, straightforward manner, or they can be taken to extremely high levels of sophistication. This book is highly recommended!

A very interesting read on some of the key characteristics it takes to be powerful. Of course you don't have to have all of these traits, but the author goes into details about what they feel are the most important aspects of being powerful and then explains what you need to do in order to develop them yourself. There's also a pretty cool bonus chapter which I enjoyed.All in all, a great book with some powerful messages in it.

I am really a caffeine addict. I can't start the day without even sipping the taste of my coffee. There are countless benefits in sipping a cup of coffee but having it too much would cause bad effects too. So I started to try lay low on my coffee sessions and this book has helped me a lot to overcome my caffeine addiction. Thanks!

reviewText: Wow, what a fantastic book.  This is not your bland, run of the mill  kind of Christian love story.  This is what I would call a beautiful love story, completely pleasurable.  I did not want this book  to end.  Anybody who loves mail order brides will absolutely love this one.  There is not one thing I would  change .  Laura had a very bad experience when she was just  15 years old and then some.  Her new husband was a very good Christian man.  No filthy stuff here, it's a nice clean book that I highly recommend.

I read all of these individually.What a wonderful set of mysteries. With each book, the characters deepen and the mysteries are deliciously complex and well thought-out. There is a perfect villain in Sir Duncan. I can't wait to see more of him.The characters really drive these stories and make them so much more than "murder of the week" episodes. I can't wait for book 4!
Looking forward to reading the next chapter of this very interesting couple of sleuths. Loved it! Always enjoy something different and well written.

I have loved all the series that Elizabeth A Reeves has written and I love how the Cindy Eller and Goldie Locke series intertwine.
