This book is full of back stories of the minor characters in the books and we are given a fresh new look at each of these characters. I thoroughly enjoyed learning  things about each character that explains some of the choices they have made or some of the deep fears that each character lives with and is instrumental in making those choices.  This is a must read as I now will have a deeper understanding of why some characters will make the choices they do as I read future adventures in the lives of Miranda's family.  If you too love these books buy it now, you won't be able to put it down, guaranteed.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!Well I'll be dammed I just read this in 3 hours... I just couldn't put it down,  T.L. Smith has created a female character who can stand up to the alpha males and make them kneel at her feet!The lead character is Krinos, a beautiful but tough Aussie who is a spitfire, she can hold her own, is confident in her sexuality, and not afraid to scratch that itch when she wants.  She's everything you would expect a drug bosses daughter to be, and the business is being handed over to her, which leads us to where she meets her fathers second in command, Stefanos.Stefanos is the Alpha of all Alpha male's, he is hot, sexy and used to getting what he wants when he wants... possessive of what he thinks is his... And he wants Krinos!When they meet, Krinos is in lust at first sight, she's not daft to pass up getting hot and heavy with this Greek God, but on her own terms...  Which Stefanos is not happy about, this leads to some awesomely hot reading... The sex is off the charts, hot heavy and hard.Krinos doesn't want to submit and neither will Stefanos and he has a hard time dealing with the fact that she is her own boss, not to be owned or submit (YAY) at last a female who is an equal to these alpha characters.  I also liked how she didn't weaken when times were at there worst, she is a fighter, and she will take on anyone who dares to think she is just a simpering woman.The story is fast paced, the drug world do not think a woman should be a boss, and they stupidly think that she will lay down and take their insolence, I really enjoyed reading this Novella, and I look forward to reading how she will take hold of both the reins in business and how she decides what future Stefanos will have in her life.T.K. Smith's writing style is fast paced, erotic and the chemistry between Krinos and Stefanos literally smokes.I hope book 2 isn't too far away.If you like fast paced story lines with strong characters this book is for you.

reviewText: Anti aging - don't we all want to turn back the hands of time? Although we cannot stop father time completely, we can slow it down a little.When I look in the mirror, sometimes I cannot fathom how I have grown this old. What happened to my youthful appearance?I have more gray hair than I should, and have more wrinkles than most people my age. This book contains many ways we can slow down the aging process by using supplements and anti aging skin care. I really enjoyed this book and I recommend it to anyone who wants to regain thier fountain of youth.

reviewText: Part Harry Potter, part a knight in king Arthur's Court, with a lil sprinkle of Game of Throwns style palace intrigue makes for a very enjoyable read.I love the characters, the alternate history type angle reminiscent of Sliders, really all of it, save the length. I know it's common for 3.99 books and ideally it will be offset by more frequent entries in the series, but I just wasn't left quite as satisfied as with the previous entry. Maybe because it takes place over summer vacation? Maybe just all the upheaval that's packed into and seemingly glossed over such a short novel?I'm not quite sure in any case I strongly recommend this title and hope Mr Nuttall is close to completing the 3rd one!

reviewText: Another solid book from Mr Nuttall. I really enjoy all of his works. They have great characterisation and detailed world building. reviewText: Jeff Calloway's book, Your Blank Page, is a short but well thought out book.Calloway begins with the chapter titled "Crafting Your Vision Statement." He then proceeds to give illustrations and guidance on how to design a personal vision statement. He goes on to explain the need for a life vision statement and includes examples of corporations' (and his own) statements.The book will take you step-by-step through the process from conceptualization to completion. Your Blank Page is interspersed from beginning to end with practical applications and anecdotes from Galloway's life.  Readers may then draw from these stories in order to create their own statements.Your Blank Page is a short, quick read, drawing on Christian principles, to facilitate each person's vision statement.I received this book from StoryCartel in exchange for a free review.

A really detailed and well-written book for anyone to read if they're thinking about having kids in the future (which is most people). This book actually reinforced my opinion to NOT have kids. It's a reminder of just what you'll be taking on in a realistic way but also helps you to decide when the time is actually right to take on that type of responsibility. Worth a download!

You don't even have to think about what you are going to eat in the beginning! The recipes are great! The ones I have tried have been easy to make and very tasty!  Vegans get this book!

One of the most important lessons in creativity is developed well in this book and that is understanding that there are various types of creative people. Not everyone can draw, paint, write or other forms of creation which is generally what comes to mind when thinking of creativity. This book will help you not only figure out what kind of creativity you possess but also how to unleash it, including great motivators as well as common obstacles. Very good book!!

reviewText: Book – FracturedAuthor – Leanne PearsonPublication Date – May 16, 2014Type – Stand AloneGenre – Romance, New AdultRating – 4 out of 5 StarsComplimentary Copy provided by Author in exchange for an honest review.This was such a wonderful and heartfelt read. I loved reading about New Zealand and the little differences compared to the States.I do have to admit that I was crying within a few pages of this story and couldn’t get past the heart break I experienced in the beginning....I wanted him to be OK – I wanted a happy time. It took me a while but I did warm up to Dell and the patience he had waiting for Kat to come around and realize that she deserved love and happiness in her life.Her devastation crushed me though…she was the poster child for what a broken heart is capable of and how one can slowly start to heal from trauma and deal with PTSD.My hats off to Ms. Pearson for writing such a touching and beautiful story.

This is a touching and emotional read! You will feel for Kate and Dominic throughout the entire book!Kate is NOT doing well. The love her life dies and now is unable to function. She does have friends to support and love her, but she's still struggling to stay a float with it all. When she meets Dominic things change.*YOU will feel for this young woman. She's experienced such sadness and your heart breaks for her. I enjoyed her ability to become friends with Dominic and the ways he slowly brought her back to life... slowly. She's a bubbly/lively person when she is around him and I loved how she got him.Dominic was in the war. He's not doing so well himself but when he meets the lovely Kate he's drawn to her. He wants to try to protect and care for her if she can let him in.* Wow! You will love this man! He's amazing with Kate. He truly is a fine and wonderful man. I loved all the little things he did for her. They were simply amazing!! I can't stress enough how much you will fall in love with this man. He truly is the kind of man we all would want and love! <3 <3This book is filled with real struggles people face today... You will fall for the friends, family, the love, loss and more... it will all captivate you until the end.I truly enjoyed this story! 4 stars from me.
summary: Tanya- The Book Obsessed Momma's Review

reviewText: What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, right? Or does it???When this book started with Gavin's mother sending a text message so say that she would not be able to attend his wedding (really? A text message?!?) I knew that this was not going to be the run of the mill, cookie-cutter romance.Gavin is just days away from marrying Muireane, the perfectly nice, perfectly stable woman to spend the rest of his life with.Fiona is back in town to be in her cousin Muireane's wedding. Muireane and her mother are just bitches, really did not like them at all. And they are out to make Fiona's time in Ballybeg hell.I really, really like Fiona. She was a breath of fresh air amongst the rich, snobbish family that surround Gavin and Muireanne. She's a combat boot wearing, outspoken whirlwind that comes back to town and stirs things up.She has come for wedding before taking of on an adventure of a life time to Australia. But the best laid plans and all of that....When she discovers something from back in her past, it affects more than just herself. Gavin is in this thing up to his neck, and in just a few days his whole world is thrown into turmoil. He loses pretty much everything with just one piece of paper.OMG,for about the first 1/3 of the book, I so was not a fan of Gavin. I wanted to scream at him to bloody well grow a pair and stop being everyone's doormat - his fianc`, her family, everyone except for his best friend just walked all over him. I could have cheered when he finally stood up to people - go Gavin, go Gavin!!There was plenty of "shenanigans" in this book - of the fun kind and some possibly illegal ones ` from the main characters, to their families, to the labradoodle dog, hideously named Wiggly Poo - I think he was acting out because of the name!!I very much enjoyed Love and Shenanigans. I was drawn into the story and it kept my interest from the first to the last page. There was a couple of twists and turns that I was not expecting. I liked the writing style, loved the Irish-isms throughout. I laughed at some of the antics, I got upset right along with the characters.If you are after a light hearted, fun read, why not give Love and Shenanigans a go.Now, bring on the next book please Ms Keane!
summary: It is as the title says, Love and Shenanigans

reviewText: Keane had me laughing from the first page to the very last.  She also works some very heartfelt and touching moments into this remarkably unique tale.  Her writing style is smooth and the story flows steadily forward.  The storyline itself was captivating and unique.  She had me guessing throughout.  I appreciate the fact that, although definitely one of a kind, the romance within the story was genuine, even if it was just as off kilter as the characters themselves.The main characters in this novel are absolutely priceless.  They definitely drive the story.  They were easy to get to know and easy to connect with.  I appreciate how the author shows both sides of the story.  Having the ‘inside scoop’ from each of them heightens the excitement and enjoyment of the tale.  I appreciate the fact that the main characters are down to earth.  The fact that they are surrounded by individuals from all walks of life, connected by the small town they grew up in adds to the fun of the story.Family, friends, hardship, and lore all make an appearance in this loveable & captivating novel.  It was a phenomenal read that I would recommend to those who enjoy second chance romances.  I know I certainly did.  I cannot wait to read the second novel in this series.Please note that I received a complimentary copy of this work in exchange for an honest review.

Fiona and Gavin may have shared the briefest of marriages, but it is clear that these two crazy kids belong together. If only there wasn’t the teensy matter of Gavin being about to get married to Fiona’s dreaded cousin Muireann.Fortunately, Fiona and Gavin are still married, a fact which may make Gavin at least temporarily Fiona’s, but which also makes the two of them the object of town gossip. Worse, it makes them the object of scorn and revenge from Fiona’s Uncle Bernard, Gavin’s would-be future father-in-law.The pull between Fiona and Gavin is stronger than either would like to acknowledge, and they struggle to fight it. Meanwhile, Uncle Bernard is determined to make their lives miserable. Fiona happens to uncover a mystery of sorts surrounding Uncle Bernard, which helps propel the story beyond that of a mere romance.One of the questions Fiona has to face is what she wants to do with her life. She’s about to take a year-long sabbatical to travel around Australia, but then she’s forced to stay in Ballybeg, a place she couldn’t wait to escape. What will she do when she’s finally able to head out on her trip? And what will she do about Gavin?There is some hot headboard rockin’ in here. What it lacks in quantity it makes up for in quality, though. Let’s just say that Gavin gives Fiona a reason or two (or more) to stick around.Zara Keane’s sense of location and characterization is spot on. She makes you feel like you’re in this small coastal town, and she makes you feel like you know the locals as well as Fiona and Gavin do. She also makes you care about her characters – even the crazy labradoodle. We know Fiona has some work to do. She needs to figure out what her future looks like and where it will take her, and we also know that she will find those answers in Ballybeg.If it occasionally feels like something you've read before, nevertheless this is a fun, charming romance, chock full of fun, charming characters.
summary: 3.5 stars for a fun, sweet romance

reviewText: This was a great course in improving reading speed. The author delves in to some very important topics to help teach the art of speed reading, including how/why to use a pointer, obstacles that often hinder speed reading, appropriate reading settings, dynamic reading and how to increase comprehension while still speed reading. I would definitely recommend this book to anyone who feels they read to slowly or someone who needs to increase reading speed for jobs or simply to get through more books in the short amount of time people usually have to leisurely read.

Coming from an avid reader and writer this book had some amazing tips. I'm always reading and proof reading and accuracy as well as speed are an important part. This book definitely helped me in more ways than one! Thanks Pakulski for writing this resourceful book!
By reading this book I learned the benefits of a gluten-free diet. What I liked most were the very well explained recipes that make it easy to implement this diet into your daily life. 5 stars!

Deliciously insane recipes found in this cookbook and I am very happy to have found this one! Kudos to the author who wrote this well and informatively, without any errors and is absolutely worth the time to read. Bacon Blueberry Carnitas is just my favorite!

The do-list has finally received a makeover that increases it usefulness for busy people. S. J. Scott identifies common pitfalls that prevent individuals from accomplishing their top daily priorities and long-term goals in his indispensable book, “To-Do List Makeover.”S.J. replaced the single to-do list with four lists that help readers clearly identify, prioritize and perform tasks. The book explains how to incorporate tools like Evernote, mind mapping and Remember the Milk. Links to these and other resources are included in S.J.’s book. He also provides advice on when it is okay to use pen and paper and when technology is the better option.I like the way S.J. walks readers step-by-step through the process of creating his revamped to-do lists for their own lifestyle. The book provides specific examples, including one of S.J’s actual weekly to-list, which is great for visual learners like me.Finally, the section entitled “How to Take Action (Even If You’re not Motivated) helps readers uncover the real reason that they aren’t accomplishing a specific task. S.J. also provides strategies to overcome the issue.If you are serious about accomplishing your personal and professional daily and long-term goals, you must read the “To-Do List Makeover.”
summary: Learn how to create to-do lists that get results!

reviewText: If  I had never read the first series (3) books, I still would be able  to pick up  this set of 3 and continue.. But I am so glad I didn't have to. Michael adds a freshness in each book , but I just love being able to keep reading once I have finished one book. There is a separateness as well as a continuity to these stories of  the Florida panhandle. I feel like I am visiting with each one I read. The suspense is enough to keep me riveted without making me nervous.  Michael is not recognized well enough for his talent.  A truly fine author

I enjoy seeing what will happen in John Jordan's life in each of the BLOOD books. It is wonderful Michael has put together this series so you can have three of his books for one low price. All three are page turners that put you in the Florida panhandle with characters that come alive with Michael's great descriptions.
Good read but rather not real exciting. This could have had a few more ups and downs. Wasn't bad though.
Nice story line. I love the growth in Marly. Kathleen O'Brien is a wonderful story weaver. Worth the time to pick up and read.
read it in one sitting! well written great heart warming characters. you feel with the characters. any book that can make me laugh and cry is a 5 star

I had a hard time getting into this book in the beginning, but after the first few chapters i couldn't put it down. Drake and Marly seemed to have a good connection. However I liked Drake's character the most.
I love to shop. This book comes in handy as I can see how it can help me save thousands of dollars. Lots of advantages of using coupons. Good money saver book.

Jack's char was great to read!!  haha dunno if I would actually want a Jack in real life since we really know what he is like but man! WHAT A MAN!!  The girl is a bit stupid I think but I put it down to her age, her sister and her past. I know I know she is in bliss with happiness but really BRAINWASHED!!  Like I said chalk it down mostly her age, sister and past.  But for someone who lived in a crap neighborhood she is really nave.. especially from someone who helped her sister work with people at a homeless shelter!  Other than that I totally loved the book and am waiting for the second part to come out.  This is another part that bothered me.  I didn't know that I was an incomplete book when I bought it and wished that she waited until she wrote the WHOLE book and then released it.  I wouldn't of minded paying more BUT I do hate waiting for a book to come out because by the time the second part comes out you have already lost some of the "feeling".

We can all be enriched by goal setting and subsequent achievement. But it's not always so easy. That's where abook like "How To Achieve Anything You Want" by Gerry Marrs can empower us. This is a very thought-provoking work. Not a shallow presentation at all.The reader is equipped with many different tools and strategies to become the achiever he or she wants to be.Worthwhile quotes from great men and women are peppered throughout the book.
summary: Many different tools and strategies to become the achiever you want to be

reviewText: "How to Achieve Anything You Want" is an extremely educational book.  A must read for everyone!  Extensive instruction on prioritizing, organizing, goals and dreams, how to set timelines and more.  I found it to be very motivating.  Lots and lots of resources and software recommendations, as well.  Well worth the money!

‘How To Achieve Anything You Want’ is an ebook chalk full of tools and tips you can use to get exactly what you want out of life. The author, Gerry Marrs, does an excellent job weaving in inspirational quotes from famous people like Walt Disney, Frank Lloyd Wright, Ben Carson and more.I also liked how much of advice in this book is actionable. It’s stuff you can do right now to start achieving your goals. Most are very simple, like clipping out pictures that represent the kind of life you want to live (ie. pictures of private jets, tropical beaches, etc.). The importance of writing down your goals is also stressed.After reading this book I felt like I had the blueprint of a great plan to start moving toward my goals. This book is incredibly inspiring and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a better life!
summary: Very inspirational book - A must read!

reviewText: This is a great starting guide for day trading! I mean I understood in theory what day trading was, but had no practical knowledge of how to properly carry my intentions out. After reading I feel confident to start making real trades in the market, however I will definitely start with lower amounts as I learn and practice. Overall a great guide for any beginner!

Stock market? Trading? Penny stocks? etc, etc.All these words were foreign to me, that is, until I got Devon Wilcox's book. I read it thoroughly, then read through it a second time. The lingo, which was confusing before is now easy to understand. I think this is a perfect resource for every beginning trader. I always see those e-trade commercials (yeah the ones with the cute baby) and my husband says, 'we need to try it'. After reading this book, I am not as scared (with the exception of possibly losing money) but knowing what I am dealing with has eased my mind a little.Simply written yet very informative.

This book was captivating to say the least! It sucks you right in. I finished in one sitting because I had to know how it ends!Ryland Roberts and Piper Jameson are high school sweethearts, and best friends. After one night that was supposed to be one they would never want to forget something bad happens, and it tears their worlds apart! Ryland had his entire life planned out, and going to college to leave a town he didn't want to be in anymore was the plan. He wanted to put the past behind him. When Piper left after the accident, and never contacted him again for 6 years he didn't expect to see her again.Piper Jameson the towns wild child is back after 6 years of staying away. It hasn't been easy staying away from Ryland, but she only did what she thought was best for him. In her mind he deserved better. She never thought she would come back, but with her mother falling ill she has to come back to the town that she left behind forever to see her mother.Ryland and Piper are thrown together so to speak to protect Piper's sister Hadley. As they go on the run feelings resurface and bitterness comes out. Ryland can't understand why Piper wouldn't contact him ever in 6 years. Will these two rekindle what they had 6 years ago? Or has too much time passed? Will trust be the deciding factor with how everything unfolds? I don't want to give it away, but just know there are some WTH just happened moments?! You will be on the edge of your seat with this book.Hadley- Piper's sister will steal your heart. She's been through so much. You will be holding your breath wanting her to be safe. She's had a lot happen in a short time so you will connect with her immediately! I loved her!I give this amazing book 4.5 stars for the first few chapters, but after that it was 5 HUGE SHINY stars for me!! It is one you will want to read for sure! Thank you Elizabeth Lee for this wonderful book.

As a new homeschooling mom, I'm always looking for ways to get my kids engaged in learning. My son loves robots and all my kids love to build. I can't wait to get started doing these projects with them. I love how there are pictures of all the projects and components and the projects seem like they will be engaging, but not too difficult to do. The author shares the websites and places that the needed components can be purchased. I'm going to be ordering the parts soon, so we can start doing these this summer.
summary: A Homeschooler's STEM Dream Come True

reviewText: Chapter Three "Allow " is my favorite it is also the hardest thing for me to do. The statement ,"When you allow something, you are simply letting it exist without argument or resistance." This is just an interesting concept and I need to reduce the stress in my life so thanks for giving me seven easy ways to "stop stressing"
I liked this story even better than the fist one. Renee has a back for being able to transport the reader quickly without you feeling like a chunk of the storyline is missing. Great short read.

Over all this was a good series so far .. it was kind of confusing and left me trying to put pieces of a puzzle together but  eventually I got it and I was intrigued .. I want to read a part 4 (if there is ) .. deuce and Italy deserves to be happy ..
Omg it was just as good as first one and the second one. I really can't wait for the next one.

This review can be found at The Blogger Girls review site.When Dan gets a call from Nathan, the omega of the pack, who’s freaked out and doesn’t know what to do, Dan expects the worst and immediately jumps to Nathan’s aid, surprised that the timid omega is asking for his help. Thankfully, it’s not as dire a situation as he was expecting but what he realizes is that Nathan is much more broken than anyone ever believed. With the urge to not only heal Nathan but to protect him, Dan makes it his mission to give the little omega some TLC. Unfortunately, things are a little more difficult than that when a new threat comes to town that’s looking to hit them where they’re most vulnerable… with Nathan. Can Dan give Nathan what he needs and save him from his past or will trying to save Nathan prove to be a useless attempt?This book just about broke my heart! I loved the way that it showed how Dan was a little miffed about not being picked as alpha but that we also got to experience why he was never selected as alpha and his understanding that he was never ready for that. I also loved seeing the change in Dan from the aloof beta to a more caring and reliable beta. Nathan was such a damaged character and he really made my heart clench with why he was so damaged but it was adorable the way he wormed his way into Dan’s heart. The relationship between them starts off tense, especially when you consider how Nathan was in Accidental Alpha and Dan’s opinion of him but then it slowly turns into one where they’re not only comfortable with one another but they crave to be around each other and reach for the other when the situation calls for it. I just adored them together.My only little niggle with this one was that it was too short! I really wished it had been longer because I’d love to have seen more of Nathan and Dan actually together as mates and to experience more of that connection that they were developing. Beyond that, I would have loved to see more of Nathan learning and exploring what it means to be a wolf and how Dan helps him with that.All in all, this was a fabulous addition to the Pack Partners series. I can’t wait to read more in this series but I definitely don’t want it to end! I’m loving the world and the characters but Dan and Nathan might just be my favorite so far. If you liked Accidental Alpha, then you’ll definitely enjoy this one. If you haven’t read it yet, then what are you waiting for?! Pick it up and read it!!

5 of 5 stars~ Review by PizzyGirlFor original review see Prism Book AlliancePoppy Dennison has yet again crafted a wonderful tale of shifters. She has given me a warm, fuzzy feeling of love and happiness. She has also left me wanting more. Ms. Dennison did a wonderful job picking up where Accidental Alpha left off. She continued to effortlessly build this world and its characters. However, Belligerent Beta also begins the development of the pack members as individuals. While learning pack dynamics, Ben must learn about himself in order to do what is needed as Beta. Nathan must learn what it means to be accepted and be part of a pack. There is great character growth and so much tenderness between these two men. My heart melted. I love this one even more than the first. I want to know which pack member will find their mate next. What new issues will arise for the pack to overcome? When will the next one be published?

Cora Seton has a way to bring her characters to life. Her style of writing is easy flowing and enjoyable to read. Read a lot of her books because of her style. Waiting for her other E-Mail Order Bride series to be offer for Kindle.

reviewText: I love Cora's easy to read , LOVE and climb into stories. I love Chance Creek and all the townsfolk.  This new series is excellent and everything that you expect of a true love.

reviewText: This was a sweet, sexy, light-hearted read. I absolutely loved Mason and Regan together. Their personalities played off of one another beautifully. I read the entire book in the course of a few hours and enjoyed every single moment. I will definitely be reading more of Cora Seton's work!
Wonderful book!  It's one of those books you don't want to put down.  Cora Seton is such a wonderful author never disappoints you.  I do recommend the book highly.

reviewText: Now I have read all your books.  Problem, can't wait for the next two to come out.  I keep looking online to see who they will be about.Thanks for writing such great stories.  Love them all..................Teresa

I must confess I bought this book solely based on the title. I had no idea what it was about but thought it would be a funny read. I was delightfully surprised to find it was an honest to goodness real book about how the mind works and why no matter how intelligent we may be sometimes we do or say world class stupid things. I ended up with a lot more information than a primer!Really glad I bought this, and am actually about to put some of its hints into guidance when I walk the dog in a bit!

Porn with a very good plot. Rachel is a very sad and lonely woman who gets a second chance at the life she had. Luc a very sexy young man that helps Rachel get her groove back. Joe a 'caveman' that brings Rachel back to the woman she has always been.

So now that I have finished this amazing story that really blew book 1 and 2 out of the water I was grateful for the chance at reading this. It is a 3 person POV which was amazing I was able to actually be inside Nick's head and let me tell you WOW!!! Okay so really had 4 but the 4th one was really really short hardly able to count that. reviewText: I liked it. Very well written story about trying to revisit a past life. Siggy is right, you can't go back. Things never stay the same and life is ever changing.

'Ride for a Cure' by N.C. Winters is a fun, hot, fast paced story. I loved the story and all the characters. Definitely looking forward to reading more from this author and this series! I recommend this story to all fans of romance, cowboys, horses and happily ever afters.

Wow what a awesome read. I could not put this book down once I got into the story line. Love this series the books keep getting better and better. Loved Grady and Holly these two were my favorite characters in Rev. Grady is the Sergeant of the Arms for The Forsaken MC. Grady is in love with Holly who is a teacher. I cannot wait for the next one in this series. JC Emery books are so worth the reading they are a enjoyable and exciting series. I recommend these books to anyone who likes to read MC books.

Rev (Bayonet Scars #3)By: JC Emery4/5 stars*Trigger warning* There is an incredibly descriptive gruesome rape scene involving a secondary character. Please be advised an object is also used. It is horrific. And no, I won’t describe it now.Holly Mercer has had more than her share of bad luck. But most of it has been brought on by her always giving too much of herself and never standing up for herself or making herself a priority. Time after time she has done this and now the cows have come home. She’s 26 and has to move in with her parents and just got a job at the Fort Bragg High School as a secretary. The principal is the kind that doesn’t want to have to tackle the “hard kids” or do any of his own dirty work, so he assigns those kids to other people. Oh, and that definitely means the MC kids.Sterling “Knuckles” Grady is the Sargent at Arms for the Forsaken MC and father to a teenage daughter, Cheyenne. Recently Cheyenne’s attendance and grades have slipped because her dad is occupied with the club troubles and losing his best friend Chief (from book 1 when Alex was kidnapped by her brother.) Grady definitely doesn’t want to have to deal with someone from the school and doesn’t need to be told how to raise his daughter.Of course, since it is Holly’s job to contact the parents of the students under her directive, she has several run ins with Grady. To say that they are combustible is an understatement. Anytime they speak to one another, it turns into an insult hurling argument. Even though they drive each other crazy, they areAfter some “club business” goes down, Grady protects Holly, and they enter into somewhat of a faux relationship. But that doesn’t mean that they spend any time with each other cultivating appearances for this faux relationship, it is alive in words only.The mafia problem comes back to town and causes some issues since the club is still holding Michael Jr. and Alex is with Ryan. We don’t see how any dispute is solved and it remains to be seen whether or not it actually is, but I’ll bet is that we’ll continue to see this plot in upcoming books. Also, the Darren Jennings retribution against the club issue comes back into play. Again, there are no conclusions to that problem, only clues, so we’ll see that later.I didn’t like the timeline of this book. We never knew how far apart things happened until a couple pages into a new chapter, so parts of the book didn’t flow & just jumped around. Like the characters knowing that the other loves them & they love the other. There was no, scene there or how it happened, it was just mentioned.The epilogue takes us 2 years out, but with the next book being Jeremy & Cheyenne’s, I’m not sure if we’ll see the mafia/Jennings issues or if the book will proceed from this epilogue. I really liked Ian in this book & can’t wait for him to get his own!!

The third installment of the Bayonet Scars series is filled with emotion and relationship building. This is the story of Grady and Holly. Grady is the Sergeant of Arms in Forsaken motorcycle club and Holly has just moved back to Fort Bragg. As a reader, you know she has a bit of a sketchy past, but all is not revealed. She is trying to get her feet back on the ground and start anew, when all hell breaks loose and she is thrown into the crossfire with Forsaken. She seems to be filled with conflicting emotions. She wants to do right and be good, yet her morality is tested in very extreme situations. Such as mobsters accosting her outside of her job. Being kidnapped, albeit in the nicest possible way and left dangling off a seawall. You know, crazy stuff like that!Grady is trying to balance being a father to a seventeen year old girl, the death of his best friend, Chief, and all the grief that comes with that, and this newfound attraction to the smartass that is trying to get his daughter to graduate high school, Holly. He has the mob coming at him in one direction and keeps getting railroaded by Holly and her sassiness. He fights it for awhile, but finally succumbs to his affection for her. This eventually turns into so much more. They balance each other out. He needs someone at home that will soothe him during dark times, and she needs to know that her instincts about right and wrong are jaded and that’s ok. Grady understands, and that is everything to her.I love how this series picks up where the previous story left off and gives you background information from a different point of view. All three leading men, Ryan, Duke, and Grady have all been presented as real badasses. They are strong and strict and very rough around the edges. Grady is older and wiser. He knows what he wants in a woman and Holly is the one for him; plain and simple. This series just keeps getting better and better and I can’t wait for more! Hopefully Ian is up next. He has a lot of secrets to be told.5 smooches~Nicole

Yet another book of JC's that I couldn't put down and was left with a huge book hangover the next morning.  This is the third book in the Bayonet Scars series.  Warning, there is a brutal rape scene in the book, but I feel that it is needed and was as well written as a scene like that could be.  This series has become on of my favorites.Holly just moved back into town and has a job at the high school as a secretary.  She is given the job of trying to get a students father to sign a form so Chey, the student, will be able to make up missed school work.  Holly has no clue who this man is, or what type of father he is.  She has made numerous attempts to get a hold of him, and nothing.  She is just trying to help Chey, so she can graduate.Grady, is in the Forsaken MC, he is also Chey's father.  He has just lost his best friend and is going through a lot.  He doesn't need some secretary getting in his face.  Grady is very alpha male.  I really like him.  He is a great dad, just going through some things.Holly doesn't show that she is intimidated by him, even though she really is.  She is just trying to put Chey first.Boy when these two finally get together it's awesome.  We get to see a whole new side of Grady, instead of the hard-ass biker." You fit in here," he says.  "You fit in with me- with us.  We don't fit in anywhere, either.  So we fit in together."I love that Holly will get right back into his face and not take his crap.  But she does love him."You're going to marry me and when everything calms down, I'm going to give you a son." ~HollyI can't wait for the next book.

reviewerName: Up All Night Book Addict "Amber from Up all N...
reviewText: JC never seems to disappoint me!  This book has been on my mind for DAYS!  I absolutely adored this book!  I can't decide if I like this or Ride better!  This is another MUST read!Holly and Grady's story is p-e-r-f-e-c-t!  This book could not have been any better!  These two unlikely characters falling into one another is not something they expected, but we, the readers, know better!  Opposites attract!  Especially in these books!Their relationship heats up slowly throughout the entire book, meanwhile, the threats of the Mancuso's and others are all around them!  The biker vs mob in this series is phenomenal!  The theme continues throughout each story.  I also love how well JC is able to overlap these books.  They don't pick up where the one before left off, but they also don't cover all of the same time-frame either!  Genius!I am looking forward to reading Crush next...
summary: Just might be better than Volume One!

reviewText: Good for beginners. Not so in depth for advanced publishers. I have around 8 books published on Kindle and there was hardly anything in this book that I did not know. However I realized, that it makes for an excellent guide for somebody starting out with kindle publishing , or for somebody whose books are not doing very well.It covers all your basics, the stuff you should not be overlooking when you set out to market your book. I'd recommend it as essential reading for most Kindle publishers and only those of you may skip it, who have had multiple bestsellers on Amazon. Good book on the whole, deserves 4 stars at least.

And how does Emma know his secret?What will Bindi do when she sees Cage leading the troops into her area? Where can she take the kids to keep them safe??What is Nim up to??This series has me totally hooked! It is a page turner!!

This is not a short story. Betrayal in any form is hard to accept but, when it comes from those you love it's so much harder. This book is for anyone that loves a well written story, shifters, and a dramatic turn of events that keeps you turning the pages.

I'm trying in my reviews of this series, not to give away too much as i want to tell you everything that is happening because this series is just getting better and better.Cage is getting pulled away from the Military with his connection to Bindi getting stronger and stronger. His beliefs are beginning to change and he doesn't believe the Military is that concerned with keeping the civvies protected from the shifters but Cage is beginning to realise that the shifters are not all bad. After Cage goes on a Suicide mission and survives, he becomes a wanted man as the military consider him a traitor.Lots of more action and dramas throughout the book that left me gripped to this story. This one is full of betrayal and i was shocked when one of the kids that Bindi has looked after, becomes a traitor but you will have to read it to find out which one! This is book 3 in the series. I really loved the story in this book.  I could not put it down till I finished reading the whole story.Thank you so very much for writing it.

It'S about  Bindi and Cage and  now that  CaGE is a shifter he has to decided whom he will  protect  humans or shifters or both. I loved this book and I am looking forward to the next book. I think Whitney is a great author and I love all of her books that I have read.

Oh my god this book was so so so good. Holy hell Andrew was hot in this book. My only complaint was it was way way to short. It was novella in length...so my whine for the day was this whole series could have been one book or two at the most. It did not need to be broken into 3 books...but it did end in a great cliffhanger. I just wish book 3 was out now!

4.5 stars!Continuing with my trend of reading serials, this one has really been my all time favorite.  I have been dying to read this one as I have been curious as to Andrew's past and what makes him who he is.And can I say that Whitney sure doesn't disappoint.Volume 2 was so much more than what I expected it would be.  In my opinion though Andrew and Aubry try to deny each other, they are insatiable for each other and in my mind a perfect match.  I find myself running the gamut of emotions with this book - smiling, swooning, fanning myself and of course sadness because my heart is breaking for these two have hold a place in my heart and mind.With the unraveling of secrets and learning the truths of this man, I could see the wonderful man Andrew could be but won't allow himself to be or go there with his heart again (understandably so).  But at what cost for himself and Aubry?Well written and descriptively delicious and sexy, this was hard to put down and I devoured it until the end and am again left wanting more...hopefully we don't have too long to wait!  Once this serial is complete, I do look forward to go back and read all together because I truly love this one and think you will too!

Oh my!!! I need more of Andrew and Aubrey like NOW...heehee!!! Well this second installment did not disappoint at all and I mean not one bit. The only thing that left me sad was that it had to end. Whitney G is a fantastic writer and even though this book was short in length, I still felt a slew or emotions, from my heart hurting to chuckling to myself out loud and smiling! Can't wait for RD3 and I will patiently wait as long as I need to in order to get my greedy hands on it.
summary: Amazing & entertaining! Whitney G. is my new favorite author!!!

reviewText: Andrew. Andrew. Andrew.There it is...that's my review. His name is all that's needed. This serial is just flipping brilliant. The perfect amount of drama weaved into some flipping hottness. But what I love most about it, is the humor. The banter...Andrew's thoughts...it's all just the best.READ THIS NOW!
summary: GAH!!! There are no words that will give this justice!

reviewText: Still intriguing, still keeping me at the edge of my seat, and rather falling in love with this damaged man.And then there is Aubrey who is a survivor.  I have no trepidation that somehow she WILL stand up to her parents and WILL pursue her dancing career.  But is she strong enough to survive the heartache that is Andrew?  I wonder...Now with Ava in the mix, we begin to understand why Andrew is the way he is.  How deeply he is hurt by this horror of a woman goes far into understanding his avoidance of any type of relationship.  Can he really survive this way before he implodes?Whitney Garcia Williams has struck a cord with this series.  Intriguing, thrilling, sexy... it truly stays with you after reading the last word of each installment and keeps you wanting more.  I am totally enjoying this ride!

I received this book as part of an ARC review from the author for honest review.4 starsSeries: Yes, book 1Characters: Well written and most were easy to connect with.Setting: Almost non-existent descriptions, but unnoticeable.Sex: Lots of it. (m/f - m/m/f - m/f/f - m/m/f/f)Kelly is a mother of two, a wife to her high school sweetheart and a self published author.  Her days are filled with trying to make everyone else's lives better and her writing seems to fill that role for herself.  The only problem is her husband doesn't agree.  Tom thinks she loves it more than him and decides to take her to a sex club to rekindle their love life.  What he didn't bargain for was Eric, a man who is willing to support Kelly and her writing and will stop a nothing to have her.The erotic parts of this story were well written and well balanced by the drama scenes sprinkled throughout.  However, the main drama revolving around the family felt a bit forced and out of place at times.  I say this because the fulfilling nuggets of drama between Nicky (the daughter) and Kelly were so wonderfully written and I would have almost trades some of the crazy sex scenes for more family interactions, I just wanted more.The best aspect of this book, all the POV chapters.  Most were from Kelly, but some sections were from Tom, a few from Eric, and some were flashbacks reinforcing Tom/Kelly's relationship starting with day one.  These small glimmers into the minds of all of the main characters helped me as the reader not pre-judge but really get to know the characters and want to read further.Recommendation: Yes, read it.  I enjoyed it and was thrilled to be able to participate in its review process.
summary: Sexy, heart-wrenching and full of action!

reviewText: SUMMER'S BOOK BLOGLauren Blakely’s ‘Burn for Me’ is… excuse the pun… HOT! And is a must read for anyone who loves the wonderfulness that is Lauren Blakey.Jamie is a girl who likes the finer things of life, the girl things of life. She love poetry, dogs, her family and the idea of being a serious relationship with a man who not only likes everything she does but is committed to her, someone she could see having a future with. She doesn’t swear and she likes her sex neat and clean…or so she thought. After her sister goes through a rough divorce from a cheating husband Jamie puts up walls to guard herself from it ever happening to her. But what she doesn’t expect is for the one man she should want to be the only man she can think about.Smith Grayson is a volunteer fireman who just so happens to own his own construction company, be one of Jamie’s friends and be working on the bar that Jamie works at. He is everything every woman could ever want, which is dangerous and a no go for Jamie. If every woman could want him then why would he just want her?After asking Jamie to dance in the back of the bar during a kickoff party Jamie finds herself unable to turn Smith down. He is everything she doesn’t want in a relationship but she can’t help her mind from wondering. And one night with him should be enough… right?But his crudeness, his dirty talking, and his rough hands on her body is all she can find herself thinking about. However a serious relationship isn’t in the cards. Smith is a love em’ and leave em’ type. Not really caring too much for committed relationships he opts out at the first chance he can take.  So Afraid to ruin their friendship, Jamie comes up with the idea to have a one week no strings attached fling… that should get him out of her prestigious panties.Unless Smith has other ideas…This story was insanely amazing! I fell for Smith instantly. The story while being told in a third person narrative point of view does an amazing job at getting in both of their heads so you see what they go through, how they evolve, and exactly what they are thinking at all times. I loved it even though there were a few moments I wanted to scream at my kindle. This is a novella that feels like so much more! Having an amazing HEA this book leaves you feeling fulfilled and satisfied by the end.Lauren does an incredible job at introducing the characters and getting you to not only like the them but making you feel for them right from the start and oh my gosh can she write some HOT sex. Never to be one to disappoint Lauren is true to form with the way she can write it. This book will ignite your bodies and leaving you panting long after it’s done.

5 of 5 stars~ Review by CarolineFor original review see Prism Book AllianceWe first meet Jamie in Salvage and his character was not written to endear him to us. He was selfish and manipulative and wasn’t a great friend to Gabe. With his story in Recovery comes the clarity of what he has been through, what has set him off on his path of destruction and what eventually leads him to become a better person.His home life growing up has failed him completely and it is probably only thanks to Gabes father and family that he kept himself together as long as he did. There was the accident that altered the course of Gabes sisters life that was the beginning of his path of self destruction. His sense of failure in himself leads to drinking, not just the odd one, but enough that it becomes his crutch and his only way of making it through the day.Alcohol can change you in the most shocking way. In Jamie it leads to a recklessness that ends up with him being raped. Too scared and ashamed to admit what has happened to him he turns even more to the alcohol that makes his existence palpable. It’s a never ending spiral of destruction that can only stop when Jamie takes ownership.The Bailey family were his salvation in more ways than one. Alec, a recovering alcoholic, becomes a mentor to Jamie and his AA sponsor. His wife Belle becomes more of a mother to Jamie than his own ever was. He is shown love and compassion for perhaps the first time in his life. He also grows up a lot and realises, maybe without even knowing, that he doesn’t want to let his new family down. With that thought he can take each day as it comes.This is a complex story and it feels almost as though the romance is just in the background. He meets Daniel at a critical time. Daniel is divorced and much older but very quickly becomes a friend and someone that Jamie can rely and lean on. Jamie has a fear of relationships only ever bothering with one night stands so it is lucky that Daniel is calm and patient.Being an alcoholic is in no way easy for anyone. Add to that the pressure of someone you love and respect dying, a man who has been your mentor falling apart in front of your eyes, their son hating your very existence and an older man trying to make your life as easy as possible and it is only with great fortitude that Jamie manages to get out of bed in the morning. Every hour is fraught with the possibility that having a drink would make life much easier.  This is when you realise that Jamie is much stronger than he thinks he is. He finds an inner strength that has him coping and fulfilling Belles dying wishes and also falling in love.This book is very different from the first one. The writing is heartfelt, heart wrenching and leaves you wrung out. A lot of things happen that would make a lesser man cave but Jamie proves to himself and those who love him that he is strong and more than capable. Quiet and loving Daniel is a true rock for the younger man even if their romance has to take a back to seat to everything else going on. A great and very different addition to the Salvage Series.  Surely it will be Owens story next?

reviewerName: A Novel Idea by Chrissy T
reviewText: I received a complimentary copy of this book by the author in exchange for an honest review.Aly Martinez really brought it in Stolen Course. This is easily one of my favorite books of 2014. When we met Caleb in Changing Course, he goes through such unfathomable pain when he lost Manda. The circumstances surrounding her death are mysterious at best, and Caleb has been trying to solve the case of who was really driving the night Manda died. He's convinced it was her best friend, Sarah, and he's been trying to prove it for 5 long years.Caleb truly goes through all 7 stages of grief in this book. Especially when Sarah's sister comes into the picture. Emma turns Caleb's life upside down. She's related to the woman he's trying to ruin, yet their chemistry is undeniable. They can't stay away from each other, but Sarah will always remain between them.Emma is hilarious, kind, thoughtful, and all around a wonderful woman. She understands Caleb's grief, but she doesn't put up with his crap either. I did a mental fist pump every time Emma knocked Caleb on his as$ by never putting up with his bull. Emma definitely proved she isn't a weakling, but she doesn't let her pride get in the way either. I love a heroine who stands up for herself, but isn't domineering.It's hard for Caleb to move on when he thought he would never fall for another woman again. Emma's compassion and understanding for everything Caleb has gone through astounded me. Caleb is a sexy alpha male, but not in a macho way. He is the perfect blend of protector, lover, and friend. He loves with everything he has, but he can't let go of the past-at least not yet. Emma and Caleb agree to keep Sarah separate from their relationship, but Emma's heart is being pulled in opposite directions. Both of them go through a heartbreaking journey in their own way.Stolen Course can be read as a standalone, but to fully understand the circumstances behind Manda's death, I highly recommend reading Changing Course first. Brett and Jesse's story is just as emotionally charged as Caleb and Emma's. A life was stolen, but it created a fresh beginning.
summary: A life was stolen, but it created a fresh beginning.

This book Minimalist Applied to your House is a neat quick read. So much information but it is laid out well. Almost all of us, if we have a home or apartment have clutter. And for some reason it just keeps piling up. This is especially true for me being in a military family. I believe we are the king and queens of clutter. We move so often that you almost have two, three, or sometimes even four of the same thing because it can be months before your boxes arrive so you buy things you need to get by. This book was very helpful in showing how you can decided what to keep and what to throw away or even give away to someone else who may need it more. Overall, keep the important things and discard what you have many of or no longer need. Happy cleaning!

The blurb caught my attention right away and I was hooked!  SL Jennings is a great writer and she did not disappoint on this book.  We get a fun, no holds barred sex education from the privacy of the Oasis in Arizona told in Justice Drake's POV.  Male POVs are few and far between in this genre coming from women writers, but I really enjoyed it!"My business is sex. I instruct sex. I live and breathe sex. And I need it, just like their duplicitous husbands."And that right there is our premise.  Rich wives sent away to the Oasis to perfect their sex skills to win back their husbands.  But we know there's got to be love, twists and turns - and there is.  Maybe not totally realistic, but who's to say?  How many of us live those lives?  Regardless, I enjoyed the book and liked Ally and Justice's journey and growth to love, honesty and seeing what is right in front of you.  ("because you're my lobster").  Two Not perfect people that enjoy the lighter things in life.I would recommend this as a fun, easy beach read that has some sexy times and plenty of laughs and Friends included.  :)"Every kiss is a goodbye. Especially the ones that kill you."

reviewerName: Megan Bedroom Bookworms "Megan from Bedroom B...
reviewText: There has been so much chatter online about Taint from S.L. Jennings and I have to say they were right, this book is awesome!Taint is written in Justice Drake’s point of view. You read that right MALE POINT OF VIEW! I loved his inner monologues and all the lies that he told himself throughout this book. Being inside Justice’s head made this book hilarious.This doesn’t mean that I loved Justice at all times though. He does something in the beginning of this book that I was so mad and sad about. I like when the hero falls on his ass chasing the girl. The hero shouldn’t even be able to think about another woman he’s so wrapped up in our heroine. In the end Justice did make me fall in love with him. He had a nice mushy side once he was willing to accept his feelings.Plus honestly, did you see that cover? Scroll up and go look. Do you see that smirk? Hot, isn’t it? Yeah, I know. I was picturing that slight smirk while reading, it helped me get over his dumb moves earlier in the book.  I want to print that cover image off, pin it to my cork board above my computer and just stare at it all day. Heck I need a signed copy in paperback just so I can set it on my nightstandOur heroine Allison was ok. I don’t have many notes on her, which is actually a good thing. It means she didn’t spend half the story ticking me off like so many other heroines out there. Allison is in a tough position, but I thought she handled it with grace and to the best of her ability.There is a big twist in Taint, that I am not going to talk about, but I’ll just say it did not see that coming at all. It comes out of left field, but I loved it. It adds just that little bit of drama to the story to really make things sizzle.  Plus the lobster stuff.. swoon. Really you just have to read the book to know what I’m talking about and it’s worth it to find out, trust me.Okay, let’s talk the sex. That’s the important part right? First let me say for you tug scene lovers out there, we get two from Justice. Overall the sex was pretty hot, but I had a problem with some of the initial scenes. You see, I get protective of my heroes and I only want them with “the girl”. I don’t want to read about them and another girl whether it be present or past tense. I don’t want to know about past conquest, especially not in any kind of detail.  It takes a while before we get any hot scenes between our two main characters. Once they do, it’s worth it because the two of them together is HOT. I just wish we could have had those scenes earlier in the story.Ultimately, that is what kept this book from a full five star rating for me. It takes SOOOOO long for the couple to get together. Taint has a very original storyline which drew me in but after a while I felt like it was dragging on because I just wanted them to finally hook the freak up.I wish there had been an epilogue so we could really see Justice and Allison as an official couple, more than we were able to in what was provided. But who knows, maybe we’ll get a book two.

reviewText: Ok like most individuals I was drawn in by the sexy man on the cover and the blurb absolutely blew me away. I could barely contain my excitement when I got started with this one.v. tainted, taint . ing, taints1. To corrupt morally.2. to sully or tarnish ( a person’s name, reputation, etc.)n1. a defect or flaw2. an infecting, touch, influence, or tingeSo I will admit that I thought that Ms. Jennings was going to take me on a completely different path when embarking on this journey with Taint. While that may have been the case I sooo much enjoyed the ride.Justin Drake has a true talent when it comes to teaching and what makes it so much better is the fact that he has absolutely zero shame or filtered. While some may have clutched their pearls by his tactics a great deal of things he said were sadly true.“There’s ONE THING that a man wants you to stroke more than his c**k: his ego.Like myself this group of housewives who’s married to some powerful D-bags did not know what they were in store for. Six weeks of learning how to keep the man that they manage to land in the first place. While Justin had done this plenty how times this round would be completely different than the rest. All because of Allison Carr and that fiery mouth she has.Allison is so different from the other wives which is her main draw. She doesn’t restricted what she says or eat. Most of all she can take it just as well as she can give it.Taint is told entirely from Justin’s POV, which is a little different since most of the books I’ve read thus far have been either dual or from the heroine's POV. I was still excited from beginning to end.I’m honestly not sure what I enjoyed more the angst, the sexy scenes, the fact that not only did I get a HEA, but I did not have to settle for a d*mn cliffhanger. So Ms. Jennings thank you ….thank you very much

Clint is coming home after a deployment, with no ride and nowhere to go because his girlfriend dumped him over text message . . . luckily the flight attendant, Della, sees him lingering uncertainly by the curb and offers to give him not only a ride, but also a place to stay for awhile . . . it almost seems too good to be true . . . good thing he doesn't know that he is the compensation needed to get her sister out of captivity. Della's internal debate over whether to turn Clint over not, was great, and his intuitive abilities didn't help things on her end any. I really liked this story, I just thought Della got off incredibly easy in the end . . . Clint is the most selfless and understanding person in the world (almost beyond belief), but I loved that about him and that's also kind of what made the story really good. Good Read!
