4 3/4 stars, After reading Damaged and the Beast(which is calling for a re-read) I fell in love with Bijou Hunter and the characters of Ellsberg, and it's no secret that after I read Damaged and the Beast I hated Bailey. I wanted her to die a slow and painful death after she was humiliated through Ellsberg (yes I know I can hold a grudge in books) I honestly never though Ms. Hunter could make me not want Bailey gone I never dreamed in a million years that Bijou would make me like and dare I say love Bailey. and want to read a book about her *gasp* But Ms. Hunter started to prove me oh so wrong and do he impossible, Bijou Hunter did the unthinkable and made me like Bailey and then love Bailey and look forward to her in the books and then she made me ecstatic for Bailey's book and now I am all on the Bailey fawn bus.Nick was always a no brainer for me he was sweet and then the more I got to know him through books the more I saw there was a lot we weren't seeing and when I heard he was Baileys hero I was on pins and needles to see how their story would play out. Bailey has had a good life more than a good life, everything Bailey wanted she got including a great family, With the help of friends and her brothers significant others Bailey has worked hard at becoming a better person who she likes and through this process Bailey has gained friendships that she never dreamed she would have. The only thing missing in Bailey's life is Nick.Bailey was devastated when she realized Nick was into Farah so Bailey did what she does best and acted out, and even though Bailey has went through a lot of changes wanting Nick for her own will never change. Frustrated that Nick never seems to notice her Bailey makes herself known and loudly. Nick grew up completely different than Bailey so when he could leave Nick never looked back. Now fighting in the Thunderdome Nick is finally able to afford college and things he never had growing up but what wants most of all is Bailey. Even though Nick knew Bailey was too good for him Bailey has always been it for him so when Bailey puts herself out there and makes it obvious that she wants him Nick finally makes his move.As Nick and Bailey start a relationship it isn't easy for Nick, the things done to him as a child have made having a relationship hard but Bailey is more stubborn than his past and she isn't willing to give him up no matter what. As Bailey and Nick begin to fall in love the past comes back in different forms to try and separate the two. Now Nick and Bailey will have to decide if they will fight for the one thing they each always wanted.I loved this book it was such and easy read, I picked this book up and I was instantly taken back to Ellsberg. Bailey is once again hilarious in this book I literally laughed on the first page and continued laughing through out this book. I also loved seeing Bailey's growth in this book she isn't just a shallow rich girl she loves Nick and her family and friends and she loves them all deeply. Like I said earlier Nick was easy for me I loved him from the beginning and knew I would just fall more in love when I read his book but Nick wasn't just easy he suffered a lot growing up and that shaped him and made him who he was. There is so much to Nick that we get to see in this book and my heart broke for him and all that he went through but we also( and maybe the best part) get to see Nick push past his upbringing so that he could be the man Bailey deserved and the man he deserved.We get to see all the great characters from the past books and we get great follow ups on them all as well. I must say that the epilogues were fantastic in this book, they weren't super long but they were written so well that I never felt like we were missing anything they were the perfect ending to a great book and even better love story . I cried while reading them and it just made me even more sad to have to finish this book. Bijou Hunter is a great author who can not only make me cry but make me laugh, and fall in love, and also make me feel like the charters she has created are real people that I know and love.This is one of those series that never can quite leave your thoughts. Though I read A LOT this is one of those series that I find myself either thinking about or check on to see when the next book comes out( fine some might call it stalking) or even wanting to re-read. Now I just have to wait for more from this series (oh the struggles I have to endure). I can't wait for the rest of this series. We get a great peak at the next characters and it just made me that much more excited for the next book.**Thank you Bijou Hunter for this book to review**

I am aware that coconut has many uses. But I honestly didn't know that it can be an instrument in losing weight! This book is an interesting read, indeed. This includes simple moves that can be included in anyone's routine to help jump-start weight loss.Another bonus is how the author wrote the book; it is simple yet, precise and straight forward.Highly recommended for everyone who already wants to give up on their diet and those who are planning and start losing weight.

What a great book I really did not want it to end. I can hardly wait for your next book. You are such a good writer and you keep the story doing and interesting, like not wanting to put the book down to go go bed!

Cats can be trained at any age. Cats like to be treated as if they’re your kid and you’re the mom or dad. Cats are very smart animals and can be easy to train. Following all the steps in this book can help you train your cat. I have seen people train their cats to walk on a leash. In the town I live in if you have an outside cat your cash has to be walked on a leash. Cats can be loving animals, I had a cat that thought she was a human. I would rather have an inside cat than a dog. Cats can be loyal and can protect you. Cats have a habit of scratching things and jumping on counters but this book helps you fix that problem. If you have or have ever thought about getting a cat this is a must read. I love cats but they can be hard to train and you have to take time to train them. If you want a cat make sure you have the time and all the steps in this book will help you have a great cat.

Grow Delicious Vegetables In Your Backyard is a fabulous book for any one who wants to start their own garden. I have been wanting to start my garden for a couple years and just haven't managed to get it done. I worked in a greenhouse for years so I already have a good handle on what needs to be done. That being said this book gave me some great ideas that I hadn't thought of. Plus I've always wanted to can my veggies and I've never known how and with these step by step instructions I will be able to can my left over vegetables and fruits.

Debra Johnson has restored my faith in gardening. I tried once and had disastrous results, but Ms. Johnson’s book offers some great tips that I can use to protect my plants from pests, to prevent over-watering and under-watering, and decide what types of plants are best to start with. The most useful information Ms. Johnson shares is determining the fertility of your soil by conducting a simple experiment to analyze the soil contents in the area you designated for your garden. This information increases the chances for having a garden where you have fruits and vegetables healthy and suitable for picking. I was also pleased that she includes several references that will provide additional information on all of the topics she covered. Most of all, I love how Ms. Johnson told her story through the memory of her grandmother showing us her love, enthusiasm, and dedication to farming through these special memories. Purchase this book and get your garden started today! This book is an excellent resource!

This was a good book. I enjoyed the story and the sex scenes were incredibly hot. There was great chemistry between Connor and Charlize. I loved Connor! He's very Alpha male protective, which I guess is what makes him such a good bodyguard. I liked Charlize but I didn't love her, she came across as pretty insecure and while she grew stronger through the story I just couldn't connect with her well. I understand she was surrounded by pretty deep misogyny but her ability to leap to conclusions was just too much for me. He owns a house in the suburbs so he will want me to quit my job and stay home baking, barefoot and pregnant….really?! That's ok though, like I said I loved Connor and he saved the book for me. There were a few nit picky things that bothered me too. The story is supposed to take place in Seattle but it's really nothing like Seattle (I would know I live in the area) and I noticed some of the language used would be more appropriate to a story set in Australia (as I noticed the author is an Aussie). We don't say “put the kettle on” to express what Charlize was trying to say we would either say “he can't even boil water” or “he can't even work the coffee maker”. None of this kept me from enjoying the story though. This was a solid first effort and I will likely read future works from this author. I received an ARC from the publisher through Net Galley in exchange for an honest review.
summary: A solid debut with room to grow.

reviewText: For Her Protection is exciting, sexy, and full of mystery. I read the entire book in one day and I wanted more. Amber A Bardan wrote a captivating story and added the perfect amount of steaminess to it. I was completely surprised by the twists in the book.The characters are amazing. Charlize is strong and independent. She doesn't need help and she is bent on proving she can rule in what she perceives as a man's world. Connor is sexy and protective. He knows exactly how strong and stubborn Charlize is. I absolutely loved reading about them trying to overcome their differences. It made for a rocky and more realistic romance.I think that any readers who enjoy a good mystery with some sexy romance will enjoy this book. It is definitely for the 18+ crowd. It is an awesome read and I can't wait to check out other books by Amber A Bardan.

4.5 out of 5 starsFrom their first encounter Charlize new there was something different about Connor.  When Connor stepped in to protect Charlize from the twins at the gym, he had no idea the affect this one action was going to have on his life.  Charlize was mad, she thought Connor seemed too good to be true and he went and proved her right when he went all Neanderthal on her.‘Too bad he’s turned out to be a complete goddam caveman.  Had he actually slung her over his shoulder and hauled her ass into his cave?  What was that they said about men who looked too good to be true?  Yeah well, this one had a flaw she wouldn’t ever overlook.  No man treated her as if she were some prehistoric prize.’Charlize was a proud, independent woman trying to make it in a man’s world.  She is currently trying to keep her father’s business going while not having to cut jobs.  In the process she finds herself in danger due to the picketers and employees who don’t want her in her position.  For this reason Connor is further enmeshed in her life.Connor is a former detective, and now runs his own security firm.  His most recent assignment is to help increase the security for Charlize and her company.  He makes it his personal mission to be Charlize’s bodyguard 24/7.  This is where lines get a little blurred.The connection between Charlize and Connor is immediately seen with their first interaction.  He is all Alpha male and plans to protect Charlize no matter what.  The problem with that is Charlize can be a stubborn, independent, difficult women and she has to put up a fight the entire way.This book has mystery, intrigue, sexy alpha male, HOT sex, relationships, and love.  I enjoyed reading this book, the characters are great.  You really get a feel for them by the way the author is able to paint a very clear picture of them, whether it is the dirtball slime or the alpha male security guard.  This book has a twist in it that I didn’t see it coming until it happened, it was a surprise and it made the entire story even better if you can imagine that.  Thank you Amber A Bardan for a book that not only intrigued me but kept my attention until the very end!!!!
summary: I want my own Connor to serve and protect me!!!!!

reviewText: Shelf Life is a suspenseful post-apocalyptic short.  Each and every story S.L. Dearing creates is a master piece in its self.In this short, Shannon has been underground for three weeks and has yet to have contact with another human being.  Shannon and her dog Max venture out in to the unknown.  Not only is there devastation all around, but she finally gets that human contact she has been longing for.  His name is Josh and together they will discover how to not ONLY depend on one another, but learn there are feelings there that can't not be denied.Will these two survive the obstacles in their way?I am really hoping S.L. Dearing expands on this short.  She never ceases to amaze me with her creativity and divine capabilities to tell a great story.

As long as I had my dog I could deal with all that is happening around me. Great relationship between Shan and her dog Max. I would love to see this become a novel or series. I enjoyed it but would like to know what happens next for the characters,or even what lead them to that point in time.

I have bought other books by Ankit Pandey in the past and have loved them all. However this time, he has got together with Dan and truly hit it out of the park once again. This book is a treasure. There are more than 35 recipes and amazing ones at that. I'm really excited to try them All. The instructions are easy and I feel like I'm being instructed by a friend. This makes for an enjoyable read and epic cookbook with a wonderfully selected range of recipes. I'd highly recommend this book to every person I know!

This was a good book, the fact that it's plausible adding to its appeal. Obviously there are a few questionable moments, realistically, but again they add to the enjoyability (pretty sure that's not a real word, but whatever. Creative license.) Of "The Doomsday Infection".

I was very surprised to find a book written for people with "baggage".  Baggage being ex husbands, ex wives, ex in-laws, and yes, even our precious children.  We don't have to become crazy cat ladies!  I love my cat but a man in your life is a wonderful thing at any age.  A very good read to give hope,practical advice and insightful tools for finding love in later life, or at any age.

I haven’t read the first two books, but it wasn’t needed to read the book. It was completely stand-alone even though there were others I didn’t know a lot about. Michelle Mankin is going on my auto read list after this read.  The characters were so real they make you feel every emotion as they play out.The writing had depth that brought dimension to the book.  You will laugh, cry, scream, and punch your pillow among other things.  Some of the situations are so *real* I had tears making it hard to continue reading.I was gifted this book in exchange for an honest review.
summary: add to Michelle to your auto buy list!

reviewText: What girl didn't dream of living in the rock n' roll world? Especially with the bad boy lead singer of the band? Count me in as one of those girls with the posters hanging all over my room! This book let me live those dreams without leaving my world as a Momma here in Iowa. Michelle created some amazing characters that sucked me into their world. Love, sadness, despair, hate, triumph....real life emotions in this fairy tale world. My only question after reading all of the Tempest books is which rock god do I want for my own? War was able to make a name for himself in this one......
readers follow characters in a very believable quest forenlightenment in the aftermath of disaster.author has a feel for the story and his intrigue is developed well.

I received a review copy of this book thru LibraryThing Members giveawayGideon, The leader of a religious sect, using the book of Revelations has prophesised Judgement Day, the time and day the world as we know it will come to an end. And by paying hackers around the world to attack the internet at the same time to cause the maximum disruption for days, possibly even weeks or months, during the disruption his militia will attempt an armed attack on Washington and the White House.It doesn't matter if they are successful or not he will gain millions of new members for his sect because his prophecy came true.Detective Gregory Hyde and retired History Professor Kam O'Brien and his wife tamara set out to thwart Gideon's plans.I really could not get into this book, the plot is rather hackneyed, and I didn't feel any empathy for any of the characters..
Clear, concise and a book that is very easy to implement at any level of sports. Highly recommended to any one in the field.

I received the book as an ARC for an honest review. I have loved Christina's books from Annihilate Me and will always read anything she writes. Unleash Me 2 had my heart racing and mouth open with the wrist and turns..Kevin ..Boss..Boss..Kevin...who who who was behind it. Unleash Me 3 had me like Wow..where did that come from?? I wish there was more on the Kevin and Boss storyline and a little more on the cult thing, like Boss somehow involved or Kevin following threw with the blackmail. All in all ...a page turner!!Getting ready for Annihilate Me 2!!!

This book has the ability to change the success you have with Facebook Marketing if you use what you learn. The authors have taken their time to create an in-depth guide to Facebook and I think it is a must read by anyone considering or even currently doing marketing on this social media platform. Don't miss out on your chance to really master this.

reviewText: I have to admit I was not really enthused about this book because I read the 50 shades trilogy and really enjoyed it. This was such a surprisingly good read! I can really appreciate the way the author put her spin and twists on the story. Keisha was much more relateable to me. I could hear myself saying some the things she said, the way she said them. It was refreshingly entertaining and I am so looking forward to the next book(s)in the quadrilogy.The second book was everything I thought it would be and more. I just can not get enough of Tristan and Keisha. I love the journey they went on only to discover they can not live without each other.L.V. is an excellent writer and I highly recommend all of her work. I am anxious to read Nate and Jada's story but I really want Tristan and Keisha's story to continue.

I was always wanted a started for meditation.But didn’t find it. This book is a very ideal starter .I liked each chapters of this book specially finding happiness,conquering stress.Mindfulness meditation could manage anxiety, i didn’t even know that.This book really helps to reduce anxiety, increase will power and strengthen the mind.Very useful book.I recommend this book for all ages.
summary: A great book for mindfulness meditation.

reviewText: Another great book by Sigal Adler that takes on the tough subject of adding a new family member. Of course this is a scary time for siblings and Sigal has handled the problem with this charming book. Sigal has a way to always make kids feel better with her happy rhymes and beautiful pictures. Thanks for this great book kids will love and parents will be glad to use to help with explaining about new babies to their siblings. Great job!

Review for Ramblings From This Chick. ramblingsfromthischick.blogspot.comHiring the Player is the second story in the Campus Players series by Allie K. Adams. This is another short read and is only about 170 pages long. This New Adult read starts when Kayla is dumped by her boyfriend just a few weeks before her college graduation. Suddenly alone with all her plans shattered, Kayla turns to her sexy neighbor Jake when she comes across him in a bar one night. They had previously hooked up, and it took her months to get over him the first time. She decides to have fun with him for the night. But when her apartment gets set on fire, she and Jake are left with the only option of becoming roommates in another apartment building. Kayla's friends make an agreement with Jake that they will cover part of his portion of the rent if he will help give Kayla some fun. But soon their passion and feelings are more than just him helping to loosen her up a bit. Can they turn the fun and sex into a real relationship?I liked Jake. He was sexy and sweet, and I loved that he was a firefighter. He was so particular when it came to everything being done correctly and about fire hazards, it was pretty cute. I liked that he was always open and honest about his feelings with Kayla. He was fun and brought out a whole different side to her. I liked them together a lot. Kayla was a bit uptight and she was scared to let anyone in. Even when Jake was being open with her and telling her how he felt, she would pick a fight or try to run. But I thought that they had a lot of chemistry together and were really hot. I liked seeing them figure things out between them and start a relationship together.Overall, this was a short and fun read. Even though the characters had known each other for awhile, they weren't close and I felt like their relationship was rushed. It was a bit too insta-love to me considering Jake's transformation from player to serious boyfriend happened so quickly. I just felt like I had missed a huge portion of his transformation, and it didn't make sense that he would change so quickly even with his developing feelings for Kayla. I thought that there should have been more time from the start of things to the point where he is telling her he loves her. It was surprising to me to see him be the one admitting his feelings and wanting a commitment though. Usually it is the girl and the guy fights it, so that was interesting to see. I would recommend this story if you are looking for something quick and sexy that is fun and enjoyable. If you are looking for a deep connection though, I am not sure this one is for you. I did like the characters though, and will look for more from Allie K. Adams in the future.**Complimentary Copy Provided by Tasty Book Tours**
summary: Short and Fun read. This one had some sexy scenes and some cute scenes.

reviewText: Highly entertaining with a little something for everyone, I found that I particularly enjoyed Wicked Witches of the West, Montana Blue and Texas Devil, though I liked the other two as well. While the stories were a bit on the short side, as I would have liked to have see more development in some of the characters, I didn't mind so much as there were five of them. My only challenge with this mini volume was the editing..I found it was a bit under edited which might compromise the integrity of the writing in the eyes of some. However, I look forward to a volume II more expertly edited!
Ronie's  books never disappoint.  She is by far my favorite author.  Counting down the days for the next installment.  Love it.

Fast-paced, action-packed start to what I have a feeling will be an amazing series!  Ronie Kendig steps into her usual rapid-fire fiction role--with women as the special ops team this time.  I am so excited to read the rest of the series...if you like action, suspense & a little romance--this book hit it all.  Way to go, Ronie!!!  You deliver an action-packed punch beginning with Overkill...
summary: Action-packed kick-start to a great new series...

reviewText: Operation Zulu Redemption: Overkill - The Beginning by Ronie Kendig is the introduction to her new serialization. If you're not familiar with serialization, it's when books are released in episodes. The next episodes in this series will be released on July 18 - Operation Zulu Redemption: Collateral Damage Part 1, on July 25 - Operation Zulu Redemption: Out of Nowhere Part 2, on August 1 - Operation Zulu Redemption: Hazardous Duty Part 3, and on August 8 - Operation Zulu Redemption: Act of Treason Part 4. By the time you are finished with this serialization, you will have read the equivalent of 2 full length novels. Why not wait until it's released in its entirety? Well, if you want more great serializations from Ronie, you need to support this venture by purchasing the episodes as they are released.I admit that I am not a fan of serializations as I HATE waiting for the next episode. Ronie's serialization makes the wait all the harder because she is such an excellent writer and has a knack for leaving you wanting more. This introduction to the series hits the ground running and never stops. You will not want to put it down, and you'll be begging for the next episode as soon as you finish it.
summary: Begin the Tour of Duty Today

reviewText: This is a very good book. Sometimes I thought he should get another girlfriend.  It was most interesting in the last couple chapters.
Very good read

This was a really sexy and unputdownable read. I enjoyed it from beginning to end. Trudy and Rick are so believable and easy to like that I found myself a little depressed when I finished! Warning- Have a box of tissues handy when you read this it is a bit of an emotional see-saw but in a very good way.

I’m a sucker for romance, and this is one of the better options I’ve seen on kindle. The book is quite different than your traditional romp, as it has a bit more emotion than others. It deals with separation anxiety, long distances, and a love that connects despite everything. I related to Trudy and Rick in a way, and found the narrative to truly be a cool story.Even if you’re not a fan of romance, you’ll find that this book has some deeper layers. It’s a solid outing, one that I recommend.
summary: A Love Story Worth Reading Twice

reviewText: This is a great book if you're looking for instructions for the more complicated approaches to soap making. It's certainly not a "heat up what you have and add some other ingredients" kind of book. If you do want to do that, the list of "other ingredients" and their benefits in this book will be helpful to you.
summary: Great little book for complicated approach

reviewText: The Wild Side begins when Alasdair Masters meets young Iris at the gym he goes to. He's been seeing her there for a while now but never spoken to her before, until one day she comes up to him out of the blue to talk to him. Alasdair is recently turned forty and just divorced a year ago after twenty years being married. He isn't exactly sure what to do with himself, or his life now. And when he meets Iris he immediately thinks she is way too young for him, but he can't but be attracted to her. And Iris is a bit of mystery not only to Alasdair but to the reader as well... And now we just have to wait and see how Alasdair will handle his young Iris..This was a very short story that seemed to end rather abruptly. It had a whole lot of physical substance in the book but very little emotional aspects. However, I find myself oddly intrigued to figure out what is going to happen in the next book. I think a lot of it has to do with the fact that we know pretty much nothing about Iris, and I want to know more. I hate how I can't seem to figure her out, and apparently neither can the hero of the story. But I will be reading the next one once it comes out to figure out what is going on.More reviews at Shooting Stars Reviews, [...]

There are a lot of books on how to build your confidence out there and having read a few I thought this simply had something others don't. The section on how to carry your body and tips on how to encourage a good stature is advise you just don't seem to see elsewhere - and it's good advise. He also give a good explanation of "fake it till you make it" that makes sense and is workable for most anyone. Good solid confidence book for anyone needing a boost in self confidence. (and who doesn't?)

The first book is an incomplete book- you have been warned. I was saddened by that because it was the one I enjoyed most. It's set in a modern western time and promised to be a real page turner. The other two are set at a time where Red Indians were frowned upon. They were okay reads, straight to the point with no definite conclusions with not much to attach the reader or endearing.

I've been anticipating this third book in Draven St. James's series, 'Firehouse Six', primarily because I adored Simon from the moment he first appeared. He never shuts up, he has a heart of gold, and he's had a major crush on Michael since they first met. In Simon's interview, no less, where Simon was imagining all kinds of wicked things he'd like to do to and with the hot, older lieutenant. Needless to say, I was pretty sure 'Fused By Fire' was going to be a hot, sweaty, sexy, steamy, and good read. I wasn't wrong. Since I've already expressed my sincere appreciation for first responder jobs, and firemen in particular, I don't need to say much more than "dayum".Simon thought that by transferring from the firehouse to an EMT unit, his crush on Michael would fade away. No such luck. What's that saying about distance and the heart? Michael, on the other hand, feels like a lecherous old man for even thinking of Simon in that manner. Michael is sixteen years older and, in his mind, that's way too big of an age gap. For all that Simon is an out gay man, he's got very little actual experience and since his parents disowned him a month ago for coming out, Simon is feeling very lost and lonely these days.When one of his firefighters gets seriously injured at a fire, Michael blames himself, even though he pulled the guy out and saved his life. Michael takes a leave of absence to figure out how he can continue to command and Simon storming the castle walls of Michael's stubbornness throws them both into a conflagration of lust. And, yeah…it's good, really, really good! But, what next?This was a wonderful addition to the series, and, in fact, Simon and Michael might just be my favorite couple so far. Their romance was wonderful and I really enjoyed reading it. Thank you, Draven.NOTE: This book was provided by Loose Id for the purpose of a review on Rainbow Book Reviews

~I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads Review Team~Madeline Pryce has such a way with words. You feel like you are actually in the book living everything as it happens. You smell the rotting flesh, you feel the blood, and feel the ice forming around you. You feel EVERTYHING!!! This was my first book about Necromancers and zombies and not normally something I would read but I fell in love with Madeline Pryce after reading Dark Cravings so I will read anything by her. I love her! This book has so much detail and I could imagine everything as I was reading it. The book would actually make a great T.V. series I think. Bastian was hot from the start and the chemistry between him and Morgan was so strong and amazing. The sex between the two was so steamy and off the charts I needed a cold shower! I read this book in one day, I didn’t want it to end and actually put it down a few times to draw it out so it would last longer! I love the relationship between Bastian and his brothers Nolan and Rory you could feel their bond and their love for one another. I hope we get to hear Rory’s story next, I just loved him. I will forever think of this book every time I smell cinnamon from now on!Characters:  the characters were so well written, you could feel their pain and feel their love while they were experiencing it.Sex:  off the charts HOT!Religious: noWould I recommend to others: yesMore than one book in the series: yes, I believe this is the first in a new seriesGenre: Paranormal/RomanceWould I read more by this author: yes~Wicked Reads Review Team~

Crimson Sins is a deliciously dark and decadent erotic paranormal read - utterly compelling and original. It introduces us to a world of magic, necromancers, zombies, ghosts, and more and contains a heady and combustible mix of smokin’ hot romance and scenes of horror. It is without doubt one of my top reads of 2014.I ADORED the hero Bastian, a tortured alpha hottie who is immediately drawn to Morgan, the heroine. He wants to protect her, not only from his father Ronan, but also from himself as he believes that he is not worthy of a woman’s love. Morgan’s own life has not been easy as she has struggled to cope with her ability to see spirits and has been grossly misunderstood. She is shocked to realise that she is a powerful necromancer and despite her independence welcomes Bastian’s help in protecting her from his father, who desires her for his own evil ends. I LOVED how Morgan’s powers grew throughout the novel and how the couple united in battling Ronan.Ronan is a formidable adversary and will stop at nothing to achieve his ends, including his evil sorcerer’s magic. Can Bastian open his heart to trust a female necromancer whose own magic could enslave him just as his father’s had?The lovemaking scenes between Bastian and Morgan are sublime – graphic, scorching hot and emotionally intense and left me in no doubt that the couple are destined to be together. These scenes contrast with the bloody and visceral scenes of horror and violence which illustrate the evil that is Ronan, Bastian’s father.The enduring bond between the three brothers, Bastian, Rory and Nathan, who had shared so much pain and abuse in the past was also a feature of the read which I enjoyed.  Although this book focuses on Bastian we are afforded an insight into what makes his equally tortured and hot siblings tick and I seriously hope that Madeline Pryce will be penning their own books soon!The pacing of the book and the balance between the scenes of magic and action and horror with the romance and lovemaking scenes were perfect. If you like erotic paranormal romances, with strong references to horror you will love this book too. Go forth and buy Cimson Sins now! You will not be disappointed! A copy of this book was given to me by the author for the purpose of a fair and honest review
ABSOLUTELY LOVED this book.....I can't wait for part two, I fell in love with Knight.....I hope Eric's crazy butt suffers....

Being Frank is a unique take on the business book - Bryan uses Frank, his mentor, as a way to guide the readers through business lessons. A similar style to that employed by Guy Kawasaki and Ken Blanchard, Frank's anecdotes do the unthinkable by actually adding valuable new lessons to the wealth of business texts out there.The lessons herein aren't lofty and erudite,  but rather practical, no-nonsense things that just make sense to employ. The book punctuates experiences with Frank with leadership lessons like "as a leader, you set the pace of the organization" and "you don't have to have all the answers". This is real advice that's really useful to anyone in a leadership position.
summary: A unique take on the business book

reviewText: Sa'id, did you feel that? It was my jaw hitting the floor!!! I didn't put this down from the time I started!!!! I'm not surprised tho ALL your books are excellent!!!!

It takes so much to understand someone with a bipolar disorder, that's why it is very important that we take the initiative to learn how we can help them and understand them better. This book contains all the necessary information about bipolar disorder, its cause, symptoms and remedies. You will surely become a great help to someone in improving their condition and in dealing with it when there's an attack.

Falling Hard:I liked this story but felt like it took awhile to get to the good stuff. By good stuff I mean the interaction between Lizzy and Mannis and the action between Lizzy and Theo. I guess that was geared toward showing the vast difference between the two men and the decision, if any, she would have to make. It just took so long to get to that point. I think that it could have happened sooner in the book. The heat in this book was worth the wait. I like that Lizzy had realized her greatest strength lie in her ability to being submissive. I would recommend this book but would also suggest to pack your patience; know that it is worth the wait.Playing Rough:This is the second episode in the Billionaires in Disguise series by Blair Bablyon.  In this episode Lizzy begins her BDSM relationship with Mannix Bonfils.  This is Lizzy’s first BDSM relationship.  After her failed attempt at a relationship with Theo Valencia, Mannix’s half-brother, you really wanted to see Lizzy happy.  You quickly see her going down the wrong road fast.  She thinks that Mannix can give her all she needs. Strength and love, the things she was lacking all her life.  At first you think Mannix will provide all those things but you soon see how manipulative he becomes.  The person who seems like the hero becomes the villain.I could not put this book down. I needed to see what happened next.  Would Theo, who is aware of all Mannix ways and who you can see cares about Lizzy, step in and play the white knight? Would Lizzy finally wake up and know that this type of relationship is not for her? I had to know.  Unfortunately, not all questions were answered but enough to give you hope. Especially when Mannix puts Lizzy in Theo’s care for a week while he goes out of town.I look forward to reading the next episode.  I want to see Lizzy get her happily ever after.

I received this book in an ARC set entitled "Made For Sin" in exchange for an honest review.  This is the first book I have read by Catherine Vale and it most certainly won't be my last!  I loved Gunner and Claire's story!  This is one of the best shifter romances I have read.  Passionate and yet tender, all while escaping danger!  I loved every second and had a hard time putting it down!  I can't wait for the second book in this series to be release in June 2014!  5 Stars!!

I am loving this book! One of my favorite things is that even though this is a series for one story, the author doesn't cheat you. Most of the time authors wrote one chapter at time and charge you high for each one. Catherine Vale gives you a substantial amount for a good price.Then there is the fact that they is a great story! I didn't see the twist that came. I will keep looking for the second book! Keep up the great work Catherine Vale!

This is a short concise book full of information and practical tips on how to balance everyday life without giving in to too much stress. Work, relationships, and family life can be very stressful and sometimes all we need is to sit back and take a breather. This book discusses to prioritize what really is imporatnt and not allowing oneself to be consumed in the business of life.
can't wait for the next book

This book talks about the disturbing truth about pet food manufacturers. Being an owner of several dogs (and 14 cats--who we used to feed puppy food because it's much cheaper than cat food) I found it appalling what manufacturers put in the pet food. Pet food can be convenient, especially if you have a lot of pets in your care since you won't have time to prepare food for them all. But after reading this book, it's not worth it.  have seen first hand the side effects of eating pet food as the pets grow older.As I read the book, I found it unethical how the pet food companies keep what they're doing secret--it's all about money, and even the Vet's can't stand up against it because that's where their research money comes from. To give you an idea what you're feeding your pets, and what's the difference and why it's such a big deal, the difference is that much of pet food is from animals who died of disease or it's meat that's already spoiled (as opposed to animals who were only recently slaughtered). That means the meat still contains the disease. it's food that's unfit for human consumption--i.e. livestock that died due to disease, you would normally not feed this to humans because it's dirty, so rather than the farmers losing income they can kind of recycle that and at least make some money out of it. It also includes euthanized cats and dogs from animal shelters and vet offices, road kill, and wastes from slaughterhouses, dead animals from farmers. That's why cat food is much cheaper.  But the good news is, you can feed your pets without spending so much. The author provides 40 recipes you can use to feed your pets.If you love your pets, you may want to read this book, it's explained in a simple and easy to understand manner and you can finish it in one sitting.
summary: No More Pet Food! Your Dog Deserves Better!

reviewText: I give this 4 stars for the characters and the premise of the story. From the blurb, we learn that Tyla was one of the biggest pop stars until fame brought her crashing down. Now, she’s trying to quietly forge a new life for herself. She wants credibility and authenticity, not the celebrity meat-grinder of the music industry. We learn that there were a lot of things going on during her last couple of months of being on top of the world, that will be touched on in the other books in the series.I was given the opportunity to read Backstage Paradise by Emma Rose and I must say that I enjoyed it. It was very short, but since it is the first part of a serial, that's to be expected. Personally, I prefer to wait until the entire series is out before I buy any of the books because I get kinda frustrated if there is a long wait between the different parts. However, I knew this was a serial, so I went into it with my eyes open to that issue. There were a few grammatical errors that need to be fixed, but overall, very good.

reviewText: It's very frustrating to find out that this series will be seven books long and books # 2 and # 3 have both been $2.99.  At this rate, the full series will be nearly $20 by the time it's all said and done.  I'm also wondering if this book was rushed because there were a lot of spelling and grammatical errors that went unnoticed.  Even in the end, when it discusses future editions to the series, it is mistakenly typed as Blood & Fire instead of Blood & Roses.On the other hand, in this book, Sloane and Zeth's connection deepens despite how neither one of them want to accept it.  Loyalties are tested and the relationships between the characters become more complicated and intertwined.  Sloane and Zeth have some hot moments, but the element of trust is mixed in.  As the chapters pass, we discover that maybe Zeth does have some "good" in him after all.  If only he could see it for himself.
summary: Wanted to give it 5 stars, but...

reviewText: This book was like seeing a movie play out on paper or digital screen. The further you read the more interesting it became. And I found myself playing it out in my head.Sloane Romera comes off almost reserved but as she continues on her mission to save her little sister she starts to release her true self and let me tell you, she can be one badass chic.You’re kneeling on the floor with a gun pressed against the back of your head, wondering if you’re about to die. Don’t f****** tell me you’re not feeling anything, Zeth.” ~ SloaneZeth Mayfair is the criminal, who has spent time in prison and has killed before and he didn't do relationships. But as he helps Sloane save her sister he's finding himself confused and uncomfortable with the feelings he's starting to feel over Sloane.“There’s nothing good about me. I watched you. I followed you. I worked out what made you tick. I made plans to break into your life and manipulate you just like Eli did. I’m no better than he was.” ~ ZethThis book was filled with action, violence, drama and steamy sex. Zeth and Sloane have some hot aggressive and angry sex. You can almost feel the aggressive passion and chemistry between them."I’m drunk on him. The way he feels underneath me; the dark, penetrating need in his eyes; his hands wandering over my hips, my breasts, my p****, down my thighs. And I’m not just beer drunk on him. I’m f****** tequila drunk. Sideways. Gone. Blind with how badly I need him. Want him. " ~ Sloane"I gather her hair and I wrap it around my hand, and I jerk on it hard. Hard enough that her head pulls back and her body bows again, far enough for me to lean forward and bite her shoulder. " ~ZethThis picks up right where the last book left off and it will have you sitting on the edge of your seat. Just imagine allowing your 16 year old daughter to emigrate to another country, half a world away.  It wasn't easy, but Edla's Swedish parents did just that.  Not an easy decision, and accompanied by grief, but with the assurance that this was God's will.  This book is based on a true story, and  I love to read true stories.  Edla's experiences in her long journey, and when she reached the New World were both disappointing and great...just like life!  She was brought to America to be a housemaid for a pastor and his wife...that was very disappointing.  However, God rescued her from that unpleasant situation through a friend she made on the ship coming over, and she was able to secure a position in a bright happy home of a wealthy company owner.  Though she had been raised Lutheran, she became a regular at the Swedish Baptist church.  At one point Edla returns to Sweden for a visit that quickly gets cut short by the onset of WWI.  The story takes place around the turn of the 20th century.  This story was of particular interest to me because we spent many years in a Swedish Baptist Church (Baptist General Conference), and many of our friends came from a Swedish background.

Leo Wilson can’t be happier. His proposal for an art project to celebrate the Fourth of July in nearby Vancouver has been accepted, and he knows it’s going to be his best shot at being noticed. However, he’d be happier if one particular city worker wouldn’t be such a pain in the behind about questioning his every move. Deciding it was time to confront the enigmatic Shannon Morgan face to face, he goes to her office. The woman he finds there is anything but what he expected and now he can’t seem to take his eyes or his mind off her, and wants only to impress and win her over – completely.Shannon Morgan is nearly at the end of her rope, between her boss who is determined to get her fired and the artist who was awarded a commission by the city to do a glass art display for the Fourth of July celebration, she’s ready to go crazy. Then to make matters worse, her occasional father and her ex-boyfriend have decided to, now of all times, show up and make her life even more complicated. The bright spot in a day gone bad is the gorgeous man standing in her doorway who turns out to be the pain in the butt artist she’s done her best to avoid. When his art turns out to be as exciting as his kisses, Shannon begins to believe that maybe having a man in her life might not be such a bad idea after all.SPARKED BY LOVE: A Holiday Romance by Peggy Bird is an extension of the Second Chance series, which featured such wonderful characters as Amanda St. Claire from book two, LOVING AGAIN, who actually shows up in this wonderful story as Leo’s friend and glass art supporter. It’s such a delight to meet old friends while meeting new ones. Leo Wilson is a hottie artist who knows what he wants and has no problem going after it. Whether it’s his determination to present his art the way he sees it at its most creative, or his determination to win over the beautiful Shannon who he fears thinks of him only as a friend even though when they’re together, they make sparks that rival his vision for his glass fireworks display. As usual, Peggy does a fabulous job of conjuring the most wonderful hero to make us fall in love right along with the heroine.When Shannon’s on again, off again father makes a play for winning over his daughter and pushes Shannon’s ex-boyfriend on her, Leo and his art get tangled up in a situation which might do more than cause a split between he and Shannon. As usual, Peggy handles the emotions and interference of others in a realistic, logical fashion, which keeps the reader turning the pages eager to find out what the not-so-nice guys are really up to, while cheering on Leo in the hopes he gets his girl. SPARKED BY LOVE: A Holiday Romance by Peggy Bird is a wonderful story about a woman who doesn’t trust falling in love, and a man who teaches her falling in love is wonderful, and can end in truly spectacular fireworks of the best kind.I highly recommend SPARKED BY LOVE: A Holiday Romance by Peggy Bird because it’s the most smile-worthy story you can read over any weekend - holiday or not.***eARC provided by author in exchange for an honest and unscripted review.
summary: 4 1/2 stars for this delightfully romantic story filled with loads of sparks. Peggy creates that falling in love feeling!

From the banned minds of Dawn Robertson and Lily White, comes a new, dark, and brilliantly written story. Separately, these two authors are Amazing. But together... WOW!! Watch out!!! The Good Girl is a dark, erotic tale of two people that are fighting through their past. Trying to suppress their memories. The voices in their heads. Elani, a young female, living her life with the bottle in her hand captures the attention of Gabriel. He follows her. He studies her. He stalks her. Until one night, acting as her savior, he kidnaps her under the presumption that he is helping her. But who is he fooling more, her or himself?The Good Girl is intense. Suspenseful. The plot twists, hidden within will keep you on the edge of your seat, turning page after page, devouring this book. As you read you will be questioning your sanity. If you start this book, be prepared to be taken on the ride of your life.

I received an early copy of this book for an honest review.I could go on for days about how intense this book was! If you're looking for a book that will have you sitting on the edge of your seat the entire time then this is the book.  These two authors combined their naughty/badass minds and have created a masterpiece.Once I started reading I couldn't put it down. Eleni was one of the strongest characters I've ever seen. This book takes a complete different direction than most books in this genre.  If you think you know how it will end... YOU'RE WRONG!  I loved the anticipation and the ending absolutely blew my mind! Nice job ladies!

*I was gifted a copy The Good Girl*Eleni and Gabriel are two people who aren't just broken, damaged souls, but monsters created by circumstance outside their control at a very young age. Eleni lives a loud and reckless existence, numbing the voices of her past with booze and men. While Gabriel lives in the shadows, the beast inside him feeding off the pain of his past, cracking his sanity and driving the obsession he forms for Eleni.His obsession with Eleni is a lethal attraction of both love and hate, pleasure and pain. When these two come together destructive doesn't even cover the pain they cause each other. As time goes by secrets are revealed that will bind them for life. What happens between them will have you questioning: When two people are this fractured can their souls be saved? Is there even anything left to save or redeem? You may be shocked at the answer.From start to finish I felt myself drawn into Gabriel's spiraling out of control. There was something about him that just lured you in. You wanted to hate him, you had moments you would, but there were these hints at something greater happening as he lost his control and sanity.Eleni took some time for me to connect to. There was something off in her way with Gabriel that made it difficult for me to worry or experience concern for her. It wasn't actually until the end, in one shocking twist that I finally started rooting for her, even if it meant she had to take extreme measures against Gabriel.I savored the ending these two got. At first I thought "No way!" But as I kept going it all made sense that there was only one way for it to end. No one would understand or accept the dark and twisted - at times heartbreaking - journey that was forced upon them, other than each other.
summary: Get ready to question what you accept in this dark and twisted love story

reviewText: A copy of this book was provided by the author in exchange for an honest review.This Naughty Mom loves her dark reads and  I couldn’t wait to get my hands on this one.In The Good Girl we meet Gabriel and Eleni.  Gabriel is a man obsessed and Eleni is a woman who lives without rules.  A bottle of whisky is her best friend while the random hookups in the nearest bar bathroom is the extent of a relationship she’s willing to have.Both Gabriel and Eleni are haunted by the trauma of their childhoods and each have their ways of coping.  When Gabriel met Eleni one day in passing…he decides he has to know everything about her.  And while Eleni is out with a friend, Gabriel decides it’s time to have her.  From there we learn the extent of the demons they both battle.  Gabriel is on a mission to show Eleni the error of her ways and has the darkest means of showing her.  Eleni sees the gentle side of Gabriel as well as the dark side that uses violence and brutality to try to control and break her but on some twisted level, she’s feels connected to him.  She hates Gabriel but feels compelled by him and at the risk of her own life, she decides she wants to save him too.This is a most unconventional love story; which is expected of a dark read.  While Eleni was a strong character, I connected more with Gabriel.  As the story progressed, I felt his internal battle.  I felt for him as he fought his demons and was even tearful for him at the end.  I was hoping for more of a connection with Eleni but all in all this was a great book.  This story is raw, gritty, angry and rough; which is what this Naught Mom likes to read.I give The Good Girl 4.5 stars
summary: 4.5 STAR for a DELIGHTFULLY Dark Read

reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed this collaboration between the two authors, Dawn Robertson and Lily White.Elena is a girl with some serious issues, drinking to get through the day and frequently hooking up with random men. He believes he can save her from herself , however, his unconventional method means kidnapping and controlling her.How does the relationship between these characters turn out?? reviewText: This book really is quite entertaining…I mean honestly, who gets sprayed by a skunk while spying on a guy??  If you're looking for fun and sweet, have at it!

4.5 StarsI read this book in less than 24 hrs. It flows that nicely and is that good.When Abigail's mother is dying in the hospital her Guardian Angel, Cillian (Ian) chooses to 'fall' by becoming human. Much like City of Angels. Of course he does this against the advice of his fellow Guardian and best friend, Rolfius. As Ian and Abby get to know one another, secrets and messages from Abby and Ian alike come into play, in addition to Abigail's best friend, Maureen. This one is a little spit fire! I feel like Maureen should've been the redhead as opposed to Abigail who is too quiet and scared for my liking. She's too much in a shell and open to vulnerability, BUT her mom did just die a week ago so I'll give her a pass...She does drink an excessive amount, though. All Abigail seems to do is get drunk, but in hindsight I can see why. Some people think alcohol solves your problems. It doesn't; it makes them worse. Also, some people who are highly 'sensitive' (to vibrations, energy, etc) try to cover it up...make it go away...if you're drunk, you can't feel, hear, or sense anything. I totally get that. More than I care to admit.Maureen however, is a put up with no b.s kind of gal - my type! ;) As she comes to term with the fact that she can see 'the other side' she takes it quite well. I know there are people who are more "sensitive" to vibrations and such (as we're all actually meant to be) so this isn't unreasonable. If you open yourself up to the metaphysical world, you'll see your physical one start to change...Unfortunately, once someone "wakes up" they not only open themselves to the good, but to the bad also. That's the balance. One must learn to filter out the energy and that's what Abby and Maureen must do.I do like that Rolfius and Maureen are starting to....let's say "meet half way" and I'm super excited for the next book b/c it focuses on Maureen!I only gave it 4.5 instead of 5 b/c I feel it fell juuuuuuuust a bit short of some plot holes being closed up. I also was a bit unsure of Rolfius "conjuring" things for everyone. Wasn't the point of Cillian's fall to become human to live...like a human and discover how difficult it really is? Problems, therefore, were solved just a bit too quickly for me and people were just a hair too accepting of certain things, but it wasn't so bad as to bring the rating down further.I felt Cillian was just a tad too naive in the beginning, but I do like that became a bit more sure of himself and stronger.Rolfius, I love his sense of humor! He's a sweetheart who doesn't rely solely on sarcasm to get a point across. He's funny about it as opposed to being a jerk. There is also a funny part where Cillian tries coffee for the first time and it make me LOL. Literally! It made me wonder how he dealt with going to the bathroom for the first time hahaha.Great read about finding faith, believing in yourself even though you're... shall we say, less than perfect...
summary: Great read about finding faith, believing in yourself even though you're... shall we say, less than perfect..
