reviewText: This was a good back for it to be the Authors debut novel. The storyline was well developed but in parts of the story it could have been more details but overall the book was very entertaining. The things we will do for a person we think we are in love with is amazing and in the story Piper did some things for Professor James. The scenes were so vivd and draws you in from page one and does not let you go…. Brianna was a double standard friend and was starting to get on my nerves. This Book left me wanting me and I cannot wait for part 2 to see where Piper and Dr. James and Carter and Piper goes… Who will win Piper Heart and I really want to know…...
summary: Great first book out the gate

reviewText: I had the opportunity to review You Had Me at Merlot.  I met Marley Gibson's husband at the NASA Social event I attended this past spring.  I had no clue who he was.  I just knew he was a space fan.  I didn't know he was a famous ghost hunter or that his wife was an author.  Cool, huh?!  Back to the review...The story is about Hale, an editor in New York City at a wine magazine and an aspiring writer, who starts her day with the loss of her job and the death of her grandmother.  She finds herself on a plane back "home" to Florida and her family and an unexpected reunion with her high school crush.The story is filled with the unexpected secrets left by Hale's grandmother, a mystery man attending the pre-scripted funeral, sibling jealousy, and welcoming home the black sleep of the family.In this book, parents learn to accept and love their children regardless of their life choices.  Hale learns that stepping out of her comfort zone and having a little fun is a good thing.  She discovers that she doesn't have to settle for a former, comfortable life, but can learn to start over.This is the first book that I've read by Marley Gibson and I really enjoyed her writing style.  Gibson's knowledge of wine and working in print media made the story believable.  The story was so good that I hated to put the book down.

Currently, Mary Balogh is probably the best writer of Regency Novels.  She knows her period and her characters are very likable.The story is always interesting.  She weaves in the lives of other characters who appear in this series.  there was less explicit sex in this one, which I think is for the better.  There is just so much one can say to describe intercourse.  The cover is, as the cover on the last one, terrible.  Just too, too sleazy - and bears little resemblance to what is behind the cover.  If I didn't know the author from past books, I might have passed this one up.  I am looking forward to the next one in the Survivor's Club.
summary: Mary Balogh is probably the best writer of Regency Novels

reviewText: Towards the end of this book, I was thinking it's a perfect example of why Mary Balogh is one of my favorite modern authors. Lovely story with characters I enjoyed spending time with while reading about them. Ben and Samantha bring each other to life and I was happy for Samantha's turn of good fortune. Ben's new found purpose in life seemed well conceived and made sense while wrapping up the story with a big, beautiful ribbon.The audiobook is narrated by the always wonderful Rosalyn Landor and I thoroughly enjoyed this book! I will definitely listen to it again.

This third installment in the Survivor's Club Series by Mary Balogh is one I have been patiently awaiting. Benedict always intrigued me and now he has his day. Sir Benedict Harper barely survived with Peninsular Wars, he came through it with nearly crushed legs and was told he would never walk again. With the aid of crutches he defies all reason by bringing shame to those skeptics. Walking does not mean that he is  not in consistent pain, but the pain of living is a far better choice than no life at all, I suppose.Through his older brother's death, Ben becomes the heir to his estate but leaves his younger brother in charge. His brother in a sense usurps Benedict's title and land, leaving him in limbo after his convalescence with the other Survivors. Deciding to travel instead of regain his home, Ben ends up at his favorite sibling's estate for a visit. That visit changes his life when he practically mows down a widow and her dog while riding a horse with some difficulty.Mrs. Samantha McKay is a widow at the age of twenty-three, when her husband succumbs to his injuries years after the war ends. While Samantha is not your typical grieving widow, he husband's family insist on deep mourning, which includes her spinster sister-in-law, Matilda guarding over her every move, making sure she wears the most awful of black mourning attire, keeps all the windows covered and sends all callers away. Samantha is growing excessively tired of the rigidity of her in-laws, especially with the fact that her sister-in-law reports back to her father on every move Samantha makes.At first Samantha finds Sir Benedict unpleasant, but after an apology for almost injuring the lady, they become friendly and Samantha has an outlet for her feelings. When Samantha decides she wants to go riding with Ben and his sister, Matilda forbids it, only to be overridden by Samantha. A shocked Matilda hightails it back to her father, who in turn sends his men to fetch Samantha back to his oppressive home and instruct his daughter-in-law on correct comportment of a widow. Instead of being bullied, Samantha escapes from England with Ben as her protector, but with a budding attraction to one another, one wonders of respectability with rule.Benedict's believing he has no right to love after being so crippled by his misfortune in the military and Samantha's insistence on being free after her one sided marriage to a man she thought she loved but fund quickly she was mistaken, fuels THE ESCAPE by Mary Balogh. Denial of a relationship by both parties only makes this story stronger as both Ben and Samantha come to terms with their lots in life. THE ESCAPE was everything I hoped it would be and more. Benedict needed a love who would never pity him his disability but see it as only adding to his persona and that is exactly what he finds with his Samantha. I highly recommend this book, as well as any in the Survivor's Club Series. They are well written and infused with emotion as well as wonderful stories of understanding and hope.~KIMBERLY~
summary: Yet Another HEA For A Survivor

reviewText: WOW...When I first started reading this book, it made me so angry I almost quit. So glad I didn't. This book was absolutely not what I expected. I've read books in 1st person POV before, but as I read this one, I often forgot that it was a novel and felt like J.J. was talking to me and revealing his painful life story. There were many places where I felt I could relate to J.J. and my heart hurt for him even though there were times I felt like yelling at him that he should have known better. I felt like J.J. knew my past, knew I wouldn't judge, and knew his story was even worse...but with a similar ending. The pain and hurts we go through serve to make us stronger and better people. It was an incredibly personal read. I was thrilled with the way the story ended. I desperately needed resolution and an HEA after the heart-wrenching read. I am immensely impressed with the writing style Dan Skinner demonstrates both in this book and in "Memorizing You" which I loved. Quite honestly, my expectations were lower knowing he is first and foremost a talented photographer, but he blew me away in both novels. I've already purchased "The Art of the Heart"!
summary: Not What I Expected but a GREAT Read!

reviewText: 3.5 starsI really wanted to love this short novella. I love shifter alpha male romances, but this fell a little short for me. The storyline is good, but it's 100% predictable. The h is a strong woman, but I couldn't help but think that some of her decisions made her a very stupid woman. Also, I know this is a very short story, so things have to move quickly, but I still felt that the romance was just too fast. The good news is that it concludes with a nice HEA ending.
summary: ~!~ Overall a nice story, it just fell a little short ~!~

reviewText: Every week there seems to be a new miracle detox and the ever increasing obesity epidemic ensures that there are plenty of people willing to try them out. Most don’t offer anywhere near the results advertised and some are even dangerous. You shouldn’t lose hope though, certain detoxes can be extremely beneficial for losing weight and general health and this guide offers an in depth look at one of the best options available.I think the main benefit of this particular detox is the speed of the results. 7 pounds in 7 days is significant for anyone. Whenever people start diets or detoxes they are always motivated but that determination often quickly evaporates so the fact that results can be seen so quickly following the program is a massive plus point. It means that anyone who follows it is more likely to complete it successfully instead of giving up.I really like the fact the book educates the reader on the known toxins present in many foods and drinks. For most people it will be a real eye opener and it helps to emphasize the need for detoxes. All the vital information on the 7 day plan is given such as the shopping list and an overview of the benefits meaning you can be sure you’re fully prepared before you begin.The author certainly has covered everything and the result is a comprehensive look at an extremely healthy detox plan. Whether you are looking to lose weight or just become healthier this guide can help you greatly.
i cant say enough about mia dymond .she makes you fall in love laugh and cry with her charactors.i buy every one of her books.
summary: she makes you fall in love laugh and cry with her charactors

reviewText: Good plot, nice action but the heavy exposition drags a lot of the narrative. Just so we are clear the author put a very comprehensive glossary at the end of the book which is apreciatted.Simply loved how the author handled the politics, the scene where the old wise Speaker just keep thrashing the new one with historical references and the like and the new speaker just doesn't understand the verbal spanking Huron senior is giving her pretty much sets up how the governament will respond...
summary: It's sci-fi space opera at it's finest really, so if you like that kinda of thing go for it!

reviewText: Like other books I've read from Erin Brady, One Last Blind Date is both funny and addictive. Brady writes in such a style that you just flow from one page to the next and the next thing you know the book's over. If you love romantic comedies, you're going to love this book.

I knew Victoria Danann could do it again! I thought the last book was good well this one blew that one outta the water! I get to be with my friends again, Elora, Ram, Storm, Litha, Glen...oh that Glean gotta love that guy he brings life into any situation. Baka is there along with the boys that Elora is training. The Z team...well what can we say about the notorious Z team! Well we find out that Raif is one heck of a guy and I think he met his match with Dr Mercedes Renaux..the feisty redhead witch turns out to be Farnsworth's lost daughter! And poor Farnsworth was going through so much with the loss of her one and only love Sol. Along comes this new guy Rev and everything about him rings a bell for her...but she can't quite figure out why, who or what. The trip down memory lane for us friends of the Knights of the  Black Swan's takes dangerous turns and makes us laugh again with them and cry again with them. You really are missing a great series if you haven't read these book's. But start with the first one My Familiar Stranger which is still free and go on from there to enjoy the lives, loves and joy's of the Knights of the Black Swan's. You can take this one to the bank Victoria Danann is one of the best writers of paranormal romance out there and she isn't done yet there has to be more to come. I can't say this enough I love the Knights of the Black Swan's. I just wish I could give this more stars..like 10 maybe!!
This is so good!!! I would love to know how the book can be as good as the first, and when you are done you have to wait how long till the next one comes out.

This is book 7 in the Black Swan series and is the story of Solomon Nemamaih. Sol died at the end of book 5 in the series. Now in book 7 we start off with Sol, dying on the beach as it was told to us in book 5. However we now get a back story. We go to the afterlife with him. Sol wants out and subsequently raised some heck till the powers that be found a way for him to return. The book still catches us up on all our Black Swan Knights as they are now recalled to Jefferson unit due to an unforeseen (spoiler). It also has our other favorite characters, including one Z-team member Sir Rafael Nightsong and the newly introduced Dr. Mercy. Their story is interwoven with our beloved Sovereign Sol and Farnsworth to give you a story that makes you go: oooh, wave your hand in front of your vehclempt face and look for a tissue.  It also made me laugh so hard I woke my husband up. Take a chance and read this series. It is a wonderful world to escape in to.

When I heard about a new book coming out in the Black Swan Series it made my year! When I got my hands on my copy I eagerly dived straight into it and was greeted with a familiarity that I had not realised you could miss so much from a book series. The vision of the world where the Order of The Black Swan lives and the likes of the adoring Animal House and rough housing Z Team were out nightly riding the world of vampires. A place where Lady Elora Laiken fell into in Book 1 and changed everything as that dimension and everyone within it, knew it.We start roughly just before where the last book ended with the death of the Sovereign of Jefferson Unit - Solomon Nemamiah and go back in time to what lead up to his untimely dimise. What happens next is a shock to say the least but I won't talk about that because I do not want to give anything away, reading it first hand yourself will give you so much more pleasure, trust me.  Sol's fiancée Susan Farnsworth was left devastated by his death and had worked hard at trying to muddle through her life so far. Taking one day at a time and beginning to look to the future, Susan is stunned when the new Sovereign Rev Farthing  who is 13 years her junior, begins flirting with her she is stunned. A wonderful plot of love, honour and forever truly means whirls and twists it's way within the book around another important plot line.Dr. Mercy Renaux, we meet right at the beginning of the book, where she encounters the hot, impulsive, rough and ready Sir Rafael Nightsong. Unfortunately their personalities clash in a war of words and tempers leaving them both annoyed but imprinted upon each other that they find it almost impossible to get each other out of their heads. Neither thought they would see each other again but as luck would have it fate steps into play and Mercy is hired by The Order. Unbeknowns to them both Raif's latest order are to protect the newest and most important new member of The Order along with the rest of Z Team. The though of being pulled off patrol to end up "baby sitting" someone doesn't sit well with the team, that is until Mercy steps onto the plane and the games changes instantly. Raif feels like time has stopped but is frozen to the spot in the shock of seeing her there and that he is her new mission that he simply misses his chance to apologise for his horrendous behaviour towards her the day they met. Torn spotting Raif's reaction to Mercy and the fact that he is a ladies man has him instantly flirting with her mixing things up to a boiling cauldron that turns to a triangle of cat and mouse.  Never have two people wished to be somewhere else than where they currently are!I personally feel that this long awaited addition to the Black Swan Series was a very good novel and I did really enjoy it, but not as much as the other within the series previously as there are many questions left unanswered when it has been made clear another full novel in the series is not on the cards. So just why is one of the major plot line so carelessly overpowered by another plot line and then left unfinished when it could have added a whole new layer to the novel, making it even more exciting and then bringing it full circle within the case  to a neatly tucked up close? I have an exceptionally high opinion of Victoria Danann and I respect her as an author on one of the highest levels so I find it hard to understand just why she has chosen to go along with this oversight? I's Only because of this I couldn't give it the full 5 stars and could only give it a 4.
summary: A Brilliantly written Novel but missing something at the end

reviewText: I loved this installment of the series. This is a series that just keeps giving, and thank you Victoria Danann so much for that!  I always love the series that keep characters around so you can see what they are up to. This is one of those. I re-read all six before starting on this one and almost just started over with #1 again when it ended. I hate when the good ones end!

Sol's back the virus is back and Raif's- Raif.  Another fun read with Victoria.  Once I started this series I was hooked.  Each book can stand alone  but why stop when you become invested in the characters and look for the potential in each one.  Victoria gives you a great read and let's you imagine who and what will be the next story.  Sol and Farnsworth have been there since book one  now there story is center stage.  review by  Rosanne

This is book seven of series about aliens, werewolves, vampires, elves, demons, etc.  The series starts off with a bang.  They have well developed characters, great love stories, exciting, nail biting adventure.  I didn't love all the books.  But Victoria is great at developing interesting likeable characters that you want to read more about.But if this is the final book of the series, it went out with a whimper.  It focused on the love stories of two couples from the series. While the characters were likeable enough, the book lacked suspense and adventure.  I was never in doubt about the HEA.  The characters that I grew to love through six books were barely mentioned.  So, If this is the final book of the series, I would have rather read a wrap up of their stories.  If this is not the end,  this book was a so-so book about two more couples finding love.
This is my favorite of the Knights of Black Swan series, and that's saying a lot because I loved them all. Sol is such a rough character and so very funny. Again Victoria out did herself

Every time I read one of the books in the Knights of the Black Swan series I think to myself it is my favorite. Then I think back to the other books and I truly cannot decide which one I liked the best. Each is unique.  Perhaps the first two were more similar in nature, but from there on they were unique.  Book 7 had a couple surprises that I really appreciated. I do not want to say more as I do not want to spoil anything for anyone who has not yet read the book.  Let me just say the author gave us more than I usually see in a single romance book.
A series you can not get enough of.  They become part of your family.
summary: Anyhing by Victoria Dannann is A Must Read.....then reread again.

reviewText: I liked the story but had no idea it wasn't a standalone novel. I'm a little perturbed that it ended with a cliffhanger and then no indication of a sequel or anything. For that, I would give it one star. #disappointed
summary: Good story but no sequel to cliffhanger????

reviewText: I don't know if you've heard, but coconut is awesome for you. It's the healthiest oil you can use, and it even improves your memory and helps prevent Alzheimer's. I'm trying to include it in more of my recipes, but I just don't really know how to use it in cooking. Luckily, I found this book.There are so many creative ways to work coconut into every meal that I never thought of. Coconut waffles, coconut shrimp, coconut cream pie...yummy - I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. This book has so many creative recipes. My favorite is the Chicken Satay with Peanut-Coconut Sauce. Delightful.

Coconut is such a delicious and versatile fruit that can be incorporated into so many different meals. Whether it’s added to a curry or used as part of a desert it offers a refreshing change to the normal western meal options. As well as tasting great the coconut offers some fantastic health benefits due to its high amount of MCT’s which are great for weight loss and also its vitamin enriched contents. You can see why coconut palms are nicknamed the trees of life. Clearly adding some coconut to your diet is a wise decision and this book is a great starting point.I love the fact that many different recipes were included for different meals of the day. This just ensures that whatever your preference you are going to have some options available to satisfy your coconut needs. As the book states, each recipe can be prepared in under 30 minutes meaning that there really is no excuse to not add some of this delicious fruit to your diet.This book offers plenty of delicious ideas for a really beneficial food and for that reason it deserves 5 stars.

Did I learn a lot from this book!  All this time, I thought minimalism was just removing clutter around the house.  This author tells the real way to minimalism. It's not just reducing clutter, but getting rid of things not vital to survive and living with less.  There are advantages and disadvantages of this and she points them all out.  The main thing is to start slow, reuse things you have and stay focused.  I plan to follow the author's suggestions, starting by making a list.  I highly recommend this book to any one that wants to get not just your clutter in order, but your life in general.

Hi again  Here is review Chic Fashion One and can I get the Clutter one now?Vanessa Pagan chooses an array of subjects and this one is fun and informative. Chic, secrets, fashion!Delving into the fashion industry discussion, is fashion important and why?  Well I agree the clothes we chose to wear reflectsmood, personality, flare.  It can bring you into a certain "look" wearing certain styles. Some of the opinion that fashion is a waste and can put those around you down.  The Leader in fashion trends France! Well I have a child that lives in  France, lol pretty trendy!!  Vanessa gives great tips on how not to break the bank and look French Chic.  Makeup tips. Developing your style and the questions youmay ask yourself if your doubting your look. There's so much more. It's very interesting information and very enjoyable, get a copy, alot of fun.5*****

This was such an interesting book!  Vanessa Pagan starts with explaining what the word “chic” actually means and how it come to be.  She then goes on to tell us why half of the entire world says fashion is important, and why the other half of the entire world says it is a waste of time.  There are very valid arguments on both sides that I have never thought of.  Vanessa tells us how fashion  has played a critical role in the French culture and then gives us a small history lesson on French Fashion.  I especially enjoyed the section in this book about achieving French Chic.  I learned that if you buy only the basics that you need, you can keep it simple and enhance your own style by adding accessories!  There are many more good tips in this book that tell you how to pull off French fashion.  Vanessa covers everything from taking care of your skin to applying makeup and she explains these tips so well.  She ends her book with 5 key things to remember when you are going French Chic.  I recommend this book to all ages from tweens to seniors.

It's a great idea this book. It's time to take stock of what you actually need and have use of instead of thinking you do!Very relatable for me. I have this personal experience since moving from a big house to a 3 room apartment, boy you learn todetach.  Shows the authors true point that we spend so much on useless items that clutter and eventually get us stressed out!A great quote from Socrates,  in examining ones life. Well this book will surely have you doing that! It is important for many reasonsto do things for the right reasons.  The book gives great thinking, tips, I mean its more than a throw it out book!  Live a simpler, uncluttered lifein your home, in your mind, in your everyday life. Pick up a copy, good material!!  5*****
summary: Pick up a copy and get going :)

reviewText: ‘Increase Your Energy’ is a life-changing book. This book is NOT all about energy drinks and physical exercise. The author, in this book, stresses the importance of positivity – in our thoughts, our words and our actions. She also goes on to speak of getting rid of negativity in our lives – a sort of creating a ‘feng shui’ within ourselves. Many of us hold on to things in our past that we cannot do anything about..time to let go of the stuff that drags us down, whether it be physical, emotional, or mentally! She makes a lot of good points within this book that I will refer to in the future. Put on a smile instead of a frown and change your perspective!

These books had me from the beginning. Funny, sexy, and just all around lovable! I am in love with Mitilda's two men! I cannot wait to see what she's in for next!!! If you love paranormal romance you will love this! I would absolutely recommend reading these books!!!

First up I just read some of the reviews before I wrote mine .. & it really PI$$ES me OFF that people think that it's OK just because they write "Spoiler"  to give up the whole story leave nothing for other people to feel that emotion for themselves!!  Try writing a review that shows your own emotion without ruining it for everyone else!!So on that Note....The first statement of "Oh My fregging God " was a mantra with a lot more feeling!.... While reading , I would say after 75%, as the dark descended & the crying began  & I could so very easily start while typing this... People say is it needed ... It ruined it ... Well you know what it's the Authors Story she gives far warning in the beginning that it gets Bad, but doesn't give away the story , so you give yourself a heads up to put yourself in that head space of being prepared ... But even with all that was done , I still thought  that they could get through ..... So when what Happened , Happened!! By the end I was going through the Handi Towels  quick lighting, yip stepped up a notch from Tissues as they weren't cutting the mustard... Even the after Marth.....  I was still crying as my Heart went out for Cory , Nolan........Little Loki had no idea what was going on .... But the other two ... Yip . They all have to live with it... The Horde as a whole felt it more so than others, but they felt it. Yes I know this is just a story but that just shows how great the writing is when you get sucked into the emotion of the book that your talking like ,it's just what happened in your home town!!So if you LOV this Series as I do ! You follow it ,no need to say get one clicking, for those of you that's just tuned in looking for a really great book / series get busy push that one click button get emotionally invested for some highs & lows with some smoking Hot S€X scenes , heart filled , Heart Break, Roller Coaster Ride that in the end you don't want to stop . For me personally in the next book since it's the Last ... I want to know what happens with Nolan , does he join ?go to college ? Become there IT guy? Dom, Tommy , Zeke ?  & if something is going to happen , cause let's face it There going to War!! It happens with the other guys  from LA (not Bart )  as we don't know them as well as we do these guys .... To leave it on a high note of a HEA not something that shocks your Panties Off!!!  that leaves you walking around for days ,thinking OMG really.... Really!!  But in this Book there is a HEA for Len & Tash even with all the Trauma .Happy Reading People. :-)

First off, this book won't be for everyone.  I think it's a must read for anyone who has read the first 5 books in this series, but with that being said, you  also might hate reading it.  It will make you cry and might make you mad, but either way it WILL make you FEEL.The author warns you this will be her darkest book yet, and she delivered.

I've read every book in this series faithfully.  This one messed me up.  I can't review it properly without spoilers so I will just say it's darker than dark.  It went far beyond what I thought was really necessary and physically hurt me to read.  I'm not saying skip it, but be prepared.

Oh my!! Where do I begin? I really loved Kevin even from the beginning. I laughed at their cute bather, and I felt the story was well rounded and full. I felt all the emotions that Lexi was feeling, from her intense dislike of those college girls to the heat she felt for Kevin. I have not read the first book, but I think now I just might. Good job Kelly Walker!!!

Set in Italy I knew right away I would love this book. From the culture to the food and of course the gorgeous sophistication of the Italian male. Niccolo returns to Italy after a 4 year absence. His father figured moving him back to Italy would set him on the right path but it wasn't the place as much as it was a person. Karina and Niccolo were childhood friends and he returns to find that she has grown into a beautiful woman with many responsibilities. A business she must keep afloat and a mother who lives with a temperamental disease. It seems it was perfect timing on Nic's part and thanks to his stubbornness or his love for the girl it changed not just his life but hers as well. Nic no longer wondering aimlessly through life has found happiness with the girl he loves and in a profession he is now making a very good living at. Which I think is all his father ever wanted for him to just have some direction and to learn to grow up. I wish I had a man who would fight to not just keep me in his life but protect my family at the same time. I love how all the childhood moments the will he or won't he came full circle. The moments on the bridge touch my heart (especially the ending). After all the betrayal and thoughts of not being good enough they finally found a home and a love in each other. What touched me most is the fact the her mother seems to be doing much better. I know how fickle a disease like that can be and the fact that Karina would have given up happiness to make sure her mother got the help she deserved...well I can see why Nic fell in love with her.

This is a 10-minute education of helpful tips covering a spectrum of topics.  I thought I'd read almost every helpful hint on the net, but I estimate Susanna Richland taught me 85 New tips!  Worth the read, especially since it was free.

Very exciting fast pace book! Loved the main characters, Nathan and Carter. Loved their relationship although I was a little skeptical of how  quickly their relationship progressed! Great supporting casts that were actually interesting and loved the back story and how it unfolded. Can't wait for the sequel! Definitely would recommend!

This is one kick add story!! This story is a rollercoaster ride that pulled you in and held you prisoner.This is a well thought out story about two people who meet when they are very young.They find one another years later and reliz they are meant for each other.This is a gangster love story and it doesn't hurt that the hero is sexy beast and the heroine is one sexy sweet thing that's so dangerous.This was a Saturday on the sofa well spent.Get the book,purchase it for your kindle but read this story.Now my only complaints are minor 1.Nate has a Russian mother and Italian father (really you come up with this name)2.There were a few typos at some critical places in the story.3.I can't wait for the next installment to this story!

I really enjoyed Nathan and Carter's story.  I like the idea of a alpha female who can hold her own.  Nathan and Carter met when they were both very young and grew very attached to each other.  Fast forward 19 years later, when they meet again. They have this undeniable attraction to each other that they just can't ignore.  This story was a fast paced story that I couldn't put down.  I can't wait for part 2.
This is a marathon reader, so good u stay up all night until I t is completed! I am impatiently waiting for book 2.  PleaseM.H. don't keep the love birds a part to long!
Another piece of the puzzle in the lives of the warriors. A very fast read as I couldn't put it down.

What an excellent little book.Never heard of Evernote - like me? In this cased you'll have to get this book.Don't miss out on getting this handy app and never fear, this guide will talk you through the download and give you the knowledge how to use it.

It was a fast-paced reading. I like the idea with the time travel machine. Unfortunately, I have the feeling there is a major interruption between the part where they solve the problem with the multiple Aunt Paradox and the second part where Reeves and Worcester's life is involved. I have to admit that this disruption isn't taken to a great length and soon everything makes sense again but nevertheless I'm bothered with it.(3 1/2 stars)

Drea u did it again this was so good that I was finish before I realized it, I want to know what's up with Christine and her son Jadien, was Nico really helping Christine, And his Ariel going to find out what her dad did to her abusive boyfriend. And is Tania really mad at Nico this time.
This book was just ok for me. I felt as if this book was just a repeat. Even the story was great and held my attention.

Over all I absolutely loved this series!  Link and Rocky are two people that found each other even though neither one of them were looking.In this final installment, the case is broken wide and Link gets what he has been looking for.  The action doesn't let up and the sexy is still ever-present with Link and Rocky.  I loved to read about them opening up to each other, putting those broken hearts on the line.  Link comes off as such a bad ass, but is really just a big ball of mush inside.I was glad to read this series when all books were published.  They are each excellent in their own way and bring you into the sexy, yet dangerous world of Link and Rocky.  Book 5 has the most action of them all and the story line flows well.  My one teeny tiny complaint would be the end.  I really wanted an epilogue for Link and Rocky, did she ever get to make him hers?  Did he let Livvie move in to second place and Rocky into first?  These are the questions I was left with.  Great series, would highly recommend!!

This book was delightful from start to finish!  It was perfectly balanced with joy and the Bingly Sisters disagreeable attitudes.  It presented an idealized version of Mrs. Bennet that was totally charming.  If only life could imitate art in this instance, it would be truly perfect.

As other reviewers have commented this is a novella, a sequel to Pride & Prejudice.  There is little angst in this story as it is more a story of how the ton did or did not accept Elizabeth into their circles and how Elizabeth managed through this process. Decisions are made as to when to return to town and how long to stay in town.The side story is how Jane and Charles find their marriage lack luster when they observe the interaction of ODC...especially when Jane has a private talk with Lizzy and hears that they (gasp!) sleep in each other's arms nightly.  Have no fear, reader: there are no graphic details about bedroom scenes.  I was reminded, in reading about the Bingleys, of what Mr. Bennet stated after their engagement (in canon) was announced, "...Your tempers are by no means unlike.  You are each of you so complying, that nothing will ever be resolved on; so easy that every servant will cheat you; and so generous, that you will always exceed your income."  Jane and Charles do learn to open up and speak out but the process is not without its bumps.The First Anniversary dinner for both couples and the later private nighttime celebration is heart warming...Darcy does not disappoint!  Lovely scene painted for us.Caroline Bingley and the Hursts maintain their snobbery and this, too, is FINALLY, addressed by the correct party.  Their further company in both sisters' houses comes to depend....well, you'll have to read the novella to learn that.  I can't give everything away.Mr. Bennet offers some sound advice as to family alliances while Mrs. Bennet, in being invited to the Darcy's for their ball...let's see if she shocks society in London as she did in Meryton.This story is much like an epilogue to Pride and Prejudice, even though Jane Austen did give out some details along that line herself.  Short and sweet.

Continuing in the fourth installment of the Gypsy Brother’s series, Juliette Portland continues to exact her revenge on MC President Dornan Ross and his sons for the rape she suffered when she was fifteen, as well as the murder of her father. The difference in this newest book, however, is that now she has someone else who knows her true identity: Dornan’s youngest son Jace. The boy that she has always loved is now a man, and he must choose whether his allegiance is to his family, or to the girl he buried years before.Just like the three books before this, Four Score was a quick, dark and satisfying read. What I liked best about this installment, however, is that it focused less on the revenge aspect and more on the relationship between Jules and Jace. As childhood sweethearts in a less than hearts-and-flowers environment, it is interesting to watch their relationship develop, not only as adults, but under the circumstances that they are now faced with. Juliette continues to be the strong and determined heroine, but we are also given more insight into Jace and what he went through as the one who was left behind.Similar to last time, the only complaint I have about this series is the price and the serial nature. As I am impatient, I want to be able to read the entire story in one sitting! But the author does a good job of leaving the stories on a cliff-hanger and this one is no exception. Now I am just forced to wait until July to continue! This series is really not for the faint of heart as I would hesitate to call it a “romance”, but it is addictive and truly a guilty pleasure.
summary: The only complaint I have about this series is the price and the serial nature

reviewText: Seriously!? Can this story get any better?Yeah. It can. A LOT!!! It is more twisted and gritty and raw.The plot has addictive and obsessing pace.Each part of the story is full delivered. Lili has once again blew me away.I am more and more addicted and glued to the story and sucked in. Again‚ I am left begging for more.Can not wait to see how it ends.≧◔◡◔≦ 5 ✰ read ≧◉◡◉≦

Major cliffhanger, can't stand it! I'm so worried for Juliette - she is discovered now by Jase & throughout most of this book she is back to being herself & not her alter-ego Sammi. Dornan is in critical care after Juliette plotted to take them all down during a motorcycle ride. Elliot is looking out for Julz & gets into a pissing contest with Jase which was pretty hot. Jase admitted what happened to him after Juliette's pretend funeral & my heart breaks for him. I'm sure he was tortured by his father for attempting to protect Juliette since Jase can't even talk about it, the memories are that bad. I would gladly have given this book five stars because all along we've been getting dirty details about Sammi & Dornan which was hot in a way & made me want to puke at the same time - how can she stomach being with him intimately after everything he's put her through? That is how strong her resolve is to take him down, to stay in character & see this through to the end. So why didn't we get lots of dirty details about Juliette & Jason's reunion that we've been dying for? I'm assuming it is because these two kids fell deeply in love & have still been in love even when Jase thought she was dead for the past six years. I still would have enjoyed a hotter reunion! Anyway, I don't know how Juliette is going to pull off her plan now that Jase knows who she is - she definitely can't return to being with Dornan! Like I said, ended with a big bang & I'm very scared to read on to find out what happens to our brave girl next.

** I received a copy in exchange for an honest review **This book is the one that I’ve been waiting for since this series began! This book starts right where Five Miles left off with Jase finding out that Jules really is still alive. Let me tell you, this is one emotional roller coaster you are about to embark on.Jase has finally found Sammi out. Now she’s just worried about what he is going to do that with information.Jules can finally be herself around Jase now that he knows who she really is, something she’s wanted since this whole thing started. However, there are so many questions now between them that needs to be answered, she’s just afraid that some of the answers she has may turn him away. Jules has some questions of her own that need answered as well, but she may not like the information that’s provided in return.The love Jase has for Jules is amazing, you can see (almost feel) how much he cares for her in pretty much everything he does. He wishes she never had to do what she’s done to get her revenge, that is something he should have done years ago, but he did what he had to in order to survive. As he listens to her story, he’s horrified, but he is begrudgingly grateful that she had Elliot there to help her through it all.What ends up happening with Jase and Jules? The big question is, now that Jase knows who Sammi really is, does that mean others in the gang know as well? How much longer will Jules be able to keep her act up as Sammi now that the cat is out of the bag?I’m absolutely in love with this series, but I will say that Lili is slowly killing me with the endings each and every time. I will sit here patiently (well not really) until Three Years comes out in July. After this series is done, I can’t wait to see what Lili has cooked up next for us!

reviewText: After reading all the wonderful reviews, I downloaded this book and read it almost immediately.  The storyline sounded so sweet, but much to my dismay, the story was not.  I have a few problems with the story.  First and foremost is that the heroine jumped into bed with the hero after blaming him for her sister's death for over a year.  Her trust came a little too quick for my liking. STOP HERE FOR SPOILERS!!!!! After a few hours of Macie helping Rylan break into her sister's, computer, he starts kissing her. She tries to push him away,(not very hard though)  but he convinces her it's okay.As for the sex scenes, they were WAY too explicit. Now on to a question weighing on my mind.  HOW DID KARYN (the sister) hide her laptop in the false bottom of her boyfriend's chest?  Rylan stated they weren't lovers and she had broken up with him.  So she couldn't have had a key to his apartment.  If she brought it over how would she have put it in their without Rylan knowing she put it in there?  Last but not least the author did what irritates me. She threw in words typical people don't use a whole lot.. macie said," You deceived me" when she found out it was rylan.  Then when Macie was trying to figure out weather to trust or not, she thought could I expunge him.Where as I know and understand these words, they are not words I use everyday.  If you're going to use words like these that is fine, but use them through out the book. DONT JUST THROW THEM IN IN THE FIRST FEW PAGES!!! Okay, I've had my say.  Two stars.  One for no swearing.(f bombs)  One for not having any glaring grammar mistakes.
Nice approach.  Believable.  Looking forward to the next book.  Leaves out the political soapbox.

reviewText: This is a fabulous story about overcoming your past and finding happiness.  And really, how could you not with Miller's attention?  Hadley is an inspiring heroine who is getting on with her life after an unspeakable childhood (the stats in the back of the book are scary and mind boggling).  As their mutual attraction heats up through love letters and texts, I fell in love with Miller right along with her.  Yum. An emotional roller coaster in the best way possible!  Loved it!

In short, Hadley has had a crap life. She lived with an emotionally and physically abusive father who targeted both her and her mother until a tragic night when, at the age of eight, she found herself thrust into a foster care system that placed her in homes that perpetuated and worsened the cycle of abuse. While not all of the placements were in unhealthy environments, the nice homes were overshadowed by an abusive court-appointed guardian who used his position of authority to force her into a sexual relationship. When the reader first meets Hadley, it is glaringly obvious that while she has survived the wretched situation of her life, she has not thrived. And while her first meeting with Miller was intense, the tampon incident made the scene feel real and made me chuckle. As much as Miller’s sexual intensity frightens her, it also draws her to him and seeing him is the highlight of her day … and has been for three years. Unbeknownst to Hadley, Miller is just as aware of her as she is of him, but he is a patient man who recognizes her wounded soul and knows he must tread lightly.When the author takes the story in a direction that enables Hadley to get to know Miller via letters and text messages, I was quite impressed. It was an original idea (at least one I have never encountered) and did not feel contrived considering who Miller is. As we learn throughout the book of all the little things that had to occur for their relationship to develop the way it did, I again felt the realism of the book. I will admit that I was surprised that the story occurred within the time frame of a year as there are so many things that Hadley had to endure and got to enjoy, that it felt longer time-wise. Because of the way their relationship developed, the reader is well into the book (close to 60%) before the two have sex. Readers with a sensitivity to sexual assault should proceed with caution as it is a topic in the book, but should also be aware that none of the sex scenes are described in a detailed or graphic nature.While I enjoyed reading Cut Too Deep and liked the characters immensely, something fell a bit flat and kept this from being a great read for me. It wasn’t until the final couple of chapters that I realized what it was – for me, the transition from the author’s narrative to the character’s dialogue and internal thoughts was not smooth. Did this interfere with the flow of the story? Occasionally. Did it make this a bad read? Absolutely Not! I enjoyed the book and look forward to reading more of Ms. Bell’s work. There are so many connected sub-plots that run throughout the book that it is difficult to discuss specifics without taking the risk of revealing potential spoilers so I will simply leave it as saying that Cut Too Deep was a solid readI received a complimentary copy of the book in exchange for an honest review.Reviewed by Angela at Crystal's Many Reviewers!
summary: 3 stars = I liked it and it was a GOOD read

reviewText: What a great concept: a superhero assassin.With superheroes everywhere these days, (Movies, TV and of course Comics), it's hard to come up with an original spin on the 75+ year concept.Mr. Lindsey has done just that.This is a super fun read with plenty of the good guys vs. bad guys you would expect, plus some unexpected turns, so buckle up.Easily my favorite book by Ernie Lindsey, i would highly recommend this novel.

This book is adorable. Completely 200% adorable. It’s not overly deep, it’s not one of those emotional reads that will have you reeling for days, and I love that about it. It’s fun and sweet. It’s romantic and angsty. I just thought it was such a fantastic, quick read.In a nutshell, this is about what our minds (all mushy and romantic like we are) assume happens after someone wins an American Idol-esque television show. The shot to fame, the paparazzi, the crazy fans. But most importantly, it’s about the people who knew you before you became a superstar. How do you fit the girl you’ve loved since childhood into this crazy new world?I loved these characters. Noah wins a talent competition, and instantly, his life changes. He’s still the kind, sweet guy he was before underneath it all, but suddenly he has to try and deal with the entertainment business and all of its craziness. I never doubted his choices though. I’m sure it’s supposed to sort of make you believe he’s with this person or making questionable choices, but for me…he just never seemed like that sort of person. I felt like he was smart enough to not fall for the games others were trying to play. And then there’s Chloe. She has been his best friend since they were children. When she takes a job in New York and near Noah, assigned to run a blog that reports on him exclusively, she also sees the world Noah has been thrown in to. I love that they sort of have to conquer this new world together, even though every element is trying to tear them apart. They try to stay strong and remember who they were before it all. Although they were never “together” before, as a reader, you just NEEDED them to be together.Overall, I thought this was a very exciting, easy book to read. It was very sweet, humorous, and had just enough angst to make your tummy turn and heart race. I’ll absolutely pick up book 2 when it’s released, and can’t wait to see what happens with Noah and Chloe.
A great read, love the characters and the fun they have while still be creative and serious.

Let first say that I actually love that Time for Love series centers around five friends who made a pack at New Years Eve to not be alone. Honestly, I think that's a clever idea for a series. In Forever, we saw Rebecca and Zach reunite. Now it's Sarah's turn to find love in Finally. However, before she finds love she wants a fling and who better than to give her that than Zach's brother, Jeffrey. Plus, it's convenient. We all know by now that in romance stories, flings never workout the way the characters want.Let me just say that I sort of predicted Jeffrey's ex would pop in the story, but I wasn't expecting how she would return. The way she reappear in his life made me not like her. For a little bit of the story I didn't like Jeff, and part of the my reasoning is how he handle his ex. He acted like an idiot and he was lucky that Sarah was willing to listen to him, but it took some coaxing. Sarah is a sweet girl in the story and is afraid to give her whole heart to a guy that's not worth the chance. Yes, it stems from a broken relationship. I completely understand why she got bent out of shape when the ex return.I enjoyed the story and like how the story progresses from previous book. The story can be read as a stand alone, but would be better enjoyed as reading from the book one. I like how Miranda gives a hint at the end on whats going to happen in the next book. I have to say I can't wait for that story, because I have a feeling it will be a doozy.Basically Finally is a light read that has two people who started out with a fling, but progress to something more. Of course, you can't have a story with no conflict, so we have a return of an ex. Can there be a happy-ever-after for Jeff and Sarah? So, if this sounds like your kind of read, you might want to give Finally a try.Copy provided by Author via Tasty Book Tour

reviewText: For all the prospective traders, I highly recommend this book especially if you're interested in scalping. This book will educate you on the difference between a scalper and a market maker. It's very important that you know the difference. There are a lot of pros for being a scalper and there also some cons which this book will educate you on. You have to be a risk taker if you are interested in being a scalper. Scalping can help you to gain small profits many times throughout a trading date. Scalpers this is the book for you!

Scalping is a trading strategy that relies on frequent, short-term trades.  The aim of a scalper is to make a large number of small profits throughout the day so that by the end of the day they have made a significant amount of money.  Scalpers are generally impulsive and reactive traders who take advantage of economic data and news events and tend to trade in markets with high volatility.  The major currency pairs; EUR/USD, GBP/USD or USD/CHF are perfect for newbies as well as other combinations from the larger more powerful economies of the world.  More experienced risk takers will usually opt for Carry Pairs, EUR/JPY or USD/JPY because of the higher volatility.  It takes time to learn this strategy and if you are not comfortable taking risks then it is probably not for you.  Tejeda does a great job discussing the key concepts of this strategy.  He gives a step by step outline of how to become a forex scalper then goes on to describe some specific examples of scalping opportunities.  In his conclusion he summarizes the Pros and Cons of utilizing the Forex Scalping strategy.  Well Done!
I like the tips offered by this book on how to make money using Fiverr. Every tip is explained very well and I'm looking forward to testing the author's ideas very soon.
summary: Really good tips for using Fiverr to make money
