Cain decides to help get her back to civilization. Of course, mating fever takes a hold of him and.... insta-wet moments ensued. I thought this was a terrific concept, I just wish to see more character development. I love werewolves and the stories about them. I enjoyed this story.

From posted reviews I expected a very good book.  In the first three pages of the Introduction I was put off by sloppy sentence construction, poor word usage and a typo or two.  Mr. Chapin could offer nothing, IMHO, that would make up for the unhappy experience of continuing.  If another edition comes out that has been carefully edited, perhaps I'll try reading that as the premise is interesting.  Sorry!
loved this book!! author is hilarious. looking forward to blue's story. was happy to hear from all the characters especially Julian n Mattie :)

I enjoyed this book I was hoping Dee would of been a bit more resistant to Grady more of the push and pull but it seemed she just got a bit wishy washy Grady was all alpha male though and I can see it be hard to say no to him lol the plot was ok bit predictable but I did like the side characters looking forward to Josie's story hopefully I think she's very interesting!!!

Roman sounds like your typical player...except he just turned 30 and is thinking about "growing up"!In one night he meets a VERY strange woman, a very nice woman and had to let his best friends know that he is moving..across the country.Looking forward to next installment!!!

I received this book in return for an honest review from LoP.I really like reading books about Camelot and King Arthur but they are always the same and after awhile they tend to be dry. I enjoyed reading a modern book that interacted with the past. I liked that this centered on Lance learning of his heritage and finding the will to protect. I hate what happened to him but in the end all his physical wounds were healed. I like that this series isn't vampire focused or werewolf focused. I like that it is magic focused. It seems everything magical is in this series without it being overwhelming. I do not like that at the end everyone from Camelot was able to come to the future because if it was that easy then Lance should have been able to know his mother. I like that he was given someone to fill the hole he had because he wasn't going to be happy just being someone else's guard and that's it.  It was easy for me to get to know the characters and feel like they were real which is what I look for when reading.  I want to be able to immerse myself in the book as an outsider but still in their world. That is what I felt in this, I was in Camelot with Lance on the ground during training and I was with Alex as she was struggling with her pregnancy.

This story stands alone BUT for those who wanted to dig deeper into Hadrian and Angie's stories and motivations this is your book. Great and consistent world-building mark this story of characters who are not black and white but just carry all their human faults, histories and insecurities into their preternatural life. A must read if you want to sink your teeth into a story!

Okay so this is the last book in this trilogy and it is sort of sad to see it end but it is a very good end. What I love about this series is that every book feels like it was better than the last one. In the two previous books we've meet Pinky but you never got to know her but in this book you get to do exactly that. And it is fun getting to know her. Then their is Rafael and I just say "yum" ;). Besides that he's hot I also love his be ground story that makes him even more complex. And in this book you also get explained those things you've been wondering about from the previous books like the crane curse and all the other things you've been wondering about.What is also fun at least it's fun for me is seeing how Liliana Rhosed grows and evolves as an athour. This is another must read if you and me and it is even better that the ones before.I just loved it and it blew me away.Way to go Liliana Rhodes! There is only one way I can describe the feeling of this book: MagicalEnjoy reading it!

This book holds up the style and movement of the previous book.  It's a quick read ( one day for me) and keeps you involved.  I bought this because I had enjoyed the two previous novels and it did not disappoint.  Would recommend to any who enjoys a not too complicated story plot with a little humor tucked between the pages.

Please read the List Trilogy. I have read the first two books twice and loved it more the second time around. Following Chrissy story was amazing. I hope in the the future she writes a fourth book. This book will make you laugh, cry, laugh again and say WTF all in one sitting. Can't wait to read other books she has written.
I really enjoyed this series of books.  You truly did not know what was going to happen.  I loved the funny parts too.  It has more twist than a roller coaster.  Good Job Chrissy.
summary: I really enjoyed this series of books

reviewText: Loved the ending. I was super happy to read that Riley and Jesse got their happily ever after. Great way to end the series!

Megan, what a story, stories, loved them all. Your writing pulls one in as if this was my story. so personable, heart felt. Really, normal part of life. Keep it up."Be sweet if all love stories ended this way. The story goes right to the heart. All the best to you, Cynthia
summary: A SWEET NICE BOOK ALWAYS LOVE READING AND FEELING.

reviewText: This is just the type of book I had been looking for, and I am going to apply the strategies as suggested in Mastering your Finances straight away. It gave me a whole new perspective on my relationship with money and to view money as nothing more or nothing less than energy. My biggest challenge is to identify what exactly I want, and then let go of it. I very much liked the tone of the book, the useful checklists and the many brilliant ideas it gave me. Compliments to the authors!

Mastering your Finances was the book I never knew I needed. I am presently in a situation where I need to really save up a lot. I found the steps given in this book to be practical and realistic, which makes it easier to follow. I am also glad that the reviews were awesome, giving the impression that the tips and advices given really works. I am determined to start adjusting my lifestyle right away, to eventually be content on living with just a tenth of my income, as one suggestion of the book says. I highly recommend this book especially for people who have growing expenses like me.
Read it in one sitting, could not put it down. It was a fantastic book, immediately brought book two. Can't wait for more in this series!!!!

This is my first time reading from this author and if this is his first book he did a wonderful job. The story kept you involved wondering what would happen next. I definitely fell in love with detective Grainger, and Janelle had my heart from the beginning as well. As with most good things, the story ended too soon. Can't wait for the next in the series.~Anna J
Aaahhhh I absolutely loved this book!! I'm so glad I started it not really knowing what was going to happen. This book is full of passion and love! Loved it!!

This book really sounded interesting and I was in the mood for a dystopian so I couldn't wait to read this book.This one takes place in 2025 in New York City. It started off slow but I kept on reading and I found myself enjoy it very much. I can't wait to read the next book in this series.I recommissioned if you are in dystopian young adult novels.
ooh.... I really enjoyed this short.  I will be re-reading this one..!
Nice freebie to keep up with Jay, Henry and Alice. Enjoyed the point of view change, seeing things through Jays then Henry's eyes.

Piper was done it again!  Created characters you can't help, but fall in love with.  Kane and Holt are seriously hot together!  Kane's love for Holt is his undoing and it is beautiful. Can't wait for more from this series!  Definitely worth your time to read!!

OMG I so want to be Casey! Lol This book is awesome. It's suspenseful, sexy, heartfelt and fun. I can't wait to read Zanes story, but I think this one will stay my fave because not only are the twins Doms, possessive, sexy as all get out but they could rock a girl's world. And love her mind body and soul.

This is my 4 star review for Something True by Malia Mallory.Something True is about Shelley Taylor and Liam Smith, two musicians on totally different paths. Shelley is a beautiful young lady but she has no idea because she has had so many men hurt her in her lifetime. Something True is her journey after she meets the infamous Liam Smith, a bad boy rock star. She doesn’t think that she is anything special and doesn’t believe that someone like Liam would be interested in her. All she cares about is her charity, KC’s Kidz. She doesn’t want the attention or the publicity that comes with fame and fortune. She just wants to entertain and take care of the sick kids that thrive on her visits.When Liam takes her life by storm she finds herself falling more and more every day. Will she be able to open up her heart to him? Will she be able to deal with all the publicity that comes along with his way of life?Liam is a superstar but he wasn’t always so privileged. He has made some bad choices but in the recent months has started to realize that he wants something real. Will Shelley end up being what he is looking for? Will he be able to convince her that he isn’t all bad?I found myself really liking Shelley and Liam’s story. I also felt that it left me wanting more of their story. I hope that the author will consider doing another book continuing their journey together. I would love to see where they are now. I would also like to have a look into the other members of Liam’s band as well….and maybe even Shelley’s sister! Hint, Hint!!
Sweet but too short. I know its a novella but even so I felt like I was just getting to know the characters and then the story ended

I love this book. It discusses why it's important to detoxify the body and to live a healthy lifestyle. I'm nearing my 30's and I promised myself that I will take care of myself more by eating healthier. Aside from looking fit, I want to get rid of the toxins in my system. Reading this book is my first step in achieving that goal. It has practical tips and good recipes to keep the body healthy.

I have always wanted to try detoxification and i always thought it was a hard process wherein you have to prepare difficult recipes. But this book simplifies everything, from the explanation of detox to how the different food groups can contribute to your detoxification process. Really amazing.
summary: cleansing my way to a healthy diet

reviewText: She meets this Dylan who gives her a fake name and doesn't say good-bye.  Two years she's had his baby and has tried to track him down to let him know.  She meets him and he accuses her of stalking him and she tells him she had his child and he said how do I know it's mine?  He's such a creepy jerk and yet the minute he kisses her she melts.  It boggles the mind that she is so weak.  Why does she have this obsession to share her child with him.  I wouldn't of told him anything until I got to know him to see if he was worth it.  All the hardship she went through alone to care not only for her child but for her brother's child.  He sure knew how to use her to get his kid.  I didn't like him at all and wondered how she could go back to him so easily.
Great!  Loved it
Great read!! Luv it!!!  Can't wait to hear Nathan's version.

Well if book 1 was hot this was scorching!! I'm left hanging yet again but not in a bad way, in I need book 3 yesterday kinda way so I can get my fix!! When she saw the truth laid out in front of her or rather the palm of her hand, I totally gasped and cursed out loud!! WTF, I guess some people weren't meant to change.I can't wait for book 3!!

Oh Nathan.....I was in your corner! I thought you had let your guard down and let Jessica in but....oh what a tangled web we weave when once we practice to deceive. Mad that I have to wait for Part III. I hope Jessica tells him where to go. SMHAuthor/editor: please make sure the proofer is doing his/her job. There have been a few instances where the wrong tense of a word was used which throws off the meaning of what the character is trying to say. Also, there were a few times when you said him, but you meant me or her. Please be more cognizant of what is being written or said so that you don't confuse your readers.Looking forward to the next book!

She did it again folks!  Keeps me waiting in anticipation to find out what happens next!  She can write a cliffhanger like no other!  Best thing about Deborah's books is she won't make you wait to long to find out!  Support your self published authors and get their names out there.  Not only is Pulse an amazing series all of Deborah's other series are amazing too!
Wow!!! This is one of the most amazing series I have read. I have read the first 2 books and just waiting for the next.
This book has several of my favorite dishes and drinks included from several popular chains such as Bone Fish Grill, Starbucks and Panera Bread.
While I liked the book about the deputies. I would like to see more about the sherif characters.  Awesome series!

I really enjoyed these. I have read the three main books and have loved every one of them, this set of three short stories is a great addition to the main books (and I hope we will see a second book of three short stories once the next three are competed).If you're looking for something fun a and quick I would say go for it however I would also recommend that main group of book. I just can't wait for the next one!

I received a digital copy in exchange for an honest review.I really enjoyed Return to Her, I really wish it was a full length novel because I liked the characters so much. I liked the slow build up of Mason and Cassie getting to know eachother, and myself (the reader) being able to get to ease into their relationship as well. The sex is way hot... insanely hot.. Its fun, its sweet and there is a pinch of realism and honesty in it as well.Its easy enough to find yourself seeing the events play out in real life without any side line questions in your mind screaming LAME. Alexandra keeps it focused, she keeps it all right on target as she builds you up into an amazing climax and a sweet after cuddle.I really hope to see more of Mason and Cassie in the future, they're great together.

This book is short and sweet but hot. I would love to read a longer book by this author so that she would have the opportunity to better flesh out the characters. Given the limitations of a novella she did a very good job of making the characters easy to like and relate to. It also doesn't hurt that the love scenes are oh.my.god. Hot.

Definitely worth the wait!  Mya did not disappoint.  Hopefully, I won't have to wait too long for the next book.  I'm anxious to see where the author will take these characters next.  The anticipation!!!  Great job, Mya.

Really interesting follow up read. Action, lovers quarrels and naughty love play!I was pleased that Freya could finally except that it was okay to be vulnerable with her mates. That I'm "that .,itch" attitude was a bit much. I wanted to sock her. She was unnecessarily doing things ie...chopping wood while pregnant just to keep her hard as nails persona. Again I'm glad common sense finally kicked in. I gotta give it to her though when she needed to be the warrior she delivered.I was put off at first by the addition of the Omega Ezra. I felt betrayed for Fenris and Rayne.  Unbeknownst to them she eyeballing another wolf and wasn't gone a whole good day from her mates. In any case he prove to be quite useful. And I can't wait to see how his character develops other than being a sub after all he is part Fae.I can't wait for the 3rd book. I'm eagerly awaiting to find out what's is going on with Rayne and the threesomes cub "Bun"Highly recommend and I seldom do reviews.

Pretty Impressive! This guide is designed to help you fight away the pests and make sure that you can keep your garden healthy while keeping everything else organic, plus awesome tips in making your own Pests Control. Download this book and discover the brilliant tips that this book offers!

This books was truly amazing from the start. When Gavin sees Becky on the same cruise as he is on with his friends, he wants to get to know her better, but she keeps putting him off. Then they finally get together and decide on a week of no strings attached sex. They never exchange last names so that it will be easier on them after the cruise is over.  When Becky starts her job in a new city, she is flawed to find that Gavin is her new boss, and a billionaire.  This is such a great love story all the way.  I highly recommend this book to all.
summary: Another amazing book by Sharon Cummin

reviewText: I rather liked the first book, Wicked, although it was hard for me to believe such a wretch could redeem himself. In this book, I was so disgusted by the antics of the heroine's suitor that it was painful to read. A creep like that is beyond redemption. Sometimes i worry that romance novels are written for women whose husbands and lovers are cheaters and liars, to reassure them that these men will turn over a new leaf. Yeah, right. People do change, but not overnight. I could imagine the sequel in which her husband gets killed in a duel over yet another woman. This book made me sick at my stomach.

I received this book as an ARC review.  If you loved the first one you will love the second one even more.  The chemistry between Harper and Levi is super hot.  The action and drama get much more intense than in book one.  I can't wait to see what the next book has in store for these two.

It's an amazing ride, right from the first few pages to the end of this second episode.  I love the characters, oddball as they are, and I can't help but root for them to survive the bad guys, especially the wicked vampire who wants them dead.Jgtimm

Nothing, I repeat nothing about Cecilia marks her as average. After witnessing the murder of her father as a child; Cecilia embarks on a mission to solve his murder. The first thing she needs to do to work her plan is land an internship at Leighton Enterprises, a place well known for investigating crimes. She believes it holds the info she must obtain in order to connect the pieces of the crime. And ultimately catch a killer.Cecilia affectionately called Ceci, decides to assume her older sister’s identity because she herself is only a senior in high school. Ceci gets the internship just as she planned but what she did not plan is the strong attraction she feels toward the soon to be appointed CEO, Bentley Leighton.Bentley is far from happy with his new role working in the family run company and instead sees it as a means to an end that will eventually land in his favor. When the sassy, confidently beautiful Cecilia becomes his new weekend intern he quickly finds himself in very compromising position…between her legs.My ThoughtsThe Intern definitely surprised me. Ceci is witty, clever and irresistible. Brooke Cumberland has a great secondary plot going with the mystery surrounding the death of Cecilia’s father. For me there is nothing like a good murder mystery being thrown in to the mix of a romance to keep you on the edge of your seat. Cumberland also has that forbidden romance aspect which appealed to my taste buds as well.My RatingsCharacters- Clever, daring and inventiveWriting Style- GoodPlot/Storyline- A high school senior fakes her older sisters identity in order to get an internship that may hold leads to her father’s murdererSteam Factor- High/Steamy on a scale of 1-10 I say 7Entertainment Level- From Lo-Med-Hi I say MediumOverall- I enjoyed it! And after that ending..I am anxious to see what happens next!
summary: Witty, Clever and irresistable..The Intern volume 1

reviewText: Bentley Leighton is in for it....and it is Cecilia "Ceci West". When Cecilia a high school senior applies for a job at Leighton Industries a criminal investigative firm under her older sister's identity it's BAM!Bentley who is a former model left the modeling industry to work for his father's firm. Now Bentley will be training and working with Ceci thinking that she is someone completely different than who she really is. Ceci has her own reasons for applying for this position to find out the unsolved mystery of her father's death several years ago that was never solved.The story is based on revenge, lies, deceit and hot steamy sex which in this case it's the saying that goes "you don't s*** where you eat" yeah that goes right out the window with this storyline.There is a cliffhanger ending so be prepared for the next installment to follow. I received complimentary copy from the author.

Wow! I started it and couldn't put it down!I love Ceci..the way she goes after what she wants and she does whatever she needs to to make it happen. Bentley..hot and alpha, ex model and future CEO.He is the boss and she is the intern, their chemistry is scorching and the fact that it's forbidden it makes it even hotter.Ceci has secrets and she is playing a dangerous game.God, that ending..need the second one NOW! Can't wait to see what Bentley is going to do!

Loved the first installment in this serial from Brooke Cumberland, The Intern grabs you from the start and sink its hooks in. I will be honest, I am not a huge fan of Serial novels in the least, but I AM a huge fan of Brooke so I gave it a shot. She did not let down.Cecilia ane her story literally grab you from that first page. It left me definitely hooked and highly intrigued as to where this novel is going to go. Cecilia is also that snarky and smart type of character that I instantly like."I'm not your "typical" high school girl. I don't want to wave pom-pons around, wear short skirts to her boys to notice me, or even bury my head in a books studying. I;m not any go those, so if that's what you hoping to get, it's time to adjust your expectations."Then we just in and meet Mr. Hot and Handsome. Bentley. He is exactly what you think, and from there? Things escalate. Bentley isn't what I expected and I found that refreshing. I also love how uncensored he is. Kind of a blatant honesty."My jaw twitches at the innuendo she's just put in my head. I try not to stare at her, but the way her soft, pink lips are perking up at me makes it hard to tear my eyes away."This is a quick read, but a great one. If you aren't a fan, or are unsure? Give it s shot. It won't disappoint.
summary: Hot and exciting read. I am Hooked.

reviewText: Once you start reading this book you won't be able to put it down!!!  IT IS STEAMING HOT!!!  Bentley and Cecilia are HOT TOGETHER!!!  When she becomes his intern it gets even more HOTTER THAN BEFORE!!!

Brooke loves to just torture us with amazing words and cliffhangers. Volume 1 of The Intern is both hot and heavy. The instant chemistry between the main characters have you sucked and wanting more.This book is an great quick read and I can't wait to see what happens between these two characters.Will her secrets be revealed and what will he do when he finds out? I guess we will have to wait and see what Brooke gives us.
summary: Can I have an order of Bentley!

reviewText: This is definately a hot little read! I really enjoyed this Novella and read pretty quick! Definately ready for the next Vol.

In Come Sundown, We meet a girl named Erin. Erin is a hard working young woman with a good head on her shoulders. She has just went throw a horrible break up her Ex says she was to controlling and always had to be in control of everything! Erin didn't agree she just liked things organized after all that's what she did for a job her life should be the same right??Well Erin's best friend Natalie and her soon to be husband go on a pre-wedding vacation to the Bahamas and ask Erin to go along to get her out of her depression and get her to live a little again. Little did Erin know going With would not only be the best thing for her, It would for ever change her life.Natalie and Gunner went out on there own once there and left Erin to her own, so she went out down the beach and explored some. Little did she know she was going to be spending the rest of her days at a little beach side bar, Trying every Drink on the menu. All while having the best vacation, fling with Tyler the bartender of the bar. And all the ladies want him. But he pays no attention to them only Erin, He told her that first night he would be what ever she wanted him to be. What happens when it's time for Erin to go home?Come Sundown was a fun read I laughed, I got mad, I almost throw my kindle. these characters will make you want to shake them and ask them what the heck there thinking but. In the end it's amazing and perfect and just how it should be! I feel in love and can say I can't wait for more! I give Come Sundown 5+ stars*****
This was a very good book. I love me some Sin. Great read from top to bottom. Please hurry with part 2 I can't wait to see what happens next.

I FELT THE BOOK WENT A LITTLE TOO FAST & WAS NOT ASTHOROUGHLY WRITTEN, THAT I HAD HOPED…ENJOYED THE CHARACTERS & PLOTS, JUST WISHED IT HAD A SMOOTHER FINISH TO IT…EVEN WITH THE CONSTRUCTIVE  CRITICISM, CANNOT WAIT FOR THE SECOND TO FIND OUT WHERE IT ALL ENDS UP.

I really enjoyed this book. Sin and Harlem are a hot mess, but in a good way. I loved the ending!!! I can't wait for part 2. I need to see how this all plays out. Left me wanting more of Sin/Harlem. Good job for a first time author. I'm really looking forward to more. :-)

I bought the complete series in a bundle.  I am glad I did. I enjoyed all three books.I will recommend them to my friends.I will read more of her work.Like her writing and how she let's the stories flow from one to the next.Without revealing any of the stories I will say that I will reread them.

Review for Yield to Me by Sarah CastilleYield to Me is a Club Excelsior Novella by Sarah Castille it’s an MMA fighter romance. One of the best parts about this book? The fighter is a woman! Talk about a switch from the typical bad boy fighter type being the main attraction in the ring/cage. Considering this is a novella length story I never felt like it wasn’t a complete book, for me that’s rare. Novella’s typically leave me wanting for more, but in the case of Yield to Me it was perfectly done.Marcy is a fighter. She is stubborn and has something to prove, which makes her determined to win. There is nothing she wouldn’t do in order to become the best female in the MMA … except accept the help from Jax the new trainer hired to get her ready for the upcoming fight.Jax is a retired MMA fighter, a psychologist, and he trains fighters to help them be their best. He was brought to Club Excelsior to help Marcy get over her fear of submission, but the stubborn little spitfire refuses him.Marcy and Jax have instant chemistry and something inside of Marcy craves everything Jax can offer. Will she let down her guard long enough to see what is right in front of her? Can Jax help Marcy accept who she really is and save her fighting career?I absolutely love fighter books and this is no exception. I can’t wait to read more in the series. Yield to Me is a FOUR star read with FOUR drenched panties!“Open for me and take it all until there isn’t aninch of your p I haven’t touched. I want you, Marcy.I want you to be utterly and completely mine.”Review by the Head Whore at Mommy’s a Book Whore.

This book was amazing.  I loved the story.  It was first and for most one steamy, and captivating read.  Then you pair it with a huge mystery, well it was such a great book to dive into.Keely and Vaughn stole my very breath and heart.  I am looking forward to book 2 alot!

Book was very sexual w a dominate man trying to set her up but he gets intrigued with her & gets everything to get her, all because a client dying is not leaving his selfish sons a dime & leaving her millions, very good & now I must go to chapter 2 :))))))

Va-Va-Va-Vaughn❤️Cocky, Alpha, ruthless, SOB are a few of the precious characteristics Vaughn is waiting to share with you. If that first line didn't hook you, he's got more."All women look the same on their knees with their mouth wrapped around my....."So for such a man what's the type of girl we're looking to see him with? A fighter? Maybe one that will turn him down? How about the shy paralegal who's scared of her boss and probably the whole world? One who's last actual real sexual relationship was to her college boyfriend. Probably the one who will finally say: No! These all describe Keely Fawes."You're making pretty bold promises. I bet you're all talk and no trouser."Because that shy little kitten took me by surprise. Curiosity killed the cat Keely and Vaughn looks like that's exactly what he needs. A pet to play with. To control. Vaughn is used to being in control and Keely is making him lose it. I forgot to tell you that Vaughn is like a messed up PI for cheaters or a person you'd like to ruin their life. He's hired to uhm, how can I put this, take pictures of himself while engaging in sex with these ex's/people he is hired to "ruin". Yeah, big A-hole he is. Oh there goes another characteristic for Vaughn."Damn, baby. You really have been starved. When was the last time you got a good mouth full?"Ggaaaahhhh. I love that man. There's a twist here. Keely has this client Mr. Ashcroft who's dying and needs to tell her a secret. He doesn't get to but his nurse June does. Not only does she shock Keely, she also scares her. Mr. Ashcroft has named Keely his heir. Left her everything. Apparently it comes with a threat to watch her back from his children who will not stop at anything to get to Keely. Where does Vaugh fit into all of this? He was hired to ruin Keely. I have a feeling I know who it is too.I hope I didn't give too much here. Actually I never mentioned the sexy times because you can read the story and find out for yourself how frigging Hawt they are. Lots of Cookie eating and many talents are put to use. Looking for a nice smutty read with a mysterious, saucy storyline, this is it. Happy Readings!*A book recommendation by TRSOR. A 1st from this author.*
WOW I enjoyed reading this author's book. Down right Dirty amazing sexual love story. The author did a great job writing this book. The characters were sucking you into the story.

I'd like to move into Ms. Kent's world.  With this short novella she has combined 3 distinct series, while continuing the love story of Mike, Laura and Dylan.  Most books end with a happily ever after; Ms. Kent gives you the happy and continues to write about the "ever after" of her characters.  If you haven't read Ms. Kent's previous work, you are seriously missing an excellent story.  I can't wait for the next edition in the lives of her characters.I was provided a complimentary copy in exchange for an honest review.

All I can say is that this is my favorite series of all time. Laura is a real women and have overcome alot to be with the men she loves. Mike and Dylan will always be my book boyfriends. Their story is unique and keeps me guessing. Alex and Josie are great too. I cant put these books down and really dont want to until the end of the story. I really do hope Julia keeps them coming. Want to learn how everything works in the end for everyone. Great read and great story.

I'm not a salesperson, per se, but I do sell. And even if I didn't ever sell anything, I believe we're all selling all the time. Just  going to a party and wanting to meet new people is a form of selling. So, in that regard, this book will benefit anyone if you look at it from the perspective of showing up as the best version of yourself.AND, if you're a sales person, this book is so much more than I expected it to be. It really offers terrific information...much more than just tips. Each tip is well laid out, short and to the point, easy to understand, and I love the "Outperforming Sales Tip" offered for each.  This author really knows what he's talking about.Definitely deserves Five Stars!
summary: Way More Than a Book On Selling

reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed this book by Scott Welle, I have some of his other books and I love the way he writes it's as if he is narrating to you while you read. I am not in the direct line of selling but as described in the book we all sell in our everyday lives so this book is of value to EVERYONE! I have also recommended it to a very good friend of mine who is a sales person and she loves it so far! Highly recommended to all, especially those in the sales field.

WOW!!  This is an other awesome book by Weston Kincade.  This book is a paranormal coming-of-age mystery and it is one that is a page turner.  I read this a few nights ago and I could not put it down because it got me hooked into this story.  This is a great book if you are into paranormal and mystery books. I promise you will not be disappointed with this one

Yefon quickly grew on me. The author weaves history, culture and her life story into a novel that draws you in. Yefon speaks to you and you eagerly sit down to listen and take it all in. You become engrossed in her story because you know it is a great one and want to know how she rose to greatness and overcame obstacles. The language and traditions of Yefon’s culture are a part of the book – the author writes in a way that you are able to comprehend what the characters are referring to (and includes a handy-dandy glossary with definitions and additional insight!).Yefon is a part of a society that does not value women and is surrounded by people that are rooting against her. What she does have in her corner is a father that tells her how special she is from a young age and that he believes she will accomplish great things because it is her destiny.  Even with his tragic death, she continues to believe and hold onto the words he spoke to her. I loved this part of the story the most.
summary: Great Read! Can't wait for the next book!

reviewText: I hold a very unequivocal view on war – it’s best avoided; but I guess sometimes it’s forced upon us and there is nothing much to do but respond to it , in consequence I don’t like the topic at all. So I was skeptical about enjoying this book, but was proved otherwise.I have a very rough idea about how the war works (it’s expected) but while reading this book which only deals with one aspect of the war I realized just how many aspects need to be kept in mind while waging war. If you have a special interest in warfare and the makings of a war, this book could be a good read. It deals with the use of tanks in World War 2 and how it came into use, which battle saw its first use, how the Allies and the Axis Powers competed over each other to develop the tank we see today, etc. For me this is a different take on World War 2 and very informative.
summary: One aspect of war told well

reviewText: Having read the truly excellent first book in the Zombie Attack series, Rise of the Horde, I really looked forward to reading Army of the Dead. I was just a little disappointed as this book doesn't contain the level of excellence, character development, and depth as the first book.Army of the Dead starts with a bang, literally. A furious pace of motorbike chases, abductions, vicious fighting and numerous zombie attacks is set right from the start of the book. In fact, there is so much violence in this story that it stopped having the intended shock impact, and only became something I read to try and find a storyline. Brutally murdered children and exploding zombie heads became a sideline and ceased to be horrifying as I read on to see what would happen next to the few characters I actually cared about.Responsibility and marriage seem to have changed Xander. No longer the cute, smart mouthed kid of Rise of the Horde, he is now neurotic, jealous of any man who looks at Felicity Jane, and extremely stubborn. Fortunately he is also very responsible and will sacrifice himself to save others.I absolutely loved the new character, Sonya, who is introduced rather early in the book. A true warrior and excellent handler of animals, she contributes much to aiding Xander and Felicity Jane  with several escapes in the chaotic post Z-Day world. However, the fact that Sonya and Felicity Jane couldn’t get along and fought like cats even while they were in mortal peril, really got on my nerves.Despite the few negative points I mentioned, I still think Devan Sagliani created a wonderfully realistic end of the world scenario. A scary world where cannibalistic motorbike gangs and power hungry Hitler wannabes fight for dominance. A place which had become the perfect playground for crazy scientists. Is it a wonder then when some of these elements decide to raise a zombie army or create genetically engineered monsters for personal gain?During the course of this very fast-moving book, we visit an old western town where a community of actors try and survive, as well as Xanadu, a colony of people who strive for harmony and healing. Apart from all the action, suspense and violence, there are some lovely tender moments in the story.For readers who enjoy nonstop action and loads of violence, I recommend Army of the Dead as your ultimate adrenalin fix. (Ellen Fritz)

"Carnal Desire" is book two in the "Severed MC" Series by K.T. Fischer & Ava Manello. Sequels are often "hit or miss", and I assumed this would be no different: the first book was so thrilling and action-packed, I was skeptical whether the authors would be able to keep the momentum.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that this book did pick up right where the first book left off.  It even flowed smoothly into the second book without pause.  If anything, this book actually read at a faster pace--something that can't often be said for a sequel.  There were so many twists and turns to keep me on my toes throughout this book.  Just when I thought I knew what was about to happen, another character would come along and make the story change direction.  This book, unlike the first one, had quite a few different points of view besides just those of Eve and Angel.  This really benefitted the story--it gave more depth and helped to keep the twists coming throughout the book.  This also created a better understanding of the characters' thoughts and feelings during their parts in the story.  I also learned so much more about each of their backgrounds and different personalities.  Unlike Severed Angel, this book did not end with a huge cliffhanger.  Nevertheless, the ending in this book is enough to satisfy you until the release of the next book.This story also introduces two brand new characters, one of whom turns out to be a main character.  You learn so much more about Ink, Cowboy, Disney, and Satan.  You also get to meet--and fall in love with--little Elizabeth.  You will definitely want to read this book, and if you haven't done it already...read Severed Angel (Severed MC, book 1).  You will not regret doing so because this series is freaking amazing.  I seriously cannot wait for the next book, and wherever it will take me.This book was given to me as an Advance Review Copy, in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Holy Hotness....Elle & Ink and Eve & Angel. WHEW! Hot stuff!!!!😍

reviewText: What a sequel.  I couldn't get enough.  We got to experience Ink and Eves new friend Elle.  I just adored little Elizabeth.  I hope they do a book on Elle and Ink, talk about some hotness there.  I enjoyed this book so much.  I was sad it ended.  It kept me on my toes definitely.

4.5 Severed Stars!!Intense. Raw. Messed up. Gritty. Crazy. Hot!  I think that pretty much sums it up. If you don’t love biker books, and you can’t handle reading about the darker side of their lives, this one probably isn't for you. However, if you do enjoy those types of reads like I do, then pull up a chair and let's chat because this book is definitely for you!Carnal Desire picks up EXACTLY where Severed Angel left off. Ava believes that she has outstayed her welcome with the Severed MC group, and abruptly flees home to England. However, little does she know that Angel's filthily evil twin brother, Satan, is hot on her trail and has not let up for a second in his determination of eliminating his one and only ever, stranded witness.Satan is a deliciously evil villain that I've been terrified of throughout this entire series. At times my heart broke for him because he has very clearly led a life devoid of any love at all. I kept wanting to find a tiny sliver of a redeeming quality in him but....nope, rest assured...there are NONE!!!I really can't say much here except for the fact that this was one of those books where I was watching a movie in my head from start to finish. There is a lot of conflict and A TON of action! So much happens in the story line- you just have to read it for yourself. I laughed a few times, cried, it had some sweet moments, disturbing moments, and some sexy sexy, hot moments!This book is unique in the sense that it does not solely focus on characters A and B. Eve and Angel are certainly still at the forefront of the story but they share the spotlight. We get to know Ink MUCH better in Carnal Desire which I did not mind AT ALL. In fact, he might just get his shot at his own HEA after having his heart broken in Severed Angel...maybe? Possibly? Or is this playboy, man-whore capable of such a thing?So therefore, the book really focuses on Eve, Angel, Ink, Elle (new character), Satan of course, and then the rest of the Severed gang.The main theme of the book is really good vs. evil. It's the Severed crew vs. the now rogue biker that Satan has become. How far can his evil reach and can he infiltrate the Severed MC and bring them down once and for all? Who will be targeted? Who's the rat? Who is safe? And who will crack under pressure? And what happens when this man completely loses his marbles and decides that attempting to even the score with just Eve, is not nearly as much fun as torturing this entire group one at a time?I will say, Carnal Desire is NOT for the faint of heart!And that ending...Amazing, crazy suspense!! I didn't want this book to end!

This is a partial review. Please read my full review on the Smoocher's Voice Blog.Josh Lanyon grabs the reader’s attention quickly and thoroughly with the novella Everything I Know. Inspired by Robert Fulhum’s book All I Really Need to Know I Learned in Kindergarten, this story is charming and realistic. The list at the beginning of the book sets the tone for this tale. The intriguing, realistic characters draw the reader into the plot through the wonderful, and sometimes humorous, dialogue.Conner Myers loves teaching kindergarten. He loves the students; he is friends with his fellow teachers. He even likes some of the parents, especially the hot Wes Callahan, Lizzy’s father. But when Lizzy is injured on the playground, Conner’s world turns upside down. Without a clear school policy in place and with a very upset little girl on his hands, literally, Conner takes Lizzy to the emergency room at the nearest hospital.Wes Callahan, Lizzy’s over protective father, is not pleased when he finds out that not only has Lizzy been hurt at the school, but also one of her teachers has driven her to the hospital in his personal car – without permission. To say Callahan is completely freaked out would be an understatement.In this novella, Josh Lanyon has created a realistic and tension-filled tale. The turmoil in this story, unfortunately, is representative of the real world of education. The prejudices against male teachers, especially male elementary school teachers, are very real, and this story brings this issue front and center. The relationship that develops between Wes and Conner seems unlikely and yet it is sort of perfect.This is a great story, and Lanyon’s talents once again shine through character development and dialogue. Callahan’s simple admission that he is an ass adds a touch of humor that helps bring realism to romantic aspect of the story. In typical Josh Lanyon style, the characters and plot are presented in an engaging fashion and the reader is left wanting for more.

Just a fun read and enjoyable read. While there Is some chronology with the other books in this "set," they are all able to be stand alone books.A great beach book or rainy day book. When "Love and Politics" was recommended to me by a friend I immediately purchased it as I'm a big fan of romance novels that explore social class and political distinctions in an engaging way. In this novel Violet Williams weaves a story about a young single mother who is working tirelessly to support her child when a Senator by the name of Jake Cunningham breezes into her life and sweeps her off her feet. Of course it not all sunshine and roses as the two navigate past hurts and current issues that keep both of them from fully delving into the romance and trusting the other to be what they need. This is an emotionally charged drama that really has an authentic story at heart, delving into the real drama of two people who need to move on from the past and step into the promising future ahead of them... one that could be a forever kind of love.The well-written novel deals with everything from the issues with navigating an interracial romance to healing from past relationships that have left both Keisha and Jake wary of falling in love again. Ms. Williams sucks the reader in with vivid imagery, strong dialogue, authentic characters and an engrossing plot that keeps you eagerly reading from start to finish. Overall, this was well worth the read and is a novel I would recommend to readers looking for an engaging, well-written and beautifully emotional love story.

I read a lot of romance books, and they tend to merge in my memory. The ones that stand out have to be well-written, with characters I care about and with some considerable obstacles in the way of their love; they're stories with real depth, that keep me thinking and caring long after I've finished. Love and Politics is one of these books: the author shows a lot of insight into her characters and their situation. That authenticity makes me wonder just how much of this might be first-hand - she really writes from the heart! Getting the first two books in the series like this is a great way to get into it, too: when I'd finished the first, I just had to go on and read the second.

A quick read with a twist. Space Sushi is about a food critic in the future named Chang who is given the opportunity to eat an intergalactic delicacy. The catch is if it is not prepared just right there is every chance the eater may die.Only the rich and powerful can afford to eat this delicacy, and the creature itself is so hard to harvest that it is a very rare delicacy at that.Chang's longtime friend Chef Nikon is the expert who will prepare the meal, though even knowing Nikon's expertise doesn't ease Chang's mind.Settled at the table of the very humble restaurant, Chang nervously awaits the meal of Kings...but it seems that every possible distraction and interruption occurs, causing Chang's blood pressure to rise.The piece of resistance is presented and all seems well...but is it?A clever story that while only short kept me on the edge of my seat waiting to see what happens when Chang finally get to eat the meal. A great read by the talented L.R Currell!

reviewText: A stolen artifact, a string of murders, and the claim of an ancient curse are all intricately woven into this new book by Robert Thornhill. Are all these events related or is it merely coincidence? This riveting and well-written mystery delves deep into the past while remaining grounded in the present.This tale of mayhem and murder explores the past and present and takes the baffled Kansas City Police down a road with many twists and turns. The clues are all there, but will they make sense? Can the mystery be solved in time?Robert Thornhill has once again created a plot that will keep the reader guessing right up to the very end. His focus on events, interesting characters, and depiction of real-life situations is what makes the book come alive. The main plot is accompanied by subplots that come together to tell a fascinating story. This work of fiction is well-researched, compelling, and an all-around great read. Navigate through the twists and turns with Walt as he uncovers what could be the most perplexing mystery yet.

reviewerName: Fictional Men's Page For Book Ho's
reviewText: AMAZING! REVENGE! SCORNED!Revenge is an evil thing and when it roots in you it makes you more determined than ever to take down your target. This last book in the series by far was my favorite. Mia plays her role so well and makes decisions that could change her life. Joe takes Mia to Russia and she meets up with her friend from ballet school and they both realize that they are known by other names, and Mia finally finds out what Joe actually does. Joe is treating Mia well but she becomes confused because her feelings are turning real because she doesn’t have anyone besides her brother and best friend. The problem still exist though that Joe is her target, she must take him down or suffer consequences herself.This book is filled with action, secrets, and deaths and it is something you must read. Now I will not spill all details to you, I can tell you this, the ending is amazing and I must say my heart mended, I was no longer angry about the end of Making Thyme. This book was written very well and you became attached to the characters throughout the series. I was so enraptured by the characters I actually felt what they were feeling and had a change of heart, when this happens that’s when you know you are reading an amazing series. I can’t wait to read other books by TJ Hamilton and can’t wait to read about Mia’s friend from ballet school. Amazing Job TJ Hamilton, this will definitely be an author that I read again.

reviewText: Lacy is an event planner at a country club/resort.  Jake is an golf manager and he is also designing the new golf course for the club.  Lacy's old boyfriend left her because he told her she was frigid.  She has never had an orgasm and she really believes she is.  She lives her life through her friends, Kay and Denise, romances.  She is attracted to Jake, but then so is all the women.  He is a very handsome man.  He starts to talk to Lacy and she finds herself feeling things she hasn't in a long time.  He takes her to lunch and they are very comfortable with each other and she realizes he really does like her.  This story is about overcoming some of our own hangups. James Scott Bell has written THE book on writing dialogue. While many gifted authors and screenwriters devote a chapter or an occasional blog on techniques for writing dazzling dialogue, Bell gathers, illustrates and explains the best of the best advice on the tricky art of crafting dialogue that readers will remember. He even details how to punctuate quotes within quotes, the proper use of ellipsis, em-dashes and other punctuation issues that trip up authors and other storytellers. The examples Bell uses clearly demonstrate the differences between publishable and dreadful dialogue.This handy book will become the same kind of gem that writers will treasure alongside Strunk & White's The Elements of Style. Buy this book for an aspiring author to prevent years of rejection letters.
summary: The Go-To Manual on Writing Amazing Dialogue

reviewerName: Orlando Sanchez "Author of The Spiritual Warr...
reviewText: Do yourself  a favor, get this book. If you are a seasoned writer this book can help you polish your skills. If you are a budding novelist this book can help you attain the skills you need. James writes in a clear and concise style that explains the execution of writing dialogue well. I own all of his books on the writing craft and it has helped my writing considerably. I strongly recommend  getting this book.
Bell nails it again with another short (very important for the busy writer) instructional. I hope he keeps writing these. A must have for any writer's library.

reviewText: What a disappointment. Let's just reach into the world view, put a mask on it and call it wholesome. I am amazed at the reviews. Doesn't anyone else see a problem here? She even strips in front of a store window to distract a bad guy after her so called spiritual awakening. No need of a savior, no heart change. Basically it is about lust between Lars and Marnie and their struggle to not give in. He, the Christian, revels in her dressing and acting the vamp. This book left a bad taste of worldly compromise.

reviewText: I had actually never heard of Reiki before, but I wandered across this book and it caught my eye.  I have always been a fan of natural healing and helping my body and mind to perform better and this book promised to do that and it delivered.  The author did an amazing job of covering what Reiki is and does, and she walks you through all the steps of how to incorporate it into your life.  In the book description, she promises to show you how to supercharge your brain.  I have been amazed at the mental focus and capacity that I have been able to accomplish with this book!

reviewText: I received this book free to read and review, as I agreed to read and review it I have but this is one of the books I would have abandoned and not posted a review. Fortunately it is a fairly short bookIt deals with adult themes including drug taking and prostitution together with a few murders.  I found the story although descriptive very disjointed, the whole story depended on a two names the relationship between which seemed obvious to me from the start.The end although unexpected, it is a disappointment; although I won’t give the plot away it at least ended the book.

I was surprised by Blue Kincaid, in Training Drew she gives you a beautiful look into the trust and faith needed for form a Dom/sub relationship. Drew goes to a BDSM club with Chad, who doesn't know how to truly treat a sub with respect, fortunately for Drew, Sebastian notices her with Chad a sees her potential as a sub. Sebastian works to end up with Drew for a night hoping he can help her learn how to be a sub but also how to choose a Dom. The lessons are taught in an indirect manner and Sebastian's technique with have you swooning. This is not hard core BDSM but it is a great representation of the honest emotions/communication needed between a Dom/sub. I loved falling under Sebastian's special!
summary: Everyone will want Sebastian as an instructor!

reviewText: It took some time to think of something to write for this review........I really really enjoyed all THREE of these books. If you are reading this review and not sure please take my advice on this one and READ THEM ALL.  RM Johnson did this.  Reading these books made me realize that you have to be careful about who you call your HUSBAND.  I don't want to give away the details in the book so I will just say......READ IT you will not put it down.  I finished this last book in less than 24 hours.

This is the first book in the Half-Life series which is about the rock band Half-Life (good name for the series then!) and this is the story of Lock, the singer/front-man of the band and Hailey.When Hailey finds out her younger sister Chloe is pregnant and instigates it was somebody from the Half-Life rock camp, she sets off to out who, seeing as Chloe is tight lipped about her baby daddy.Hailey is a Sunday school teacher so to be in the midst of the rock star world is way out of her comfort zone. However she finds herself face to face with Lock, the lead singer who agrees that Hailey can hang around to ask her questions in return for her to be ‘his’ for sexual favours for the next three nights, which Hailey agrees to.I loved the concept of the storyline – innocent school teacher meets lusty rock singer – yeah that got my literary horn dog panting! The sex scenes were extremely hot and let’s just say anything goes. Whoo-hoo! What I did find hard to grasp was that Hailey knew what to do and that she would be so eager to get down with whatever she was told to do by Lock. There was even a threesome thrown in for good measure and a little male on male action for those that love m/m*waves hands in the air*There were some issues that were inconclusive and the reader was left hanging wondering what happened. For instance the sex tape was never concluded as to who done it and why (unless I missed something) Also the Lock and Krist connection, I was wanting more of this and their backstory as after the threesome it was kind of swept under the carpet.This was an insta love story for Lock and Hailey but I felt it needed more chemistry and connection build up in order for the reader to grasp that. The sexual heat was off the charts but in order to have a believable HEA, I just wanted more (I’m a greedy bint!)It was great we found out who Chloe’s baby daddy was and a good curveball thrown in there. That would make a good story in itself.Overall a good sexy read but needed a bit more connection and more back story of the band. Three and a half stars.
summary: OK read but could have been so much more!

reviewText: My Soul For You by Morgana Phoenix is a NA contemporary romantic thriller.  It is definitely intended for 18+ readers since it was hot, hot, hot.The story is very well-written and the plot flows so smoothly that you get lost in the story without realizing how long you've been reading.  I did not want to put this book down and I read it in one sitting because I couldn't stop.  The story had so many twists and turns and surprising secrets.  I normally can figure out who the bad guy is and predict what is going to happen...but I couldn't with this book.  There were some jaw dropiing, OMG moments for me as I read.The characters were amazing.  Katie was a sweet heroine but she also had a lot of inner strength and a quick-wit.  And Kaleb was swoonworthy.  He was an alpha male who would go to any lengths to protect and take care of Katie.  The sexual tension between the two of them was intense.  I really liked Ashlee, Katie's best friend, because she had so much personality and she was such a good counterbalance to Katie's seriousness.I highly recommend this book...you will not be disappointed!!

Oh. My. Goodness!! What a sexy, yummy book! It had it all, the suspense, the humor, the steaminess, the hot guy, and the plot was sooo good. I seriously LOVE Morgana's writing. I love that it wasn't predictable and had me guessing through the entire story.Kaleb? Seriously one of my favorite book boys now. I love that he was so protective and caring of Katie. And I have to be honestly, I've been there before where I've been attracted to the "off limits" guy and this just made the story even better. Playing out a fantasy I'm sure most girls have had.Katie was such a strong character. She'd been through so much and it was so hard for her trust anyone. It broke my heart a bit with everything that happens with her, but I loved that Kaleb fought to be by her side the entire time. I can't wait for more books from Morgana.Would I recommend to others: AbsolutelyLanguage and sexual content: strong language and sexual contentAppropriate reading age: 18+
Buy the book and read it. It's so so good. Don't even think about it, you won't regret it! Promise.

'Reviewed on Behalf of Give Me Books'Lyndley was just a lawyer working one of the biggest cases she'll ever get, taking down the Nelson brothers. The Nelson brothers are the two biggest crime lords of Chicago so just taking on the case was a big possibly lifethreatening deal. She soon found out that she'd be leaving her family and friends behind by faking her death in the hope of keeping her life safe. Little did she know her life may never be safe while the two men she was trying to take down walked the earth.Ky Wakely, the hotshot U.S. Marshal who was assigned to protect Lyndley. He was on the verge of being an alcoholic because he just couldn't deal with his past. He was a dick throughout a good portion of the book but it's understandable. He didn't want to get close to Lyndley and even then he figured he couldn't because she was just a job. But playing fake husband and wife may have been just what these two random people needed.With near death experiences, being on the run, crazy plans, and fake deaths this story was a page turner filled with suspenseful heart racing action and romance. I was on the edge of my seat chewing my fingernails for most of the book. Can't wait to read the next in the series.

this book was completely unnecessary...I understand that the author wanted to meet the demand of the readers, but this book had no storyline and the series should've ended with the fourth book.the organization is mentioned a bit, but it almost seems like the author added that in just to keep people going through the repetitive story...Garrett and jade talk about her past and his family, and then they have sex and jade talks about his and abs...then they say I love you. over. and over. and over. then they have sex again. that's about it.so if you're looking to continue the suspense and intrigue from the last four books, you won't find it here!

Allie Everhart did it again! Forever You is a great story that shares another chapter in the lives of Jade and Garrett. Although this book was less of a mystery than the others it has my mind wondering what the future has in store for this young couple.
summary: I can read about Jade and Garrett Forever!

reviewText: loved this series and this book was a great CONTINUE to Garret and Jades love story. Garrett dad realizes his son is important and how he has not been the dad he should have been. Garret and Jade become husband and wife. loved it.

"Surviving Reagan" is the emotionally charged and entertaining sequel to "Executive Disclosure", delving deeper into the tangled relationship between Chad Caldwell and Reagan Reynolds. Isabella is a talented author who has a knack for creating authentic and engaging characters that forge a connection with the reader; weaving an emotional, gripping and action-packed story that has romance, drama, mystery, suspense and fast-paced thrills.What I liked about this novel is that both Chad and Reagan are strong, fierce and powerful women who are in love... but that love is tumultuous and tangled like any normal love story. As Chad tries to recover from the break with Reagan she is brought headlong into a dangerous situation that could very well lead to the deaths of thousands of women, all while dealing with the sudden reappearance of Reagan in her life. The drama is multi-layered, adding on complex storytelling that brings this novel to life in intriguing ways and creating a drama and emotion rich story you can really sink your teeth into.Overall, this was a wonderfully gripping sequel that ran the gamut of emotions from fearful to hopeful and everything in between. The author certainly achieved creating a well-written, vivid, engaging and entertaining novel that had me eagerly reading from start to finish.

Lilly is conflicted with Jeremy, he is hot and cold, caring and brutal at times.  This is strange because Lilly has feelings for this man that is confusing for her, he gave her freedom and she makes a mistake he then takes it back and leaves her in the depths of darkness.  What Jeremy wants with Lilly is still unanswered, she is his captive, used for sex and whatever he sees fit.Lilly's plan to get back at Jeremy is surely delayed as this story ended, but Book 5 hopefully will answer some more questions.  As some point this story needs to end, sooner than in later books.
summary: Lilly is in over her head with JS..........

reviewText: I didn't think I was going to like this series at all...now all I can say is..HURRY JUNE 20th!! Can't wait for the next one..although way to short!!!

"My Dad is a Zombie" is a charming novel that draws readers into Liam's world as he finds the world topsy turvy and his father a zombie with a permanent death sentence if Liam doesn't save his soul from the Land of the Dead. The well-written novel has a fast-paced, energetic and vibrant writing style that makes readers want to delve even deeper into the mystery of how zombies are taking over his little part of the world and just how he and Lupe are going to save not only his father, but all of Lemon Grove and the world at large from a zombie infestation as well.Deborah Bravandt does a wonderful job of weaving a story that is fun, humorous, packed with friendship and bravery in the face of fear, and makes for an engaging read from start to finish. The story features vivid illustrations that really bring the novel to life, adding dimension and world-building to this unique tale one page at a time. This is the kind of children's novel that both kids and adults alike would appreciate as it sucks you in and takes you on a thrilling supernatural supernatural adventure. Overall, it was well worth the read and it left me eager to see what else Mr. Bravandt writes in the future.

reviewText: I really enjoy reading this book and I will tell my friends about this author. I really happy that in the end Sumner said yes

Platinum Pleasure is a fun and steamy short read and is the first book I’ve read from Kate Deveaux. And I can tell you it won’t be my last~This story stars Ainsley who’s in her forties with a successful career but is alone on Valentines day after her ex-boyfriend left her for a much younger woman some weeks prior. In her loneliness she decides to take advantage of the assistance her friend slipped her a week prior in the form of a card, Fantasy Inc., in which they will send you a fantasy lover who’ll provide  you sexual pleasures of your dreams! So, kind of on a whim she took the offer and started checking off the list to create her lover for one night. And by chance she decided to pick a much younger lover, maybe as a way to get back at her ex for choosing a much younger lady? But she wants someone to dominate her and give her the release she craves. But there’s one catch, she didn’t expect the very young and sexy gentleman at her door to be a case of mistaken identity.Marcus, a young entrepreneur is on his way home to enjoy a lonely Valentine’s Day decides at the last minute to take on a delivery for his assistant. Having lost the love of his life years prior he didn’t think to ever find another to take her place until the occupant of the delivery opened her door showing him all her glory in sheer lace! Amused and in total shock he lets the sexy lady do her damage on him.Not wanting to reveal their identity for it’s only one night of flame gave each other aliases. Mrs. R and Mr. R. After some really steamy scenes she finds out that the young man she’s been playing with was not her fantasy lover. Horrified and absolutely stupefied, she tried her best to not think about it. And this was where all the fun came in! Trying to explain what just happened.But Marcus had given her something that she has never been given…. Being older and not getting any younger she feels beat out by the much younger and prettier woman and having her ex-boyfriend leave her for a younger woman just poked at her self-esteem about her looks even more. But being with Marcus was different. He made her feel beautiful in her own skin and even though their “acquaintance” had been short they had so much in common. Both having lost something, they connected and fulfilled what they other needed, through companionship and just someone to be there to listen to and talk with.Marcus feeling this unsuspecting relationship grow begins to change how he saw his life and began showing how life could get better if he can just get Ainsley to believe him.Awww~ This story really made me smile and giddy all over. I find that short stories like this does that to me a lot. They’re just so quick and to the point that I can’t help but just love it! Although I would have loved for it to be longer it had everything that makes it a great story from background information to development of characters throughout the story.This is one short story folks should really try if they want something quick, hot, and steamy, and it comes with a full story to tell!!!I can’t believe I’ve been missing out on Kate’s works! So now it’s time to fix that problem~ :DRating: 4.5 out 5
summary: a super steamy and cute read!
