reviewText: Sweet, sweet book. Sandy and Ev prove opposites attract and can become deeply in love. Each brought something to the relationship that the other needed. I also thought the PTSD issue was handled with tact and realistically.

Rounded up from 3.5 stars. The Silence of the Stars is a 'spin-off' of The Stars That Tremble. I'm not sure of the differentiation between spin-off and sequel, but there you have it. We are introduced in more detail to Sandy Sullivan, Mike's childhood friend from the first book . Sandy works as a contractor for Mike's home remodeling business and is hired to remodel Everett Blake's horrible orange monstrosity of a kitchen.  Everett just came out of a long-term relationship. He is a professor at the school where Gio (now engaged to Mike) teaches. He is a classically trained violinist, and comes from a cultured, wealthy family where education is paramount. Everett is Upper East Side Manhattan, Sandy is Brooklyn blue-collar.The Silence of the Stars  works as a standalone, but having the background provided by the first book is helpful. Mike and Gio are secondary characters in this story, which mostly revolves around Sandy's PTSD and its effects on his life as a civilian and those around him. Sandy is an Iraq and Afghanistan veteran. He served fourteen years under DADT and was medically discharged after a car bomb killed his closest friend over there and left him with a crippling case of PTSD. His symptoms have lessened considerably in the six years he has been home, but he still suffers from vivid nightmares and periodic flashbacks.Sandy, while refusing to apply the label "PTSD" to himself, doubts anyone can deal with his messed-up head for long. He has kept most of his symptoms to himself, not sharing them with his family or even his best friend Mike, who is also a veteran. He doesn't even want to spend the night with Everett because he fears Everett's reaction if he sees him caught in the clutches of a nightmare. When he accidentally falls asleep and wakes up having thrown Ev to the floor, the truth about the depth of his struggles comes out.Everett is supportive and comforting, but  worries he's getting into a situation he doesn't know how to handle. He fears that Sandy might get violent and unpredictable, like a man his friend was involved with who had PTSD. Ms. McMurray dealt very well with PTSD and the struggle so many of our veterans live with when they return from war. There is still a huge stigma in admitting that you are damaged on the inside. Wounds on your flesh are easily explained, the physical limits they cause understood.  But acknowledging that your mind and your heart may not heal is something that remains difficult to this day. I felt that Ms. McMurray's research was very solid on this front.I found nothing really wrong with this book. The main characters were both nice, fairly ordinary guys who meet, go out, and actually talk about their relationship. They kiss and hold hands, not shy in the least about public displays of affection.  Their relationship progresses without angst, breakups or major misunderstandings. Things were far from perfect between them, but they wanted it to work, because loved each other and truly felt futures would be better together than apart. I kept waiting for the other shoe to drop; to introduce the angst and separation they need to come back together as a stronger unit. It never came.I found the book to be bland. The heat was missing from the sex, which was often alluded to but rarely seen on the page. There was very promising talk of kink, but we never got to see if it happened or not.  Much of Sandy and Everett's conversation felt awkward. There were too many internal monologues on the part of both MCs, many of them were repetitive and didn't synch with what was happening on page.Everett's parents were stereotypical. Their every word and move predictable. Even though they had readily accepted their son's homosexuality, they were unable to accept his choice in men because of Sandy's background, both economically and educationally. They were snobby and judgmental to the extent that they almost became caricatures. I loved New York City and the outer boroughs as a backdrop for the story. They are almost characters on their own. I got a good feel for the varied cultures and character of the city.I love Kate McMurray’s writing, it’s thoughtful and thought provoking. Her characters usually have so much depth. Her main characters are real flesh and blood, and they have a vulnerability that rings true. The blue collar guy with the classical musician, such an unlikely pairing, yet so right for each other. I feel like The Silence of the Stars was a missed opportunity. I liked it okay, but I love Ms. McMurray's work in general and this one didn't live up to the standards she has set in her previous books.
summary: Not Up to Ms. McMurray's Standards

reviewText: Excellent writing, characters & location. The story moves along and kept me reading until the early hours. The characters were deep enough to command interest. The romance was hot!
summary: Above average story within a romance.

reviewText: Most times, I have troubles with novellas in new worlds. I think it's because it's hard to capture the world and characters in such a short amount of time. I am one of those people who needs the extra pages to gain a fondness for the characters. So, it shouldn't be a surprise that I've spent every day since the book was released trying to read it. I've read Carlson's other books so I knew I wanted to read it, but starting it was hard. I think I read the first page 4 times. Finally, I decided to put my head down and JUST READ IT. I'm glad I did!The world building, obviously, isn't the greatest because it is a novella, but the characters were flushed out enough that the book grabbed me after the first dozen pages and I needed to finish it in one sitting. Thank goodness it was just a novella or my entire day's plans would have been ruined by my need to finish it! While the writing of the ending (don't know why) I didn't particularly like, I liked the story as a whole. I didn't feel like I was "missing" anything profound to jump into the world of the Collectors. I also didn't feel like I was really missing anything with the characters' histories. I will say, you do know you're missing JUST enough that it keeps you wanting to read the others so you can delve further into the world, which is a good thing, but not enough to detract from the story. I also liked the use of a Dhampir and Hellhound. You don't read about Hellhounds much!So, in all, It's a short read, but it was worth it. It's fast-paced (good thing) and semi-predictable (it does have a good twist or two), but nothing interrupted my enjoyment of the book and I'm looking forward to the others in the series too.

Amanda Carlson starts off this new series of novellas, Sin City Collections, with Aces Wild and what a read it was! This is something entirely new for me, a series of novellas written by different authors to be released one at a time! Normally I'd read an anthology where we have a theme of some sort, but these novellas will all take place in the same world! So it's definitely going to be an exciting series to read! And quick too!Nevada Hamilton is a dhampir and a Collector. From what I could gather, it basically sounds like a police force for supernaturals. I wasn't able to get a good grasp on the Collectors and their buildup, other than that they collect supernatural bad guys for The Boss, who remains a nameless figure, but this is the first in the collection, so I guess answers are meant to be given so soon!When her boss, not The Boss, tells her she has to Collect a certain vampire and that her partner will be the hellhound, Jake Troubadour, Neve is not a happy camper. She and Jake had a thing once three years ago and she's never looked back on it. Needless to say, it didn't end well. Having to work with the hellhound after so much time has passed by doesn't please her. She's been doing her best to push him out of her life.Jake on the other hand, isn't too thrilled with working with Neve either. He's a bit hurt from her actions three years ago. He hasn't been able to get her out of his mind either. And naturally this leads to a boatload of romantic tension between the two.I have to say that Amanda did one helluva job writing this novella! She packed sooo much into so few pages. There was history between Neve and Jake, and we got the details along the way and then there was even more buildup around the mysterious villain! And even a hint at what her next novella from this series would be come August! It was remarkable! I always find trying to write a novella is harder than the novel, because you basically have to combine all those novel writing elements into the novella, but give the story in under a hundred (or so) pages. That's freaking hard!! Which is probably why I didn't do so hot in my high school short story class...in college my first critique group loved my over the page limit story!Anyway, this novella was just awesome! I loved it! The action was well paced and the romance was to die for! I loved that there was even something "chemical" between Neve and Jake. Something threatens to keep them apart and it will take a lot of willpower from the two of them to work it out. And let's just say wow! I wasn't expecting my own kind of reaction from the two of them! I was totally thrown into their ordeal and dying to see what would happen between them! Novellas can sometimes have an odd effect on me! I might enjoy it, but never feel totally involved in the loving of it or whatever, so yeah, I was surprised by how much I sank into this one like I do with a regular novel!To make an insanely long review short, ha!, this was the first in a new novella series and I have to say that if you love Paranormal Romance and Urban Fantasy, then definitely check this series out! There's a great lineup of authors and if you see even one name you are at all familiar with, then I suggest you buy, buy, buy the entire lineup! The series is going to have different characters with each novella, but they are all in the same world, so we might yet again see Neve and Jake pop up in the next one!Authors to look for in this incredibly amazing series are: Amanda Carlson, Kristen Painter, Sara Humphreys, Angie Fox, and Shawntelle Madison!Overall Rating 4.5/5 stars--again, my only complaint was not fully understanding who the Collectors are as a group and who the mysterious Boss is. But it might be too soon to know that second bit!
summary: A fun new serial novella for paranormal fans!

reviewText: I enjoyed Amanda Carlson's Jessica McClain series but this one was not for me. It was bad vampire movies mixed with the most overly flowery and cliche of romance novels. The storyline was trite at best and the entire novella in need of a good editor. Better luck next time Amanda.

Paranormal and urban fantasy have become very predictable leaving me unfulfilled at the end.  Reading  Aces Wild  has brought back my love for the genres, and it was all thanks to Amanda Carlson.  Aces wild's main characters are Neve,a dhampir,  and Jake, a hellhound.  They are not a normal coupling.  They don't know they are mates, and have no idea that they started the bonding process three years ago and have avoided each other ever since.  Forced to work together to collect a supernatural, neither one is happy.  Things get hot sexually, before it blows up again and Jake leaves.  The bond they started all those years ago will help bring him back  in time for Jake to help Neve fight off the supernatural after learning much about her parentage and her situation as a dhampir.  I am looking forward to reading Ante Up later this year.
summary: Tired of paranormal books until I read this......

reviewText: Kate is great, I think if she was real I wiould like her. couldnt wait to see what happend next and to see how she handled it. As with real life sometimes things happen for the better you just have to stop and take inventory of your life, Kate did this. Was rooting for her all the way.

reviewText: I was looking forward to reading more about Megan and Mark and wasn't disappointed. It is a true love story. Mark worships Megan's daughter Lucy even though she isn't his.When Mark and Megan’s pasts team together to blow their world apart, it leaves Mark in the hospital after and attack. Megan has no choice but to choose her daughter over Mark. Even though I was rooting for her to explain to Mark and not break his heart in two, as a mum I understood Megan's reasons. Poor Mark, my heart ached for him.After making her decision and landing them all in hospital, can Megan and Mark move past the horrific event?I was happy to see Megan and Mark get their happy ending, they deserved it.Reviewed by Amy Davies @ Eye Candy Bookstore

I loved reading Firecracker by the magnificent Desiree Holt. I liked that Chad, Brody and Dani were good friends first before they entered into a ménage which was explosive and I could not get enough. It was fun to see Dani's flirtatious side and have both of these alpha males lose control. I also enjoyed Chad and Brody's strong bond and that there was no jealousy involved when it came to sharing Dani. Even though this was a short story, it packed a lot of heat so readers will not be disappointed.

I really enjoyed the opportunity to be introduced to 3 new authors. The story's were inventive and kept me on the edge of my seat. I am going to amazon right now to purchase more oFrom these three authors

What’s a good girl to do when the man she loves sees her only as a friend? Why hatch a half-baked, slightly immature plan that actually works, of course. Lexi has been in love with Ash since she first set eyes on him when she was 15 years old and 12 years have not made a difference in her feelings for him. Unfortunately for her, Ash has always been kind and friendly towards her… emphasis on friendly. He’s never looked at her as anything other than a friend. However, that’s about to change if Lexi has anything to do with it.I found this to be an incredibly sweet story and great if you are looking for a quick, non-complicated novella. My only issue of contention is Lexi’s behavior. She seems very manipulative. He won’t approach her at the bar, so she dances with his friend… he won’t go with her to a secluded beach alone with her, so she threatens to go hunting for bears by herself. Her behavior was more reminiscent of a 17 year old, not a 27 year old. That being said, their romance was actually tugs at the heartstrings. Who doesn’t remember falling in love at such a tender age and still remember those feelings fondly decades later?I would definitely recommend if you’re looking for a quick, sweet read with just a bit of naughtiness tossed in for good measureReviewed by Iris for Cocktails and Books

I have been a fan of the Matson men ever since Until November was released. I devoured each book as they came out but Asher was still my favorite. This has changed! Nico is the guy who looks like he would be bad news but actually has the biggest and softest heart for Sophie after he met her and realized she was his "boom". This story follows their relationship as they meet and all in love even though Sophie has suffered in the past and doesn't believe she can be involved with anyone. Nico breaks through her defenses and makes her realize that she is stronger than she thinks.We also get to see how all the other family members are and it made me glad that Aurora Rose Reynolds doesn't forget they are  close family who loves each other and is there through the good and bad times. reviewText: I started reading Until November on mothers day 2014, nad have read each book three times now. and I have read Nico twice and it just came out 2 days ago. it is fantastic. Must read!!

Actual Rating: 4.5 starsI have been anticipating Nico and Sophie's story after the taste we were given of it at the end of Until Lily. I am a big fan of the Until series and wasn't disappointed.Until Nico follows the story of Sophie. Her life has been hard and she's just been living one day at a time. She's always kept herself isolated and locked away from the world......That is until she meets Nico. Nico turns her life upside down and makes her fell alive again....Nico knew the moment he saw Sophie that she was the one. He got his BOOM. He always believed that his family curse wasn't going to happen to him, so needless to say, it shocked him when it finally happened....As with the other books, the Mayson men are very easy to fall in love with and Nico is no exception. He knows what he wants and goes after it. He's not putting up with any of Sophie's excuses. Even though Sophie and Nico were complete opposites, they were great together. I loved watching them fall in love.My only complaint that I have is that I felt that the end was a little rushed. I wanted there to be a little more drama/action. There was all this build up with someone wanting to hurt Sophie and I felt like it was resolved way too quickly. Other than that, I enjoyed the story.One of my favorite parts of this story and this entire series, is the epilogues. I love, love, love getting a look into what the future holds for the Mayson boys! And all I will say is that Nico definitely has his hands full!!Overall, I really enjoyed Until Nico. It was fun, exciting and had great romance.

Nico and Sophie don't match.Sophie is small and demure and looks like a sweet sexy librarian.Nico is tatted up and pierced and big bruiser of a guy and he is the last of the four Mayson brothers to find love.Sophie has escaped a nasty childhood and has isolated herself from life. Nico has a huge family growing more and more everyday.Nico is ready and more than willing to find love and begin a family but will his career put him in danger?Can Nico teach Sophie to open up and accept his love and protection?Can Nico be patient enough to wait for Sophie to realize they are good for each other?Can some outside forces tear Sophie away from Nico ?So many questions to be answered in this sexy, romantic and dangerous tale of a man who accidently finds the love of his life in a woman who still is trying to find her way out of her a haunting past and how a man's love can help her overcome anything.This is the fourth book about the Mayson brothers and all of them and their families make appearances in this story and it is so sweet to see the future generations of Mayson's. If you have read any of the other books you will so appreciate this book's epilogue. Well done!!!

I love the (Until Series)!!!! it has it all. it has excitement, laughter and can be heart breaking at some point. If you're in the mood for a good book this is definitely it. P.S the sex scenes are hot!!!!!

First i would like to say, i love all of the Mayson men. Even James, is hot. Aurora has given us an amazing series with these books. I have read all of them and each time, i say that guy is my favorite. Nico is absolutely hands down the best!! I read this book in a few hours, i could not put it down. The pull that Aurora's books have are amazing, you just can't wait to see what is happening next. I hope this wasn't the end of the Mayson men.<3
I absolutely love this series. Every time a new book comes out I can't put it down. Based on the last sentence of this book I can't wait to see what is to come for this series.

I loved Nicos story.  I have been waiting for his book for a while.  I loved how he was this badass, alpha guy, who got the shy librarian.  I'm sad that the Until series is over, but each book was a 5 star read for me.

Have you picked your favorite Meyson Brother? Asher, Trevor, Cash, Nico?  You shouldn’t have to.  They are all Delicious and their own kind of Alpha.Sophie Grates is a 23yr old middle school librarian. Her mother died when in a car accident when she was 15 and lets say her father died along with her. He couldn’t face his own daughter and turned to alcohol to grief. Bad move on his part because its one of the reasons Sophie got emancipated at 16. His irresponsibilty of not watching his daughter lead to one night that turned Sophie into the lonely, panic young woman she grew up to be. Sophie only managed to make 2 friends while her time at the Job Corps. She is so terrified of people she would rather be a loner. I don’t blame her. It’s an ugly world out there. I don’t think her situation is giving up on life, its more being scared of what happens when you let poeple in. She has been on her own since 16.So what happens to this super shy young woman, who doesn’t like people touching her, and she’s faced with a Meyson brother. Not just any Meyson brother, we’re talking about Nico. Remember…ex-construction worker who sold his part of the family company to the brothers, who lets not also forget is a Bounty Hunter.If you’ve read the previous Until books, you know there is no giving up for these boys. The BOOM (The Meyson curse).“You, know the moment I saw you, I knew you were the one for me. You’re mine, Sophie. Every beautiful inch of you is mine.”In this case I think it hit Nico really, really hard and fast. Poor Sophie didn’t even stand a chance. It was either she got over her fear or Nico ws going to vanish it out of her, amongs other things he does to her. Oh and Sophie is a virgin which made it even more fun for the Beast that Nico is.“I hate that you were worried. I just didn’t know what to do. I feel like ever since I met you, I have wanted something I’ve never wanted before, and that scares me. I don’t know what I’m doing, and my head is all messed up. I just want to make sure I’m good enough for you.”I call him a Beast because from the first timehe meets her he’s already so demanding. I thought that Sophie was going to pee on herself. He’s so big, has a fauxhawk, gauges in his ears and has tattoos all over his body. Total opposites attract. Still that didn’t stop Nico. Of course not. Alpha on overdrive. What man thinks and wants for their first time with a girl to get her pregnant? Oh, this fudger does. Like seriously no condom, I want her knocked, married moved in with me in a matter of weeks. No make that days. He is straight up Cray-Cray. Crazy head over heels in love with Sophie. I loved how he sort of asked her if she wouldn’t mind, but at the same time knowing he was getting his way.Overall, a very fun read. Moved quite fast, but that was Nico’s caveman tendencies taking over. Needed to mark his territory all over the damn place. A bit emotional once you learn more about Sophie’s past. You will get some angst becuase you know Aurora has to give you something to spice up the story and she needed to put Nico’s bounty hunting skills to action. Nicely done. Author’s just a thought from my very opinionated brain…Please, Pretty Please, when a girl loses her V-card, can you make her cry, scream, possibly bleed?  I’ll leave you with Nico’s proposal to Sophie because well I felt I needed to share his Alpha side gone Mr. Softy. I also recommend you give the other books in the Until Series a chance and check out for yourself where the BOOM began. Happy Readings!!Nico’s proposal to Sophie:I knew from the moment I saw you I would do everything within my power to make myslef worthy of you. I was going through lofe one day at a time, nd then you came along and gave me a reason to plan for tomorrow. Every second, every minute, and every day, I will prove to be a better man, a man worthy of you, a man who will lve you the same way you love me for who I am, not what others see me as. I promise to love and protect you until my last breath, Sophie Jean Grates. Will you marry me, baby?

Loved Until Nico. All of the Until books are swoon worthy. I wish the Mayson boys were real because I definitely could use a Asher, Trevor, Cash or Nico. I am so glad that Nico knew what he wanted when he first met Sophie. Good thing that Nico didn't give up on Sophie's shyness and actually went in slow with his attraction to her. I am always on the look out for new and different diets to try, since most of the time I can't seem to stick to the strict, difficult or complicated diets. The Mediterranean diet definitely looks like the one for me. Simple to follow, basic diet, that doesn't limit what you can eat, or how much, and there is no counting or logging to do! Susan Conner definitely did a great job laying out what the diet is, and how simple it is to follow! Husband and I are starting on this diet right away, and because there are loads of great recipes included with this book, we already have a place to start! The book is wonderfully laid out, and makes you feel connected with the author as she goes through the diet pretty much day by day. You feel like you're right there with her. I can't wait to try the roasted eggplant dip! 5 star book, highly recommended!

reviewText: This is book 3 in the Centre Games Series. I have not read books 1 and 2 but I assure you I will be buying them and devouring them and waiting for the next book in this series. I read this easily as a standalone but want to know the other stories.When we first meet the super sexy, Dylan "Ice Dragon" Thompson he's in the ring, easily winning an MMA fight. Can I just say this guy is the total package; sexy, confident, and just enough of sweetness. We later learn he is not so "normal" as he seems, he was born with some unusual DNA, as were most members of the elite team he works with.The cute Vanessa Aldridge enjoyed watching Dylan win his fight. Vanessa ends up trying to plant herself as a mole in Dylan's gym, "Animal Instincts," to aid her long time friend and father-like figure John get ahead in the illegal supplements distribution business in this sport. She's not sure she really wants to help John but agrees to try to get into Animal Instincts somehow. Unfortunately for Vanessa, Dylan does not take the bait and doesn't accept her into his training classes.Vanessa and Dylan are thrust together through some unusual circumstances. A sweet and budding relationship ensues. Dylan and Vanessa need to learn how to be a couple even when they are not sure if it's real or just for show.I truly enjoyed seeing these two intriguing people come together and seeing how they react not only to each other but the others around them and getting their jobs done.I don't want to give up any spoilers. Let's just say this is one of those books thats a paranormal romance with just enough paranormal to make it seems not over the top paranormal. For those of you that may not like paranormal romance, give this a read, I promise, it's very well written and truly enjoyable.

Swing Trading is one of the best strategies for Forex, stocks, ETF’s and commodity trading.  It gives the trader a chance to profit on up and down price movements without the trader having to spend as much time as a day trader.  Swing traders rely heavily on technical analysis rather than fundamental.  They combine Fibonacci Retracements with other technical indicators such as Moving Averages and Support and Resistance levels.  Fibonacci Retracements are psychological support/resistance levels within a certain range of price levels in an upward/downward trending movement.  Essentially this means that stocks will often retrace a % of their previous move before reversing.  Fibonacci Retracements often occur at 38.2%, 50% and 61.8%.  Swing traders should watch for these retracements when starting a short/long position.  Walker does an excellent job with this subject, he gives readers detailed descriptions and examples to ensure their understanding of this somewhat complex trading strategy.  I highly recommend to anyone currently trading as well as those just beginning.

ok I think I liked this book better than the first, I totally enjoyed the way sparky fought his attraction for her and tried not to care because of who she was, which was the daughter of a rival motor cycle club, this is a typical biker book with violence, sex and more, totally right up my alley :)

This book continues the Starborn Ascension saga, picking up seamlessly from where the first book left off. And, to me it seemed the ploting was a little tighter. We come closer to a confrontation with the evil mastermind who may have inflicted this scourge on humanity, and Waverly and Remi do battle with greyskins, and faction of two communities they have visited.Good stuff. Action packed with scene after scene of their struggles to get some peace and normality in their lives.At every turn hurdles are thrown down before them that may totally derail these efforts.Lots of tasty plot twists as well. As the story unfolds several big reveals about the supporting characters affect particularly Waverly's attempt to shield those she cares about from futures she's seen with her new found power of Foresight.Good story, with strong characterization and dialogue helping the story zip along. Highly recommended.

reviewText: Everyone today who has cable tv know all about the Bigfoot Hunter shows on. There are other creature shows where people claim to have seen strange or frightening beings. There is a saying that thoughts CREATE things. If you think something, it will manifest into reality. I used to think my Mom was nuts for watching those shows, until I started. This is an excellent book about all of the world's stories of sightings and legends going back to creation stories. He explains why the beasts run from human beings. (Not to be snide. I WOULD LOVE TO RUN FROM HUMANS AND HIDE ALSO).  It is ok to be skeptical.......but this book talks about these, also. Not everyone can or do think alike. This is just a very interesting book, no matter what. I was sad that it was over so soon. I have never seen one. But, in Rochelle county, MN one summer, I mowed property near a wooded hill. I had to dump the grass there, and the hairs on the back of my neck would bristle. I would stare up the wooded hill, and wanted to get out of there so fast. It felt like someone was staring at me. I never put the two together, even now........ but.....something was making my intuition go wild.
summary: I was disappointed that the book was too short!

This review is so hard to write because I don't want to give too much about the plot away. So I will just say a few words.You will be constantly surprised with this book, its dark, kind of twisted,hot as hell and not what I expected at all. BUT guess what I feckin LOVED it.Catarina is not only a little crazy but she is amazing. Lethal, sexy, she is a predator indeed and watching her coming into her own is not only scary but fascinating.Marco the new team member is HAWT, I mean like panty-dropper hot. The two of them make quite a pair and I have no idea where it will lead but I am super excited about it.The dialogue in this story can be cryptic at times and since this is only the first act you will not only be left with a WTF  cliffhanger but you will also have several questions about Cat and the rest of the characters' history.Belle Aurora has some mighty woman balls, she has no problem pushing the envelope and making you feel slightly uncomfortable because you find yourself enjoying all her dark and sinister ways. I love her writing and can't get enough. I am immensely intrigued by this book and I can't wait to see where the story will go.

I could not put this book down...I read it all in one shot and I am about to read it again and again. I love all our original characters from "Pinned" and I love them even more than anything now. I really want Julian as my own...I know he is into men/Dan but he has me so in love with him. Avery and Michael, Julian's Mother are awesome new characters. I don't really like Blake though...I do not trust him!! I was kinda hoping that Zack would be a good guy and wind up hooking up with Seth. I felt that he was really hurt be Jules' original rejection. I think he really had genuine feelings for him. I also liked Liam...he has a funny way about him...I have to agree with everyone else, Maris Black knows how touch us all. Almost like your personal writer with access to your heart!!! totally great and worth every damn penny I paid for it.

Maris Black began her SSU series with Pinned and continues it with Smitten.  Both of these books are simply superb and each can be read as a stand alone story despite characters flowing from one book to the next.  In this one, Dan Fisher is asked by Avery Wakefield, a very wealthy student from Savannah to accompany her to the family mansion and be a "pretend boyfriend" for her coming out party at the annual cotillion because she does not want people to know that she has just dumped her latest boyfriend when she found him cheating on her.  While she knows Dan is gay, neither she nor Dan really know each other but Dan agrees to go along with the charade since it means spending a few weeks in a mansion and getting a new wardrobe as part of the bargain.  When they arrive at the mansion, Avery's brother, Julian, meets Dan and at first it is mutual dislike at first sight.  The story follows the developing relationship between Dan and Julian which has many peaks and valleys, but is a love story that grabs you from the start and never lets you go.  Maris Black is also becoming one of my favorite authors in the M/M erotic romance genre.  Hopefully she will continue writing the SSU series since there remains several characters, particularly Seth, whose story is yet to be told.  Don't miss this extremely delightful read and her first book in the series, Pinned.  Buy them, read them and enjoy two heart felt romances as they develop. You will be glad that you did.
summary: SSU Boys are Back with Another Hot Love Story

reviewText: The author has shown great research in the development of this intriguing story. The protagonist is an educated individual who isIs benefited by a serendipitous find of a great tool to describe past and current events by location.I definitely would like to see this story line continued.

* I received this novel from the publisher in exchange for an honest review *Going Down in Flames by Chris Cannon was such an exciting, fast paced read. There was never a dull moment. I loved that the author jumped right into motion. I understand development can take time and is a must for some novels, but for YA, it works well. I loved that this story didn't drag on. Literally in the first chapter we meet Bryn, and she finds out that she is a shape shifting dragon.It's not too long before she is being forced into dragon training school where she learns more about a species and a society she never knew existed. I enjoyed the conflict the author set up. In their world, dragons are mated according to their genes, and lineage. A crossbreed is forbidden, hence why Bryn never knew about her past...her father and mother were two very different species of dragons but that didn't prevent them from leaving the security of the only way of life they ever knew out of love for one another, making me cheer for Bryn and her parents all the more.There were an abundance of love interests in this novel making me a bit on the fence on who I wanted Bryn to end up with. I can't wait to read more about that in the next installment. Zavien is the obvious choice, but I won't lie...I liked Merrick. There was just something about him that I was drawn to.The supporting characters were important too. I enjoyed reading about the different personalities in each species of dragon (orange, green, blue, red, black). The author has set the tone for a very interesting world, one I can't wait to return to.
summary: Wonderful start to a new YA series!

reviewText: "Mirror X" by Karri Thompson was phenomenal. I could not put this story down. I wanted to know what was happening and where the storyline was headed the entire time. Thompson does a great job at keeping the reader in the dark too. The reader was able to find out what was going on when Cassie found out what was going on. I think "Mirror X" is very well written. Thompson grips the reader right away and continues to keep them hooked throughout the story. There was one revelation right after another.Cassie wakes up in the year 3025 when she had died in the year 2022. She doesn't know anyone, her entire world has completely fallen apart. She is told that she is the only person that is able to save humanity. Cassie is woken up in a world where women can't conceive. When Cassie finds out that she is the only female that is able to get pregnant and have a baby, she doesn't want to do it. She is only 17 years old and she wasn't to live her life a little. Cassie finds out what is really going on in this new world and all she wants to do is get out.Cassie is an amazing character. I loved her from the very beginning and I was on her side the entire time. Saving the world may be the right thing to do what you should have a choice not be commanded. I actually thought that Cassie was handing life pretty well for some that has been frozen in time for so long. I think Cassie is a very well developed character. I don't feel like Cassie grew up at all but I do feel like I got to know her a whole lot more as the book went on. I'm not really sure that Cassie had any growing up to do anyway.The story line and plot were absolutely fantastic. I really couldn't put this book down. "Mirror X" was great. I am looking for to the sequel because this is a story I don't want to miss. The revelations in each chapter were fantastic. I felt like I was getting to know a little bit more about the mystery of what was going on. The plot was rushed a few times, so there were a few flaws but all in all I think that the story is great and Thompson did a wonderful job. I would definitely recommend picking this up as your next great summer read.I think "Mirror X" has just enough mystery in it to keep a reader hooked. I am looking forward to the next installment in the Van Winkle Project.
summary: "Mirror X" by Karri Thompson was phenomenal. I could not put this story down.

reviewText: This is a new author and new world to me. I have to say, I found it to be very cute. How can you not love a werewolf who is taken down by a house cat due to extreme allergies. She is allergic to everything under the sun; cats, pollen, even marshmallows. Evidently, marshmallow allergies are a thing, who know? I didn't.This is a world where lycans are mated, so you have the instant love. In this case, our female is mates with a human. He finds her as a wolf, near comatose in the woods. She wakes up in a cage as a human, much to his surprise. Vanessa is a strong and has all the traits to be alpha female. Our hero is a park ranger.Someone doesn't like this pairing and is trying to put a stop to it. There is quite the suspense story around this as not only is Vanessa attacked, but Dane is too. Werewolves are dying and there aren't many to begin wtih.This is a cute story with some great suspense. I will say I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked this story. I thought it would be cute. I didn't realize that I would like the suspense as much as I did. I can't wait to see were this story goes next. According to the author's website, book two in this series is due out in the Fall. I will definitely be checking that out, plus looking at what else this author has available.

I have done it yet again. I have devoured another one of C.L's books within 3 hours.  She has succeeded in making each new book in this series better than the one before. This book has much more drama than you can ever imagine. To make this easier, I'm going to name off some characters and summarize their role in this book.Sang: Sang has been one of my favorite characters in the book. She is assertive, hard-working, and strong, mentally and physically. She deals with a lot of drama in this book. Between Rocky drama, Mr. Griffin, Jade, and much more, she has loads of problems to deal with.  It pains me to say that she deals with some hard situations and uncomfortable decisions, but she will get through them, not without scars and bruises though. As some might know, this is the book in which Sang gets her first kiss....Let's just say the kiss won't disappoint any readers. Just know everyone will get their kiss. Okay, moving on..Nathan: Nathan is the main character in the book and also my favorite for this book. When his dad comes back he has to learn to stand up for himself and fight back a little. Nathan struggles to convey his feelings to Sang in this book also. He doesn't want to hurt her but he finds out how she feels in one of the bad situations that happens to her. He will rise to the occasion as the main guy for this book.Kota: I'm sad to say that you don't see much of him in this book. Luckily, no drama happens involving him in this book. Although he is not in this book a lot, he does have a nickname for her.  ;)Victor: I seriously love Victor. (DON'T CONTINUE IF YOU HAVEN'T READ THE OTHER BOOKS) As you know since he admitted his love to Sang in the last book, he is more in sync with his feelings for her. He continues to spoil her and treat her like a "princess".North: North has good parts just this book. He finally gets to take her out on that date. (That's all I'm gonna say.............)Silas: Silas is pretty popular at their school. He is supposedly the one dating Sang and he tries to claim her as best as he could so she doesn't get any trouble with the guys. Silas will have some punches to throw around....Don't worry.....it will be epic. ;)Luke: Luke oh Luke! I am seriously in love with him. He is the best. He has some good roles in her but not the biggest......Gabriel: Gabriel doesn't have too much roles but he will get some fun time with Sang.....Mr. Blackbourne: I believe every book we read, every time we get a little more of him. He is like a onion. You keep peeling and peeling. One layer= one book. He opens up a little more.Sean aka Dr. Green: Sean gets a lot of roles in this book. He and Sang connects a lot more. Let me just tell you know.....He will do something unexpected but not what you think. or maybe it is. Teehee.Other characters:Rocky: Stirs up some trouble... So does..DanielleMarieJade (You'll find out something disturbing about her)Will: He gets literally one part in the book. Oh and it is good.Karen: She will help Sang out in some hard situationsJay: Not as bad as you thinkOverall, this book is very good. The books before have been almost a little more tender and fragile. It was as if they were glass. Something could go wrong and BOOM it shatters! This book feels more real and solid. I am finally getting a taste if the real life of the Acadamy. Oh and if you have read The Thief just know you'll see some of them on and off in the book. Once again I strongly recommend this book. It is worth the four dollars that you planned to use at McDonald's. So worth it!! This isn't a book in the series you can skip. Don't even try. I swear once you read it you will love it.Btw, if your not a fan of the reverse harem thing going on than don't read. (I honestly don't understand when people leave a bad review when they know it's going to be centered around that) Anyways, I hope you enjoy the much as I did. I really whole heartedly did!!-Devianna Smith <3
summary: C.L Stone had done it again!!!!!!

reviewText: I love all of C. L. Stones books so much. She is an amazing author, and makes you feel for the characters. I will for sure continue reading!

Another great book. Made me cry made me laugh and made me fan myself it was getting so hot. Loved everything about it, everything that made me start reading this series came back with a vengeance. Favorite books in the series so far. A MUST READ for everyone

I love this series but the last book with the Volto drama took something away from Sang's relationships with the boys. This was just what was needed - it's back to being a romance with a side helping of intrigue instead of the other way around.

I have been searching for a book that is well written about Minecraft and thank God I found this one. This is the best guide and tutorial book. The book is easy to read and the steps are very easy to follow as they are accompanied by clear pictures. I love this book and recommend it to all.

I had trouble with the early part of the book. It just didn't seem believable. The sexual tension between Leonide and Celeste was exciting, but I could not figure out why he did not see the difference between helping local Estonian women find good husbands, and kidnapping an American and "training" her for a husband she neither know nor wanted. Even though it was revealed at the end that the practice was begun by his father and taught to him from a young age, it just wasn't believable.
summary: Got Better as it Went Along

reviewText: The writing is good, the plot solid, and I enjoyed it all, except for one thing: the drapes didn't match the carpet. It nagged at me for over half the story.
summary: Good story, one massive plot hole.

reviewText: Over and over as science advances and religion offers "eternal truths" each generation needs people who can be at peace within themselves that both science and religion can have a place in the hearts and minds of the same people, and that there are many good ways of striking that balance. This is a story of a young man and a young woman discovering for each of them where that balance lies, and helping each other in discovering that balance, even though they both respectfully reach slightly different answers. Well told, and dealing with a difficult and important decision. Easily at least a solid four star book.
summary: How Do Science and Faith Co-Exist?

reviewText: I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads.I wanted to like this book much more than I did. I was intrigued by the blurb, but the book was not what I was expecting.To fall in love at 22 is all or nothing for Hallie. Having just finished nursing school, she's catches a glimpse of man candy on her first day at work only to find that Ryan has transferred to another floor after she finally meets him. Sean, the hospital social worker, another piece of man candy, seems nice enough, and she can't help but wondering what his story is.Ryan makes the first move and Hallie tries to resist the irrestible Ryan and fails. Falling deeply and madly in love, they spend weeks getting to know each other until tragedy strikes.Hallie must pick up the pieces of her world -- the question is does she know how to do this?~~Wicked Reads Review Team~~

Angelina has broken down everything you need to know in order to use essential oils to help with your weight loss. Remember they are not some miracle but a good addition to a healthy lifestyle. Make sure to read the directions closely as essential oils are powerful  medicine. If you are looking for an edge on your weight loss I would check this out.

This book is an all-in-one kind of book, the majority of the book covers how to be happier in life but also after that, there's a neat 30 day guide on how to increase your happiness on a daily basis. It's wonderful to be able to read a book and also have a game plan daily to adapt the concepts on a daily basis! I'm very impressed with how the author went about constructing this and I appreciate it tremendously! Real valuable book for people looking to increase their happiness on a daily basis.
I would like to thank Zoe York for giving me a free copy in exchange for an honest review.I love this series and I loved this book. I enjoyed reading it. Very heartwarming.

Simply amazing... Zoe does it again with another hot and steamy book about Beth and Finn... This is a must read for all ... Two people who have this love hate between them ... Find out in this book if they have their HAE!

Thanks Joyce for sharing all these recipes. Recipes in this book are so yummy and I am trying to prepare every cake one by one at my home. These recipes are very easy to follow. And I agree with you; " A day without a cake, is the day wasted."

At more than 125 recipes this one is a great buy. I had never imagined there were so many uses of essential oils. The author goes to great lengths to ensure that there are recipes for every person. There are different recipes for all skin types. Essential oils can take your beauty secrets to a whole new level. There's no reason for you to not give it a try if you haven't yet. This book is the perfect low cost way to start. Go grab a copy.
I loved all of Eli Easton's books - this is probably one of my top 3 of her books - Kevin and Chuck are great - Brian is really great too

This was the first book that I have read of Victoria Ashley. I got addicted to all the posts on FB...all the counting down the days and all. I was a little nervous just buying the book randomly without reading any of her books before but I'm glad I did. This is a amazing book containing the darker side of romantic novels. It's amazing just to see how good she writes. I love it when the authors have one chapter be in the males point of view and the next chapter being in the woman's point of view. Her writing flows well.This story is about a male stripper, Slade, who has this set of rules. One of them consists of never sleeping with a woman twice. As you can predict he ends up breaking this rule. You learn why Slade is the way he is and end up falling in love with his character. Great book with great scenes!

Slade is a stripper. A filthy-talking manwhore. Aspen is staying with her friend, Cale, for awhile. Cale is Slade's roommate. Aspen is obviously attracted to Slade but denies him through most of the book. And he all of a sudden turns into a good boy because Aspen is the only one he wants. Not very original. I recommend this book if you're in the mood for something quick to read that contains raunchy language, but there's not a lot of substance. I didn't care for it.
summary: More like porn than a novel

reviewText: LOVED this book!  Slade is raunchy and brash and down right dirty mouthed, with enough cockiness to almost make you want to smack him, before you give in!  Well written, and entertaining!  Will def be reading Victoria Ashley's other books!  If you want a wild ride, this is the book for you!  Not usually a fan of the "females" in these types of books, but actually liked the female (Aspen) in this one. The heart of gold male stripper was a treat to read, so I advise you to come and get you some!  You'll be glad you did!
Wow absolutely loved this book.  Very dirty and RAW can't wait for Hemy and Cale's stories because they were just as good in this one.  I would give this book more than five stars.
Just couldn't put this book Down. Dirty, Filthy, Hot, pressure cooker!!! Loved the storyline and all the walk of shame characters!!

This story is somewhat different from what I read. Lots of cursing and sex! But the really cool thing is there is a story here.  Two people messed up. Then meeting and healing each other. I enjoyed this story.
This book was great! I loved the fact that it was from a guy's point of view most of the time. Great characters and most importantly great sex scenes!

Slade Merrick is a addictive bad boy whose past will bring you to tears. Victoria Ashley has done an amazing job bringing to life characters you can relate to on many levels.From hotter then hell lust to deep passionate love. This book has it all. I couldn't decide at times whether to take a cold shower or grab a box of Kleenex. It's a roller coaster ride that can't be missed. Bottom line it's a story of never judging a book by its cover (90% of the time lol) . Enjoy the walk of shame like I did. It'll make you crave the next installment like you will Slade.
Awesome book. This is the first book i ve read by this author. I cant wait to read more of her books. I definitely am looking forward to the next book in this series.

A nice and a little bit different story with good writing. The ending was unexpected, and it made me wonder if a sequel is planned or not. The ending came also a little bit too fast, but overall this is a nice story.
Simone's adventures in dating would make me give up dating for good! These are cute mostly funny stories. An easy read. The details are a little crude for my taste.

A good majority of these books were really really good and fairly well written. However a few were hard to get through and needed a lot of editing help. All around this was a good purchase because 10 books for the price of 1 I mean who can turn that down!

Elsie owns an elite B&B; in a remote outport on the island of Newfoundland on Canada’s east coast. Completely self reliant, she is proud of her success, even if it has come with a price. There’s not too many ‘fellers’ kicking about the small town of Heart’s Ease and Elsie has sworn to never fraternize with the guests...ever again.Smoking hot Scottish artist Cam needs inspiration and the busy streets of London are just not cutting it. When his sister books the remote location overseas, he reluctantly agrees. Finding the place proves challenging, though not so much as keeping his hands off the deliciously rigid owner.Against Her Rules is the witty contemporary debut novel from Victoria Barbour. The author has created rich characters that charm the reader on every page. Barbour’s setting is vivid and her storytelling is tight. I look forward to many more charming and fresh stories from this wonderful new author. I think she has a very bright future as a romance novelist.
summary: My review for Against Her Rules

reviewText: I'm really glad I decidedto grab this book."The Portal" takes you onan adventurous  journeywith  characters that keepyou riveted to every page.Can't wait to read the  wholeseries. Thanks!

Baby, be mine..Not one baby but two...Jake is left with his very young twin babies, his ex just popped up one day surprise....oh by the way. I don't want to raise them.....so his best friend Mike tried to help him.....Okay two single men, clueless to babies, tried to do this on their own...no, disaster.Well, Olivia came to the rescue..sister of Mike and she use to have a childhood crush on Jake....without giving too much away, but Mike was a little bit of a sneak, when it came to getting Olivia to help Jake...remember childhood crush....kiss on 18th birthday, has not spoken since....Fun read. The rightful inheritor agrees but one stipulation is that the heir marries his illegitimate daughter whom he loves and wants to ensure she will be cared for although he makes no provisions for his wife who has been by his side with his mistress and his sickness.

it was a ok read 50% of the book was part one .i found myself skipping some pages. it was a lot of flash back momments that really didnt have anything to do with the book. i dont know if i will buy part 3  but it was a ok read

This entire story was like a yo yo. It seemed as though no issue was ever resolved, the new omega, the addition members from their enemy pack or even the focal point of the story between Michael and Justin. This book was slow and boring.

This is a very good book. The only thing I don't like the author does not let us know how much time has pasted. Where are they as far as school wise. I have second book about to read. Hope all goes well for Vanya and Percy.

There's only one thing i can say to the author Mark Dawson hurry up and get the next one done i can't wait. What a great read this was just like his others. If you haven't read any of his books yet what are you waiting for

Great Book! Every woman wants to find her Prince, it is not always easy to but this book gives us the tools we need to make it possible. We all know that in the beginning relationships are wonderful, we think we found our soul mate only to be shattered. I believe we each have one person we are meant to share our hearts with, and finding that person can take a lifetime. This book is written in a perfect format and is very easy to get and understand. And it gives us the power to find the one who is meant to hold our hearts. The author Amanda Hollingsworth clearly spent a lot of time and thought into making this book happen. She has a wondrous gift and I thank her for sharing it. I strongly recommend this book to everyone and remember, You have to kiss a lot of frogs before you find your prince

I love this serial read more than is probably good! I love the mystery of why Claire killed Gannon Dodd, the forbidden romance of Claire and Irish..the ongoing evilness of Dakota Cassidy as she prolongs the story...part by exciting part. <3

Well it is almost bitter sweet to write this review. I am sad it's over and definitely want more, but it was such a sweet series and would definitely recommend. If you are looking for a series with love,friendship, little drama, and great characters this is for you. I will definitely be on the look out for anything else by this author!

You know a book is good when you get so mad you actually say out loud "HOW CAN YOU BE SO STUPID AND LET THAT HAPPEN??!?!"Thats what happened when I read this series.  The ups, the downs, its so much like high school but in some ways its better. Because they knew what they really wanted and worked hard to get there. Amanda  Chayse did a wonderful job with this series. I laughed, I had some tears,  I got angry, but most importantly, I could feel for the characters.
summary: True love is worth fighting for

reviewText: Can't believe that I got this book!! I love music and I love to sing. This guide has much information that I needed as far as music is concerned. The book is easy to read and understand and I had fun going through it while applying the information provided. I would definitely recommend this book to all music lovers out there and those who wanna be artists.

Your heart tells you to jump, but your mind wants you to stay cautious of the man before you, do you jump or run? Kassie wakes up in the hospital with all her memories, the good and the bad, all gone. As she is picking up the pieces there is a man with dangerously alluring dark blue eyes that causes her already hurting mind to spin even further. He makes her heart skip beats, but there is a small voice that tells her she should keep her guard up.Love Undone by Diana Nixon was very well written, good flow without extra fluff some books might add. Kassie has fun witty fights with Daniel the alluring dark man. Daniel will make any woman weak in the knees. I loved reading this story, you feel for both characters. Kassie because she is trying to piece together a life she can not remember, and redealing with tragedies from her past. Daniel, well no one is perfect and no one has a clean past, but you still got to love him. This might be a book that I will eventually pick up a paperback if there ever is one :) go grab yourself a copy!

Wow!  Is usually the impression I get after reading one of Diana Nixon’s books and this one holds this feeling to be true as well.  Nixon gives us another amazing book of romance, determination, wit, charm and love.  You will fall in love with the characters as always.  I love reading books by this author because I just know that they are always going to be 100% amazing!!I don’t give away any spoilers in my reviews so you just have to take my word for it.  This book is a must read and one that I will read again (once I get through my TBR list).  I highly recommend this book as well as all of her other ones and this gets 5***** all the way around.  *Holding my breath until her next book comes out.*

I wish I could give half stars because this really is a 4.5 star review for me !! I did enjoy the book , it was a quick read and kept me very interested. I had one issue with it and I will get to that after all the good stuff !! I will definitely read more from Annalisa Nicole and I would recommend the books to others. If you have been following the series you have already met the family and are pretty well acquainted with the whole Wellington clan and their extended families as well. This book is about Adrian Wellington and his ex-wife Shay. I will admit I did not read books 1 & 2 but that did not hinder this book at all for me.Adrian is a HOT,single 35 year old. He runs a construction company and loves being with his family. For years he has been missing something or maybe just someone. You quickly learn that 17 years ago he was married to his high school sweetheart Shay. After a tragedy strikes them Shay takes off without a word leaving behind only divorce papers. Leaving Adrian to pick up the pieces of a life changing injury and some serious depression. Now on the brink of a great work project Adrian is face to face with the woman who ruined him. When Shay took off all those years ago she went to college and became a pretty successful architect. The memories of that tragic day have never been far from her mind. Because of her choices she lost the only man she has ever loved. Now forced to move back to her hometown to care for her sick mother Shay will be forced to face her past and finally tell the truth and find closure about her leaving. Reading about both their loses and suffering was heartbreaking. I could relate and understand their insecurities. I loved reading about their re-connection. It was a beautiful heartfelt story of love , healing and honesty. Of course the HOT SEX was a bonus !!!!!WHAT I LOVED-* Absolutely hands down loved the Wellington family ! I enjoyed what each and everyone of them brought to the story and what they will be bringing to future stories !!* Adrian is a phenomenal hardworking guy ! He is so full of love for his family and Shay.* I loved the twists and turns , the bits and pieces of real life drama that were easy to connect with.* Without spoiling I have to say that I LOVE what Shay and Adrian do. It was beautiful and heartwarming when they opened their hearts and home.WHAT I DISLIKED-* SHAY OMG she drove me crazy. This happens every now and then in books. I understood her reason for leaving 17 years ago. But her actions during certain parts of the re-connection were just immature and ridiculous. I wanted to strangle her. Adults are suppose to talk things out.*As much as I loved what they did to create their family I hated how they jumped so fast to do that without any real reasoning and then how it happened so fast for them it just seemed unrealistic.I am looking forward to going back and reading books 1&2 and Annalisa set up a great path for the next few stories as well !!

This book has a good story behind it and the artist tries his hardest to hide from cameras. Every artist has that problem with poperatzi. This guy worked hard to get everyone to like his songs and buy his records. Music isnt always the easiest thing to sale. This guy in the book struggled and had a hard time making music. Everyone wanted to be in his business. He had females that he left the concert with and poperatzi wanted to take pictures. Anyone that hangs with a band deals with this too. Managers are always there willing to help handle your needs. It takes some good songs to get that many records sold. I buy cds sometimes just for one song. Many people now days dont even bother with cds since ipods came out. I recommend this book to an artist.

We all have had those heart throbs musicians, or even actors that we have dreamed about. Every wondered or dreamed of living like them. Well if you ever were curious of this then i highly suggest this book. It talks about the life of a famous pop stars. He shows you the behind the scenes of a day in life of a star. All the crazy temptations they have that can lead to some of the crazy stories we always hear in the media. You think would think that with all the advantages they have that everything would be so grand. Which in this book you see how money and frame has a habit of just sending people over the edge like the old saying states money does not buy happiness.

Ace is the perfect bad boy. And he wants the good girl London. London witnesses something that has her on the run and she has no choice but to leave with Ace. At first they try to deny everything between the two of them and then???yeah I will leave you at that as you need to pick up this awesome book.Every time I flipped the page I didn't know what to expect but wow did Shanora have me on the edge. I absolutely loved this book. It shows you that yes true love can really happen even if you don't think your capable of it. I loved Ace and London.Grab your copy you will love them too.

Even though the title of the book is "Paleo Recipes: On the Grill", Beth has also included some wonderful recipes for side dishes, salads and desserts, together with 3 meal plans.  All this, in addition to the mouth-watering recipes for grilling. Excellent value.

This book is full of twists and turns. You loved to hate the one character that caused trouble. It made you cheer, when they won over the animosity that was their life. It was thought provoking.  Thinking of the past mistakes and the What ifs. We all hope and pray for a do over. A story about how one person's life can affect others. How one action can have a rippling affect. I truly enjoyed this, yet another Sienna Mynx's creations. From the mind of this brilliant storyteller.  Bravo.

I love this author and I always enjoy reading her books. This book did not disappoint me either.  Ketura and Crispin have are from two different words but have several similar wants circumstances concerning there family.  Crispin is the typical billionaire that doesn't want to follow the rules but has to or is forced too.  Ketura's very intelligent, and learns to move her life in the direction that she needs it to be in.  I liked the chemistry between the Crispin and Ketura and I was glad that everything came out into the open.  I do wish that Ketura had at least slapped the S^&* out of Mae for what she did. Good Job Ms. Mynx!

I was not sure what to expect after reding the description of this book! Well it was more than I bargained for. A few grammatical errors did not detract from the steamy story line! Loved it from beginning to end. Ready for more even!
I loved every thing about this book. Even the love scenes are not over the top. From previous books by this author this proved to be another exciting love story.
This was definitely a different vibe from this author. But this is Sienna Mynx and anything she writes is beyond enjoyable. I liked it...a lot!
Definately worth the money. I even picked up a few new authors to follow and  a couple new series to finish.  There was a book or 2 that i have already read and to reread them was great.

Book two was seriously just as good as book one, on to book three...original ideas, very detailed, very funny at times, I just lived it I just started book three just wanted to come back for my review, this couple and there life us great I want it, hmmm highly recommended GREAT.

Who loves gold? Almost everyone loves it! Want to learn how to trade it? Then this guide is for you...I learned a great deal of information and how-to with this guide. It provided good background information, tips, examples, gold trading options, gold forex trading, trading gold as a currency etc; the subjects in this guide just go on and on. There is a wealth of information here, so do yourself a favor and read this, I highly recommend it.

Good action, an  an interesting story, if a bit on the superhero unstoppable special operator side. My main complaint: the story is constantly hopeless-no plan ever works, it just keeps getting worse and worse, one impossible scenario after another barely being survived...just let one plan work out as less than a total disaster? The  story is a bit short as well, and another cliffhanger ending? I will definitely get the sequel, though. This story is worth your time for sure.
summary: Very good, in the same vein as the previous stories

reviewText: Omg another great book in the series. I can't wait for the next one. If you want a great book look no further.

Anne Glynn provides a richly detailed read that hooked me from the beginning pages! Twenty-five year old Louisa Jolene Hanlon (Lisa) is a mail order bride on the run. She  found refuge with her uncle Ted Hanlon at his Broken H ranch for three months before he passed away, while he didn't have much he left everything to her,something that should have provided a measure of security, instead a telegram arrives that says FOUND YOU! As if the telegram isn't enough she finds a strange man in the barn, could it be that he is after her?A different type of mail order bride read for certain made this a page turning read for me. I found the characters of Lisa and Pearce interesting. I couldn't help but wonder why she was running, and the author feeds snippets of information that kept pulling me along making me need to know more! Lisa was a strong character that wasn't afraid to do what needed done.  The feelings are certainly apparent between Pearce and Lisa but that's the last thing either of them want. Speaking of Pearce he really isn't what he appears, he has issues from his past that really add another layer to the story. A very well written story with a fast moving plot that kept me engaged from beginning to the end. Anyone who enjoys reading historical romance will find this one to read, but if you're like me and enjoy mail order bride stories this one certainly provides a fresh twist to that genre. Anne Glynn has gained a new fan here I can't wait to read more of her work!
summary: A different spin on the mail order bride genre a must read!

Silly girl tricks are for kids sorry she played herself...onto the next one. Channel did it again....lots of surprises and sad moments...however the book was rocking.

reviewerName: Confessions of a Y.A. and N.A. Book Addict
reviewText: I loved the premise of this book; lovers reunite unexpectedly.  I even liked Regan.  I enjoyed her chemistry with Lucas as well.  I didn't like Lucas as much as I'd hoped and even though he grew on me, I still didn't feel the level of connection I usually do.  It really had to do with Lucas's actions when he first met Regan.  I really would like to tell you exactly why, but that could spoil the book for those who haven't read it yet.  There was a chat later that cleared up some of my questions but I didn't feel like they were strong answers.I read it quickly but did have to put it down at the 55% mark because of Lucas.  I was also expecting more resistance from Regan regarding giving in to her feelings for Lucas.  I was also hoping for more clarification regarding Regan's parents.  There were somethings mentioned at the beginning of the book that had bearing on Regan but then nothing afterwards.I really felt as if Chasing Forever had a lot of promise.  It was a quick and short enjoyable read.  I haven't read anything by Lisa Cardiff in the past and look forward to seeing what else she's written/will write.

Hey! I just finished reading this book.. It was a simple, easy read, but also was over flowing with action-packed chapters. This Mine craft Novel is a book about Steve.(If you play Mine craft then you will understand! )There is a hacker in Mine craft and it's Steve's job to protect everyone in Minecraft. This is the Xbox version in mine craft, so there share tons of giant endermen attacks. I would recommend this book to boys 7-11 and maybe some girls, too! I hope this helps you make your decision!!

I really enjoyed this book!  Shana is in love with her high school sweetheart but when he proposes after graduation she just does not feel she can accept because she wants to go to college and leave her small town.  Years later when she returns home to stay, she runs into Brody again and the chemistry is still there.  This time though Brody is not going to let go as easily as the first time.  This is such a great romance and I loved the ending!  I received this book from Stormy Night Publications as an Advanced Reader Copy.

I got this book for a friend who was worried about his hair loss, and looking for an ultimate remedy for his lose in hairs. I must confess this book discuss the subject thoroughly and left no stone UN-turned. Some wonderful tips like food to avoid, Foods to take and some awesome herbal remedy for hair loss treatment. This book is a gem to anybody looking for treatment of their hair loss. Highly Recommended.

Review from ChannellingCloretta.blogspot.com:This story was the most honest account of relationships that I have read this year. The heroine Mia is your average party girl who always having drinks and sex. Good times, good times. But with all the good times, she is lonely and needs more, than the good times.One evening while Mia is at the club she meets Grayson, who happens to be her kindred spirit.  When reading this book, you will find that these two souls are made for each other, similar to Plato’s’ theory of the bellybutton. Well if you haven’t heard the story before, here it is (bet you did not think you would be getting a philosophers story while reading a review on this book). Once upon a time… LOL.Two people who were made for each other (physically, mentally, and spiritually were conjoined. Their love for one another was so great that they were separated per the gods request. (I know heartless bastards).  After they were separated, Apollo, sowed their bodies up, only to leave a bellybutton so they could once again find their soul mate. The humans lived in angst, searching to find their soul mate. Through misery, with hope to see their soul mate again.Grayson and Mia are my version of this concept. They were both two hurt, lost souls. When they meet they feel their powerful connection to one another. They feel something different, than the numbing of their life from meaningless sex. They have found one another. Two peas in a pod. Yet, Mia is resistant to this connection. She only wants sex from him. Per Mia, “Save a horse, ride a cowboy.” The question is will Mia let her past go and be with her soul mate.Grayson by far is so profoundly awesome. He has this realness about him. He is so vocal of what he wants and if this had some bondage in it, I might call him a Dom in the making. Though he acquiesces to Mia on many occasions and is patient with her fears, like her knows himself, he only did this to keep her near. His devotion for her was off the charts.The supporting characters did a wonderful job and their words were powerful and help to guide Mia and Grayson’s story along beautifully. All the characters were so real.Overall, I was pleased with this story and the graphics.P.S. I would love to get Steph’s story. She is so insightful but briefly displays her fears.
summary: I liked it. It was honest and sweet. I truly love me some Grayson.

reviewText: I love stories about women who make up there mind  about love and to trust God for He is always with us  to guide our lives and a baby makes a story come alive .

I flove flove flove Seth and O. He is so my bbf *heavy sigh*. I always love a good book when the alpha and H finally finally communicate and what a HEA. Awesome writing and looking forward to more from Skyla Madi.
Oh boy, that Seth Marc is effing awesome!!! Jackson his best friend needs to get his ish together. Skyla needs an story bout him and Serena
This was slow to start . After it took off it was interesting. Ellie is a strong willed woman who is not afraid to stand up for what she believes. It's always nice to have a strong female In a story.
