reviewText: I am becoming a HUGE fan of Deborah Bladon. I have enjoyed all her books I have read. The perfect amount of story, lust, love and everything in between!
Like this one but not as much as the others in the series, I found myself getting bored.

I have enjoyed all of the books in this series. It's the most satisfying feeling when a writer knows how to write and capture you completely in the world of their books. Deborah has done that and this ending to such an intense book was exactly perfect in the end. It had just the right amount of drama to keep you intrigued , chemistry that solidified the main characters and an ending well deserved.
Glad to see some "happy" in this saga of half-truths and manipulation.  Who would have known that Jax could find some satisfaction in his life with Ivy away from the high powered life he live in.
Funny Sweet and well written with great characters I immediately want the next in the series when I finish one. My only problem with these stories are that they aren't 800 pages long ;)

How is it that I've failed at failing for so long? I had no idea that failure is a time to change course like the author illustrates in the first book "Failing Upwards", he did a great job at laying down the logic in a way that is easy to understand. The second book "The Power Of Habit" really dived into how habits can make and break you, these two books really complimented each other and I was impressed. Both books are a great read and this prices is excellent! Glad I found this book and recommend it to anyone who is a fan of developing their skills and abilities in life more!

This book by Benjamin Chapin is a combination of his popular books 'Falling Upwards' and 'The Power of Habit'. The two books, in this bundle, go hand in hand to lay the ground work of how successful people think and therefore succeed in life.Failure, shown by many examples in the book, is often just an important turning point that, if used wisely helps you gain greater knowledge and understanding in order to overcome your challenges and help you to run headlong into a successful future!How to control bad habits and develop newer, more effective, life enhancing habits is clearly elaborated, in this important book. The importance of perseverance in pursuing your goals is highlighted because you never know when you are just a few feet or even inches from your desired goal.Never give up!  Learn how these important principles can help you achieve the success in life that you want and deserve. The Q&A; at the end of chapters guides your thinking with insight to removing the fears that hold you back.Get this enlightening book bundle to guide you to your goals the quickest way possible!  You'll be glad you did!

The disaster that destroys society in this novel by Kurt Gepner is a truly unlikely set of circumstances but the damage as depicted in this surely breathtaking in its severity.  Fighting to survive in this nightmare scenario is a humble man trying to gather his family, friends and neighbors for a trek out of their doomed city and to a questionable future in the mountains.  The author does a nice job in developing some of these characters into decently complex people and the fears and apprehension exhibited by the travelers resonates with this reader.  The writing was a little uneven in parts though, but overall very descriptive.Though some of the usual tropes from this genre are present here, I was also amazed at some twists not only in the plot but how villains and heroes seem to switch places depending on circumstances.  Additionally, let me say the passage describing the trip from hell on the "bicycle built for two" was haunting in its brutality.Of course, with a book with this many characters, some of the plotlines remain unresolved.  Hopefully, this means the author is planning a second book because there is still plenty of story to tell here.
Loved all the characters can't wait for more books to come out. Anyone who's a fan will enjoy this book.

This was a sweet novella, though totally predictable. I'm reading the first book in the series now, and have to say that this was simply too short to really invest in the characters, and I think the full length novel will provide that connection and depth that I felt was needed here. Still, it was a quick read and enjoyable all the same. I love the author's writing style and how the setting really comes to life. I'm looking forward to continuing with the series.
I just like a story that does not have a lot of sex in it but still has a good story to it

reviewText: I enjoyed reading this book that teaches you to become successful and to be practically set for your daily life habits which will help you to manifest your money. It gives a lot of tips to know how to construct a law of attraction and ability to detach things to achieve what you desire into your life. This book is very useful and helpful! Great job!

Let's face it you get so much more out of a book than information culled from surfing the web and author Nicholas Meyer's latest book 'Dirt Cheap Detox: 101 Ways to Detoxify' is another example of why I turn to E-books if I really want to learn something. Everything is in this book that you could possibly need to know about how to 'auto-detox' on a budget and in a healthy way. This is a gem of a book and a real bargain for anyone serious about detoxing and losing weight. Recommended.

Characters take shape with personalities all of their own. Realistic conversations and personality traits are uniquely mixed in this fantasy novel. There's not only magic and heroism within the story, but the skillful writing of suspense and love. It definitely sparked my curiosity page by page and I look forward to hearing more from D.R. Hitt.

D.R Hitt cost me some sleep. I stayed up all night trying to figure out the fate of these characters. Fantasy isn't one of my favorite genres, but this book stood out to me. The writing style and character development is top notch. I am really excited to read more stories from him, he has definitely sparked my interest in fantasy with this book. Reading this story has been a thrilling roller coaster ride. I got this book through a review site. I decided to give it four stars because it's really good.

So I have read many of Jet Mykles stories including all of heaven sent and indigo knights. These are great stories pulling you in and making it feel so real with emotion. And this story was different. I love this series but I didn't like only Lance's point of view. Not did I like that there was so much time explaining what happened in the past. I'm suppose to believe that these men are different people and that they learned from their past. However so much time was spent talking about the past that I had a hard time wrapping my mind around them getting back together. The story was sweet and funny, but It could have been so much better if more time was focused on the present and less on the past.

I received this book in exchange for an honest review. LopThis series is definitely better. I liked when they went into Adere's mind and they had to figure out the fairy tales in order to get through her mind. I liked Alyx's rousing speech to vet the troops ready for battle. I like that Passar redeemed himself and finally found peace. In fact, I don't think there was anything I didn't like although I do not want Jordan to end up with Cleo. I don't like that I have to wait until the next book comes out.

After Alyx made a deal with the devil in book 3 (well a demon anyway) you knew that in order to save Israel from a terrible fate that a fantastic adventure was going to happen. What you also knew from the events of book 3 was that Israel was going to have a hard time coming to terms with what happened whilst he was in a coma, as was Alyx.Israel really grows up in this book and I have to admit to now understanding what Alyx sees in him. As for Alyx I didn’t find her quite as annoying!! Don’t get me wrong I love them both but their relationship finally really clicked into place. Even if their relationship in this one is on hold to a degree.One of the threats that they faced are defeated in this instalment, in spectacular style. Our other favourite part of the love triangle looks like he may also get granted a HEA.There is another side story going on in this book that is setting the scene for what is to come. Alas for fear of giving away too much i’m not going to tell you who is involved in this side story. We have met them before and their back story has been vaguely hinted at in previous books, and I mean very vaguely.I am desperate for the ending of the series and how it will all come together and how their relationship ends up. I really, really want them to get a fantastic HEA.Please note I was given a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.
summary: One Threat Down, One To Go

I love all the characters - a husband and wife both vets, as well as all their friends and pets, especially Rags the klepto kitty who helps solve cases. There is also helpful information on feral cats and other animals in most stories. The mystery itself was interesting, I didn't anticipate the ending at all. I'm curious to see if the rescued colony cats develop further - there seemed to be some hints of a psychic connection with the white angoras?

This is a great guide on juicing for all. I really liked many things told by author.One of the facts that I liked about the book is that the author has told which fruit or vegetable helps us how. It is not like he has told us it is helpful for blood and we are forced to accept it. No, he has given which fruit and vegetable contain what substance that help us and how. I really liked that and which made easy for me to believe and follow it. Believe it or not, it is easy to trust and implement anything if they are supported by facts.He has explained how every fruit and vegetable is helpful along with the recipes. He has given such delicious and helpful recipe that anyone who read this book will definitely tempted to try it, thus involuntary inducing fruits and vegetables as the part of our diet. Isn't it that what we all want for ourselves but fail to?I will recommend this book who wants to start to eat vegetables and fruits but simply fail to, because of our liking preferences. Well, I can tell you it will help them. It has definitely helped me! And to those who already love juicing because it will definitely give you more delicious and healthy recipe.
summary: great way to start eating fruits and vegetables

Each recipe includes comments of the benefits and purposes of each recipe, even when to drink.

The dialogue throughout the book is completely stilted and unnatural.  The author also struggles to write from the male perspective. The female and male voices end up sounding the same.  I was disappointed after such great reviews and I could not even get halfway through the book.

Beautiful writing and wonderful characters. The best part about this book is not the cookie cutter romance you typically find anymore. I love it Kiera was disabled, but not defined by it. Jeff was broken emotionally, but overcame it to become stronger. Highly recommend!

When I saw this on the top 100 free books yesterday I recognised the title. It took me a while to work out where from and then I remembered it was on a Goodreads list of books where 'hero/heroine has a disability'. I have read a few romances with that theme, so I was interested to read this one.Kiera is a paraplegic (from mid torso down to her toes). It was sad how she became a paraplegic but she hasn't let it get her down. She meets Jeff and they are instantly attracted to each other.Now this was not really my cup of tea but that doesn't mean others won't love it. For me, it was all just a bit too 'nice'. It's a 'clean' romance. There are no real sex scenes, no swearing, no angst. Jeff is a lovely romantic nice person and Kiera is really nice. Note my theme of 'nice'!I think this is the authors debut novel and she didn't do a bad job however, she needs to work on her 'male' voice as Jeff at times sounded too female. If you like 'clean' romances then this is the book for you.

A quick read book, but it's full of good information inside. This book is a great guide on training your puppy to have a good sleep. The book is very well written, easy to read and understand. Good book, recommended.

I really enjoyed this book, Puppy Sleep Training since sleep training and toilet training are two of the biggest things when you get a new puppy! I found this book to be really interesting and had a lot of great information including information about Crate training which I didn't know much about! I loved this book and would highly recommend it to new dog owners!

I found this series by chance and I can honestly say I am not disappointed. I can't wait for the next book I hope it is soon. Downfall it's not available on my nook yet grrr but I still loved the story line and the men : - )

Reviewer: DonnaRating: 5 StarsI really loved everything about this story. Kat and Will are amazing characters and i couldn't help but want everything to go well with them both.Kat attends college in LA where she wants to pursue a career in singing and acting. This is where she meets Will. He's arrogant, very cocky but really hot. They have a great attraction but when Kat wants more, Will hurts her by saying he doesn't do relationships. It's safe to say he realises his mistake and confesses his really feelings for Kat. When Kat and Will get cast in a new movie, Nightwalkers, They lives change for ever. Screaming fans, interviews, premières and the paparazzi. Situations arise which test their relationship and whether they can remain together. They have a great bunch of friends, Kat's friends are Brooke, V, the strange one and her best friend, Charlie. Will's friend are Dan and his best friend but also quite creepy roommate, Olsen. He is the only one that i didn't like. Kat and Will's friendships with their friends are tested along their journey as well.Amazing and brilliant read. Hooked me in from the beginning like the rest of K E Osborn's book. I have to admit, i read it in a day! I couldn't put it down but then i was really gutted when i finished it! I found the stalker situation really scary and i had a few "OH My God!" moments. My husband kept asking what was wrong! But it was truly an amazing book and i'm looking forward to the next books from K E Osborn.

The story is based around Shay. Her father abounded her after birth and her mother left her in her grandmother’s care to travel around the world with her new wealthy husband. Shay and her grandmother had a wonderful relationship, the problem was after being left by her mom Shay was angry and had a deep down dislike towards wealthy people.Shay lives with her gay roommate Charlie who she met her freshman year of college. They have a great relationship and I had many laugh out loud moments reading the things these two said to each other. Shay works three jobs and Shay and her roommate are in the process of opening a Yoga business together. She will manage the books and he is the yoga master.Shay has kept herself guarded after her one and only relationship with her college sweetheart Dean. That relationship went south after Shay realized Dean only was in the relationship because of her family connections. She dumped him and focused all her energy into her work. She no longer trusted men and basically wanted nothing to do with them anymore.“I can’t be the girl that changes her entire life because she met a guy.”Sometimes you can’t predict who you will fall for no matter how hard you try to put walls up and protect yourself. Sometimes you just have to take a leap of faith and this is what Shay learns when she meets Brodie.“You’re always wearing your running shoes, getting ready to bolt.”Brodie is the drummer from a famous rock band who walks into her life and turns it upside down. He will not give up on what he wants and he wants Shay. The chemistry and humor between these two was fantastic. I loved how he didn’t let her get away with anything and no matter how hard she tried to push him away he would not give up. Lets not even get me started with the sex between these two because that was off the charts HOT!!!!“I’m tired of having to overcome your relationship with Dean, and I’m tired of being punished because of him.”The book flowed but a few times it seemed a little to rushed. Overall it was a good story that had me smiling and laughing several times.

reviewText: This is the fifth and final installment of this amazing series, and you need to have read all four to fully appreciate the collection. With wonderful writing and well developed characters, that with each volume, became richer and deeper. It drew me right in and I was spell bound until the end.Club Prive Book V had the perfect ending to this powerful and suspenseful series. Every segment had a major cliffhanger and with the ending of the four we were all left wondering what will happen next. Book v picks up right where we had left off, with Carrie hiding out in Howard's office. She over hears some major news that shocks her and sets her on a path of revenge. With the revelations that she finds out one can't help but wonder what will she do. Now that Howard is on to her, she is even more in danger.Is Gavin involved in any part of Howard's twisted and sick business ? What will Howard do to Carrie ? Will Carrie be able to extract revenge and make this monster pay? What will become of the love between Gavin and Carrie?Drama, angst, suspense, passion , love this series had it all. All questions were finally answered and you will get to see if true love prevails.I fell in love with this series the moment I started reading it and it did not disappoint!

I've been in a committed relationship for a while now, and have been considering taking it to the next level by having a child with my girlfriend. But being a father is an extraordinary responsibility and I want to know everything about bringing up smart, healthy children before becoming one.I trust John McQuilkin for giving great advice on life's important issues as I've already read many books written by him. In this book, John explains patiently and gently to aspiring patients on the various aspects of bringing up great kids.He starts of with newborns – taking care of a newborn's health,  the various health checks for a newborn baby are discussed. Even basic stuff like how to hold a newborn is explained by John – that's exactly how thorough he is with his information.He further discusses the various stages of a young child's life and the parents' responsibility at each stage to ensure that their children are well brought up, cultured, well-behaved, smart and healthy. Child nutrition is an important subject here and explained in depth.In fact, plenty of the wonderful advice in the book is what your wise grandmother would tell you, but sadly, not every one of us is blessed with a grandmother who is still with us, to help us with the major issues of our lives; so this book serves as an excellent guide.
summary: Every aspiring parent should read this book!!

reviewText: I have been reading to learn more about coconut oil and this book was a good read. I especially liked the examples of how to use the oil for everyday purposes.

I was blown away by these two. Dayton and Aaron are the perfect couple. She's a control freak and so is he. Aaron wants Dayton and only her forever. She finally gives over all control to him when she is blackmailed by his ex wife. Dayton doesn't want her past reviews because it could destroy Aaron's business and reputation. But none of that matters to Aaron. All he wants is to protect Dayton at whatever the cost and that's exactly what he does. In the end they win and their love is even stronger. This was such a creative story. I loved it. Cannot wait to read Tyler and Livs story.
I enjoyed  all of the stories. This was a fun read. I highly recommend the Blue grass series by Kathleen Brooks.
summary: The first and third were the best

reviewText: Hello fun cover! Robyn Peterman is my go-to author when I need a pee your pants funny read, and when I saw that she came out with Ready to Were in an anthology with two other authors, I knew I needed to read it. I poured myself a cup of coffee and cozied up with my Kindle. (Sidenote: I think I need to name my Kindle; since he and I spend an entirely large amount of time in bed together!)First up in this book was Kathleen Brooks and All Hung Up. You meet Taylor Jefferies, a Hollywood starlet and Trey Everett, small town football star turned pro. Both choose a quiet life in Hung Island, Georgia instead of the bright lights of the big city. This incredibly sweet story of the world's hardest proposal had me in a non-stop fit of giggles. The grand gestures in the romance genre will never grow old with me. And this story is no exception. "You deserve so much more than a country boy like me, but I promise no one will love you as much as I do. I fell in love with you by the pond in Keeneston the night we first met, and I've spent these past years falling more and more in love with you. Not only do you make me a better man, we make each other stronger. We're a team, a family, and I would love nothing more than to be your husband." By the end of her contribution to this anthology, I added all her books to my TBR shelf on Goodreads and my Wish List on Amazon!Our second trip to Hung Island, Georgia is Divorced, Desperate and Dangerous by Christie Craig. Reese Morris walks into Casey's Honkytonk Diner to run away from her problems back home. A broken heart, a breech of trust, a witnessed murder leads her to pouring coffee and serving up the best damn breakfast on all of Hung Island - to the locals first, of course. Reese hopes this help keep Trey Freedman - or Turner Calder, as she learned was his real name - off her mind.In this diner, she finds her peace in a gun-toting lady by the name of Casey and a former FBI agent who she dropped eggs on and paid $20 to smile so she could get the job! In walks, Trey Turner and asks to be sat in her section. "What the hell did he want with her? What part of, 'The tooth fairy ill be serving cherry Popsicles in hell before I give you the time of day again,' did he not understand? Had she not been clear?" This story was full of suspense and I felt like I was turning the pages so quick to get the the HEA.Turner has an amazing group of friends, Cops and PI's who are all content on never getting close to a woman again. They are a group of divorced men who called themselves the No Ball and Chain Gang. They watched out for each other if any were in danger of getting to close to getting in too deep with a woman. Nobody held a chance in stopping Turner from making things right between him and Reese. And as much as Reese wasn't having his apologies, it was hard not to loose yourself in Turner - after all, "Let me tell you, if he was gravy and I was a biscuit, I'd sop that plate clean." I cannot believe I have never read any books by Christie Craig - she is talented beyond belief. She also pens YA novels under the name C.C. Hunter! And my TBR lists grows...To wrap up our vacation on Hung Island, Robyn Peterman fills us in on the stories we heard briefly during the treasure hunting about the paranormal activities on Hung with her deliciously witty story, Ready to Were. Robyn tosses you knee deep into the Council, a paranormal government that ran all things supernatural. WTF (Werewolf Treaty Federation) is who Agent Essie McGee worked for. Essie ran from Hung Island when she caught the love of her life, Alpha of her pack and the sexiest Were around cheating on her. Chicago is where she finally stopped. Dwayne is her 300+ year old Vampyre best friend she only answered to her Granny, and the WTF! When Essie gets an assignment that sends her back to Hung - she is not pleased to be working with the local pack alpha and sheriff."Name's Hank Wilson. You know him?""Yep." Biblically. I knew the son of a b***h biblically.With Dwayne tagging along, she heads to Hung Island to be the professional she has worked so hard to become. Essie knew she could work with Hank, get the job done and be back to Chicago before she knew it. Turns out Hank doesn't want to work with Essie either! He makes her prove herself with her impeccable gun skills and than hand-to-hand combat. "Pinned underneath him on the floor, my inner wolf hooker was ecstatic." No time for nonsense, they had missing were's to find all while maintaining the cover that Essie was home to work out their "issues." Ester and Henry were on the job! Dragons, Fairies and Vampyres beware. This duo is dangerous.Hank's older brother, Junior is who I am petitioning for to get their own story! (And Dwayne of course, but I am sure he needs no help getting Robyn's attention in his Prada wedges and Gaga drag!) Junior's secret is safe with him - but when he finally steps up and takes over the Pack, he is going to be a force of nature and the woman who finally tames him - I need to be her friend. That will be one fierce lady. The HEA was perfect in this one. Sand in inappropriate places, Grandma in a thong bikini and a gay Vampyre demanding to see the ring - what better way to end the fun and giggle filled vacation to Hung Island? "Weird was my new normal - accept and continue."My favorite aspect of this anthology was that all the stories tied the location together. When I picked it up, I thought all would be beached themed stories, but to have them all with a central location made them all flow so well. Each showed the individual author's incredible talent to paint a beautiful story with their words.
summary: Hang out on Hung Island with 3 AMAZING authors!

Wow, indeed. What wonderful, giddy, un-guilty pleasure and fun there is in compulsively page-turning your way through Christopher Nuttall's wonderful naval adventure novels.They are set in future space, of course, but they are squarely in the tradition of C.S. Forester's Horatio Hornblower novels and --so far as spirit is concerned-- Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey and Maturin tales. Nuttall tells a great story skillfully building characters we learn to care about and identify with.Action, action and more action propel these stories along almost as quickly as the good ship Ark Royal folds space to cross near-Sol space. Nuttall captures for us the feel and sense of his imaginary world without bogging us down in unnecessary technical malarkey --often a pitfall of aspiring science fiction novelists-- but instead sketches out for us a set of rules in which the action takes place most comfortably and which is never undercut by a deus-ex-machina "What if we use the Framulous Hypergel Guns from the original armament?"Another major departure is Nuttall's refusal to hang his stories on the shoulders of just one character. Admiral Sir Theodore Smith, V.C., DSO, etc.;and his internal struggles are central to the tale, as is his predilection to dive into the bottle from time to time. But his XO, James Fitzwilliam; Major Parnell of the Royal Marines; Kurt Schneider, the commander of the carrier's fighter group; and many more well-drawn characters add richness to the literary feast Nuttall provides.If Nuttall had penned ten more novels, I would be working my way through them right now, the way I worked through all the Forester and O'Brian novels "back in the day." Nuttall has not yet risen to the mastery of atmosphere created by Forester, but he gets inside the heads of his characters nearly as well. Nor is Nuttall the elegant literary stylist that O'Brien was, but his prose is snappy and full of energy. These three novels, Ark Royal, The Nelson Touch and The Trafalgar Gambit are wonderfully entertaining and edge-of-your-seat exciting. For the kind of money Nuttall is asking for the Kindle editions, you have no excuse --none at all-- to pass them by.
summary: The Ark Royal Trilogy -- The most fun since Forester's Hornblower or O'Brian's Aubrey and Maturin

reviewText: This was a tough book to review.  On the one hand it's a very interesting story and well told. But, it has a glaring problem.  The race of aliens that the author created as the protagonists in the story are so improbable that they are minutely close to impossible. Why?  Basically the species violate all kinds of attributes that would evolve into a highly technological civilization.Start with the basic driver that causes a species to change and acquire new attributes. It's need. The need to survive in a hostile world or to take advantage of that world's conditions. The environment may be changing, or they may be threatened by other, more powerful species. Or they may take advantage of such favorable conditions that they grow ever bigger, but there is no driver that would cause this group to change basic characteristics. Nature is a selective breeder, with each species having to, by necessity, adapt characteristics that allows them to survive whatever environmental conditions that they live in.  This could be by becoming bigger/stronger/faster, producing many offspring so that some will survive, or in humans case, becoming smarter because we are none of those things. From the authors description none of the conditions seemed to exist that would drive the aliens out of the water onto the land and result in their ability to breath air.  They seem to be the top of food chain and have no reason to adopt new characteristics.But, the the main problem with this species is problems they seem to have being out of the water for any period of time, or at least in a hot very damp environment.The most fundamental ability that a species must have to develop into a technologically advanced civilization is the ability to control and usefire. And, to do so for long periods of time. Without that ability, metals could never be smelted, alloyed and formed into useful tools or weapons. The authors species could never man the great furnaces and mills that would be required to support the building of the space ships, guns, missiles, etc. needed for warfare. Abilities that would be needed even in the beginning of their equivalent bronze age on earth. How would the aliens of the book ever be able to mine for  the ores, and the fossil fuels necessary for this to happen. How could they build the machines that would necessary to do so without that ability.  They would have to have crawled out of the water millions of years ago and adapted the land, or they are going to remain what their environment made them, perhaps smart dolphins. Or smart fish, as they seem to have gills.There seems to be no driver that would cause them to move onto dry land in the first place, and they have not adapted well enough to dry land conditions. to be able to produce a technologically advanced civilization.

I'm so glad to read more of this hot couple!  They have such great chemistry, they jump off the page for me.  What great news to learn there will be two more books!  Can't wait to read them too.  I loved Frenched very much and Yanked did not disappoint.  Thank you Melanie!

reviewText: Frenched ended a little too soon for me. Yanked help fill that gap, but on it's own just wasn't as fleshed out as I wanted it to be. The personalities of the characters seemed somewhat off in this story. Some of the spark was there, but they were altered enough that they were less compelling than they were in Frenched. Perhaps the story was a little too much Mia and not enough Lucas for me?
summary: Perhaps the story was a little too much Mia and not enough Lucas for me?

reviewText: This was a great follow up to Frenched. The girlfriend made me a little uneasy (hate love triangles) but glad Lucas came to his senses. The ending was perfect. I'm also happy to hear there will be more stories to come.

I strongly advise against reading Yanked if you were happy with the way Frenched ended.  Yanked completely ruined Lucas and Mia's story in Frenched.To say I am disappointed with the direction the author took their story is a complete understatement.Lucas was a completely different character from the loveable guy from Frenched.  The way he handled the situation in NY with his apartment guest was unbelievable.  His cavalier response and attitude towards Mia disgusted me.  That was not the same Lucas from Frenched.Not only that but Mia forgave Lucas WAY too easily and then they both used sex as a means to make it all go away.Lucas goes from one extreme to the other with his willingness to commit and I just didn't find it genuine at all.  After the whole apartment debacle I just didn't care any more.I know a lot of people begged for more Lucas and Mia...but this was not the way to go about it.  I hate nothing more than when unnecessary drama is created between MCs and we had it here in spades.What the author should have done is given us a FREE epilogue.  As it stands, she ruined Lucas and Mia for me.
summary: 1.5 Do Not Waste Your Money Stars!

I absolutely loved this sweet addition to the Sons of Johnny Hastings book set!Sunny is a 19 year old who has moved to the small town with her mother after the death of her father.I love Sunny's intelligence, wit, and headstrong ways. Even though she is from the cultured, refined class, she has no problem setting her sights on a tradesman, Abel.Abel is a divorced blacksmith, ( he's 40!) who has finally made it past all the contempt and judgment from the small town.He likes the feisty, young Sunny, but is told in no terms by her mother, that he is not in the same class, and that his attentions are unwelcome.Fortunately, Sunny has her mind made up.She wants Abel, and will stop at nothing, even lying and manipulating to get him.This earns her quite a few spankings by the firm handed Abel.I loved this story. Though it was more DD related, I detected a note of age play in the relationship. It was wonderful.Sunny's desire and need for a firm handed, kind, older, almost paternal figure, led to a beautiful relationship between the two.I adored these two together, and loved Abel's character tremendously!I loved the ending!
summary: Older man, younger woman- perfect combination!

reviewText: Go big or go home. Love the marine but... one night brings you two people drawn to each other for years but denied themselves until finally....oh yah...great book...even better ending.

Not all of us had the ideal high school experience where the laughter was plentiful the friends endless and it was a time full of firsts. This was the case with Kennedy. Kennedy was the one always being bullied and on the receiving end of endless cruel jokes. Upon graduating high school Kennedy vows to make a change; not only in her appearance but in the way she thinks of herself as well; she is done playing the willing victim. Kennedy successfully manages to do these things in college she has great friends and has finally started to see herself in a new light. One night brings all those unwanted feelings back. Campbell is s handsome man and he knows it while he can have any girl he wants he is still in search of “the one”. He thinks he may have found her when him and his friends go out to a bar and a beautiful woman with red hair and stunning eyes looks at him from across the bar and literally makes his heart skip a beat. When he goes over to try and get to know her everything seems fine until he brings up high school football and his lovely beauty bolts like the place is on fire. Campbell has no idea what he said or did to make this happen but is determined to find her and win her heart. Kennedy was totally into the hot guy that walked into the bar he made her feel things she never has before. When she finds out that the hot guy she was drooling over once made her high school life completely miserable she runs not wanting to ever feel that way again. Campbell finally gets his chance to speak to Kennedy and try and see where their relationship can go. Will Kennedy be able to let go of the past and try and make a go of this thing she feels for Campbell? Will Campbell still have the same feelings for Kennedy when he realizes just who she is? Or will tragedy strike one of them before they ever get the chance to figure anything out?

They honestly keep getting better..spoilers ahead:Tess and Garron are an amazing pair.  The back story for Tess is wonderful and extremely heart wrenching.  Her past is so believable regarding her abuse (both verbal and physical) that you cannot help but start rooting for her the minute her friend gets her to hide in the Pairing Puppet House on the mother ship.Garron is so repressed regarding any type of physical contact that you almost cringe for him when it comes to the extreme physical urges he has but the mental blocks and shame that he keeps running into.  I understood the immediate feelings of betrayal that he felt when he found out Tess wasn't what he thought she was.  All I have to say is, THANK GOODNESS for the mate dreams so he was able to help her in time.I shed some tears when Garron went to get his "implant".  I understood why and yet I wanted to yell at the book "you don't have to do this!" right along with Tess.I had every emotion run through me during this book and I have to admit that I think these Kindred novels are getting better and better the more the series progresses.  There are so many layers and characters that this is truly a unique and completely full universe that I can picture clearly in my head as I am getting lost in these books.  My only complaint is that there are so many characters that are important from previous books that when they are mentioned in these following books I feel the need to go back and revisit them :)Length~5 starPrice~5 starCharacter development~5 StarOverall Storyline~5 Star
summary: They keep getting better and better....

reviewText: The Kindred are back. The book is well written and the characters are complex and hurting. Tess is a woman on the run. It's hard for Garron to break from his home world traditions and find peace with his other half, a beast.The only one that seems to calm Garron's beast is Tess, and in turn; Garron seems comfort Tess and calm her fears.This book introduces new characters and old ones make brief appearances. 'Devoured' is a great addition to the Kindred mythos. Can't wait for more.

reviewText: Struggling with what to write in twitter, facebook or on your blog?  These questions and statements really help to open your mind and help you create unique thought provoking posts.I see those posts advertising what they are going to do that day....  then there are those that just post what they are eating and a million pictures of their cats.  But it's those that posts that are conversation starters that gain all the likes and retweets and comments.  That is what this book is for...  it gets your mind working in a different way and helps you to create posts that will make people think...  and make them want to comment and join in the conversation.Or you could just open it up during a party like I did....  and start asking questions of the group.  What a fantastic way to start some really great conversations!I give this book a five out of five....  If you need a creativity booster in your brain...  this is the book for you.  :)
summary: Answer a question a day...  keep social media blues away!

reviewText: Great Story ... But someone needs to re-read their work more closely. It seems that this writer is giving too much time in trying to create his story and not enough time to properly re-read and edit some of his many, many errors throughout this story, especially when he switching from one character's POV. This is an exciting series. After reading all seven of this writer's e-books, he failed miserably and wholeheartedly in his revision process before going live with his e-book. There are so many misspelled words or misused of words, either he can't see them or just rely 100% on his wordprocessing program to tell him his words are okey-dory. Alongside the spelling errors, there's any incorrect or improper sentences. I think it is great that he continuing this series with Thad Torin's son, but what's hard to read is this writer failed miserably in his character's separation of identity or POV.Bren is a great character where his life is differently from his father's life. Yet, the writer still maintain this ignorance of a teenage boy, just like he did with the first six e-books with Thad.I just hope that this writer will take the time in the future to review all his books and make some revision. I know I would enjoy this book more AND change my rating if he would do that. Maybe the writer could use a beta-editor. Just look me up, dude.Good luck with your other e-books.

reviewText: *5 Stars*This series just keeps getting better and better! I was nervous to read this book because I'll admit, I did not want to like Blaire. After the way she treated Trudy, I just did not want to like her.Blaire did redeem herself to me in the book. (As much as I hate to say that. lol) She truly had a reason to be as angry as she was and she was having a very difficult time letting go of it.Lyric. I want a Lyric!! He is the total freaking package! Protective and gentle one minute and a total bada** the next minute! He is HOT!For a while I have been looking for a book with lots of action and this has so much of it!! I loved the suspense. It made it so hard to put the book down. I was sucked in from the beginning. So much happens in this book that I just can't write about it without spoiling the story. There were a few unexpected surprises as well.R.D.  is such an amazing writer. The intensity of this book will keep you from putting it down. The emotions demand to be felt. It was painful, angry, loving and passionate. The characters were strong even when they didn't think they were. The characters in all three books of this series are very well developed which not only makes the stories easy to read but very enjoyable. I love R.D. Cole and cannot wait for her next book! I definitely recommend this and would also recommend you read Learning to Live and Learning to Heal first.
summary: Reviewed for Abby & Lisa's Book Blog-*5 Stars!*

reviewText: “Opening yourself to someone is harder than closing off the entire world. The question I ask myself is, are they worth the struggle?”HOLY H*** Did someone order a book with a side of Angst?! Yes I think I did and OMG it was exactly what I wanted. This story is the third in the Learning Series, this is Lyric and Blaire’ story. A story that is so filled with everything we want in a book, love, hate, drama, and holy h*** moments that leave you breathless with emotions. I will warn this book is a bit darker then the first two but I knew she was going to have to go there and what she accomplished was beautiful.“New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings.” ~ Leo TzuIt took me alittle bit to come around to Blaire and LOVE HER. I blame Trudy, loyalties I met her first LOL. Blaire has the whole strong on the outside, soft and broken on the inside thing going for her. She drives you alittle crazy. Where you are all JUST STOP IT!! But once her guard is down you find that you have fallen for her, completely. I think that shows volumes of RD’s writing style she is able to take someone you are not crazy about and just make you stop and say OMG I completely understand her. I just wanted someone to show her love, someone to hold her, someone to show her how special she was. I wanted her to be who she was meant to be.“All girls dream at one point in their life, And we all hurt when they’re crushed.”I was introduced to Lyric at the end of Learning To Heal, and was more than intrigued with wanting to know a little (a lot) more about him. Now what can I say about Lyric, one word, WOW. I was instantly in love with this guy the moment I met him. And with this book the more I got to know him and was in his head the more I adored him. He is beyond driven, so compassionate and if I was to create a man for Blaire he would be it. Lyric has his own demons and his own problems but that is what makes this relationship so powerful and maybe one of the best rides.“Every crack, every smear, and every mistake isn’t a mistake at all. It’s something that’s just simply meant to be and made me who I am.”R.D. Cole completely stole my heart again and had my emotions bouncing all over the place. I cannot recommend this series enough and I am completely ready for Ryan’s story.

i like Leondra's work but for once give me something that would actually have me happy to be waiting for the next one not happy the book is over. the story line was okay i give her that but its just seems to me like her work is getting shorter and shorter and yet the prices will always continue getting higher and higher
