Liked the first one but loved the second one! Not going to rehash what other far better reviewers have already posted but I really like that I get the feeling that although he is her boss he doesn't hold her job entirely in his hands as his dad is the the top boss and the family stuff reigning in his normal behavior.Really great books-thank you!
summary: Need more...please say 3 is on the way!

reviewText: I liked the first book in the series and this one carries on along the same lines. It’s a twist of plots that makes it different and while there were a lot of dry areas in the book, all in all it was good. It took me a few days to get through all of it and that’s fine, just means I can savor it.The two main males had me wanting to reach through and slap them and the female at first I wanted to give her a smack upside the head.
I did not like this book. The guy was mean, rough and did not represent BDSM well at all. Unrealistic

Although I have not made any of these recipes YET I fully plan on it. My young son has really been missing desserts after dinner. My one issue with these recipes is that there's no serving size or time required for the recipes. Before I make a recipe I need to know how many waffles this will make so I know whether or not I need to double recipe or not. That is my only complaint and reason why I did not give five stars.
summary: A good round up of chocolate Paleo treats

reviewText: I was given book for honest review. Mia has patched up more than her fair share of idiot fighters so when Mike is laid up in her ER room she tries to deny the attraction and walks away. Fate seems to want them together and they crash into each other again. Loved how she wasn’t afraid to speak her mind and tell it like it is.  Colorfully hot yet romantically sweet. Can’t wait to read the other siblings stories.

the alpha gentleman is one sexy creature. Michael is a fighter and does piercing but he has a big heart. Dr. Mia is lonely and needs someone. she experiences horrific things everyday in the ER. the two of them have a sweet love together after dealing with a psycho from Mikey's past.I have grown to love the banter and conversations they have especially Ma.

I loved Throttle Me, I thought City was great and he totally is, but my heart now lies with Michael Gallo!!!  Michael turned out to be just an amazing man with such a big heart and it was so obvious how much he loved Mia!!  I also really love that Chelle Bliss incorporates real places from the Tampa Bay area into her books, makes them seem more teal even though they're not!

I love the Gallo men.  They're funny, hot, and truly interesting characters.This is Michael, the fighter.  He's a player from another level but meets his match in Dr. Mia.  I love Mia!  She's strong and a good match for Michael.  She also brings out the best in him which we all know a good woman does.I loved the inclusion of Tammy~ the psycho ex.  She got in there and really messed things up for awhile.  I was on the edge of my seat to see if her revelation was true or not.I hated that Mia was so quick to believe Tammy without giving Michael a chance to explain.  A lot of the tension in the book could have been thwarted if she was a little more trusting~ or at least stayed quiet long enough to think about what made sense.  I understand that tension is needed but I wish it wasn't so predictable.I was so sad that all this came to be because of what happened to City/Joe.  I hate when things happen to characters that I already love.I recommend this series and will continue reading it as new books come out. Izzy is next!!

Mia is an ER doctor, but it causes her a lot of stress. She would rather work in a clinic to help disadvantaged people. Michael is a hot fighter, but also a member of the wealthy Gallo family.  He falls hard for Mia, who snubbed him upon their first meeting. Michael wants to help Mia realize her dreams and he does.  They definitely have chemistry.The cover is HOT!This book was enjoyable, but I liked Throttle Me more.  Throttle Me was much hotter.Michael and Mia were hot, but there was a slight lack of heat in this book and the story felt a little more rushed than book 1.  Maybe I am just partial to City and Suzy because they were first, but I felt they were a lot hotter and had more chemistry.I would have liked this book to be a little more fleshed out and more focus on their developing relationship.  Also, the typos, incorrect spelling of some homophones - were distracting - but totally fixable with editing.  There is angst, a very psycho ex and some dirty talk - all good stuff!I look forward to reading more from Chelle Bliss!

I am really so curious about raw recipes that's why I downloaded this book and to my surprise, I was able to learn new things and ingredients in this book for amazing vegan recipes that I can try really soon. The recipes are easy to follow and ingredients are easy to find in the market. This book is a complete guide regarding the fruits, juices, desserts and even chocolates that anybody could try if you want to do a raw vegan diet. Highly recommended!

I've been reading Cynthia Eden books for a while now and I have yet to come across a bad one. This is the second in a series about a paranormal prison called Purgatory off the coast of Washington state. I had the first book for awhile before I read it then decided that I should start it before I read this one and I'm glad I did. It wasn't really necessary since this can be read as a standalone, but it was more enjoyable with the background of knowing the characters. Shane's introduced as just a regular agent in a secret organization based in Seattle called Para Unit. They're a secret branch of the FBI. But that's not all he is. He's also a very old vampire. The only thing is, in the first book, The Wolf Within, he's said to been born/made in the 1300's and in this book he's 2000 years old. So, not sure there...This book starts off when Shane meets Dr. Olivia Maddox on the ferry ride to the island prison and sparks fly from there. Olivia is there to interview the prisoners to figure out why they kill. Shane is there to figure out who's trying to make the prisoners try for escape. Of course nothing goes right for either of them and they start off on a run for their lives.I loved Shane's character from the start. What's not to like about an alpha badass vampire? Uh, nothing. Olivia was the right parts vulnerable and tough. More beta then alpha, but kick-ass just the same. She ends up on a journey where she not only finds love, but herself as well. Even the secondary characters are intriguing enough to want more from them. Looking forward to Connor's story to see him finally redeem himself. But I'm really looking forward to Pate's story!Thanks to Netgalley for the ARC.

Marked By The Vampire, Cynthia EdenReview from jeannie zelos book reviewsI've read several of Cynthia's books now, so I know I enjoy her  classic, succinct writing style. All story, no waffling! This one is paranormal ( its that vampire bit in the title that gives it away – yes?) and was a fun read.To begin with we're given a clue that some people aren't exactly what they seem, and that there is clearly some uncover/underhanded work going on. That fits in with much of Cynthia's novels that I've enjoyed, they have that suspense element and she does that really well, keeping me guessing exactly whats happeneing. So it was with this one, til it got to the point where I was wondering just what and who was going to be revealed next...dealing and double dealing, people who were working for others and not the side I expected, all wrapped up with some danger, violence, and sexy, sensual sex....A great mix.I liked Shane right from the start, and it was clear that he was in Purgatory for reasons other than what were given, but I didn't know who else was in on that, and what he was actually there for. Olivia seemed a troubled person, seeking to find out what made killers act as they did, but she didn't fit the usual “do-gooders” mould, and wasn't afraid of danger – til she reached Purgatory where the danger wasn't just the usual from interviewing dangerous prisoners, but had the added addition of someone – or maybe several someones – flipping and messing with the safety measures. Why, who, when and where was the next danger coming from. It's a novel full of suspense and danger and some vivid surprises, but with a perfect ending. Its the second in a series, I've not read the first but that was fine, as it seems each is a standalone, but with connected characters so it's the sort I like, where novels are complete but integrated with each other and carrying an overall story arc. I look forward to more.Stars: Four – a fun read.ARC supplied via Netgalley.

Olivia is on her way to the top security prison Purgatory to interview some of the inmates, paranormal inmates, when she meets Shane.Shane is undercover, impersonating a vampire detainee, to investigate how corrupt the prison system is. He never thought he'd meet someone like Olivia, a woman who makes him feel all too much.When the situation at Purgatory turns out to be ever worse than he thought, he has to try and keep Olivia save.But that turns out to be easier said than done.PNR, action, suspense and smutty fluff in a great combo that Cynthia Eden always delivers.

I wanted to like this, I really did. But, the characters were awful. I had so many problems with each one, I kept wondering why i'm reading this if there wasn't a single character that I cared for. The premise was good, and it started out good. A prison for supernaturals, a doctor doing research, an unlikely hero and potential sizzling romance, what's not to love? right? wrong!The heroine: She was weak, and it was by the authors design. She was weak in the sense that opportunities for her to show strength and character was just glossed over, and often times forgotten, or not addressed. I also dislike self denial immensely. It's impractical and is a waste of time. So naturally I don't like that trait in any character. And Olivia was in denial about what she was constantly.The hero: A*****. I had no love for him. One minute he's spouting sonnets of how he would never hurt Olivia, blah blah blah, and the next he betrays her, and uses her, and/or allows others to use her. Really? This is his version of love?The dynamic between hero and heroine: This is where the heroine's opportunities to grow never happen. Her "mate" betrays her continuously in the books, fine. If it's a part of the plot sure, it's not so bad. What bothered me was the fact that the author failed to address this stuff between the two. It's like when they have a conversation, she doesn't even bring up that he betrayed/used her. It's as if it never happened. What was there for her to love about this guy? She couldn't trust him (and believe me that was clear), and he puts others before her all the time. I just didn't get it.Pate: A****. Yep to me, he may as well have been the villain. He claim Ethan's his friend yet he continuously put him in situations to have him betray his mate. I get that he runs a unit, and needs to think of the innocent, and play hardball. But seriously, It never occurred to him to "ask" anyone to participate in his plans? He just thought it was ok to bully them into it? Betrayal and lies left and right. And this is the guy Ethan trusts? Oh and you  know what else bugged me? Ethan is supposed to be all powerful, and yet, he kept doing whatever Pate asked of him. He kept saying "my debt is paid", and the next scene is him still doing something pate asked him to do. It made no sense.I disliked all the characters, there was nothing redeemable about any of them. So sadly, i don't think i'll continue reading the series.
The author has broken down 6 ways to increase your metabolism and in turn potentially lose weight. There is also a breakdown of nutrients and a glossary for any beginners that may be reading this.

I liked 'Make money online' quite a bit; this book is amazing and will get you started making money right away. I now supplement my income with residuals thanks to what I learned from this wonderful book.In the first chapter I was enlightened on the idea of offering an online service that was very practical for me and in demand. I quickly followed the instructions on how to market my service online and now I am making 1000+ dollars extra every month!What I think could've been better was that I had a few extra questions on services that could've been answered, but I still learned enough to make the money I've already made.I highly recommend this book to everyone that wants to learn how to make a living at home.This book is the real deal, you are going to wish that you read this years ago!Start making money online now!

~ 3 Mating Heat Stars ~The Mating Heat is a prequel to the Werewolves of Montana series. This is a nice quick read about overcoming scars from the past and embracing love and hope for the future. Insta-love storyline. We get a taste of the world of the Werewolves of Montana, but the world is not fully developed.Both Ryder and Kara as well as the whole pack where damaged by their previous Alpha. They are friends who turn into lovers. Ryder has always know from that one kiss that he shared with Kara that she was special and no other would do. In the story Ryder goes back and forth between wanting to take Kara and wanting to woo her. As the story progressed he saw how much damage her father did to her emotional/physically, that the only thing he forced her to do was face the pack with her damaged face, so that she could see that the pack accepts her as she is and that she is and always will be the heart of the pack (the glue that kept them going).The Mating Heat is part of the Dark and Deadly box set. It was a nice quick PNR read into the Werewolves of Montana series. I enjoyed it.
A interesting tale full of mystery, humor, difficult decisions, and romance! A page turner with many interesting twists. Can't wait to read the next book in the series!

This is the last book in the Sons of Johnny Hastings series.  This is about Matt and Annie.  Annie has been in love with Matt since she was little.  But, he was only annoyed by her and so he spanked her.  Finally, Matt hurts Annie’s feelings when she is 15 and Annie decides to stay away from him.  When Annie is 18, her father dies and she is left with her stepmother, Eva and stepbrother, Robbie.  The ranch has been gambled away by Annie’s father and Eva comes up with the plan to drug Annie and marry her off to a rancher’s son that Annie doesn’t like.  Annie runs and decides to take up work in the saloon.  Matt finds her there and decides that he loves Annie and that they need to marry.  The rest of the story goes into Matt and Annie’s marriage and how they save Annie’s ranch.I really liked this book.  There are plenty of spankings, but they are done in a loving manner.  Matt is the head of his household and Annie learns her place.  Matt loves Annie, but she needs to learn that she is a lady and to follow Matt’s lead.  4 stars!
The plot keeps moving and I kept turning pages - couldn't stop

In this world of instant results, sometimes we want weight loss to be quick too. Rachel Barret has written a book that gives you the formula for fast weight loss. Just pick a number, set a goal date, and then follow her plan. The author shares her weight loss journey of losing 30 pounds in just 5 short weeks in her book Fast Diet for Weight Loss: How I Lost 30 Pounds in 5 Weeks Using the Effective and Easy to Follow 5:2 Fast Diet Plan. Having a cycle of low calorie/high calorie keeps your body guessing, and keeps your weight loss results quick. I recommend this book to anyone who's tired of slow weight loss and wants to see fast results.

The Flextarian diet is one that almost anyone could follow. With this diet you replace much your meat with vegetables, fruits and nuts. This allows a person to eat healthy and still feel full. Many diets restrict foods but don’t replace them with food that will leave you feeling full. The author of this book was on a emotional roller coaster when she went to the local library and found this diet. Being overweight and depressed the author was desperate for a diet that would work. This diet allowed her to loose the extra weight and within a short period of time was feeling energized and happy again.
This was a good book.  The characters were believable.  There was drama, adventure, sex and acceptance.  Looking forward to more from this series.

This book is easy to read and begins with the premise that finding Mr. Right is all about YOU.  The more you know yourself, the more you will attract the perfect man into your life.  Sarah shares strategies that are very grounded in knowing yourself and how to find the perfect man while staying true to who you are.  Highly recommend book for any woman who wants to find a partner for life.

This story is short, but extremely well written.  As the saying goes, quality over quantity.  Jackson and Kylie were living the ideal married life.  Well mostly, Jackson is keeping buried within him a secret.  He keeps it to himself because he doesn’t know how Kylie would react if he did tell her.  One day, the tipping point came and he just had to tell Kylie, expecting the worst.  To his surprise, she was not disgusted by the idea.The plot line flows very well.  The sex scenes were done just right, graphic but not offensive.  My only complaint is that the details of Trinidad wasn’t all there.  It would have been better if the author spent some time detailing out the history of Trinidad.  However, that being said, everything else was wonderful and definitely worth the time.

Hot, sexy, seductive book that gives you a taste into the secret fantasies that some men have.  These fantasies creep their way into Kylie and Jackson’s marriage and with their new adventures they both discover a new side of themselves they never knew they could enjoy.  This sweet, quiet couple explore the sexual side of other people and their explorations will leave you curious yourself.  This book took me about a half an hour to read so it was very simple, but these types of stories make me open-minded to other people’s personal lives.  Read a Taste For Kylie when you have a few extra moments to spare.
summary: Hot, sexy, seductive book that gives you a taste into the secret fantasies that some men have.  These fantasies creep their way

reviewText: I’m a big fan of Paleo and when I saw this book I knew I must have it! This guide is filled with great insights on how to use paleo condiments in your food and give them a special touch. It includes lot of different options on  Dips, Sauces, Marinades, Dressings And Rubs. It's been a while since I found such a well written guide on condiments, with too much different options. Charity Wilson did a great job here! Thanks a lot for your help

Ms. Chardou has talent,spunk, expertise and the astonishingly uncanny ability to transport her readers(fans) to scenerarios they'd only dream of experiencing. She's magical, her consistently astounding books never ever fail to capture my heart and touch me profoundly to the core. I'm emotionally, mentally and spiritually enamored as well as very invested in her world of Chardou♥. You're at the top,the best! you rule Ms. Chardou♣ Reading her books is one of my favorite things in the Universe aside from spending time with animals which I love. Naked Dirty Love is another astounding addition to her masterpieces. Her books are definite keepers in my precious romance collection. Everyone who loves very genuine, realistic, relatable lovers that go through hardship, tribulation, a challenging romance and are willing to open their mind to unconventionality with a HEA needs to give her books a try. Plot Rating:5★ Character Development: 5 ★ ♥♥Sex :500★☺ Setting:5★ Series: 5★

Maddie Taylor once again has written a wonderful romance story the captures your attention from the beginning.  Clint and Emmalee are engaged to be married when Clint learns about an inheritance from his father that he has never known.  He also learns that he has siblings.  He must travel to Denver but tells Emmalee it’s to dangerous and she needs to stay behind.  Against his wishes and knowledge she buys a ticket and boards the train.  This starts her adventurous journey to Denver.  Her finance, Clint discovers her injured on the train.  This changes everything for both of them.  Emmalee is a sassy, independent, strong willed young lady.  She certainly meets her match with Clint, who is domineering and headstrong.  Even though he is strict with Emmalee he is even more loving and caring.  You will definitely enjoy this sweet and enchanting addition to this series.
summary: Maddie Taylor once again has written a wonderful romance story the captures your attention from the beginning

reviewText: This is not what one expects of a Niall Teasdale book.  There is no sci-fi super android and there is no super-powerful sorceress.  The protagonist is an insecure and vulnerable superheroine.  But she kicks butt!This story is a little harder to get into than Thaumatology 101 or Steel Beneath the Skin.  But by the end it's worth it.  I hope there will be more in this series.
I've read other books in this series and liked them all.  I liked these short stories as well, but they almost seemed too short. They were nicely done but felt rushed.

This was a revelation for me on just how many herbs we use everyday can also be used as remedies - and are just plain good for you. Fascinating reading, even if it is just to know more about what plants can do for your body and health. This is like a grocery store shelf of herbal remedies. Great stuff.
summary: I had no idea so many common herbs are so good for you.

reviewText: This was a new author for me and I must say I enjoyed reading this book. It wasn't exactly what I thought it was gonna be, I guess I thought it was going to be like all the other New Adult books out there. And I guess in a way it was; there was the necessary first person POV, the problem of committing, the man that makes everything suddenly make sense, and the slutty friend. The couple is a little older then in NA (well, Dylan is at least). All that being said, I did enjoy the relationship between the two, Dylan and Samantha, and the fact that it was built up and not insta-love. Not sure if I'll read the next book in the series or not yet. Guess I'll just have to read the blurb first.Thanks to Netgalley for the ARC.

A very simple and lovely book.I try to spending lot of money in various unnecessary things and this has helped me prioritize things and only spend on those which are needed and also many tips were shared as to how to reduce expenses and get self satisfied. Great and worth reading. Highly recommended!!!!
A page turnerthis book kept my attention from beginning to end. Can't wait til part two comes out. keep up the good work.

This book is an excellent guide for beginners or experts. I have been doing kindle publishing for about 6 months now and know most of the ins and outs of this business. This book surprised me and gave me a new perspective and a few new techniques to try out. The author is right about how easy this is, and he makes it easy to follow with this guide.

In the past months I have noticed while looking for jobs in writing that many people are seeking ghost writers. Back then I didn't give it much though but eventually I figured out what was the power behind that and I can tell you , it does leave profit. I haven't try it myself but with this book I'm definitely going to give it a try. There was so much information on this book. A very compressive guide on how to make a profit with kindle direct publishing even if you are not a writer yourself. All I'm going to say is, give this book a try. It is worth it and while I can't say you will become rich, you can make some pretty good passive income once your books take off.

ABSOLUTELY LOVE LOVE THIS BOOK. LOVE THE SCENES BETWEEN ENZO AND ANGEL. THE SEX SCENES WAS AMAZING AND WONDERFULLY WRITTEN.  I LOVE JACKSON AND LAINE AND HOPE WE GET A STORY ABOUT THEM.  I'VE ALWAYS LOVED THE WRITING STYLE OF MS. ROBERTS,  SHE IS ONE OF MY FAVORITE WRITERS.  I HAVE READ ALL OF HER BOOKS AND AM NEVER DISAPPOINTED.  BUY IT, AND READ IT YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED. MONEY WELL SPENT.

What I’ve come to love about Vera Roberts and her brand of storytelling is how beautifully she weaves all of the darkness and desperation that life’s decisions present with perseverance, love and determination. Along with her hallmark sizzle, Ms. Roberts showcases her ability to present a strong character. The strength of any worthy story is built around the characters, their thoughts, their decisions, their motivations. Ms. Roberts is the master of crafting the perfectly flawed character; they clutch onto their reality, own their decisions, and most of all shine with all of the nuances of  their individual humanity. It’s the characters that compel the reader to risk the journey. It’s the characters that compel the reader to invest in each step, that induces a curiosity that can only be satiated by finding a resolution. With each word, Ms. Roberts cultivates that curiosity and does a fine job entertaining the reader in the process. Even if that story is about a prostitute, a pimp, and an talent agent.What a potent trifecta, right?I have to admit, however, that I approach any story with such a lurid premise with a bit of trepidation. Stories with this subject matter usually delve into predictability rather quickly; desperate girl meets driven and determined bad boy while hero swoops in to save the day. Rather run of the mill and highly frustrating.Thankfully, Ms. Roberts doesn’t prescribe to the predictable tale.Yes, Angela is constructed as the desperate girl and yes, Jackson is the driven and determined bad boy but these characterizations are spun on their axis. Angela, though desperate, has not succumbed wholly to the lifestyle; instead she’s become an outsider in both her interactions with the others that reside in the house and within herself. I got the feeling that when she was with a john, she subconsciously left the building and returned when the deed was done, collected the money and went home.  End of story. There was no reveling in what Jackson, her pimp, provided. She merely took just enough to sustain herself. I felt divided by Angela, by her reasoning to stay rather than leave, to continue to subject herself to so much loneliness all for the sake of surviving. Not living, just surviving. But, that is what makes Angela so human in her decisions and why I can’t fault her motivations.Conversely, Jackson and Enzo turn out to be mirror images of each other. Both are powerful in their own right, both have a visceral command over the people in their lives and both have similar intents on possessing Angela. The difference, however, is the approach. Jackson maintains a sense of entitlement, of possession over Angela. In his warped sense of what love is, he gives just a little and then  expects a lot in return and although he believes he loves Angela, its nothing more than a play into his ego as are all the girls in his stable. Jackson had all the markings of the tragic hero (my favorite type of hero) but for me, he missed the target completely. There was no sense of redemption for him and oddly it works. He remains, however, nothing more than the tainted bad boy who has yet to meet his match.On the other end of that spectrum is Enzo. He is the savior, the white knight in shining armor, almost too good to be true.  He wanted to lift Angela out of the dregs of darkness into the light and did everything he could to make it happen. Yes, his was a intent of possessiveness too…but what mattered was that Angela was buying what he was selling and she was able to turn the tables simply because Enzo believed in her past what she could physically give him. I will admit, I was dubious of Enzo and his motivations but was won over by his sincerity. It became less about his needs and more about Angela’s gains. She had become more than something to be  simply possessed but revered.All the makings of a delicious love story.At the surface, Daddy’s Angel could’ve been a garish tale but instead became something much more brilliant, more substantial. It’s what I love about Ms. Roberts and her talent to infuse her words with spirit and conviction. She’s a bold storyteller, one that is determined to say what she has to say, regardless of the naysayers and cynics and continues to grow as an author. It is why I will continue to read and laud her  seemingly effortless attempts to enlighten and entertain.Excellent work, Ms. Roberts!

Scavenger is a fabulous story with breathtaking action and a relentless plot. The writing is brisk, vivid, and engaging.The brevity of the story means that apart from the protagonist, Rush, characterization is pretty thin. The villain’s motivation is unclear, apart from his being a big meanie with a grudge against the elites. The other characters are all very secondary, because there isn’t time to know them.Rush, however, is richly drawn and his circumstances present a fascinating moral dilemma. The turning point at which he makes his ultimate moral decision comes and goes a little too quickly, but once he chooses his path, the story drives inexorably and compellingly to its conclusion. Remember to breathe.

This was a good book with a great story line. Take two broken people with similar tragic events in their past, put them together and get a wonderful relationship. It took time but was well worth it. Can't wait to continue their story. I read this in two days. This one was hard to put down. Way to go Abby Reynolds for a wonderful book.

Keira is broken, her very first boyfriend took her virginity and then broke her into a million pieces!  This is the story of a girl that climbs out of the pit of despair and learns how to trust and love again.  It takes two things for this to happen, first a VERY SPECIAL friend and a VERY SPECIAL man that will put the effort into a love of a lifetime.  In this story we find Keira with her cousin Scotty trying to deal with both Keira' s problems but also Scotty has lost his parents to.  Keira is not only is broken, she is alive but her parents died trying to protect her.  She's dealing with her guilt and trying to recover not only from her physical injuries but her emotional ones too.Our author takes a very delicate and very hidden problem and puts it out there in such a way that it is not a unaproachable subject.  With her very special writing skills of taking the reader into the story with her vivid descriptions the readers can feel the pain of the broken and despaired girl.  Feel the heartache she is going through and watch the emotional pain she goes through in trying to reach out.  Scotty and Liam have their own pains and emotional scars that Abby uses effectively in helping Keira to that place where she can reach her goal.  I see Scotty as the real hero in this story.  Not many would devote himself to another to this degree and yet not see it that way. Liam was special too but in a different way, he took that extra step and was patient in letting Keira find her own way.  Without giving away the story, you will find that Keira is also a very special person in what she does for both Scotty and Liam.This was an emotional read for me because if not for a VERY SPECIAL friend in my life it could have happen to me  but I was able to get out before it came to this.  I am gratified to see this in print in such a way that others are able to feel the pain of the person but not be involved themselves.  I can also see it as a leaning tool for those of us that could someday meet someone that this has happen to.  This, of course is a fictional story but it's one that happens more than anyone of us wants to admit.  I definitely rate this with a full 5 stars and highly recommend this to all.  Maybe with this knowledge we could all be heros someday.

Two broken, damaged souls who help each other heal!  Told in 2 POV's which I enjoyed , you understand  what both characters are feeling and going through.  The story developed quickly, and somewhat predictable, but none the less interestingly.  I would have enjoyed a little more angst in the story, but would recommend adding this book to your TBR list and anything else this author puts out!  Well done Abby Reynolds!

Keira is a broken women. After the abuse of her ex left her broken and trying to piece herself back together with the help of her bestfriend /cousin Scotty. (I wouldn't mine hearing a story with Scotty finding his someone, he deserves happiness too)Liam is a broken man. Past family events has torn his heart to shreds. He tries everything to pick up the broken parts. Women, sex, fighting. Nothing worked. Until Keira came into the picture.At first sight neither one could get each other out of their heads. Together they are fighting to just BE. They complete each other. The chemistry alone is enough to read this book. A total must read. If you have read anything else by her and liked it, you will LOVE this. Bravo!
summary: Abby! This was a great read! I was sucked into this world the moment I read the first page.

reviewText: Jane Austen would surely have thought Unbreakable too short a novel.  She would want more, immediately.  I think Abby Reynolds should take this into consideration and fast track book two for us.I read this book in one day not because it was easy, but because I had no choice.  I was captivated by Keira and mesmerized by Liam.  They are perfect compliments of each other.  Where one is broken, the other is the balm that heals.  My emotions were everywhere; there is not one part of my heart Abby Reynolds didn’t touch with this book-- sexy, soaring high and in the blink of an eye, chill inducing, numbing lows.  There are moments when I held my breath, hurting for Keira, wanting her to live a life free from her demons.  I wondered if I would be able to move on from the terrors she endured, or if I, too would shut myself off from the world.  Liam stole my heart with the care and compassion he showed Keira.This is a stand alone novel, without a cliffhanger.  Keira and Liam will continue their story in the second book.  The story is told by both Keira and Liam in first person.  .  I greatly admire Abby Reynold’s knack for voicing a man’s perspective.  I did get a chuckle when Liam spoke of his manly desires, the only phrase I felt was out of character.  It didn’t take away from the story at all; in fact, it was quite endearing.  The author fleshes out the secondary characters nicely.  I am hoping for Keira’s cousin and protector, Scotty, to get his own story.I would certainly recommend this book.  I give a well deserved 5 stars and want to share you can like Abby Reynolds on Facebook, where you can find more information about the second book in the Forehead Kisses series, as well as her other works.

reviewerName: Fictional Men's Page For Book Ho's
reviewText: Girls on Fire CollectionBy Dauntless AuthorsRating: 5 starsThis was a seriously good collection! Usually you buy these collection thingys and the books are kind of craptastic. NOT the case with this collection. Actually I think this collection is seriously under priced because I would pay full price for most of these books, so buy it! I found all the books to be well written and well edited, also there are quite of few truly original plots in this boxed set. Also there is something for everyone; they’ve got scifi/fantasy, high fantasy, paranormal, suspense, thriller, etc etc. They also cover a multitude of age ranges from 15-21 and that’s really great because girls face different problems at different ages. The only problem that I can find is now that I have read the first books from all the different series in this collection, I now have to buy the rest of the books in all these authors’ series. Ladies, my wallet does not thank you! But my heart does thank you because this anthology was seriously brilliant and provided me with many hours of joy.

Wow, I just absolutely loved The Faerie Guardian. I'm always a bit skeptical picking up a book I haven't heard anything about, but I figured hey I love anything Fae and man was a pleasantly hooked on this book so quick! If you love Fae, Rachel Morgan puts and excellent twist on all things Fae and I could not put The Faerie Guardian down for a second.Violet is such a kick butt character from the very opening chapter and instantly loved that about her. I love how she breaks the rules and follows her heart, and yet is still always trying to do what is right. Regardless of what she's lost, who is mean to her or betrays her, Violet keeps going and that is an admirable quality.Then there's Nate, who I find myself very conflicted about. I always in the back of head was wishy-washy about him, even in scenes where I thought he was being adorable. I'll be very curious to see where his character ends up.With Ryn, well I just love love loved him. It doesn't matter how horrible he acts towards Violet, I understand where his hurt and anger comes from, and yet to me you can still tell there's a heart under all of that. Plus, his hot name and glass blue eyes...oh hellllo gorgeous. I really hope to see a lot more of him in the future, and even though there are no hints being dropped yet...I just may be shipping Ryn and Violet.The twists and the betrayals in this book were just too notch. I really liked how the story line played out and how it all ended up crashing into each other at the end. I also love the multi-colored hair and eyes to match qualities that Rachel gave her Fae. Also the fact that she made the Fae up to date but yet kept a lot of the same lore. Plus, the whole guardian training aspect was just awesome to read about.I'm so happy that I have this book a chance, because I ended up absolutely loving it and already bought the next book in the series! Total top notch faerie book!
summary: TFG - Amazing!!! Girl on fire, for sure!

reviewText: After reading a few Angsty reads I was ready for something light hearted and funny...And it was! It was like A great romcom- Decker Steele is one sexy guy- Kind of a sad one when we first start reading about him thoe- And its understandable..He started to even believe he was broken until SHE came along- He hasn't seen Andi since she was a scraggly little thing with braces and hiding behind her books...She crushed on him but was turned off from his womanizing ways when they were teenagers- But alot of yrs has passed and she's definetly NOT that same girl! AND Decker takes notice ..and so does something else((: -- This was clever , cute  and Sooo funny at times!  I thoroughly enjoyed this read and definetly would recommend! 4 stars ****
It had  nothing to do with porn and everything do to with love.... Loved it the entire book and the story

Decker Steele lived the life of a popular porn star until his body and little Decker simply weren't in it anymore. He took a break from being in front of the camera and set up behind the camera.His life turned dull and lifeless until his best friend's cousin, Andi comes into his life. She is nothing liked he remembered and little Decker jumps back to life.He has mixed emotions through out the book but it is understandable, I wanted to hug Decker at times and bless him even though he was an arse some of the time. Andi slowly worked her little Texan soul into his life and showed him that she was a strong independent women. She had to be, moving from Texas to New York on her own. High five to Andi! The banter between them made me laugh and Andi was so funny.Andi's friends Casey and Lionel were her world and they helped her through her heartache when Decker finally screwed up, he did warn her on a number of occasions but I was truly hopeful that he wouldn't :( silly man. The way he got her heart back was so bloody sweet, he deserved her heart after that.Reviewed by Amy Davies Eye Candy Bookstore
I enjoyed this book.  There were parts that were really funny and made me laugh.  I wasn't crazy about Decker and some of the decisions he made but the story was unique and creative and I liked it.

Who didn't fantasy about hooking up with one of their college professors? Isabella Johns gives you the chance to live out that fantasy through Celine. Celine was the nerd in high school, always getting good grades and never going to the parties. In college she tried to have a boyfriend with some disastrous and humorous results. It's now her senior year and she has a very hot English professor but will he notice her? Then an opportunity presents itself and she does something she has never done before, makes the first move. From here the sparks fly and sexy and saucy encounters ensue. (These may also melt your panties!) I love how I can escape into a total fantasy every time I pick up one of Isabella Johns stories, it's almost like it's my fantasy.
summary: Hot and sexy fantasy with just the right amount of drama

reviewText: This book is just a wonderful romance book. I loved the characters. Well, I just love anything by this wonderful author. Thank you so much Billy London for making me laugh out loud and fall in love again.

I received an ARC copy of this book in return for my honest review. 'Soren: The Angel & The Prize Fighter' is the first novel in a new young adult paranormal series following teenage main character Beau as she discovers she is going to become an Angel.The story is well told and merges a darkly toned reality with the concept of angels existing amongst humans. Beau's life is difficult and she is forced to make some hard choices to help her sick mother. These choices put her in danger and made her almost instantly likeable. I liked the other characters also and look forward to learning more about them as this series continues.I will admit it took me a little while to get into the story simply because there were quite a lot of different characters and it was fairly fast paced so it just took some time to absorb everything. However as soon as I got into it I was captivated and very much enjoyed the interactions between the characters and the slow unveiling of various elements of the tale. The ending was just brilliant! I would definitely read the next book.Overall an excellent start to an interesting and original young adult paranormal series. Highly recommended for fans of YA and paranormal romance.

I hate gelatin. But my wife loves cooking it. So she picked this up to hopefully convert me. I'll admit the health benefits of gelatin (especially how they're cooked with these recipes) made me a bit intrigued... but the real kicker were all the banana, coconut, pumpkin, and fig recipes. Love them. Recommended!

reviewText: This book is filled with easy and delicious vegetarian recipes that are creative and satisfying that anyone can make in under 15 min! Great book, I highly recommend it!

Yay! Here’s the story of another of The Daughters of Alastair MacDougall. I’ve been waiting for Lindsey’s book, and it doesn’t disappoint.I so like the way Lane McFarland creates such distinctive voices for her characters. By now, the people who move through the various books are familiar and loved (or not ). They feel like friends.This latest entry in the series is an exciting tale of Lindsey, the daughter who’s an expert with horses. Fiercely independent, she secretly carries messages to the rebellion while she struggles to gain acceptance of her abilities as a horse breeder and trainer. She’s female, after all—how can a woman do a traditional man’s job? Only her clan and Logan, the man she’s loved since they were young, accept her as she is.Logan loves the spirited and appealing Lindsey, although he wishes she’d give up the dangerous job of slipping secrets around the enemy English. Nothing would make him happier than to claim her as his own. But as a bastard, he has nothing to offer this daughter of the laird. And as a warrior, he never knows when the rebellion will claim him.From an exciting opening rescue to the surprising revelation at the end, Lindsey and Logan’s journey is fraught with challenges and danger. Ms. McFarland has crafted another story that’s not to be missed.Please Ms. McFarland. Say there are more sisters to come! I hate to leave this wonderful world you’ve created.

Making Money Blogging is a practical guide to help you understand how to make money with your fingers. There are great tips in this guide for sure, although I did find it a bit of a challenge to find the flow.This doesn't take away from the experts facts delivered to help you find your way monetizing your writing talents online. The book also shorter in length so you'll have no trouble reading it and gaining from it in less than an hour.Give it a read and let the author know your thoughts!
Pretty Good story. It is a typical Frank Roderus book that I enjoyed reading. I would give the story 5 stars but the book was a little short or not long enough to be really good.

IT TURNS OUT TO BE MORE DANGEROUS THAN SHE EXPECTED. THIS  BOOK  LEAVES ME WAITING ANXIOUSLY FOR THE NEXT BOOK IN THIS SERIES. EVERY BOOK IN THIS SERIES HAS BEEN GREAT.

reviewText: This story just keeps getting better!  I don't know if I can trust our hero or not , but he certainly is  delicious!  I hate waiting for the next episode, but I'm determined to see this one to the end.  It's really, really good!Jgtimm

Darksider by Erin Kellison is book three in the Reveler Series. Harlen and Sera likable, strong, trustworthy characters brought back together because of danger. They worked well in the reunited or second chance story line.  Right now, they are my favorite couple in this series.  I loved their story but it ended too soon for me. While one could infer that Sera is safe from the dream/real world stalker, it was not settled in my mind.The epilogue changed to another set of characters completely so there is really a cliffhanger at the end of this story. However, the bigger danger concerning the Reve is being revealed bit by bit so the villains are still on the loose but a few more of them are known by name now. More questions now too. Just who or what is the Sandman?I’ve caught the Reve Fever so bring on the next novella soon. To truly enjoy this series start with the first novella, Darkness Falls. Highly recommend the series.Copy provided by NetGalley for an honest review.
When my family come up (three are vegans) this is perfect! What an amazing cookbook :) Have already tried three of the recipes. ThanksHighly recommended.

It had its good points, and I had to finish it because of the mystery angle of the story.... but I had some issues, mainly because of the length.  For example, the characters didn't even really meet each other until about 25% of the book....  They started interacting at about 40%.  I could be off in my percentages, but the beginning was way too long just to let the reader know that Brayden was a player.  Brayden was a player before Mackenzie, I got it...I didn't  want to read a ton of pages to get to the real meat and potatoes of the story.  Anyway, overall, the book was entertaining and worth the read.

I went into this story knowing it was going to be the last of Nathan and Delilah. I wasn't ready to say goodbye and frankly I'm still not. The story that this third tale tells is something that no simple review can perfectly describe. It's full of action, love, passion, intensity and excitement. It's a story that will suck you in the moment you pick it up and refuse to let you go until the last absolute moment. I told myself when I started that I was going to finish it quickly. That I was going to savor every last moment. However when I started reading I knew that wasn't going to happen. I am now on my second read through of it and it's still just as good as the first time. This author is not only amazing but also someone I call a friend and her books are amazing. If you're looking for a trilogy that will suck you in and leave you wanting more stop looking because you've clearly found what you're looking for.

Ahh, finally we get the conclusion of Nathan & Lila and their pursuit of happiness against their crazy, effed up pasts. This last installment is chock full of steam and angst and it doesn't disappoint. Favorite part of this book, Disneyworld *smile*. If I had to gripe about something, I would say some of the sex scenes seemed gratuitous. I mean, from the two previous books we know that these two burn up the sheets and often, but several just weren't necessary nor did they add anything to the circumstances at that moment. With that being said, this was a great story and I enjoyed it fully! 5 solid stars!!!!!!(less)

SUMMER'S BOOK BLOGReciprocity is the third and final book in the Breach series by K.I. Lynn. This book is not a standalone, you must read book one Breach, book 1.5 Dissolution and book two Infraction. Nathan and Lila have been through so much tragedy in their personal lives and their journey to be together has not been easy but they are finally together and happy. They are engaged to be married and things are starting to look up, unfortunately there is one black cloud still hanging over their relationship and it's about to pour. Now they are fighting for more than just their relationship, they are fighting to survive.Reciprocity was an amazing conclusion to a wonderful and addictive series, K.I. Lynn is a talented author who knows how to keep readers hooked on her stories! I've read many series where the final book left me a little disappointed and that is definitely not the case here, Reciprocity was the perfect way to end this series, it wrapped things up completely and no questions were left unanswered. Nathan and Lila are both incredibly well developed characters, the reader gets to know them very well throughout the entire series and we learn all about their tragic pasts.I was thrilled to see them so happy and so deeply in love in Reciprocity after everything that has happened. They are both very intense and deep characters and the emotional aspect of their relationship is fierce, their bond is unbreakable. Their relationship is so intense and passionate, the author writes some seriously hot sex scenes that will leave the reader begging for more. Nathan is a dirty talker and I loved every second of it!Of course It wouldn't be a very good book if there wasn't some drama and suspense and the author delivers it perfectly. Once the action picked up I was on the edge of my seat and holding my breath, the reader knows something is going to happen but the suspense is a killer. I felt that the author did an amazing job of describing the emotions of the characters and the anxiety they were feeling and how it affected their relationship. It made me feel like I was right there with them just waiting for everything to fall apart around them.Reciprocity has both Lila and Nathan's points of view which I loved, I was so attached to both of these characters after reading the series it was vital to me that I knew what both of them were thinking, feeling and doing! This story is very emotional, both of these characters have heavy emotional baggage and depend on each other for their mental well being and the pain and fear they go through is heartbreaking.I couldn't put this book down until I was finished and I loved the ending. It ended on a happy and hopeful note, the reader knows they are finally free and able to have everything they want out of life. It was a true happily ever after and no one deserves it more than Nathan and Lila!

In the third book everything finally comes to a head. We meet Nathan and Lila's demons face to face. Watching as these two continually fight for their love. Their hardships seem never ending. Will they get their happily ever after ?
summary: Still as good as the first

reviewText: Ryan Michele has another hit. It didn't think she could do better than Cruz and Low, but I love Casey and G.T. It was a fast pace read with a lot of passion and heartbreak , along with healing and moving forward. Ryan will take you on a thrill ride with some hidden bumps along the way, but a very Happy ending. Great job and I can't to see who's next!
Can't wait for the next book, Ryan knows how to keep you on the edge until the very end and then leave you wanting more

Wow..Just Wow..Another amazing book from Ryan Michele and her abso-freakin-lutely amazing series, Ravage MC..When I read Ravage me ( Book #1), I was ecstatic! I was in Book Heaven! It was that good, I'm telling ya! So, it's very possible that I was very excited for Ravage MC #2..And it may be possible that when I saw the invite to the tour, I didn't even hesitate..In fact, I think I hadn't even read the synopsis..And THAT does not happen very often..Seduce Me does not disappoint,ladies..It is amazing. Absolutely Delicious..I would even call it lickable ~Oh yeah, that hot! ~ But not only that, Ryan Michele has created a fantastic story under it..I always say that no matter how hot the book is, if the basis is not solid enough,then we're not going anywhere..And Ryan Michele is a master at that!She writes great stories, with amazingly remarkable characters who yeah are very hot..But the story on its own is wonderful and it was as expected seeing as it comes from this specific author..I have no bad things to say..Except that you have to buy this book, and the series if you haven't read it yet,that is..So go ahead and one-click freely!!Because you'll stay hot and bothered and utterly pleased with this book

After reading Ravage Me, I thought that Seduce Me would follow the same writing style, but it was completely different in a very good way. There was so much more emotion and connection with the characters. It was still a biker book, with all things bikers, but there was a great story that established an emotional connection with the reader.Casey just had to get away from the biker world, she wanted to get a degree and make her father proud. GT was a biker who wanted Casey, but never thought he was good enough for her. The book revolves around their attraction and the connection that cannot be broken.I absolutely loved this book; I honestly connected so much more with Seduce Me than the first book, Ravage Me. I loved the different points of view from Casey and GT.GT: "I'm a selfish prick and almost dying has put a few things in perspective. I don't deserve her but I need her. I need her like air. And this time, I am not f*&%$#@ up. I can't."Casey: “He kisses me again, but the kiss is full of promise, of hope, of love. I can feel it with every fiber of my body and I want to believe it. More than anything. I want this…him.”I think to appreciate this story, you have to read book #1 first! Then once you get through the crazy antics of Princess and Cruz, you can get to the heart of the story with Casey and GT. You can’t go wrong with this book! Great read!!Lisa

Well written book of suspense, obstacles, love and emotions as Nora and Daniels' story plays out.  They both have obstacles that they must overcome themselves as they both fall in love with one another as you continue to read!You will be caught and sucked in right from the start!

A Single Mom's Guide to Raising Young Children is such a great book! This is a good resource if you find yourself in the unfortunate position of being a single parent and aren't sure where to start. This book emphasizes on the positive sides of being a single parent. It's a guide that gives easy steps to take to raise a child on your own. It's a difficult task to be successful when it comes to raising a child as a single parent, but this book was really encouraging, and motivating. I am not a single parent but I know that this responsibility, raising child alone, is such a difficult obligation. I really love the book, it is very well written and I would recommend this to anyone who  are looking for some parenting tips especially with dealing with single parenting issues. Great job!

Loved it. I have followed this series mainly for the Pierce and Lucas storyline but this novella about Napoleon finding his mate was just priceless. It's listed as a stand alone but reading the rest of the story is icing on the cake.
clear and easy directions to follow. I like the build your own salad section.

You have to try the meatloaf muffin recipe in this book. They have a bbq glaze that is really quite good. The only thing that I would recommend is that you use fresh garlic instead of buying the kind that comes minced. This will give you a much more pungent taste.I also think that the high-energy granola bars are great. They are perfect if you struggle to get enough protein in your diet.One thing that I really like about this cookbook is that it makes planning meals very easy. They have several large sections which allow you to pick and choose the items you want. This makes it easy to focus on getting the right macronutrient balance. You can also easily customize your diet to include different options if you get sick of eating the same meals over and over again. All in all I really like this cookbook. I haven't gotten the chance to make all of the recipes yet, but if they are all as good as the meatloaf muffins then this may be one of the best cookbooks I have ever read.
Compelling, heartbreaking, and so beautifully written. Brava.

This book is not at all what I had expected. In fact, it was better. The book takes you on a fantasy adventure, introducing you to a powerful and magical world. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a short, yet captivating read.

Where should I begin with Protecting Olivia?  As is so often the case with ménage stories, plot can take a rear seat to the sex.  While there was a lot of it in the book, Caitlyn O'Leary clearly wanted to tell a story in between the passion play that occurred between Olivia, Joshua, and Ian.  Unfortunately, I felt that the plot fell short.  It seemed to advance too slowly, and offered a less than stellar impact on the conclusion.  Even having the story drag as much as it did, the ending just seemed to be rushed.  There was no delightful "ah-ha" moment for me - it all stemmed anticlimactic.The heroine, Olivia, was a woman who overcame much from her childhood, earning her MBA and heading up a successful charity.  However, no matter how hard I tried to, I just couldn't like her.  She flip flopped so often emotionally between the, "woe is me" and the ball buster personna, that it gave me a serious case of whiplash.  The heroes, Joshua and Ian, should have easily rung my alpha male bell, but instead felt flat and one dimensional to me.  Seriously, living in Fate Harbor, where they were both acutely aware of several polyamorous households, it never occurred to them that they could have a multi partner relationship with Olivia?  I found the most interesting characters were Leif and Caleb, and even then the multiple references to the attention they were paying Isabella got old, fast.  I'm hoping that when Leif and Caleb's story is written, the plot will flow more smoothly and have more sexual tension.As much as I wanted to love this story, I simply did not feel engaged for the most part, and that left me disappointed.  Caitlyn O'Leary does get credit for making Protecting Olivia a story that's more than a poor excuse for a plot insinuated in between sex scenes, which is a common pitfall in this genre, but it wasn't enough to make me wild about the book.

Romance books are not the normal kind of books I read but came across this spur of the moment. But kept my interest from start to end. Had perfect amount erotic to pull you into the story. Good enough that I will go look see what other books this writer has done

I smiled and cried while I read this.  Wanted more when it ended.  Your story of Candace and Mason was so real not just for someone who has been widowed but trying to make a relationship work period. Thanks Brooke!!!

The TWLD founder brings the noise once again in this explosive finale! It started on Facebook, but then the drama came alive. Be careful what you post, that's all I can say. Remember, there's real people behind those profile pix and ish ain't always sweet.

It is full of very practical advice and tips that are beneficial and can help an individual get ahead in life. It's helped me realize new ways to control my emotions and get along with my peers, coworkers and supervisors. Great book with lots of useful information!

Emotion is very important to our dealings with others which make emotional mastery vital.This book provides the read with the basics they need to become more emotional balanced and perfect the skills they need to properly get along in the world the part I enjoyed the most was the section on how to remain motivated in the face of adversity.

reviewText: What is EQ ? How is it different from IQ? Is it more important than IQ? I would recommend this book to anyone looking to understand this topic - also educators, physicians, and corporate leaders. It gives insights into what Emotional Intelligence is, into how and why EQ can matter more than IQ … to understand what it means and how to bring intelligence to emotion.
