reviewText: I was blown away by how tasty the poached shrimp were.  They were the first recipe that caught my eye and I made them that night.  I was not disappointed.

With so many NA and YA books out there, how refreshing to have one that is MA, with characters in their later thirties or, gasp, early forties. There is something very satisfying, and beautiful, in the story of a woman who has had relationships but never real love finding it after so many years. So, without spoilers, the question is, what will she do with it? Seelah is essentially set up on a transatlantic blind date with Gerhard. After a week of dinners, drinks, great company, and one single goodbye kiss, Seelah is off to Ghana for months of research and lots of time to soul-search. How Gerhard re-enters her life, and how their relationship develops, is just great fun. I forgot to mention that they are both witty, sensual, and very likeable characters. I fell in love with them as they fell in love with each other. Thank you Daisy Prescott!

This was a beauty of a read.  It's actually hard to rate it bc in the beginning I skimmed a bit just bc I was missing a certain character and really wanted that said character back on the page.  This book is so different from every other single book out there.  It's about a mature woman who knows who she is, what she wants but when that package is boxed different she's open to the new wants she desires.  If you want a teenager read this isn't for you but it you want to read and fall- mind you fall HARD then click this now
summary: I really really REALLY enjoyed S & K's story!!!!

reviewText: This book was amazing, simply amazing!!  It was truly captivating.  The witty banter and twist and turns of the plot kept this book interesting and following!  It's a true to life story and that is one of the reason I loved this book.  She writes it so well it is like you are really there!!I don't like to do spoilers and you can not talk the book without giving some away so I'm going to tell you Selah is a very relatable character.  She is smart, funny, sexy, and loves what she does.  She lives in the moment and enjoys life!  With a chance encounter at the airport, will her life change?
I just finished reading it and i want to reread it.......right now! lolYou are an amazing writer and i really LOVE this book.
Quick & enjoyable summer read! Definietly hot...steamy...sexy.
Great book about a lowly grunt in the near future marines in space fighting on asteroids and planets with some great banter and believable characters
K. J. Emrick has done it again.  Love this series and looking forward to the next one.  Also enjoyed reading about Smudge the cat.  Would highly recommend this series.
This book felt unfinished, like it was a chapter or two too short. Many of the characters were not flushed out.

Dear Lorelei,As I sat down to write a review of Cowboy Take Me Away, I was overcome with emotion and wondered how I would ever be able to do justice to this book.  It's more than that really; this book is the end of an era, the final tale in an epic saga, a love story that spans 60 years, and the series that made you into the writer you are today.  I say that with love because as I re-read the Rough Riders series in preparation for CTMA, I noticed how much you've grown as a writer and even in the early stages of this series your stories were heads and shoulders above so many out there, but as time went on they became even better; deeper, more emotional, and truly special.  I also took note of every little hint regarding Carson and Carolyn's relationship and there were many but they were only the tip of the iceberg.There were some pretty big revelations in CTMA; we saw many facets of Carson and Carolyn and while some were surprising, some we'd seen all along if we paid attention.  We gained even more understanding of Carson, Calvin, and Charlie's responsibility of being stewards of the land something they passed down to their children as well as Casper's children.  We saw the burden of secrets that Kimmie and Carolyn knew but couldn't share with anyone else. We saw that sometimes history does repeat itself even when we swear it won't.  We saw the full story of many partial stories we'd seen throughout fifteen books and we saw it from the eyes of those who lived it.  We were treated to glimpses of the events that shaped many lives but most of all we learned that without Carolyn, Carson would have been a shell of a man.  That's not to say he wasn't exactly what she needed, but I think even Carson would agree that Carolyn was the backbone, the pillar of strength, and the fierce guardian of the McKay empire.  We saw a man realize that his life despite all the hardship, the tears, the joy, and the changes was completely wonderful because of the woman he knew he loved from the first moment he saw her and we saw a woman fight to make sure that their life together would continue on for years to come.I can't even begin to express the myriad of emotions I went through as I read this book.  I knew it would be an emotional journey but I had no idea how cathartic it would be.  I'd been preparing myself for this book for the last two years and honestly, I was okay with this series ending because I knew that at any time I could go back and revisit it and relive their journey.  I really loved the way you entwined so many of the past books into this one and how they each jarred a memory to be shared.  How you showed that no marriage is perfect; that even those couples who appear the most solid have had experiences that have shaped them and brought them to where they are today.  How a couple can have their ups and downs yet still maintain the love and lust they once had for one another even have 50 years together. I love that Carson shared with his nephews, niece, grandson, daughters in law and son in law that while his life with Carolyn wasn't perfect, it was theirs and theirs alone and he will always be the one to make sure she is taken care of and safe even if it means pissing off the people he loves most in the world next to his wife.From Long, Hard Ride through Cowboy Take Me Away you have given so much of yourself and you have given your readers and fans a ride they will never forget.  You have taught us that people change, relationships of all kinds take work, people come and go, and most of all that no matter what family comes first.  It isn't always pretty, but you don't come into this world alone and if you are lucky you don't leave it alone either--especially when you find that one person to be by your side forever.Thank you for sharing your talent with the world, for giving us this family to love, and for reminding us of all of life's lessons along the way.  I am thankful for you and your friendship; it means more to me than you'll ever know.PS---As emotional as this story was, thank you for the moments of laughter in it as well and for clearing up some questions I've had along the way.  You rock!
summary: EPIC story of family, passion and a love that spans over 50 years!

reviewText: OMG!! I cried through out this entire book, But it was a good cry!!  Lorelei did it again.  She makes these characters so human. I feel so much of the emotion that Carson and Carolyn felt.  I LOVED THIS BOOK!!!!!!!!!! !I am so very sad we are done with the McKay clan.  I am sure I well read them again and again!! I have loved everything of Lorelei's I have read!!

~I received a free copy to read & review for Wicked Reads ~Erica Chilson did it again! this is the second installment of the Blended Series. WIDOW gives you the story of Clover and Malcolm and their journey on becoming a blended family. I'm pretty sure Erica hit every emotion while writing this. Clover, having lost her husband to cancer is raising teenage twins. she is tired and feels unappreciated she made mistakes in her past and is trying her best to cope with them. Malcolm lost his wife to depression, he is left with 4 children to raise on his own, he has also made mistakes in his past and struggles with raising his children alone. Together, as a blended family, they can make this work. Malcolm breaks down Clovers walls and she lets him in! they both NEED each other.This story is raw, emotional and more real than anything Erica has written.~Wicked Reads Review Team~

Although I would of loved to read this book from two points of view I still absolutely loved the book. Both Evie an Rys are amazingly strong people to overcome the event that connects the two. Although the book was predictable, I couldn't put it down. I'm looking forward to reading more from Ms. Snow.

Sigh...I just finished reading it and I can't help wishing for more.  I liked Evie...which is rare!  She stayed true to character even after falling in love!  That makes me happy.  Rhys was delicious...do I even have to say more?  The writing was superb...well edited...Emily Snow is just amazing.  I love everything she writes.

Wow!  Reese Allen and Phillip Anderson hot, hot, hot!  Who would of thought two people both burned by someone they loved in their pasts. Would find true love.  They thought they were only having "fun" .  In the past Assassins books Reese came off as cold hard  bitch.  So I thought I was going to like her as much I do they other heroines . Boy, did Toni Aleo proved me wrong. Once again she made loved her character's more.  Phillip, Reese and Claire makes this book worth reading.  I hope Claire gets her own book in the future .  I love that Toni Aleo keeps her main characters the story. All the other Assassins are a added bonus!  Can't wait till the next Assassins book.  Great job Toni!

Toni Aleo has done it again! What a gifted writer! Love this series! Loved this book! Whenever I think I am totally for the couple in her book and don't see how I can LOVE the next one, she pulls you in and I fall every time. Phillip and Reese 's story  was well written and thoroughly engrossing! If you pick up any of her titles you are sure to become a fan! Didn't want to put it down til I was finished and even then, hated for it to end

Oh hell no! It can't be done! These people have become my family, Toni Aleo has to have the Assassins hire some more players, start a dance team, I'm hooked! I couldn't put the book down, I wanted Phillip's niece Clair (or is it Claire?) to learn to trust that he was keeping her forever, and the team was their family and he wasn't just passing her off on some stranger when there was an away game. I wanted Reese to realize that it hurt just as much whether you admitted you were in love or not. I love this series. If she keeps writing them, I'll keep reading them.

Marriage is an entirely different commitment, than dating. While this may sound obvious, so many marriages end in divorce—and I don’t want that to include me. Don’t let the title of this book through you off, because it is geared toward the modern and independent woman—who wants to maintain her sense of self, while being part of a solid partnership. The communication section is invaluable, as well as tips for how to address life changes that will inevitably occur.

Oh my...slap that Anders right Now,,,I thought he was getting more involved in his head with Tessa.  Now there is a wife.  In my mind I actually wondered this...so...he ignored Tessa to be by his wife....can't wait to read book 2 to see what he has to say about that....was an Awesome page turner.  Great book.

Good book, plenty of info on how anger is destructive to our bodies and relationships and how to deal with it. A good guide for anyone, even people who don't have major anger problems (we could all benefit from learning how to manage our anger).

There are times when I experience unwanted situations and suddenly, I cannot control my anger, making me vulnerable to inflicting pain to others and even to myself.  As I read this book, I was able to reflect within myself, and I realized how awfully bad things were back when I didn't have anger management.  In this book, I was able to get some good advices on how I could properly manage my emotions and anger, making me feel more in control of myself.  I definitely love how this book has somehow changed me to become more positive and less distracted with negativity within me and around me.
summary: Anger management for a positive life!

reviewText: I was impressed with how in depth this book goes into how anger affects us physically.  I have a close relative of mine that is consumed with Anger so much of the time.  I am definitely passing this book on to him to read.  I knew anger made me feel bad all over but didn't realize it was affecting me so much physically inside.  I hope that this book can show him how it is affecting him as well.  There are great tips to reduce that level of anger as well in this book and if you are suffering from this, please take the time to read this book and take it to heart.  It really could save not only your relationships with people around you but also yourself.

I recently started meditating and have had great experiences with decluttering my mind. The next step for me was to expand that to simplifying my surroundings and lifestyle. This book was a great easy to follow guide to help me achieve this.
summary: Great Guide To A Simpler Life

reviewText: I was apprehensive about buying this book, but I love the work of the author. I was happy that I did by this book. It was raw, real and shows that we can live different lives but experiences are the parallel. Read it and you will say "it is worth it".
funny and cute book. it was a bit frustrating when the characters couldn't convey their feelings how they wanted but over all it was fantstic.
I always love Shannon's books.  They are easy going.  The stories are interesting.  The relationships real.  The chemistry always good and clean!

As a painfully shy youngster I wish I had this book.Nobody makes it on their own we need to deal with people in our everyday lives however for a person who is like I was this can be hard.What I likes best about this book is that it will take the reader by the hand and guide them through becoming more sociable with others, which make it an ideal starting point for any socially shy or introverted person.
summary: Great start to the new sociable you

reviewText: Perfect beach read! If you read one book this summer, make sure this is the one. Break Me is so sweet! I could relate to Gemma and I really loved that.  I could totally see where Gemma was coming from with her trust issues. Im the same way. I loved watching her grow into an adult with each obstacle she faced. I was so proud of her!I loved Abe so much! Complete sweetheart and a hottie at that. ;)  Im so glad he was such a patient person, especially with Gemma. He is definitely a great swoon worthy book boyfriend. Girls, Im not even kidding. You have got to meet this guy! He will blow your mind!I cant wait to read more by Harper James. I have absolutely loved everything she writes! She is brilliant!

Sleep is essential to keep our brains and bodies function properly. There’s nothing like sleeping safely and soundly under the blanket without any interruptions from the physical world as well as in our dreams.For those who have problems sleeping, this book provides the natural ways to improve the quality of your sleep.

A copy was provided by the author in return for an honest review.Cassandra & Ryan are thrown together when Cassie's mother marries Ryan's dad.  Cassie is very much attracted to Ryan & unknown to her, the attraction is mutual.  But neither one knows how to make the other aware so they constantly bicker when in each other's company.Ryan finally makes a move on Cassie right before he's due to ship out before a long deployment & Cassie is stunned but the pair is interrupted before they can do more than share a few hot kisses.  When Ryan returns from his deployment Cassie is unable to make his welcome home party because she's stranded by a hurricane & Ryan thinks she's deliberately avoiding him so the pair is back to snarking at each other.Things finally come to a head when they're each asked to houses-sit by their respective parent.  Cassie feels challenged by Ryan to do everything she can to prove she's no spoiled princess until the pair collide in a passionate tangle.  It doesn't last long though when Cassies asks about making their relationship open to their family & gets her feelings hurt when Ryan tells her there's no need to tell the family instead of clarifying that the family already knows how they feel about each other.Overall not a bad story.  A lot of the couple's conflicts could have been solved sooner by actual communication leaving room for more relationship building.  I got a good sense of character that is sometimes lacking in shorts.  I would be willing to read more from this author.

A great story of how with the support of family, and the love shared between Nell and Cole anything is possible. Financial and health problems, job stress, and a past haunted with abondonment are all things this couple must face to allow their love to grow.

Dominique has put together a great detox plan with full menu items. You can follow along step by step and receive the full benefit that a detox can offer. When you are done with the detox these recipes will be something you continue to enjoy.There a ton of tips for you at the end also to help with the transition. Recommended for anyone looking for a successful detox.
Her book was funny and intriguing enough to keep you interested. More Sci-Fi, Action than intense sexual scenarios. I actually look forward to the next book. It's worth the read.

This book contains considerable information on the Paleo diet. I have already tried several of the recipes included and they are yummy.  Recommend this book for anyone considering a paleo diet and wants to find delicious dessert recipes that go along with the diet.
Trying the ketogenic diet and was looking for a good book on the topic. I found this quite helpful and full of great info and tips.

Scared To Death by C.S. Latu is a standalone contemporary romance (new adult) novel about Ruby and Noah, best friends since childhood, who have to deal with issues of confusion, misunderstanding and fear of loss when lust and physical attraction start to weave their way into their friendship. Psychological and emotional issues take their toll as we witness the characters evolve through their young adult lives. You can't help but root for them throughout the story. It's one of those deep seated friendships that you don't want to see end.I stayed up way too late one night while reading Scared To Death because I just HAD to know what was going to happen next. That feeling of not wanting to put the book down hadn't happened to me in a while. I loved the friendship between the 2 main characters. The secondary characters are loveable and the last chapter gives off the impression that one of them might end up with his own novel.The eccentric backdrop to this story is unusual and refreshing. Noah is into the art of the macabre, with a passion for making frightful masks and costumes and a good part of the story unfolds in an old house that is home to a wax museum.Ruby is a very smart young woman and Noah is extremely sexy and sweet. This being said, you do, at one time or another want to slap both of them in the back of the head (but I love them nonetheless!).A really smart, emotional, quirky, sexy, sad-but-happy book with a good balance of lightheartedness and drama, with unconventional characters that stand out from your traditional romance novel. I love the way C.S. Latu brings her story to life. Superbly written. This is her debut novel.Technical info: New Adult, Contemporary, Romance. Contains mature content (language, violence and descriptive sexuality). Told alternately from Ruby and Noah's point of view. Characters in their 20's.I received a complimentary copy of this novel for an honest review.
summary: I stayed up very late one night wanting to know what happened next in this story of long standing friendship and blurred lines.

reviewText: This book is about Gabby who lives in a world where certain people have the power to control the elements; earth, fire, air, and water. Gabby finds out the she has the power of a Firemaker, but there is just one problem she has it. So one day Gabby’s decide to cut all of her hair and pretend that she is a boy. But before she is able to start her councilman training there’s is a fire that is started at the school. You guess right Gabby is being blamed for it. Gabby, does the only thing to do is to run from the authorities. While she’s is on the run from the authorities, she meets up with the rest of her council (air, earth, water, and manifested).  Gabby begins to develop more and more powers and with that she realizes that she has a great responsibility both to her country and her council. There are powers that are at play trying to manipulate Gabby. While on this journey she has become a much stronger woman to let someone take advance for her.While she on the run she meets a young man named Adam who can control the air. Gabby decides to teams up with him, even though there is a past alerting her to danger. The question I would have for her can she trusts him?This book was very engaging from the very begin of the story. There was plenty of action that will keep you turning the pages. This was an enjoyable read for me.

Excited about trying out the lasagna stuffed spaghetti squash, crisp baked lemon cod, coconut fish sticks, prosciutto-wrapped basil shrimp, and sesame chicken with broccoli.It also has helpful 'what foods to eat' and 'what to avoid' sections, along with excellent references and resources at the end of the book.Thanks for all the great information, and looking forward to making some of these recipes.
summary: There's some great information along with recipes in this book

reviewText: I recently went Paleo and part of this diet meant going gluten free. Although, if you are aware of what gluten is doing to you - everyone (Paleo or not) should be going gluten free. It's been incredibly difficult to stay gluten free though as it's in so many of my favourite dishes - pasta, morning breakfasts with my toasted bagels are now things I can't enjoy. In an attempt to find more delicious recipes that are gluten free, I purchased this book and was thrilled to find great recipes that replaced my cravings. The spaghetti squash recipe was a genius way to substitute my pasta craving! I also enjoyed the gluten free pancake recipes and Thai wraps using lettuce wraps! There are some great ideas in here and if you're looking for ways to easily go gluten free without feeling deprived of the dishes you normally enjoy then I would recommend this book for you.
summary: Great Substitutes for Dishes You Would Normally Enjoy

reviewText: This is a great collection of gluten free recipes. Until recent, I never thought I would be interested in this kind of diet, until my daughter got some health issues that was caused by gluten intolerance.Glad I found this cookbook.

This book was amazing. I really like things like this. This is my first time really reading about how to become a phychic and if I ever consider it, I know where to turn. This book has some detailed information to take you to the next level. I love it!
summary: I've Always Wanted To Be A Psychic

reviewText: Okay, I'm still out on this book series but I'm giving it another star for originality. I know nothing about Iris's past; but, my gut feeling is says that she has something to do with maybe the story Dair was watching on the news about the VP daughter that went missing five years ago. It was such a weird fact to throw into a story like this, without it being important in some way. Also, we got a glimpse of what the next two stories in the series "The Other Man" and "Tyrant" will be about, I nearly shit my pants when Frankie showed up to Turner's house. I just love when Lilley intertwine her characters. It gives me some new details from my old favorite character in her other books that I love. Not to mention they were in the Cavendish Casino too. All and all I enjoyed reading it and couldn't put it down, I can't wait for the next installment. I prayer Dair gets the ending he deserves. READ THIS STORY

WTH did that just happen!!  I love RK writing and this is definitely another one I love. Dair is obsessed with Iris and finding out what is going on with her.  I could not put this down.  Iris sure is an interesting chick.  I love Dair and his character and how Iris turns him into someone that is so not like him.  I love a book with hot sex and suspense.  This series is a must read I can't wait for book 3 to come out this month*****5 stars

Once again AMAZING! But Iris seriously, WTF is going on?!?! Dair you had my heart once again. I feel so bad for him. Soo many questions and theories are swirling in my head once again. I know whatever the answers are they are going to be a doozy.Bravo again Mrs. Lilley!
Another good installment of this series.  Intriguing. Hot sex. Mystery. Keeps me hooked.  Can't wait for the next book in a few weeks.

R.K. Lilley has absolutely outdone herself, I didn't think this serial could get any better but then she goes and proves me wrong!She takes the story to a whole new level of awesome. We still don't know so much about Iris. There is still this cloud of mystery on her and like Dair we want to know more!!This book, nay this entire series has captured me, I am so intrigued and I can't wait for the next one.This is a sizzling, over the top amazing book I have read in a while. I devoured this book in a couple of hours and that's note cause of it's short length but because of good it's and and how much I needed to flip the pages so I could read more.

I was given this book for my honest review by the author.I usually love Steena Holmes' books so much but for some reason I had a hard time with this one. I'm not saying it was bad, just that I couldn't get into it. Maybe it was because I didn't read the 1st book of this series. It was a slow read for me. One I would usually read in an hour easy but it took me several days. It just started slow for me although it did pick up about half way through and I was rooting for the two main characters to get back together.I would love to have the 1st one to read and find out exactly what happened between them and if it told what happened to Lexi when she was younger.I hate to write this kind of review when I feel a book is probably much better if you have more facts but I was asked for an honest review for being gifted a copy and that is what I have to do.It was not a bad story, just a bit confusing to me.I have to think others have read the 1st book and knew what was going on. I do look forward to finding out more about Lexi, Tessa, Ellie, Paul, and the rest in future books but this one just didn't do it for me.If I get a chance to read the 1st book, Sweet Memories, I could come back and change this review to more stars and a better review of the story. I won't say what it was about because I do not like to give anything away in a story. I don't like to read a review that gives away anything and I won't do it to others.I only gave it 3 stars and if not for it getting better in the middle and having a good ending I may have only given it 2. I just could not go any higher. It makes me feel bad, but I do have to be honest.
A very captivating and entertaining story with well developed characters. I always look forward to titles from this excellent author. Highly recommended!
Do you really want to stop drinking??? If you're really committed to stop alcoholism, this book is for you! I highly recommend it, give it  a read!
Wonderful series anxiously awaiting the next a must read series fun, sex and humor.
I absolutely love this series!  The heroine isn't some cry baby chick who just accepts her alpha males edicts. It just works!

I loved this trilogy.  There were so many twists and turns which left me yelling at the characters in my head or just truly loving them more.  Great ending to this love story...but wait there is more!  I would really love to read a book about Edward as well, will that be possible - I hope so.  This book could have used a little better editing but it didn't hurt the story.

I'm so happy when I found out it was another installment of the story of Gabiel Storm and Elizabeth Storm. I'm happy they work through everything. I was hooked from the start of the book. A Must Read! Great work Magda!!!!!

Very good read! I personally have been trying (and failing) to cut sugar from my diet. This is due to some excess body fat I have that I don't necessarily want. Needless to say I found this book incredibly helpful and I really is helping me towards my goals! 5 stars from me.

I teach English as a second language and my young learners loved this book. It's a fact that kids want to find out more about the world as they grow up. They are facinated by animals, especially strange ones! This book makes for an enriched learning experience. Page by page, kids learn about awesome, intelligent and interesting animals with coloured photographs and fun facts. Perfect for teacher/class interaction and projects or read aloud at home. Highly recommended.

I felt that the book was great! It had a lot of twists and turns and drama lol I loved the storyline as well because many ppl go through the same thing and it makes you think how do you get through it. But I love when it said you can't base decisions on people's opinions! Ppl may think you're crazy for leaving or staying anyway so what's the point in listening to their opinions lol But overall I love the book and the ending was pretty abrupt but in a way i believe she did it that way to keep you guessing so I look forward to the next book!

I thought this book was scorching hot! I think the author should write a better blurb so others will read it. And I know this is short but why is for free?  Two really hot men meet and get it on.  Tons of sex but still there is a relationship growing.  I want more of these two guys. Great story.  I want more please!

I enjoyed reading this book.  It has 26 tips from A to Z  to help you cope better with stress at work like K for kick-start your day, Q  for quiet time or V for value my dreams.  The book is well written and I liked how the author presented the tips and advices. It is very nurturing and let you see how important it is to take time for yourself to be happier and consequently feel more energized and more empowered at work.

This was a helpful and interesting read on anyone looking to strengthen their relationship. I think ever couple should read this book to be honest. I don't know many people that can go through a relationship without needing a little help along the way. This book gave be a chance to reflect and make some changes. The info was great. The most helpful was the chapter about taking time to do the little things for your partner that make a big difference. in the long run. Overall great info.

I Love Christina C. Jones story-telling style. This is a follow-up story that reminds me of the way she weaved the story in Love and Other Things. Tori and Avery's story focuses on their journey to finding forever together. I like the not-always a happily ever after real life, truer to life story theme. Every story doesn't always end with a wedding or a sound relationship established. Sometimes, like in real life- stuff happens-life happens and couples have to deal with the fall out. Ms. Jones guides us through the relationship with Tori and Avery with humor and fresh dialogue. This is a great 5star story.. You will love it. Can't wait for Chasing Commitment with Brandon as the lead character, and Catch Me If You Can and finally, Nothing But Love..
summary: Finding Forever is a Five-Star Story!!! Loved It..

reviewText: So I read, strictly business and unfinished business pssst.....I'll be honest I thought they were great books and hmmmm I thoroughly enjoyed, but  this book has placed this writer in my"forever writers"heartI loved this book, I'm going through a divorce, and I feel like freaking tori lol, so yes it was a great read

South Beach Diet Deliver.  Anytime we hear south beach in the equation we automatically think about hard bodies from the men and soft toned bodies from the women. If you’re like me thinking about that can be very intimidating. So reading this book was good for me because I was able to read about how to speed my metabolism up to work faster for weight loss. I have always had a slow metabolism and learning how to speed it up is a good thing for me. The good carbs and good fats, lean protein and low fat dairy has always been confusing for me but I can understand it a little better after reading his book.

What a delightful diet book! It was also truly an inspirational story. Here you have a woman starts out weighing 266 pounds and then fell in love. Her guy asked her to get married and she bought a dress that was way to small for her, but for her that was her goal. Her goal was to lose enough weight to fit in that size 10 dress.The animation of the stick figures goes along perfectly with the story. The author does a great job of not only being very serious but use humor in her writing. This actually kept me glued to the book, me wanting to see what the next pages would bring. I found the way that Ms. Westgate wrote to be very matter of fact and I loved the way her style was like she was actually having a conversation instead of just a bunch of words and sentences on a page. I loved the whole book, but I think I liked the last several chapters the best, where is describing the different phases that she went through.I highly recommend this book to anyone wanting to lose weight with a no nonsense approach.

This book is extremely informative discusses about different herbal medicinal products regarding curing sexual problems of any Gender. The informative listing of any potential side effects was also a plus in keeping me informed as a reader. This book is very useful and helpful. Great job!

There's nothing new here. Nothing. Everything that's talked about can be found on various blogs in various forms for free around the net. Rob Parnell claims that his wife and himself have made a living writing fiction, written over a hundred books between them, etc. However, there are only 4 items on his amazon author page that aren't "easy way to fill in the blank" books. Where is all this amazing fiction he earns his living from? Read blogs by writers who sell fiction and you can save your money on the "advice" in this book. Even the so-called template for outlining is nothing you haven't heard already.
summary: Nothing you can't find online for free

reviewText: Reiki healing is a new found stress reliever technique that I plan to incorporate in my daily routine.  Before, I was never aware that this practice of healing one's mind and body can be very relaxing and revitalizing until I came upon this book and read it. I learned a lot from this book regarding Reiki techniques and hand placements that will ultimately come handy when I wanted a quick break from a stressful day.  Reiki is a definite must try that I recommend to anyone who wanted to easily imbibe positive energy into their lives!
summary: Reiki healing for a more positive you!

reviewText: Reiki healing is a whole new concept to me. I have never heard of it before but as I like to read and discover new things I went for the book right away. The first thing I have to say is that it was not a waste of money. The book's topic is really interesting. The origins are Japanese and it is a method of “healing” or making you feel better by transferring ki or energy via the palm of your hands. It might sound absurd to some of you but keep an open mind and you will be able to grasp the concept really well.

I am slowly educating myself on living a holistic lifestyle but this is the first time I heard that there are essential oils to help lose weight. I love the fact that the author isn't just talking she walks the walk. This book is both inspirational and informative just as all of her books are. I'm thrilled that weight loss and a healthy lifestyle can be achieved NATURALLY and I'm so grateful that this author makes such good information readily available and easy to digest. I highly recommend this!
Well,I really enjoyed this book. Characters kept my interest. Moved quickly. Good strategy for the bad guys. I really will keep eye out for SEQUEL.

Fantastic book about positive thinking.  Well organised and well researched. Very powerful life changing book.I read a lot of "positive psychology" type books and this is my favorite so far.  Well worth getting.  I highly recommend it!.

Four Stars = Satisfactory Plus, a rewarding and engaging reading experience.Book 3 is the final in this series and it's easily the pick of the bunch.Why It Gets a High Rating:1. The overall work is well-integrated and polished.  The story flows easily and each leading character's POV change works well.  Best of all it's a high-paced story that grabbed me and kept me hooked from first to last.  Somehow all (or most) of the sprue and jagged bits that were present in Books 1 and 2 were cut off and polished out in Book 3: there was a more caring focus to it which perhaps hints that the author took a bit more time over its crafting.2. For the most part the story arc is credible, or if not absolutely grounded, at least it runs as a genuinely diverting entertainment.3. Although levels of creativity are at par with Books 1 and 2 (average) and there're no real surprises or twists in this linear story, technical details in most respects are excellent and environmental scene descriptions (a quality I look for in a zompoc novel) are right on the mark.4. Jillybean gets top billing in Book 3 with top marks earned for dissecting her psychology.  The ensemble cast sparkle at times with Sadie emerging as the action co-star but without much by way of three-dimensional development.  For example, the rationale behind her shifting relationship towards JillyB is told rather than explored and shown.  Suffice to say that Jillybean fans will not be disappointed. :pShortcomings:  (Remember 5 stars = The Exemplary Book)1. The Bounty Hunter begins with a zinging bang, then fades out into an ethereal boogyman.  Man, I was hanging out for a twist like TBH was in fact (e.g) Sadie's brother or one of Sarah's past bed-mates.  But no.  Big missed opportunity there in my opinion.2. Deus ex machinas are used to bridge plot holes and get the characters out of the doo-doo.  The miraculous arrival of XXXXX is a classic that had me shaking my head in disbelief. Also, more than one avoidable McGuffin also weaves its way into the yarn and is evidently used to pad out the narrative.  For example, Nico's wound requiring "action" and Sadie's illness providing "distraction".3. Abraham's cult was well handled but, as per Book 2, needed way more creative seasoning and depth.  Sorry, but in my opinion this class of Doctor No villain has been done to death by 50 years of Bond movies.  Like what the hell does Abe want with Baby Eve?  It's not explained...and his Wicker Man transposition was somewhat derivative.  Thomas Tryon's classic Harvest Home could have pointed the way: (e.g.) making a human sacrifice to "appease" the zombies instead of the present self-referencing artifice.4. No way would Sarah be able to do what she did at the end...no matter what her willpower.Overall Book 3 is easily the pick of the bunch and a highly enjoyable reading experience that kept me fully engaged from the first page to the last.  Okay, it has a few soft spots but none of them are of a serious nature.Go for it, you'll have no regrets...except to wish there was a Book 4 that meets or beats it on a quality entertainment experience.
summary: TAO Ends on a High Note

reviewText: I truly enjoyed the first two books and eagerly awaited this one. I must admit I'm a little disappointed in this one. The writing was great, just like the rest, but the story wasn't. I didn't care for the ending, or the path the characters chose. Overall it's a terrific series. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who loves a good zombie story.

“Swarm – A Zombie Survival Horror. (Book #1- Outbreak Escape Series)” by Alex South is simply amazing. I have to say that from start to finish this book is simply gripping. Main character John is developed to perfection with a deep POV that brings the reader close into what he thinks, feels and sees as the world around him begins to collapse. Survival is on everyone’s mind, including the Zombie’s who are on a wild hunt of death and destruction. Who will live? Who will die? I won’t say for sake of a spoiler. However, the end will take your breath away and leave you wanting more.In short, “Swarm – A Zombie Survival Horror. (Book #1- Outbreak Escape Series)” is truly the perfect start to what I feel is going to be an astounding series; Words to describe this book in my view are: Captivating, Thrilling, Suspenseful, and Action Packed in a well written fashion that I thoroughly enjoyed. Can’t wait to get started on the next book in the series and highly recommend to all. 5 Stars!!!
A great introduction to companion gardening for any gardening enthusiast. I like that this book gives a large range of suggestions of plants that will go well together

This book contains more juicing recipes than what I thought was possible. I always thought that it is not right to mix vegetables and fruits, since I cannot imagine how the combination will taste as well. But alas, I decided to get bold enough to try the recipes, and I was surprised. It tastes so good! I have been mix and matching different fruits and vegetables, and aside from the obvious health benefits, I have become noticeably slimmer, and my skin just glows. I have been using my beauty products less, and juicing my fruits and vegetables more. Highly recommended recipes!

In "The Wolves Next Door," we meet Julie, a curvy woman who moves into a new home and is pleased to discover her neighbours are two insanely hot and charismatic men. In doesn't take long for them to display their interest in her... The best part? She doesn't have to choose, she gets to have both steamy hunks! However, they are hiding a secret that might drive her away....This is a well-written and an oh-so-steamy read! I like love triangles, but love steamy ménage like this one. I liked the heroine, but LOVED the two heroes. They made my heart race!  What woman wouldn't love to have two dominant alpha shifters not only interested, but willing to share you, making your happiness and pleasure their goal? A steamy, page-turning story.
Minecraft: The Hidden Secret is another excellent Minecraft book. There are several that I have read the last several months. I do recommend this one in particular.

This series has been one of my favorites from Tiffany King. It's super fun and has such a strong female lead. I'm sad that it has to end but this was a good way to do it. I was personally happy with how things wrapped up, and now that it's finished it makes a great binge read.

Series:  Fantasy Diary #1Category /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceReceived from:  Siren Allen (in exchange for an honest review)Recommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentGrammar/editing:  A - near perfectThis is the first book in the Fantasy Diary series.  They do need to be read in order.Alyssa and her sisters, Adora and Ashley, have a tradition of writing fantasy diaries and competing to see who will fulfill their fantasy before Christmas.  None of them have ever won their little fantasy contest, but it's fun to play.  Alyssa's boss, Devin Jordan is her muse for all of her fantasies, but she is certain he has never thought of her that way.  Devin does think of her, constantly, but doesn't believe he should.  He is a Beast to her Beauty, a dark creature with a conscience, and he fears her reaction if she were to discover his truths.Alyssa and her sisters reminded me of the weirding sisters, each different, but together they are bonded and extraordinary.  Alyssa even has her cat familiar.  Devin may be beastly, but he is also incredibly compassionate and passionate with his Alyssa.  This was a terrifically dark, steamy, seasonal read, well worth reading.Back in December 2013, I read this great little story and I was completely sucked into this world of demonic vampires and lust-filled daydreaming.  Ms. Allen has decided to add content and characters.  It will now be a series. (I guess she took my "hint, hint" to heart - yeah me!)  While I loved this as a short, erotic, holiday story, now it is even better and I beyond excited that this story will continue just in time for Christmas this year.I look forward to more from Ms. Allen.  She is a master at the steamy romance that I love.

There is a lyrical prose to this that I enjoyed. It isn't the norm as far as kidnapping/contract but I liked it--it grew on me as I read. As I said the flow of it pulls the reader in. It has a sing-song feel to it. (You'll see what I mean if you read it)I will definitely be reading the next one.It is NOT dark even though it falls under the 'Guy owns girl' due to year long contract.

" You have five minutes of this life left."Those are the first words that I read and immediately I found myself pausing and thinking about if I was the one hearing that sentence. Five minutes left with my daughter and husband, not being able to see them laugh and grow, believe me it definitely set the stage for the story.This book was a post apocalyptic setting, the end came about with rain that never let up and dangerous sized hale.  The storms flooded the world and what did not kill most people, the radiation spills from building collapsing did.I like that the author mentioned that most of the survivors rescued in the start where children because of how resourceful they where. I found myself thinking about it and came to the understanding how right she was. With children's imagination and the will power to live, I could definitely see them being the survivors of a major catastrophe like that.The setting went back and forth between two different lives, the past when it all started and the present where things where a system had been set in place and had worked successfully in most peoples eyes for generations.  Sadly this took away from the book for me. It was hard to really get into the book when I had to switch mind sets back and forth. The alternating points of view made it very hard to connect with any of the characters.It was still a well written book, I would have liked to have the book broken up into two different books instead of the different points of views. I would have loved to get more of the stories and really gotten to know the two instead of going back and forth. It was obvious I was reading their life not living it with them.

You know the saying, "Some things are just better left unsaid..." Well in Kara Jones case, she probably wishes she would have taken that saying to heart and left the truth alone. Or just let those dogs that are sleeping in the corner, just lie. Sometimes mystery and wanting to know the truth trumpets all that knows best."Collision" by Kate L. Mary starts off with a punch. Our female lead is in a pretty nasty car accident. On her way home from school her Christmas break, her car skids and collides head on into a tree. She is banged up, but okay. During the time in the emergency room secrets are brought to life. Nothing she would have expected in her wildest dream. Kara's dad that she known her whole life is not her dad. Bad Part? You think there isn't something worse than this?? Well there is! Kara's mom has known this little fact for her whole life and chose not to let either him or her into this little secret. Kara's mom, Charlotte has her reasons. Some truths should never be told. Well little Miss Kara refuses to think so and goes on a journey of some unfortunate discovery. Which has her wishing she never made this faithful journey in the first place.I gotta say, when I read the synopsis it intrigued me and what made me want to sign up for the blog tour. I have always been a mystery girl. It was my first love before the "Fifty Shades of Greys" of the book world. When that came out and others like it, my love of mystery faded like fashion statements. But when I realized that I got two of the same type of genres that I loved, I dived right in. I wasn't disappointment with this book entirely, but I was disappointed with how the female character was portrayed in the book. I completely understand she found a devastating secret about her family and I would be hurt to if that was me. But my God. She put a whole new meaning into the word, "Brat". Drammmmmmma was Kara's middle name and that annoyed me. She kept playing the "woe is me" card just a tad bit too much. If your mother tells you there is a reason for her not sharing who your dad really is then believe her!! Don't make her out to be Satan or the plague. She's your mom, moms have their reason that just the nature of the beast. Now on the other side of the token I would want to know who my father was too, but I would of been upfront with her and told her this was just something I needed and wanted to do. *sigh* Kara was infuriating and almost the reason I couldn't finish this novel, but lets enter the knight in shining armor shall we. Derek was the savior of this story for me! He was funny, smart, geeky and downright sexy. Aww loved him. Derek was admiring Kara since High School. So for their paths to run again after this development was good for Kara. Since she didn't want her mom around and her dad that she thought all along was her dad, abandons her, Derek was a good addition in her life to keep her in check. I liked him alot! I truly think he was the best part of this book.Once the secret is found out, who her dad really is you are basically telling yourself, "Holy Shit..this can't end well". In some ways it really doesn't. The way the ending is setup it sounds like there could be a part 2, but looking at the author's Goodreads page it doesn't mention it. Time can only tell. This was a good story with a good pace. I just couldn't wrap my head around Kara. And sometimes you just can't with some characters. Don't pass this book up though because it is still good and entertaining read.Out of a 5. I'm giving this a 3.5. Good debut!

Vaughn and Keely's connection grows stronger as they get to know each other and there's more personal information revealed about Vaughn, as well as Keely, too. Plus, Keely is still adjusting to the fact that she has been named in the will of her lawfirm's recently deceased client and inherited that client's fortune. That is a problem for her because the client's other children and her lawfirm do not believe she is the rightful heir. This part of the series wasn't as fun to read as the first portion even though sexual tension still ran high because Vaughn's predatory advances didn't let up although he definitely has more going for him as a character, yet those other parts of him weren't elaborated on very much. Keely's resolve towards Vaughn crumbles and he is interested in her as more than a job. By the end, Vaughn has a new motive that involves Keely and so that will really be a page turner when the next installment releases. The question as to who hired Vaughn to seduce Keely still remains unanswered although there are hints in the story as to why.

So far I've only read Dissension, but I absolutely loved that. I'm itching to be able to carry on reading the remaining books, but life had just been too busy.  Here's my full review of Dissension and my full review of the others will be posted as soon aa I'm done reading them.Katie Salidas has succeeded in writing something different from her other books, this is a dark, gritty page turner; where the tables have turned and the hunter is know the prey and the humans are more bloodthirsty than the vampires.The world that Katie Salidas has created for me was totally believable. I could see everything clearly in my own mind and I was soon completely immersed with Mira, Olivia and Lucian to name just a few. The characters are fantastic.At the front of the story we meet Mira. Mira is an amazing vampire. She's not afraid to stand her ground knowing full well that every time she does, she will be punished; horribly! But still she stands her ground and faces her punishment head on! I suspect that Mira's desire for freedom; both for herself and her fellow vampires; is what drives her on; and gives her the strength to continually fight against the rules and her punishments.There seems to be a human owner for the vampires, Mira is no exception. Mira's owner is Olivia. I can only think of one way to describe Olivia; she is a complete and utter bitch! I don't like her one bit, she's evil! Olivia is only out for monetary gain and really doesn't care about Mira, she will readily dish out punishments for the tiniest of things. The only time Olivia is happy is when when she gains from Mira's behaviour, so when Mira wins a fight in the arena or when Mira manages to secure herself a Patron!In this new world there is a human governor; of sorts; called the Regent. The Regent; Lucian; watches the battles in the arena and decides whether the final fatal blow is to be delivered. Lucian has seen Mira fight in the arena, but he meets her properly on her latest escape attempt. He claims to be intrigued by Mira and wants to get to know her. Lucian convinces Mira to allow him to escort her back to her cell so that her punishment will be less severe. Lucian also decides to be Mira's patron much to both Mira and Olivia's surprise; not the Olivia will be complaining as this will give her more money! Mira doesn't trust Lucian. Lucian is is wondering if what he learnt growing up about vampires is actually true.I was hooked on this book from the beginning. I love everything about the book; the characters, the plot and the setting. I especially love how Katie Salidas has turned the tables on the vampires; so that they are no longer the predators, they are now the prey.There is action and humour throughout, its dark and gritty, completely different to Katie Salidas' other books, and I have loved every last page.

Newly mated, Cage and Bindi are faced with the daunting task of breaking into the heart of the military's base in order to rescue the children. While their bond continues to strengthen, the emotional turmoil of losing the kids begins to break Bindi's previously unshakeable core. Cage steps up to support her, but when previous emotional connections resurface from outside sources jealousy rears it's ugly head.Unexpected help arrives from others in the shifer community, and just when it seems that they may be able to regain their family unit, the military throws another wrench into their already shaky plan and once again Cage and Bindi must regroup.Another amazing addition to this captivating series, Revenge contains less of the romance that was featured in Betrayal and instead focuses on developing the exciting plot twist that left me hanging at the end of book 3. I was on the edge of my seat from the very first page as the suspense continued to build!A copy of Revenge was provided by the author in exchange for an honest review.
summary: A thrilling adventure from start to finish!

reviewText: The authors do an outstanding job as they work through the book keeping you so enthralled with all the strategic planning and fighting going on that you can't put the book down. Intermixed in this dynamic story is a very steamy, hot, love scene between Bindi and Cage.For me one part stands out. There is a scene between Bindi, Cage and Emma where I cried as these three deal with how Emma feels about Cage and vice versa. What a beautiful piece of writing showing Cages empathy for how Emma feels for him and him not using her love but their friendship to get her to help them save the children.To see the full review visit my blog: sportochicksmusings.blogspot .com

We are gardeners and I can tell you everything in this book is right on spot. In fact, neighbors often comment on our garden and how well it does. We have the greenest yard on the street and it never burns no matter how much the heat. The reason -- clover!! love it as natural fertilizer and nitrogen source.

reviewText: Competitors. Opponents.The attraction is undeniable.Trey and Faith are rivals, both vying for the same job. When circumstances force them to work together, the snark becomes foreplay… and eventually I just wanted to lock these two in a room and watch them go at it!! Trey is sexy as hell and never without class. Faith is a beautiful woman from his past, and soon he realizes that she is everything that he’s ever wanted.But she belongs to someone else.“I was looking forward to shooting you,” she smiles and bats her eyes, feigning innocence.“Me, too,” I say with a straight face.LOVE IT!And I’m going to need Trey’s brother, Jett’s, story ASAP!! His witty sarcasm and hilarious immaturity had me laughing out loud throughout the entire story!!“The idea of you always made me excited, but the reality of you in my life and in my heart is better than anything I could imagine.”TK RAPP, FIVE FEISTY STARS!!!!

reviewText: Leading the Way is the fourth novella in the Corbin's Bend series and serves as a cautionary tale highlighting the importance of communication in a Domestic Discipline (DD) relationship. In this installment we meet Erin and Zach who, along with their two daughters, have moved to Corbin's Bend in an effort to get their family back on track with a better implemented DD marriage. While Zach and the girls have adjusted well to the move, the same cannot be said for Erin. She's having a difficult time making friends and, understandably, feels shunned and lonely. Add would be expected, her feelings of isolation are worsened as she watches her husband and children flourishing.Although DD is not my preferred subgenre, I found Leading the Way to be a hoot and a half. Because a large part of the storyline focuses on Erin making friends, the reader gets dragged along for the ride as Erin and her new friends get up to no good on their bowling day. These ladies are a mischievous bunch that kept me chucking at their antics. The sex scenes were steamy, but I would have preferred more of them. That said, the focus of Leading the Way is the relationship between Zach and Erin and how it is enriched by living in Corbin's Bend.Ms. Masters has given readers a well written and entertaining novella that will enable you to return to Corbin's Bend and catch up on some former characters while meeting new ones. I really enjoyed this novella and am looking forward to the next book in this series, as well as checking out more of the author's writing.I received a complimentary copy of the book in exchange for an honest review.Reviewed by Angela at Crystal's Many Reviewers!
summary: 4 stars = I REALLY liked this book

reviewText: I honestly dont understand all the 5 star reviews. The writing was good but in all honestly the story was so totally unrealistic.... It what parallel universe does someone who you've just met, under 10 days, spend 1.5million dollars buying an online magazine so that the journalist you just me doesn't get fired because you want to have a relationship with her? You then tell her if she sleeps with you in the same bed you'll pay off her student loans totalling $85,000 - when she balks at that you up it to $150k. Then you GIFT her the magazine you just paid 1.5 million for. Declare your love to her and To top it all off, you've only known her for 10 days when her Dad has a heart attack and to give him something to look forward to you gift him a $250,000 rare mustang! I mean seriously..... When the hell has this EVER happened. Totally unrealistic

Flexible diet essentials is one of the most unique and interesting dieting books that I have read.  What makes it really unique is it is not a strict diet and definitely it doesn't require me to avoid or completely keep away from specific kinds of “bad” foods that I wanted to eat but rather, I just have to keep it in moderation and track my food intake in order to give my body just the right amount of macronutrients it needs.  Another good thing about it is it's interesting since there are also proper exercises provided to give me maximum results for my weight loss.  Moreover, it has a good amount of benefits to the body  and at the same time, I won't have to completely eliminate my sweet tooth cravings just to lose weight.

reviewText: Wow this book was just amazing and I was hooked right from the start. Both heartwarming and tragic in some parts, this is a tale of love, loss and everlasting friendship, with a triangle that leaves you loving all three of the main characters.At the tender age of 13 a young troubled meadow meets the Jacob twins, forming a close friendship, setting their future paths and sealing all three fates forever.As love blossoms over the years tragedy strikes leaving two friends to heal and mend each other, over the course of their young lives there is more heartache to come destroying the bonds formed and breaking hearts.time can only tell if Meadow is destined to finally be with her soul mate.This story is beautifully written with some fantastic characters with not just one but two hot alpha males to swoon over with some amazing secondary characters that are just as loveable, I would love to hear more about them.I'm a huge fan of Ker's writing and again she has delivered another excellent more then 5***** read. Fantastic!!!

I absolutely loved this book! Ian is everything you want in a man, rich, dominate and sexy. Tiny is absolutely 100% my favorite! She isn't one to take a handout or be pushed around. I enjoyed every page of this book and can't wait for the next one.

Victoria or Tiny is struggling, her mothers cancer is back and they haven't recovered from last time either emotionally or financially. Due to a severe leaning disability Tiny can hardly read making most jobs difficult if not impossible so she works hard as a bike courier delivering legal packages for Neil's Courier Service and not so legal ones for Malcolm her stepbrother. She's in a bad situation, desperate for money and nowhere to turn and this is when she meets Ian, one thing Ian has is money more money than he knows what to do with and although she's desperate Tiny won't take handouts or charity.Ian is rich and stubborn, he's used to getting what he wants, money means power which makes him a powerful man. Tiny is stubborn and despite her bad situation she's no pushover and she'll definitely stand her ground which sets this book up to be an interesting read.I loved both Ian and Tiny and I really enjoyed this book now I'm left waiting for Taking Control which is told from Ian's POV and is out later this year.

reviewText: Distant Desires – Part 1 by Cambria Hebert – 5 Shining StarsI am sure those of you that follow my blog know that I have read just about every single book of Cambria’s. Yup I love her writing that much. But those are romantic, ooohy, gooey, suspense filled, action packed books. So when she put out this new book Distant Desires and I read the blurb I thought “what she is writing about aliens – really”Well let me tell you something – READ THIS BOOK!!!!! It is stellar, it is exciting, it is make you wonder just what it might be like – yes I went there. OMG I mean hello if all beings from another world could do what this one can I am game for sure. LOL :PThat said Sophie girl wow, I am glad you chose the “remember” instead of the “forget” option. Sophie seems like your ordinary girl, working her dead end job, with friends and a guy she has crushed on forever, living her life day by day…. Then suddenly everything she always thought was not possible was right in front of her eyes and before she knew it she was on one heck of a ride.I could not put this book down. Okay well I did I had no choice or I would have had no sleep but you could read this in one sitting so be prepared when you pick this up – you will be pulled in and wanting to find out just what this mysterious (and I am going to go out on a ledge here and say Stunning) other worldy being is going to do to Sophie and what happens.Oh yes this is a cliff hanger book lol so if you don’t like those just be prepared – it is very well worth it. Cambria spins an amazing story here and draws you to the edge and is going to leave you dangling, waiting for the line to pull you up and into the next part.LOVED IT CAMBRIA!!!!!!!!
Intriguing!!! Left me wanting more. I am already hooked.Tales of friendship, loyalty, paranormal events, mystery. What more could you want?

reviewText: This is an informative guide that isn't your everyday "how to" self-help guide on relationships.  That's what makes it unique.  Ms. Watterson has written a personal account of how she has used -- and failed to use -- these seven tips in her own life and her own relationships.  Talking about her own successes and failures, Ms. Watterson's guide reads more like a friend's words than some self-help mumbo jumbo.  The seven points outlined are useful tips to keep an eye out for, because everyone falls into similar traps at one time or another in their relationship.  The important part is identifying when you're falling into those traps, and working hard to get out of them.  If you're struggling in your relationship right now, give this book a go.  It might just help you keep things from falling apart!
summary: Informative, valuable and a little sweet.

I loved how these characters were not what I expected and their relationship even though chalkiness was not predictable.Nina did a great job with this book!! It will make a great summer read. Gosh, what can is say about Lucian Bane and Dom Wars Round 5? I am not going to summarize the book because you can find the summary above and in other reviews.One thing I am not generous with is Five-Star Ratings but Lucian Bane earned every single one of them. Truthfully speaking, if there were 100 stars that could be given, I'd ask for 101. Lucian is a literary Genius and he certainly proves that in his writing. I read Dom Wars 5 in one sitting. I couldn't put it down! It's not that I didn't try, it was an impossibility. The first sentences grabbed me by my collar, dragged me into the center of the book, exposing my emotions, exploiting my senses, stealing any words I might have said. I laughed until I cried, my body shook with anger, my heart pounded with fear, my pulse raced with sizzling, erotic tension and my breath hitched as I struggled not to cry from heartbreak.Yes, it's like that! Every character that Lucian writes is so complex, have so many layers. They have their own personalities which explode off the page so brilliantly, you wonder if these are real people giving a first-hand account of the things they've experienced. He writes in such a way that is satisfying yet keeps you yearning, begging, needing more! More Lucian, more Tara, more challenges to dominate during the game. By the time you turn the last page you are speechless, spent, yet excited to see what comes next.Dom Wars 5 honestly left me in awe. It left me speechless and it left me satisfied. If you haven't began the Dom Wars Series yet, you are missing out on one of the BEST series' ever written and no, I'm not exaggerating. Dom Wars is Lucian's first work of fiction but you will never know it by reading it. Lucian is taking the literary world by storm and there is nothing they can do about it except hold on tight and experience the power of The Ineffable Dom.
summary: Just when I thought it couldn't get any better

reviewText: Up until now, Dom Wars has been, mostly, about two things:  Lucian and Tara’s relationship and sex.  There’s a lot of nuance to both of those and a lot of layers, but if you had to boil the major themes down to two things, these would be them.  We’ve watched Lucian and Tara come together and form this incredible relationship; they’ve been to hell and back in a very short period of time.  And they’re solid now.  There’s no more, will she, won’t she, they are standing together on a rock solid foundation.  Lucian launched a full out assault on every single one of her senses by engaging her entire being through intimacy, and it worked.  So what now?Now the real work begins.  Now we get to see how Lucian becomes the Ineffable Dom.  Now we get to see how reflexes get re-wired.  Now we get to see what happens when two newly born people, still in the process of letting their wings dry, go about learning to fly.Lucian’s work lies with his relationship with his father.  His reflex is automatic rebellion, no matter the instigation.  His reflex is to default to the inner monologue instilled by his father long ago that he’s not good enough, not worth enough, not capable enough.  The snake chasing its tail is that cycle of damnation and rebellion.  In order to finish his transformation into the Ineffable Dom, Lucian must first knock that cycle off course and hardwire new reflexes into place.  He has to re-learn how to trust himself on new legs.Round 5 also brings us a new level of Steve.  He goes from the cheery, problem-solving sidekick to a main character in this round when he’s made to pay penance right along with Lucian and Tara for their rule breaking behavior before Round 4.  Steve brings a wonderful dose of humor to what would otherwise be some pretty painful and uncomfortable situations.Last, but certainly, not least is the Preacher Dom.  Designated to meet out Lucian and Tara’s punishment for breaking rules, he’s set up as the bad guy.  He’s set up in such a way that we shouldn’t like him.  Shouldn’t want to know anything about him other than, hopefully, he’ll leave Lucian and Tara alone.  But I fell head over heels for him.  This man has survived the seven levels of hell through the grace of love and faith and to watch him dole out that faith and that love as lessons instead of punishment is glorious indeed.Lucian Bane has written a pivotal book with Round 5.  This book peels back the faade of pleasure, success and simplicity of competition and exposes the interior framework still under construction.  Exposes the raw nerves and, in the end, the immense power and beauty waiting to be claimed by doing that work.  This Round is well balanced between humor, introspection and some truly lovely (and hot as hell) scenes of intimacy with Lucian and Tara.  Bane continues to have moments of absolute perfection with his writing.  Moments that make me stop and have to re-read entire sections several times just for the sheer joy of it.  Those moments alone are enough to keep me shouting from the rooftops that everyone should read this series.I don’t know what the final round has in store for our crusaders.  But I do know that as long as their journey continues to be laced through with the same heart, soul and laughter than exist in all the previous rounds, it will be nothing short of epic.

reviewText: This is an absolutely amazing collection of hot stories to keep you entertained one the summer! I won't attempt to write a full review of each book but needless to say so far the stories have all been five star reads from me!Having never read anything by any of the other authors before it was such a great way of being introduced to them.  I particularly loved  His Wicked Games by Ember Casey which is incredibly steamy but had me from the first page.  The "game" that Calder plays to give Lily what she needs and wants is something totally different!I love Fierce by Clarissa Wild and you won't be able to resist falling for Hunter and the story will have you turning the pages until finish! I devoured this book in hours and it certainly leaves you wanting more from Hunter and Leafy (Autumn)!That First Kiss by J C Valentine is also the first of her books that I have read and I must admit it frustrated me yet I couldn't put it down! Classic one night stand that comes back to bite a girl on the backside and the interaction between Piper and Tate is worth the read!Slow Burn by V J Chambers - WOW this one was a bonus for me - such a gritty story and it kept me turning the pages. I was gripped from the start with Leigh and Griffin and it is a totally different read to the prior books! A worthy read in its own merits!Layers Deep by Lacey Silks this was a different spin on the troubled girl meets the wealthy boy story and was a good diversion from the usual!  As with most of the books in they boxed set this one is part of a series but I was left feeling a little frustrated at the ending (cliffhanger) and will definitely have to re read when I buy the sequel but all in all it was a good, yet very different book!And the bonus is that I STILL have five books left to read - Learning Curves by Olivia Regal, Can't Shake You by Molly McLean, His Indecent Lessons by Sky Corgan, Sorority Pledge by Daizie Draper and Rae Omnibus by Blair Babylon.  This has to be a 5 star read if nothing else but for the incredible value in getting ten hot books and ten hot book boyfriends to boot!One click now!!
summary: Ten hot book boyfriends - whats not to like?!

reviewText: Dana is a writer of sexy spanking, DD, and light Age Play books. And, as surprising as it may be, she had never experienced real life spankings or any of the other fun and kinky things that fill her stories. However, Dana's vivid imagination, keen research abilities, and general interest were enough to keep her busy. Dana's friend Carla had other plans for her and had been matchmaking behind the scenes. When Dana met Richard for the first time - he had a completely unfair - but totally sexy advantage. Not only had Carla shared lots of information that only best friends usually have - but she also gave Richard all of Dana's books to read. Richard knows full well what Dana thinks she likes and he is more than willing to engage in some kinky escapades. The real question is whether or not Dana's rich fantasy life can really translate into a reality.I would classify this book as a romance with light domestic discipline, light age play and some anal play. Most of the spanking scenes are mild, some are playful - but I wouldn't characterize any of them as harsh. Also, there are plenty of spankings for readers to enjoy. There was a more intense ménage scene - but if for some reason that isn't your thing -it turned out to be a dream anyway. My favorite part of the book was watching Dana's relationship with Richard unfold. Richard is an awesome leading man for a kinky romance. He is handsome, dominant, caring, attentive, patient, has a sense of humor, and if I explain too much further I'm sure I would end up swooning. I totally recommend the book.Please note that I was provided with an advanced free copy of this book for review purposes.

I got this book for my nephew who's a huge Minecraft fan and he loved it. Some made him roll his eyes and some made him laugh out loud. He said it was worth 5 stars so I'm leaving this review for him. The jokes made no sense to me since I don't play Minecraft but that's to be expected.

What a interesting book!  The author writes about her early years and always having excess belly fat. As a teenage she experimented with fad diets only to lose but gain back.  It wasn't until she and her husband found out she was pregnant when she know something had to be done.  She learned that being over weight could also have bad consequences on your health, such as diabetes, which she was diagnosed while pregnant. The Flat belly diet has two parts, the four day anti bloat followed by the four week maintenance plan. The good thing about this diet is you don't need to but special foods or spend money on exercise programs. She tells about the right foods to eat and those to avoid, along with regular exercising. Belly fat seems to be the hardest to get rid of but this author makes it sound easy with her plan. I highly recommend reading this book if you struggle with belly fat.

DIY Home Improvement Secrets: 49 Amazing Ways Save Money, Improve Your Home and Fix Things You Thought You Couldn't is such a great book!! I learned so many things about how to effectively do minor and major home improvements that will help me save a ton of cash in the long run for a lot of bills, plus increase the value of my home 10 fold! From outlets, painting tips and tricks, ideas on how to save money on electric bills (in Arizona our electric bill quadruples) how to entertain your children at low cost, nice curb ideas to bring value to your home, plumbing,plus many many more ideas.I LOVED this!! Cant wait to start trying out all these great ideas!

This book is one of my favorite books I have read in a long time.  I say this because it is one I can relate to on a personal level, I am personally a do it yourself type of person and a hobbyist.  Home improvements are a must and you have two choices either call a handyman or as the title says roll up your sleeves and do it yourself.Yes, you will have to read up and learn the how to’s as well as safety but you can save money and also have the satisfaction of doing it yourself.  This book is full of great ideas not only for home improvement but also really good ideas on new hobbies.I will recommend “DIY Home Improvement secrets: 49 Amazing Ways Save Money, Improve Your Home and Fix Things You Thought You Couldn’t” by Patricia Mayo to all of my friends and family.  This book may even bring your family together to learn what you didn’t think that you could do.

In this book it tells you to start from the top and work your way down. Keep your hot water heater at 55 degrees celsies to lower energy snd chances of burning yourself This book breaks down every part of your house and teaches you how to make sure its running correctly. This book also teaches you how to make your bills smaller but having certain lightbulbs. In our house we have the energy lightbulbs. Tells you how to set up your electronics the right way with a sergy protector. Buying a home is expensive so you want to keep your bills low. We dont own a house yet but planning on owning soon. This book is a must read for all home owners. Never to late to find cheap ways to fix problems with your house.

How I cured my Depression- The Practical Plan I used to Cure my Depression and anxiety problems without Drug prescriptions and expensive counseling sessions by Gabriella Williams was eye opening. She grew up with negative thoughts and issues her whole life and tried medication and therapy and just kept trying it. It never really worked and just kept doing it. Wow one day someone took an opportunity to reach out to her in the grocery store and saw the cutting marks. This lead though to a life of Health and Contentment. She learned the way of meditation and other ways to deal with life. I like the real examples of how to get through the thoughts, and actions to be healthy. When you put yourself first to get stronger and healthier is great. Even how she gave examples of toxic people and what to do is amazing. I learned a lot and will be putting it into practice. I highly recommend this book.

Cocktails At Home: How To Surprise Guests With Perfectly Appropriate Drinks For Every Occasion is such a darling ebook!
