The how-to prepping guide is very helpful as well.There are soooo many different varieties of recipes she gives as well, that are classy and elegant. I will have to try some of these drinks myself sometime soon.And wow my own guests.Great book to help anyone out who needs a heads up on how to make great drinks, and impress even yourself!

When preparing yourself to expand your cocktail making skills, you need to look at it as if you are earning a PhD, you will need to practice and study as hard as you can so you can become the master cocktail maker that you may want to become.There is some good information in this ebook. I like the ideas on what to use if you can't afford the basic tools were interesting.  A couple of the tips for making the most of your entertaining that was offered I had never thought of before and will be using for any party I have in the future.  I can't wait to try out some of these recipes like the  Gilligan's Island Cocktail or the Silver Dog Cocktail and the Tropical Heaven Cocktail sounds divine and can't wait to taste it.  This book is very helpful, I am going to throw a cocktail party because of it.

And it just keeps getting better----Kalon is part 2 in the Take Over Series. And as much as I enjoyed Krinos, Kalon was even better. I found myself wanting to cry when I finished the last page because I really need to know what happens next.Krinos is back with a vengeance. She is kicking butt and taking names, all while wearing her favorite stilettos. She is rapidly becoming one of my favorite heroines, and I find myself wanting to be her when I grow up.Krinos is taking over her fathers Drug Empire, and as she is trying to make her way in a male dominated Mafia, she somehow manages to maintain her femininity. I LOVE this about her. She isn't afraid she will break a nail, and jumps in with both feet. Don't want to listen to what she says? No problem, hope you didn't value your life. Want to question the choices that she is making? Again, no problem, you just got demoted, to 6 feet under.Stephanos-- mmmmm....he is just lush!!!! But, in the 1st installment I found myself really wishing he would "man up" a little more. I needed him to be a bit more alpha and not take so much crap from Krinos. In this installment he came charging through. And I LOVED it! By the end of the book, I was panting after him wishing he would show up with guns blazing, to my front door and take charge. He has found his voice with Krinos and is finally taking over and doing what any good alpha male should do---which is what ever he d*** well pleases.The only down side to this, is that right as everything gets going, you're left hanging until the next installment.... I really really need to know what happens... and Im really hoping Krinos makes the right decision. No, Im not going to tell you what she is trying to decide... but, I will tell you I was surprised with the curves in the road that author took us through...Bring on the next installment please!!!!
summary: and it just keeps getting better.....

reviewText: Loved these characters so much! Their chemistry was off the charts & I think Sherry & I could be BFFS! All the post-its made me swoon, too. This book had me grinning from beginning to end!
summary: You should totally read this on purpose

reviewText: Remember how in Taste the Heat (I think) there was this part where Sherry’s ex cheated on her? Well…. I mostly hoped Cane will do something about it in Sherry’s book. He didn’t. But that doesn’t mean the ex didn’t get his *snickers*Sherry Robicheaux is the youngest sister to Cane and Colby. Colby got her HEA in Taste the Heat and Cane in Seven Day Fiancé.Sherry was always the one to jump into relationships looking for ‘the one’ and always fell head over heels in love. She always got burned, too. Which leads her to just give up trying.When Colby can’t go on a business trip catering an event in Las Vegas, Sherry goes in her stead, having decided it is also the perfect opportunity to make that night in Vegas her last careless night as a risk taking-free-spirit. Her last night of irresponsibility.Tyler Blue and his up and coming band, Blue, is required to marry, or at least settle down in a steady relationship. Fans demand it, so his contract demands it, too. The thing is, he doesn’t want to. Tyler is a player on the outside but just likes to have fun when not in the spotlight.Tyler likes the new caterer. Sherry thinks Tyler is a Blue roadie. They hang out that weekend, drink themselves stupid and wake up, yup yup, married.Tyler promises he’ll take care of the marriage using the band’s lawyers, Sherry leaves it all to him, impressed the band thinks so highly of him (still a roadie, yes?) and will help with this – and heads home. The news break, Sherry discovers Tyler is actually the lead singer of Blue and that he would actually like to stay married, as a PR stunt.They need to figure out how to live as husband and wife for the next few months – which will serve both their purposes. He will give his fans and the label the image they want him to have. Sherry will not be perceived as the silly-girl-who-falls-in-love-with-every-guy-she-dates. But actually living the life, on the outside playing the perfect couple and behind the scenes keeping up the charade is becoming increasingly hard.This romance is just what everyone needs in their reading repertoire. Its fade-to-black Bliss style leaves both much and not so much to the imagination. It carries a swoony punch, it carries humor. There are wonderful circumstances in the plot and all the Taste the Heat and Seven Day Fiancé characters fill their roles as supporting Sherry and Tyler beautifully.So how in love am I with Rachel Harris’s writing? A LOT. Why? Because of many reasons, most of them start and end with her magical writing. Sherry and Tyler’s story is perfect, as are the first two titles in the Love and Games series. It is also the last book in the series, and I can only recommend and then recommend all three some more.Go get it. Read it. Enjoy it and tell your friends. This one does not disappoint.* My thanks to Rachel Harris and Entangled Bliss for this title’s copy in exchange for an honest review.

3.5 starsSherry is a bit of a wild child and not necessarily on purpose, but somehow she always ends up in these crazy situations. Though this last one definitely trumps all. She is a woman that falls in love very easily, she loves to love, unfortunately love doesn't seem to love her really back. So far all she's left with is a broken heart, though I like that she never really gives up on love.Just one more crazy weekend in Vegas and then Sherry's had it. She wants her happily ever after, which means no more bad boys and hello nice guys. What she didn't count for though was waking up and married, let alone to country superstar Tyler Blue. Sherry doesn't even like country music.The last thing Tyler Blue wanted was a girlfriend, let alone a wife. While he's not okay with the idea, his publicist and management think otherwise. Him being married is apparently a PR dream come true. Now Tyler just has to convince Sherry to play his wife a little while longer.From that first page the attraction between them is obvious, that's what got them in trouble in the first place. There is this click and easiness between them, that is just plain swoon worthy. Playing pretend isn't easy, when slowly real feelings are involved. I liked how it all developed, there is that chemistry but things turn pretty naturally into something more. Tyler and Sherry spend time together and live together, there is bound to be some feelings involved. It's impossible to deny, now they just have to figure out what to do with them.Sherry and Tyler are great characters. They are very easy to connect with, have very distinctive voices and there is this overall sweetness around them that is simply adorable. It's a sweet and innocent story about finding love when you least expect it and giving that love a real change.*I received a copy through NetGalley in exchange for an honest review*

The Fall of January Cooper is an intriguing story about two people who are unhappy for vastly different reasons. Over time, they teach each other they each are strong and can weather any storm.January Cooper is known as the rich girl, the spoiled girl, the girl who gets everything she wants. And she seems to live up to those perceptions. But underneath, she's a vulnerable young woman who rarely gets what she wants, and what she most wants is someone to love and accept her for her. When her father is arrested for orchestrating a Ponzi scheme, things go from bad the worse.Christian Cutlass is a damaged young man. Once a promising young hockey player, he lost everything he most cared about in one night. He now drowns his guilt in work, school, and alcohol. When January comes into his bar one night, Christian's life is irrevocably changed.I really enjoyed watching as January and Christian became friends, and not friends, and back again. There seemed to be miscommunication between them as they each tried to stay away from the other but there was snarky banter that made it entertaining. I liked that their relationship wasn't going to be perfect but they seemed to be exactly what the other needed. And the emotional growth and healing they brought about in each other was touching.I liked this story and the characters so much. However, I felt there were a few threads in the story that were either left somewhat unresolved or resolved in an unsatisfying way. One thread, involving a character named Vanessa, seemed more important that the resolution it received. I also didn't like the way in which events with January's parents culminated. I know they were selfish and greedy people but to have treated January the way the did seemed a tad unrealistic (maybe because I'm a parent who can't fathom it) and it made for too tidy an ending.I don't know if Ms. Bell plans on giving us more of January and Christian's story but I certainly wouldn't mind. As I said, I liked these characters quite a bit and maybe I'd get a better resolution for January's parents' story, as well as for Vanessa. The Fall of January Cooper was engaging and nicely paced...at least until the end.**I received a complimentary copy in exchange for an honest review.**

This is not one of those spoiled rich girl thinks that life is easy and that everything is right for her. Although a spoiled rich girl just like that is in this book it's not the typical book. January had everything that a girl could want but than again she didn't. Her life was being flushed down the toilet and the friends that she thought that she had were not really her friends. This book had me laughing and cheering on January as she figured out that life is not what she thought it would be. Christian is the guy that was on top on the world until one day all that changed and the life that he always knew was taken from him. He lost his hockey career and his brother and he felt that he had nothing to live for. This book was about January and Christian finally each other and what they both had left in life. I loved the fact that January was this girl that lost everything but she was still willing to fight. The back and forth banter that January and Christian had while they were trying to fight their feelings for each other was the best ever because they kept you wanting to read to see what they would say next. I enjoyed this book from the beginning to the end and I hated to see it end.

The Fall of January Cooper was a completely unexpected surprise for me. Picking up a book by an author you've never read before is a real toss up. You never really know what you're going to get. Well, what I got, I LOVED. Audrey Bell writes exactly the way I love my books to be written. Smart. Clever. Witty. Unpredictable. Real. This book is funny. I don't know if it was supposed to be funny, but it is. The writing is sarcastic and snarky and so full of humor, I laughed out loud more times than I could count. The characters are just so real, their dialogue so authentic. This story is original, refreshing... perfect. While the blurb is just vague enough to allow a reader to assume this story could potentially be cliché, it's anything but. You've never heard this story before.January Cooper is a child of privilege. She's a spoiled, self-absorbed Harvard student whose biggest worry is what designer shoes to wear on any given day. But the author nailed the development of this character. Reading the story through January's point of view, I, as the reader, didn't know how self-absorbed she actually was. The author crafted this story in such a way that I could never really decide if she was actually a self-centered brat, or if she was actually just very right about all of the crappy people she constantly talked crap about behind their back. January is obviously wealthy and spoiled and of the mindset that she  has been the perpetual victim of a crappy family, crappy boyfriends, crappy friends. But is she? Or is she just so wrapped up in herself that she fails to see things as they really are? Maybe a little of both. Maybe a lot of both.I loved Christian Cutlass. He's no-nonsense. No crap. Every word out of his mouth, I just wanted to devour. He's the perfect male hero because he's just so darn real. He doesn't say all the right things, do all the right things. He's real enough to make mistakes, enough mistakes to tick off the reader and add a decent amount of angst to this story, which I love. He's just a genuine guy, trying to navigate through a really crappy course of events that have altered his life forever. And when his broken world collides with January's collapsing one, it isn't all cliché rainbows and sunshine. Together, their dynamic is just perfect. Perfectly imperfect, really, as they fight each other, fight themselves, all the while developing an unlikely friendship and an even greater understanding of each other amidst their growing attraction.This story is told in alternating first person points of view... my favorite kind of thing. I love getting inside the heads of these characters, knowing exactly who they are even though the other character has no idea. Their inner monologue is just as witty and humorous as their dialogue. My only criticism of this story is how rushed some scenes felt to me. It wasn't a significant rush, but just enough to leave me wanting more detail, stopping briefly to reread a few sentences to try to figure out what I just missed. But never enough to remove me from the storyline... which was consistently well paced. This is an extremely well written story of love, loss, and self discovery. It's a beautiful story of unearthing who you really are after you've lost everything that once defined you.
summary: An original and refreshing story with snarky, sarcastic dialogue.

reviewText: I really enjoyed Love Show and I was excited to read this book. Overall I thought it was a good read I would give it 3.5 stars if I could. I thought that the banter and arguing between January and Christian was just enough to be defined as a relationship where they challenge one another without getting tiresome. Their relationship overall worked well and developed nicely. The things that did bother me though were the fact that January comes off as a high strung, air head snob and I feel like she never completely shakes that. Her background seems so underdeveloped we don't know what she's studying at Harvard, what she wants to do/dreams if doing, or is she a good student (unlike Love Show which had a very realistic college feel (I am in college so I can vouch)). We get briefly that she rides horses but she never seems passionate about it and it's a brief blimp. I think January does change for the better by the end of the novel but the way that she's presented in the beginning really never leaves her character and maybe it's the lack of background that does it.I also had to get over what I sort of saw as a plot flaw with Christian (hockey playing boyfriend some I'm up to speed on this information). When you're drafted into the NHL, unless you're one of the top three players (even these aren't guarantees) picked you don't go straight into the NHL (of course exceptions are made made on the basis of what the teams need(looking at you Sidney Crosby)). But lots of teams want the players they draft to stay in college or with their junior teams and continue to develop for at least another year otherwise they would probably be playing with their minor league team. I just felt it was a flaw in the opening with Christian and Sam. The rest of the things pertaining to hockey were great though because lots of other novels I've read get them wrong.I was also disappointed by the way it ended. There seemed to be no true climax and the Epilogue really didn't offer much. I would have liked to see it be a few years later as opposed to a few months. Overall I still liked it but I would definitely recommend Love Show first

Addiction is an insidious disease that can sneak up on you when you least expect it, especially when you are at your most vulnerable such as while you are recovering from a major injury or surgery. It is very difficult to overcome because addition changes the way your brain operates and artificially prioritizes the substance you are addicted to.  Knowing it's bad for you and knowing that you want to quit isn't enough by itself. You need more support and understanding of how the process works.This book provides valuable insight into the nature of addiction and what you can do about it. It lays out strategies for the first few days which can be white knuckle torture, as well as long term.
summary: Insightful Guide to an Insidious Disease

reviewText: First off, I like these free downloads to see new ways of presenting aromatherapy topics.  However, I will start with this comment there is no such thing as either Avocado or Coconut essential oil.  Second, the recipes for "Essential Oils" in this book are infusions where herbs are steeped in oils, they are NOT essential oils.  Essential oils are most often steam distilled from the plant parts in a still...you do not derive essential oils from steeping herbs in oils...there is actually no "OIL" in essential oils.  Keep this in mind as you read this book....though later in the book, recipes call for the FUNDAMENTAL oil...so I think they might have realized the mistake and were trying to fix it, but inhalation of infused oils is not going to yield the benefits...herbal infusions and essential oils are not interchangeable in aromatherapy.

reviewText: Well then. I see what all the fuss is about. I don't like young, virginal heroines because they're often portrayed in a very immature, childish way, and their dialogues just make them worse. The exact opposite was the case here. The way she spoke, the way she carried herself; she wasn't a timid, flaky female, and I loved that about her. Yes, she had baggage, but her character didn't use it at every opportunity to shy away from everyone. She kept a mysteriousness about her without coming off as pathetic.And wow, Sebastian. He made a big, good first impression in the foreword. For a then seventeen year old, he seemed mature beyond his years. If he was cute then, he was devastating as an adult – all raw passion, intense and mysterious. It took a while for the SEAL part to come to the fore, and I'm quite pleased that there was a little more emphasis on the fact he was military instead of some pampered billionaire who thinks money can buy everything and everyone. There were times I thought he recognized Talia, and then he'd say or do something that said he didn't. That push and pull is just a part of the magic between this pairing. Throw in a bit of BDSM-lite and the sex fizzled my Kindle.I'm not going to lie, I'm a bit peeved that this story ended, unlike the others, without a HEA. This is part of a serial, and now the wait begins. This was a very well-written, beautiful story, and I can't wait to read the sequel.**I read this as a part of the Hot Alpha SEALs Romance Megaset**
summary: Scorching hot and mysterious. A very well-written erotic romance with intriguing characters.

reviewText: Has a lot of useful information about many different herbs and wild flowers that can be used to help with just about and ailment. Great for people new to herbal remedies and experienced herbalist. The information is short and precise so you can find remedies quickly and start making and administering them.
summary: This is the perfect starter book for using herbs

reviewText: It was Plato, I'm pretty sure, who first described love as a form of "divine madness," and Insipid does an awesome job of putting flesh on the bones of that abstract concept. It's a beautiful story, beautifully told, that unfolds gradually, just as MC Jade's world is crumbling around her.  But that process of destruction is also a process of creation, as each seemingly crushing blow contains within in the seeds of the next stage of Jade's journey.  What I really loved most about this book was the way it describes that astonishing, reason-overwhelming experience of being consumed by the irrational emotional experience of falling in love, inappropriately, wildly and inexplicably, even to the person undergoing it. That crazy feeling of "I know this is a bad idea, why is it so compelling?"There are several other elements of this book that really stand out for me as well.  First, the portrayal of Jade's world of finance and deal-making.  Many writers attempt to depict this world - there's no shortage of sexy CEO's, bad-ass billionaires, and make-believe moguls in the realm of romance and women's fiction. But few, if any, have the verisimilitude and believability of Christine's portrayal of Jade's world.  From the boardroom encounters to the painstaking process of document review, her familiarity with the setting, and her ease at recreating it bring the background to life.Another element I loved is the way Christine uses the seasons and elements of the natural world as metaphors.  Okay, that's maybe not the most original thing in the world, but that's a fault more of my description, because her use of it is fresh and always apropos. Allusions to the natural world enhance the emotional impact of the story, as well as move the narrative along.Finally, I want to just touch briefly on Christine's eloquent style - she has a lovely gift for a memorable insightful phrase that lights up the story like brief flashes of lightning.  You'll find your highlighting finger working overtime as you discover them.  Here's an early on example that draws in the seasons, too:I found love in the summer and then lost it in the spring.  I cried myself to sleep in the winter and froze my heart with the soft tumble of the snow.Lovely, really.  And although at this point in the book it's just foreshadowing, it serves a narrative as well as poetic purpose.Christine's skill as a storyteller and writer has matured with each of her novels, and here in Insipid she has really hit her stridee.  I urge you to enjoy the sometimes bittersweet, but always artful pleasure that Insipid affords.
summary: Love is a form of divine madness, a fire that renews us even as it consumes

reviewText: Don't bother buying this book, it's a waste of money. Nothing is referenced, there are spelling and grammar errors, etc.. The book is obviously just thrown together and slapped on Amazon for a buck.Instead, google ketogenic diet, and you'll find websites written by actual experts on the diet and it won't cost you a cent, and you'll get much better, more complete information with the scientific references to boot. For instance, this book has a section called Tips on Maintaining the Ketogenic Diet Lifestyle section; it seems to be a rewrite of information you can get for free from the top ketogenic diet websites.

I love this this series. Redeemed Love is my favorite, I gave it a five star rating, but it deserves five plus rating. I could not stop reading, it's that good! I'm happy and cannot wait for the next one to be released in the fall
summary: Best in the Sulfur Heights Series

reviewText: I've bought all kinds of boxed sets, from Alpha to MC...It's a refreshing change to see a boxed set featuring heroines who are voluptuous, curvy, have a little meat on their bones, pleasingly plump...Well, you get the picture.Curves For Him is a boxed set featuring 10 bestselling authors who have written in a variety of sub-genres, from IR to paranormals/shape-shifters.  It's nice that they've included some of the best stories available for us to read and enjoy within one boxed set, and at a steal-of-a-deal price, too.If you follow my reviews, you would know I'm a huge Dez Burke fan, and one of her stories, Burned by Passion is included in the set  Burned..is a hot read, featuring curvalicious heroine Kira, who has a love-hate relationship with the British hero, Blake.  However, the heat, the passion between these two are explosive.I've also read a few of the other authors' works in this boxed set as well.  Aubrey Rose and Marian Tee are among them. But I'm also introduced to one or two other authors, whose works I haven't read as yet, so I look forward to reading what they have to offer.This boxed set has the potential of being a great summer read.

This is a ten book box set. To date i have only read one but  the one i read makes me want to read all of the rest. Scent  of a Mate By Milly Taiden is Sexy and Funny. Let me just say that i loved this book. I can not wait to read the rest. Well worth the  99 pennies. Sassy Mates Books are awesome.The relationships in Scent of a Mate by Milly Taiden  are palpable. Jordan reminded me of myself when i was younger so guarded and sassy. LOVE HER. Aric is an alpha that is amazingly hot and in control. Seriously, i cant go into more detail because of spoilers. Just get the book already. go, click, buy,  shoo go, now, click it!
summary: Every book will rock your socks!

reviewText: OMG the men that Jennifer creates!!! WOW just WOW! Getting a glimpse of the wedding of Clare and Logan was so sweet. I swear I fell even more in love with Logan. I laughed, and yes I may have shed a tear or two too.This amazing author has a way of making you feel like you are living every second with these characters. Thank you again Jennifer for a wonderful book and series! <3
I really enjoyed this. I cried and laughed. Finding true love after losing someone and finding out they have more troubles ahead and just loving each other.

These stories allow the reader time to escape the their sad life and live  theirs through what the author has crated. This author has been blessed with the ability to create a story that makes it easy to draw you in and carry you away from daily troubles.
summary: IT REALLY DOES SUCK FOR THOSE OF US WHO WOULD LOVE TO LIVE WITH THIS OPPORTUNITY!

reviewText: I received this book for free in exchange for an honest review. This does not affect my opinion of the book or the content of my review.Her Imaginary Lover by Doris O’Connor grabbed my attention from the blurb and I crossed my fingers that it would live up to the expectations set by this intriguing blurb. I am so happy to report that Her Imaginary Lover was everything I hoped it would be. Ms. O’Connor impressed me with her creativity and imagination.Macie Johann has been blind since birth but she’s never let her disability stop her; until one night when she is attacked on her way home by men taking advantage of her blindness.  Macie is rescued by a muscle bound hunk that seems familiar. Her savior turns out to be her childhood imaginary friend, Kaylom. Turns out he’s not imaginary, but he’s not exactly human either. Macie knows that Kaylom and she are meant to be together but there are so many obstacles to a happy ending.Macie was a fascinating character and I loved how her blindness was not used as an obstacle but instead just a part of her such as her hair color or height. Being unable to see did not hinder her determination to win Kaylom and did not detract from her inner strength. Macie was a smart, independent woman with a successful career. It was very easy to cheer for her to find love.Kaylom was everything you would want in an imaginary friend, but as a real life lover he exceeded my hopes. In addition to being well built, strong and alpha, he was protective of Macie and willing to sacrifice his own happiness in order to ensure her health and safety. I think I fell in love with Kaylom almost immediately and wanted nothing more for this couple to be together.I was so enthralled with Her Imaginary Lover that I read and finished the book in one sitting. The book had everything I could want in a romance novel - original storyline, fascinating characters and hot sex. Ms. O’Connor really knows how to write steamy sex scenes that are off the charts hot but still include love and caring that raises the lovemaking to another level.Her Imaginary Lover is a novella coming in at about 75 pages which is my only complaint because I wasn’t ready to say goodbye to Kaylom and Macie. I wanted more of Arthura and maybe some more hunky imaginary friends. Maybe Ms. O’Connor could write a new series about these imaginary friends? Oh well, a girl can hope.

Immortaland paints the picture of the greatest dreamscape you could ever hope to imagine. Walking you through in second person, it is a little like a guided meditation, the purpose is to simply let go, enjoy, and explore the fantasy kingdom. And it's a great kingdom at that. I could almost feel the cool water on my skin as the story took me to dive in, and watch as the landscape spread out before me while I flew overhead. It's really well imagined and, well, I'd certainly like to go there! If you want to experience what it is to be a hero, and be able to just let go an do what you want, read this book.

Review by Author Cliff RobertsThis every campers or grill masters guide to quick easy eating. Great recipes written in an easy to follow style.  It’s short and sweet. Easy to carry around in a backpack. I highly recommend this book to everyone even the stay at home occasional griller.http://www.amazon.com/Light-Up-Grilling-Campfire-Cookbook-ebook/dp/B00L0UKE6O

For someone who loves to go on long or short trips and loves to cook, this is just perfect for me. I always want to release my stresses away by cooking. The recipes in this book are very simple and easy to make – very convenient when cooking outdoors. It gives good ideas to those who love camping. This book is worth having.

I love cookbooks and this is one of my favorite! The recipes look really good and the instructions are easy to understand and follow. Being in the outdoors is just so much fun especially when you have good food and great company. I highly recommend this one.

While I don't do it as often as I like, I love to spend time with my family cooking and camping out in the summer, and this book really brings the two together.  Full of helpful, easy to prepare and delicious recipes like stew, stir-fry, pizza, burritos and (my favorite) BBQ ribs. The author also provides easy readymade checklists of what gear and equipment to bring so you don't forget anything for stress free camping.  My only wish was that they also included photos of each recipe, but it didn't take away from my enjoyment of the book.  Extremely useful guide!
It's Leah's and Gavin story. I really enjoyed this book. Leah had to overcome so much in her life. But with help from family and a good man like Gavin, her world turned out pretty good.

I loved this book. Gavin is a dream come true. I loved that there was no drama and conflict between the heroine and hero. It was all about getting to know someone, trusting them, and letting go. It was beautiful and perfect.

Ella Fox has done it again!! The anticipation to the lead up of this book was HUGE and it was so worth it. I loved Gavin and Leah's story. It was also great to have some more of Flynn (along with his baby arm..haha) and Tessa. We have had a lot of Leah's back story in previous books in the Hart series, but the reader also gets a summary at the beginning, so this technically could be read as a standalone BUT I recommend to at least read Picture Perfect first, and you should read the Hart Series, because it is AMaZinG.Leah and Gavin have met previously and the twist of fate that brings them back into each other lives isn't  under the best of circumstances. Leah has had a difficult life and has experienced a lot of tragedy. Life keeps throwing things at her and she is forced to join the Renegade Saints Farewell Tour for her own personal safety. Of course her roommate is Gavin Wilde, HOT, tattooed, drummer. Gavin also had a difficult family life growing up but his outlook on life is positive and exactly what Leah needs. The attraction between the two is still there but they start as friends first. I loved them together, they have great chemistry both emotional and physical. There relationship was very believable and not rushed. Gavin is an amazing man ( you will fall in love with him) and is there for Leah to help her move on and really live her life. The story line is very well written and pulls you in. You really connect with the characters and cheer for them to find their happily ever after.One thing I loved about this book is that we also get a glimpse into the other band members lives and hints to what the remaining members books will involve. I cannot wait for Coles story to see how things end up for him and for Tyson's book to see who his love interest will be (cough...Gavin's sister...cough...just a prediction). Ella Fox has a way with words and I devoured her Hart Series as soon as I started it. She is definitely a go to I must read her new release immediately author. If you've read her other books you will love Twist of Fate if you haven't then what are you waiting for???
summary: Another Amazing book from Ella Fox

reviewText: “Everyday Anxiety Control: A Guide to Managing Anxiety for the Panicky” by W.J Bowman is a magnificent book for the panicky people who like to control their anxiety. The author has covered all the aspects of anxiety and moreover, also has discussed the prominent ways to manage anxiety without using any sort of medication for it. The author has said in his book that medication is not the proper solution for anxiety. He has explicitly focused on the self-talk techniques and meditation procedures, which could help the panicky people suffering from anxiety to get rid of it soon. This book is strongly recommended to the people who are suffering from anxiety, as it will be the perfect guide for them.

This book picks up at the start of Rylee's senior year of college where she, Layla, Brock, Garrett, and Cole have all accepted scholarships to Pothercrest to finish their senior year of high school and attend college. Seemingly the opportunity of a lifetime it is quickly revealed this school is so much more than any of them thought it was. And then there is Chance…oh buddy has Rylee got a lot in her mind to sort through. Though many questions are answered and you get more background into why Rylee seems to have been chosen, even more questions arise. Evil lurks in the shadows with a much larger plan in the making. Will Rylee be able to live the life of her choosing or is her path already in motion with or without her consent? How do her friends figure into the equation and why does it seem that no matter what she does someone is always out to get Rylee for something she knows nothing about?I am an absolute lover of all things paranormal and this series has had me from the get go! The paranormal elements are gradually revealed making for constant intrigue that will keep you wondering what twist will come next. This is by far my favorite book of the series…though I loved the first 2 as well…and the ending about had my kindle meeting the wall! The ending of this installment is definitely a cliff-hanger that will leave your mind reeling as to where SM is going next. Get your one-clickers ready because this is a must have!!!
summary: Another 5 star on this fantastic YA series!!!

reviewText: Just breathe.  It sounds so simple, but sometimes it's really not.  It's been a very long time since I read BOATK and Who We Are, so it was nice that in this third installment we got some flashbacks, but they were all seen from Ty's perspective.  And I absolutely LOVED that we got to see Paul, Vince, Sandy, and Darrin from Tell Me It's Real.  Even though Ty is all grown up now, he's still just a little guy and he needs the people he loves like he needs the air to breath.  This was as emotional as it was hilarious.  There is never a dull moment in a TJ Klune book, that's for sure.  He's the king of OTT, but in the best way possible, and somehow even when it's absolutely rediculous, it works.  He had me laughing and crying and lauging so hard I cried through this book, as seems to be his trademark.  I absolutely cannot wait to see what comes next. Let's Go, Let's Go, Let's Go!
summary: Emotional and Hilarious, what a combination

reviewText: Superb. TJ , they are real. It's a study of the human condition. With each episode in their life we want to meet them more. Family is what we draw around us. Bear Otter and the Kid have shown us that. Thanks.

From Who We Are to the Art of Breathing, this has been a wonderfully fulfilling week of reading for me. Enough has been said of this 3rd book by 59 reviewers before me. All I have to add is that  TJ Klune is one extraordinary writer, his style unique. There is no other writer who writes like him. It is just crazily astounding and engrossing, his characters completely captivating and so alive that their dialogues, musings resonate long after I finish the book. Beautiful beautiful Bear and The Kid. My only little niggle is Dominic's action which left me annoyed because The Kid should only have the best. Looking forward to the 4th book.
Another sweet and funny story that made me smile!  I loved Jack and Curt. They were such a great match. I cannot wait for the next book.

reviewText: * I received an ARC of this book free from the author in exchange for an honest review*In Asher’s youth he was a lot of things. A football player. A pre-med student. And a soldier. But an IED explosion changed all of that. Now he’s a shut-in. He never leaves his house, except for doctor visits. He had come to the determination that he would be the last Lee to occupy his family home because there was no way anyone would ever want him. He let his disfigurement control his life and he’d accepted that…until a beautiful woman showed up on his doorstep.“I love you. Don’t you know I’d do anything for you?”Savannah trusted the wrong person and it not only broke her heart it also ruined her career. Now she has an opportunity to fix her career by writing a patriotic heartfelt article in time for the Fourth of July. Asher is the first person to come to mind and when he accepts her interview she knows she’ll get her career back. But what happens instead is that she finds someone who can repair her heart.“You don’t have to be pretty to be sexy. You’re plenty sexy, Asher.”Asher will never understand what a beautiful woman like Savannah sees in him, or how she can see past his disfigured face, but he never wants to let her go. She will turn him inside out and make him do things he hadn’t done in years…like go into town.“He fell in love. Someone tangled with his girl. He settled accounts.”This isn’t just a love story, it’s a life journey. Two people figure out how to get over not only their own prejudices, but also those of an entire town. It’s a beautiful story that will pull at your heartstrings and also make it soar.“I love her. I want to kill her most days, but I love her. I just don’t know what to do with her.”My Favorite Laughable Moment:I loved it when Asher and Savannah were discussing her driving his car.My Favorite Quote:“Can’t ride two horses with one *ss, honey. Try it and you’ll get hurt.”
summary: Love is in the eye of the beholder

reviewText: Journalist Savannah Carmichael is forced to return home to Danvers, VA, in humiliation after a lover's betrayal results in the loss of her job in New York. When she's offered a chance to revive her career, she decides to interview the somewhat abrasive Asher Lee, the town's resident veteran. Almost a decade ago, Asher was maimed and left severely disfigured by a bomb blast while on a tour of duty in Afghanistan. Since then, the rejection he's suffered because of his appearance has been almost been as devastating as his injuries. When Savannah comes knocking on his door, the two begin a friendship that quickly grows into a soul-deep connection neither of them ever dared to believe was possible. For the first time in years, Asher has hope but when circumstances threaten to come between them, will their love be enough to ensure a happy ending?If Asher and Savannah's story doesn't rekindle your faith in true love and miracles, I don't think anything will. I can only describe it as a modern day fairy tale... the kind that becomes a part of you. Not only will you be moved deeply, you might need a cold shower once you're done reading. I'm telling you the truth when I say that it has to be one of the hottest romances out there! You'll see...Keep in mind that 50% of everything Katy earns on “The Vixen & the Vet” in June and July 2014 will go directly to Operation Mend, a non-profit organization at the UCLA Medical Center that offers assistance to the returning wounded in the armed forces. You're getting a wonderful story as well as contributing to a good cause... and it's worth every cent.

Dominance at it's finest! When I started to read the book I thought, ok, nice love scene, so who is going to be the aggressor of the two? Of course there is a twist in the book, so I can't say. But the book itself was brilliant, well thought out and just plain out sexy!!! For those of you who like a dominant character this sure has one! The one thing I did notice in this book that the others did not have much of, were the emotions between the couple. I LOVED it! Great job! I would recommend this to everyone who wants a quick, hot, dark, edgy, and emotionally charged book to read!
Hottest book ever! Will read over and over. Fantastic characters, tons of kinky sex. Absolutely mouth watering physical scenes of debauchery.

This is a highly engaging story about Mossad agent Cobra, who gets a task to follow the roots of the revolutionary Muslim movements in Paris. His task brings him to a number of adventures around the world and also gets him involved into a coward scheme of Sergey Ismailov, a Muslim, Tajikistan-born, Soviet officer.I loved tension in a story and unexpected twists. I liked this book

I don’t know what it is with spy thrillers, but they are just fun to read. In this novel you are treated to a fast paced thrill ride, on par with Tom Clancy and others. I found Nisim Kobarsky to be a thinking man’s Archer. Ok, maybe the wrong comparison, but with the name “Cobra”, I thought of Stallone’s film and the contemporary spy comedy. This is not a comedy, obviously, it’s a deep spy novel with thriller elements and action packed scenes. Set to a backdrop of contemporary Middle East political problems, you have a winning combination. I found the book to be great, I read it during breaks between world cup games and after watching them. I love the pacing, Cobra is my kind of hero, although sometimes it’s more of an antihero, if you ask me. Pick this one up, it’s pretty good.
summary: Fun Spy Thriller With International Flair

It is not worth your time.

reviewText: Survival Pantry is a great read to have when you needed survival guide ideas.  This book is well written with organized thoughts of surviving neatly discussed in every chapter. It also gives specific presentation of the needed tools and materials for every possible time frame that a person or group of people needed for in surviving.  Moreover, it has brilliant surviving tips that could help anyone prepare ahead of time and even in times when there's a shortage of needs. This book has the answer to successfully help anyone increase the chances of their survival!

A much needed and a very useful book for anyone. Read this book very seriously. Because I came to know about a very essential matter meaning anyone’s life and safety. Well this is a book that is all written about food and water safety and preservation. If you are thinking about your safety and a healthy and hygienic life, what comes to your mind the very first is what you are eating and drinking. And so preserving them becomes very important to you and also a vital question. Well this book is a clear answer to all the questions that can guarantee your safety. This book teaches progressive methods and techniques of food and water storage and preservation.
summary: Be careful of what you eat!

reviewText: I believe that it is never too early to prepare for a disaster, and no one can really be prepared enough. These are the reasons why I was interested in this book. While my belief about the timing of preparation is right, this book showed me that enough preparation can be achieved, if you know how to do it. This book teaches the readers how to preserve food by a number of methods, and I found the information very helpful and useful. I would definitely recommend this book to all my family and friends and neighbors so that all of us can be prepared.

A madcap mystery with a zany heroine and a roguish hero. Lucy and Lord Adair have plenty of chemistry, the mystery was interesting, and the book had the perfect setting. The cover also captures the story well. At time I had trouble following the plot but I think that was just me.The name's of the characters were also a good fit for their personalities.  I hope there's more Lucy adventures in the future.I received a complimentary copy in exchange for an honest review.

As I have written about in other reviews, I'm not a dieter but I do try to take care of myself. One of the issues I have is just staying motivated to maintain by diet choices and gym regimen. This book contains a number of really good motivators for overcoming the excuses we all tell ourselves. Excuses like lack of time, money or motivation, eating too much or exercise programs stink. Yep, they're all covered. You'll also find a chapter on validation and seeking internal motivation rather than external motivation that will help you re-evaluate why you are trying to lose weight. All this an how to determine if you are willing to make all the real sacrifices needed to lose weight.Overall, if you lack the motivation to keep up with a healthy lifestyle and/or diet plan, get this book for some real thought-provoking motivational steps to keep you on track.
summary: Great motivators for maintaining your weight loss and health goals

reviewText: It's always a pleasure when a new Selena Kitt story is released. Donnie and the Maid as usual, does not disappoint with it's steamy storyline and likeable characters. Donnie struggles after his divorce to deal with everyday household chores like cleaning and cooking. When he worries it will cost him time with his daughter, he breaks down and hires a maid. Enter Elena! This is a great quick read for a summer night.

I liked the main character Tia - she made me laugh.  She started off as a strong confident woman but as the story goes on she seems more of a push over.  I went back and forth with what I wanted her to do - make a stand or be patient.  The BF Autumn was somewhat confusing and didn't add much to the story but to tease you with her "story".  Reign was likable when he was with Tia but a total jerk otherwise.  I liked this book - I love books with strong, funny women and the men who love them!
Great book. I fell in love with the characters abd the author. After I read this one I check out the MC books and bought and read all Bella's novels  no regrets.  Love them all.
summary: Great book. I fell in love with the characters ...

reviewText: This is a difficult book to rate.I read it in one sitting, couldn't put it down. From the start it had me laughing my head off at Tia's "wingman" antics. The $500 dollars and the promise of a night with Reign and the chaos that ensued, literally had me laughing like a drain!Tia was a feisty girl, sailor's mouth, attitude from hell, didn't take anyone's crap....until she started getting feelings for Reign. Then she turned into this pathetic, whiney, whingy pain in the bum. I suppose it's difficult if there's an unrequited love, to watch them fawn over someone else. But Tia knew what she was being paid to do.The lines became blurred when Tia and Reign took their friendship to the next level. I felt sorry for her in one way because although getting emotionally involved with Reign was her dumbest idea, you can't control the feelings in your heart.Reign...he started out as fun bobby, needing a wingman to get himself laid was funny, but then he turned into a total bellend. He used Tia to make himself feel good, that's never cool, especially when he was still chasing his ex.It was a very interesting idea for a story. Most blokes have a wingman, a friend who will pair up with a girl's ugly friend and take one for the team (yeh I know, shoot me now, cut off my balls, plot my death 101 ways but it's true lol) so the wingman being a woman and actually getting the lays for her buddy was a great concept.Bella Jewell is a strange author to me. On one hand, she writes this very funny story....then she writes a book like Life After Taylah that is packed with heartbreaking emotion....then she writes a book like Thirteen which is completely at odds to these books and is very very dark.Strange is probably the wrong word to use....talented....she is freaking talented.So my rating.....gotta be 5*
Dnf this box set. While it's called beasts and monsters, it's a little too beastly for my liking!

Controlling stress can be so hard especially when you don't have anyone by your side to calm you down. I needed this book because I am always stressful. This book has helped me overcome that and I would definitely recommend it to all.

4 1/2 STARSThe second novella in the Good to Go series is a mesmerizing and heartwarming romance.  Major Mike Cava returns home to find that his little sister’s best friend is all grown up and seeing other guys.  Maria Thompson is tired of mooning over a man who never saw her as anything but a little girl so she’s devised a new plan and if this doesn’t work… she’s done.This fast paced and smooth flowing plot keeps readers entertained with drama, humor, romance and red hot passion.  The author uses well written scenes and details to paint the story in vivid detail and makes it easy for the reader to picture the characters and the story as it is happening.  The characters are strong, compelling, easily understood and invite the reader to get to know them better.The chemistry between Maria and Mike is combustible and the frequent sex scenes are red hot and scorch the reader with vibrant intensity, but the relationship has a few issues.  The reader can’t help but get caught up in the drama of Maria’s long standing crush and finally deciding it’s time to make Mike take notice that she’s not a little girl anymore and that she can handle everything he can dish out including his dominant side. Their story also inspires quite a few chuckles with some snappy dialogue and family squabbles.This girl finally get boy romance is enjoyable and entertaining and makes the heart feel good and I can’t wait to read Brad’s story.

This book was a gift for my daughter because she absolutely loves dinosaurs. I was a little worried she may not like the gift but she loved it. She can't stop talking about all the cool dinosaurs and information found within this book. Thanks so much for making my little girl happy!
summary: My daughter love this book! Great dinosaur read!

reviewText: Heroine is determined to avenge her mother, meets two weres who are after the same guy and they….you know what? Really, why try and describe the plot, which was nonsensical. Don't get me wrong, I've read nonsensical before, but the characters didn't click, the characterization is pretty shallow, the heroine's pretty much TSTL, and it's all about the sex. Mostly sex. Lots of BDSM sex.The Bottom LineIt was meh, but hey, it’s free and has paranormal menage MFM sex. If that’s your gig, you might like it, but I wasn’t engaged in the story or the sex.

I read Jessica's Pieces series and loved them! I thought she had so much potential as a new author and was eager to read more. i gave both of her other books 4-5 stars! The series had likable characters, laughable moments, mystery and amazing potential!When I saw this book attached to her name, I one clicked without a 2nd thought! Now, i am left wishing i could have those 4 hours back I spent reading-but not finishing :(.Possible Spoilers****Even though her first 2 books were more YA, I am not opposed to authors crossing over to NA. I actually love to see the possibilities. What I am opposed to is so many NA books, like this one,copying the same story line over and over again. Controlling rich guy,traumatized girl,meet and he has to have her after 3 seconds,he has sex with every one he sees until her and then no more..it's all her, she has nightmares, he buys her a car and sends drivers over, then,BAM..the story develops out of nowhere. And, let's not forget, funny BFF, Gay BFF, and nutty ex who interferes, and when she's "bad", he takes her over his knee??!! Lastly, yup..you guessed it..the cliffy! No originality, many eye rolling moments and too many unrealistic sex scenes. I understand why some writers follow this trend. But, you have talent, Jessica! You had 2 amazing stories and potential for so many more. Why sell out to the sex trends if you don't have to!?

Due to her irresponsible mainly absent mother Rose not only works to pay the bills and put food on the table but also has to look after her five siblings, leaving very little time and no money for herself, when the bills pile up it becomes obvious that one job just isn't enough so she approaches Tonto the President of the Devil Savages asking if he has more work for her, there's definitely an attraction between her and not only Tonto but also Sandman the clubs Sgt at Arms but she's determined not to become her mother and sleep with any biker that looks her way. Rose is not only a hard worker but her feisty personality and take no s*** attitude not only surprises but intrigues Tonto and Sandman, but the question is can they break down Roses resolve since she nothing like the women they're used to they'll actually have to put some effort in and if they do do they only want one night with her.Now I have to say I enjoyed this book, it's a hard gritty MC book with violence and sex, I was never bored while reading but I did have a few issues, Rose I loved for the most part, I liked the way she stood up for herself but, and I know she had to appear strong but on a couple of occasions she just went too far, on one occasion way too far. Tonto and Sandman jumped far too quickly to conclusions based on the evidence they had, I know they're men but still, and I just felt parts were rushed and almost jumped over, like I said this is an enjoyable book but with more time and development it could have been so much more.

As always, Mr. Bunker did not disappoint with this short story set in the Pennsylvania world.  My only complaint was that it ended far to soon.  I know its a short story, but once you get caught up in it, you hate to see it end.  But as PT Barnum said, "Always leave them wanting more," and Michael always does.  Please keep them coming!!

This book was different then lot of diet books I've read. It didn't just line the pages with the story of how Stella did it, but it offered tips and recipes throughout the story, not just mentioning the recipes and then referring you elsewhere in the book. Stella tells her story of how she went from obese to slim, and then she tells the stories of reaching her goals, and finally gives some information in a Q & A formation. She shares various recipes and tips throughout her story. And the information she shares is very beneficial for medical purposes. In the first nine chapters Stella takes you on a detailed journey through her fat life, into her journey of each phase of the Atkins diet, and then on through to her success. The next few chapters are her goal success stories, (I really liked the one with her mom who doesn't take Stella's new way of eating serious). And the last chapter is the diet Q & A and information. If you want to know about or are thinking about the Atkins diet, this book may be the inspiration you need to get started.

I had friends that had done the Atkins Diet and even though I was very supportive of their choice, I really never knew much about Atkins. This book was quite informative on the subject. The author’s down to earth, tell it like it is style of writing appeal to me in a big way, the illustrations that she includes bring a sense of comedy to the storyline.I like the fact that the diet is broken down into stages and there is a ladder that represents that 10 rungs with descriptions  that you climb throughout those ten stages of the Atkins.I really enjoyed Chapter 4 the most, I think. “Preparing to Succeed aka Gathering My Courage To The Sticking Point.”  The author shares some good tips to start off with.I like the fact that although the diet calls for you to drink 8 ounces of water a day, it does not have to be plain water, the water can be consumed by drinking broth, tea etc.Now a days the Atkins products are available in most grocery stores so this would seem a really great diet for anyone wanting to lose weight to try. Being a recipe junkie, I love the recipes that the author includes.
summary: Love The Tell It Like It Is Style!

reviewText: This is a story of a young girl that was humiliated and bullied about her weight all through high school. She went on to college with her sister and it was there that she tried a variety of fad diets.  It wasn't until she watched a TV show with a motivational speaker about the Engine 2 diet.  This diet was created by a firefighter and it's not just a diet but a lifestyle change. This was such an interesting book, learning about the 28 day challenge where you only eat plant based foods and exercise. The author discusses the vegetables that contain calcium and which foods that include simple carbs which are the ones to avoid. She has some great recipes and tips at the end of the book.  I recommend this book if you want to get back on track to a healthy lifestyle.

I have been waiting on this book for so long! I was so excited to get started and continue the journey. Is was blown away! It was everything and more than I what I expected!Amie and the rest of her friends have put the world on the back burner and they are losing there perception of time. is millionth the cause for this? or is the thought of bringing the world back to hard to fathom.Get ready for Love in the Purest and Hate at its darkest and not to forget the twists that will make your jaw drop! An amazing Story by my favorite, Tara Brown! If you love Paranormal Romance, then this is for you! Even if you don't, it's still an unbelievable story!

I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book. The main characters, Drake and Rachel, are two people who are perfect for each other. You have Drake, the alpha guy what wants the sweet Rachel as his woman and will stop at nothing to get her. Then you have the virgin Rachel, who is trying to rebuild herself after a bad breakup in the city. Together, they show a sweeter side of a love that is worth fighting for. Also, because this is a book by Sam Crescent, it is very very hot! Enjoy!!
Superb!  A great short story with a lovely, humorous traveling companion.  I was entertained from the first paragraph to the last.  Keep em coming Minnie!

I was given this book to give an honest review. Unfortunately this means that I haven't read book one of the trilogy and was left a bit confused.  This trilogy is meant to be read in order.  Without having read the first book, which I'm sure details the relationships between the characters and the universe that they live in, I felt that this book was rushed.  There isn't enough background given to bring a new reader into this story.  There was rarely a dull moment, but without knowing who the characters are I had no real desire to pick the book up and read their story.  Overall, the writing was good and there wasn't much unintentional awkwardness.  It's definitely read-able.  I am a fan of the genre and I plan on picking up book one and reading it first and then reading this one again.
This book was good, but you do need to read the first book before this one or you will be lost at first.
summary: This book was good, but you do need to read the first ...

I didn't enjoy this story as much as 'His Saving Grace' because of all the tension of danger and violence. I'm glad it was a short story, for that reason.Apart from that, it was a clean story from a Christian author, which I appreciated.

I’ll be sure to experiment with some of these, depending on their relevance to my own endeavors. If you’re anything like me, I’d recommend it to you.

reviewText: Libby Bateson spent eight years on her own barely making ends meet. At 17, she lost her mother and her brother. When she gets pregnant, her father hands her money and puts her on a bus, telling her to never come back to the farm and small town where she was raised. Without finishing high school, Libby has struggled to make a good life for her daughter, Nicole, and not look back. When a combination of events force her to make the decision to go home for a few months to get on her feet, she faces an up hill battle.Libby's situation broke my heart from the beginning. I found myself rooting for her to get her life back. Her father doesn't make it easy for her, and neither does the town with all their questions, but she holds her head high and fights for her and Nicole's future. When things heat up with her neighbor, Gibson (who was also her brother's best friend), they both struggle with their relationship, trust, and facing their own short-comings.A Daughter's Place was another of CJ Carmichal's books that I couldn't put down. The character's were real people that I felt could be anyone and, while the ending was everything I hoped, I hated reaching the last page!

So I pretty much was up all night reading... It was Sooo so good!! It took you on a journey of self discovery and acceptance of others differences in such a sweet and hilarious way. The only reason I didn't give this a 5 🌟 raiting and the only thing I can say is that I wish it was not just Lil pov telling the story I wish all 3 of the m leads would have had more to say especially when they didn't understand each other. However that being said dispite that i, and that issue is something I Kinda have a problem with with every book I like to know both leads pov .... Omg it's such a good goood great awesome read!!!
summary: great book!!!! review contains kind of some spiolers

reviewText: I read a brilliant book and then see that the author has written a second book, a follow on book. I actually feel slightly sick. Yes it’s great that there’s another book featuring brilliant characters, but what if it doesn’t match up with the first? What if it’s absolutely terrible or the author changes a character’s traits?That’s how I felt when I started Bastian’s Storm. To me, Surviving Raine was a fantastic book and I really couldn’t believe the author could write a second book as good, as encapsulating…..but Ms Savage did!!In Surviving Raine, Bastian was fighting for survival, his and Raine’s. His natural survival instincts kicked in and he used all of his extensive knowledge to get through the shipwreck to the rescue.In Bastian’s Storm, once again he was fighting for survival but the difference was, he was fighting for the survival of his family. The love he had for Raine and Alex made him much more of a determined man, a better man.Ms Savage, I take my hat off to you. You have done a brilliant job of bringing alive two characters…one I want to be, and one I want to (censored) lol You are an excellent storyteller and use just enough descriptive writing to set the scene….you don’t take a hundred words when only twenty will do. You make those twenty count. I felt everything Bastian was going through. I felt his separation pain, his physical pain, his frustrations, and his helplessness. I wanted him to succeed, I was rooting for him; I was unable to put the book down til I got to the end.Fan-flipping-tastic!!

I had never really given power walking much thought.  I felt like once I reached the level of walking that I needed to move to running that I would be stuck as I have bad knees and can't really run.  This sounds like a perfect alternative and can keep me going in the right direction to losing the weight I want to lose.  This book is very detailed in instruction and gives great tips as well.  Really enjoyed it and can't wait to get started!

It was great to reading a book were race was not the overwhelming focus but the love and caring of two people. I will continue to read more books from you. Great job.

How to Sell Anything: Succeeding in Sales without feeling like a Slimy Salesperson by Geoffrey Wright is a short, easy-to-read book on how to be a good salesman without feeling bad about it. The book reminds those of us in sales that customers buy products or services to fulfill a need.  A successful salesperson determines what their customer's needs are and how the product or service they are selling can fill those needs. By looking at selling from the customer's perspective, How to Sell Anything casts the salesman in the role of the buyer's trusted adviser. To establish and navigate this tricky relationships, How to Sell Anything provides several useful tools that promote sales while allowing the salesperson to maintain integrity.As an independent author, I am responsible for selling my own novel. This book helped me find new ways to market my book by challenging me to think of what it has to offer a reader that is different from the other novels available. Using this process, I refined my search words and am re-writing my promotional material. Within two days, I had tripled my sales.Elly MichaelsTo purchase For Love of a Cause or read a free sample, click here:http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00DX6IV0EFor more book reviews, visit: [...]
summary: This five-star sales manual lives up to its name.

reviewText: this entire series is gold. I am in love with this author. I cried with all 3 but this one....I wanted to kick Jason in the head no less than 20 times. awesome books.

My husband and I are looking to buy a bigger house and start a family, so we're really interested in learning how to save as much money as possible. Our grocery bill is out of control (especially for only 2 people) so I was excited to read this book to learn how to coupon. The book didn't disappoint. Tons of info and tips that are very practical and useful. Great guide!

I thought that this book was very thorough. I really like how detailed it was about couponing. I never could really get into couponing the few times that I tried to do it, because it seemed like I just couldn't figure out how to make it worthwhile. This book provides a lot of good information about how couponing works and what I need to do to make it a useful technique for helping my financial situation.

I didn't know that I could save a lot of money from collecting coupons. I never gave it that much importance before since I wasn't aware of all the benefits and savings that I could get. This book helped me understand more about the process of collecting and maximizing my coupons. The strategies on how to master your skills are explained in a simple yet very detailed manner. All in all, a great book about couponing!

reviewText: This book is great for people who are just starting to see the benefits of couponing. They will be guided on how to maximize the use of their coupons, as well as get more enlightened on the great economic savings coupons have to offer. Although the stuff are pretty basic, it is enough to get acquainted with coupons and to slowly get the hang of using it. Some people might think that couponing is an easy task, but from experience, I usually end up with a lot of expired coupons in my wallet. Couponing guide books are really useful, so grab a copy now.

A well written book and explained well on the vegan diet. This is the complete guide on how to why the fast diet work.This books has a variety of great recipes from 100 -300 calories. This a great book to lose weight or if you justwant to live a healthier lifestyle.

Everything was wrapped up with a bow in the blink of an eye. It was a cute story that could have been developed into a great story.

Another great book in the Hounds of Hell Series.  This book is written with a lot of compassion and caring on the part of Joel, who is always trying to help others, and makes you feel so sorry for Feodor, the Hell Hound turned Heaven Hound. Take one Hell/Heaven Hound who isn't comfortable around people and doesn't know how to talk to them and , let him find his mate. All he wants to do is to protect him, not talk to him.  Take a human who feels like he has been a prisoner all of his life and doesn't want to be stalked by his mate, no matter how good Feodor's intentions are. This creates a lot of tension between the two as they battle their way trying to find their own HEA.  This is definitely a book you won't want to miss.

Three years have past since the Hounds & Angels have teamed up to save the Souls,  Feodor Markova, has worked tirelessly behind the scenes helping the school in any way he can.  Always watching from the sidelines because he feels that he isn't good @ dealing with people.  He's also been watching a certain young man, Joel Sweet.  Joel is a Saved Soul, now an English teacher @ the school, he loves his job with a passion.  Our heroes have a hard time connecting & understanding where the other is coming from.  As usual Flynn Eire has created characters that you care for and want everything to work out for.
summary: An overprotective Hound meets his match.

reviewText: This is a great series I can't wait to read more of this series . Can't wait till next one is here.

Love the hostile ops team series.  All of the books have been great so far, I hate having to wait for the next one but, I am sure it will be worth it.  All of the books have the super HOT alpha male, the stunning strong women that bring them to their knees.  There is excitement, HOT HOT sex, and lots of love.  I highly recommend the whole series!  Can't wait for #6!  Enjoy!:)

The guys from HOT are on a new mission and this is Jack Hunter’s story.  Their mission, eliminate arms dealer Athenasios Metaxas and get out quick.  They did not expect pop sensation Gina Domenico, his girlfriend, to be on the island.  After carrying out their mission and eliminating the target, his bodyguards emerge from the house and being to manhandle Gina.  Jack acts on instinct and kills them saving Gina and allowing her to escape on her own.As Jack is on route to the pickup with his team he finds Gina and takes her along with him.  They end up sending three days in a cave together waiting for their pickup.Three years later Gina contacts Jack to help find her kidnapped son, Eli, only to find out that he is Eli’s father and Gina has kept it from him.Hot Shot is another well written romantic suspense story in this series by Lynn Raye Harris.  I have read all of the previous books in this series and this one does not disappoint.  Right from the beginning there is a connection between Jack and Gina and the sexual tension is well balanced between the two.Jack is an engaging character but he does have commitment issues.  Gina however is a strong character determined to change Jack’s view of what a relationship with her would be like.This is a great read where you will be kept on the edge all the way through.  There are some great villains you will love to hate and more of the HOT team.I received a copy of this book through NetGalley from the author/publisher for an honest review.

Reinventing Retirement – Baby Boomer Style is an insightful book that teaches 50-year-olds and above how to plan wisely for their retirement. I have read tons of self-help retirement books and I can say that this is, by far, the best. People have to realize that there is no formula for a successful retirement and that not all generations have to subscribe to the same retirement standards. Retiring varies from one generation to another and the author made this clear early on in her book. I like the fact that she’s taking specific examples from her life which makes the book really relatable. I’m about to hit 52 years old this year and I’ve been seriously thinking about my retirement plans. I thought that having savings in my bank account and a decent home to live in are enough but this book made me realize that there are still a lot of things to take care of before retiring. The author also ‘customized’ the chapters to suit every income level and lifestyle. I hope her next book will talk about (in detail) hobbies/organizations that you can engage in once you retire.
summary: Great book for people pushing 50 and above!

reviewText: This book was good!!!!!!!!!!!

OMG, this book was straight crazy. You meet Lyn, Maya, and Natalie in this urban soap opera set in the Windy City. Looking from the outside in, you'd think they have the perfect life's right...wrong!! Things get out of hand in this book. Take a chance and find out just why everything is not what it seems.
