So happy to have gotten another Jack Rabbit7 fix. Sarah has taken the backstory of a character we meet in Embracing Hamilton and given us new insight into her Orion’s life as well as the terrible implications of being injected with JR7. If you haven’t read Embracing Hamilton yet, you should. Though I guess it isn’t quite necessary to read it before you read Starring Evans but know, you won’t meet Orion or Bruno again until then.In the best possible way, Sarah weaves the lives of each character so intricately together, giving you the opportunity to connect with even the most secondary of characters – or at least you think they’re secondary until you read their story.Without spoiling the book for you, in Starring Evans we get to see the damage JR7 does to her, her family and those around her. In addition, we get a taste of the love story between Orion and Bruno – something I wanted more of when I read Embracing Hamilton.What’s interesting is how widespread JR7 truly is. Just when you think The Coalition couldn’t get more sinister, another character pulls us into their story and evokes such empathy from the reader.Orion and Bruno’s love story is actually quite bittersweet. To have two people fall in love the way they do – pure and unabashed love – in the midst of such turmoil shows Sarah knows how to make a reader feel. And when the characters know they’re doomed from the start? Kinda makes me want to throw things at Ms. Carr. But I’ll hold off. For now.I love the JR7 series of novels and novellas and I would recommend them to anyone who wants to go for a wild ride of plot twists, sharp turns and emotional wringers. Pick this book up, pick up all of the JR7 series. You will not be disappointed.
I love the detail in this book addressing so many areas that everyone, as well as business owners, can benefit from.  Pick a few of the suggestions and implement, then try more.
summary: I love the detail in this book addressing so many areas ...

reviewText: Not only are the recipes fantastic, but this book is a great resource for making smoothies. It’s easy to understand, and the ingredients in the recipes are readily available. I love the author’s use of nuts and thickeners to give the smoothies a full-bodied flavor.
what away to stop, Alex and Cass keep the story going, can't wait to for book 3. hope to see it released soon.

Kept me reading late in the night! When you start this novel, you won't be able to stop. Beware; the sensual intensity of THE WICKED BARGAIN, written by Gina Danna, will pull you deep into the story. You will enjoy every minute of it; it’s so passionate and romantic! Ms. Danna created two beautiful characters whom  you will fall in love with. Let’s start with Ethan; tormented by a past as a sex slave, he was now a courtesan and a master in the art of seduction to please women. But, he had debts to pay and needed rich heiresses to help financially. He really enjoyed giving pleasure to women, until he discovered that he was falling for the sweet and nave young woman. Arabella, had to flee her family and seek refuge near Ethan! She had witnessed, Ethan in a compromising situation, and now the deliciously wicked man was invading her mind and dreams. Soon, her ingenuity will mesmerize him and sparks will flare! Being around this charming man, she will understand the power of her sexuality.  I have read many Regency stories, and I believe that it’s the first time that the hero is a male courtesan and the heroine practice as the house physician. Both roles are reversed, and I loved the idea, it was refreshing! It was interesting to understand these roles for that period of time. You will enjoy inflamed love scenes and a well developed intrigue. Beautiful hot and sensual chemistry between Ethan and Ari! Loved the role that Elizabeth played in the story! THE WICKED BARGAIN really seduced me, because it was wonderfully written with tenderness and passion. I highly recommend this historical romance filled with a touch of eroticism!

I'm not a lover of labels or affiliations like Buddhism, Christianity, etc. But I really connected with the underlying lessons of Zen Buddhism. We are One has really become quite the cliche, but it's a cliche because it happens to be true, and this book reminded me of how important it is to practice meditation daily in order for our minds to be receptive to remembering that so we stop feeling separate and alone.

My suggestion is that you never buy a book that is only available as an E-Book.  These books are nothing more than pamphlets where the information is nothing that you could not find on the internet for free.  This alleged "book" underscores how bad this problem has gotten.For example, Chapter 5 is called "Stock Trading Strategies . . . Advanced Analysis."  One would think that this chapter would actually discuss advanced analysis, but really all it does is summarize various strategies such as "trading on margin" and "[t]rading mutual funds and ETFs."  First, none of these has any relevance to "analysis," nor could trading on margin or buying mutual funds be considered "advanced" by any stretch of the imagination.  Moreover, the information provided is nothing more than a watered down wikipedia article.A while back this book was on sale for .99 cents.  Even at that price it is represents a colossal lack of value.As far as the multitude of 5-star reviews, I have to wonder how many are really genuine.
Readable but without real plot or humor. A lot of sex, but this story could be finished in 1 book.

I usually prefer not to eat my raw greens and when I think of salad I think rabbit food.This book changes all that as I came away with a new definition of what a salad is.I love that this book is well illustrated and even has the recipes of the dressing used when the author could have just as easily just mentioned the dressing in the salad recipes and had the reader going shop the buy some bottled dressing.Like many cookbooks I review and enjoy on kindle my only gripe with this book is it isn't available in print.
summary: Sick of the same old rabbit food read this book

reviewText: I just finished the last part of the Love Trails and I'm still left in awe!! J.S. Left is hanging at the end of part two and I thought she was going to go it again. I just wished it was a little longer and we got to see what became of Hunter and how Nancy's family accepted Jaxon into the family. Hopefully we can get another short story on how this series will wrap up.  Can't wait for her next release.
This was an interesting story, I really liked Christoff's character. it had suspense, drama, romance and, of course, some sex. Well written and easy to read. Looking forward to the next book.
Could not put it down read the book in one day. Can't wait to find out what will happen next.
I felt empowered by the female because she went thru something horrible and came out stronger for it. It's worth the time to read.

Holly James has lived through a horrific event that has left her unable to connect with people.  She cannot stand to be touched, not even by her friends or family.  Her brother is trying to be the protector of Holly, his guilt from not being able to save Holly has left him being overly protective.  She has good friends too, but none of them truly understand the horror that Holly lives each day with her inability to be touched and her nightmares where she relives the event.Holly’s friends convince her to go to a concert with them to see the Renegades.  She is not sure how she is going to survive the crowd but she decides to give it a try.  Little did Holly know that at this concert she was going to meet someone that had the potential to change her life…Drew Walker is an egotistical, tattooed, gorgeous, lead singer of The Renegades and the guy that has the potential to ROCK Holly's world.  During the concert Holly inadvertently meets Drew in a field when she was trying to avoid the crowd.  She had no idea that he was in the band, let alone the lead singer, all she knew is that his touch didn’t bother her and she wanted to understand why.The instant connection between Holly and Drew was amazing, they have a hot, sexual tension that cannot be denied by either of them no matter how hard they try.  With Holly’s past and Drew’s fears of commitment, they have many hurdles to overcome if they want a relationship together.Between the tension from Holly’s overprotective brother, her caring friends, and Drew's drama; this book is a roller coaster of emotion.  There were times where I wanted to just yell STOP to both of them so that they would listen and understand before messed up or said things they could regret.  I absolutely loved the characters in this book.  The story line kept me on my toes and wanting more.  Alexis Noelle has a hit on her hands with Breaking Free. I loved this book, I finished it in one sitting and wished it didn’t have to end…
summary: I LOVE THIS BOOK, DREW MY BE AN EGOTISTICAL ASS AT TIMES, BUT YOU JUST HAVE TO LOVE HIM!!!!

reviewText: I really enjoyed this book and hope there are more stories following Blaze and Safron!If you like a story about how opposites attract then this is for you!  The love they find is all consuming and hot as Hell!I loved meeting the members of the MC club, and look forward to more!  This book hooked me from the first paragraph and I highly recommend it!

I enjoyed this series as well.  I am pleased to have waited and read two books together with the first read much earlier. The plot was good and having read the two before makes the other characters more familiar.

At first I was not sure I was going to like this book.  Saffron was so week and needed that it was kind of irritating but after I got into the book a ways it got a lot better and I found myself enjoying the book a lot.  By the end I was glad to see Saffron get a back bone and stand up for herself.

Great job by Keith James! A wealth of information was provided. As the title suggest "Your Complete Beginner Guide to Trading Options" this book held true to its title, it was very informative using great examples and a high overview of information. A option is an exchange traded contract that gives the buyer the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell an underlying asset. Options Trading terminology was highlighted; exercise, strike price, expiration date, premium, in the money, out the money, and intrinsic value, all these terms were defined well, gave me a good idea of what each meant. Another topic discussed that was beneficial; In the Money (ITM), which means options- meaning that the strike price of the option is already profitable, compared to the price of the underlying asset are more expensive. There are three option trading strategies; in the money, at the money, and out of the money--good to know! Overall this is a must have and read! Great guide to options trading!
I really liked this story. It was very different from most books I've read. I ended up reading More from this author.Can't wait for part 2.!!!!
This book had me from beginning to end and although some things are horrible I really enjoyed it and can't wait for the next book. Funny, provoking and mad crazy.

I received this book from Sara Wolf and "Paranormal Romance and Authors That Rock" in exchange for an honest review.Aliens, aka Gutters, crash landed on earth 11 years ago. They feed off of human emotions, and this is done with a special organ that is placed into humans, EVEs, and it converts the emotions into a liquid for the Gutters to drink. In an effort to integrate the aliens, a special school is formed that both EVES and Gutters attend. This story follows the lives of Victoria, an alien hater, and three royal aliens on their quest for acceptance, friendship, and to prevent war. This is a major cliff hanger, so be prepared!This was an excelled book. Victoria is mouthy, strong, and has so much more to offer than what meets the eye. This is the same for the other main characters. There is so much more than appearances. I loved that the book was fascinating, enchanting, and had a bit of rawness to it. This book is suitable for the mature young adult population, and I was happy with the underlying moral compass it had. It was the perfect book to discover that you should never judge a book by its cover. People should be judged on their behavior and what's in their hearts instead of what other people tell you to believe because of race, color, or gender.I enjoyed all of the characters; even the evil ones. The story was so well written that I read this book very quickly and I found myself thinking about it when I wasn't able to read it. I am definitely looking forward to the next installment.
summary: 4 awesome zol fangs for this fantastic read!

reviewText: This books starts out with an attention grabber--the main character, Mira, is in the hospital after trying to commit suicide. Her mother is concerned; her father is off on another campaign trip for the up-coming election. We learn quickly that Mira has a gift (or curse). Whenever someone makes skin contact with her, she receives an instant zap of all their memories. The only person immune to her powers is her father.We enter Mira's world, one with a loving mother, never home father and a body guard on constant alert. Mira's life is lonely and due to her ability, she's cut herself off from everyone even more. I'll admit, I wondered where her friends might be or at least, loose acquaintances. But at least, she does run into a wonderfully sweet guy, who accompanies her on this journey (one which her father doesn't instantly approve of, of course.)It was interesting to watch a main character who absolutely hates their ability. Often characters may not like it, but they at least try to use it to their advantage every now and then, where Mira does not. She also attempts to seek professional help and is willing to open up to Dr. Walsh, which was also a nice and interesting twist. Even better, Dr. Walsh believes her, an act which doesn't completely shut Mira out from the world.I found the inner-contrast in Mira very interesting. She's willing to try to commit suicide twice to escape her ability, but on the other hand, is a strong person, ready to take on a powerful opponent when the need arises. She has strengths and weaknesses, both which make her a very sympathetic and realistic character.The world and plot surrounding Mira deepens quickly, making the story run along at a nice pace. There's plenty of emotion, mystery and adventure, which tended to remind me of scenes from the movie Die Hard. I couldn't help but smile at the end chase---although it was really tense!I had no problem connecting to the characters and was glad to see a hero, who is heroic without being overly dashing, overly strong, or overly anything. He's simply sweet, nice and totally lovable.In other words, I recommend this to YA Urban Fantasy fans, who like a bit of romance (but not too hot), a mystery with twists and turns, and actions scenes with a few explosions.

I am a huge fan of this series. I mean, what’s not to love? Hot as hell Marines mixed with more hot as hell Shifters – ooooh-freaking-rah!In this installment, Adam, the human civilian contractor, drives convoy trucks for the Marine base. He has friends on the base who are shifters, but he really doesn’t know or understand much about them. His friends are trying to teach him though, especially once he meets Dawson, who comes to the base to assess and handle the resident shifter pack.Dawson and Adam take a liking to each other, and boy do they turn up the heat! Dawson is one hot, sexy, dirty talking wolfie. And, he backs it up out of the bedroom as well, implementing change and making things right after he ousts the current pack leader who has basically been using and abusing the humans.As expected, Ms. McKenna is spot on with her military details. The lingo and combat action is very realistic and really sets the tone for life on an outpost base. The fighting with the wolves was exciting as well and really makes you feel as though it were a normal every day possibility to have a pack of wolves assisting every platoon. The sex scenes were hot, and the action fast-paced and exciting.It did feel a little strange that Adam was so clueless about the wolves, given he was working with them every day, and the fact that his brother is mated to, oh, not just any old wolf, but the True Alpha of all the wolves! I understand Adam and Tim weren’t very close, but you would still think he would know a little more about the wolf goings on than he did. I was happy to see the brothers come together when it was needed and to see them get past a few of their issues.  It also felt a little off that the mate issue wasn’t really brought up until it was needed to keep Adam from being sent home.  Seemed rather anticlimactic.  There are no actual “I love you’s” here, but there is plenty of puppy loving and affection to show how much these guys care.I didn’t love nearly as much as the first book, but definitely more than the last. It still has many of the elements that made me fall in love with this story in the first place, and I’m eager to see where the next one will take us. I’m hoping for a Jason/Paul/Borovec threesome, but maybe that’s just my own fantasy.
summary: Hot, Sexy, Civilians, Marines, and Werewolves, Oh My!

reviewerName: Sophia Rose "Guest Reviewer for Delighted Rea...
reviewText: I have been eagerly awaiting this book since the moment I finished the last one.  I had no idea who would be the characters or what the story would cover.  I didn't care because I trust the author to tell me a good story and she most certainly did that.  I love the shifter culture, the military connection, the nuances that are small, but important, the character development, the plot movement and of course the partnerings that take place.I would recommend that these be read in order for understanding of the worldbuilding, backdrop and ongoing minor plot threads.  Both characters are introduced in the last book and something of their personalities and place in the series is established.  I was actually surprised by whose story this is as I was expecting two other characters to be next.  I confess that Adam Madison was not my favorite person in the last book and I was extremely curious how the author would win me over to him.This story in some ways begins in the previous book because Adam Madison is the brother of one of the previous main characters and Dawson Rivers is on the same executive staff as Adam's brother, Tim.  Adam is a sullen, angry person that strikes out at his brother any chance he gets in a misguided transfer of guilt over their younger brother's murder.  Adam is also resentful because he believes that everyone loves Tim and he's the perfect brother/son while Adam is just the second-rate one.  He bristles at anything he considers a hint that someone might connect him with Tim or his overwrought suspicions that Tim is checking up on him.  He wraps his grief and anger around him like a cloak keeping himself isolated from other people until recently.  Adam is a civilian driver stationed at the marine base and is contracted to drive convoy runs to deliver supplies to other bases.  It's a dangerous job, but he likes it.  He keeps his cool and has earned some respect even amongst a group of marine werewolves he has tentatively reached out to as friends.Unfortunately, not all the wolves are honorable marines including the base pack alpha and his cronies who make life a misery for humans and submissive wolves.  They get off on having the power to mistreat others.  Word finally leaks out to Noah, the true alpha and he sends in Dawson Rivers his Omega to get the situation under control hopefully through diplomacy and education.  Only the situation is worse than they thought so Dawson has to take a more pro-active role.Adam has had an embarrassing crush on Dawson since he met him while visiting his brother Tim back in San Diego.  So he is particularly sensitive of Dawson's presence and that Dawson seems to always be nearby.  Adam is suspicious and resentful at first thinking that Dawson is there to check up on him, but then he adds anger to his tumble of emotion because he can't stand the way the werewolves bully with their strength.Adam soon starts to see that he has Dawson wrong, the werewolves as a race wrong and even starts to sense that he's got even more wrong particularly when it comes to his brother and his family.  Adam had kept himself deliberately ignorant of werewolf culture as a misguided bit of his resentment to his brother and now he needs a crash course in all things werewolf quick.  He needs to understand what is happening amongst the pack wolves and for sure what is going on between him and Dawson.  What he thought was just a casual fling seems to mean more to Dawson and if he is honest to him too.Things come to a head with the bullying wolves, the insurgent activity along the convoy routes, Adam getting over his personal issues and the relationship between Adam and Dawson and that was before Adam gets taken captive.  Life as he knew it just got a whole lot more precious and he is forcibly made to know every second that it might all be over.Okay, so Adam Madison...yeah, he was pretty much the same putz guy that was introduced in the book before and this time I got a front row seat since he's doing the narrating.  He is so ugly toward his brother and is pretty self-absorbed.  His resentment is to the point that he disassociates from being related to his brother and freaks out at the thought of someone coming on base who knows Tim and will speak of Adam's relationship to Tim.  He barks at even his friends if they show any respect or appreciation for his brother.Then there is his unreasonable assumptions about the werewolves in general.  He has three good friends and he knows the wolves back home and yet he is so caught up in his anger that he doesn't think to speak up about the injustices going on at the base and would rather blame all wolves than see the issue for what it was.  When Dawson tries to draw close to him and shows an interest, Adam spends much of the relationship with one foot in the doorway ready to bounce denying there is a relationship and denying the truth of their mutual interest.  See?  Not much to like here.And if he had remained the same for the whole book, I would have felt such pity for Dawson or at least questioned his intelligence to want a guy like that.  However, Dawson saw something in Adam that Adam didn't even see.  Dawson was the catalyst Adam needed to get his business together and see things differently.  He stopped filtering everything through his internal issues so everything was no longer something to react in anger or resentment to.  By the end of the book, he was a guy that was worth it.  I know these are tough marine types and on top of that there is the whole family forgives and receives back prodigals, but I was disappointed that Adam's change of heart didn't include more restitution.  He had been so ugly to people particularly Tim that I wanted to hear the words.The action plot is a series of snapshot scenes of life on the base and its environs.  The situation with the sadistic wolves was an interesting thread as were the scenes of Adam out on the road in those intense convoy missions.  The capture situation was intense because Adam had no idea what his fate would be and because the author made me as the reader feel right there in the moment as the isolation, boring days and situation as a captive were well-drawn.The romance is gritty and rough.  These guys like to talk dirty and just go at with little finesse and tenderness.  You won't hear sentimentality and some stuff isn't put into words, but is just assumed.  This suits this pair, the circumstances, and the setting.And just an observation, I enjoy how each book offers up a different set of circumstances, settings and personalities even though the books have a nice cohesiveness.  The stories aren't formulaic yet I can count on strong military and werewolf actions scenes, werewolf culture and strong characters in the wolf/human pairings.As I wrap-up, I again find myself looking forward with great anticipating for the next book in the series.  I hope it is Terrell's, but hey, I'll go with it if it's not.  I enjoyed the experience of the author working her magic and making me eventually enjoy Adam and his story with the delectable Dawson of the Lilac eyes.
summary: A difficult, resentful human and a peacemaking werewolf in another strong entry to this paranormal military romance

What is interesting about this book is it is two books in one. The first part of the book deals with providing a useful guide for a healthy lifestyle when starting college, primarily in not falling into the traps of college life and staying with a routine that will maximize your experience in a positive way. The second part offers an excellent collection of recipes from a quick breakfast to well rounded dinners, and the best part, they are easy. The smoothie recipes are a really neat addition too.Overall, this is a book that just about anyone could benefit from. With common sense advice and suggestions for better living and excellent recipes, this is a niffy book with quality content.
summary: A Niffy Book with Quality Content

reviewText: I never know exactly what to expect when I start a book from my Kindle library, but I was happily surprised by this choice! A tale of teenage love, this is a story of Phoenix and Star, two kids from the DZ (Dark Zone) who are brought into America to vie for a chance at heroism. They have the opportunity to provide electricity for their families back home by attempting to woo children of The Families (the new ruling class of America) into marriage. I was glad to see that this was not a formulaic copycat of The Hunger Games, although the starting premise feels very similar. I'm looking forward to the next two chapters to this story!

This book has great information about sleep apnea and how to treat it. My husband has breathing issues while he is sleeping and it worries me. I am so happy we got this book, now we have more of an understanding what sleep apnea actually is and the symptoms of it. We are going to go see a doctor this week. In this book there are tips on what the doctor is going to ask for, which we have done and I am ready for him to actually have a good nights sleep. Great book!

I can't recommend this book enough!  The author does a great job of pinpointing specific traits that many "beta" personalities have, and then specifically outlining steps to take to curtail them.  As I read this book from the male perspective, I was very interested in the insights of how women percieve men... really helpful stuff to see things from their perspective! I am excited to start implementing the practices proposed in this book into my life to help boost my self confidence... Thanks to this book, I am looking forward to a better me!

Just finished Human Bacon and it feels like the good feeling you get on a Sunday morning after a nice brunch (that always includes bacon BTW).  Justin, in his typical witty, humorous and at times irreverent style makes his point about being intentional about our personal brand.  Highly recommend this book to everyone that is a brand, which is everyone (You'll learn that if you don't already know by reading the book).  Very practical advice on things not often written about including: personal style, presence, social media, technology, and relationship management.
summary: Just finished Human Bacon and it feels like the good feeling you get on a Sunday morning ...

reviewText: As a bonafide entrepreneur I am always interested in business related content.  The title  Workplace Morale caught my attention.  .  As I read through the book I could not help but feel that the techniques, while valid and applicable to all businesses big and small, are easier to implement in bigger companies with staff that do not have to wear many hats.  That being said, I think that Workplace Morale is a good primer for young businesses that are growing.  Rapid growth is exciting, but with rapid growth come challenges which if not addressed could derail all your hard work.  The techniques outlined in the book serve as a checklist to keep company and employees on track towards a common goal - success.  The content may not be riveting stuff, but it is important stuff, stuff that every business owner should keep top of mind.
summary: Good Stuff for a Business Owner to Keep Top of Mind

She is taking an old home and turning it in Haven.  And to their surprise there is even a "woodshed"  with spanking implements on the property. After the weekend, and them spending time together this is where her newfound relationship begins with Craig, and her becoming open and honest about her feelings.This story contains consensual spankings, explicit hot sex, BDSM, age-play, anal play with many different couples who are in loving committed relationships in various lifestyles.

*Grace Martin comes from a very small town and lives with her VERY religious parents, her boyfriend who is also 'religious' is a major hypocrite. Grace has had enough of them and in a bid to get her freedom she accepts a job as a PA to a billionaire.Blake Harrison is the gorgeous 'older' billionaire who she accepts a job with. But he is very mysterious and keeps his cards close to his chest. But one secret is bigger than the rest. Grace finds herself falling in love with, but she wants to know all about him including his biggest secret.What happens when Grace discovers what it is?? Can their love survive it??*This is a great story written by a very talented author. All about how the demons of our past make us think we are not worthy of loving and everyone deserves a second chance at love.I really felt for Blake Harrison in this book as he had a devastating thing happen to himAnd the fact that he believes he is not worthy of love as he will destroy those that love him. At the same time thoughI really felt for Grace as neither her parents nor her ex finance believed her secret, because according to her family she was just confused by 'the big bad world'.I loved the fact though that both Grace and Blake were not afraid to fight for what they wanted and refused to give up on Blake even when he gave up on himself.I would definitely recommend this book to others.*this is the first book written by this author

reviewText: If you are like me and you are always being told you need to do this or that in order for you to be a leader then this book is a prefect book to place in your library. It helps all of us see ways we can try to be leaders. The book tells us what a leader is and what a typical leaders goals to achieve are. The book is divided into multiple sections and each section is easily written so we all can relate it to our own life. If looking to improve your life or just getting some suggestions on how to be a true leader I highly recommend this book. It truly is a big motivational book for me to put to my life.

This books is perfect for anyone who wants to be an effective leader. I was in management for over twenty years, and with each business I managed, I was always able to immediately gain the respect of not only my employees but my employers as well. I did this because I did basically every single thing that Debra Johnson mentions in this book. To be an effective leader, you need to know how to deal with your employees in a firm yet respectful way. Never back down on what you tell anyone. Stand accountable for all of your decisions and actions. Anyone who is just getting into a management position or who is in one already but could use some help with gaining the respect and following of their employees should really read this book and definitely follow the outstanding advice that the author gives. If you follow this advice, you will go far with your career and will become the productive leader that you want to be!
summary: Outstanding book filled with solid advice!

reviewText: First off, Full Moon Over Cedar Hill is free for the next 5 days or so, it’s a short read at around 20 pages and is perfect for trying out Edward Lorn.Go on, give it a go, it won’t even cost you 30 minutes of your life.Peter Hoskins suffered a stroke and is completely paralysed, apart from wiggling his toe and blinking his eyelids. From his Nursing Home room, he hears screams and all sorts of terrifying noises and we wait with him, reminiscing over his past as something comes closer to his room, something that without a shadow of a doubt is going to kill him, in a none to pretty fashion.There’s good deal of humour lurking in this tale of terror, some clever analogy’s likening his prostrate form to an item on a buffet and Whore Spackle, the wearing of too much makeup.Recommended

This has given me a more positive outlook on my future and I want to read more of the authors books.  Excellent read!
summary: Uncertain Times: How To Love the Unknown

reviewText: A detailed, informative guide for parents or caregivers.  I wish my parents had access to this kind of information many years ago.  I'm sure any parent will benefit from this book by helping them raise their child.
summary: Conscious Parent: how to raise a conscious child

reviewText: This is the second book I’ve read about shopping addiction, and I’m impressed that it gave more comprehensive thoughts on the causes and effects of excessive retail therapy. I liked this one because it made me ask myself if I’m suffering from such through the questions asked in the symptoms section; hence, helping me ponder on my expenses since I do some shopping from time to time when I’m angry. Thankfully, I realized that I don’t qualify as a shopaholic because I buy only stuff for necessity and only splurge when I have a bonus, but I think this is also good to keep me aware if I need the things that I buy and if I’m going way beyond budget when going shopping.
summary: Understand Retail Therapy and Gain Self-Control

reviewText: I have an obsession when it comes to retail shopping especially when there are huge sale discounts at stores or even when I badly wanted to buy something.  This kind of obsession became my habit already that it caused some damage on my financial and emotional freedom.  When I got the chance to read this book, it changed my mindset, making me aware of the harm that I've done to my overall lifestyle. Through this book, I learned some good tips on how to control my obsession with shopping and  discovered how this could greatly contribute for my financial freedom.  Now, I even recommend this book to my friends who have the same shopping obsession as mine!
summary: Good guide to remedies for shopping additiction!

reviewText: Mmmm hmmm the moretti men r hot this whole book series is great  they r all sexy and hot and sweet and loving  love it the sex in these books is hot

What a great book this is, I have read and enjoyed all of these books and each one has been so great to get lost in. I didn't want this series to end, but the end of this series is actually really great, nothing sad just the characters moving on.

Sad, that it's the end of the Moretti's but what a way to go! Fantastic read! love, love, love MJ Carnal and the way she tells a story;-) Can't wait for the next series. One click today any and all MJ's books!
Hard to pick a favorite, love the books, love a book that keeps my attention, and this series sure did that!!! love love love them

Slight SpoilersOkay the book was good but not as good as the last story.  I firmly believe this should have been a third book in the series or later on.  The reason is that there was too much going on in the story background from the last book that this book never fully dealt with the mates in this book.  I mean we never get a resolution for the vampire blood poisoning so they can never speak telepathically.  Then they poisoned further.  That was a sore spot for me.  I was also upset that we didn't hear more about the ex-alpha's plans until very late in the story after he was kidnapped.  We still didn't get much.  Also, how could they have traced the poison to the wolves and not realize that it was originating from their own coven.  I mean no offense but DUH.  How did it take someone from the outside to realize that they must have an inside leak.  Parts of the book just seemed so very convoluted.  Also, how is it that his mother never made and appearance in this book.  She obviously played a big role in the overall scheme and was abusing her own children.  How was her involvement not developed and explained further.  What was she gaining?  If they killed men that abused him, why not the mother?  I just think the story was not developed as much because it was going in so many directions.  If there is going to be an ongoing nemesis, more needs to be explained about the reasons behind it all.  I mean the guy that kidnapped the vampire's mate didn't seem to have a real reason.  I mean why poison men you say you wanted to mate with.Anyway, now I am just ranting, but you get my point.  I only gave it 4 stars because I loved the first book so it pulled me into the second.  If this had been the first, I would not have rated it so high because I would honestly be way to confused.
summary: Make sure you read the series in order

reviewText: Disappointing after the first novel was so promising. The characters never grew on me; I didn't get to know them and I didn't really care about what happened to them. The secret identity of the elders was lame. Hopefully the next novel will be better.Anybody notice how fast these series novels get pumped out nowadays? It's like the authors just don't put any time into crafting a decent novel, just pump out the sequels as fast as they can and forget about story arch, character development, etc.

Miranda Sweet is back in town. The equal to the Hatfields to Logan Martin's McCoy's. But he has never forgotten her nor has she forgotten him. Knowing the town hates the Sweets, Miranda just needs to turn the family brewery around and sell it to her company. Guaranteed to give her the corner office she so badly wants, she weather's the taunts and whispers. Logan is now running the family bank, and needing the brewery land for the Salvation Industrial Park, he denies her a loan. But the attraction is stronger than ever. Finally seeing how it was to grow up a Sweet, Logan realizes he has a lot to make up for, but can he make Miranda believe him. Can they come together for the good of the town and their own happiness. Find out in this first installment of Avery Flynn's Sweet Salvation Brewery series!!

Loved it!! This is a wonderful story and I read it in one sitting, just couldn't put it down. I loved Miranda who s smart(super) , feisty, strong willed, awesome and determined not to fail. Add in Logan who knows he has been wrong and works to fix it - love this in a man.Miranda wants to bring the Sweet Salvation Brewery to succeed and Logan wants it to fail. She is working against family history, a family feud and almost an entire town that wants her to fail and leave. Not something she will do in this life time.I loved this book and I know that you will too.I received a free copy in return for an honest review. I loved it so much I purchased a copy of the book.

Her Secret, His Surprise was a really sweet story with two very likable characters - even though they are both keeping BIG secrets.I loved how Logan and Cass take the high ground with each other, even though they have plenty to be angry about. Instead of lashing out, they try to see each others point of view. It made their rocky relationship very believable and easy to root for. Olivia was all kinds of adorable - as was Logan's reaction to her.The mystery/undercover fell a little flat for me. I was like…that's it? - so I kind of wish this just stuck with the secret baby aspect but overall it was a cute read.You kind of can't go wrong with an Entangled Bliss title if you're looking for a quick, sweet romance for summer beach reading.

Her Secret, His Surprise is a well-written, sexually charged, contemporary romance. The characters are well defined and the quick-paced plot flows effortlessly from beginning to end. This is the first book I have read by Paula Altenburg and I can't wait to discover more from her book library. In addition, this story has a wonderful and engaging ending, which continues to make me smile whenever I think about Cass and Logan, the couple in this book.I love stories about secret babies. After a passionate one night stand with Logan, a government investigator posing as a bartender, Cass learns she is pregnant. Two years later, Logan is in her life again, investigating her and the company she works for. Their quasi-professional relationship evolves into much more, as they learn about each other and learn to forgive the mistakes of their past.Cass and Logan are extremely likeable, have great chemistry and challenge each other in the most unique ways. I immediately connected to them as individuals and as a couple. Their sex scenes are lustful and full of promise. Olivia, Cass and Logan's toddler, has some very funny laugh out loud moments. This is a delightful book, complete with great characters, a plot that twists and turns in all the right places, and an romantic love story.Complimentary copy provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review.

The idea of the secret baby and the undercover male character in this book got me curious about how the story will unfold. The story started with how Cass and Logan met in the bar and their attraction led to one night with Logan and everything changed for Cass. A baby was coming on board but she couldn't contact Logan, who seem to disappear. The staff at the bar didn't know anyone by his name. How shocking! Two years later, they met again under some shocking situation--he's her new assistant. Another surprise--he's actually the grandson of her kind neighbour!Paula Altenburg creates relateable characters. I can understand how Cass emotions through the words, about her protectiveness towards her daughter Olivia and her wariness of Logan. Although I understand Logan's need for secrecy at times, it frustrates me to read that he's keeping a barrier when it's kind of obvious how she felt about him and him with Olivia. Logan's grandmother is a darling! I was touched that she was actually keeping a lookout for Cass!Overall, this was a cute read for me! Olivia is adorable and so are Logan's reactions to seeing and interacting with her. Looking forward to reading other works by the author.I received a review copy in exchange for an honest review.

This book grabbed me from the beginning.  I couldn't put it down. I felt like I was there with Becky and Logan.  I fell in love with Logan, Becky, Sophie and Jiggy. Becky was so great and Logan was so sweet even with everything he was dealing with.  I look forward to reading more by this author!

The Once A Marine series is definitely improving with each book, I really enjoyed Adam and Meg’s book (The Baby Bargain), but Logan and Becky’s story was even better. Jennifer Apodaca, has once again combined just the right amount of romance, drama and suspense into the book to keep you reading until the end.”Most people who see combat come home with scars. Everyone deals with it differently.”Logan Knight is struggling to deal with the scars that he has returned with, plagued with nightmares and struggling with P.T.S.D, all he wants to do is set up his ranch as a safe place for other veterans to spend time at, and to be able to convalesce and receive the best help and support they can for their issues. Two things are standing in his way – his father and his lack of a wife.Becky Holmes is in trouble, caring for a young baby is struggle enough, but she’s recently lost her mother to cancer, and her ex has just been released from prison. His time spent behind bars because she called the cops on him, and refused to take the blame for the hit and run accident he drove away from whilst she was in the car.Logan and his family name offer her the protection and the stability she needs in order to fight a custody battle for her daughter. The daughter her ex never wanted, but is now using as his way to punish her for sending him to jail. A deal is struck, a contract is signed, and they agree to a mutually beneficial marriage, Logan gets his ranch, and Becky keeps custody of baby Sophie as well as having the powerful Knight Family as her allies.I loved the sentiment between Logan and Becky in this book, they are emotionally scarred from things that have happened in their past, they are wary of each other initially and the emotions they are feeling, even though the chemistry is there, neither wants to rush headlong into something that they don't quite understand themselves.Becky – “When you touch me, I feel safe, sexy and whole.”Logan – “When I touch you, it all gets easier. Kissing you today was like that blanket – warm, soft and giving me a little protection.”The bravery displayed by both of them in different ways, to push past their long held and deeply-rooted fears, so they are able to embrace something new together, in spite of the odds, interfering families and demented exes makes for a really enjoyable and heart-warming story.She had the power to shove back the ugliness inside of him, the memories and the failures that shadowed his soul.Although there isn’t really anything new offered up in the way of storyline, this second book in the Once A Marine Series, offers us another extremely hot leading man, a likeable, strong and sassy heroine, mix that with a little bit of suspense, a whole lot of sexyness and you are onto a winner, with a well written and easy to absorb book. I look forward to reading more books in this series in the future.”You’re turning me and my world inside out. You make me want to become more than your temporary husband.”ARC generously provided via Netgalley, in exchange for the above honest review.(less)
summary: 3.5 - "No one's ever loved me enough to stay." Stars!

reviewText: Joe and Drea have one week in Buenos Aires as reward for getting the marketing contract. Unfortunately a mix-up at the hotel means one room and one bed. The two friends figure that they can suck it up for one night. But then they wake up in each other’s arms, seconds away from taking their relationship to the next level. They decide to follow through on that impulse, vowing that they’ll forget the fling when they go home. But then Joe falls hard for Drea. Can he convince her that what happens in Buenos Aires doesn’t have to stay there?I really liked the awkwardness between Joe and Drea when they try to discuss their relationship. It was realistic. I would have been pretty suspicious if either Drea or Joe admitted to having feelings for the other right away. I would’ve wondered why neither of them acted on them before heading to Argentina. I especially liked the situations where one misinterpreted what the other was saying. It not only made things more awkward, but it also made the person responding struggle with a response.The setting in Buenos Aires was both positive and a negative. Setting the story in a foreign country, especially in South America, let Drea and Joe feel comfortable separating their friendship at home from this new romantic relationship. It also gave them the sense that the romance stayed in Argentina. I really liked that aspect of the setting.But I didn’t get the feeling that the author had ever been to Buenos Aires. While visiting a setting before writing about it isn’t necessary, convincing the reader that the author didn’t just flip through a guidebook is important. The setting was too superficial for me. I struggled to get lost in the setting and to believe that I was reading about Buenos Aires. All of the activities that Joe and Drea did seemed like they were either found in a tourist guide book or looked up online. That bothered me. It really took me out of the story.I’d recommend One Night in Buenos Aires to a reader looking for a short romance that doesn’t shy away from the awkwardness of friends becoming lovers.Rating: 4/5One Night in Buenos Aires by Amanda K. Byrne is published as an eBook by Engtangled Publishing.**I received an advanced copy of this book in return for an unbiased review.

The price is so worth it for the 30 recipes provided in this book! The author knows what to provide and he did provide so much uses of essential oils not just for the body but for home purposes as well. I tried the air and vacuum cleaner freshener and I'd surely try the other recipes soon. Great and highly recommended!

Best writing concept and effective cover photo to be understood about this book. Maximum stories written about portraits, political leader or famous business man, but at first I have seen different and a famous soccer player situated at the point of view of this book. Personally, I like Ronaldo and his playing. This book described all things about Ronaldo in details. Highly appreciated to author!
Informative without  being overly dramatic. This reporter comes across as completely credible. My heart goes out  to those poor children. And those poor dogs.

I was intrigued when I saw that Kate Gosselin was the subject of this book - curious to see whether the author confirmed or disproved what I already knew about Kate Gosselin from what had already been revealed in the media.  Being a voracious reader always looking for a good tome, I downloaded this book onto my kindle app, and off I went.  From the moment I downloaded it, I couldn't put it down for the day and a half it took me to devour it. All I can say is, "oh my freaking God..." Kate Gosselin must be having a coronary right now over what has been revealed here, and the fact her own carelessness (and document disposal, lol) is largely responsible for her exposure to the public! Jon, however, is redeemed a little here, but if he witnessed even HALF the things claimed by the author in this book, and has not made an effort to take custody of ALL OF HIS CHILDREN away from this woman, then he is no better than she. He could very easily call upon former babysitters, volunteers, TLC staffers, the list goes on and on, as witnesses in his custody case testify on his behalf.  He needs to step up and file for FULL custody of his children, with KATE being the one with visitation, before they are further damaged by this selfish, narcissistic woman!  The truth is, Robert Hoffman has a treasure trove of what amounts to be EVIDENCE, and he should make it available to the AUTHORITIESIronically, she is actually on a front page tabloid RIGHT NOW accused of abusing her children! The book is well-written expose that is sure to have Kate Gosselin burning up the phone lines to her attorneys, looking for ways to sue Mr. Hoffman for revealing to the world the true nature and extent of her fraud!  It's crazy to have discovered that everything I suspected about this woman was true and WORSE!! One of the best books I have read in a while about a horribly sad subject (you can't ignore the fact that real children are being abused here!). I can't imagine that Jon, or anyone who cares about what happens to the Gosselin's 8 children, can continue to simply look the other way any longer. I highly recommend!!

Nadine picks up where she left off with Adam and Lily's engagement.  This book is exactly what we've grown to expect from NM Silber...humor, laugh out loud moments, craziness, support of friends, love, and hot sex!  I have loved all of the Lawyers in Love books and a reader will not be let down.  I love how Nadine has a way of including the entire group of friends and at the same time setting us up for the next stories within this great series.The reader is taken on a journey of preparing for Adam and Lily's wedding.  I love the anxiety as a true bride to be experiences this.  Adam certainly steps up to "comfort" his fiancé.  While I love all of the books within the series, this has been my favorite.  Adam and Lily just have this connection that's real...childhood frenemies to adult lovers.  Perfect!

I enjoyed this book and it has a lot of good points about developing a success mindset. I highlighted this particular point:One thing that is common amongst every one of the 1% is their drive and search for constant self-improvement . They are always seeking a better way, idea or belief that will make life better. They have the ability to take an honest look at who and what they are presently, but always with an eye towards improvement.I think that sums up a lot of what this book has to offer.
summary: It Is All In The Mind

reviewText: In the busy modern world of consumerism and rapidly changing technology, it is easy to lose sight of simple pleasures. This book gives insights into minimalism, a concept beyond owning fewer belongings, but also taking time for friends and self. It is a thoughtful book, and I can see several areas of my own life where I can simplify, declutter both my home and mind, and find even more contentment. Nicely done!

What a great read this was. I really like how this book makes you look at yourself. We are too hard on ourselves sometimes and can be very negative, but how can we expect someone to love us for who we are if we can't even do that ourselves? This book makes you take a step back and focus on loving ourselves and seeing the good in everything. Love will come in time when we are being our amazing selves and when we least expect it. Look for the person who loves you for who you are and doesn't want you to change. I would recommend this book to anyone who is struggling with a relationship or anyone who is struggling with finding true love.
THIS WAS A REALLY FUNNY MURDER MYSTERY THAT WAS AS ABOUT AS MIXED UP AS ANYTHING CAN GET.  I WILL READ SOME MORE OF THIS AUTHORS NOVELS AS I CAN.
I sincerely hope the Ghost-in-Law mysteries never end. I love Helena. Now that she's going to New Orleans with Taylor, maybe that's the beginning of the next book?

The antics of a hilarious, ghost who doesn't know how the ghost world functions and who causes so many mishaps when trying to be useful is an extraordinary rendition of fiction. The attractions between the main characters and the connections of the group of friends who are always looking out for one another while trying to solve a mystery is refreshing. Humor, murder, and intrigue are a great combination. I highly recommend this book.
summary: Chaos in Mudbug by Jana DeLeon

reviewText: As always the Mudbug book did not disappoint!  Funny, suspense and mystery all in one amazing story! Jana DeLeon has a great sense of humour!  I can't wait to read the next one!
This is another great read from Jana.  Helena has got to be one of my favorite.  If you have not read any Jana DeLeon you are missing some wonderful reads.

This was a great book. Quinn Carpenter was in love once but the guy cheated on her with one of her friends. Another ex-boyfriend drove her home one night from a party while he was on drugs and they ended up in a horrible car accident. Quinn walked away with terrible panic attacks and anxiety but the boyfriend sadly didn't walk away at all because he died. After that Quinn started going for only bad boys and she didn't want a relationship and figured she only wanted friends with benefits. She meets Reed Porter and he is completely different from her "type." He's blond, has blue eyes, he's preppy, and doesn't have a single tattoo. Reed makes Quinn's hackles come out. He makes her start to feel things she doesn't want to feel and hasn't felt in a long time, if at all.Quinn is messed up but she really does try to be selfless for Reed. Her heart is in the right place. Reed is a wonderful man that will do anything and fight any battle for the people he loves, especially for his love for Quinn. There is more to people than just appearances.Definitely worth reading and enjoying.

This book was a 5 star for me! I could relate to Quinn on so many levels. Staying with the safe normal type that she is used to. She has been hurt in the past, so she is afraid to move on. That is why she has a friends with benefits type of relationship with Tyler. Then Reed or Preppy Porter as she called him comes along and basically sweeps her off her feet. He wants her and fights for her. Reed makes her realize that the bad boy friends with benefits type isn't always the best fit. There were a few times I literally shook my Kindle hoping Quinn would feel the effects because she frustrated me sometimes lol. In the end, the lesson is your certain "type" of guy isn't always the right one for you.Reviewed by: Amber Cromer

I get so excited when I Lisa has a new book out. I read them all. Typically the day they come out. I always know I am in for an amazing story. Side Effects was no exception. It gripped me from the first page. I loved how the title fit with the story. Can't wait to read more by this author!
summary: Loved it and everything else Lisa has written.

reviewText: This was the first book that I have read by Lisa Suzanne and it will not be the last. From the first page I was sucked in and could not put this book down until the end. Quinn carpenter a happy go lucky girl enjoyed going out and hanging with her girls. although she wasn't strapped down with a man in her life she loved to dapple around with Tyler. Quinn and Tyler were friends with benefits. They both knew what they wanted and when they wanted it even if it was in the hallway of the bar. Quinn liked her men to be dark and rugged, until she met Reed Porter. There was something about Mr. preppy but she couldn't put her finger on it. Reed found himself taking an interest in Quinn as well and would at at her parents BBQ with her brother Grant. Fate just seems to be getting the way because every time Quinn turns around reed is right there and he let's her know it. Reed is so very adamant about making Quinn his and she is adamant that she will not give in. My favorite quote in the books is this." Quinn, I won't be your sloppy seconds. When you F**K me, and you will F**k me, I'm going to be the only man on your agenda for the night."Loved it and can't wait to read more from this author.
I so did not expect Leanne to take it that far.  These two were fun and challenged but perfect for each other.

This book was another sound testimony from Mrs. Lindsey. A lot of the topics relates to marriage as her first book related to singleness. Although I enjoyed reading the book, it isn't meant for new Christians who may feel overwhelmed by this life of constant submission. One does not become selfless overnight. I'd recommend this book for those who need encouragement & conviction to keep on the straight and narrow. I liked the focus on limiting worldly entertainment and keeping up appearances. I personally hate attention so I never wear revealing clothes, but I'm learning to update my  extremely modest wardrobe to a more attractive style even if just buying milk and bread from Wal-Mart.One thing I feel has been left out is the issue of abuse. Submission to her husband does not mean a woman should accept physical or emotional abuse. A man of God will help build up, not tear down and belittle. You are somebody! And finally some of us are meant to be single warriors; Getting married is not the goal serving Christ is!I can't wait to read Mr. Lindsey's books as well.

So yes I'm a huge fan of HM Ward - I have a love/hate relationship with Holly due to how she puts my emotions through the ringer with her Ferro men.  I have to be honest and say The Arrangement series has been tipping the balance a bit to close toward the hate aspect but this book appears to have the potential to bring me back from the dark side.In this first installment, to be 1 of 7 books in the series, we meet Kerry who has gone away to college only to be dumped by her douche lord first love and childhood sweetheart.  She meets and instantly bonds with Beth who persuades her the best way to get closure and finality is by having a one time rebound hook up.  One night, one time - no strings and no tomorrow.  Only it turns out there is no one time and there is definitely a tomorrow.This books has an amazing comedic element we have seen glimpses of before with Mr Turkey and Squirrel however this book features my fave already - the raccoon.  Throw in the little Asian man and the school bus and everything is there for a comedy riot.Don't read this book expecting a big Ferro bang and you're not going to get and it is also lacking in some of the instant "between the sheets" heat that usually comes with a Ferro story.There seems to be a tendency to draw things out as long as possible when sometimes I just want to settle down and start a big ass novel, fall asleep on my kindle and wake up with a book hangover.  With these much smaller serial books I've barely even got comfortable and it's over with.  I am a little sad that it is 1 of 7 - I personally would much rather prefer to wait a little longer for something more substantial and have it as maybe 1 of 3 but there's no accounting for personal preference.I see alot of potential promise with this story and I really hope it delivers.  At the moment I am looking forward to seeing this through to the end and I hope that doesn't change.
summary: Hopefully the start of good Ferro things to come

reviewText: Holly, I just don't know how you turn out so much product and keep me addicted to it all.  This latest series has me so caught up and it's killing me to figure out which Ferro man and branch of the family he's from.  And Texas - that's really thrown me?!!  Great characters, great direction with the story, and fabulous description of yet another Ferro man.  Thank you for continuing to do what you do.  :o)

So I'm the biggest H.M Ward fan and I really like her books and the start of this story, but I'm just so over them being so short and then getting excited for the next part to come out then it being short again. it's frustrating...!!!!!! and it's not like they come out every week you have to wait a while. I feel like I'm going to lose interest in her books. I just want a full length book. I'm pretty upset about this 😕

I loved that Olivia was a strong willed woman with a backbone, "if you think that today is going to have any bearing on our business negotiations, you are sorely mistaken, Mr. Hayes." I said coldly. I couldn't believe his nerve. "It will be a cold day in hell before I sell my company to you. You had your chance two years ago and you blew it." Logan I really did love him and all his innuendos:"Have you ever been in a limo?" he whispered into my ear, his hands tightening on my waist. I loved how I felt with him touching me."No," I replied slowly, my eyes still closed from the kiss."Want to take a ride in mine?" he asked."I also loved that he's willing to do anything to distract his woman from dying with hunger, "a naughty smirk lit up Logan's features. "I guess I'll just have to distract you until then." I love this series so I'm also excited to see a new book.

Olivia and Logan's relationship is just as tumultuous as the hurricane that thrusts them together. I enjoyed the second chance romance theme of this Kisses book and how passionate and protective Olivia was about her company. Logan was the perfect billionaire hero who oozed sex appeal. I could actually feel his pain at being torn between his loyalty to his family's business and his attraction to Olivia.I've read all of Krista Lakes' Kisses books love them all. Her characters feel real, and her story lines are believable, and they all handsome billionaires who fall for everyday women. I just love the beachy settings, which create the perfect backdrop for romance. Hurricane Kisses is all of these things and more. It's the kind of love story you can lose yourself in. Highly recommended!
summary: The perfect billionaire beach read - a true love story!

reviewText: Not very many enjoy what they are currently doing; I used to be one of those people until I picked up this book. It has a very inspirational tone and message that makes you want to wake up tomorrow quit your current job and pursue that thing that you have been pushing for later all your life.

I didn’t know that I actually still had my childhood believes in me. This book has taught me the value of spiritual survival. It came as a surprise to know that I was actually exercising spiritual survival every time I engage my believes in an argument or debate, or when something bad happens!
summary: Taught me the value of spiritual survival

reviewText: I found it interesting how the book explains about timing when it comes to protein intake. Normally I would go for a heavy meal with many proteins only when I was really hungry. I now know how to control the level of proteins I eat every day thanks to this book!

It is amazing how I did not know how our bodies are made to operate, prior to reading this book; I did not know that it is important to do accurate protein timing before a workout. I implemented the process and got amazing results in a very short time. This is the ideal book to read if you want to get rid of that beer belly.
I just fell in love with this author. She did a great job not many grammar errors. The story line stayed in place. I loved how the surprises kept coming. Happy ending....

Adam was a good book, but really felt more like a novella with the way it's answered all your Adam questions but was building you up for all the really HUGE stuff that's about to happen. I hope SLADE isn't too far away, cos I'm busting at the seams :-)
I loved this book. I loved the characters and the story line. Love Adam and his Angel. I can't wait for the next one! I hope its Jill and Slade, and then Sloan's book after that one.
summary: Another Must Read by Teresa Gableman

reviewText: I love this book and I'm absolutely glued to this amazing series! Lots of hot and hunky guys in the story and a ton of sexual tension between Slade and Jill. So cannot wait to for the next book ''Slade" to come out soon. Read this book and the whole series and you will most certainly not be disappointed;)
summary: I love this book and I'm absolutely glued to this amazing ...

reviewText: ADAMS STORY WAS AWESOME.  Adam and his Angel get there HEA finally.You also get to read about all you fave Warriors.  Especially my Fave Sid!!Adams story  set up the next book in a huge way!I won't spoil it but it is going to be so hard to wait for the next book.  My mind is going a mile a minute with so many scenarios.  One being that the Mayor and his Vampire Witch are going DOWN!  HahaAnd a new character was introduced.  Jax!!  I already love this Warrior.  He reminds me a little of Sid.I "hope" Jill and Slade are next, though I think Caroline and Sloan had a "moment".  I could be wrong, but I felt they did.

Since I first discovered this series, I have become dependent on it like blood to a Vampire, a full moon to Werewolves, water to grass, and well you get my point. I LOVE this series and have reread each book at least twice. Each book gets better and better because the stories keep developing and getting more intriguing and complicated like all great series should. This author is amazing and where her mind takes us into this world is amazing. Its hard for me to pick one VC Warrior as a favorite because, really, they each have their own special qualities and each one can hold their own with one another; Damon-silent but will rip the head off anyone who dare harms his girl; Jared (my favorite)-sexy, outgoing, funny but will do anything for Tessa damn the consequences; Duncan-quiet hero, who takes his job seriously, but would give it all up for his son and Pam in a heartbeat; Sid-sarcastic, great cook, loyal, loner, finally found someone to share his life with and who can keep him in his place; and then there is Adam who surprised me with his story, and I actually learned a lot about him and respected him more than I did previously. I cannot wait for SLADE. I think his story has been the most anticipated since he made his first appearance way back when. The tension with him and Jill just keeps building and I can't take it anymore, I want this book out now. With that said, I hope there will be a Sloan story, as well, and other characters introduced. Keep doing what you doing Teresa-you're only getting better.
summary: Everything About This Series Is Fantastic-No Negatives!

reviewText: Very good series can't wait for more wish they were longer and please hurry with the next one

Adam's book was another good read from Teresa Gabelman.  Adam's not my favorite VC Warrior wannabe that spot sits with Jared and Sid :).  All of the characters seemed a little sedated from their previous selves, but as the book progressed I got why, but all and all its a good read that left me excited for the next book and not just for Slade and Jill ,but what Teresa has in store for her VC warriors vs Alice and a whipped Mayor the ending floored me!!!
summary: Cant get enough of the VC Warriors

reviewText: A page-turning, suspenseful, and engaging paranormal series with extraordinary plots, amazing alpha warriors, and their strong-willed lovable mates... Throw in some of the most vile villains written in this genre and you've got yourself an adrenalin filled, edge of your seat ride into Gabelman's fantastic Protector Series.  If you are a PNR fan, don't miss out on these wonderful books... It will have you cheering, growling, laughing and gnawing body parts.  Definitely on my auto-buy list!  And just a side note to the author... I can not wait to see the book titled Slade as Jillian has completely captured my heart... wonderful character development.

I liked this book and yeah it only got 2 stars. I knew it was dark but it just was way too fictional for me. I like my MC romance to be more believable. Too many things just made no sense to me. If you like dark unbelievable books it's for you. As for me no cops showing up, dead bodies all over. Nah.  Had it been more real it would have gotten more stars.

This book was WOW.  I love Slade and Sam, and their love.  I also loved the other characters in this book.  I laughed at times, and them mostly cried because you truly feel what they are going through.  It was like it was happening to one of your best friends.  This book is a must read.
Book three was incredible!  I love Slade and Angel's love story!  This book was so great!  Didn't want it to end!
what a great book. lots of twists and turns a complete page turner. I will not give away anything in the book but for me it is a must read

This was a very informative and well written book on low cholesterol diet solutions. It provided me with a good introduction to cholesterol and why it is so crucial. I also love the fact that it came with a great overview and lot of useful tips on medications for cholesterol management. And of course, the recipes – what a wonderful collection of healthy recipes. Be sure to check them out! If you’re anything like me, only wanting the best for your body and trying to regain control over your cholesterol, this books is definitely for you.
summary: If you only want the best for your body or gain control over your cholesterol, this books is definitely for you!

reviewText: I have had these books for years and had to take them out and do a refresher read on them . Yep they are still awesome books . I loved the fact that twins separated at birth find love and each other.  If you love reading about that then this is the box set for you . Maggie Shayne takes you on a journey from here to a different world so pick up the books and lets go for a ride I think you might like with the Fairies Of RUSH.....

I absolutely loved this book and I even read it twice just to make sure that I got some of the basic concepts down. This book was very descriptive, as it gave you a step-by-step guide for you to follow for each particular soap. My favorite part of the book were the pictures that were provided. In the other soap books that I have tried to follow, they didn't have any illustration just words, so I was never sure if was doing right. Excellent read!!!!

What a great addition to the series. I have since the first book had a soft spot for my Dragon man Royce. Am I a lover of redheads, not exactly but Royce just nudged his way into my soul. Once again Ms. Mills relays a wonderfully exciting story in her world of Dragons. She has created an emotional rollercoaster that brings to the forefront the ability to move on from past experiences and preconceived notions. Though not completely, Ms. Mills tries to give us the stages of Royce's turmoil in letting go of prejudice and overcoming tragedy in the wake of finding the one the Universe has chosen for him. I enjoyed the pairing of the main characters, and I like the idea of a "tiny" wisp of a witch being strong and feisty, not just flaccid and vulnerable. Bringing Royce's mothers voice into the fold was also well thought out and touching, though I wish she had had a stronger more dominant force toward Royce. All in all I really like this addition to the series. I am still completely perturb that Andrew has not met the death he so deserves, this guy has gone on long enough and I think we need a new villain. I am already waiting impatiently for the next release, Devons story will surely be one to delve into with bated breath!

reviewerName: Carrie Book Fairy Fort "Indy Book Fairy"
reviewText: Favorite Lines “Damn, little ole me sent the big ole dragon man running home.”“Fate has given the task to drag him out of the past and into the future that awaits both of you.”“One thought followed her into her slumber, hope was a scary bitch.”“Yes, you are strong and honest and loyal and everything your father and I ever hoped you would be, just as your brothers are. We could not be prouder of you than we are but tears do not make you week, mo mahc, on the contrary they make you strong, they show you have compassion and you of all people know that.”“You were so right, mom, she is worth everything.”“You and your love saved me from myself.”I was shocked by this book! I thought of all our sexy dragon warriors that Royce (after all his advice and pushing the other men to claim there mates) would be the smart one and let fate give him his other half with a smile but....NO NO NO Royce the gentle giant turned into a big jerk! I understand why he's scared to a point but he's taking it to far! He won't let the past stay in the past!Kyra can't believe that Royce is her chosen one. He won't even look at her. She's a spitfire! I love her! She's my new favorite heroine of this series! If anyone can knock some sense into that big lug it's her!Andrew that traitor is still up to his games. He's crazy!!! This crazy dragon takes payback to a whole new level. I'm almost scared to see what he has planned next.Julia Mills is becoming one of my most favorite authors. Her writing is so easily to fall in love with, her characters are the kind you can talk about with your book circle and fall in love with. She's just an amazing author!Also this cover is spectacular!I would tell everyone who loves some yummy paranormal romance that this is the book for you! Actually this whole series is for you!I was given this book by author in exchange for an honest reviewFIVE BLUE FIRE FAIRIES

I stumbled upon this book as I was searching for ways to increase and grow my business communication skills. This book intrigued me because it discloses some of the best secrets in the field today. I liked the whole book, especially chapter 5 that dives into the qualities of good business communication. Pay special attention to this chapter because it gives top-notch advice and steps to follow in order to maximize your communication skills. I recommend this book to people who are looking for ways to get ahead in business and life in general.

What can I say. I love the way Lynne St. James writes a story. The intricate plot and steamy sensual love scenes. You can feel the passion an intensity with every word on the page. Ms. St. James pours her heart and soul into this book. I cried an that is huge for me I'm not a big cryer at all.Jeremy is one sexy beast! Talk about wanting to get to know a character more, I couldn't put this book down. Something I love!!Far to many authors don't get deep enough into the heart of their characters. But Lynne isn't afraid to push the boundaries and more.  I love Kristy and she special powers!! This story is a wonderful sequel to Embracing her Desires.There were surprising and unexpected plot twists. I guarantee you will NOT be disappointed when you read this book. Even days after I've finished it. It's still on my mind.  :o)

Declutter Unlimited: How To Organize Your Life And Maximize Your Potential is a fantastic book. It has so much useful information. This book has helped me organize my life which has made it so much easier to get other things done. Highly recommended!

How long until book 3 comes out?! I need it right now after reading volume 2!We pick right back up where Volume 1 ended, and OMG if you thought Bentley and Ceci were hot in volume 1, wait till you get your hands on this! I love the attraction between these two, and finding out more about Bentley and his past makes me want to strangle Ceci for the lies she is telling him. I LOVE Bentley and don't want to see his heart get broken.Now don't get me wrong, I totally understand why Ceci is doing what she is, but still it doesn't make it easier for me to not want to strangle her for lying to Bentley. The scenes between these two are so hot you'll need a fan to cool off after reading them. Brooke has a way of writing that makes you flush after reading, because it is so hot!This book is simply amazing and you will fall in love more and more with Bentley, he is so freaking hot (in case I didn't mention that already). I started this book and could not put it down, and then when it was over I was in instant need of volume 3 to see how it all ended. I mean, the ending, is just WOW! You'll understand once you read why I can't wait to see what happens in the conclusion of their story.If you haven't read volume 1, go grab it today so you can read this one. You will fall in love with Ceci and Bentley and this crazy twisty relationship they have going on. Make sure this series is on your TBR list today and get reading it now!

What can I say this book is HOT HOT HOT!!! I had high expectations for this book and they were beyond exceeded. I love Brooke Cumberland and this is definitely the best yet! The story, character development and plot twist were fab. And I can't wAit for the final book :-)
summary: WARNING! MAKE SURE YOU ARE DOUBLE PACKING THE SHAMWOW PANTIES FOR THIS ONE!

reviewText: ☆☆☆☆☆ 5 BENTLEY STARS☆☆☆☆☆Pardon my language but Holy S***… The Intern Vol. 2 was F#%*%NG HOT!! If I thought the first volume was sexy, let me tell you Brooke went beyond my expectations in this installment. Volume 2 was filled with so much suspense and lots of steamy drop-your-p@nty kind of hot sex.If you were like me, I had to know what will happen to Ceci when Bentley discovered she was hiding under his desk. How will Ceci manage to get out of her predicament ? Well lets just say Brooke Cumberland took her readers on to a whole ride of hotness. The chemistry between Ceci and Bentley was like a blazing inferno. It was hot, raw, primal and intense. The strong connection between these two is so palpable that you were on the edge of your seats waiting for Ceci’s secrets to be unraveled.
