The more time they spent with each other, Bentley warns Ceci that he doesn’t give his heart so easily and constantly ask her for the truth. With lingering suspicions of Ceci, will Bentley be able to f@#* the truth out of her? Or will Ceci’s lies finally catch up to her?Ahhh… Brooke Cumberland does it again with another shocking ending!!! Why must you torture your readers like that? HAHA. What can I say but I loved The Intern Volume 2. It was one hot, steamy suspenseful quick read. I loved that we got to see a whole new side to Bentley. He was the total alpha sexy domineering hero. And I can’t get enough of him. I wanted more Bentley!!! I can’t wait to see what Ms.Cumberland has in store for Bentley and Ceci in the third volume. All I can ask of her, is to please hurry and finish it soon. I am dying to know what happens next. <3
summary: The Intern Vol. 2: Sizzling hot suspenseful read!

reviewText: My entire family is on a strict gluten-free diet, so I was looking for new foods and treats that won't trigger our food allergies.  I had never tried almond flour recipes before until now.  There is definitely a different flavor to it, but it's surprisingly complementary in baked goods.  My favorites are: the buttery biscuits, the peach crisp, and the pumpkin spice bread.  If you are new to cooking with almond flour like me, this is a nice intro.  There are some really tasty recipes here.
summary: Some tasty almond flour recipes for a gluten-free family

reviewText: If you like hot alpha males and lots of hot steamy sex then this book is for you!  Vance and Julia know how to work it in and outside of the bedroom.  I thought the story flowed well and was a good read overall.  I hope there is more to come with this couple in the future.  Amanda does a good job of pulling you into the story and keeping your attention.  I look forward to reading more books by Amanda in the future.  I received and ARC for an honest review.

I received a free ARC in exchange for my honest review. It was a rather short read for me. I love to read sex scenes and this definitely has them. About 85% of the book is sex scene. Descriptive and HOT. The last 10% or so was actual story line. I would've liked to have more story line with the sex scenes. I think this writer could do a great job. I will actually read at least one more of her books to see if this was a one time thing or if this is her writing style. Thank you Amanda for letting me read your book.
summary: Lots of HOT sex but IMO it lacks story line

reviewText: A very well written book on the strategy of Pay Per Click.  Whatever profession you are in, if you are intending  to  popularize your area of niche or market your work/product, go and buy this book. In a very easy language, you will learn the online marketing tricks, how you can attract productive customers ,how  to convert a simple customer to a buyer through just advertising. Strongly recommended who are newbies in this area but have strong urge to know how the Giant companies Google, Yahoo  makes it a BIG on the Web world.
summary: A ladder of success with Clicks

reviewText: A good basic understanding of pay per click advertising,and how to do it.Very easy to follow,the author has explained the principles well.Good for someone just getting into online marketing.

I was a vegan for four months and found amazing results. The problem was that it didn't go align with my lifting as I was a bit unprepared. Thankfully, I'm more prepared now with this book. It helped me remember why I'm eating this diet, how to properly eat it, and provided great recipes that I can easily prepare. Highly recommended!

reviewerName: Jen @ A Book and a Latte
reviewText: What a beautiful, perfect ending to the Harp's Song duology! I loved being back with Harp and Connor, getting to know and understand Harp's mother more, and meeting the new characters. Harp's Voice pulled on my heart strings... made me laugh and tear up at times, but left me smiling in the end.
summary: A perfect ending that left me smiling!

reviewText: I loved reading this book by Jake Hargis. The author goes very deep into the topic. The book in fact provides all kind of aspect about gluten, talking about what is gluten, how to recognize if you're celiac, the basic of a gluten free diet, the lifestyle you should have; how your family can support you!Really recommended it!

this is the second book to angela's closure. once again i was sucked into the book and i could not put it down! so much suspense and drama! there is a bit of emotion that is very well writen and its a bit scary to think that these things can and do happen in real life! i cannot wait to see what is in store for us with her next book!

After reading Karma which I enjoyed very much,I thought I would try Kink. I couldn't get through half of the book. Paul appeared to be a jerk,while Emily was his puppet. This was suppose to be an erotic thriller,yet I found no story development. Perhaps a story was immient further into the book, but Paul's method of teaching Emily about Kink was repeatedly boring and gave me no encouragement to read further. This book was a thumbs down for me.:(

3.5 stars.I was given an ARC in exchange for my honest opinion.Second Chance Honeymoon is a fun summer novella, the heroine is Juliana Jones, JJ, is 27 year old and she never had a long term job and she was married for one day when she was very young. She is looking to have some fun during her cruise but as soon as she board the ship she realize that her friend Erica made a mistake and she booked her a room on a Second Honeymoon Cruise and she is surrounded with married couples over the age of 60!Our hero, Kane Phillips is the ship's fitness director and he meet JJ on her first day on the ship and there is an instant attraction between them.I did feel a strong chemistry between them and there were some very funny moments on the cruise ship especially with all Senior citizens that made me LOLI also enjoyed learning more about Kane's past and his brother and I just wish we could learn more about JJ and what made her the woman she is today.

Ally had me in stitches. Who would accidentally book a cruise for their friend with the wrong theme. At first I thought were can this go? A bunch of seniors with a young lady. Ally surprised me.JJ and Kane had perfect dynamics. It made sense for Kane to be hiding out on a cruise boat nursing his injury and just avoiding publicity. Any girl has had to deal with a mishap from their girlfriend.A couple of my a favorite scenes are when JJ finds out her next door neighbors, who keep her up all night are a older couple she is hanging out with and the bets they are placing on JJ and Kane even though it could cost Kane his job.

I loved the first two books in this series.  This one left little to be desired and doubt I will purchase the follow up to this one.  For one, there were numerous grammatical errors.  I'm not sure why and this is frustrating when buying books from the indie authors.  I'd get deterred every few pages to another error and it irritated me as I went along.Zara knows how to write a sex scene, but sometimes it get monotonous and there was a whole book of sex until the last 10 pages when it got interesting.  BUT, the plot isn't anything new or mind blowing. I was overall bummed as I anticipated this book for some time.

Well I didn't think this series could get any hotter but it did!! I loved High and Higher so I was excited to read Spiral!! I was blown away by this book!! It's now on my favorites shelf and is 5 stars all the way!! I was swooning for 2 days over this book and can't wait for the next! I love Zara Cox and this series!!. You can read this book as a stand alone as well!!**WARNING Definitely wear your Sham-Wow panties for this book!!
summary: Noah will turn your panties in to dust!!

reviewText: bust out the ice water and prepare for the cold showers!!!! NEXUS will set you blood on fire and ignite a desire like none other!!!!! a BBW mixed in with a Dom and Sub action. a page Turner that leaves you craving more. HOT is a mega understatement for this sizzling erotic romance. a must read and a have!!!!!

This was page turner from page one. Fast-paced, full of action and soooo hot. The chemistry between the main characters was amazing. Thank you Ms. Towers for writing a book not ending in a cliffhanger!!!!

This is a very typical pretty girl kidnapped for sexual trafficking story.  I wanted to like it more because it was well written, the plot lines were consistent (altho one young guy able to take out an entire high profile network in a single sweep was too fantastical), and the H and h were likeable.  It just failed to take a tonality stand - it's a dark subject, but it was handled so lightly that it felt like a high school version of the real world.  It was also extremely predictable, which lessened my enjoyment.

Gwen is the all American girl. a cheerleader, eighteen and still a virgin. She is taken as she walks home from her boyfriend's one night and thrown into hell. She is to be sold to the highest bidder. But  Lance happened the son of the man who was going to sell her. He was her knight in shining armour but she was his temptation and tried his patience at every turn,  They come together as she needs to be trained and he was going to train her. As she grows on him, Lance finds a way to keep her in his life . He goes as far as to mark her and take her virginity.  But will their love survive and get them out of the trouble that they are inThis isn't your bubbly summer fall in love read . It is gritty and dark. There are some scenes that will make you want to shout at the screen. The author sets up a good story line with complex characters and a darkness that jumps from the page .  She creates a good back story between Lance and his father , the boss. Which makes us understand Lance's motives on why he does what he does. To me Gwen was a little bit nave at the beginning, As the book went on she did get a backbone and became stronger as a person . The secondary characters are essential to the story . I truly like Becca , she was the friend that Gwen needed when she was trapped in the dungeon. They had a bond that wouldn't be broken, The guards were just evil and they showed it every time they were with the girls . There are enough men for everyone in this book . LOLThere is mystery and intrigue, the twists and turns in the book are just great. Who knew that they would do what they did at the end of the book. My only concern with the book is that there are so many books in the genre. They are all starting to sound the same. This book has a little extra that I hope and pray that is doesn't get lost in the shuffle. The author made the characters more real and that needs to be shown when people look it over. Terry has the ability to take you to a place that you didn't know you could go. So please don't let fact that there are a lot of books out there . Take a chance on this book , you might be pleasantly surprised
I enjoyed some this story however there are some MASSIVE editing flaws here, which make the story quite confusing in places.

Jill takes a vacation from Melbourne and heads to the Outback to visit her best friend Vicki.  Jill is essentially a part of the family.  Vicki’s brother, Michael has always seen it as his responsibility to protect and keep Jill safe.  He has had no problem putting her over his knee for a sound spanking when needed.  Through the years they both have developed feelings for each other.  However neither one of them expresses it to the other.  Jill and Michael relationship is full of miscommunication and misunderstandings.  Although I felt this story had great character development and a very in depth storyline I felt it was a little to detailed.  The descriptions and details took away from the flow of the book.  I found myself skipping paragraphs at a time just to get to the next part.  Overall a good story but very long and drawn out.
summary: ... Melbourne and heads to the Outback to visit her best friend Vicki

reviewText: I have read all of Liv Bennett's books and they are always full of suspense, hot  Alpha men, twists and turns, steamy love scenes and did I mention hot Alpha men. If you don't like reading these types of books then please don't read them and if you happen to read it please Don't leave a negative review if it's not your cup of tea. Those of us who like reading this Erotic Romance Genre really appreciate Liv's writing style.Liv takes us on a roller coaster ride with Lindsay, Zane, Mr. Ice(Ace) and if course Michael.  Lindsay has lots to deal with in her past and you so want her to find that special someone. She goes through lots of self discovery, pain, heart break and betrayal. She also finds herself in all the madness that's her life although it takes her to hit rock bottom she's strong and finally finds her happily ever after with her Mr. Right.  I loved this series so much because of all the suspense and twists and steamy sex scenes in the story, it is for Mature Audiences so be aware before you purchase.Keep them coming Liv, I've totally enjoyed Binding Love 1 & 2 and patiently waiting for Blinding Love 3!!
summary: Reading Liv's Books Always a Pleasure

reviewText: I think this was the best in the series so far. Julia kept you wondering who the Mentor was right up until the end. Then it was really a shock. I loved this book & can't wait until book 7 comes out!

I truly loved these stories. I was caught up from the get go. I couldn't put the book down. Each story flowed beautifully. Each writer was a breath of fresh air. I don't wanna give to much away. I highly recommend this book to be added to your collection. I know I'm excited to read it over and over again. I can't wait to see the next collection

I never knew that I actually needed Basic Methods of Viral Marketing to succeed at viral marketing! I have learnt how to develop effective ways to convey my message across to customers. I found it useful to use social media, individuals and sales people as a platform to convey messages to my customers!

This is one of the simplest diets I have ever come across. It is simple and easy to follow. Not to many restrictions. I now know that you do not have to restrict yourself to certain foods only in order to live an healthy life. Thanks for the book. It was amazing
summary: An amazing book that will educate you

reviewText: If you guys didn't already know, I like my alpha males a lot. And what can be better than one alpha male you may ask? Two alpha males getting down and dirty! With the amount of hotness, sexy-ness, perfection, alpha-ness and manhandling, Unequaled should be tagged with a "Danger, ovaries may explode" tag.I ABSOLUTELY LOVE ASHER AND RHYS! And if you follow me on twitter or goodreads, you might probably have seen me spazzing over the both of them. Asher and Rhys are perfection together. They fit so naturally together. They are strong enough for each other, strong enough to love the other the way they deserved to be loved, strong enough to bend the other to their will.Unequaled is hands down one of the best M/M romance I have read in ages. We get to see a whole load of panty-wetting sex for one. With two alpha males in a passionate, sizzling relationship, we get to see both of them topping and bottoming, loads of manhandling and dirty talking. Neither is truly the "man" in their relationship and it works. (One would expect more head butting with two strong confident males but nope.) Asher and Rhys are sooooo adorable together, I couldn't stop giggling. I would love to have a side story where perhaps, they get married and adopts a little girl. That would definitely make my year!Beside Asher and Rhys, we are also given a glimpse into Dane and Kerry's relationship and some very yummy, very dominant sex. Can't wait to read their story!My only complain was that I got slightly confused at certain scenes change but I got the ARC so that might have already been fixed in the final draft :D Overall, hot and dirty sex, loads of dirty talking, an overload of alpha-ness and a very lovable couple. Good story telling, pace and flow!

This book really helps with explaining how you can use natural products like lemons or oils we cook with to clean and remove things. This is a helpful book for everyone! You will learn how beneficial everything naturally you use to eat or even brush your teeth with, can actually be a safe and easy way to clean your counters and remove stains. This is great for families with pets and kids. Plus, this is great for you! No more toxic products that will easily be added to whatever is touching the surface, once its clean.I loved this book, easy to understand and like myself you will learn a whole lot of good and useful information.
summary: Full of Information for Going Green with Cleaning

reviewText: It was a little extreme for me. I thought it would be more about things that are good for storage and things that you should have in your cabinets and less about how to build a bunker. I am all about preparing for the unexpected but I am not to the stage of building a survival pantry.
summary: I thought it would be more about things that are good for storage and things that you should have in ...

reviewText: I always want to plant tomatoes. I mean I eat at least 2 tomatoes a day, so you could say I have a close relationship with them lol. However I know nothing about planting...until know. The book covers every detail, from the basics to the more complicated!

Garcia has the knowledge to help you succeed in Facebook marketing. This book shows you how to take action to get noticed on fb and make money. The main issue I had with this book was that it was way too short! I wanted more information, more knowledge to apply. It's not bad to want more is it???Bottom line is there is definitely knowledge to gain with this book. Read it and let the author know what you think.

I got this book on a Sunday and I basically had an entire day to make smoothies. I particularly like the berry and almond smoothies. The author does a great job of teaching how to prepare the ingredients and what goes well with these superfoods. I just wish there were more pictures as I’m more visual

Gives a good overview and explanation of the different super-foods. I like the flavor combinations and the use of avocados as a thickener to the smoothies. I'm enjoying the blueberry grape lassie right now.
As a working professional and graduate student, any information in how to improve my time management abilities is helpful.  This book delivered that and more.

The Blood Type Diet. This is a unique diet book as it looks at an area that most have not such as eating based on your blood type. It is a concept that makes sense and your blood type is something that never changes. This book goes through a man's journey as he discovers the types of food he can eat for his blood type. It is based off of a popular book called "Eat Right for your Blood Type" and it is actually a book I have on my shelf too. This man found his blood type, type O, and ate the foods that agreed with his blood type and amazing changes took place. An eye opener book and a unique way to look at gaining better health. In his case it started with his blood.

Kathyrn took a dive after she lost her husband and thought life was over and that she no longer needed to worry about how she ate, lived, or looked. Boy was she wrong. When her son returns home with a delightful surprise, Kathryn learns that life is not over just because she is older and the love of her life is gone. She decides it’s time to live again and slowly starts to take control of her life. She doesn’t diet so to speak, but she begins to eat healthier to nourish her body properly and later she incorporated exercise into her life. Exercises that was easy on the average adult over 50. She shares her story of what happened to get her to a low in life, what bought her back to reality and what she did to get healthy and live again.I recommend this book to anyone (male or female) over 50 who needs a little pick-me-up after the gloom of life has taken its toll on your life and body. This book will encourage you to take on life in a whole new way.
A short motivation for  weight loss with useful links. A few unique stories that inspire make this short book with the time.

Loved this book, because men are not easy to keep happy. This book is not just for men, it is for anyone. I think we should all unplug sometimes and just take a break. The advice in this book is great, everyone should follow them. This book will help anyone achieve some happiness. Sometimes people are their worst enemies on being happy. I highly recommend this book to both men and women to achieve the happiness they deserve!

4.5/5 starsI love a good down and dirty motorcycle club book, and again, Madeline Sheehan brings the dirty. Though not as sexually charged as the other three in the series, UnBeloved continues the story of the Hell's Horseman MC and tells the history between the love triangle between Jase, Dorothy, and Hawk. As they figure out how to move forward together — or not — more of the MC's story develops.If you've loved the other three UnDeniable series books, you'll want to catch up with the characters and all of their dirty relationships.

Holy effing F! I don't know how Madeline does it to me every time, but here I am crying over a bunch of bad ass bikers! Wow was this a gripping, sad, raw and gritty story! and the ending!!! OMG!!!! I can't wait for more HH!

All I can say is this book was totally worth the wait! I just do not know what to say my mind is a jumbled up mess. Unbeloved was perfect, I tried to read it slowly so it would last, but you can only hold back for so long and you just have to devour every single letter & syllable until you are finished, full to the brim and wanting more! Well done Madeline Sheehan(standing ovation)!

I love this series, this writer. I couldn't wait for this book to come out. But I felt I didn't get what we were told we were going to get. Which was Dorothy and Hawk's story. This whole book felt like a moment, a day in the life and what a grim day it was. Gone was the epic sweep of MS books past....the laughs, the crazy out of control-ness, the zany personalities....it was kitchen sink grim. And not a heck of a lot happened either. It was mostly a coming to terms moment for the main characters involved--D, Hawk and Jace. Each one of these characters had long moments of thought to themselves about the crossroads they were facing, the lessons they'd learned, the choices they needed to make. But it just didn't make for gripping, exciting, intriguing reading. And Jace's scenes weren't terribly interesting, I didn't care about him so much, not invested. I was greedy for Hawk and D!!! No such satisfaction, though.  We found out about Hawk's background, and then a choice he and Deuce made for the good of the club and......that was it. Really. Yep, we saw black hearted ZZ (sigh) and that story line continues on until we get to his book.My red hot disappointment lies in the fact that we don't get to see how it all began with Hawk and Dorothy. When that secret relationship was revealed in a previous book, it was a TOTAL mindblower, it was fantastic! I was dying from then to see how it got started...to live all that hot, secret intensity between these two. How he "forced" her, how she couldn't say no to him, how he was a good dad through it all, etc, etc...(Ach, don't get me started!) Did we get those scenes here, the book dedicated to these two wonderful characters?? Nope. I still can't believe it!  Instead we get recollections, thinking, more thinking, pondering, deciding, declaring...all rather passive and tedious after the beginning excitement wore off.Yes, it is MS so it is well written and emotional. But it's all thinking, pondering and deciding and a lot less wild and funky. And no, it's not because "they're older now." So what? I wanted to live Hawk and Dorothy like we've vibrantly lived the other couples' stories in all the previous books. But we don't get to. Why, Madeline?? The mood of this book was very subdued, serious, which made it different from the others. (Yes, the goodbye scene made me cry.) And, no, different is not a bad thing, but this story just wasn't a very interesting read.

I seriously love Madeline. She is just amazing. The third book to this series, Unattainable, is to this day the best MC book I have ever read. And I read A LOT. Although this author has never disappointed me, I was still a little unsure about Unbeloved. For the simple fact that I didn't want to read about a back and forth love triangle. But this wasn't the case at all. You know from the beginning who Dorothy really loves and wants, and never steers in another direction.  Also, this fourth installment wasn't as long as the first three, but for the story that had to be told, it was perfect. Can't wait to start reading about the next generation of Horsemen, along with Preachers story and even ZZ's. (Poor ZZ, the jerk!)

The Undeniable Series just keeps getting better and better. With each story the Madeline Sheehan writes it's like you can tell she puts everything she has of herself into her stories.UnBeloved is a story not of second chances, not even of third and fourth chances but a story of what it takes to truly come to terms with the consequences of our actions and learning to accept ourselves as a result of those actions. UnBeloved is about learning to let go of childish notions of love and realizing that REAL love is not like in the fairy tales. Forget the comics that state "love is never having to say sorry." In UnBeloved love is saying your sorry so many times that your voice is wrought with so much emotion you don't think the person your saying it to will understand you. Love is asking for forgiveness when you know that you absolutely don't deserve it but want it anyway, love is putting your ego aside and humbling yourself, not being afraid of what others may think because getting through to that other person, the person you can't stop thinking about the person who controls every waking thought you have; the person who has accepted you flaws and all deserves nothing more than to simply here the words I'm sorry.This is not the sugar coated love story of Dorothy, Jase and Hawk this is the story of forgiveness redemption and bitter truths and anyone wanting to read a story like this needs to get on the Madeline Sheehan train because you won't get anything less than amazing.

I don't know what else there is to say ... PHENOMENAL.  This book.  Everything about this book.  Fantastic.  It made me feel things I didn't know possible.  When that one thing happened with Dorothy ... And Hawk ... And then Jase ... And Cox ... And Deuce ... And EVERYONE!!!  PHENOMENALEven though this book didn't have the same *punch* as the others, it was beyond perfect.  Having lived in this world, lived this life .. it's AMAZING to see an author show the emotional side of this life than all the action packed goodness.  The path that Dorothy took to find her happily ever after was heartwarming and made me so happy ... and sad at the same time.I cried.  I laughed.  I smiled like a fool.  I was choked up.  I was shocked.  EVERYTHING.  I was ... EVERYTHING.Madeline Sheehan... thank you for showing a softer side and bringing REAL characters to life.  I'll be forever grateful for this novel and I'm debating going to sleep dreaming of all things Horsemen or starting to read it over again.You are amazing.  Your books are amazing.  Your characters are amazing.  EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!!!Anything less than 5 stars is a crime!
Again.....another great read. I have enjoyed every book thus far, and cannot wait for the next installment. I have yet to read a bad book in this installment and for that I thank you!

Ho-lee.Mother.of.All.LOVE.STORIES.Yes, this book is just that. Wrapped up in an MC house giving it that Madeline Sheehan flair we all have grown to love. I'm not going to lie, I started this book shaking in my boots. Let's be honest, after UnAttainable we have trust issues with these characters. ALOT went down and we knew ALOT lies ahead.This is a love triangle.Yes.It's a 20 year span love triangle.Different? YES.So we have Dorothy. The sweet "mother" figure of the MC house. She has been Jase's secret for years. She starts an affair with Hawk. Jase doesn't know. She ends up pregnant. From reading UA, we know Jase's wife shoots Dorothy and leaves her with no memory. Flash forward 7 years. Now, recovered and moved away Dorothy has a new life that doesn't involve the club. Jase is still involved with their son but that's the only connection Dorothy has now. This story progresses with an accident that forces her to go back. Forces her to face her demons. Forces her to face her past.Throughout this story, we get some past information that we hadn't learned, along with ALOT of new. Dorothy is once again faced with Jase and Hawk and even after all the years apart, the connection remains. This story takes us to a new level within the club. A deep hearted level I've only ever felt in UnBeautifully. Madeline's writing is flawless. There were so many moments that brought tears to my eyes. She summed up the definition of love so eloquently I have to share this quote. It gave me goosies from head to toe and I had to go back and reread it no less that 5 times in a row."There was only one who could steal your soul, that untouchable, unreachable place inside you that existed only in your mind, that warmed and cooled, fluttered and shook without rhyme or reason, and make it theirs forever. Someone who could take your breath away with just one look, who makes all those past secret smiles and glances afar pale in comparison to the way he looks at you."Deep right?So, where is ZZ? Who will Dorothy choose? What about Tegen and Cage? Kami and Cox? And of course, what about Deuce and Eva. Yes, you get all those answers throughout..To give this book a 5 star is just an insult. What are stars anyway? I give this book the title of BEST BOOK OF 2014.You feel me?PS. I could live inside this book. I'll be Ripper's ol' lady. I'll be his seat warmer, just don't ever make me leave.

I received this book from the author, Violetta Rand, and from Paranormal Romance and Authors That Rock.  Blind Redemption is the third book in Blind Series but this book can be read as a standalone book as well.  This book is based during the eleventh century about Vikings.  This book starts off with Aaron making a very radical change to his life.  The book then switches between following Aaron on his adventures and Kara, who you learn about later on in the book.  Then of course their paths cross and sparks fly.  The rest you need to read for yourself, as I don’t want to have any spoilers.This book was great.  The characters are very approachable and draw the reader in. There is no confusion when switching from one character to another as with some books and the story flows very nicely.  There were surprises that kept me reading.  This is a book I would read again!I’m giving this book 4 fangs.

As a proponent of continual  self-improvement, I really do believe in the Law of Attraction. It just works. You become and attract what you think and believe. As such,  I try and read anything I can on the Law of Attraction. That’s why I got this book.The author does a good job in the first chapter talking about Quantum Physics and how it relates to the Law of Attraction. This one excerpt pretty well sums it all up, “By visualizing what you truly want in life, then putting forth your positive energy to get it, you truly can manifest your destiny— drawing and attracting the wealth, love, and/ or happiness you desire.”There are many examples of famous people we all know outlined in this book. The one commonality of their success is they all use The Law to bring success to them. They all attribute The Law as the “secret” to their accomplishments and are very open about it.The second chapter begins with a discussion of Positive Thinking as it relates to The Law and how to “clean” your mind to make The Law work for you. It’s a step you simply cannot skip. Next it moves into manifesting abundant wealth and attracting friends and romance as well as how to lay out a plan to do just that. You can’t simply “want” it, you must visualize and truly believe in the abundance in order to attract it.The final chapter lays out “easy” exercises you can practice to help you get started manifesting whatever it is you desire more of in your life. It does take considerable effort to make The Law work for you simple because most of us have to re-train our brain around this concept and rid ourselves of negativity and improper thought – easier said than done.In conclusion, if you have a desire to change your life for the positive or even have a desire to learn about the Law of Attraction I would highly recommend this book.
summary: Using the Law of Attraction to build the life you want!

reviewText: Knitting for experts book is a great guide to advanced knitting skills improvement and upgraded stitch ideas.  This book has a thorough presentation of higher levels of knitting patterns and has clearly discussed each type of advance knitting idea that possibly exists.  Alongside with the guidelines, there are colorful photos and images that will surely help the reader to internalize the pattern and the totality of the end result thereafter.  Moreover, it has incredible tips to importantly take note of in creating the best knitted product one desires to achieve.
summary: Getting the best advance knitting skills!

reviewText: Rhythm of my heart ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️I was gifted a copy of Rhythm of my heart for an honest review.This story really does pull at your heart strings, Grace is a very beautiful, daughter, sister and Auntie. Her life totally revolves around her family. She helps to run a family business as well as looking after her niece Ruby for her brother Charlie. My heart was full from the moment I met them all, but then there is an accident and in walks Dr Cole Tierney. Swoon! Grace guards her heart and finally takes a chance on Dr Cole. The meeting between their two best friends is probably one of my favourite scenes, they are funny and I can't wait to learn more about them as the series continues. There are many people in this novel with fantastic personalities some you love and some you hate. The cliffhanger almost caused palpitations but there is more to come. I absolutely loved this book and congratulate Velvet Reed on her debut novel and wish her all best with this series and other stories she writes in the future. Victoria DeBono⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Cheryl Holt’s novel, Wonderful does not live up to its name.  This novel is frustrating due to a self-absorbed whiny hero.Evangeline Etherton is a bright bubbly woman who was orphaned and taken in by a director of a girl’s school. Her headmistress left her a dowry in her will and betrothed her to a sour vicar.Evangeline travels to meet the vicar and his horrible mother.  The vicar ensconces her in his cousin Aaron’s country home.  Evangeline loves the house but is dismayed to discover that Aaron and his friend and his friend’s mistress are also residing in the home.Aaron is the heir to an Earldom and he is betrothed to a demanding woman.  He does not particularly like her but he just does not have the energy to refuse the suit his father has made for him, he hates arguments. However he has no trouble trying to break down Evangeline’s will.  He finds her attractive and wants to start an affair.Poor Evangeline, she has serious doubts about the vicar but no other options, or does she?  She likes Aaron immensely but he seems to only want a brief liaison.  She cannot see how very dishonorable and self-centered Aaron is.  Evangeline is not a bad character.  Her biggest flaw is she lacks discernment.Aaron practically has no backbone.  He allows stronger personalities to make the most important decisions for him.  He does not know the meaning of loyalty and he certainly does not treat the heroine in a thoughtful manner.  I could not respect the hero and I wondered how the heroine ever could.
summary: Hero does not act like one

reviewText: I read all three books of the Cheryl Holt Reluctant Brides Series and I have to say this book was a good end to the trilogy. Aaron and Evangeline story had all the elements of a good story.  A reluctant groom, a reluctant bride, a few conniving females, a selfish relative and a little seedy dark side of London was tossed in.  But love prevailed.There was a similar repeat in this story as in CH's other book, Love's Promise, the same storyline when it came to the fathers.  There were a few unanswered questions in this book that ticked me off.  First, did Miss. Peabody really want to punish Evangeline by this marriage to the vicar and why?  Second, did the Earl marry Priscilla or on the flipside, her mother?  Who is Thumberton and or the benefactor to the siblings?All in all, I enjoyed the story/trilogy.  I recommend you read the trilogy set in the order written, to understand the other characters better.
Good story line and it keep me reading late.  Loved seeing the stuffy Vicar and Sister put out.  The reunion with her brother was also good.

I really enjoyed this book full of drama and suspense. It had me thinking hard who was he actually cheating on her with but when revealed its a shocker, I was like whoa great page turner and must read. I really hope Tiffany lives a life full of happiness now.

I'm always looking for all-natural ways to be healthy and author, Julia Cussler, does a fantastic job of explaining what cholesterol is and how to keep it at healthy levels. The information is easy to understand (not too much jargon) and the juice recipes are delicious, using easy-to-find ingredients. Great book!

What a great book! I look inside too many juicing and smoothie books and just see the recipes. However Julia Cussler has really educated me! I knew about good and bad cholesterol, but not enough to be able to talk about it. Now I know enough to hold an intelligent conversation. But that's not the real bonus of the book. After explaining all about cholesterol and statins (drugs to reduce it), Julia then educates us on the benefits of certain fruits and vegetables in the fight against cholesterol. Only then does she give you recipes for lots of juices and smoothies that will help you. She talks about the benefits of each juice/smoothie and the possible problems with over doing certain ingredients. I've noticed coconut water in the supermarket, but now I'll go and buy some. A real education! Awesome book.
summary: A Great Lesson on Cholesterol and Juicing

reviewText: I have a very good friend that I have known 20 plus years. In all the time I have known him I have watched him battle with his diabetes. I have also noticed in what seems like an upward trend of the amount of people today that are diagnosed with diabetes. Along with that we are a society that has relied on fast foods and unhealthy foods for far to long and this I feel has contributed to the rise in obesity as well as the rise in people being diagnosed with diabetes.Not only was this a very inspirational story, it was very informative. The author not only includes diabetes facts, some I did not know; but also included are the nutritional elements that were recommended by the nutritionist. I never knew you could actually reverse diabetes. I will definitely be sharing this book with my friend in the hopes that he to can do the same thing. I hope anyone that has diabetes or anyone that needs to lose weight will read this book.

What a great book about a chef who was asked to be a contender for a TV weight loss cooking show.  If he could create delicious meals and loss weight in the six month challenge, the station would pick up his own TV show.  This book has 45 recipes that don't even sound like "diet" meals, just delicious and healthy meals. I can't wait to try some of the chicken and soup recipes.  He also has many delicious dessert recipes. The chef met the challenge and his meals were featured in his restaurant. A great book that I recommend to anyone to read, whether on a diet or not.

reviewerName: Dr. Johnson C. Philip "Author of over 100 boo...
reviewText: We live in a generation flooded with disruptive technologies. A good number of people do not have any idea of how to use them in a manner that can be called beneficial and useful. This is unfortunate because these technologies can help one to bridge a great gap that has been creeping world wide due to increased mobility.The ease of travel and settling in new places has created very high rates of mobility. This means that members of one's family and one's friends are no longer a stone's throw away. This also means that not it is more difficult to maintain regular communication and relations. This is where disruptive technologies come up with their ease of communication -- provided one knows who to do it.The author has explained the above things analytically and insightfully. In fact I was surprised to read how we tend to ignore the power of these technologies to maintain long-distance relationships.*** Very highly recommended

Excellent Read! I know it's mainly just a manual but I found it helpful and surprisingly inspiring. I know I can watch my carbohydrates. I just need to follow the plan in the book. It's sort of like the paleo diet. I look forward to reading more by this author on weight loss.

This book is a day-to-day diet plan. The wonderful thing about this is it's a real helpful guide; with a little discipline from the reader, you'll definitely get a thinner body. What I loved about this book was it didn't feel like the book was condemning you or banning you from the food you love. It's a conversational book that let's you eat some of the food you like, just only be sure you control or discipline yourself when faced with food you love. Everybody should try the book's daily diet plan!

4 STARS!I'm a huge fan of Kathryn Perez, I didn't know what to expect.  Kathryn left her comfort zone and delivered a SEXY STORY, that has me salivating for the next!!!! I need the next book right this second.

Since this was a short book and just a beginning. My review will be short and sweet, well maybe not short. Haha. This is a juicy, hot as hell, sexy and emotional read. Perez does a wonderful job weaving in alot of heart into the book and despite the description and title this book is not just all sex. Its about starting over, second chances and taking risks in order to find happiness.My heart broke for Candace in the beginning and then I found myself in admiration of her. I loved that she was willing to take the leap with Brisban into this new sexy side of her life. Now Brisban, holy toledo does this man have a way with words. Brisban ooozes sex appeal, what a smoking creation by Perez, he is what fantasies are about lol.The ending will leave you pissed and hurt not at the author but at a the situation. I felt every bit of anger and pain that Candace felt and I literally wanted to punch him in the face.I can't wait for the next installment to this story to see where things will lead. Well done Perez!
Well, I really liked this book. Too short for me tho, didn't like the cliffhanger, seriously! I can't wait for the next book, what she will do? who she will choose? I can't take this for too long.

I am a fan of Kathyrn Perez's writing and was very excited to read this book. As always, I was drawn to the characters and felt a connection to Candace. I felt her pain and wanted her to get back into "her game". Once introduced to Brisban, wow, he's sizzling and there is something mysterious about him. When I got to the end, I was screaming in my head, NOOOOOO!!! To me, that's always a sign of a great story. Try it, I know you will enjoy it. P.S. Brisban is a very sexy name! :)

Organic Square Foot Gardening is a wonderful guide to helping you start your very own garden. I have always wanted to have a garden but I don't have much yard to speak of. This book has made my dream of having a garden possible. Now I know how to utilize my space for maximum benefit. Thanks Jessica Davis

This book is a good starting point for anybody interested in organic gardening, but lacking the space traditionally required to make it happen. Square foot gardening is all about using limited space efficiently, and this book details various methods and techniques to harvest good yields within limited spaces. Great for anybody with a passion for gardening who might otherwise have not thought it was possible to grow an organic garden without having access to a lot of land.
summary: A great introduction into the practice of square foot gardening

reviewText: Wow!  This book was a worthy sequel to Warchild: pawn.  I stayed awake last night reading and finished it, just now. I can barely wait for the next episode.  Ernie Lindsey is a good author who brings his characters to life, and pulls the reader into that world. There are questions that need answered in book three.  Hurry with book three!
summary: Wow! I felt like I was there!

reviewText: This book opened my eyes to the potential of oil pulling as being a lifestyle change in addition to its health benefits. I had no idea the process can take up to 20 minutes but the author had some excellent suggestions on what to do during that time in order to improve the quality of your life and well-being. I don't think you will find a more comprehensive guide on the oil pulling process. It gave me everything I needed to know for getting started and choosing what type of oil I would use.
One of the reason why I decided to include oil as part of my health products list.  Can't wait to share this book to my friends and relatives who are facing health issues.
summary: COMPLETE PACKAGE WHEN IT COMES TO HEALTH BENEFITS

reviewText: A well written book  for beginners, I have purchased a few oil pulling guides for beginners before but to say the least they were not ideal for beginners, they were far to complicated but this book was easy to understand and I cannot wait to get started, 5 stars from me
humorous and sad.  I loved how April wrote in the last chapter how the future holds for them.  I have read few other books she wrote, and liked her humorous style to domestic discipline.
Very good. I really enjoyed the story. Characters were interesting and intense. Book moved quickly kept me reading. Few typos mistakes.

And then there were 6.  This is a continuation of the first book Seven Sons.  Sammie continues exacting her revenge on Dornan and his sons.  She was raped at 15 by Dornan and his sons.  Dornan killed her father.  Her mother gave her up for a fix.  Lili lets you feel through this story of what happens with Sammie as she exacts her revenge.  This book is dark.  There is rape lots of sex and murder in it. If you don't like reading dark books with a lot of sex in it don't read this.  This series is very good.  I am starting the next book in this series immediately.
Great!....another home run Tiana. Loved it. I have loved all the Saint series, but this one is probably one of my favorites.
I hate when women are stupid no matter how supposedly intelligent they're supposed to be.

This book was so good! I thought it sounded like it would be, and after reading the glowing reviews, and a .99 price tag- I clicked my 'Buy' button. I am soooo glad I did. It has a bad boy, a good girl, female trafficking, hired guns, slime balls and more! Lets not forget the perfect amount of hawt scenes.I loved every minute of it! I cried - twice!! Don't worry- I won't give you any spoilers but.....,,,, there is a happy-sorta-ending. I am praying for a sequel!!!!
summary: such a great book!!! not your typical read...

reviewText: This is the story of Flick(h) and Rushe(H).  Flick is in a cab, on her way to a date, when the cab breaks down in a bad and secluded neighborhood.  The battery is dead on her cell phone so she decides to stop in a bar to use their phone.  She is warned before she enters the bar, by an unseen man, that she should walk away and NOT enter the bar.  She refuses to listen. This being the first of many future instructions given by Rushe that Flick will ignore. Flick enters the bar and immediately realizes her mistake.  The men in the bar are having a meeting. They are not good men.  She is not welcome.  Four of the men capture and whisk her off to a secluded cabin.  One of her captives is Rushe. What follows is a non stop page turning dark gritty read.  There is a lot of sex, and yes it was good.  Both Flick and Rushe were likable characters.  Rushe is a very Alpha male.  Flick is a strong but vulnerable woman.  She has never felt appreciated or cared for.  These two together made a great couple.  If you are a fan of dark erotic reads, this book will be right up your alley.  This book is well written with non stop action and emotion.  So, why the 4 star rating and not a 5 star rating?  Two reasons.  One, I actually thought there was too much sex, although it was well written and very good.  Two, I thought Flick fell for Rushe too quickly.  Regardless, I still enjoyed this book and look forward to future work by this author.  I hope she does more dark erotica because I find good dark erotica hard to find.  This author managed to do it without entering the dreaded corny arena that other authors of this genre seem to slip into.  Yes, I would most definitely recommend.
I am glad that Justin took responsibility for his actions. I wished the story would have ended with him out of prison though. I still love this series.

3.5 to 4 StarsGiven to me to review for Summer's Book Blog for an honest review.When I first got this book it didn’t have any reviews to go off of.  I gave it the benefit of the doubt and took a chance.  The title intrigued me enough to read it.  This is the first book I’ve read by Stephanie Witter.  I will be totally honest.  I had some mixed reviews on this one.  I liked the storyline and where it could have gone but I found it jumping around some.  I couldn’t follow it sometimes.London Reed is in her second year at UCLA and is in need of a new place to stay.  She doesn’t want to go back to living with her parents.  She came to her last apartment for the day in her search and it was 2B. When she gets to the door she finds a tear stained faced girl and a guy who liked like he didn’t care standing there.  It turns out this cocky guy owned the apartment.  That didn’t stop London.  This is where she wanted to live.  She may get herself into trouble but nothing was going to stop her.London doesn’t let anyone get to her and she will tell you exactly how she sees it.  She is a girl with no filter.  She finds it hard to let any guy get close to her heart.  There is something about Byron that she can’t help but to fight.Byron Davis is a student at UCLA looking for a roommate but he doesn’t want a girl.  Against his better judgment he gave London a two month trial period.  He was a playboy who could have any women he wanted.  He had a different girl in his bed all the time.  All he wanted was a one night stand and then he would kick them out in the morning…until London.  She had this draw to her that made him feel again.  He was a solider that had some terrible things happen to him while he was deployed.  It hurt him deeply and his walls went up afterwards.  He didn’t let people get close to him and he was a changed man after that.  London, without even knowing started to bring the old Byron out again.  He did have one rule.  Don’t ask him about his time in the Army.He often found himself jealous of London and her ex-boyfriend Ryan.  He often thought she was going to get back together with him.  So in return he set out to hurt her.  The end result was they both ended up hurting each other.  Finally he let himself open up to her and laid it all out on the line and expressed his true feelings.  London being London left him hanging.I often didn’t understand their actions towards one another.  I felt like I was shaking my head a lot and thinking “Do people really act like this”.  I then it hit me and yes they do.  I guess I’ve been out of the dating scene for way too long.“You almost gave me an orgasm with your mouth.”  -London, this is one of the many things she would say to Byron that left him speechless.  She had plenty of things to say that would leave you saying “Did she really just say that?”These two aren’t finished yet.  You will get to see them some more of the Roomies Series.

2.5 starsThis was a quick read with a really interesting plot line. The story had a lot of potential but I found it extremely frustrating.Byron was promiscuous, to say the least. Even after deciding that he liked London, he constantly had females in his bedroom. But he didn't think it was okay for London to have any guys around. He was such a hypocritical tool! And he was always saying to London, "You didn't just say that," after she would say something that he deemed guy-like. Yes, she did! I think it was so frustrating because what she was saying wasn't that uncommon for women to say. I hear girls talk like that all the time.London bugged me for a whole other set of reasons. A) She didn't want to be "that girl" so she didn't say anything about Byron hooking up with other girls even after there were very strong indications of mutual interest between her and Byron, if you know what I mean. She should prefer being "that girl" to the one that lets some guy disrespect her. B) She constantly assumed she knew what Byron was thinking, so she kept making idiotic decisions. C) Every time she hooked up with a guy, it was to make Byron jealous. Grow up! (I know, she's only 19, but that's just so petty and unsatisfying. What's the point of hooking up if you're not even enjoying yourself?!)I felt London's weight was addressed too much. Even when she was relaxing with her best friend, she was described as crossing her chubby arms over her chest. Usually when weight is addressed this much in a book, it's eventually discussed in a positive light later on, but that didn't happen here (at least that I can remember).I would have also liked to get the rest of the story behind the Ryan situation. London discussed in it a very vague way that left me wondering what exactly he did to her.I think this book could benefit from an editor. Spelling and grammar weren't horrible here, but there were several times where words were obviously misused (not misspelled). It was very distracting for me. I would literally stop and debate with myself about whether or not things were spelled wrong or whether the author deliberately used that word (e.g., bare feet paddled across the floor instead of padded). I know a lot of people can ignore that sort of thing but I got caught up on it.Like I said, I liked the story line and I'm not opposed to reading more of Stephanie Witter's work. I'll just probably stick to things with a little less tension because I wanted to shake these characters sometimes..
Good to have around for any number of ailments from feeling sad to needing energy; from sleep problems to bruises and scrapes. There's even a home care section.
summary: Handy Guide to Getting Relief Using Essential Oils

reviewText: The beautiful cover art first draws you in, then you are carried into the world of Cathren and Donovan.Donovan initially appears to be a bit of a feeble character - in matters of the heart at least - but soon makes up for this with witty one liners, and brave (or maybe foolhardy) deeds. He endears himself to the reader quite rapidly, providing many laugh out loud (or squirm and look away) moments!Cathren, seems to be a bit of a radical - but we soon find out why. She initially appears and disappears rather frequently, much to Donovan’s consternation. Their attachment soon becomes apparent as they face down the bad guys - human and zombie - as a team.There is far more to this story than first meets the eye. There is evil megalomania, sidekicks, good guys and ordinary folk. There's a love story you'd never dream of, a reluctant hero, and a host of bit part players dispatched in a host of horrifying ways - and yet there is a comedic edge to the writing. The plot moves along at a rollicking pace which you never want to end.If you've read 'I Zombie' by Hugh Howie, then you'll enjoy the descriptions in this book too, and the way Carl Plumer makes his zombies into more than a mass stereotype. If there were a genre called ‘witty romantic zombie horror’, then this would fit into it well. Many scenes will have you on the edge of your seat... ‘how on earth will they get out of this?’I was pulled along by the plot, and could visualise the scenes as easily as watching 'The walking Dead' on TV. I could almost see, smell, hear and feel what they were going through.I loved the short chapters - though this is quite a long book. I enjoy the feeling of... 'I'll just read one more chapter, then another' and was immersed until the early hours of the morning, on more than one occasion. You are left with a gripping, then satisfying, ending. I sincerely hope there will be a sequel.
summary: An Entertaining Adventure and Romance Enclosed Within a Zombie Apocalypse

reviewText: This'll be short and sweet...Kade is one of those authors I follow and read regularly. And while I'm not a fan of shorter stories, Keep Swimming is a winner. in fact, I had to pause a few times to wipe my eyes.Kade is great with character development, and Gus -- the little kid -- completely stole the spotlight in this story. I'm hyped to read the next book in the series.I wave at you from the south sound area, Kade, and congratulate you on another job well done.

The character development and romance are better than the average tale, but would have been better if an editor had been utilized. There are a few glaring grammar mistakes and the story line needs some fine  adjustment in places.

I have read a few articles on the health benefits of using coconut oil for cooking but never thought of it for other things like for your skin or hair to promote good health, help to prevent some illnesses and even weight loss. There is a recipe to make your own coconut oil and it is so easy. The book is well written and laid out. It starts with a history of coconut oil, the health benefits and how we can use it to loose weight, help the body repair and much more. There is also lots of creative recipes that look very delicious. Each recipe has a picture and the instructions are clear and easy to follow. I can't wait to make the chili coconut crusted shrimp. Highly recommended book.
Thanks to the author for putting this book together. Very helpful information clearly presented. Some excellent ideas for those interested in preventive health care.

This is a well written book on a new approach to psychology.  It is an easy read and the sections are divided nicely so anyone without a psychology background will easily understand the content.  I particularly like the section on Mindfulness.  Sometimes we forget the benefits of meditation on mental health.
summary: A great new approach in Psychology

reviewText: Chrysoprase is the second novel in the Chalcedony Chronicles, a time travel saga that blends created time travel mythology with ancient history.  This book was definitely my favorite of the two written thus far.The mythology is much more developed in this book with much more significance given to it.  There are a lot of twists and turns and unexpected moments in this book that truly change the course of the book.  There are characters from the first book that play much more important roles now, while others move to the background a little bit.We learn a lot more about the past and the brothers' connections to it, as well as some surprising information about Mari's world, too.  In the end, she finds help in the last place she ever thought she would, although whether or not the help is true is a question that we just don't have an answer to!The one thing that truly bothers me with this book, however, still has to do with emphasis paid to certain parts of the plot.  There is a whole lot of action on Mari's part without a lot of respect to the well-known fact that messing with the events of the past significantly affect the future.  There doesn't seem to be a whole lot of attention paid to that concept by Mari and her friends.  Nor do they seem to spend much time trying to understand what the goddess needs them to do, instead focusing on their own needs.  This is something that directly flies in the face of the goddess' issues with children of time.  It will be interesting to see how this plays out.Things to love...--The blend of created mythology and ancient history.--The stronger emphasis placed on the sci-fi/time travel.Things I wanted more/less of...--More understanding of what it is that they are supposed to be doing with the time travel.My Recommendation:  The story line of the overall series is much more developed in this book and I think the story will continue to grow!

I was not impressed with this series. I was really looking forward to it after the Samantha Smith books, I loved the storyline.  This one started out great but I couldn't understand why I had read through half way of the second book and the main characters never hooked up, not even once!  They hooked up with other people but not with each other - why? These books lacked the steamy love scenes the Samantha Smith books had in abundance! Still love the author though!  Looking forward to the continuation of other character stories.
Devon does it again!  GREAT story with tons of laughs, sizzling chemistry  & a little heartache!!!  Can't wait to see how the story continues...Victory: TRUE!!!
summary: GREAT story with tons of laughs

reviewText: I really loved this book and happy to find out the story isn't ending yet! This series has it all love, sex and rock & roll! It really is a must read!

Even if you already add you first kiss, this is a good reminder for anyone who is celebate or seeing someone but not at the kissing stage yet. I would not suggest buying for young teen because it talks about sexuality but then again it all depends on how your teens are. This book is a easy read without any extra explication and a matter to the fact time of thing.

The Rizzo Protocol is book 2 of the Dragonflies Series.  Once again, the character of Duncan Peters is integral to the story but the main focus of this book is Karen Simpson, aka “Rizzo”.  Rizzo is thrust into take Duncan’s place at Blackcard.  She must actually act like an adult; especially when it comes to NOT sleeping with the employees.  Duncan orders that Rizzo must have a driver/security with her at all times to which Fergal or “Sharky” is assigned.  Rizzo and Sharky have a history; we follow their hot and cold relationship throughout this book.  There are surprises, suspense, and of course those steamy moments.  Rizzo’s character is fabulous and well-written.
This book is loaded with priceless information, great ideas and simple plans for anyone to follow. Covers a broad range of topics and will be a great reference book in a disaster.
summary: Good basic introduction to Long term survival

reviewText: I assume this was called a VIP Room book because King owned the club.  You do get some insight on King, but honestly, this book should be called Evie (The Last Riders).  I always liked Evie in the Last Riders series and I was pleasantly surprised that she got her own story.  I love her attitude.  She's sweet and sexy and strong and she doesn't take crap from anyone.  I like that you get to see her as a person and not just a sex object.  You find out her background and how she came to be with the Last Riders and what makes her so loyal to them.  Plus, you get more of Shade in this book and that can only be a good thing!

I have followed this series since the very first Spearwood Academy Novel Episode 1. The short Novellas are very addictive always leaving you wanting more, which is why it is so good that there is a relatively short time between each publishing.  Spearwood Academy Episodes 9 & 10 are no different, once you have a taste you cannot help but devour it in one sitting!In the last Novel Roseman had gotten into Avalon's mind and replaced her memories, leaving her to believe that he was her father, her childhood was completely different and that she was indeed engaged to be happily married to the Royal who in reality she cannot stand; Paden.  When he lets her go he tells her that her friends will be acting strange for awhile but that they will soon be "back to normal" by the next day.When she wakes up and sees the boys, Avalon is astounded by just how weird the boys are acting around her. None of them understand why she is acting so strange; her choice of clothing is different, the way she is bothered  about her appearance and even references to a Mother (whom she never knew as she abandoned her at birth) who would go mad if she could see her looking so messed up, she has to look pretty for Paden. at this the Boy's know instantly something is very wrong but Avalon just brushes off their concern for her to visit Dr. Quinn (Spearwood Academy DR), she remains insistent that they need to hurry in order to meet up with Paden for breakfast.Paden is shocked to see Avalon arrive for dinner with the boys in tow, especially with the way she is acting towards him, and although it is his greatest wish to have Avalon in his arms, be agreeable to be his wife, does he really want her this way, with no mind of who she truly is? In an unlikely turn of events, Paden decides that certain things are worth more than his social standing - Avalon.  Restoring Avalon's memories is of more importance to him as even though he wishes she would love him, he wants her true love not her false memory induced love.Dante, Amr, Horace, Lusk, Lennox,Bullock, Maerick and Paden all work together in an attempt to rescue Avalon from the mind manipulation that Roseman has put her through - Things are never easy and as the boys find out, that even working together things can be exceptionally dangerous and the game has just gotten deadly...........Deep inside her mind Avalon is barely hanging on by a thread all she knows is that she can hear her own voice making comments to herself , but comments she feels like she wouldn't normally make.... Can the Boys save Avalon before she is gone forever?An amazing edition to the Saga that has again left me wanting more! Again the novel, just like the other previous episodes, 9 & 10 are no different, they are too short; just as you are really getting into it and are full to the brill of excitement and anticipation is suddenly cut short - Cliffhanger Overload!! But yet these novels are SO Intoxicatingly addictive that you know you will have to read Episode 11!! I can't wait!!!

This book was awesome. I really enjoyed. I finished it in one setting. I could not put it down. I had been a book funk for a couple of weeks and was very happy to come across this book. I cannot wait until the next book in the series. Hopefully it will be soon!

I loved this book. A little racy, mixed into a love story, topped of with the blunt, edgy lifestyle of the mafia makes for a fantastic read. I fell for Nero's dominance and loved Elle's strength. My only question is when does book two come out??

I don't write many reviews but felt this book deserved one. I stumbled across this book and decided to give it a chance and I'm so glad I did. At first I wasn't sure I was gonna like it and I almost quit reading it after the first couple chapters but once the book picked up with Nero and his friends wow I quickly realized why the book was rated five stars and I'm so glad I didn't put it to the side and gave it a chance. Now I'm desperately trying to find something comparable and I'm coming up empty handed lol. I've already passed the word to family and friends and now some of them are reading it. I'm looking forward to more books from this series and this author in hopefully the near future. Great job Sarah Brianne!
The book brings you in and makes you relate to the characters before the sex even begins. Loved and recommend it.

I had read a review saying it was this could be the love child of Fallen Crest High Series and Eagle Elite Series and I agree.I can only imagine how great the rest of this series is going to be. All of the Caruso siblings, even dad, are so complex, so scary but so likable.  This is one of those books that the author has made so many interesting supporting characters that you just want more and more and more.When do me get book 2, Sarah ?
summary: That book was MADE to be read!

reviewText: oh my goodness,this was a great read i loved Nero so much he was so sexy and tough and ALPHA MAN he was umm umm ummm go read you will enjoy it seems like these are not teenagers untill they are in school but i do not want the book to end i have not finished it yet

I loved this book. I have no clue why, it's a mix of everything. There was so much drama and even funny moments. I was afraid it would be a bit immature because the characters are in high school, but I was pleasantly surprised that I couldn't put it down.I hate bullying. I think it's terrible. It's sad to think that some of the things that happened in this book have probably actually happened in reality.I absolutely loved Elle. She is a bad*ss. Absolutely, on of the best females ever. All she cared about was protecting her friend. She went without so much and dealt with so much and still continued to be nice. I like that when people picked on her she just kind of looked at them. I hate that she didn't stick up for herself, but at the same time it was almost better not saying anything.Nero.. you kind of want to punch him then swoon all over him. He's scary and very alpha. Of course you kind of hate him for the things he does, but you love him for doing some of those same things. I'm not sure how I feel about how Nero acted towards the end. I guess it's the alpha part. It kind of irritated me. His friends were awesome. I'm really hoping the other books are about them.Usually books like this don't really entertain me, but this is a book I could probably read repeatedly and not get bored

Loved the story line. I really hope the author will continue with the series there is so much more to learn. Also unlike other recent books of other popular authors this book was a full length. Great job! Please keep writing

Prince Jorem returns to claim his destiny. Magic, dragons and sorcerers are only a few of the challenges he has to overcome to find his place in the world. A satisfying conclusion to a great trilogy.  Rick
summary: Great conclusion to a great epic!

reviewText: I was gifted a copy by one of the authors and I've made it through most of the books.  The following reviews are of those I've read and of course they were all fabulous!Mr. Black: Strangers yet familiar these two are hotter than hot. Talia and Sebastian have met before, 8 years ago on a horrific night. She has dreamed about him all this time. They meet again, only it's during a masquerade party with costumes and a mission. Her past keeps coming back but this time she might get closure. There is so much mystery about him and she keeps their secret to herself. As a serial this has a cliffhanger, not to worry, it's in the perfect spot. Gifted this book by the author for review, anxious for the next.Unbreakable Seal: As part of Madden' s series, the Lost and Found series, we have the introduction to Max. He's damaged from his last mission and traumatized by hallucinations along with being wrongly medicated. A chance encounter with Lacey, a former Walter Reed nurse, and she's saving him. Recognizing his strengths and needs she guides him to the right help. These two connect quickly and passionately. Look for more of Max in the next novels.Stone Hard Seal: Sex on an island is more like it. Stone's mission is to save hostages from pirates. One is a Senator's daughter and he does more than save her. This one has lots of action, military and otherwise.The Kiss of a Seal: A sweet romance between a tough female trainer and her client. She's stuck in a strange relationship with her fiance and falls for her client. Lots of good feelings with this one.Night with a Seal: Strong leads and military action makes this is a great read. Look for the next in the series soon.  It's very believable and I believe we see these characters again in her next book.

This is an excellent fiction story that is well written and has masterful character development. Full of adventures, drama, humor and romance, this mystery story is fun to read and it never gets dull or boring. I wish some parts were better made but overall it is worth checking out and I couldn’t stop reading it from start to finish. Highly recommended.

Mark Dawson's characters are complex and engaging.  I thoroughly enjoyed all three books in this great action thriller series and only wish the story would continue on.  Thank goodness there is a new John Milton story in the works, and that Dawson leaves us with the hope that there may be a continuation of the Rose saga possible with Beatrix's daughter Isabella.  Read all three stories and you will see what I mean!
summary: Strong ending to a phenomenal action series

reviewText: I enjoyed the story although the health of Rose was a bit of a downer however the author handled it well.  A good story with a lot of intrigue.

In my quest to find the perfect diet for me, I ran across this book. I love that the book is not huge. It's easy to read and everything is explained simply. It explains exactly how the diet works, the science behind it, and why it works. It gives great tips on keeping motivated and reminding the reader that this is a lifestyle change, not a diet. It also reminds the reader that exercise is a key factor in a healthy lifestyle. I really like how the book is set up. It even gives the skeptics view and debunks them. This is the perfect introduction to the Mediterranean diet.
summary: In my quest to find the perfect diet for me

reviewText: (A very long and thorough review) **Spoilers Alert!!!!Okay, You got to read this. You really got to pick this book up! I’m going to say it right now up front. I recommend this book!I’ve read many menage novels before and really liked them, and can say that this is another one I really, really, — REALLY loved! If I can I would so make a video review so you can tell how much I enjoyed this book and see all my quirky stupidity over this book.This is Meghan March’s debut book and I was hooked right from the start — and I mean the start, like when I first read the synopsis when it was up for a Book blast and review tour, I knew I had to read it. And so here I am finished reading it and now reviewing it for y’all.Oh my gosh I can not tell you how much I love this! I mean I don’t want to reiterate the synopsis but man it’s hard not to do. Teeheehee~ hard.But anyways, the world is like basically heading into a hectic apocalypse, no zombies, just out of electricity, a blackout of sort, reminds me of the TV show Revolution (which is now cancelled by the way) when a plane crashes down in Chicago. We then have Rowan, or Ro, packing up the instant the madness hit and finding her way back home to join her father and sister. Unfortunately she got herself into a bit of a scramble, literally, and is on the run from some mad rapist hillbillies. Of course she gets herself injured by tripping and then rescued by a hunky and intimidating, Conan the barbarian. She gets brought to the safety of his camp and finds herself surrounded by other hunks. Dream come true right? *wink wink*So yeah, things got down and banter flies within the moment she’s safe inside the in-caged barrier, she did not want to be there. And even though there’s two hunky men that makes her tingle in excitement, she’s hell bent determined to get the heck out of there and reunite with her family.Okay, now on to the good stuff. I really liked Ro. She was heck of a heroine and I just couldn’t not like her. She had never placed her family first on her list because she was such a workaholic that once the apocalypse hit, it made her regret not having spent more time with them. But then her father did prepare her for something of this like so she was shocked that his craziness didn’t hit far from the truth. She was determined as heck to reach her family and also hell bent on doing things her way. Even to the point of defying the hottie hunky Conan the barbarian, Graham, again and again.  She was strong-minded, stubborn, independent, infuriating, and a not so small of a girl with a size 8 waist. Yup, I liked her. But man can she be full of surprises!  Not just can she argue and ignore the over protectiveness of these men but she can really pull something over their heads, and dare them to sack her. She’s a heck of a troublemaker for these ex-Marines. Dang! And I like her so much!And then the two hunks. Graham, Conan the barbarian –from what Ro likes to call him because he likes to man handle her, in a very good and protective way—, and Zach the gorgeous friendly one. But yes these two are my absolute favorites! I mean they are the heroes but I can’t tell you who I liked best, gosh! I just wish they were one whole person! But of course they have to be two separate characters and in personalities which works just fine by me, but they are down right sexy. But I got to warn you, these two are just tortured. They’re both not perfect and had a rough childhood with parents that were just, not there when they need them so they really had a background and trust issues.Graham is the absolute Alpha male every girl who reads romances super love. He’s the one who likes to take control and is the leader of the pack, so of course he likes control and likes to take control of the situation; which therefore made it difficult for him to handle when Ro was always disobeying his orders. He is the one with the most trust issues because of his childhood and so doesn’t like to be attached  to people, most likely women so he’s never into the relationship thing. He can be very tenacious when he finds something that he wants, in the situation it’s Ro. And he can be very intimidating and can also be very aloof and detached if something emotional gets in the way. Very doubting you know. He’s the bad boy with all the problems but is very broken inside and sweet and you just want to hug and make everything better for his sake.Zach on the other hand is the total opposite of Graham. He’s what we would call the Beta hero, but then he’s not actually the beta neither. But compared to Graham, he would be the beta. And you know me, I super love my Beta heroes! Just saying. But Zach can be very forthcoming and open about what he likes and can really take control of thing if he felt he needed too. He’s very friendly and flirtatious, I call him the pretty boy type because he knows he oozes everything sex. He’s the more approachable type and he doesn’t judge you right off the top and is more trusting and compassionate. He’s also more in touch with his feelings, which I loved about him because he doesn’t hide it. He too had a hard childhood but he tend to hide that and see only the good things in life. He’s the more rational one between him and Graham, while Graham is more action.As I read this though, I felt that Graham had, or seem more of the “true” Hero in this book.
