I felt that he had more parts and we got to understand and see more side of his character, personality, and past than we did Zack. Zach felt like he was just the motivation to bring Graham up to pace with his feelings, although we also saw Zach’s personality and his role in their relationship he was more, to me, the wing-man.As for the story I really loved how it was written. It wasn’t written in only one person’s point of view but in all three, and wasn’t in first person either which I really liked because I enjoyed reading this kind of story and setting in third person. The interactions between these three were super strong. I was surprised that I wasn’t turned off by this relationship. I know I had trouble with this kind of genre-ish because I would want each of them to find their own HEA. This is why I like separate books for these two different types of heroes because then I won’t have to choose who I liked best out of the book because I would know that the other one might get to have their own book and find their own HEA. Butas for this case, they all found it and I liked it.Their interactions were very enjoyable to read and see move along as their relationship grew. Although it grew within a short space of time, like not even within 24 hours —of course an apocalypse would do that to you I believe— I was really invested in it. It had me on the edge of my seat and heart racing with every bit of action it gave me. And it had every good bit of action down from man handling to fearing for the lives of peoples and just, fire arms, guns, and lots of action.Oh yeah, every banter and argument Ro and Graham had either got me laughing or thinking of what would happen next. They most definitely got me thinking of what Ro would do next to vex Graham because I just loved vexing him. I super loved it. I also super love how Zach is always reassuring Ro and asking her permission before he does things with and to her. I thought that was very sweet and caring of him to think of her personally first before himself. And he to likes to reassure himself by asking her those questions and to tell him verbally so that he hears it from her mouth what he can and what she wants him to do to her. Getting permission from her, you know, very gentlemanly of him. Whoa~ is he turning out to be a submissive? That just got me thinking. But anyways the sex.Can I just say the sex was amazingly heart stoppingly panty wetting. Oh my gosh, that dang first sexual scene! Ugh~ I’m not sure why I’m feeling so vexed but that scene really got me frustrated because I needed some—thing! I had to skim over the the last sex scene because I couldn’t deal it with. It was too dang amazingly written I….errrr…..I wanted to finish reading before I exploded! Yup, that’s what it did to me. I’m giving y’all Too Much Information but I’m sorry, it just….. I can’t even come up with the words. My mind just poofed~ Those scenes just sucked every rational thought out of my head and left me feeling naughty and needy. Tsk tsk tsk~ I can’t believe it you know. I’m still reeling. Even after my shower. *sighs*Moving on, Loved the secondary characters of brother in arms at the camp along with the wife and little girl of a brother in arms there. How the story ended was great. I wasn’t sure how the author was going to pull it off because it was so complicated! Especally with Ro’s determination to reunite with her family and the dangers that lurked outside the camp walls. But the ending was good, they got a HEA and I was happy. All was good, I didn’t care what happen next because they were good and that was all that mattered. Apocalypse be damned.Then I read the epilogue. It stared off good because I really wanted an answer to a surprising situation and then, I didn’t get it but I wish I hadn’t read it. It just left me hanging with lots of questions and I wasn’t sure if the author was going to have a sequel or something, but I was already hoping for a sequel for the rest of the other hunky brothers in arms so that they could each find their own HEAs, but no. It just got messed up and Ugh~ So frustrated! I loved it so much and then, Bam! *sighs*I loved it though. Despite the epilogue which I loved and hated, I still recommend this. Like really highly recommend this.This lovely ARC was provided by the author for a honest review.Rating: 5 out of 5
summary: A must read debut for erotica readers!!!

reviewText: Wheat Free Gourmet Desserts is a great collection of recipes that are much healthier and delicious. I love desserts but recently had some health issues with use of regular desserts. I'm glad I found this cookbook that is clearly written and easy to follow.

If your someone who is sensitive to wheat, or just want to try to eat healthier, then this book is a must read. The author shares some really tasty recipes that will surely entertain your friends and family. I especially enjoyed making the cupcakes and the caramel tarts. Great recipe book!
summary: Great Recipes For Wheat Free Desserts..

reviewText: A cliffhanger is one thing, this is no cliffhanger... To stop the story in mid sentence is not a good thing. It didn't hold enough interest for me to wait and buy the next book..
Don't know what could be sexier than a hunk with a great accent? This series is Hot! Loved it and it ended better than I could hope. Can't wait for more!

very sad this series is over.....but very much looking forward to Edward's story. I can't wait to see what is to come for him and Mia. I hope it includes plenty of William and Jennifer....Will be fun to see them as parents. Very well done Mrs. Casey....another winner in my opinion.
I really enjoyed reading this author's books. This book was written very well. It was the last book in the series. It was a really good romantic, drama, funny and sexy story. Please Enjoy!!!!

Another fabulous read by great authors. This book is very dark be forewarned. The twist is awesome and terrible. If this is your first time reading them great way to start. The story is short and can be read in a few hours.

Maybe it won't ruin your life, but your day for sure. I'm all for fictitious children in peril (I am a Wright and Platt fan, after all), but in Crash, these guys actually made me cry. Cry!Aside from that, Crash is a masterful story. I couldn't put it down from the moment that I began. I kept wanting - no, needing - to know how it all ended. With nearly each turn of the kindle page, some new twist showed up, confusing me even more (in a good way) as I absolutely could not figure out how it was going play out. I never would have guessed the ending.You really should read this book. Just be prepared to be ruined.
summary: This book will ruin your life.

reviewText: This book made me feel super sad due to the beatings Tania got at home and at school. I wanted to rescue her so bad so she could see that life is better than what her mother had shown her. Can't wait to read the rest of her story! The editing was pretty bad and for this reason I gave it a four.

I really enjoy Gina Whitney's writing in general but Saving Abel was not exactly my favorite story by her. Every character seemed to have some drama or hidden agenda that the story just felt over the top at times. I never connected with Gia or Abel and they didn't seem to connect with each other -- well sexually they did but not emotionally. The story was super steamy...super! However, I felt that the strength of the story hinged more on the sexual interactions between the characters rather than other interactions -- such as their relationship itself. And, Gia and Abel weren't the only two characters who seemed not to connect together well. Gia and BFF Cindy felt more like frenemies than true friends and their interactions with each other were...awkward.Be prepared to loathe Gia's mother and Morgana. Two major witches! I will commend Whitney on her book villains. She writes them quite well in all of her books, and these two "ladies" are no exception. Vile!I also credit Whitney for crafting a unique story -- a Dom rocker! Never seen that done before. I liked the plot twist about Gia and who and what she really was. Major cliffy there. But, I am intrigued and look forward to seeing how Whitney resolves their conflict. That story promises to have much more potential to allow a deeper connection between the characters.

Ugh, there was sooo many roll my eyes moments in the book. Within the first few pages I wanted to give up!I don't know how to explain this to y'all. It's a full on cheesefest! AND it ends with a cliffhanger of epic suckness. Buy at your own risk. You've been warned.

I never thought I'd ever give this author such a low rating. I love this author's books and have read nearly all of her books and I've read this series and enjoyed it. This book was a complete miss for me. The love story just wasn't realistic and I don't believe that mature adults, particularly the H, would behave like this. The H is a high school principal and we know him from the other books as he is a close friend of the family of all the other main characters. The h was an art teacher before a horrific car accident injured her badly. Now she works on websites. The H is set up with the h by Maggie, another character we know from the previous books, who finds the h on an online dating website. Maggie starts writing to the h and then connects the H and h with each other. The problem is that the photo the H has of the h was taken before the accident and she had long blonde hair, blue eyes and was much thinner. After the accident she is badly scarred on her face and leg, she has brown contacts and has died her hair black and cut it. They begin corresponding and the H falls for the h. He decides to push her into meeting him by arranging to visit her much sooner than she planned. She wanted to have one more op on her face, change her contacts, dye her hair and lose weight. She concocts a scheme to go and meet him before he comes to see her. Sounds good? I thought so.+++Spoilers+++The H was so superficial and fell in love with the h's picture. The h hadn't used her real name on the website and so when he met her as her true self, he had no idea who she was. The h was too scared to tell him the truth and his interaction with her as her other persona just complicated an already messy story. The fact that the h never tells the H the truth during her week long stay had me wanting to throw my Kindle several times. The rehashing of everything in the main characters minds the whole time wore on my nerves. I wished I found the plot credible but I didn't buy it for one second and sadly the execution of this book didn't live up to the author's usually good standards.

My first introduction to G Mitchell Baker, the man and the author-was impressive from three points of view; intelligent, charming, and devoted to the game of baseball !The title of this book-"Soccer Tommie's Baseball Mommies," was a stop sign , promising a worthy read for me. I was not wrong.I appreciate the honor of being privileged to read the pre-release...intriguing, holds the attention, interesting style of writing, subject matter and choice of words all woven into a tale of make believe reality for the reader that has a special grab.Baseball fan or not, read it, share it, gift it...it is life unleashed with humor !
summary: Reading The Best Books, Shapes The Best Minds~

reviewText: Great Read. I always love Colleen's books. I love her characters.

I believe this was the favorite SHORT STORY because it focused on a different side of Kosmas. I really like him. He's smart and can be funny. His dog! She needs one too! A little girl Chihuahua. But his Mom might kill it. I like him.
summary: This was favorite story so far. Kosmas is showing a side I fear and hope she will fall for at the same time.

reviewText: Another good contemporary romance from Sarka-Jonae. Alex finally became a lawyer, but then she feels more like a punching bag as co-workers scheme to make her look bad and partners criticize her every move. She can't quit because she worked so hard and her wife is so proud. Becki is starting to nest in anticipation of adopting a baby. She's in training to be Super Mom and isn't sure she's measuring up. Lisa is dating a new guy after her ex let her walk away. Jan is opening a new spa and trying to figure out how she can her friends with their problems, not realizing how she's sabotaging her own happiness.Spin Control is a great follow-up to Spin Off. I'm curious about the next book.

Living in a same sex abusive relationship for thirteen years this story hit me hard.  I really enjoyed the interaction of the characters and wish we all had parents like daniels.  I am happy he found his inner strength and admire the counseling and the love they share.  Yes strength comes from within and we all have it we just sometimes need a push.

Rachel and Jake met while in college and the timing was just never right, even though there were definite feelings on both sides.  Fast forward to now and Rachel needs Jake's help because she thinks she saw someone her brother is hanging out with on TV as one of America's Most Wanted.  Rachel and Jake reconnect, sparks fly, and all old emotions get dragged up and to the surface.  Add to Rachel's brother getting kidnapped and chaos ensues.Rachel is the sweet, loving, and has the ability to bring Jake to his knees.  Jake regrets all the years he's lost with Rachel because of his own mistakes.  All he wants to do is help Rachel find her brother, bring down a potential terrorist threat, and start a lasting relationship with Rachel.I loved the connection that Rachel has with Jake.  It reaches though the pages and I felt all the angst and need between them.I would highly recommend MARKED to anyone who has read any of Kaylea Cross' other series.  I can't wait for the next book!

I'm a huge Kaylea Cross fan, I have absolutely LOVED every book in the Titanium Security and Bagram Special Ops series, so I was on pins and needles waiting for the HRT series and Jake's story. Once again Kaylea blew me away with a phenomenal book chock full of the perfect combination of suspense and hot, make your toes curl romance!This woman writes alpha bad a**es that make your heart beat faster and wish you had one of them for your own. Wishy washy, whiney women? Ummmmm......NO, not in her books! I simply cannot find a single fault in this first installment of the Hostage Rescue Team series.My only complaint is I now have to wait for the next book......so Kaylea? WRITE FAST! :D

As usual Ms. Cross has turned out another well written book.  I have read almost all her books and enjoyed them all.  I will always pick up one of her books because the writing stays consistent.  She develops well thought out plots with believable, like able characters.  Thanks Ms. Cross for another good read!
summary: We'll worth the time and money.  Author stays consistent in her writing.

reviewText: I read the first book of the trilogy and I loved it. And the second one turned out to be another awesome book. I was so intrigued by how well these are written and how real they felt. The continuation of End of Computers was as intense as it could get. The characters make it an interesting read. How would we actually face the end of the world if this all came about? I love the writing and how easy it easy to keep reading it. I could not stop once I got started and I hated for it to end. I can not wait for the third book. This author is quickly becoming a favorite of mine; Andre Mikhhailovich Solonitsyn is an outstanding writer with a flare for mystery and science fiction. I applaud his passion. I highly recommend this book, as well as the first one of this series. It will take you on an epic adventure.

Loved it. , by far the best in the serious.  Love how kelly brings the characters together to save his future and life ! But she gets caught in the middle ! Love the drama, the ending was amazing. Can't wait to see what happens in the next one

I love all of K.A. Young's books, so I was really excited to hear that she had a new one out. This story is different than her other books. It is mostly a love story, but there is a little bit of supernatural in there too. The story had so many twists and turns. I thought I had it all figured out, then it would go in a completely different direction. Loved it!
I just love this sweet, lovely, little book.  What a wonderful lesson for all on tolerance and understanding.  Gorgeous illustrations.  Highly recommend.
Been a fan of Lani Lynn Vale since the very first freebirds book and she didn't disappoint with this book.
I really like the series !! this book had it all for me. I laughed and cried. I would really recommend this series .

I love Cassie and Logan! It's hard for me to review and not tell you any spoilers.I love how Cassie grew stronger. I felt every emotion that she was feeling. I understand how she is drawn to Logan because I want him, too.I love how whatever they are going through, they are in it together.**I was provided an ARC for my honest review.**

Shawn Chesser has come through again and again with a story-line that is one of the most thrilling reads in this genre. With much anticipation for Warpath the next book in the STZA I was once again drawn into the complex lives of Cade, Brooke, Raven and now the squabbling siblings, and my love for the Duncan and Daymon characters just added more flavor to an already exciting series. To juice this book up Chesser added some "fan names" to his characters which was totally exciting (you need to follow Shawn on his FB page to find out more).I'm always impressed with Shawn's work, he's stuck true to the genre giving his readers zombies, action, blood and guts. I won't spoil by writing what happens, but as a female I loved the deaths of the two nastiest villains towards the end of the book. Jaimie- you go girl!!As stated on many of the reviews, this is a series that has come to the forefront of the genre. Shawn has managed to give this reader what she craves- Cade a man of spectacular action, a book full of exciting-kick-ass-fight scenes with zombies and road bandits, and one hell of a bang at the end. Dude you have done it again! Stay Frosty Shawn!I highly recommend this book and ALL in this series.

reviewerName: Elizabeth Rose "Be Yourself Everyone Else Is ...
reviewText: Firstly, I love that from the writing of the story you can tell the author is authentic, that they grew up in the world that they are creating.With that said Carmen Amato does an amazing job of creating a mystery that is quite the page turner. From the first page to the very last, it's one of those books you'll quite happily pick up and read from start to finish. I love this story and will be checking out the first two in the series as well.

I found this book to be very informative. Just like other books written by this author-to the point and practical. I now know how to read the labels and protect myself from added sugars so as to choose sugar-free foods. I also liked author's personal story.
This was a great ending to the series! Te'Jadan does it again! More twist and turns had me on the edge of my seat. Great job author!

This is a short story, but for once I do not mind. What I however do mind, is lack of editing - there are misspellings and missing words. Had this been better, I would have given it all five stars.Payton and Noah started off as friends the day they were assigned to share the dorm. After a while they became lovers. In the early twenties the most people feel grown up, but in reality they are still unfinished. Especially if they still attend the school. And I feel that the author had it quite right in this story.In the beginning it may seem as if Payton is the good guy, the one who was betrayed, and that Noah is the bad guy, the one who let Payton down. But I changed my mind while reading the story. They are both to blame for what happened.I feel that Payton and Noah were probably more in love than loving each other. Why else would Payton belittle Noah for his choices without feeling any remorse, any guilt? Why else would Noah cheat on Payton? Payton never asked, had never wondered, never saw the problems Noah was battling. He felt superior to Noah because Noah went out clubbing, while Payton himself stayed at home and studied. And still Noah had better results, but even that Payton did not acknowledged.Then we meet the two men some years later. Payton continues pretty much the same way he had left off. He is quite self-righteous, still not listening. Even his best friend Adam who had supported him "back then" is not quite on "his side" now. Of course, it is partly because he knows more than Payton, but probably also because he judges Payton as stuck in old patterns. Noah has served his time. He had messed up his life very seriously, but he had come through, damaged but living. I cried for him, for them.The story shows that changing is doable, if you add some will to it. And when you let go of all prejudice, you may find out that another person is good enough even when flawed.
summary: To read this second chance story you will need some tissue.

reviewText: There aren't many books in the Tunbridge Wells police cells suite. There aren't many books in the Tunbridge Wells police station at all. While being held overnight on charges of indecent exposure (before being released due to insufficient evidence) I very fortunately had recourse to my solicitor's spare kindle, and this book was on it. I'm glad that it was. You don't get many laughs during the night-shift at Tunbridge Wells police station.Darrin has a sense of humour that is, well - and, yes, but not only that, it's more sort of... now you get the idea except that you need to add a dash or a soupon of something before you can quite, and even then you must unhinge your brain-glands to experience the full, unadulterated, do you see? I thought you would. This is not your usual fare, and it's a milion times the better for it.All I can say is that if you're ever locked, trouserless and slightly tipsy, in a six by eight tiled cell with an ex-boxer who has been detained on charges of tending personally farm animals in a manner contrary to the 1733 Cute, Furry & Asking For It Act, Subsection 12a, then don't read this book.My personal favourite was the rather capital 'THE WICKED WITCH OF THE WEST: STAR TREKKING, ACROSS THE UNIVERSE'.Buy it - you won't regret it.
summary: This is far, far from your usual brew. Witch (sic) is a good thing...

reviewText: Great guide on how to build a greenhouse successfully. This book goes into details on how you can effectively grow the plants you have always wanted. Great guide.

SPOILER ALERT !!!!Nicky Wells is one of my all time favorite authors.....I thought the "Sophie" trilogy was brilliantly written.  So it was with great anticipation that I read "Fallen For Rock".  Nicky, you set the bar too high with the "Sophie" books.  While I enjoyed FFR, I didn't love it.  The characters lacked the depth that held my attention in Nicky's other books.  I wanted to know more about Nate who, after all, is really a major character.  I found myself rooting for Mike and Emily and was actually shocked when Nate comes back on the scene.  We don't know very much about him and never get a chance to feel if there is, in fact, any real chemistry between them.  I was disappointed that the relationship between Mike and Emily didn't develop into something more.There was something missing from the story and I can't quite put my finger on it.  It felt rushed.....incomplete.....not well thought out.  I wanted to learn more about Emily....more about Mike.....and definitely more about Nate.  There were just too many blank spaces for a story that had so much potential.

I love band books, rockers and their wild nights… but there is something unique about Fallen For Rock and I just adored this book. I wanted Mike to take on the world when things got rough, I wanted Emily to decide that Mike wasn’t a rebound… I wanted so much from this book… but what I got was anything but what I expected. It was awesome!Emily doesn’t do rock. She doesn’t understand it and it really has no place in her world. She doesn’t operate that way. But her ex-boyfriend did. He lived it and loved it. But it was just too much for Emily to handle. He was just too obsessed with it. Ultimately that is what broke them up, but what happened after that was anything but what Emily was expecting.Nate had entered a contest when they were still together to win tickets to a MonX concert and VIP treatment. He won the concert and had the passes sent to Emily’s. Only problem… he wasn’t returning any of her calls, clearly done with the entire relationship. But she tried to contact him over and over to no avail. So she went to the show. This was going to be a new experience for her. She had never been to a rock concert. She had no idea what to expect.But everything she thought she was expecting turned into so much more when she ended up on the tour bus after spending a lot of time with Mike’s brother behind the scenes. When she finally met Mike, she decided that she was going to cut loose a little. Live a little, rock a little… She had taken time off from her job and this was her chance to get out there and experience life.I am not sure she was expecting what she got herself into, but once she was there, she knew she was going to take advantage of the situation she found herself in. Mike and Emily became fast friends, in and outside of the bedroom. But could there be potential for anything more there? Could she forget how much she loved Nate and just move on? Could Mike change who he was and want anything more than a fling with Emily? And what about the rest of the band? How will they react to their new traveling companion?This book was just amazing. It had fun twists and turns and new binds at every turn, but it was so much more than that. It was a great journey of self discovery. Emily finally had the chance to step away from her carefully planned life and find out who she really was. What she wanted out of life and she found the courage and determination to follow through with what she wanted and she found the strength to find love all over again.I will admit, I was a little nervous at the beginning when I found out that this would all be written in the language of the locale. I thought that it would be a bit distracting as I usually have to pause and remember where an author lives when words aren’t spelled the same and there are new twists on phrases that I am used to hearing. It typically makes me take pause when I come to words like realise and pyjamas and cute phrases that we say in everyday life, “He looked like a million pounds.” Now for those across the ocean these are normal words and phrases. But it worked really well in this book, because the scene was set in the location of the language. I actually grew really fond of it in this book. It doesn’t work in a lot of books, but in this one it does.This book was hot, it was sweet and it shows the power of friends, faith and staying true to who you are, even if you are rediscovering who you are supposed to be. Nicky Wells writes with a great passion for rock and it shows throughout the pages of this book.
summary: Nicky Wells writes with a great passion for rock!

reviewText: After seeing a trailer for this I thought that it was a picture book for very young children. It actually has lots of text on every page and in my opinion, is suitable for children up to 8years or 9years. With beautiful photographs and the story of Odd's adventure it really is a delightful book. Throughout the story, lots of worthwhile information is imparted, like how to take a compass bearing, use a whistle to call for help and there's a stunning photograph of Ben Nevis, the highest mountain in the United Kingdom.A lovely feature is the vocabulary list on the back pages for the new words that appeared in each chapter. Before reading the book I'd never heard of a Munro, a Corbett or a Bothy. Odd Sock looks cute in all the pictures.
A very awesome resource with a lot of great information in the one place. Very well presented, and written with great ideas and strategies for making the ultimate garden. THanks for a great book!

One stop shop guide for all your square foot gardening needs.  This is a complete book on square foot gardening.It covers everything you need to know in a step by step guide from how square gardening can save you money to how to grow unique things for jams and even wine.This book also covers topics like how to use gardening as valuable family time and using gardening as relaxation.  Over all a very helpful book and I highly recommend.
summary: Complete guide to square foot gardening

reviewText: I am totally impressed how Benjamin Chapin wrote this book that it made me realize so many things I actually missed from not understanding the Power of Now! He was able to provide so many insights about dreams, forgiveness, happiness and living today. If you want to experience and understand so many things in order to be happy in life, then start with this book, it will soothe you as much as it did to me. Live today and be happy! :)

Today holds so much power that I never knew about.. I think there is a lot of people that are wasting their time not focused on today. Chapin does great in explaining how to grasp the power the now and how to adapt it to your life. I've read a few of this author's books and I have to say this is one of my favorites.

I found this book very appealing and so real. Edgar could be anyone  with his potbelly and flab and his philosophy on life, but he becomes a positive, endearing and reliable person after everything ends.  There are only a few people left including his wife and 2 children but he gets separated from them and must begin his search. A really good read and I will be looking out for this author again.
Fun summer read!

I loved this heart warming love story. Although there wasn't a lot of intense emotions, I found it hard to put down. I felt like I knew Mia well enough to consider her a friend of mine and I wanted to see her get her HEA as soon as she could. I can't blame her for pushing Ben away for so long. I would have too. He was downright cruel to her when they were growing up.But Ben's changed. He's not that arrogant teenager anymore. He's now a sweet, caring man who feels guilty for what he said to her. It's amazing what 9 years will do to a person. Even though I understood Mia protecting herself, I kept hoping that things would work out between them.The was scene that had a lot of emotional potential, but the author didn't put too much time into the sad parts, choosing to instead to focus on how Mia was feeling towards Ben at that time. I was glad she chose to do that because it would have been hard to read through all my tears if she went the other route.Once you read the book, you'll totally understand what I mean. If you enjoy a great love story with realistic characters, I highly recommend this book.
summary: I loved this heart warming love story

reviewText: I love this book! If you're looking for a light read with lots of swoony and drool moments you have to read this!! I love all the characters especially the hottie Officer Kelly and his angel Mia! Looking forward to other books by Ms.Daniels!❤️

I'll give my opinion on this book but not a synopsis like so many do. If you've read what the author puts out there for us to decide if we want to buy you know the jest of what the story's about. However my opinion is that this is a great love story, GREAT character development of both the H/h, great secondary characters, really hawt sex scenes, loved mia and Ben so freaking cute!!! And on my gosh Ben's son Nolin loved him wanted more of him in the story!! Nolin's mom thou real piece of work...would have loved for her to get punched in the face just once.. just a really feel good romance.
was such an excellent story and the love between them was amazing! the characters are strong and  hilarious! Nolan is so so cute
Loved this story it was amazing this whole series was amazing.I want a clay for myself. This series is a must read one of my favorite authors.

I went Paleo a few months ago and I must say, I never thought I'd see a Paleo ice cream book. But to find something that fits with my current lifestyle, while still allowing me to indulge in my guilty pleasures was a welcome sight. I appreciated the variety in the recipes...there seems to be something for everyone who loves ice cream.
I can hardly wait to try all of them. ICE CREAM has always been my favorite dessert so I love this book!
I love all of the books, there is not many books out that you can laugh, cry and worry about the characters. I never want this series to end.
summary: I love all of the books

reviewText: I hated the last book it was just too Damon dark and evil but man this one was awesome!!!  Okay I'm ready for the next one!!!

This book has so many ideas that you will get caught up in the possibilities!  It is a fun read too!  It is like sitting down and talking with somebody who REALLY wants to know about you--your likes, what you think about, what gets you excited --and you will know more about yourself once you sit with these ideas!  Enjoy and get the energy to get your writing started with this great book!
summary: You will get a LOT out of this book!

reviewText: This was a very inspiring book.  It engages the reader and motivates.  I was pulled in almost immediately to explore more creativity.Well written.  I loved it!!!

Another awesome chapter in the slaver wars series. Lots of great battle scenes good story telling and just the compulsion to carry on. My only worry is the next book has so much to wrap up. I hope the author takes his time or better yet expand it in to two more books so the full potential can be experienced. Keep up the great work.

I loved this book, it had a great mix of romance, drama, and suspense. I loved Sebastian, I loved how dominant he was, how sexy, how loyal of a friend he was, and in the end how loving he was. I really enjoyed reading about Rosslyn, her back story was so sad and what a wonderful sister she is to Kyle. The things they had gone through were terrible and yet she kept on trying to make it better for both of them. Right away I loved the chemistry between Roz and Sebastian and the further into the relationship they got the better it was. Then of course there is quite the shocker in the story and then another shocker lol I could not believe what happened when the truth came out. I was so happy that Roz was able to forgive. I loved reading from both POV and I loved the epilogue, it ended perfectly.

With all they hype surrounding this one I decided I had no choice but to bump it upOn my TBR list! So glad I did! It was worth staying up until 1am reading! Can't wait to see what this duo does next.This is a stand alone with a HEA.

Be prepared LBB starts off with a bang, one that will have you clinching your thighs together not even 3 pages in.Sebastian Black has it all. Owner of the most hottest night club, money to burn and woman at his beck and call.His little black book is filled with ladies that will do anything for him, but with all the women he has, he's still searching for the elusive Jessica Rabbit, the myth.Mr. Black has two rules for the ladies in his life1. Don't ever deny him2. Don't fall in love with himHe just wants their bodies, with no strings attach. All has worked until he meets her.Rosslyn Harris's life has once again crumbled around her. Getting a job at Clive's will set everything in motion, because that's when she catches Sebastian's eye... She's his Jessca Rabbit."She's my Jessica"- SebastianWith a proposition from Mr.Black, one that can help herself and her little brother, she can't refuse it, even if that means becoming another name in his little black book."Jessica" is a challenge, one Sebastian will except.Rosslyn will have Sebastian feel things his never felt, she's the reason he has his rules. He can't let this happen.Everything is going better than they thought, they've surprised their self, but when Sebastian's dark secret is unearth, will it ruin everything? Can one overlook the most horrible thing that happen to them?Little Black Book is one of my top reads in 2014! I read this book in less than a day. As soon as you start reading it grabs you and will immediately have you panting, every book needs to start off that way. Sebastian Black has given Mr. Grey a run for his money in my eyes. His is an alpha, demanding, sexy, private, my way or no way character. He wants what he wants and goes for it. My God, I will be thinking or Sebastian and his dirty mouth for days. Rosslyn Harris is a character who doesn't know her own beauty. She's shy, with not a lot of sexual inexperience. She stands her ground, but once she is broken, that's when she goes to Mr.Black. I loved how she grew in this book, she found her sexuality and her voice. With all the amazing sex scenes and I'm telling you there is a lot, there is also a growing relationship. Two people finding each other, two people who complete each other. I loved their chemistry, they have a love hate relationship in the beginning, but soon they can't fight the unavoidable. Vick, ugh i freaking hate her. I wanted to throat punch her!!!! With everything there is a back story, these are two people that had a hard pass, one that will bring them together. I definitely didn't see that secret coming. I was shocked as hell to read those words. This book has absolutely everything one needs and I'm not kidding. I loved reading from each of their POVs. Ive never read about a belt and gun like i did in Little Black Book. Be prepared ladies ;) I give this book 5 stars!!!
summary: Mr. Grey who... Welcome Mr. Black

reviewText: Wow...This story sure took me by surprise.  Sexy Sebastian owns a club and doesn't do love. Only sex with absolutely no strings or emotions. For that he keeps his little black book.  That is until he sees the new waitress in his club.  Roz is desperate to take care of her brother since their grandmother's death. So she takes a job at the club.  Just when she's getting the hang of the job Sebastian fires her and offers her another proposition. Rob is completely shocked by his offer but finds she has no other options at this point.  What a wild ride the author takes you on.  Rob has a tragic past and when their two worlds collide who will come out winners. Sebastian is a dark brooding type with his own tragic past to deal with.  I really enjoyed reading their story. It was well written and the characters were so easy to connect with. A very hot and sexy story but with so much more. Highly recommend.

I loved this book from the synopsis on I HAD to read this an  I'm so glad I did because it.was.worth.it!If you want hott sex,A story with a twist,A strong fearless heroine,And an unexpected love story....BUY THIS BOOK NOW!5stars!!

This is a story about Sebastian Black - rich club owner, and single by choice. He has his "girls" listed in his little black book. These girls are well compensated, and are required to do only two things: (1) come when they are called, and (2) don't develop feelings for Sebastian. If they break either of these rules, they are removed from the little black book, and all future payments cease. In order to keep this strictly a business transaction, the girls are given names from cartoon characters; namely Wilma, Betty, Bambi, etc. Sebastian doesn't believe in love and is happy with his arrangement until a new waitress enters his club and changes everything.Rosslyn Harris has had a rough life. She lost her parents at 12 years old, and now - 10 years later - she loses her grandmother. She is desperate to find a job, take care of her little brother Kyle, and tries to create some stability in her life.When Sebastian sees Rosslyn, he knows she is different. She quickly becomes his "Jessica Rabbit", AKA the perfect woman. As their journey together moves forward, Sebastian's criminal past continues to haunt him while his feelings for Rosslyn deepen. Rosslyn knows this is only a business deal, and falling for Sebastian will only push him away.The book is a fun read; it is well written, has great character development and flows nicely. I loved the ending, and look forward to reading more books from the author.
story with a twist. This was a good read. I could not put the book down. The storyline was awesome.

A sexy alpha male.  √An innocent woman.  √Cartoon character names.  √Oh, yes.  *smirks* And the Little Black Book.  √√If the blurb doesn't grab you - Well...You just didn't read it yet!!5 + 1 Deliciously Wicked STARS!!!I'll just begin by saying that if the cover of the book doesn't intrigue you... The blurb certainly will!!  I added this book to my TBR faster than you can say 'yes please'.  The first few pages of this book set the mood for the rest of the book.  And I was definitely not disappointed!!  I had a love/hate thing happening in my head about Mr. Sebastian Black.  I found I was drawn to his character and couldn't read enough about him but also repulsed about how he treated the women in his little black book.  I found me throwing my head back and silently laughing about his need to name 'his girls' cartoon characters.  For instance, he's with Wilma and Betty as the book begins.  Funny, right?!  Every girl in his book is a different name.  Jessica Rabbit is one name that will remain unused.  All until Rosslyn Harris walks into his club."Because deal or no deal, you're my Jessica... I most definitely do not call anyone else Jessica.  Only you and for a special reason."The writing is witty and classic.  Classic in the sense that we will be talking about this book for a very.  Long.  Time.  As I uncovered more and more layers of Sebastian, I found myself unable to continue the love/hate and became captivated by his charm.  As did our heroine, Rosslyn, Roz."I was shaking again, but I wasn't sure if it was my nerves or the sensations that were flying through my body at light speed.  I was losing myself in him and it had only been a matter of minutes since we'd stepped into the room."Roz is a 22 year-old virgin.  I know!  I know!  But just go with it.  I find that many authors use this... template, for lack of a better description.  And it works but I always find flaws.  The young innocent falls to the alpha without thinking twice.  But here... well you're in for a REAL treat! After propositioned from Sebastian, Roz doesn't immediately fall at his feet.  And she doesn't play the 'I'm just curious' card either.  Although she is... immensely curious.  Roz and her brother have just lost her grandmother.  And she's been left to care for her younger brother, Kyle.  So she doesn't make this choice to accept Sebastian lightly.  Only after she exhausted other avenues and find herself without a roof over her head and living with Kyle in their car."I'd failed Kyle... and there was nothing I could do to make it right."It's raw and gripping.  It works so poetically in this book.  This is made that much harder on her with the tragedy we discover that happened 12 years earlier.  More and more pieces of that puzzle evolve like the wings of a butterfly coming from its' chrysalis.  It's beautifully written.  Much care has been taken to be sure - in every way - that the reader falls for each of them.  Each of their problems and conflicts I wished to shoulder for them.  The evolvement of their relationship is unique.  And not insta-love.  It progresses in an intricate, yet effortless, way."I'm almost there with you - so close it scares the s#*t out of me.  I want to know your name, but I'm still afraid that I'll run when you tell me and running from you is the last thing I want to do."The book is told in dual POV!  And transitions between the two flawlessly.  This book has some great secondary characters.  The truly had parts to play.  They weren't just taking up space!  There are dark, twisty moment.  There are sexy, fierce moments. And the chemistry is explosive between Roz and Sebastian.  But there is never a moment that you want to quit swiping pages.  Never a time with valleys.  Only peaks!  With an exceptional epilogue that leaves your heart warmed and your smile wide!  And this Little Black Book has become a 6-star favorite for me!
Such a sexy story!! I love part two and how the relationship developed between the two main characters. Cambria has outdone herself with this very sweet and sexy story!! Loved it!

A great collection of stories. Enjoyed this set very much.Book 1 The Widow Vanishes by Grace CallawayAnnabel is a widow whose husband left her in debt with a very bad man. McLeod works for this man. Two people trying to find their way after being hurt by others in their lives. McLeod is supposed to find Annabel for the bad guy but ends up protecting her. This is avery sweet and hot story about a second chance for Annabel and McLeod.Book 2 Scandal Before Sunrise by Sabrina Darby Story about Abigail Billings and Elliot JonesBook 3 A Highlander Heart by Jennifer HaymoreThis story opens with Robert Campbell in the aftermath of a battle. He sees his wife whom he hasn't seen in quite a while. Two months earlier Claire gets a letter from Robert that he is going into battle. They fought before he left. Now she wants to find him to say she is sorry. She finds him injured on the battlefield. This is Robert and Claire's story about finding their love and becoming stronger. Robert and his men get a special assignment and thus a new series by Jennifer Haymore. Can't wait!Book 4 Lord Lucifer's Disciple by Sue LondonThis one is Joh Howard and Elise Jarvis' story. He's shy and she needs a husband. He pretends to be someone he's not and they fall in love. Cute story.Book 5 How to Lose a Duke in 10 days by Kate MckinleyThe Duke decided he wanted Pippa for his wife. She didn't want him. So the battle of wills ensue! This book has an ending for these too - sort of. I'm not a fan of cliffhangers.Book 6 Miss Amelia Lands a Duke/Prequel to the Caversham Chronicle by Sandy RavenThis is the story between Amelia and Marcus. Life hasn't been easy for Amelia. Marcus, the Duke of Caversham has been alone since losing his wife 10 years ago. When these two come together sparks fly!Book 7 Lady Northam's Wicked Surrender/Wicked Liaisons Book 1 by Vivienne WestlakeThis is Rowena and Simon's story. They were torn apart by the lies of others. Years later Simon is back for Rowena!My favorite book in this set is by Jennifer Haymore and I'm looking forward to the ones that follow in this series!

This is what I have found with other "sets".  Either the stories are so similiar you start to get the idea you are reading the same story with the names changed to protect the authors, or there are a couple good stories and the rest are filler.  That is NOT the case with Summer Nights.  Each author has a different voice and a unique way to bring their characters alive.  Every story had it's share of drama and humor.  These are all very good novellas.  And there's only one thing I hate about good novellas, they leave me starving for more.  More story, more character development, more "what happens next?".  Every one of these stories left me wanting more.  So if you are in love with historical romance and looking for some new authors to add to your favorites, start looking here.  I had planned to tell you what my favorite one was, but I can't decide on just one.  I think you will enjoy all of the stories and the authors in this collection.The copy of this book was given to me by one of the authors.  This did not impact my opinions.
summary: A great way to spend a couple of your Summer Nights

Sometimes when I look around my house, I am simply amazed at all of the stuff that we have accumulated.  Sometimes it comes in handy, but mostly I just wind up moving piles of stuff from place to place when I am looking for something.  This book has been a big help and has given me some motivation to organize and downsize, getting rid of some things that I don't really need.  The author takes a minute as well to explore the reasons behind just getting "stuff" and how it is not that important a part of our lives.  I think this book would be a great help to anybody who is not already on the minimalist track.

Some truths cannot be hidden forever and some can’t be told, the must be realized.Keely has embraced what life has handed to her, which an unbelievable amount of money, a CEO position and an evil step sibling that wants to take it all away. She travels to New York where the estate and corporate offices are located along with Vaughn, who offers her support with his own ulterior motives.“How will I destroy her, when she’s the only one I want?”While there, Keely gives her full trust to Vaughn while pushing her limits and at the same time slashing away his emotional protective armor, making him doubt his original motives and moving him into the unwanted territory of feelings and love.“She’s breaking through my defenses, chipping away at my stone cold heart. And now she’s unraveling the only thing I thought I was sure of in the world.”But the truth has a way of coming out, both past and present. Loyalty and trust are tested, new players emerge and shift positions, Keely finds herself having to take stand, make difficult choices and while unknowing her life is in peril, leaving this filthy mystery in a shocking cliffhanger.The main reason for my rating is because at times it feels like smut and I’ve had a difficult time empathizing with the characters. But the intrigue is well incorporated in this seductive serial and I’m looking forward to reading its last installment.
summary: Some truths cannot be hidden forever and some can’t be told, the must be realized.

reviewText: Vaughn has the filthiest mouth ever, and I love every thing that comes out of it!  And in this book Keely starts to come into her own, and she stands up for what she wants.  The love scenes will melt your Kindle!  There is also mystery and suspense along with the hotness.  Oh, but the cliffy, it's a doozie!  Loved this book, it was the best yet in this series, very much looking forward to the next book!

May contain spoilers as review for all three books!Book 1This book ticks all the boxes! Romance, drama, suspense and even some comedy!I love that even despite the history between these characters, there's no unrealistic, premature early declarations of love which is present in so many books! This helps make the characters believable, and I didn't find myself rolling my eyes at any point.Only downside is having to wait for books 2 & 3, but if this DEBUT NOVEL is anything to go on, I'm sure they will be worth the wait.Well written, and hard to believe its TK Leigh's debut work!Book 2I was lucky and honoured to read a BETA copy of ATW.Once again TK Leigh has succeeded to write a book that will take you on an emotional rollercoaster along with Olivia and Alexander! I laughed, I cried and I have the biggest book hangover possible. I think I enjoyed ATW more than ABM, I could totally empathise with Olivia throughout the book and I found her really relatable. And Mr Burnham?? I think I love him even more, most certainly in my top 5 book boyfriends, which is no mean feat!I can't wait to see what comes next!!Book 3A fantastic final instalment of the Beautiful Mess series. This series has had me on an emotional rollercoaster from start to finish, and I'm not ready to say goodbye to the characters 😢. Can't wait to read Cam's book!!!I loved all three books, and will definitely be a series I return to for a reread! The third book had even more twists and turns than the other two, and after thinking you know what's going on, and that you've known the story from the start, expect to be twisted in a completely different direction!
loved it. love the whole series and can't wait for next one

It was amazing, epic, etc...! I could go on all day! I must say that I will read anything that this author writes and publishes. Her characters, well, I fell in love with them. Everything was so real to me as I was reading this book. It was better than watching a movie. The back story of Ada was thought out perfectly. James, well all I can say is that these characters seemed like they were actually real people. I mean wow! It was like I was there in the book watching everything that was going on, watching as they were talking and doing their jobs. I felt as if I could really feel there emotions. Everything in the book had perfect details. Everything was described perfectly, not too much and not too little. I love this book and give it five stars and recommend it to everyone to read. 5 Stars!!!! :)

Loved the chemistry between Josh and Ashley and was definitely rooting for them in the end!  Very fun book!

This book was such a great find for me. I was struggling with some tough decisions in my life and I didn't really know how to go about making the decisions. One of my friends recommended this book to me as she knew what I was going through and thought that the book would be a great read. This book has a lot of tips on how to cope through serious decisions in your life. Mental training really is an art and this book teaches you how to focus on the problems at hand in your life. I was very satisfied about what I learned in this book and I am looking forward to applying it to my life. Nicholas Black, the author, really knows what he is talking about and he wrote the book in a way that was easy to understand and get through. I finished the book within a few days and I am planning on rereading it. It is a great book and worth the price!
All I need to know is when is No Shade coming out, cause this book had me hooked from beginning to end.

While there they discover things about themselves, each other and get pampered by Mama Lani. I could really picture the island and the people and their blooming love for one another.I received a free copy in exchange for an honest review.
summary: Prizes are never what they seem to be

reviewText: Love sometimes quietly comes up behind you when you're not looking or wanting to acknowledge it...as Nick and Addie find out.  Friends since kindergarten, they find that their friendship may have developed into something more - if they are willing to take the chance.  Great read to bring some sun into a rainy afternoon!

Life for Addie and Nick is complicated. They decide that marriage will solve their problems. These two have been friends since childhood and have secretly loved each other forever. Now they will live together as friends only. They are excited by winning an exotic honeymoon trip. What happens when they find their prize comes with a camera crew that will be their constant companion. They don't want the world to learn their secret. I loved this sweet, romantic story. Melissa McClone has written a book that pulls at your heartstrings. The characters are wonderful. Addie and Nick are charming, passionate and full of life. What starts out as a marriage of convenience turns into a true love match. Starfish Island provides a magical background. I laughed as our couple find out that they are on a reality show and can't get out. I couldn't put this book down. The Honeymoon Prize has it all - romance, humor and a perfect couple. I was pulled into their romance. This is a wonderful touching story that made me feel good.

Ty has been burned by women before and don’t trust them. He feels a pull towards Ash, knows she is his mate, but don’t want to admit to it and tries his best to push her away because of those trust issues. Ty’s story was about the strength it took for a man to forgive/forget and learn to be true to himself.I liked this part: Ty let out a low growl. "Female, what did I tell you about being in my room?"Ash face him, brows raised and a smile on her face. "If I got my scent in your space, you'd f**k me until I scream."Ash knows how Ty feels about women, but she has to gain his trust so that she can help prove his innocence. She also feels the pull, knows that Ty is her mate, and once they admit their feelings things are HOT between them.I love Ty and Ash together. My favorite part, I think, was when Ash got Ty to let her take off his sunglasses, because that meant that he trusted her to take them off and see the “REAL” Ty and then that is when Ty started to give in to the feelings for her, in my opinion.This book kept you hooked through the entire book. It was fast paced and the smooth flowing plot keeps readers on the edge with lots of suspense, action, and romance. The author makes you feel like you are there experiencing it with them, because of the detailed descriptions of each scene with well written details that capture the imagination.I can’t wait to see what happens next with this series in Artemis's Hunt.
summary: Ashes of War! Love these Dragons!

reviewText: I enjoyed the book.  The storyline was a little iffy at times.  I would like to see this turned into a series to see where the characters end up.  In the end, I would recommend reading it.

TITLE~ High Class Harlot (Switching Tracks #2)AUTHOR~ Delia SteeleGENRE~ New Adult-RomancePUBLISHED~ July 1, 2014PURCHASED/COST~ ARC for ReviewMY RATING~ 5/5I chose to read this book because I loved the first one in the series and I was provided with an ARC for review.High Class Harlot was an amazing second edition to the Switching Tracks series. In my opinion, this book is even better than book 1, Trailer Park Princess.High Class Harlot picks up right where Trailer Park Princess left off, but in different POVs. We still get a lot more of the characters from the previous book and that's awesome! We got to go on an emotional roller coaster throughout this story. The main character's story is no fairy tale for sure. It's real and it's rough.Delia Steele did a great job writing this book as well as the one before it. I can't wait for more of this series!

"You don't have to be expert in order to write."This book is indeed a great resource about how one can start writing, it doesn't say you can be expert by following the tips mentioned here but Mike is a great writer that I know he can convince so many readers to write with the heart and believe that you can write!I really love how this book was written by someone who loves writing, I enjoyed this book and learned a lot about writing! I even got curious about one chapter that says "don't try this at home!" that was really amazing! Mike indeed is a great writer and all the tips here are awesome. I would highly recommend this book to anyone who wants to write.

I have read all of this series and had no intention of reading this as I usually don't read prequels.  I needed a new book last night so, I thought why not?  I read it all without any breaks, it was by far my favorite of the series!  Vasile and Alina have the most intriguing story yet.  I highly recommend this book to everyone.  It is a great stand alone book all on it's own.  Great job Quinn!!  Look forward to the next tale you share with us.

Theresa Kay is quickly becoming one of my favorite authors. She is very talented and I can't wait to see where she goes from here.Bright Beyond was fantastic. It is not your typical love story, and I love that it is not predictable.Very quickly I fell in love with the main character, Eva. She is smart, brave and strong. She is confident yet still sweet. She is not your typical "give everything for the man she loves" girl.Eva is in a confusing new place trying to figure out what happened to her. She meets some new people, some friendlier than others, while trying to figure out how to get back to her squadron. The details of the storyline sucked me right in and I could hardly believe it when it ended.I LOVED the ending and cannot wait to read the next episode.

Jean Lafitte comes to the rescue of Nicollette who is supposed to be marrying someone when she gets home.  But she falls in love with Lafitte and even marries him symbolically.  The ruthless man she was supposed to marry tracks her down, conveniently after she had a bad fight with her love, and tricks her into returning home under the pretended her father is dying.  She makes it home only to discover her father is the picture of perfect health.  Still she feels obligated to marry the man her father chose for her out of a sense of honor.  Can Jean stop her before it's too late.  This was a really well written historical romance novel set in New Orleans area.
summary: Romance set against the backdrop of the War of 1812

reviewText: My roomie and I have been planning to declutter and discard some of our stuff but we don't know where to start.  We've been wanting to have a minimalist approach in our house and luckily, we stumbled upon this book.  This book made us realize that we need to go back to the basics and just keep it simple.  The simpler it is, the lesser the complications.  Highly recommended!

Loki was always the bad, but incredibly sexy, brother in Thor's world this carries over into the hybrids too.
