reviewText: Montana DesiresVella DayThis story was gifted to me in exchange for an honest review.Dr. Randy Carstead and Ali McDaniels have a history together. They used to be in love until Ali broke it off when Randy went to med school. She thought it was the responsible thing to do, to allow him to concentrate on med school. That was twelve years ago and this is now. He is working at the Lucy Ambrose Centre for Excellence. The local hospital where Ali is contracted to do some work with a training program and she has specified that he be the Doctor to help her.Both Randy and Ali are still harboring attraction for one another and it does not take long for things to heat up in the bedroom once again. It is going to be slow going as both are older now; they are more mature and understand what it takes to make an adult relationship work. But in the discovery period they can certainly have a lot of fun. They experiment with motorcycle rides, picnics and chocolate sauce.This is a story whose character you will recognize and it is good to be back in touch with them again. Vella Day writes a pretty romance with some hot sex scenes thrown in. She can usually be counted on to provide a story worth sitting down to and devoting some time to and this one was certainly true to form. The characters are likeable, the storyline flows nicely and the sex was hot, what more could you ask for? A great summer read. I would give this story a 5/5 and recommend to all romance readers.

Kudos to Debra Kayn for realizing that not all couples are in their twenties.  This series always changes it up and Kayn will write about the younger couples (can't wait to read Ink and Lily's story) and also the older couples.  Remmy and Natalie show you that the fire, if set right, will burn just as hot and just as long, no matter the age of the wood.  I love the way she continues to incorporate the original characters in her books so we still have a feel for the whole MC and are not limited to just the one showcased in the latest installment.  My only problem with this series is the Los Li storyline.  It's getting old and I hope she settles this soon and moves on to new antagonists.Great book, great series.

It is sad but I have noticed my creativity and imagination skills wane though the years. It could be lack of use or just the lack of challenge on my daily activities but whatever the reason I'm determine to get back on track as I was before.This book has helped me prepare for this as I know what I can do to increase my creativity and imagination. The book itself is not that long, but knowing is only part of the process, so after reading I have been putting what I learned to use and I can say that it works. It is not an overnight thing but it can be done.

This was an interesting installment to the call series. I loved getting into Aaron's head. This isn't a retelling of either book or a recreation of the Call Series books but from his POV. This is just strictly certain scenes from both Late Call and Final Call told from his mind. Emma picked out the most important scenes from those books and told us what Aaron was thinking and feeling. If you have read the Call Series then I would suggest reading this book so you get both sides of the story. DO NOT READ this if you haven't read the first two books….Late Call and Final Call. His call won't make any sense to you.
summary: Loved being in Aaron Stone's head ;)

reviewText: This book is not suitable for everyone, it does contain some sexual content. This is also not a stand alone book, because it will leave you questioning what happens next. Mechelle Taylor thinks everything about her life is perfect. She married her college sweetheart and they have been together two years. She has started her own million dollar business. She is an architect. Her husband Ian is not quite as lucky he hasn't been able to find a job, but he keeps telling her he is going on interviews. This is a short story so I don't want to give too much away. One day everything is fine and the next her life is in shatters as she finds out all is not as it seems. She really is lost in lies. You have to read this to appreciate it. I can't wait for the next one. Good job and congratulations P J

Attention all fans of military men and shifters! A new series has come to town!!Excellent paranormal book with simple yet effective world building- just what the doctor ordered! Charlie Cochet, your hard work has paid off. This was very enjoyable, though I almost knocked it down to 3.5 stars because the mystery element was weak.In a lot of paranormal books the reader has to do a lot of hard work getting up to speed with the author's created "world." There is often either an info dump or things aren't very well explained, both of which are pet peeves of mine. This was surprisingly simple and easily digestible world building. If you read the blurb and were a bit confused, here is what you need to know: Therian= Shifter. That's about it. The rest is easy peasy, just some details about how the world got that way and some other basics. I liked the care that the author put into the THIRDS world. Everything was well conceptualized and nicely executed.And the MCs?! *fans self* I loved Dex and Sloane and the chemistry between them. It was all very alpha male, very testosterone-y, and smoking hot. I could have used a wee bit more dirty talk, but I have a weakness for a dirty mouthed boy.Charlie Cochet also created side characters with a TON of meat on their bones... and I don't mean in the chubby-chaser kind of way. There is so much depth to them! I could see this series going on and on. Who DIDN'T feel the chemistry between Ash and Cael and between Calvin and Hobbs (yup, you read that correctly)?? There is a LOT to work with there and I can't wait to read those stories.And the writing... so tight! It had an excellent flow and pace, never getting boring or dull.Now on to the bad... The mystery. *wince* That was a blunder if I'd ever saw one. If you are going to make a bad guy, at least hide him better, Captain Obvious. If I'm going to read romantic suspense, or a mystery, I want to be more clueless. I think this author has to work on her red herring skills (PLEASE!).If I'm going to nit pick, there was also a ton of back and forth between Sloane and Dex that grew a bit tiresome. I don't like my guys to waffle quite so much, but that is just personal preference.All in all, a very nice book that will be sure to please paranormal and romantic suspense fans alike.

reviewText: All I can say is AHHH-MAZING!!! I loved this book and once I started it, there was no putting it down!!My heart broke for Tatum from the start. She has just gotten a phone call from the hospital asking her to come in. Not knowing why, she goes and soon learns her parents have just been killed in an auto accident. All she wants to do is run to her boyfriend of 2 years Josh for comfort. Knowing he should still be in school she lets herself into his apartment and finds him with another woman crushing her even more.Her best friend since kindergarden Leah and her fiancé Brent are all she has left and they are getting reading to move to Tennessee. Eventually they talk Tatum into moving with them. Once in TN and with the help of Brent she soon gets a job interview with the town mayor. It is there she will meet the most beautiful man she has ever seen. While a relationship is the last thing she is looking for, she can't keep her eyes off of Mr. Tall, Dark and Handsome covered in all those colorful tattoos.Blaise Richardson is a volunteer firefighter and owns his own tattoo parlor with his twin brother Asher. Being burned in the past by his ex as well, a relationship is the last thing he wants or needs....that is until he agrees to help his mother at the office where she works and lays eyes on the most beautiful green eyed beauty he has ever seen. He can see the pain in her eyes and all he wants to do is hold her close and kiss the pain away. She is different, she is not like all the rest, he wants to know her and he wants to make her his. Will Tatum be ready for Blaise? Will he be able to break down those walls that she has guarding her heart anytime soon or has Josh ruined her forever?OMG, all I can say is  YOU MUST GO ONE CLICK THIS AMAZING BOOK NOW!!!!!  You def will not regret it!!

Review for Ramblings From This Chick. ramblingsfromthischick.blogspot.comTempting Tatum is the first book that I have ever read by Kaylee Ryan, and I absolutely loved it! It was so good, and I honestly can't wait to read more from her. This book had one of the best book boyfriends I have ever read about, and he was just amazing. But I also really enjoyed Kaylee Ryan's writing style and I loved all the characters.When Tatum Thompson loses both of her parents in a tragic car accident she turns to her boyfriend, only to find him with another girl. Her best friend Leah and Leah's fiance Brent offer to let her move with them from Ohio to Tennessee and stay with them for as long as she wants to get a fresh start. She decides to move with them and Brent gets her a job interview with the mayor's office to work in her field of marketing and PR. She ends up meeting Blaise Richards the receptionist's son. They are both instantly attracted to each other and feel a connection neither of them have ever felt before. Tatum is determined to stay away from guys after what she just went through with Josh, but Blaise isn't willing to give up so easily. Blaise has kept things casual since his ex cheated on him, but he knows that what he feels for Tatum is so much more than just a good time. Can Blaise show Tatum that he is worthy of her trust and that they belong together? Can Tatum open herself up again and take a chance on forever with Blaise?I really can't say enough great things about Blaise, but I loved and adored him. He was sweet and kind, patient and understanding. He was so great with everyone in his family and his friends, and he was so good for Tatum. He let her take her time and do things on her terms, but he was always there for her. He was supportive and encouraging, and I loved that he took things slow with her. He wanted all of her and he didn't want to be with her physically until she was able to commit to him, which I thought just made him that much better of a book boyfriend. He cared so much about her, and even though their feelings developed quickly they just felt so real and believable. Tatum was great also, and I liked seeing her find Blaise and see what a real man is like. She had been used to a relationship that while not awful at first wasn't great either. It was nice to see her cooking and playing games with Blaise and his family, and really starting to let others in besides Leah and Brent. She had so much healing to do, and I felt like Blaise and his family were exactly what she needed. Their relationship was so sweet, and I really felt like they were perfect for each other in every way. I loved the chemistry and attraction between them, but I also loved the emotional connection that they were forming as well.Overall, I really felt that this book was fantastic. I read this cover to cover because I couldn't put it down. I loved everything about the story and the characters, and I really liked how everyone fit together. This group of friends and family were so much fun to read about, and I loved the connection that they had to each other. I will say that this one was really sweet sometimes bordering on cheesy and the feelings happened quickly, and for some it might be too unrealistic to get behind. But honestly for me, I really was enjoying the story and characters so much that it didn't even matter to me and I felt like it worked. I would highly recommend this book to romance fans of all genres, and I think that these characters will be so easy for readers to relate to and become invested in. If you are looking for a sweet HEA with a sexy tattooed hero and a strong and likable heroine, you should definitely give this one a shot. I can't wait to read more from Kaylee Ryan in the future.**Complimentary Copy Provided by Between the Sheets Promotions**
summary: Absolutely LOVED this book! I loved the story, the writing and the characters!! Blaise is worth the read alone! A must read!

reviewText: Tatum has had a rough couple of months. She knows she needs to leave her past behind, but it's easier said than done. Thankfully, she has a good support system in her best friend and her boyfriend and decides to start anew by moving with them to another town. Once there, she's lucky enough to find a job that she loves and meets the one man that will change her life for the best.Blaise has been burned before so he doesn't do relationships anymore. His focus is volunteering as a firefighter (*swoon*), managing his tattoo parlor (*sigh*) and his family (*melt*). But from the moment he meets Tatum, he can't think of nothing else. Drawn by the pain behind her eyes and her easy manner, Blaise tries to deny that he has found his one.I loved this story!Kaylee Ryan didn't pull any punches drawing me into the story. From the very beginning I was emotionally invested in Tatum's story. I felt her pain and cried right along with her when her world shattered into a million pieces. I admired her determination to move on with her life and the way she went about her attraction to Blaise.Tatum and Blaise's connection was immediate and their chemistry easily palpable, but what I enjoyed the most were their honest interactions, the tender touches and their conflicted emotions regarding what was developing between them. I loved that they questioned, analyzed and pondered what laid behind their connection. Yes, they had an insta-love kind of relationship, but the author went to great lengths to back that up with plenty dialogue too so that when the time came for them to be together, I didn't for a moment doubt their feelings.Along with the sizzling chemistry there was also a great range in emotions. From Tatum's pain in losing her parents and being betrayed to her excitement in starting in a new town all the way through Blaise's affection towards Tatum and the thrill he felt at pursuing her, Kaylee Ryan brought it all to the page in a way that helped me connect to both characters. I found myself cheering them on, even if I wanted to shake some sense into them a time or two.All in all, an emotional but sweet romantic read with lots of funny and steamy moments to round it all up!
summary: An emotional but sweet romantic read.

reviewText: 4 starsThis book was an easy read with a great message of what happens when life kicks you to the ground, you have to pick yourself back up and live again no matter how much you want to give up.  Even in the worst of times, there is always a silver lining.  True love will knock you off your feet.Tatum Thompson is happy.  She lives with her parents, finishing her major in what she loves and has a boyfriend who loves her.  But when life decides to turn Tatum’s world upside down she believes she will never love or trust again.  She only needs her best friend, Leah.  When Leah suggest that Tatum move with her to Tennessee, a fresh start will be exactly what she needs.Blaise Richards seems to have it all co-owner of a tattoo shop with his twin brother, volunteer firefighter and loving family.  But there is one part that is lacking that is in his love life.  He thought he had found the perfect one with Beth but she crushed his heart by cheating on him.  He has since just had casual nights here and there.  Blaise still had dreams of having that forever with someone.When Blaise and Tatum’s world collide in morning things seems to get better from that day for both of them.  They have this instant chemistry but are both wary of falling to fast.  Well that is until Blaise decides Tatum is his “One”.  He can not imagine the thought of someone else with her.  He will wait for her and tells her so.Tatum is fighting her attract to Blaise.  She does not want to be hurt again.  She does not think she will survive another heart break.  As Blaise buys his time showing Tatum everyday that he is attracted to her, she finally decides she can not deny what her heart is telling her.  She needs him.Finally all seems to be going wonderfully for Tatum and Blaise until there is another accident.  Will this leave one of them without their true love?This was my first book by author Kaylee Rynn.  I enjoyed the story that she told with these characters.  Tatum and Leah’s relationship was exactly what best friends should be.  Blaise and his family is also what everyone wishes their families were like.  And the underlying story broke my heart a few times, shed a tear or two and yelled at Tatum to stop fighting her attract and just jump Blaise.  All the side characters were a perfect mesh for this story.  Looking forward to more from this author.
I gobbled this one up so quick! It was the quintessential love story of star crossed lovers. Love always prevails!

Writer’s Digest has a collection of annotated classics that provide great insight on how past writers have created their masterpieces. Thanks to K.M. Weiland, the classic Jane Eyre by Charlotte Bronte is now a part of that collection.If you’ve never read Jane Eyre, I suggest reading it before picking up this annotated edition. Mainly because it is a great book, but also because, if you’re anything like me, you’ll get so swept up in the story you’ll bypass the notes. I’d never read Jane Eyre before. But, when the opportunity presented itself to read this, I decided it was time. So, I read the book, then I went back through and read the annotations by K.M. Weiland.Understanding structure and how a novel progresses can be a difficult thing sometimes. With the annotated version of Jane Eyre, K.M. Weiland makes it easy to see where in the story the key factors to make a great story take place. She explains the hook, setting, conflict, tension, using all five senses, closing chapters, and symbolism and theme to name a few. And it’s not just, “Hey, this is where this happens.” It’s a detailed description of how Bronte used these aspects of writing to better her story.This is one of the few writing advice books I would recommend, not because it gives advice, but because it helps you to understand how you can make your story really shine by offering examples.

Calling Eli Jackson the "shy" Jackson brother is not a difficult stretch, considering how loud and boisterous his two older brothers are.  But there is something more reserved and cautious about Eli that "shy" doesn't even begin to cover.  So when Cutter and Calder gift Eli a "honeymoon" trip to a gaming convention with his "game wife", Eli is not thrilled.  After finding out his "wife" is outgoing and sexy, he is ready to call the whole thing off.Zoey Daniels lives life in the moment.  She touches everyone she meets, both literally and figuratively.  When she is invited to spend a weekend at a gaming convention with the man she has been gaming with for two years, but has never met, she jumps in with both feet.  Now she finds herself falling hard for a man who has cut himself off from the world, and happiness in general.  Can she touch him deep enough to make a difference and open him up to the possibilities of life?This one started out very fun and light-hearted.  There was a lot of back and forth bantering that actually does happen when gamers congregate (I know because I am married to one and have hosted my share of game nights).  I loved the brotherly interaction as well.  Ironically, that is another one I have first hand knowledge of.The light-heartedness turned a little emotional toward the middle though, with both characters discovering each other's challenges.  The way those challenges were dealt with were very really.  I didn't feel cheated, as though the author was trying to find an easy fix to some major issues.  The reactions were raw and well timed, and the resolution was fun, but with that little bit of brevity that makes it special.As always, I need to consider the supporting characters.  The only real supporting characters in this book were the brothers.  And their antics were both fun and endearing.  They obviously love their little brother and are genuinely worried about him, but they also like to take the mickey out of him...a lot.Overall, this was an awesome and insightful story that will have readers admitting that they might just be gamers at heart.

If you read TRY (book #1 of this series) you are ready for the next stage of this erotic love affair. (If you have not read TRY ... STOP reading this review and go read it NOW!).Tate and Logan have had their romp and as we found out in book #1, they were shocked to find this was not just about sex. Their attraction is more than a one-night-stand and there is more at stake here than meets the eye. Both are willing to "try" and see where this leads them, maybe even to the forbidden word... relationship.As I read TRY and now TAKE, I discovered what I "knew" to be true but had not really felt it illuminate me - love is love regardless of gender mix. Yes, I was always tolerant of M/M etc. relationships, but did not really understand to what degree love is the same for all couples. We love a partner that fulfills, encourages, instills pride, and takes our breath away. Gender does not matter, it is the connection we feel for each other that matters. In addition, what is most important in a successful relationship is trust. That is the crux of this book. Logan and Tate have to build this trust in each other in order for them to get closer and leave the past behind.Did you ever wonder what the impact would be on those around this couple? How will their families react? Their business associates? Acceptance is a word used and flaunted every day, but what does it take to really accept the intimate relationship of two men in our society? Not everyone is open-minded and some would go as far as call it a perversion. How will our couple survive in a society full of mixed reactions? The only way I can think of is by hanging on to each other, loving each other and trusting each other. This is what our story is about.Ella Frank, I bow to your genius! I was blown away with your first book in this series. I never thought you would do it to me again. I must admit you got me 100%, again! Through the genius of your writing, you have given us an emotional, sentimental, amusing and most definitely heart-wrenching erotic story that will not be soon forgotten. I keep hoping for more books in this series. Maybe one more for the road?

All of us will need to organize our things properly and minimize it on using it right. This book gives us a lot of tips and techniques on how to design our home with a minimalist design and organize it in very easy and simple way. It is very useful and helpful to us to have a organize life. Good read!

*We received a copy from author for a honest review*This is the second book in the series, if you haven’t read Dark Cravings and Dark Innocence you should read those before reading Dark Secrets.Ella and Micah have been together for a few months now and are constantly questioning their relationship. Both are keeping secrets from one another and once they are told their relationship takes a hit. Can what they once had be saved or do they loose each other in the process.Once again Ms. Pryce had me so addicted to the book I couldn't put it down! I loved every minute of this series and I highly recommend it!

This is the 2nd book in Ella and Micah story.  I Loved this book as I do all her books. Omg what more can you ask for in a book?? You have the Alpha (yummy) and a badass take no s*** from no one heroine. There is some WOW steamy parts.This series is one once you pick it up you are transported into it and can't put it down till you finish it. I love books like that. Ms. Pryce is a very talented writer.  Asked to read for honest review by author
summary: Madeline has done it once again

reviewText: I find this book so helpful and informative. Honestly, I didn't know that Hydrogen Peroxide has a lot of uses and can actually cure some types of cancer. Indeed a great and highly recommended book.
This book goes deep about how we find our place in the world.  Being true to ourselves and grateful for what we have.  Excellent reading!
summary: The Law of Attraction: The Law of Attraction and Love

reviewText: The book starts with a thorough explanation of what Astral Projection is, moving on to dispel certain myths about the practice, and then concludes with descriptions of various methods for achieving it. A fun read and a useful addition to the literature on this technique.

This book is packed with substantial information about spiritual journeys outside our bodies. Introduces several methods of learning to focus and concentrate on our inner beings to help in your OBE quests. Very well written and extra ordinary.

This How to Improve Memory book is really great!It contains useful techniques to help boost memory power.I know that I have trouble remembering things so I'll be looking forward to implementing these ideas.Definitely worth the buy, very helpful and informative.Great and I would recommend!

KP Baker is an excellent story teller and really strives to put a lesson into each of her books.This one is no exception, everyone has some kind of talent whether big or small they all matter and sometimes we may need others to help us realize our own talents.This is a fun and learning book that kids will enjoy!

I love Fireman Max and all of his stories. I have read everyone with my kids. They love finding out about Max’s latest journeys and always choose these books to read at nighttime. This time Max’s school is having a talent show. The problem is that Max does not think that he has any talents. This is such a common problem with kids today so I was delighted to see this being written about in a book! Max and his family go on a journey that helps Max realize that everyone has talents; they just need to be uncovered. KP Baker did a great job with this one!

This is the first book I've read written by this author.  All I can say is if you like true horror coupled with a lot of kinky sex, this is the book for you.  What an ending!  Read this book in 3 days and finished it at 1am on a work night because I couldn't put it down.  Will definitely be reading more books by this guy.  Great job and great imagination put into this.  All I can say is wow!!  And yes the title of the book (Porn) definitely got my attention first.
This book was awesome! Read it all in one day. New fun twist on things, and I can't wait for the next one!

HCG Diet book - To be honest, I didn't even know what HCG was before I picked up "The HCG Diet Plan," but I read the whole book in one sitting! If you're a complete novice (like I was) you can pick up this book and come out 90 pages later knowing a lot about the HCG hormone. There are even recipes at the end to help you get started. HCG dieting pretty controversial, but if you're willing to experiment and open your mind, this is the book for you!

Someone recommended the HCG diet to me so I got this book to learn more. This has a lot of useful information about what it really is and why it is effective in losing weight. The recipes also looks good. I am trying to shed off some pounds so I can't wait to start with this diet plan!
summary: Someone recommended the HCG diet to me so I got this ...

reviewText: I really liked the honest approach that this book had. One of the key things that resonated with me was the section on how most people don't even notice your so-called flaws because they are too busy focusing at their own. So true. A good perspective on an important topic.
I cannot wait till the next book comes out! This series is well written and has kept me wanting more lol! I recommend this series. Well worth your time

“You see, once you open up your heart to one person, Zeth..it’s so much easier for others to slip in unnoticed too.”I wish I had the words and the ability to convey how much I loved this book and the entire series that has led up to this moment.  I love everything about this story.  I love Zeth and Sloane.  I love the connection that they have.  This story showed Zeth’s softer side if you can imagine him having one.  His love for Sloane was so strong and undeniable.  He even allowed himself to be vulnerable.  I enjoyed this nice change in him.  Don’t even get me started about Zeth drinking tea with Sloane’s parents.  Hilarious. Sloane had some soul searching to do of her own.  What she was willing to give up to be part of Zeth’s world.  I know Zeth and Sloane are supposed to be the main characters but really this story would not work as well without all the supporting cast that add so much.  Lacey is always a delight and is slowly gaining her confidence back and somehow becoming the voice of reason.  Even the bad guys are just the most awesome violent bad guys.  There are so many layers to this story and I cannot wait to see where it continues.  It has been a great ride since book one and it continues to be fun and action filled.  Some series lose a little of the story with each book released but this one gets better and better.  So glad I found this series and waiting anxiously for the next installment.

WHEW!! Another winner in this series..each book just makes me love Zeth more. And Sloane? She is a pretty tough chick. And the sex scene where he asks her what HE wants? My goodness...SMOKIN' HOT.There is a a cliffhanger. Cant wait for the next one.
This was a great storyline exciting cliffhanger can't wait to read the next one!! It will not disappoint!! Good book!

Really Great book!!!!! I can NOT wait until part 2 comes out!!! I recommend this book!! I had been seeing this book and because it was 5 star rated I had to get it!!! DONT let the title fool you, its deeper than that!! I was hooked. Story line was everything!! I wish it was longer!! GREAT job Treasure!!!! THIS IS A MUST READ!!!!!

This was really, really good. Even though Tyler couldn't keep his hands off the ladies for what ever reason I still liked his character. I hope Troi and Tyler work out their differences because I like them as a couple. They may fight like cats and dogs for dumb ish I think they can make it. I can't wait to find out what happens next. Don't pass this one up u won't be disappointed.
This was the first book I've read by the author.I love this book from the beginning to the end. Can't wait to read pt2. Treasure Bee you did your thing writing this book.

This was good. A whole bunch of crazy stuff going on. A goo storyline and it kept me turning pages. I need more from Sky. Her story is much needed. I loved all the characters. Can't wait for the next one.

I’m always trying new fads or anything to help me lose some weight and when I saw this book I had to get a copy. After reading it I found it was quite interesting and the author’s insights into using the Dutch people as a standard was inspired. I like the fact it discussed their diets and their living conditions and how we the reader could use them as an example creating our own healthier lifestyle. So if you are looking for a new diet book, check out this one.

I received this book for an honest review. Such an enjoyable read. Once I picked this one up I was unable to put it down. This was such an enjoyable read because it is not your typical Rocker book. In the beginning you meet Mackenzie who is just barely surviving. As a person who feels like she is losing everybody she loves first her husband and child and just recently her father. After her father passes away she finds out that she needs a job and FAST. Enter Dean and his band who have hired her as their tour chef. Of course these wonderful sparks fly between them.I really enjoyed this because it showed how hard it is getting over losing someone in your life. That you do not just move on the next day. Also how hard it is to move on.EXCELLENT

Much needed step-by-step guide into how to make more money. Shows you how to invest on the stock market, how to set up your own business, how sales and marketing can work for you and how to invest in real estate.
summary: Much needed step-by-step guide into how to make more money

reviewText: Rob is awesome - such a good book.

It's been awhile since I read the first part of the Trouble series but this book reminds you in a perfect way of the past. I love the characters and the passion they have for each other. The adventures are fantastic. I can't imagine how celebrities stand not having the freedom to live and enjoy life without being mobbed. This book made me laugh and cry. Fantastic!!!

This story was perfection.. Great writing style and dual povs...Kieran and Megan were great characters and had chemistry off the charts.  I fell in love with Kieran right from the start. A few times I found myself tearing up.  Emotional, heartfelt read with plenty of hot sex...loved it..would recommend to all my friends and fellow book lovers!!!!
summary: great story with several twists and turns

reviewText: Rating 4 1/2 StarsI enjoyed Be Mine immensely. You have two people who are polar opposites that have to come together, because of a baby. Granted they didn't have to get married, but Liam needed to find a wife and get her knocked up, so he could inherit his fortune to fix things. Then Bella shows up on his doorstep like a godsend, but he wouldn't look at that as divine intervention. After all, Liam believes it was pure coincident. Even as they are trying to get better aquatinted they still argue on ideology and politics it becomes a sore point in there marriage. So, Liam and Bella struggle to see eye-to-eye. And both are extremely stubborn that they don't appreciate the gift they have until it's almost too late.Be Mine is a fantastic story that brings two people that shouldn't really be together, because they are so different. Somehow they manage at the end. They both have insecurities and use them unintentionally hurt each other. Each of them has to reflect on what was more important being right or working things out. Yes, Marquita did squeeze out some tears. So, if you are looking for two stubborn people who are attract to one another, but don't know how to deal with the other, you might consider Be Mine.Yes, Be Mine can be read as a standalone.

I typically don't like action/suspense books, but the blurb intrigued me and the beautiful couple on the cover pushed me over the edge. It's Always Been You is such a roller coaster ride!! I was sad, stressed, excited, elated and finally happily satisfied at the end.  Travis is a caveman alpha male who is possessive, jealous, sex on a stick. Caitlin is a strong woman - no weak Wilma here even though she was often in danger.There is violence, military, bikers, Russians, weapons of mass destruction, hot steamy sticky sex all in this book! If you like action, adventure, love/lust and romance then you should give this book a try.
summary: Action packed ~ in more ways than one!

reviewText: I loved this book. The characters are wonderful and their stories of pain and loss are charming. The backdrop of a band and their families is fabulous and keeps the reader engaged in their stories. I loved Grace and Casey and the story of love. Recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good romance with twists.

Since I have never done crochet before, this book is a little beyond what I would be able to do. I started reading this book no knowing it was the third in a series, but it has given me motivation to start crocheting and work my way up to the beautiful stitches and patterns included in this book. The author takes the time to explain each of the advanced stitches and includes a variety of advanced patterns. I would highly recommend this book to any advanced crocheter.

I have been following this guide since Vol 1. But I must say that this book is defiantly for the more advance, so if you are a beginner then I would advice you to start with vol 1. My favorite part of this book was the pictures and also the step by step guide on how to do edging.
Ok dang you didn't have to end the book like that!!!!..lol now I'm too ready for part 3!!! Great read!!!!

This book was good I loved Emeri and MurphMurph was really a hitta huh my favorite part of the book was when he pulled Emeri from Zays funeral I was like GOT DAMN But I can't wait for part three good job

reviewerName: Jeffrey Littorno, author of The Most Uncommon...
reviewText: As someone who has dabbled a bit in the freelance world, I thought that I had a pretty good handle on the process.I am happy to say K.C. McAllister proved me wrong.  Make Money Online as a FREELANCER is full of fresh ideasthat will greatly help anyone starting out or getting back into the opportunities available to freelancers.
summary: I thought that I had a pretty good handle on the process

reviewText: Extremely helpful book with lots of great tips and practical techniques to help overcome stress and anxiety. Highly recommended!

The author continues the story of a post pandemic U.S. with a well written group of central characters. I like the fact that Dr. Bradley has every one of the cast share in the troubles and heartache. This adds a level of realism not found in most of the post apocalyptic genre.Worth you time to read. Well written by an author that did his homework.
summary: The Marshal is A Great Character

reviewText: Another top notch read by Halliday.Alex Vallja-Marquez is a man who is haunted by the deaths of sixteen of his men and women at a Special Forces base in Afghnistan. Its eating him alive especially on the anniversary of the bombing.Marquez himself was badly wounded when a woman who worked as an enterpreter at his base blew herself and her nine year old son up. In the process she was responsible for the dead and wounded within the base.Marquez was also the commander of the base and he feels responsible for the deaths. He felt there was something he could have done to prevent it. Of course there wasn't but no one not his brothers Drae or Cam or anyone else can say anything to convince him otherwise. Its a demon he lives with every day.Being commander weighed heavily on Marquez. Something his brothers thought but never knew for sure until Marquez was so badly wounded.They both learned how badly it ate at him when he had to write letters of condolence to the families of those who were killed when sent out on missions. Men he sent out. How he felt personally resonsible for those deaths. Being commander was one tough row to hoe for Marquez. He wished he'd been able to refuse the promotion that made him commander but according to his commanding officer he was the best man for the job. Duty. A small word that means so very much to a man like Alex Vallja-Marquez.When hospitalized after the bombing Marquez wrote letters to the families of each of those killed by the bombing. He felt it was his personal duty as the commander of the base. Major Alex Marquez is a man of honor and duty.Marques was put back together after the bombing but he's usually in loads of pain with a very bad left side and leg. Sometimes the pain is so bad it lays him out for a day or two. Its just something he has to deal with. Something that his brothers and the folks at the villa are well aware of. He's left strictly alone per his request when he's dealing with the pain.Meghan O'Brien was engaged to a man who was killed in that bombing. A young man Alex, Drae and Cam knew quite well. Major Marquez's personal touch with the letter eased Meghan's pain.Meghan and Marquez exchanged many letters while Marquez was hospitalized undergoing therapy. Her letters helped him and his letters helped her. After a while it was a holiday card once a year but they did keep in touch.O'Brien was a big winner in the lottery and decides to take a roadtrip around America.One of the places she lands is Sedona, Az. The home of the Justice Team and Alex Marquez. She decides to stop and introduce herself to Major Alex Marquez.So begins one damned fine read.This one has Alex, Meghan, Cam, Drae, Lacey, Tori, the rest of the Justice Team at the villa, a secret Meghan has been carrying since the death of her fiance, friends, lovers, Meghans family and Alex and Meghan reaching for love and life.Five Stars and then some. Hope Brody is the next Justice Team member we get the story on.
summary: Alex, Meghan, secrets and one happy ending.

reviewText: This is the ultimate guide to learning how to cook Mexican dishes in a short amount of time.  Some of the recipes are really simple and some are a little more advanced but all are really good.  Can not wait to try many of these recipes.
summary: Good guide to learn Mexican dishes!!!!

reviewText: Beauty and the Cowboy is a nice romantic story with a modern feel to it. It's situated in a small fictional town called Marietta and I enjoy small town stories. They have a great feel of community to them. All in all a nice story with good characters. The first in a series.

Jesse and Charlie grew up as best friends.  Then she went off to college and became involved with someone else.  Until 5 days after taking Charlie to pick out an engagement ring, which she doesn't, Tom marries someone else.  This is Charlie and Jesse's story of how a love that is meant to be, will be.  I loved this story!

I loved this book.  The story was very sweet, romantic and well written.  A pleasure to read. This is one of those stories about finally realizing what you thought you wanted was not what you wanted and the person you really wanted was right there in front of you all the time.I especially loved the final Ferris wheel scene.I was given an ARC to read for an honest review.
summary: Finding love on the Ferris Wheel

reviewText: This is a fun kick off to start a new series.  Who doesn't like a good country fair?  Charlotte and Jesse have great chemistry and you root for them from the beginning.  It's a story filled with promise and fun and an ending that just makes you smile.

Amazing book! I really enjoyed this one. It was such a great story with tons of action. The author did a great job describing the plot, characters and the scenes. I love books that feature treasure and pirates! This book was full of non-stop mystery and action. I couldn't put this book down. I found myself reading it when I woke up, during my lunch break and at night before I went to bed. I really enjoyed the read and I would recommend this to anyone. I am hoping to read more by Joe Corso. He's a great writer and I love how he's writing to help his grandkids with college! How inspiring!

Suspense, power, revenge, love. It's all in here! Get to know Zach through Chloe's eyes, see what she sees. Know him like she does. You get to follow her as the real Zach is revealed!!! This will keep you wondering and wanting more!!!

Not quite sure how this is possible, but this series keeps getting better and better.  I was hooked with Jake and Mikala and I thought nothing could top Amanda and Logan, but Jay did it...Lucy and Cam have the best book yet.  Jay develops characters that you want to hang out with and can't help falling in love with.  The drama, the pain, the love....it's all there and it's amazing.  This series will suck you in and you'll keep wanting More...forever

Absolutely Amazing. This is a must read. You will not want to put this book down. I love Lucy and Cam. There story made me cry, laugh and could not get enough. Jay McLean knows how to draw you in. I am never disappointed in any of her books when I read. I loved Cam and especially Lucy in the More series and to have them have a whole book I loved it. Everything that Cam and Lucy went thru it made me feel like I was experiencing it too. Amazing read as alwa

What can I say... The Debt pulls you in and you don't want to escape! Kelly Favor has written a series that will leave you begging for more..and more is to come in part 5!! This series has a lot of twists and turns and we still don't fully understand why or how.. But you won't be saddened by this Alpha Book Boyfriend .. Grab your copy and catch up before part 5 comes out!
summary: What can I say... The Debt pulls ...

reviewText: As I am finally semi retired, I found this Kindle book to be very interesting. The idea of saving additional money while traveling is very appealing to me, as I am sure it is to you as well.Obviously, you aren't going to be able to travel for free, the author even admits that the title is a bit misleading, but the ideas in this book are going to save you and me a lot of money when we travel.Inside this book there are lists of places where you can stay for free, eat for free and even commute for free. Yes, places that are all over the world.  The author explains how you can travel and get paid while traveling.This is an excellent book for anyone looking to travel and save a lot of money. The book is well written and worth the little that it costs.

This book is an arguably indispensable help not only to anyone yearning to adopt a vegan life style, but also for those who do not have the time or income to spend hours preparing vegan meals. It offers recipes for every important meal of the day. These include everything from breakfast parfaits, jicama and guacamole for snacks, ruby grapefruit and radicchio salads, Italian eggplant sandwiches, various soups, and main courses like rigatoni with roasted tomatoes and arugula. Perhaps, most importantly, all of the dishes presented can be cooked within ten to thirty minutes and have ingredients that are affordable. In addition, to offering enticing recipes this book also gives detailed histories of veganism, its doctrines, outlines a seven day plan one can make when first becoming a vegan, and shows how he or she can do so without possessing immense wealth. Therefore, if you are interested in turning to veganism, but always thought that it would be too expensive and time consuming to do so, pick this up. It will change your thinking.
summary: Vegan Recipes That Won't Break Your Budget or Run Out The Clock

reviewText: This is a very good recipe book for understanding and enjoying veganism.  Beyond that though, it also helps you understand exactly what it means to be vegan, as a lifestyle choice.  It includes very good information about nutrients and minerals, and even addresses various allergies like soy, nuts, and gluten.  I personally liked how it revealed animal products hidden in our food that we wouldn't normally associate with animals, like beer and wine.  Of course, you get a ton of recipes, from pumpkin pancakes, main courses, and desserts.  This book is a good read.  Highly recommended.
summary: Great way to learn veganism and eat healthier

reviewText: One of the first things I noticed about this book is how simple the recipes are. The recipes were ranged as well and I like that. Soups, deserts, breakfast the whole nine yards. Everything was in this book. In fact, some recipes are so simple they can actually be done using the things that are already in your refrigerator. I enjoyed reading about the pointers on how one can go about shopping for ingredients for creating different meals.Like for instance the book spoke about the fact that the recipes for creating foods with a low fat diet in mind can be found on the out skirts of the supermarket and that's actually true. Fruits, vegetables, beans, etc. are some of the first things you see when you enter supermarkets before you start going through the isles.Another thing that this book provides  that's awesome information for any reader are storage tips for some fruits and vegetables. It's a good read because many of us are not familiar with these little tips. Good information here and there, otherwise this book would just have been another suggested recipe book.I would definitely recommend
summary: Good Read - Low Fat Recipes in 30 mins

reviewText: Yes, you can lose weight and still enjoy that frothy, creamy, frozen coffee beverage you love. You may not believe me, but it’s true. With the help of Low Fat Recipes in 30 Minutes. Yes! Lose weight and enjoy the finer things, all without having to spend hours in the kitchen. This new book from Shasta Press encourages planning ahead and provides a guide for “stocking your low fat kitchen.” Low fat doesn’t mean low flavor, but it does mean forward thinking. That’s where the meal plan and recipes come in. Complete with photos guaranteed to make you hungry, each chapter offers slimmer, healthier versions of your favorites, from Mini French Toast Casseroles to Grandma’s Macaroni Salad, and Classic Beef Burgers to Wine-Poached Pears.
summary: Low fat, but not low flavor

reviewText: There is much to like in this low-fat cookbook.  The first few chapters are quite educational, especially if you are not a whiz in the kitchen.  The recipes are easy enough to follow, too.  The only issue I have with this book are the recipes themselves.  To be a true low-fat recipe, one should not be using to many carbohydrates in their ingredients.  But, most people just think about ‘fat’ and not the sugars when trying to get healthy.Still, this book will serve you well.  Just tweak the ingredient list a little.
summary: There is much to like in this low-fat cookbook

reviewText: The story was good yet for me something was missing that I can't put my finger quite on, maybe book 2 will show me what I'm missing.

This is the best book I have ever had the pleasure of reading on my kindle. The story is a long winding tale with a bit of dark feel to it. The author is descriptive in a way that really gives you a sense of involvement and a clear image of what the characters are experiencing. Action. Mystery. Romance. This book has it all, and if you don't give this author a try even if its not your usual genre, it's your loss because the author knows his stuff and you will be hooked!  I found myself completely obsessed with finishing it and couldn't put it down!
summary: The story kept my attention all focused.

reviewText: Ahhhhhhh! Once again I am completely blown away with Monique Martin's ability to keep me guessing......the way that true events and fiction are woven together for the story is uncanny (she really does her homework). Simon and Elizabeth head to 1800s London in this next installment to believe it or not, save Jack the Ripper....um save him? Yes.... We meet Victor , a Frenchman who is also a member of the council and the three are off on a whirlwind adventure. Ms. Martin uses actual events in the story, and at times I felt myself thinking..."holy cow what if it really did happen that way??" Jack Wells also makes an appearance as does the evil Katherine Vale. can Simon and Elizabeth save the world in time? Once again a great read that kept me glued to the book from page one. Love this series....

I really loved this book once I got over the difficulty of the characters in the beginning.  The writing was excellent and the story line was gripping.  I look forward to more books from Rebecca Milton.  I highly recommend this book to other readers.

While I was waiting for the next book in the Ell Donsaii series, I looked to see what else Dahners had been writing. I came across this great book. I especially like online books that are well written and have obviously had an editor review them before distributing them to the public. This fits that category. I also like the way the characters are developed. It doesn't take long before you really care about what happens to them. I finished it in one sitting (with just a short break to make lunch). Hope the next book in both series come out soon. I can hardly wait.

I am a sucker for a good post-apocalyptic tale and this novel is a very good one, indeed!  The story revolves around a family with certain unusual, yet subtle, powers.  There are no flashy super powers here, but what they have is just as helpful in the long run for surviving in a world that has changed radically from the one we know today.  Laurence has managed to weave a tale that enthralls and entertains, while using his keen mind to do the "What if..." he does so well.  What if someone really has telekinesis, albeit at a very minor level.  He can't throw boulders around, or even lift much more than a small rock.  How does he make that talent useful?  And he can sense his surroundings through the heat signatures all things emit, including the internal structures of the human body.  What if he combines the two abilities, what might he accomplish?  You'll just have to read the book to find out!  I can promise you that you will not be disappointed.  I hate to admit this, but I think I may fall in love with the Hyllis family even more than Laury's other great series about Ell Donsaii.
summary: Not your run of the mill, post-apocalypse novel here!

reviewText: I was hooked with the first book LATE ONE NIGHT in the River Bend series.  Lillian Darcy did a wonderful job with the entire series and this book was like the icing on the cake.  AFTER THE RAIN pulls at your heart string and ties up the loose ends from the previous books.  This book could be read as a standalone book, but I think reading the others in the series makes for a complete reading experience.I was given an ARC  to read for an honest review.
summary: It started LATE ONE NIGHT and ended AFTER THE RAIN

reviewText: **I was given an ARC in exchange for my honest opinion**Sometimes, events in one's life lead to heartaches with no answers. The journey to finding the answers means facing the past, unearthing secrets, and finally, that can lead to love in the most unexpected way.Kira and Casey's lives have already intersected before they meet face-to-face. But, the circumstances of their lives intertwined is what separates them initially, even though both feel an attraction to each other. Forced to work together, they must seek the truth in what happened one night, 18 years ago, that changed each other's life. A common bond from that night--Neve--is dead, but it's her life's secrets which holds all the answers. Kira and Casey's trek through time brings them closer together, heals the scars of the heart, and opens up the opportunity for the love of a lifetime.

Surrender: By, Rue Volley.What can I say Ms. Volley did it again! She has brought a whole new meaning to the words dark and sexy! This is certainly naughtiness at its best!!  Now does is have some steamy hot pulse raising scenes??? You better believe it! Oh and the keegan the mysterious hottie oh my! He will set you on fire! Put it this way get comfortable put up a do not disturb sign and enjoy ride!!  I always look forward to reading Ms. Volley’s work. Her creativity is out of this world!
I great story as always miss drea her thing again I can't seem to get  enough of mister nico can't wait for the next one

I am not new to the Mediterranean way of cooking, but I was more used to Spanish and Italian cuisine. The moment I saw that Patrick Smith released a new cookbook, dedicated to Greek cuisine 100% I knew it was for me.There are 50 recipes that are nicely written and mouth-watering. It's really hot now where I live and I was really happy to find refreshing salad recipes or fruity cous-cous.
summary: Patrick Smith- the healthy cooking expert!

reviewText: I was really looking for something that could help me improve my productivity in my office job as an auditor and find this book a valuable one. I loved the Chapter 3 "Breaking Bad Reading Habits" and Chapter 7 "Free Speed Reading Resources" and looking forward to testing my reading skills with the aid of these links.  Highly recommended.
summary: speed reading for a more productive you

reviewText: Minecraft has become such a wonderful and popular series that everyone wants to play it as games now. This book gives the guidelines on how to make the mountain fortress belonging to the Minecraft story. A step-by-step process is given following which you can easily build the mountain, dark hall, blacksmith room and wizard tower.

. This story is about Krissy, a secondary character from M.S.Parker's last spicy series Club Prive. Krissy is a lawyer looking to move up in the world and she flies across the country to interview for a legal position at an extremely successful Talent Agency. The boss is a complete jerk, he's alpha and dominant, and treats everyone he meets badly.  DeVon uses these women who are looking for their first big break in acting, and who will stop at nothing to try to succeed in Hollywood. Krissy is no pushover though, but she is not completely immune to his good looks and power.DeVon Ricci expects rules to be followed for his employees but his double standards stink! Krissy is excited with the way her first interview went with Duncan, the head of legal, but is stunned to find out what awaited her in her hotel suite. Then to be interviewed by DeVon himself whose interview skills leave a lot to be desired. A good lawyer could file a sexual harassment suit just saying!I raced through this Volume 1 of Chasing Perfection and can't wait to see what is in store for these strong dominant characters in Volume 2.
summary: Another exciting start to a hot new series by M.S.Parker

reviewText: I strongly dislike novella's but since this is a three book series I tried it. I feel like you don't get enough connection between characters in short books. Not the case here. Building it perfectly! HOT, HOT & HOT! Loved it. Funny as well. Can not wait for next book! Definite read!!!

Elizabeth Aron makes a good case for turning vegan.  She lists the many benefits to the human body and to our planet in general.  When you consider the benefits to a world besieged with chronic diseases and early death primarily caused by poor diets, it just makes common sense to spread the word about a different way of living, one that is opposed to killing animals for meat.When you think about changing the human diet globally, the task seems daunting, even impossible, but it really can be accomplished by changing the heart of just one person at a time.  The information in the book makes you think.  I spoke to my acupuncturist this morning about changing my lifestyle to Veganism.  She thought it would be a good change for me, but recommended than I read more of the resources listed in the book.  Good job!!
I am addicted!This is great. Definitely going to invite my friends over for a fun night :)Thanks!!

A very helpful and informative book on living a healthy lifestyle. It explains in a very clear and concise manner how and why our cavemen ancestors lived in a very healthy manner and how we can too. Highly recommended!

Wow!!!! Lach and Phoebe are amazing together! Kennedy, you are just getting better and better! I thought going into this book, how can Lach carry a story when he speaks in 10 words or less?!!! Haha! Well, I was so wrong about that and there is so much right about this book. The chemistry, the honesty, the heart - just awesome! This series is so good, you can't go wrong with CSA or Kennedy Lane......I read this in one sitting, I just couldn't put it down! The story, the people, the heat (scorching) - it's all there! Don't miss this series........The CSA team is back and it's awesome! I can't wait for the next installment!

Reading through this book a few times is very helpful to become familiar with the different names and purposes of the essential oil ingredients.  I do highly recommend however, that before attempting these body healing recipes, that you invest in only high quality brands of essential oils as the recipes from any healing book may be effective or work at all if done with mediocre of compromised essential oils meant for pure and natural healing and instead adds synthetic or harmful ingredients that might affect your skin and health.Essential Oil for Body Healing is a good basic guide to have in your home to implement as your at-home first aid or to use in addition to other healing methods. I like that this book has specific recipes, seems easy to concoct at home and encourages a homeopathic natural way of healing with pure ingredients.
summary: Good list of recipes for specific home ailments for your family. Safe and handy guide.

reviewText: "Weight Loss for Christians" by Brett Richardson showed how one man put into place the connection between weight loss and having a relationship with God.  It used Scripture to show how God expects His children to keep their bodies like a temple, clean and holy.  This is a great book with solid advice for weight loss that shies away from fad diets.  If you've tried other plans and failed, try this one.  You might not only lose weight but you may also grow your relationship with your Father.
summary: Shrink Your Body, Grow Your Faith

reviewText: Weight lost Motivation: How I got myself pumped up and Boosted my willpower and lost 170lbs in 7 months, is an very uplifting and  enjoyable.  One of the most endearing things about this book was the little stick figure drawings.  They seem in and of themselves little voice of confidence and motivation as you progress through the book.  I like that the author conveyed her message in a down to earth and matter of fact method.  I never felt like I was being preached to or made to look down upon myself. I love that this book is more about building the self esteem and breaking the negative cycles in your life leading you to make the healthier choice naturally instead of forcing harsh changes and strenuous exercise.  This make loosing weight a natural occurrence and not something you constantly have to think and anguish over.  I would highly recommend this book to all my friends even those who can simply eat anything they want and not gain any weight.
summary: It is simple Stick Figure Motivation and I like it

reviewText: To be a good Alpha to his pack, that is all Samuel has ever wanted. He’s studied his entire life for this role but books can’t teach him how to connect with people on an emotional level, an area he is severely lacking in. He also has no idea why he is so drawn to the future Alpha of a neighboring pack and it bothers him…a lot. But oh man, those eyes and that smile….For Korban, he just knew from the very moment he met Samuel that he had found an undeniable connection. Finally, he could envision a life of true happiness! Now, all he needed was for Samuel to recognize it too.I love the logic in finding the person who makes you better and stronger, regardless of gender! My only issue is that I wish it was a little bit longer, I had some linger questions but I think I have to go back and read books 1-2 to fill in a few gaps. This can be read as stand alone.Even still, I am really liking Cardeno C’s writing style! I am a total fan!
summary: Well, hello Alpha!! I am really liking Cardeno C’s writing style! I am a total fan!

reviewText: Liked Jake and Patrick's story.  Their interaction and the slow, really too slow, build up of their relationship. The notes Patrick left in the laundry were humorous. After going through several housekeepers, he finally finds to perfect housekeeper/companion in Jake. Nice story. It dragged a little and had to skip sections to ward off boredom.  Jakes problems with his Mum and siblings was a bit much. Too much time spent on that subject. This was my first read by Renae Kaye and I would purchase another.

This was my first read of Kate Benson's work. Really enjoyed this hot, interesting story. At times Callie really angered me, at times she was kick A and confident. Tommy, I was all about him from the get-go. By the end, damn was I into Tommy! Callie's "dates" and clients were so interesting, not at all what I expected and I loved being surprised like that. Will be watching for the next in this series.

An Escort/Sex therapist for her clients, Callie has little to no limits.  Living with her Dr. Tommy( Just roomies) who has feelings for Callie and would want nothing more that to have her to himself. This raw and smoking sexy read will have you begging for more!  I can't wait for the next installment in The Callie Leveaux Series!

The premise of the novel is dragons who shapeshift as humans, only our hero is stuck as a human by curse. From his mom.Julian's personal weakness is that he's a nice guy. And Dragons aren't nice. At all. It's pissed off his mother and caused him problems.But he has decided to embrace being nice. Rachel Aaron has bucked the classic hero prototype that heroes are generally a nice guy because that's their default setting. Instead being a decent person (dragon, whatever) is a burden to overcome. It's a fun twist to make the nice guy thing a disadvantage that he can use to against his foes.Several characters, especially the quirky dragon seer, Bob, are wonderful. Marci, the mage, is not just a paper cutout female to compliment the protagonist, but is a strong co-protagonist, perfectly willing to kill, while Julian, the dragon is more squeamish about taking life. And Ghost the Dead Cat is quite terrible in an interesting way.There are lots of references to pop fantasy culture things to find. Some are obvious, some are not, which makes it fun to wonder if you found something intentional or if you are imagining it.I enjoyed it. And I look forward to the next one immensely.
summary: A fun twist on the Nice Guy Hero.

reviewText: Another "sweet" Samantha mystery.  The plot is intriguing until the very end and the desserts make one crave chocolate.  The author always keeps her readers entertained and reading into the wee small hours.  Great book.

Divine Charity is one of the best books I've read all year. I was hesitant to read about Charity, but I loved how Ms. Heather showed the backstory and how their romance was not something that just came about. The reassurances between Justin and Charity about the solidity of their relationship allowed them to move forward so that Charity was free to love Val and Ransome. This book has it all -- happiness and elation to deep sorrow and remorse. I can't wait to read the next book in the series to see where Ms. Heather takes us next. All I know is its going to be one heckuva ride
summary: strong, solid foundation on which to build

reviewText: I wasn't sure how I felt about Charity becoming a menage story. I've loved her and Justin from the beginning and their relationship worked and I was afraid that the love that they had for each other would be ruined. Don't get me wrong I love Val and Ransome and I was hoping they would have a story I just didn't see how they could be worked into Charity and Justin's life and I'm glad that Heather proved me wrong.Divine Charity was well written. The love they all had for each other was there and expressive. All three men were protective and loving and it made me love Justin even more by showing Charity they could have the relationship she'd always wanted.There is some sadness in the book and I was afraid after reading the dedication that something was going to happen to one of them. It's sad to loose a husband or a wife but to loose someone that is a friend because of stubbornness I think is sometimes worse but with the friends loss it gave others life.I can't wait for the next Divine Creek Ranch Story. They never ever disappoint and I read them over and over.

"Love wasn't planned, it wasn't a conscious decision, and it sure as s*** couldn't be  made up."Wow! What a book hangover!  Seriously, I finished last night and I loved it.  Beautifully Done is the story of Asher.  He is every mothers nightmare for their daughter.  Not that he's a bad guy.  In fact, he's a very genunine, hardworking, and puts everyone else first.  His only downfall is that he's not a one woman kinda man.If you've read Beautifully Awake, you understand what the characters have been through with the death of their dear friend, Kimi, but if you're like me I had an OMG- I'm gonna kill that f***** moment when I realized why Tali really left.Needless to say, she's back and sparks fly for Asher and her, but not without a little pain, excitment, realizations, and a new way of life.Within Beautifully Done, Asher has to let go of helping others and find himself again.  I know for a fact that if I would have been in his situation, I would have done the same.Talia on the other hand is a rare jewel.  She's dealt a bad hand, but what happens within these pages will break your heart.  I wanted to hold her and tell her it would be okay.  As you read, you will realize she's the backbone.  She sees the light at the end and goes for it."Tragic, nah.  that's a cop-out for when you don't have enough story to fill the pages.  We filled novels..."I loved this story, but I will have to say the Epilogue brought all my emotions to the front.  Even just thinking about it my eyes well up with tears.  Riley Mackenzie do a awesome will filling in every gap and making a complete story: past, present, and future!Beautifully Done is a phenomenal story that will make you smile, know that there are good people out there, and will have you cheering for Asher and Talia!  They deserve to be happy... together!
summary: I finished last night and I loved it. Beautifully Done is the story of Asher

Intense, raw and pure dark brilliance. This took D.H Sidebottom to another level for me. She has always been queen of angsty , raw and gritty books but this one topped them all. It was as if she evoked the dark lord himself and then used a dark poetic pen to transform him onto paper. Daniel was scary! End off. He lacked any form of empathy to begin with and had me gasping in shock at just how brutal he was for a main character. I won't say i fell in love with him as the book went on but my feelings did change towards him but that was down to Mae, i lived the story through her and was wrapped in her essence as the story breathtakingly progresses. It is an edge of your seat, breath holding, heart wrenching battle of over coming darkness and never losing yourself no matter if the devil himself comes to claim you and in it all still finding a place to leave your heart... even if its in the shadows of a tainted soul.

Outstandingly Brilliant!!!One of the best books I have ever read.D H has blown me away with Mae's story.I have felt every emotion from the start to the finish and then some.Such a dark and emotional story that will tear your heart out and rip it to shreds and still leave you breathless and panting for more.I love dark reads and this is up there in my favourite ever reads.I highly recommend this book to those who love dark reads,if you do not like them its not for you.Deserves so many more than 5 stars an outstanding read!!

The author of this book found a way to take control of her diabetes. She found an alternate means other than modern  medicine to take control of her condition. The author explains how going back to natural remedies helped her not only take control of her diabetes but to conquer it. We all know that our diet and the amount of exercise that we get contributes to acquiring diabetes. The author has a special diet that helped her conquer the diabetes. She was in shock  in the beginning after hearing the diagnosis of diabetes and knew she must do something and take control of the monster that had taken control of her body. She only uses natural methods and takes no medication prescribed by a physician for her diabetes. This book is a great find for those that have been diagnosed with the monster called diabetes.
summary: great for any diabetic or pre diabetic

Gin Bonham knows that demons exist. She also knows that her sisters are embracing their powers to manipulate water and the wind. With a traumatic event behind her, fear is all Gin associates with her own ability. And so, she wraps herself around a carefully constructed, normal life, free from the world of demons and supernatural powers... or so she thinks!Demons are all around her. Some are there to protect her, while others are there to cause her harm. But with portals to the other realm showing up on Earth the Hunter demon, Mathias, is instructed by the leader of the Lash demons to meet Gin, and to convince her to join in their mission. Mathias is confident he'll achieve his goal. The problem is, once they meet, the chemistry between Mathias and Gin is off the charts! And plans are put on hold.As Mathias and Gin's romance intensifies, danger is creeping in. A sinister plan is underway, and time is of the essence."They reached the foyer, dimly lit with the sun's valiant effort to shine thorough the clouds ... Eight male Deserati demons lurked... "And in the realm of Torth, we discover delightful exploits, as the Lash demon and the Solsti weave their way through this enchanted world. All the vibrant details we've come to know, love, and expect from this series are realized in this installment!I loved all the characters, but especially Mathias. He's powerful, loyal, handsome, and respectful -- all the important elements of a swoon-worthy alpha male! And the romance is exquisite. This book contains some of the most well written, and steamy love scenes I've read!Get ready for an exciting adventure, with vibrant world building, and fully developed characters! This is a must read for paranormal romance fans.Note: This book was provided by the author in exchange for an honest review.
summary: An Exquisite and Steamy Paranormal Romance!

The first book in a forthcoming trilogy, Ann Christy’s “Strikers” is a bold and imaginative entry into the expanding field of YA dystopia. Its characters are memorable, relatable, and smartly written. Even better, the world she has created stands up to scrutiny, making sense where so many others fall flat upon closer inspection.Karas Quick is a girl living on the margins of society in the Republic of Texas, scraping by despite a long-absentee father and an alcoholic mother. She relies upon her friends, and they her, to keep each other under the radar of the local authorities — at least, as best they can. Karas has already earned a strike upon her neck, the first of five tolerated by the Republic.Its as Karas and her friends are watching a parade of the captured, so-called Strikers being herded through the center of town that her life suddenly and irrevocably changes. Soon, they’re propelled upon a path that will challenge each of them physically, mentally, and emotionally, though in profoundly different ways.As the story progresses, Karas and her friends discover that much of what they’ve been told about the territories outside the Republic of Texas are outright lies, fictions designed to keep them compliant and complacent. The more they find and hear, the more they are compelled to follow the path they tread despite their doubts and misgivings. For the first time in their young lives Karas and her friends have hope, and that’s a powerful thing to carry going forward.Ann Christy’s first original novel is beautiful and fearless, a story of how family and friendship have the power to transcend even the worst humanity has to offer. Fully realized and deeply affecting, this is young adult storytelling at its finest and smartest.
summary: A fantastic introduction to a new series from an emerging talent

Don’t let one mistake keep you from taking on the world.It’s such a great piece of advice, but what happens when that one error destroys two lives in the process. How can you battle everything humanity throws at you, when you would have to start by taking on yourself – the one person who took things too far and lost everything because of it?This is the state Ceci finds herself in as The Intern, volume three begins.Bentley knows the truth – or at least enough of it to figure out that everything they have has been built on a mountain of lies. And, if you remember how the saying goes…fool me once, shame on you…fool me twice – well, let’s just say Bentley refuses to allow a third time from happening, and he does what he needs to do to ensure that doesn’t ever occur again – he removes Ceci from all aspects of his life.But how do you forget someone who you can still taste and feel…someone whose memory resonates in your heart and in your soul?  Time and distance seem to be the only way, but even that doesn’t take away the pain and the depression from losing the one person you thought completed you.Is there any hope for a fresh start for Ceci and Bentley? And what about her father’s case…how do you come back from losing not only the love of your life but the only real chance you had of getting the answers you so desperately need for closure?Dive in to The Intern, volume three and see how everything plays out.I have been anxiously anticipating the final chapter in Ceci and Bentley’s story since I finished volume two. Brooke sent out the ARCs last night, and as soon as I woke up, I began devouring the text, and let me tell you, readers will be able to tell that Brooke put her heart and soul into giving us a beautiful conclusion.The final volume is about so much more than Ceci and Bentley’s shattered relationship. It’s about their growth as individuals both emotionally and mentally. It’s about them learning the value of forgiveness and the worth of living their lives for themselves. It’s about figuring out if love can continue to be unconditional even after such a betrayal. It’s about a young girl’s journey to find out the truth about her hero and learning to accept whatever information is learned.It’s a beautifully written story with well developed main characters that readers can’t help but root for as they try to figure out if and how they can be back in each other’s lives after all of the lies and pain they have caused each other.  Brooke does a great job of showing how deeply both Ceci and Bentley were affected by their break up and then illustrates their attempts at reconnecting through not only their words but also the sexual intimacy that has always allowed them to completely express their feelings for one another.The Intern is one of my favorite serials out there! Definitely a must read!A complimentary copy was provided in exchange for an honest review.5 poison apples (The Fairest of All Book Reviews)

Third in a series, it might be better to read them in order. Don't despair! You can go back and buy the earlier works by this prolific writer.
