Lindsay Buroker offers up another fast-paced adventure tale in this third entry in the Dragon Blood series. Featuring the same stellar development of the companion ensemble as her other books, this one continues the story of Ridge, Sardelle, and Sardelle's irreverent magic sword, Jaxi. Buroker's ability to create interesting, entertaining characters is as good as her ability to keep the narrative whipping along. Even more intriguing is the way she creates a fantasy world that's palpably real. This book, and the series, is highly recommended for anyone who likes character-driven, imaginative adventure fiction.

How I love stories about fate! Adrian was Mia's First..Kiss, Love, Everything! That was 20 years ago. She never stopped thinking about him but she moved on with her life thinking that she had filled the spot he had left in her heart. Now 20 years later she meets him again. Mia is now a divorced mother of 2, can she start over with the man that owns her heart?This was an inspiring story of fate overcoming time and distance. he waited for her, yeah he had others in his life but... He waited for her to be his forever.I loved this story it was pure and beautiful yet complicated and frustrating all at the same time. Lacey Silks gave me a story that will live in my heart and continue to inspire me with Fate.
summary: Fate is a patient thing it will wait till the right moment to make everything PERFECT!

reviewText: Perfect way to end season 2!  Rachel is as usual a genius.  She manages to make so many things happen in a short amount of time, a mere 2 episodes ago and things for dear Reagan were very different.  This episode takes us back to the bunker where Hendrix, Miller, Page and Reagan are recovering after watching Kane's suicide mission.  I feel like this event is going to have a serious and damaging effect on Reagan, and can you blame her?  They make a plan to get out and go looking for the rest of the Parker family when morning comes and they haven't arrived.  There are of course plenty of zombies, epic battle scenes and an abundance of drama.  A perfect end to another fabulous season!

There were parts of this book that had me holding my breath for so long that I let out a big gasp when I finally took a breath.This book is definitely not for the faint hearted & is by at the most brutal of the series.Can't wait for Sept 28th
OMG!!!! This series is so intense, terrifying, and nonstop heart wrenching! The twists and turns the author takes you on are incredible. Dornan is one crazy, evil SOB! Cannot wait for the next part.

WOW!My first thought when I nabbed this sequel, damn, it's really short!As I was reading I became aware that I really like the story within the story.  Candace is reading her clients new novel and is so enthralled with it she isn't doing what she should; editing it.  We're slightly getting two stories in one.  Kathryn Perez has me craving both worlds.The build up of what's going to happen next; Brisbane, James, Candace....Then to end the volume as she did, EEK!SUPERB!  I don't typically write reviews and especially not after just reading it,but WOW!I'm on an adrenaline boost right now.  The tension and hotness and the surprise, oh my!
summary: DELIGHTFUL!  I was not expecting THAT shocker.  I need volume 3, STAT!

reviewText: Warning here, this is a novella series, so they’re cliffhangersThe story continues where the 1st novella left off, the progression is nice.  We are still following Candace and Brisban.  I am enjoying the fact that both of these characters are middle aged adults and that they freely speak what is on their mind without all the guess work.  Candace doesn’t does not misinterpret any of Brisban’s words or motives, she is not afraid to speak her mind or ask questions.Brisban is still a delicious bad boy who will charm the pants right off of you.As the story progresses, it’s clear that feelings are starting to come into play.  The drama with the ex’s is not over the top and feels very realistic.The novella does end on a cliff hanger and it was not something I was expecting.  I am very interested in seeing where the author goes with it.
Loved it!! This gripped me from the first chapter. And it was so different. Ms. Brown knocked it out of the park. I highly recommend this one.
summary: Compulsively read this one until the end at 3:00am!!

reviewText: Melissa Brown tells an amazing tale of some amazing characters.  I fell in love with this book and could not put it down.  I knew going in that it would be a book that definitely didn't fit in a mold, but I had no idea how amazing it would be.  Strong characters, an amazing plot, a breathe of fresh air.
Alycia Taylor, brilliant, this story sucked me in and now I feel empty, I literally have a void in my chest that needs to finish this story...
summary: Speechless, I feel like I can't breathe until I know...

reviewText: So going into Hard Roads, I wasn't exactly sure what to expect since this is a first for Lily on MC reads. I know most are gritty and somewhat dark as it is, but Lily always pushes the dark limits for me and how she messes with my mind so I honestly didn't know what direction she was going to take this book in. After reading, all I can say is I loved it. She had a mixture of two of my favoite type books together wrapped into one and did a fantastic job and I would love for her to put out some more MC type books in the future.J.D. and Holly both have a hard road to travel that eventually brings them both together and not in a good way. Infact, J.D. hurt me by his actions with Holly and his choices at the beginning on how he treats her and those actions lead to even worse things for Holly. Lily never lets up on them and she makes you wonder if they will be able to survive the path they both end up following. There were a few cringe worthy moments for me in this book that had me screaming "how could you just do that to her!!!" You meet quite a few character who you will hate and wonder how can so many people be that mean and who is actually the worse out of them?? She also added a few lighter moments that I think the characters and even the readers needed so they could come down off the high of everything that is going on for a few minutes.I loved this book and was suprised where it ended up at and it still has me thinking about it because I just didn't have a clue how it was going to turn out. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to feel every emotion there is while reading this but be warned that it's not for the light hearted. It's not as dark as some of her other reads but I still enjoyed it.
summary: all I can say is I loved it. She had a mixture of two of ...

reviewText: I must say this has been my favorite Ace book out of the three. As usual Nicole did not disappointed. I really didn't like Farrah in Craving Redemption but u watch her and Casper grow throw out the book and u can't help but love her. Loved the twist in the book sure ass hell didn't see that coming. Hope we get a book on Cameron next
I love Cody and Farrah.  I wasn't so sure about Farrah in the last book but now I really really like her.  Cody is amazing!  And Cameron is the coolest!  Buy the book and enjoy!

I have read all the books in this series and I love them all.  I couldn't put this book down. Read it in one day!! Love the characters in this series. Great storyline and I really enjoy the way Nina pulls you into the story. Can't wait till the next book. Great job, keep it up !!

No one believes that life is going to utterly change in an instant. We are not promised tomorrow. So many families have been heartbroken over the loss of a service member. I wouldn't want to imagine how my own life would change if I were in Gen's shoes. Cade was her rock and all she ever knew. Dan knew what she had with Cade and stepped in when there was no one else, or when Gen really didn't know how to ask for help. Dan had to grow up really early and was a man before any of us would envision he should have been, based on his age. Age doesn't determine a man's maturity. His experiences in life usually propel him one way or the other. Dan was wise beyond his years and showed compassion when Gen needed it most. Genevieve would always love Cade, but was able to open her heart for something new.

What a killer duo Ward and Mosteller make! From the get go this story gripped my heart, shredded it and slowly but lovingly mended it back piece by piece. There was such tragedy in the beginning (tissues galore) I almost forgot to breathe and when I did, it felt labored. So emotional.. I have a lump in my throat just thinking about it and it's been days. This is a story of love, loss, devastation, new life and second chances. I love books that make me forget to think and instead make me feel. Thanks Holly and Stacey for such a great story to read! I can't wait for the next ;)I received an advanced readers copy for my honest review.
summary: A Devastating Beginning / A Beautiful Ending

reviewText: This was a fabulous read. **SPOILERS AHEAD**In true HM Ward style, Second Chances hit the heart strings. It'll make you laugh, it'll make you cry and you will go through every emotion throughout the book.I was ugly crying before the first chapter ended, so if you are looking for something that will make you feel something, this is an excellent book.Gen and Cade were soul mates - they were everything to each other and when tragedy strikes, a life is taken away too soon - but another is being created.Second Chances is all about mending a broken heart that never thought it could love again.Left with a broken heart and a beautiful little baby, Gen is determined to keep to herself. That is until Daniel (Dan the Lawn Man) sparks something inside Gen.Gen's new found feelings are strong but she is concerned what her bossy, know it all mother will think... being 10 years+ older than him, Gen is worried what others will think - but she doesn't even know if Dan likes her in that way. Little does she know...Dan has had a secret crush on Gen since he first started working for her. He's kind, sweet, understanding and best of all, he doesn't judge her. He sees what no one else does - a strong woman who was put through something no one should ever have to go through - left with a baby to raise by herself. Daniel looks at Gen like she is super woman and his other half."This can be our little secret if you want to continue being super woman, saving the world all by yourself. I won't tell you joined the top-secret-super-justice-alliance if you don't" - DanielJust when she thought she wanted to be alone in life, Daniel brings her back to life - but words are said that cannot be taken back, and Gen will do anything to get Dan back in her life.Seconds Chances isn't like any other book I have read from Holly. This one seems real - like it could totally happen. I was hooked from the first chapter, and I loved watching Gen break free from her shell, and I loved reading how these two fell in love.Another fabulous story from HM Ward...
summary: I ugly cried before the first chapter ended!

reviewText: I cried when I read this book. The story was amazing. I usually don't read a book like this,but I took a chance on it and I am glad I did.

I didn't know one book could invoke so many different emotions in me.  Loving the collarboration between these two authors.  The book made me feel like I was part of the story, I was feeling the same emotions as Genevieve as they were occurring.  I enjoy books that make me feel like I am part of the story, feeling the emotions taht the characters are feeling.  I wish we were able to get a glimpse into the future but sometimes it is just as fun to leave to our own imaginations.  This was a wonderful stand alone book.  I am hoping that these authors will collaborate again in the future.
